In the US, when oil prices go up, incomes in Texas and Montana rise, which means that these states then contribute more tax revenue to the federal budget, thereby helping out the rest of the country. => 在美国，当油价上涨时，德克萨斯州和蒙大拿州的收入会上升，这意味着该两州将向联邦预算贡献更多的税收收入，从而帮助美国的其余地区走出困境。
Europe, of course, has no significant centralized tax authority, so this key automatic stabilizer is essentially absent. => 当然，欧洲不存在大型中央税收当局，因此这一重要自动稳定器也就不存在了。

Some European academics tried to argue that there was no need for US-like fiscal transfers, because any desired degree of risk sharing can, in theory, be achieved through financial markets. => 一些欧洲学者试图论证像美国那样的财政转移并不是必须的，因为从理论上说，不管你想要多大程度的风险共担，都可以通过金融市场达到。
This claim was hugely misguided. => 这一论断大错特错。

Financial markets can be fragile, and they provide little capacity for sharing risk related to labor income, which constitutes the largest part of income in any advanced economy. => 金融市场可能非常脆弱，所提供的分担劳动收入相关风险能力几乎为零，而劳动收入是发达国家收入的最大来源。
Kenen was mainly concerned with short-term transfers to smooth out cyclical bumpiness. => 柯南主要关心的是短期转移可以平滑周期性起伏。
But, in a currency union with huge differences in income and development levels, the short term can stretch out for a very long time. => 但是，在一个收入和发展水平差异巨大的货币联盟中 ， “ 短期”所经历的时间可能非常长。

Many Germans today rightly feel that any system of fiscal transfers will morph into a permanent feeding tube, much the way that northern Italy has been propping up southern Italy for the last century. => 许多德国人如今正确地感受到，任何财政转移系统都有可能兑变为持久的饲管，正如上个世纪意大利北部对意大利南部的不断输血。
Indeed, more than 20 years on, Western Germans still see no end in sight for the bills from German unification. => 事实上，德国统一20多年来，西德仍然看不到统一的成本什么时候才是个头。

Later, Maurice Obstfeld pointed out that, in addition to fiscal transfers, a currency union needs clearly defined rules for the lender of last resort. => 再后来，奥布斯菲尔德（Maurice Obstfeld）指出，除了财政转移，货币联盟还需要有明确定义的最后贷款人规则。
Otherwise, bank runs and debt panics will be rampant. => 否则的话，银行挤兑和债务恐慌将会泛滥。

Obstfeld had in mind a bailout mechanism for banks, but it is now abundantly clear that one also needs a lender of last resort and a bankruptcy mechanism for states and municipalities. => 奥布斯菲尔德构想了一个银行救助机制，但现在，显而易见的是，国家和自治地区也需要最后贷款人和破产机制。
Europe’s leaders cannot carry out large transfers across countries indefinitely without a coherent European political framework. => 没有凝聚性的欧洲政治框架，欧洲领导人就不可能无限度地在各国间实现大规模转移。
European policymakers today often complain that, were it not for the US financial crisis, the eurozone would be doing just fine. => 如今，欧洲决策者经常抱怨说，要不是美国金融危机，欧元区根本不会遭殃。
Perhaps they are right. => 也许这么说并不错。
But any financial system must be able to withstand shocks, including big ones. => 但金融体系必须能够抵御冲击，即使是剧烈冲击。
Europe may never be an “optimum” currency area by any standard. => 欧洲也许从来都不是一个“最优”货币区，不管从什么角度看都是如此。

But, without further profound political and economic integration – which may not end up including all current eurozone members – the euro may not make it even to the end of this decade. => 但是，如果没有更加深远的政治和经济一体化 — — 也许最终无法将所有当前欧元区成员国纳入进来 — — 可能连这个十年都撑不过。
Achieving a “Europe of Results” => 建设“以成果为导向的欧洲”
BRUSSELS – The tsunami that has swept across financial markets is a global catastrophe. => 发自布鲁塞尔 — — 席卷全球的金融海啸无疑是场巨大的灾难。
If handled correctly, however, the crisis may yet raise the esteem of the European Union and its institutions. => 但如果处理得当的话，这场危机反而能为欧盟及其下属机构赢来人们的重视与敬重。

The EU’s legitimacy problem has two different aspects: apathy, leading to a low turnout in the European parliamentary elections, and outright euro-skepticism. => 毫无疑问，欧盟一直被其和合法性问题困扰着，而此问题则来自两方面：首先是人们的漠视，这导致了欧洲议会选举低下的投票率，还有就是那些彻底反对欧盟和欧元的怀疑论调。

The voter-turnout problem partly reflects frustration about the present state of the EU, and also people’s impression that they can exert little influence by voting one way or the other. => 低投票率在某个侧面体现了民众对欧盟目前状况的挫折感，在他们看来无论选谁，自己这一票都微不足道。

So, although the EU represents our best hope of ensuring that Europe is internationally competitive in today’s increasingly difficult environment, it is actually being blamed for globalization. => 因此即便欧盟体现了我们为确保欧洲在日渐艰难的时势中保持竞争力的良好愿望，它依然受到“为危机全球化推波助澜”的指责。
But in most cases, this is not possible. => 但在绝大多数情况下，这条路根本没行不通。
At first sight, the easiest answer to the problem of low voter turnout is to give more power to the European Parliament. => 照“拍脑袋”简单一想的方法，提高投票率的最简单方法就是赋予欧洲议会更多的权力。

The trouble is that, EP elections must be “about” something if voters are to be interested, which means they must involve a real choice. => 问题在于，欧洲议会选举如果要吸引选民的话，那么它必须“言之有物 ” ， 让选民意识到自己确实在作出一个“实打实”的选择。

And a real choice requires Europe-wide election campaigns by all parties. This would also involve making the choice of the European Commission’s president dependent on the outcome of the EP elections. => 而这样一个“实打实”的选择要求有全欧洲所有党派的竞选活动来共同组成，其中还包括让选民通过决定欧洲议会选举的结果来选定谁是欧盟委员会主席。
And this year’s elections saw a more intensive presence of party organizations at European level than ever before. => 而今年欧洲议会选举中此类欧洲层面上的党团势力也比以往更加集中地出现在人们眼前。
The Euro-skepticism problem can be tackled only if the Union itself starts to perform better, and is seen to be doing so. => 而欧洲怀疑论的冰释，只能在欧盟开始表现得更好，并似乎能一直保持努力进步之后才能达到。
Given the gravity of the economic crisis, the time has come for the EU to demonstrate its strengths whenever possible. => 考虑到经济危机的巨大影响力，是时候让欧盟尽可能地展现自己的力量了。

The aim must be not only to win back the hearts of Europeans who have become skeptical, but also to convince them that the Union is indispensable to meeting the challenges Europeans face. => 而这些努力的目标不仅是赢回那些满腹狐疑的欧洲人的心，更要让他们确信：欧盟这个组织在应对当前挑战方面是不可或缺的。
Europe’s citizens understand that the relatively small nation-states that make up the EU are no longer able to face these enormous challenges on their own. => 欧洲的公民们已经意识到，欧盟内部那些相对较小的国家早已无力独自应对这些巨大挑战。
European countries have become so interconnected that isolated national measures on issues like financial-market regulation are hopeless. => 欧洲国家的利益是如此盘根错节地交织在一起，以至于那些试图用孤立的国家政策来应对金融市场规管问题的手段都变得一无是处。
A changing world in which new powers like China and India play an increasingly important role will not wait for Europe to make up its mind. => 世界正在变化，中国和印度这类新兴强权正日渐扮演更重要的角色，它们可等不及欧洲去打自己的小算盘。
The EU must instead show leadership through its efforts to solve the world’s current problems. => 因此欧盟必须通过解决当今世界问题的一系列努力来显示其领导地位。
As for the European People’s Party, for us the economy is not an end in itself but should serve the people. => 而对于我所属的欧洲人民党团来说，经济体系的存在目的不是为自身谋利，而是服务大众。
That doesn’t mean that we are advocating a move to socialism; we want better and smarter regulation, not regulation for its own sake. => 这并不意味着我们鼓吹社会主义；监管必须更好和更明智，而不是为监管而监管。
We see five keys to recovery: => 而下面五点则是经济复原的关键：
A “Europe of Results” is achievable. => 一个“以成果为导向的欧洲”是可以实现的。
The Education Roadmap to 2030 => 2030年教育路线图

LONDON – When I visited the Zaatari refugee camp in Jordan earlier this year, I met with children who told me what education means to them. => 伦敦—今年早些时候，我访问了位于约旦的扎塔里（Zaatari）难民营。 我遇见了一些儿童，他们告诉我教育对他们意味着什么。

For Syrian youths who have been forced from their homes and have lost everything, education is about more than qualifications or test scores; it embodies their hope for the future. => 对被迫离开家园、失去一切的叙利亚年轻人来说，教育的意义远不止合格或分数；而是寄托着对未来的希望。
This goal is still a distant prospect for far too many children. => 对于太多的儿童而言，这个目标仍然遥不可及。

With so many development issues demanding our attention, policymakers should bear in mind that education is not just a good in itself; it is also a catalyst for many other development gains. => 有如此多的发展问题需要我们关注，决策者应该时刻铭记，教育不但本身是一种好东西（good ） ； 而且也是其他众多发展收益的催化剂。
As the old African proverb goes, if you educate a girl, you educate an entire nation. => 非洲古谚有云，教育女孩等于教育整个国家。
Ensuring access to quality education for children, especially girls, will lead to fewer child marriages and less child labor and exploitation. => 确保儿童特别是女孩获得高质量教育能减少童婚、童工和剥削。
Tackling the education challenge needs to start from two principles embedded in the goal. => 克服教育挑战必须从联合国可持续发展目标的两大原则开始。
First, “for all” means that we must focus on the children who have been left behind. => 首先 ， “ 全人类”意味着我们必须关注落后的儿童。
Millions of children are out of school or are receiving a substandard education because of who they are or where they live. => 数百万儿童因为出身家庭或地区而辍学或只能得到劣等教育。

According to the UN High Commissioner for Refugees, refugee children are five times more likely to be out of school than other children in the countries to which they’ve been displaced. => 据联合国难民高级委员，难民儿童辍学的可能性比收留国儿童高五倍。
And in all but two African countries, girls remain less likely than boys to complete a primary education. => 只有两个非洲国家，女孩完成小学教育的可能性不低于男孩。
Getting these children into school will require new approaches that directly address their exclusion and make schooling genuinely accessible and relevant. => 让这些儿童上学需要直指他们被排斥的问题、让学校真正得到开放和重要的新方针。
Second, “quality”: Education must be effective, so that children actually learn. => 其次是“高质量 ” ： 教育必须是有效的，从而让儿童真正得到学习。
For the 61 million children who are out of primary school, formal education is beyond reach. => 对6,100万无法上小学的儿童来说，正规教育遥不可及。

But, just as urgently, more than one-third of children of primary-school age – 250 million – are not learning the basics, according to the UNESCO Education for All Global Monitoring Report. => 但是，同样紧迫的是，据联合国教科文组织全民教育全球检测报告，有超过三分之一的小学适龄儿童 — — 2.5亿人 — — 没有学到基础知识。
Half of these children have been in school for at least four years. => 这些儿童中有一半已经上了至少四年学。
Upholding these two principles will require increased investment. => 坚守这两大原则需要增加投入。
Last year, UNESCO calculated that governments must double education spending as a share of national income to achieve the 2030 goals. => 去年，联合国教科文组织估算政府必须将教育支出占国民收入的比重提高一倍才能完成2030年目标。
This will require increased revenue from taxation and stronger efforts to collect what’s owed. => 这需要增加来自税收的收入、加强查漏补缺。
Donors also need to live up to their aid commitments and target aid more effectively. => 出资国也需要兑现援助承诺，加强援助的定向性。
For example, less than one-third of education aid goes to Africa, even though the region accounts for almost two-thirds of out-of-school children. => 比如，只有不到三分之一的教育援助流向了非洲，而那里的辍学儿童数量占全球的近三分之二。

Moreover, at the moment, education budgets are often regressive, with almost half of spending in the poorest countries allocated to the most educated 10% of the population. => 此外，目前教育预算常常呈现出累退特征，最贫穷国家的近一半支出流向了受教育程度最高的10%人口。
Fixing education investment requires action in two key areas. => 增加教育投入需要在两大关键领域采取行动。
First, we need equitable financing, with more investment in early childhood care and development, where there is the biggest potential for returns. => 首先，我们需要公平的融资，更多地投入早期看护和发展，这是回报潜力最大的领域。
Budgets must be focused on the most excluded children, and primary education must be free at the point of use, so that every child can learn. => 预算必须着重关注最受排斥的儿童，小学教育必须免费，以使人人都能上学。
We also urgently need more transparency and accountability, so that budgets are visible and communities have a say in school governance. => 我们急需更多的透明度和问责，以使预算可见、社会能对学校治理问题发出声音。

With these priorities in mind, the education commission will deliver its recommendations at the UN General Assembly on September 18, when the Secretary-General will receive and act on them. => 带着这些重点，教育委员会将在9月18日的联合国大会上发布它的建议，联合国秘书长将得到这些建议并据此行动。

The Education Commission will have succeeded if we are able to leverage the funding and political will to ensure that every child learns, regardless of their income, location, or social status. => 如果我们能够利用资金和政治意愿保证每个儿童，不论其收入、所在地或社会地位，都能学习，教育委员会就取得了成功。
Our work will not be complete until that happens. => 到了这一步，我们的工作才能宣告完成。
Sustaining Progress in Transition Countries => 保持转型国家的进步

NEW YORK – In the World Bank’s most recent “Doing Business” report, half of the Eastern European and Central Asian countries included in the global ranking were among the top 50. => 纽约—在世界银行最新的《营商 》 （ Doing Business）报告中，有一半参与全球排名的东欧和中亚国家位列前50名。
As a measure of economic maturity, the report confirms what many in the international development community have long known: the region is ascendant. => 作为经济成熟度的指标 ， 《 营商报告》确认了许多国际发展界早已熟知的事情：该地区正在崛起。

Over the last decade, the economies of Eastern Europe and Central Asia have recorded spectacular gains, buttressed by ambitious market and public-sector reforms. => 在过去十年中，东欧和中亚国家进步抢眼，它们依靠的雄心勃勃的市场和公共部门改革。
The question now is how to ensure that this progress – which has tripled the size of the middle class – is sustained. => 现在的问题是如何确保这一进步 — — 它让中产阶级规模扩大了两倍 — — 得到保持。
Signs of the region’s social and economic prosperity are everywhere. => 该地区社会和经济繁荣的迹象随处可见。

In Azerbaijan, incomes have increased dramatically in recent decades, and only 5% of the population now lives below the poverty line – down from nearly 50% in 2002. => 在阿塞拜疆，最近几十年来收入大幅上升，目前只有5%的人口生活在贫困线以下 — — 而2002年这一比例接近50 % 。
Elsewhere, Estonia is the third country in Europe in startups per person and has one of the fastest Internet speeds anywhere. => 在其他国家，爱沙尼亚的人均初创企业数量位列欧洲第三，也是全世界互联网网速最快的国家之一。
And from Albania to Kyrgyzstan, e-government systems are allowing more people to connect with critical services through online and electronic portals. => 而从阿尔巴尼亚到吉尔吉斯斯坦，电子政务系统让更多的人能够通过在线和电子门户连接到关键服务。
To maintain momentum in meeting the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) by 2030, leaders must address three key issues. => 要保持势头、实现联合国2030年可持续发展目标（SDG ） ， 领导人必须解决三个重要问题。
First, the region’s economies need to be strengthened to incentivize smarter, more sustainable growth. => 首先，该地区经济体需要变得更加强大以激励更智能、更可持续的增长。

For example, fossil-fuel subsidies should be reconsidered, because they discourage investment in energy-efficiency projects, and impede the development of renewable technologies. => 比如，化石燃料补贴应该重新考虑，因为它们阻碍了能源效率项目的投资，也阻碍了可再生科技的发展。
Job creation is an urgent challenge for every state in the region. => 就业创造对域内所有国家来说都是一项紧迫挑战。
Second, in many countries, the space for civil society is becoming narrower, posing a threat to pluralism and accountability. => 其次，在许多国家，公民社会的生存空间越来越狭窄，这成为多元化和问责的威胁。

To prevent conflict and give voice to the region’s marginalized groups, tolerance and respect for human rights must be made essential ingredients of governance. => 为了防止冲突、为域内边缘化群体提供发出声音的机会，宽容和尊重人权必须成为治理的核心要素。
Finally, the region must coordinate on strategies to address the changes that automation and artificial intelligence will bring to the labor market. => 最后，该地区必须制定协调战略克服自动化和人工智能给劳动力市场带来的变化。
Leaders in some countries, particularly Belarus, are shifting economic output from heavy manufacturing to technology startups. => 一些国家特别是白俄罗斯的领导人正在设法让经济产出从重型制造业向科技初创企业转移。
But authorities everywhere can do more to increase the resilience of their workforces. => 但各国当局都可以在提高劳动力适应力方面做更多事情。
In many countries, heads of government are using the SDGs to guide their national planning and efforts to legislate reforms. => 在许多国家，政府首脑正在用SDG指引国家规划和立法改革。
The parliaments of several Central Asian countries have even endorsed the SDGs as a development roadmap. => 一些中亚国家的议会甚至将SDG写入了发展路线图。
Changes like these are helping to translate development ambition into action. => 诸如此类的变化有助于将发展雄心转化为行动。

In Armenia, the government recently created the world’s first national SDG innovation laboratory, a collaborative effort designed to “accelerate” SDG implementation. => 在亚美尼亚，政府最近新成立了世界首个国家SDG创新实验室，这是一个为“加快”SDG实施而进行的合作项目。
Initial research efforts will focus on increasing the country’s tax collection, improving its education system, and boosting its renewable-energy sector. => 初始研究计划将聚焦于提高国家税收、改善教育制度以及提振可再生能源业。

Meanwhile, planning officials in Moldova have used crowdfunding to raise millions of dollars from the diaspora to fund sustainable development projects at home. => 与此同时，摩尔多瓦的规划馆员利用众筹从侨民手中筹集数百万美元用于国内可持续发展项目。
Revitalization efforts have included the reconstruction of a public plaza in the capital, Chișinău, and the expansion of infrastructure in rural areas. => 复兴计划包括重建首都基希讷乌的一个公共广场和扩张农村基础设施等。
The region’s private sector is also participating actively in sustainable development efforts. => 该地区的私人部门也在积极参与可持续发展措施。
In only a few decades, the people of Eastern Europe and Central Asia have witnessed profound political and economic changes. => 在短短几十年里，东欧和中亚人民经历了深刻的政治和经济变化。
To capitalize on the development progress already made, countries and organizations must learn from one another, adapting solutions to local conditions. => 要利用已经取得的发展成就，各国和组织必须彼此学习，根据本地条件采用方案。

That will be the main topic at the Istanbul Development Dialogues, an annual global gathering organized by the UN Development Programme, this week. => 这也是本周举行的伊斯坦布尔发展对话（Istanbul Development Dialogues，联合国开发规划署组织的年度全球会议）的主要议题。
As the new UNDP Strategic Plan for 2018-2021 argues, collaboration is a critical component to any sustainable-development strategy. => 联合国开发规划署2018—2021年战略计划指出，合作是可持续发展战略的关键要素。

If the measure of a country can be calculated by how easily business is conducted within its borders, the states of Eastern Europe and Central Asia have a bright future. => 如果一国的衡量指标可以通过在其境内营商的容易程度来计算，那么东欧和中亚国家有着光明的未来。
With strong leadership that transforms the region’s economies and modernizes its institutions, the region’s recent gains will not be fleeting. => 拥有改变地区经济、现代化地区机构的强力领导层，该地区最近的进步不会飞逝。
The Achilles’ Heel of Trumponomics => 特朗普经济学的阿克琉斯之踵
NEW HAVEN – Donald Trump’s economic strategy is severely flawed. => 纽黑文—唐纳德·特朗普的经济战略存在严重缺陷。
The US president-elect wants to restore growth via deficit spending in a country with a chronic shortfall of saving. => 这位当选总统想要通过赤字支出在长期储蓄不足的美国重塑增长。
This points to a further compression in national saving, making a widening of an already outsize trade gap all but inevitable. => 这将进一步挤压国民储蓄，导致已然十分巨大的贸易缺口不可避免地继续扩大。
The Trump administration will not inherit a strong and sound US economy. => 特朗普政策无法从前任手中获得一个强大而可靠的经济。

The pace of recovery since the Great Recession has been running at half that of normal cyclical rebounds – all the more disturbing given the massive size of the contraction in 2008-09. => 自大衰退以来，复苏速度只有常规周期性反弹的一半 — — 考虑到2008—09年间的巨大萎缩程度，复苏速度的萎靡尤其令人不安。
And savings, the seed corn of future prosperity, remain in woefully short supply. => 而身为未来繁荣种子的储蓄仍然处于严重短缺状态。

The so-called net national saving rate – the depreciation-adjusted sum of business, household, and government saving – stood at just 2.4% of national income in mid-2016. => 2006年年中，所谓的净国民储蓄率 — — 经折旧调整的企业、家庭和政府储蓄总和 — — 仅为国民收入的2.4 % 。

While that’s an improvement from the unprecedented negative saving position in 2008-2011, it remains far short of the 6.3% average that prevailed over the final three decades of the twentieth century. => 尽管相对2008—2011年间前所未有的负储蓄头寸而言这已经算得上是改善，但与二十世纪最后三十年6.3%的平均水平相比仍然相去甚远。
This is important because it explains the pernicious trade deficits that Trump continues to rail against. => 这个问题很重要，因为它解释了特朗普一直大加鞭挞的罪恶的贸易赤字。
Lacking in saving and wanting to grow, the United States must import surplus saving from abroad. => 美国一方面缺少储蓄，一方面又渴望增长，因此必须从国外进口储蓄盈余。
And the only way to attract that foreign capital is by running massive current-account and trade deficits. => 而吸引这一外国资本的唯一办法是通过大规模经常项目和贸易赤字。
Trumponomics has the cause and effect behind this development backwards. => 特朗普经济学具备了这一趋势倒转的因果关系。

It fixates on country-specific sources of the trade deficit, like China and Mexico, but misses the fundamental point that these bilateral deficits are symptoms of America’s far deeper saving problem. => 特朗普经济学关注贸易赤字的具体国家来源（如中国和墨西哥 ） ， 但忽视了这些双边赤字只是更深层次的美国储蓄问题的症候这一基本点。

Without addressing America’s chronic saving shortage, the Chinese and Mexican components of the trade deficit would simply be redistributed to other countries – most likely to higher-cost producers. => 这无法解决美国由来已久的储蓄短缺，来自中国和墨西哥的贸易赤字将重新分配给其他国家 — — 很有可能是成本更高的生产国。
The result would be the functional equivalent of a tax hike on beleaguered middle-class US families. => 结果在效果上等价于对饱受挤压的美国中产阶级家庭增税。
In short, there is no bilateral fix for a multilateral problem. => 简言之，多边问题无法通过双边方法解决。

The US had trade deficits with 101 countries in 2015 – a multilateral problem stemming from a saving shortfall that cannot be effectively addressed through country-specific “remedies.” => 2015年，美国对101个国家存在贸易赤字 — — 这是一个源自储蓄短缺的多边问题，它无法通过针对具体国家的“疗法”解决。
That’s not to say that America’s trading partners should be let off the hook for unfair practices. => 这并不是说美国的贸易伙伴可以摆脱不公平行为的干系。
Alas, this plot is about to thicken. => 可惜，情况将变得越发复杂。
Trumponomics seems likely to exacerbate America’s saving shortfall in the years ahead. => 未来几年，特朗普经济学可能恶化美国的储蓄短缺。

Indeed, the Navarro-Ross analysis attributes fully 73% of the growth-inducing revenue windfall of Trumponomics to a massive improvement in the overall trade balance over the next decade. => 事实上，纳瓦罗-罗斯的分析认为，将特朗普经济学所带来的促进增长的收入意外之喜的整整73%归因于未来十年间总体贸易平衡的大幅改善。
Yet, as stressed above, barring a miraculous surge in national saving, this is highly dubious. => 但是，如上文所强调的，如果国民储蓄不出现巨大增长，这一前景非常可疑。

Ironically, in the coming era of negative saving, the US will find itself increasingly dependent on surplus saving from abroad. => 讽刺的是，在即将到来的负储蓄时代，美国将越来越依赖来自海外的盈余储蓄。
If the Trump administration takes aim at major foreign lenders – namely, China – its strategy could quickly backfire. => 如果特朗普政府将目标对准主要外国贷款人 — — 即中国 — — 其战略可能很快会适得其反。

ITHACA – With 2012 underway, it is worth reflecting on how a decade of strong economic growth in emerging markets led to last year’s resounding political transformations. => 伊萨卡—步入2012年之际，我们值得思考一下新兴市场的十年强劲经济增长是如何引发去年波涛汹涌的政治转型的。

A negotiated “land for peace” solution still remains official Western doctrine. => 通过谈判达成“以土地换和平”协议迄今仍是西方的主流理论。

As US Secretary of State Hillary Clinton put it in a recent speech, “a just, lasting, and comprehensive peace” has to be based on “two states for two peoples.” => 正如美国国务卿希拉里·克林顿在最近一次讲话中提到的那样 ， “ 为两国人民分别建国”是实现“公正、持久、全面和平”的基础。
Meanwhile, the two main parties to the dispute, Palestine and Israel, are searching for unilateral alternatives to the stymied “peace process.” => 与此同时，中东冲突的两大主体巴勒斯坦和以色列都在不停寻找阻碍“和平进程”的单方解决方案。

The Palestinians are pushing for international recognition of their statehood, while the Israelis are using their settlement policy to preempt a Palestinian state. => 巴勒斯坦人不断要求国际社会承认其独立国家地位，而以色列则意图借助定居点政策抢先占领巴勒斯坦。

Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas has said that, if the latest peace talks collapse, he will press for UN recognition of a Palestinian state based on the 1967 borders. => 巴勒斯坦总统马哈茂德·阿巴斯已经表示，如果最近一次和谈失败，他将敦促联合国以1967年边界为基础承认巴勒斯坦国。
This month, Brazil and Argentina recognized “Palestine,” and a cascade of Latin American countries is expected to follow. => 巴西和阿根廷这个月承认了“巴勒斯坦 ” ， 预计将引发一连串拉美国家的纷纷仿效。
Abbas is now setting his sights on Europe, and would ask Turkey to serve as a go-between. => 阿巴斯现在将目光钉住欧洲，并将要求土耳其扮演中间人的角色。

The game is to use international recognition of an independent Palestinian state to pressure the US to retreat from its almost unconditional support for Israeli policy. => 其目的是利用国际舆论对独立巴勒斯坦国的承认向美国施压，迫使其改变几乎无条件支持以色列的政策。
Israel’s main concern continues to be security. => 安全问题仍是以色列主要的关注目标。
The official Western doctrine is that Israel’s long-term security depends on the success of the “peace process.” => 主流的西方理论仍然是以色列的长期安全取决于“和平进程”能否成功。
In practice, Israel has been taking other measures to secure its future. => 事实上，以色列已经为保证未来安全采取了很多其他举措。
Media attention has been focused on the “security wall,” which has certainly succeeded in reducing the level of violence. => 其中最受媒体关注的非“安全墙”莫属，这种方法确实有效减轻了暴力活动。

But, to the hawks who now control Israeli politics, the key to Israel’s security depends on depth of defense, for which expansion of the settlements is indispensable. => 但在目前把持以色列政局的鹰派人物看来，以色列安全与否直接取决于防御深度，因此扩建定居点成为必不可少的一步。

Thus, while Abbas seeks to create a new “fact on the ground” by drumming up international support for a Palestinian state, Israel aims to trump him by making such a state unviable. => 于是，在阿巴斯争取对巴勒斯坦国的国际支持，力求制造“既成事实”的同时，以色列的克敌之道则是釜底抽薪，让建立巴勒斯坦国的愿望不可能实现。

The ideal alternative to both strategies is a peace process that aims not to create two states, but rather to establish the political and economic basis for a single confederal state. => 不追求两个国家、而建立拥有统一政治经济制度的联邦制国家才是上述两种战略的理想替代方案。
Indeed, the two-state solution was always an illusion. => 事实上，分别建国的解决办法从来都无法实现。
There was never enough land to satisfy the passionate possessiveness of all those with claims to it. => 有限的土地资源从来无法满足各方强烈的占有��愿。

And, over time, Israeli settler disengagement from the West Bank and East Jerusalem has become just as impossible as any attempt by Israel to expel its remaining Arabs. => 而且，随着时间一点一滴的流逝，让以色列定居者从西岸和东耶路撒冷地区撤离和从该地区驱逐剩余阿拉伯人的企图都已经无法实现。
Israeli Jews are bound to stay in the West Bank and East Jerusalem, and Israeli Arabs are bound to stay in Israel proper. => 以色列犹太人注定要待在西岸和东耶路撒冷，而以色列阿拉伯人也注定要在以色列的本土上繁衍。

These are the “facts on the ground” that doom Palestinian hopes for a sovereign Palestinian state no less than Israeli hopes for a wholly Jewish state. => 这就是“不得不面对的现实 ” ， 它打破了巴勒斯坦人独立建国的希望，而以色列人建立纯粹犹太国家的梦想也同样因此而破灭。
Moreover, land for peace never made sense from an economic point of view. => 此外，从经济的角度讲，以土地换和平从来就是行不通的解决方案。

Most people have forgotten that the Paris Protocols of April 1994 established a customs union between Israel and the occupied territories, with a joint Economic Council to adjudicate trade disputes. => 绝大多数人已经忘记1994年4月签订的《巴黎协议》建立了以色列和被占领土关税同盟，并规定由联合经济委员会负责对贸易纠纷做出裁决。
The free movement of goods, labor, and capital between the two parts could have given a tremendous economic boost to Palestinian GDP. => 货物、劳工和资金的自由流动可以在很大程度上推动巴勒斯坦国内生产总值的发展。

It could also have been the basis of a confederal state, whose Palestinian part would have benefited from the West Bank settlers’ productivity and taxes. => 这也可以成为建立联邦制国家的基础，西岸定居者的生产和纳税会帮助联邦制度下的巴勒斯坦方面。
But this benign prospect was undermined by the violence needed to maintain the Jewish state and enable the emergence of a Palestinian one. => 但如此美好的前景却遭到以保护犹太国、成立巴勒斯坦国为目的的暴力的无情破坏。

The official view remains that only an internationally guaranteed two-state settlement will bring about the security needed for the economic revival of the Palestinian territories. => 主流观点仍然坚持只有国际社会担保的两国解决方案才能确保巴勒斯坦地区经济复苏所必不可少的安全。

But it is just possible that unilateral Israeli policy, implicitly backed by the US, will create interim conditions of peace that are sufficient for economic growth to cool Palestinian nationalism. => 但我们必须承认这种可能性，即受到美国暗中支持的以色列单边政策可以创造和平发展经济的临时条件，而经济的发展则能够熄灭巴勒斯坦民族主义的火焰。
Netanyahu’s project is not moral. => 内塔尼亚胡的计划不合乎道德原则。
But that doesn’t mean that it won’t work, at least for a time. => 但这并不意味着这项计划不会取得至少某种短期效果。
A Confederation for Kosovo => 为科索沃建立邦联
Time is running out in Kosovo. => 留给科索沃的时间已经越来越少了。
That would be a disastrous step. => 那将是一个灾难性的举动。

Russia would be furious, because it fears that Kosovo’s secession – whether or not it is internationally recognized – might fuel separatist movements in the former Soviet empire. => 俄罗斯会震怒，因为它担心科索沃一旦分离，不管是否为国际所承认，都会进一步引发前苏联帝国内部主张独立的运动。
Serbia is even more strongly opposed. => 塞尔维亚甚至会更激烈地表示反对。
Dusan Prorokovic, Serbia’s state secretary for Kosovo, has said that his country might use force to maintain its sovereignty. => 塞尔维亚负责科索沃问题的国务秘书普罗洛科维奇曾表示他的国家可能会动用武力来维护他的主权。
After eight years of international administration, Kosovo’s Albanian majority has tasted freedom and is eager for full independence. => 在经过八年的国际管制后，科索沃占据多数的阿尔巴尼亚族已经尝到了自由的味道，并且渴望完全独立。
But Serbia claims that the province remains an essential part of its historical and cultural tradition. => 但是塞尔维亚宣称，这个省从历史和文化传统上都是它的一个重要部分。
Serbia is prepared to concede only “enhanced autonomy” to Kosovo, and some capacity to enter into international agreements. => 塞尔维亚已经准备给予科索沃只会“得到增强的自治权 ” ， 以及部分签定国际协约的地位。
Yet, while the two parties now seem irreconcilable, it is not too late for compromise. => 然而，尽管这两方看上去似乎无法调和，要取得妥协现在还为时不晚。
But this is possible only by resuscitating – and updating – an old institution of the international community: a confederation of states. => 但是这只有通过复苏以及更新一个国际社会的旧的机制，也就是多国邦联才有可能实现。
Kosovo would thus gain some essential trappings of statehood. => 科索沃将因此获得某些表明国家地位的重要外部标志。

As a result, Kosovo and Serbia would constitute two distinct international subjects, bound by a confederation hinging on a common decision-making body. => 其结果是，科索沃和塞尔维亚将组成两个不同的国际主体，捆绑在由一个共同决策机构将其连接起来的邦联体下。
In addition, the EU should create a small but effective military force (say, 5,000 troops) to back up the common body’s decisions. => 此外，欧盟应该建立一支小但却有效的军事力量（比如说，5000人的部队）来支持共同决策机构所做出的决定。
As with any compromise, the contending parties would both gain and lose from this arrangement. => 像任何妥协一样，参与的各方在这一安排中都会有所得也有所失。
Serbia would save face, and would continue to have a say on crucial matters concerning Kosovo, including the treatment of the Serbian minority. => 塞尔维亚会保全脸面，并且将继续对有关科索沃的重大问题、包括科索沃的塞尔维亚少数民族的问题拥有话语权。
The EU would benefit as well, by contributing to the stabilization of a highly volatile area. => 通过给一个高度动荡的地区注入稳定，欧盟也会同样从中受益。
Subsequently, the EU would monitor Kosovo and prevent any dispute that might turn violent. => 其结果是，欧盟将会监管科索沃，并且防止任何可能会引发暴乱的争端发生。
A final advantage of this solution is that it would be temporary. => 这一解决方案的最后一点好处是它会是临时性的。

The confederation I advocate would thus constitute an intermediate stage (lasting five or ten years), at the end of which Kosovo is likely to become fully independent. => 我所提倡的这个邦联因此将是一个中间步骤（延续5到10年时间 ） ， 在这一阶段最后科索沃可能会完全独立。
A Cool Calculus of Global Warming => 全球变暖的成本计算

The report proposes an agenda whose cost would be equivalent to just 1% of annual consumption, but would save the world risk equivalent costs that are five times greater. => 该报告提出的计划其成本只等于年消费的1 % ， 但却能为世界节省5倍的风险等价成本。
But few saw, for instance, the Artic ice cap melting as rapidly as now seems to be the case. => 温室气体集中度的增加会对气候和海平面产生强烈的影响。 但几乎没有人认识到北极冰盖以现在的速度融化也与此有关。
Still, some suggest that because we are not certain about how bad global warming will be, we should do little or nothing. => 可仍然有人建议说由于还不清楚全球变暖的情况究竟有多严重，我们应该静观其变甚至无所作为。
To me, uncertainty should make us act more resolutely today, not less. => 在我看来，不确定性应该使我们今天更坚定地采取行动。

As one scientist friend puts it: if you are driving on a mountain road, approaching a cliff, in a car whose brakes may fail, and a fog bank rolls in, should you drive more or less cautiously? => 正如我的一个科学家朋友所说：如果你在一条山路上开车，驶向一处悬崖，而汽车的制动系统可能有问题，又正逢山雾弥漫，你应该开得更谨慎还是更随意呢？
Global warming is one of those rare instances where the scientific community is more fearful of what may be happening than the population at large. => 全球变暖是少数几个令科学界比令大众更担心的问题。
Scientists have glimpsed what the future may portend. => 科学家们已经窥见了未来。
As the Stern report points out, as usual, the poor are the most vulnerable. => 正如斯特恩的报告中所指出，和很多情况下一样穷国是最脆弱的。
A third of Bangladesh will be underwater by the end of this century. => 到本世纪末孟加拉国三分之一的国土会被海水淹没。
The Maldives and a host of Pacific Island states will disappear: our twenty-first-century Atlantis. => 马尔代夫和一些太平洋岛国会消失：成为我们二十一世纪的亚特兰蒂斯。
To an economist, the problem is obvious: polluters are not paying the full costs of the damage they cause. => 对于一位经济学家而言，问题是明显的：污染的制造者们没有为自己造成的破坏完全买单。
Pollution is a global externality of enormous proportions. => 污染是一项比例巨大的全球性外部因素。
The advanced countries might mean Bangladesh and the disappearing island states no harm, but no war could be more devastating. => 发达国家可能并非有意危害孟加拉国和那些正在消失的岛国，但即便是战争也没有这样的破坏力。
A global externality can best be dealt with by a globally agreed tax rate. => 应对一项全球性外部因素的最佳方式是通过一个全球认同的税率。
This does not mean an increase in overall taxation, but simply a substitution in each country of a pollution (carbon) tax for some current taxes. => 这并不是意味着总体税收的增加，而仅仅是在每一个国家以一项污染（碳）税取代现有的某些税种。
It makes much more sense to tax things that are bad, like pollution, than things that are good, like savings and work. => 对污染这样的不良现象征税比对储蓄和工作等良好的事物征税更有道理。
Although President George W. Bush says he believes in markets, in this case he has called for voluntary action. => 虽然布什总统声称他相信市场的作用，但在这一问题上他还是呼吁自发的行动。

Some companies even seem to celebrate the melting of the polar ice cap, because it will reduce the cost of extracting the oil that lies beneath the Arctic Ocean. => 有些公司甚至似乎在庆祝极地冰盖的融化，因为这会降低它们在北冰洋开采石油的成本��

The good news is that there are many ways by which improved incentives could reduce emissions – partly by eliminating the myriad of subsidies for inefficient usages. => 好消息是我们有很多办法可以通过改善后的激励机制减少（温室气体的）排放—其中一个办法是取消对低效使用能源的种种补贴。

The US subsidizes corn-based ethanol, and imposes tariffs on sugar-based ethanol; hidden in the tax code are billions of dollars of subsidies to the oil and gas industries. => 美国对用玉米为原料制备的乙醇提供补贴，而却对以糖为原料的乙醇征收关税，被这一税则掩盖的是对石油和天然气工业的巨额补贴。
Most importantly, price signals that show the true social costs of energy derived from fossil fuels will encourage innovation and conservation. => 最为重要的是，显示来自化石燃料的能源所造成的真实成本的价格信号会鼓励创新和节能。
Small changes in practices, when replicated by hundreds of millions of people, can make an enormous difference. => 日常行为的小小改变如果被成千上万的人实践就能扭转局面。

For example, simply changing the color of roofs in warm climates to reflect sunlight or planting trees around houses can lead to great savings on energy used for air conditioning. => 例如，仅仅改变气候温暖的地区的房屋顶部颜色以反射阳光，或在房屋周围植树就能实现空调耗能的大量节省。
We have but one planet, and should treasure it. => 我们只有一个地球，我们应该珍爱它。
Global warming is a risk that we simply cannot afford to ignore anymore. => 全球变暖是一个我们无论如何都不能再忽视的风险。
A Cool Head for the Hottest Issues => 每临大事有静气

LONDON – Reading Barack Obama’s Dreams from My Father, the US president’s beautifully written reflections on his early life and identity, most people are struck by his cool and intellectual approach. => 发自伦敦 — — 当读到《我父亲的梦想》这本美国总统奥巴马用优美的文笔叙述自己早年生活以及个人身份定位的自传时，许多人都会惊讶于他那种冷静而理智的做事方式。
This is not to say that he is unemotional. => 但这并不是说奥巴马就是个毫无感情的人。
Obama can rage and weep. => 他这个人可以表现得狂野暴躁，有时也会软弱无力。
But he rarely seems to act on the basis of raw sentiment or instinctive prejudice. => 但奥巴马似乎很少由着自己不加掩饰的情感或者本能的偏见行事。
Pragmatic and highly intelligent, sooner or later every issue receives the full attention of his forensic curiosity. => 得益于他的务实和睿智，所有事物迟早都会被奥巴马仔细研究和审视。
He would not be afraid to act, but he would be prepared to think first. => 在行动面前他从不缩手缩脚，但在此之前，他必会三思。
Obama was praised extravagantly a year ago; 12 months on, the criticism is over the top, too. => 一年之前，这位总统承受了过度的赞誉；如今12个月过去了，他所背负的批评自然也会登峰造极。
Obama inherited a terrible legacy – recession, financial meltdown, Iraq, Afghanistan. He has not solved all of these problems. => 奥巴马继承的是一笔非常糟糕的遗产 — — 经济衰退，财政崩溃，伊拉克，还有阿富汗。
That seems to be changing now. => 但事情如今也有了转机。

Obama may have come to understand that when you are the leader of the world’s only superpower, you need to be feared just a little if you are to be respected. => 奥巴马可能会意识到，当自己是世界唯一超级大国的领袖时，如果想得到人们的尊敬，就得至少要让别人有点害怕你。
The left in America criticizes Obama for not turning the economy around already. => 美国左派批评奥巴马至今没有令经济完全复苏。
The right angrily denounces him as a crypto-communist because he wants every American to have health care. => 右派则愤怒地宣称他是个共党地下党员，因为他试图令每个美国人都享受医疗保险。
With a dispassionate eye on the long game, what will the president himself be thinking? => 但不知道这位用平和的心态去看待这个漫长过程的总统，自己又在琢磨些什么呢？
One issue that Obama is certain to have in his sights is a problem that shadowed the world for years. => 对此，奥巴马肯定会考虑的一个问题就是那个笼罩了世界多年的阴影。
When I was growing up in the 1950’s and 1960’s, world peace was based on the nuclear standoff between the US and the Soviet Union. => 在我成长的那个1950~1960年代，世界和平是构筑在美苏之间核力量的均衡之上的。

The main strategic assessment on both sides of the Berlin Wall was that if either side made a wrong move, all of us might end up consumed in the flames of a nuclear holocaust. => 柏林墙对面双方的主要战略形势评估就是如果任何一方走错了一步，那么我们所有人都会在一场核浩劫中化为灰烬。

This was called, in the geostrategic jargon of the day, “mutually assured destruction,” or MAD. The acronym was entirely appropriate. => 在当时干地缘政治这行的人口中，这叫“保证互相毁灭 ” （ Mutually Assured Destruction，亦称“共同毁灭原则 ” ） ， “ MAD(癫狂 ) ” 这个缩写堪称神来之笔。
We have forgotten those days. => 如今人们已经淡忘了那些年月。
Yet there are still 23,000 nuclear warheads on our planet, with the explosive power of 150,000 Hiroshima bombs. => 但这个星球上依然有2万3千枚核弹头，破坏力相当于15万枚广岛原子弹。
Terrorist groups would undoubtedly like to get their hands on one. => 而那些恐怖组织也肯定很想搞到其中的一两枚。
In all, there are eight nuclear-weapon states – the US, Russia, Britain, France, China, Israel, India, and Pakistan. => 世界上总共有8个核武国家 — — 美、俄、英、法、中，还有印巴两国以及以色列。
North Korea may also have a few bombs. Iran is believed by many to be trying to develop one. => 朝鲜可能也有几枚原子弹，很多人也相信伊朗正在努力发展核武器。
The Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty (NPT) has contained the number of nuclear states. => 《核不扩散条约》文本中列明的核国家数目已经过时。
A conference is to be held in May to renew and review it. => 因此将在今年五月召开一个会议对条约重新进行审议和修订。

Obama clearly recognizes that the NPT needs to be strengthened in order to prevent countries from turning their civil nuclear-power capacity into weapons. => 奥巴马清楚地明白到必须加强这一条约，否则就难以阻止那些拥有民用核技术的国家将自己的科技转化为杀人武器。

But Obama also knows that if the existing nuclear states want others to accept tougher restrictions, they will have to cut back their nuclear arsenals. => 但奥巴马也同时意识到，如果现有的核武国家希望其他国家接受更严格的管制，他们就必须削减自己的核武器数量。
This is principally an issue for the US and Russia, which possess 95% of the world’s nuclear weapons. => 而这主要是美俄两家的事情，因为两国手中握有占全世界总量95%的核弹头。
In addition, it would help if the US could take a strong lead by ratifying the Comprehensive Nuclear-Test-Ban Treaty. => 此外，如果美国能批��《全面禁止核试验条约》的话，那么将起到一个强有力的示范作用。
The nuclear issue is one of the biggest items on the Obama agenda. How it is handled will help to define his presidency. => 核问题是奥巴马众多议程中的其中一个重中之重。
Even before the talking gets serious in May, there will be the question of Iran to sort out. => 而如何处理这个问题甚至将决定人们对他总统任期的评价。
Iran says that it seeks no more than its own ability to produce nuclear power. => 即便在五月进行正式谈判之前，伊朗的问题也亟待解决。

Disbelief grows with every revelation of secret Iranian facilities and plans, and with every refusal by Iran to negotiate safeguards that would allow for civil use while preventing weaponization. => 随着伊朗秘密核设施和反应堆的不断曝光，以及德黑兰当局不断拒绝旨在保证核设施民用而非武器化的国际监察，不信任的情绪正与日俱增.
The US, the European Union, and Russia have tried to engage Iran on this issue, so far without success. => 在这个问题上，美国，欧盟和俄罗斯都在努力和伊朗接触，但至今都无功而返。
China seems likely to block effective sanctions on Iran because of its close energy relationship with the country. => 中国似乎出于两国之间紧密的能源关系考虑，希望阻止对伊朗进行有效制裁。
How China eventually handles this will profoundly affect its standing in the US and Europe. => 而中国最终如何处理这个问题将深远地影响其在美国和欧洲心目中的形象。
These are going to be some of the major questions for Obama over the next year and more. => 而上述就几个是奥巴马在今后几年中所需要面对的主要问题。
If he gets them right, he can forget about his short-term critics. => 如果处理得漂亮，他就能把这些短期内的批评置诸脑后。
Fortunately, he is smart enough to know this. => 幸运的是，他足够聪明，肯定会意识到这一点。
A Crisis in Full Flight => 大逃亡危机

MUNICH – For a while, it looked as if the European Central Bank’s €1 trillion credit program to pump liquidity into Europe’s banking system had calmed global financial markets. => 慕尼黑—曾经有那么一段时间，看上去欧洲央行向欧洲银行系统注资1万亿欧元信用以提振流动性的计划已让金融市场平静下来。
But now interest rates for Italian and Spanish government bonds are on the rise again, closing in on about 6%. => 但眼下，意大利和西班牙国债利率再次开始上升，正在向6%靠近。
Of course, this may not be the breaking point beyond which the debt burden becomes unsustainable. => 当然，这或许并不是债务负担变得不可持续的临界点。
After all, interest rates in Southern Europe were well above 10% in the decade before the euro was introduced. => 毕竟，南欧国家的利率在欧元引入前要大大高于10 % 。
Even Germany at that time had to pay bondholders more than 6%. => 即使是德国，当时也必须向债权人支付6%的利息。
Nevertheless, the markets are clearly signaling growing doubt about whether Spain and Italy will be willing to bear their debt burden. => 尽管如此，市场清楚地标明，对西班牙和意大利是否愿意承担债务负担的疑虑正在与日俱增。

The current-account deficit remains at 3.5% of GDP, despite the recession-induced decline in imports, while economic contraction will cause Spain to miss its budget-deficit target again. => 经常项目赤字相当于GDP的3 % ， 这还是衰退导致进口大幅下降情况下的数字；而经济收缩将使西班牙再次脱离预算赤字目标。

Moreover, Spain’s debt with the ECB’s TARGET settlement system rose by €55 billion ($72 billion) between February and March, because capital outflows of that amount had to be compensated. => 此外，今年2月—3月，西班牙在欧洲央行“目标 ” （ TARGET）清算系统中的债务增加了550亿欧元（相对于720亿美元 ） ， 这是因为大规模资本外流需要获得补偿。
Since July 2011, Spain’s TARGET debt has grown by €199 billion. => 2011年7月以来，西班牙的“目标”系统债务增加了1990亿欧元。
Capital is in full flight, more than offsetting the inflows from 2008-2010. => 资本蜂拥而出，比2008—2010年的流入量还要多。

The cumulative total since the beginning of the first crisis year (2008) means that Spain has financed its entire current-account deficit via the printing press. => 从危机爆发首年（2008）以来的累计总量看，西班牙的全部经常项目赤字都是通过印钞来融资的。

The picture is little better in Italy, where the current-account balance has swung from a surplus of around 2% of GDP to a 3%-of-GDP deficit over the last ten years. => 意大利的情况要好一些，过去十年来经常项目收支在2%GDP盈余和3%GDP赤字之间波动。
The country’s TARGET debt grew by €76 billion from February to March, with the total since July 2011 reaching €276 billion. => 今年2月—3月，意大利“目标”系统债务增加了760亿欧元，2011年7月以来的总额为2760亿欧元。
Italy, too, is being drained of capital; in fact, the flight of investors accelerated after the ECB’s liquidity injection. => 意大利也面临着资本枯竭的问题；事实上，投资者的外逃加速了欧洲央行的流动性注入。

It is now clear that the ECB itself has caused a large part of the capital flight from countries like Spain and Italy, because the cheap credit that it offered drove away private capital. => 现在看来，显然欧洲央行自身压实资本从西班牙和意大利等国大量外逃的一大原因，因为它所提供的廉价信用驱走了私人资本。
The purpose of the ECB’s measures was to re-establish confidence and bring about a recovery of the inter-bank market. => 欧洲央行行动的初衷是重塑信心并让银行间市场复苏。
In this, too, it has not really been successful, despite the huge amount of money that it put on the table. => 但这个目的同样没有达到，尽管它抛出了巨额资金。
Indeed, now the French are looking wobbly. => 事实上，现在法国看上去也开始动摇了。
As capital fled the country between July 2011 and January 2012, France’s TARGET debt increased by €95 billion. => 2011年7月至2012年1月，资本从法国逃出，该国“目标”系统债务增加了950亿欧元。
France, too, has become uncompetitive, owing to the cheap credit brought by the euro in its initial years. => 使用欧元最初几年的便宜信用同样拖累了法国的竞争力。
Italy will have to depreciate by 10-15%, and Spain by roughly 20%. => 意大利必须贬值10 % — 15 % ， 西班牙必须贬值约20 % 。

While Greece and Portugal face the need for deflation totaling 30% and 35%, respectively, the figures for Spain and Italy are high enough to justify fears about the future development of the eurozone. => 希腊和葡萄牙所需贬值幅度分别为30%和35 % ， 但西班牙和意大利的数字之高已足以引起人们对欧元区未来的担忧。
These imbalances can be redressed only with great effort, if at all, and only if one accepts a decade of stagnation. => 这些失衡唯有通过付出巨大努力才能消除，而且必须接受长达十年的停滞。
For Greece and Portugal, staying in the eurozone will be a tight squeeze. => 对希腊和葡萄牙来说，留在欧元区内将是活受罪。

But this would unfairly force savers and taxpayers in the core countries to provide capital to the South on terms to which they would never voluntarily agree. => 但这对核��国的储蓄者和纳税人是不公平的，他们向南欧提供资本，所能获得的回报太低，他们不会自愿接受。
No one knows what these claims will be worth in the event of a eurozone breakup. => 如果欧元区崩溃，没人知道这笔债权能有多大价值。
Such systems cannot work, because they eliminate the capital market as the economic system’s main steering mechanism. => 这样一个系统是无法运作的，因为它剥夺了资本市场作为经济系统主要导航机制的地位。
One cannot help but wonder how thoughtlessly Europe’s politicians have started down this slippery slope. => 留给人们的只能是无尽的迷惑：无脑的欧洲政客为什么会选择走这样一条黑路。
A Crisis in Two Narratives => 一个危机，两种解读
CHICAGO – With the world’s industrial democracies in crisis, two competing narratives of its sources – and appropriate remedies – are emerging. => 芝加哥—世界发达民主国家陷入了危机，关于什么是危机的源头以及如何补救，出现了两种相互对立的声音。
The first, better-known diagnosis is that demand has collapsed because of high debt accumulated prior to the crisis. => 第一种为人所熟知的诊断是需求因为危机前积累的高债务而崩溃。
Households (and countries) that were most prone to spend cannot borrow any more. => 最具支出倾向的家庭（以及国家）再也无法借到钱了。

To revive growth, others must be encouraged to spend – governments that can still borrow should run larger deficits, and rock-bottom interest rates should discourage thrifty households from saving. => 为了重振增长，必须鼓励其他家庭和国家来支出 — — 仍然能够借钱的政府应该扩大赤字，同时极低的利率应该阻止节约的家庭继续储蓄。
Under these circumstances, budgetary recklessness is a virtue, at least in the short term. => 这种观点认为，粗犷的预算是一种美德，至少在短期看是如此。

In the medium term, once growth revives, debt can be paid down and the financial sector curbed so that it does not inflict another crisis on the world. => 从中期看，只要增长能够得到提振，债务就能活得偿付，而金融部门得到了抑制，因此不会在世界上掀起另一场危机。
Its virtue is that it gives policymakers something clear to do, with promised returns that match the political cycle. => 其优点在于向决策者明确指出了行动方向，还给出了符合政治周期的预期回报。

Unfortunately, despite past stimulus, growth is still tepid, and it is increasingly difficult to find sensible new spending that can pay off in the short run. => 不幸的是，尽管已经实施了刺激措施，但增长仍然疲软，而且，从短期看，要找到给力的新支出之源越来越困难了。
More such spending will not return these countries to a sustainable growth path. => 更多的同类支出无法给这些国家带来可持续的增长。
Instead, they must improve the environment for growth. => 相反，它们必须改善增长环境。
The second narrative starts with the 1950’s and 1960’s, an era of rapid growth in the West and Japan. => 第二种观点的着眼点始于20世纪五六十年代，当时正是西方和日本的高速增长期。

But, as Tyler Cowen has argued in his book The Great Stagnation, once these “low-hanging fruit” were plucked, it became much harder to propel growth from the 1970’s onward. => 但是，泰勒·柯万（Tyler Cowen）在其《大停滞 》 （ The Great Stagnation）一书中指出，这些“低处的果实”被摘取殆尽后，进入20世纪70年代以来，提振增长就变得日益困难了。
But, when growth faltered, this meant that government spending expanded, even as its resources shrank. => 但是，当增长开始放缓时，这意味着政府支出的膨胀（尽管此时其创收资源出现了萎缩 ） 。
For a while, central banks accommodated that spending. => 在一定的时间里，央行承担起了支出的重任。
The resulting high inflation created widespread discontent, especially because little growth resulted. => 由此产生的高通胀引起了广泛的不满，特别是在增长不见提振的情况下。
Faith in Keynesian stimulus diminished, though high inflation did reduce public-debt levels. => 人们对凯恩斯主义刺激的信任度下降了，尽管高通胀确实降低了公债水平。
Central banks then began to focus on low and stable inflation as their primary objective, and became more independent from their political masters. => 此后，央行开始将稳定的低通胀作为其首要目标，并越来越独立于行政。

Productivity growth increased substantially in these countries over time, which persuaded Continental Europe to adopt reforms of its own, often pushed by the European Commission. => 多年来，这些国家的生产率有了显著提高，受此影响，欧洲大陆国家也采取了改革（大多由欧洲委员会推动 ） 。

Yet even this growth was not enough, given previous governments’ generous promises of health care and pensions – promises made even less tenable by rising life expectancy and falling birth rates. => 但由于此前政府承诺了过于慷慨的医疗和养老承诺，如此增长仍旧显得力不从心，而预期寿命的增加和出生率的下降使得政府愈加不堪重负了。
Public debt continued to grow. => 公债水平继续增加。

And the incomes of the moderately educated middle class failed to benefit from deregulation-led growth (though it improved their lot as consumers). => 而教育程度适中的中产阶级在去监管化带来的增长中并没有获得好处（尽管作为消费者，他们获益良多 ） 。
The most recent phase of the advanced economies’ frenzied search for growth took different forms. => 发达经济体疯狂寻找增长的最新阶段，各国可谓八仙过海各显神通。

In other countries, like Greece, as well as under regional administrations in Italy and Spain, a government-led hiring spree created secure jobs for the moderately educated. => 在其他国家（如希腊以及西班牙和意大利的部分地区 ） ， 政府领导的招工潮为教育程度不高者提供了就业保障。

In this “fundamental” narrative, the advanced countries’ pre-crisis GDP was unsustainable, bolstered by borrowing and unproductive make-work jobs. => 在这一“基本面”观点看来，发达国家的危机前GDP增长是不可持续的，是用借贷和非生产性冗余工作岗位堆出来的。
In the US, the imperative is to improve the match between potential jobs and worker skills. => 在美国，当务之急是改善潜在工作岗位和工人技能之间的匹配度。
People understand better than the government what they need and are acting accordingly. => 个人要比政府更清楚知道他们需要什么，并据此行动。
Many women, for example, are leaving low-paying jobs to acquire skills that will open doors to higher-paying positions. => 比如，大量妇女正在脱离低收入岗位，以便获得更好的技能叩开高收入职位之门。

Too little government attention has been focused on such issues, partly because payoffs occur beyond electoral horizons, and partly because the effectiveness of government programs has been mixed. => 政府在这些方面的关注度远远不够，部分是因为其好处要在在任者任期结束后才会显现，也有部分是因为政府计划的效率不够高。
Tax reform, however, can provide spur retraining and maintain incentives to work, even while fixing gaping fiscal holes. => 税收改革可以刺激人们参与再培训，也可以激励人们继续工作，且不耽误填补财政窟窿。
The advanced countries have a choice. => 发达国家有的选择。
They can act as if all is well, except that their consumers are in a funk, and that “animal spirits” must be revived through stimulus. => 它们可以若无其事（尽管消费者如同惊弓之鸟 ， “ 动物精神”也需要刺激来予以提振 ） 。
Or they can treat the crisis as a wake-up call to fix what debt has papered over in the last few decades. => 它们也可以将此次危机视为修正过去数十年来产生债务的问题的契机。
For better or worse, the narrative that persuades these countries’ governments and publics will determine their future – and that of the global economy. => 无论如何，政府和公众选择相信哪种观点将决定它们的未来 — — 以及全球经济的未来。
Financing the Next Development Agenda => 为下一个发展日程融资

The outcome of these discussions will shape policies and investment aimed at spurring GDP growth, strengthening human capital, and promoting more inclusive prosperity. => 这些讨论的结果将决定旨在刺激GDP增长、强化人力资本和促进更具包容性的繁荣的政策和投资。
Both factors challenge us to define, in the longer term, more sustainable patterns of production and consumption. => 两大因素对我们构成了挑战，从长期看，我们需要更加可持续的生产和消费模式。
Governments, civil society, and the private sector must rise to the challenge, cooperating to find and implement creative solutions. => 政府、公民社会和私人部门必须应对这一挑战，合作寻找并实施创造性解决方案。
To start, governments should design targeted, evidence-based policies and support the development of sound institutions. => 首先，政府应该设计基于证据的定向政策并支持可靠机构的发展。

This would make government services more effective, while helping to catalyze additional development aid from traditional donors and mobilize private-sector resources. => 这将让政府服务更加有效，同时有助于刺激传统赞助者提高发展援助以及动员私人部门资金源。
In many countries, there is considerable scope for domestic resource mobilization. => 在许多国家，国内资源动员空间相当大。
More equitable taxation would have a positive impact on governance, another important tool for mobilizing domestic resources. => 更平等的税收能对治理产生积极效应，而治理是动员国内资源的又一重要工具。
Progress in these areas would help governments to channel their spending more effectively toward those who would benefit the most. => 这些方面的进步有助于政府有效地将钱花在受益最大的人群上。
For example, only 8% of the $409 billion spent on fossil-fuel subsidies in 2010 reached the poorest 20% of the population. => 比如，2010年所发放的4090亿美元化石燃料补助中只有8%送到了最贫困的20%人群手中。
A targeted support program could increase substantially the efficiency of spending, freeing up resources for education, health, and poverty eradication. => 定向支持项目能极大地增加支出的效率，解放资源用于教育、卫生和减贫。
Furthermore, promoting financial deepening and inclusiveness could accelerate private-sector growth, creating more opportunities. => 此外，促进金融深化和包容能加速私人部门增长，创造更多机会。
A deeper and more efficient financial sector would also reduce transaction costs and facilitate risk management. => 更深化、更高效的金融部门还能降低交易成本、有利于风险管理。
Local-currency bond markets could help to develop domestic investor bases and mobilize domestic savings to support long-term investments. => 本币债券市场有助于发展国内投资者基础病动员国内储蓄支持长期投资。
At the same time, the international community should work to improve the availability and effectiveness of official development assistance. => 与此同时，国际社会应该致力于改善官方发展援助（ODA）的普及型和效率。

The ODA target of 0.7% of GDP – agreed in 2002 at the International Conference on Financing for Development in Monterrey, Mexico – should motivate countries to increase their contributions. => 2002年墨西哥蒙特雷国际发展融资会议（International Conference on Financing for Development）为ODA设定了GDP的0.7%的目标值，这应该能够刺激各国增加各自的贡献力度。
They can also take steps to make ODA more predictable from year to year. => 它们还可以采取措施逐年增加ODA的可预测性。
Donors should structure aid to ensure that it supports sound national development policies and programs, rather than their own narrow interests. => 赞助者应该设计好援助结构，以保证支持优质国民发展政策和计划，而不是满足它们自身的狭隘利益。
More generally, improving coordination among donors would help to maximize the impact of aid on the ground. => 更一般地，改善赞助者间的协调有助于援助项目影响的最大化。

Attracting even a fraction of the assets held by institutional investors, sovereign-wealth funds, and public pension funds could boost development finance substantially. => 吸引哪怕一小部分机构投资者、主权财富基金和公共养老基金所持资产也能够极大地提振发展融资。
Diaspora populations are another major potential source of development financing. => 侨民是另一个发展融资的潜在主要来源。

Reducing transfer costs, which average an estimated 9% of the value of transactions, would put more money into the hands of those who need it most. => 降低汇款成本 — — 据估计平均而言占交易价值的9 % — —将使更多的钱流向最需要它们的人的手中。

Tailoring financial products for diaspora communities could attract resources for investment, while reinforcing migrants’ ties – economic and otherwise – to their home countries. => 为侨民社区量身定做金融产品能吸引投资源，同时加强移民与其祖国的经济和其他联系。
Finally, the international community bears a special responsibility for delivering global public goods. => 最后，国际社会有实现全球公共品多样化的特殊责任。

Duty-free, quota-free access to OECD markets, complemented by simpler, more transparent rules of origin, would raise GDP by 1% in the least-developed countries, lifting millions out of poverty. => 免责、无限额地进入经合组织市场，并辅之以更简单、更透明的原产地规则能使最不发达国家GDP提高1 % ， 让千百万人摆脱平困。

Investment in statistical capacity would help governments and businesses worldwide to make better policy decisions, based on a more accurate accounting of the associated costs and benefits. => 投资于统计能力有助于全球政府和企业更好地做出政策决策，让计量相关成本和收益更加正确。
The challenge of the post-2015 development agenda lies in finding creative solutions to support prosperity, equality, and sustainability. => 2015年后的发展日程的挑战在于找出创造性解决方案支持繁荣、平等和可持续性。

Together, governments, civil society, international organizations, and the private sector can improve the availability and quality of finance for development, and shape a better future for all. => 政府、公民社会、国际组织和私人部门齐心协力就能改善发展融资的普及和质量，为所有人带来更美好的未来。
A Czech Moment => 捷克风光时刻

I suppose that Donald Rumsfeld’s misguided bid a few years ago to incite a divide between “new and old” Europe contributed to the re-emergence of that disdainful attitude. => 几年前，拉姆斯菲尔德想要把欧洲分出“新欧洲”和“老欧洲”实为不智，但是他的这一言论确重新体现了这一令人厌恶态度。
The reality is that there is no such thing as “old and new” Europe, and there never was. => 实际上，世上根本就没有什么“新欧洲”和“老欧洲 ” ， 历史上从来就没有这回事。
The break with communism and reunification of Europe is now almost two decades old. => 欧洲重新统一并且与共产主义决裂目前已经将近二十年时间。
We Czechs are 100% European, and were even when the Iron Curtain cut us off from democratic Europe. => 我们捷克人是100%的欧洲人，而且在铁幕把我们从民主欧洲分裂的时代更为如此。
Indeed, our pro-EU sentiments may be all the stronger because our membership in the Union, like our freedom, is so comparatively new. => 确实，随着加入欧盟以及刚刚获得自由，我们的亲欧盟情感更为强烈。
So no one in Europe needs to fear that the Czech Republic has some nostalgic or idiosyncratic agenda that it wants to impose on the Union. => 所以，欧洲没有必要担心捷克共和国有什么怀旧或者怪异的议程来施加在欧盟头上。
On the contrary, events have imposed an agenda on Europe that we cannot escape and for which solidarity – true union – will be needed. => 相反，国际大事确给欧洲施加了我们所无法逃避的议程。 对此，我们需要真正的欧洲团结。
The primary, and most pressing, of the problems we face is the financial and economic crisis that is enveloping the EU. => 我们面临的主要、也是最为迫切的问题是正在席卷欧盟的金融和经济危机。
Unfortunately, conditions across the Union will likely worsen before they begin to improve. => 不幸的是，整个欧盟的形势在转好之前还要继续变坏。
It will fall to the Union, once again, to help transform despair into hope. => 这样，欧盟就要再次帮助把绝望转化为希望。

We Czechs know something about this, as the wrenching economic transition that we underwent in the 1990’s taught us much about how the right policies can break the grip of hopelessness. => 我们捷克人对此有所了解，因为我们在九十年代经历了艰苦的经济转型，告诉了我们许多道理，也就是正确的政策可以打破绝望钳制。
To contain today’s financial and economic crisis, Europe will also need to continue the cooperation that it has shown up to this point. => 欧洲为了遏制当今的金融和经济危机就必须继续进行迄今为止的合作。
But we cannot be complacent that the forces of national egoism will remain in check. => 但是我们并不能自满，认为各国民族自我观念会受到限制。

For now, EU governments’ coordinated fiscal stimulus has deprived populists of their usual charge that the EU is indifferent to the fate of individuals. => 目前，欧盟各国政府协调财政刺激政策，民粹主义者通常指责欧盟对单个个人的命运无动于衷也就不攻自破。
Even more policy coordination will be needed both to confront the crisis and to re-establish EU norms once the storm clouds begin to dissipate. => 为了应对危机以及在暴风开始消失的时候重新建立欧盟规则，人们就需要更多的政策协调。

Although it is right that the Stability and Growth Pact has become more flexible in these extraordinary times, its rules did secure a successful first decade for the euro. => 欧洲稳定和增长公约在这一特殊时期变得更为灵活，这是不假。 但是这一公约规则确保了欧元取得第一个十年的成功。

These rules must eventually be restored intact if Europe is to return to the path of sustainable growth, and a consensus will need to be forged now to make that happen. => 欧洲要想回到可持续增长的道路上来，这些规则就必须最终得以恢复，而且人们必须就如何促成这一局面达成一致意见。
The second key challenge that we will face during our European presidency is that of Russia. => 我们担任欧盟轮值主席国期间将要面临的第二个关键挑战就是俄国。
A new Partnership and Cooperation Agreement (PCA) between the EU and the Russian Federation must be negotiated. => 我们必须谈判制定一项欧盟与俄罗斯联邦之间新的伙伴关系和合作协议。
Those negotiations should have begun seriously last year, but the war in Georgia intervened to put them on hold. => 谈判原本应该在去年就认真开始，但是格鲁吉亚战事却把这一工作陷于停顿。
Now those talks have resumed, but the background to the negotiations has changed dramatically. => 现在这些谈判已经恢复，但是谈判的背景发生了剧烈的变化。
Russia’s economy is now in far worse shape than that of EU members. => 俄国经济现在比欧盟国家的要糟糕许多。
Moreover, without a new PCA, individual European countries may feel it necessary to seek even more bilateral agreements with Russia. => 而且，没有新的协议，欧洲各国就会感到有必要与俄国签订更多的双边协议。
Indeed, many EU members have been in a race with each other to see who will be Russia’s closest friend in the Union. => 确实，许多欧盟成员国已经开展竞赛，看看谁成为欧盟中与俄国最为亲近的朋友。

Europe’s main strength in foreign policy is not its commitment to a rules-based multilateralism, important as that undoubtedly is, but its unity. => 尽管多边主义毫无疑问非常重要，但是欧洲外交的主要力量并不是其专心致志建立规则基础之上的多边主义，而是团结。
When the Georgia crisis erupted, Europe united around a single position on Russia’s withdrawal. => 格鲁吉亚危机爆发之时，欧洲团结一致，要求俄国撤军。

It is the Czech Republic’s task, and that of the Swedish EU presidency that will follow our own, to maintain this unity as the PCA negotiations move forward. => 捷克共和国的任务，以及随后担任主席国的瑞典的任务就是在协议谈判的时候维持团结。
We, like all EU presidencies, will be representing the wider Union interests when we negotiate. => 我们和其他欧盟轮值主席一样，将会在谈判的时候推动广泛的欧盟利益。
In Praise of Fragmentation => 赞美碎片化
LONDON – Emerging markets are back in the spotlight. => 发自伦敦 — — 新兴市场再次成为了众人的焦点。
Investors and banks are suddenly unwilling to finance current-account deficits with short-term debt. => 投资者和银行突然不愿为为经常账户赤字提供短期贷款融资。
South Africa, for example, has had to increase interest rates, despite slow economic growth, to attract the funding it needs. => 例如南非尽管经济增长缓慢，但不得不提高利率来吸引资金。
Turkey’s rate increase has been dramatic. => 土耳其的利率提升也非常引人注目。
For these and other emerging countries, 2014 may prove to be a turbulent year. => 对它们以及其他新兴国家来说，2014年可能会被证明是动荡的一年。

If volatility becomes extreme, some countries may consider imposing constraints on capital outflows, which the International Monetary Fund now agrees might be useful in specific circumstances. => 如果波动变得极端，一些国家可能会考虑限制资本流出，国际货币基金组织目前认为这个做法在特定的情况下可能有用。
But the fundamental question is how to manage the impact of short-term capital inflows. => 但根本问题在于如何应对短期资本流入所带来的影响。
Until recently, economic orthodoxy considered that question invalid. => 直到最近，正统经济理论认为该问题是不成立的。

Financial liberalization was lauded because it enabled capital to flow to where it would be used most productively, increasing national and global growth. => 人们赞美金融自由化就是因为它能使资本流向生产力最高的地方，从而促进国家和全球的增长。
But empirical support for the benefits of capital-account liberalization is weak. => 但对资本账户自由化优点的实证支撑相当薄弱。
Likewise, most cross-country studies have found no evidence that capital-account liberalization is good for growth. => 同样地，大多数跨国研究发现表明没有证据证明资本账户自由化有利于经济增长。

As the economist Jagdish Bhagwati pointed out 16 years ago in his article “The Capital Myth,” there are fundamental differences between trade in widgets and trade in dollars. => 正如经济学家贾格迪什·巴格沃蒂（Jagdish Bhagwati）16年前在他的文章《资本神话》中所指出的那样，在商品贸易和美元贸易之间存在着根本差异。
The case for liberalizing trade in goods and services is strong; the case for complete capital-account liberalization is not. => 商品和服务贸易自由化会促进经济增长，而全面资本账户自由化则不会。
One reason is that many modern financial flows do not play the useful role in capital allocation that economic theory assumes. => 一个原因是许多现代金融流动并非如经济理论假设的那样对资本分配发挥有益的作用。
But in today’s world, net capital flows are often from relatively poor countries to rich countries. => 但是在当今世界，资本净流动通常是从相对贫穷国家流向富裕国家。
Moreover, capital inflows frequently finance consumption or unsustainable real-estate booms. => 此外，资金流经常会促进消费或非持续性的房地产繁荣。
And yet, despite the growing evidence to the contrary, the assumption that all capital flows are beneficial has proved remarkably resilient. => 然而尽管有越来越多的反面证据，但认为所有资本流动都有利的假说却长盛不衰。
That reflects the power not only of vested interests but also of established ideas. => 这反映了其力量不仅来自既得利益者，同时也来自已经建立的某些观念。
Empirical falsification of a prevailing orthodoxy is disturbing. => 须知一个流行的正统理论被实证推翻是件令人不安的事情。
It is time to stop looking for these non-existent benefits, and to distinguish among different categories of capital flows. => 是时候停止寻找这些子虚乌有的好处，并区分不同类别的资本流动。
Some are valuable, but some are potentially harmful. => 有些是有价值的，有些则是有害的。

Foreign direct investment (FDI), for example, can aid growth, because it is long term, involves investment in the real economy, and is often accompanied by technology or skill transfers. => 例如外国直接投资（FDI）可以刺激经济增长，因为它是长期的，涉及到实体经济中的投资，并往往伴随着技术或技能转移。

Equity portfolio investment may involve price volatility as ownership positions change, but at least it implies a permanent commitment of capital to a business enterprise. => 股票投资组合可能涉及价格波动作为所有权的位置变化，但至少它意味着对商业企业一个永久的资本承诺。
Long-term debt finance of real capital investment can play a useful role as well. => 实际资本投资的长期债务融资可以发挥有益的作用。

By contrast, short-term capital flows, particularly if provided by banks that are themselves relying on short-term funding, can create instability risks, while bringing few benefits. => 相比之下，短期资本流动，尤其是如果由本身就依靠短期资金运作的银行来提供的，会在带来少许好处的同时产生不稳定的风险。
What is less clear is the best policy response. => 而最好的政策回应就是留下一点模糊空间。

Capital controls are invariably porous, and we cannot gain the benefits of free trade and FDI without creating some opportunities for short-term investor positioning. => 因为资本管制永远有漏洞可钻，我们无法只是获得自由贸易和FDI的好处而不给短期投资者留下一些机会。
A case can thus be made for capital-account liberalization that is based on the impossibility of effective control, not on any supposed benefits. => 这可以作为基于不可能有效控制 — — 而不是基于任何假设的优点 — — 的资本账户自由化的一个案例。

But while perfect policy is unattainable, partly effective controls can still play a useful role if targeted at the interface between short-term inflows and domestic credit cycles. => 虽然完善的政策是不存在的，但如果针对短期流入和国内信贷周期的临界点，部分有效的控制仍能发挥作用。
After all, capital inflows cause the greatest harm when they drive rapid increases in credit-financed consumption or real-estate speculation. => 毕竟，当资本流入驱动信贷消费或者房地产投机快速增长时就会导致最大的破坏。
The required policy response should integrate domestic financial regulation with capital-account management. => 所需的政策反应应该把国内金融监管与资本账户管理整合起来。

The effectiveness of such measures can be undermined if global banks operate in emerging countries in branch form, providing domestic credit financed by global funding pools. => 如果全球银行在新兴国家以分行形式运作，并利用全球资金储备提供国内信贷，那这些措施的效果将会受到破坏。

Such requirements would not prevent useful capital flows: global banking groups could invest equity in emerging markets and fund their subsidiaries’ balance sheets with long-term debt. => 这样的要求不会阻止有用的资本流动：全球银行集团可以投资于新兴市场股票，并将长期债务来为子公司的资产负债表提供资金。
Neither mandatory subsidiarization nor tax- or regulation-based capital controls will solve all of the problems. => 无论是强制性的子公司化，还是基于税收或法规的资本管制都不能解决所有的问题。
But, taken together, they can stem the volatility implied by short-term flows and help to smooth out domestic credit cycles. => 但总的来说，它们可以遏止由于短期资本流动所引起的波动，并帮助缓和国内信贷周期。
Much of the financial industry resists such measures, as do the many economists who remain wedded to the old orthodoxy. => 许多金融业坚持这些措施，就像许多经济学家仍然执着于旧的正统理论一样。
Renewed capital controls, they claim, would “fragment” the global financial market, undermining its ability to allocate capital efficiently. => 他们声称，更新资本管制，将使得全球金融市场“碎片化 ” ， 削弱其有效配置资本的能力。
In the past, policymakers have been at pains to stress that no such fragmentation will be allowed. => 过去，政策制定者一直在竭力强调，这样的碎片化是不会被允许的。
But we need to be blunt: Free flows of short-term debt can result in capital misallocation and harmful instability. => 但我们需要直言不讳：短期债务的自由流动会导致资本配置不当和有害的不稳定性。
When it comes to global capital markets, fragmentation can be a good thing. => 当全球资本市场来临，碎片化可能是一件好事。
The High-Tech, High-Touch Economy => 高科技、高接触经济
LONDON – A recent report revealed that the five richest families in Britain are worth more than the country’s poorest 20% combined. => 伦敦—最近的一份研究披露，英国最富的五个家庭的财富比最穷的20%英国人加起来还要多。

Some of the wealth comes from new business ventures; but two of the five are a duke and an earl whose ancestors owned the fields across which London expanded in the nineteenth century. => 在他们的财富中，有一些来自新企业；但其中有两个家庭是公爵和伯爵，他们的祖先拥有伦敦在十九世纪所扩张的土地。
Urban land wealth is not just a London phenomenon. => 城市和财富并不只是伦敦才有的现象。

As Thomas Piketty’s recent book Capital in the Twenty-First Century shows, accumulated wealth has grown rapidly relative to income across the advanced economies over the last 40 years. => 托马斯·皮克提（Thomas Piketty）的新著《二十一世纪的资本主义 》 （ Capital in the Twenty-First Century）指出，在过去四十年中，发达经济体的累积财富增长相对要快于收入。
That might seem odd. => 这或许有些奇怪。
Though we live in the hi-tech virtual world of the Internet, the value of the most physical thing – land – is rising relentlessly. => 尽管我们生活在高科技互联网虚拟世界，但最实实在在的东西 — — 土地仍在不停地上涨。
But there is no contradiction: The price of land is rising because of rapid technological progress. => 但这其实并不矛盾：土地价格之所以上涨，正是因为快速的科技进步。
In an age of information and communication technology (ICT), it is inevitable that we value what an ICT-intensive economy cannot create. => 在信息和通信技术（ICT）时代，我们难免会珍视ICT密集型经济无法创造的东西。
One consequence is the striking phenomenon of huge wealth creation with very little labor input. => 一个结果是一个令人惊奇的现象：极少数劳动力投入就可以创造巨大的财富。
Facebook has an equity valuation of $170 billion but employs only around 6,000 people. => Facebook市值高达1,700亿美元，但只有约6,000名雇员。
The investment that went into building the software that runs it entailed no more than around 5,000 software engineer man-years. => 建设运行Facebook的软件的投资不过5,000软件工程师人年。
This remarkable technology has helped to deliver increasing average incomes and will continue to do so. => 这一令人瞩目的技术推动了平均收入的增加，并将一直如此。
But the distribution of that bounty has been very unequal. => 但这笔财富的分配是非常不平等的。
The lion’s share of the growth has gone to the top half, the top 10%, or even the top 1% of the population. => 增长的绝大部分都流向了顶层的一半人、10%的人甚至1%的人。
As the better off become richer, however, much of their rising income will not be spent on ICT-intensive goods and services. => 但是，尽管受益者变富了，其收入增幅的大头并没有花在ICT密集型商品和服务上。
There is a limit to how many iPads and smart phones one can need, and their price continues to plummet. => 一个人需要的iPad和智能手机数量总归有限，并且它们的价格也一直在下降。
But if the land on which the desired houses and apartments sit is in limited supply, the inevitable consequence is rising prices. => 但如果高尚别墅和公寓的地段供给是有限的，那么涨价便成为难以避免的结果。
Urban land is therefore rising in value – in London, New York, Shanghai, and many other cities – partly because of consumer demand. => 因此，伦敦、纽约、上海和其他许多城市土地价值节节攀升 — — 部分是因为消费需求的推动。
But its rising value also makes it an attractive asset class for investors, because further price increases are expected. => 但土地价值的上升让它们成为令投资者垂涎不已的资产类别，因为可以预期未来价格还会上涨。

Moreover, returns on real estate have been swollen by the dramatic fall in interest rates over the last 25 years, a decline that was far advanced even before the 2008 financial crisis. => 此外，房地产回报因为过去25年来利率的大幅下降（远在2008年金融危机前便已开始）而节节升高。

The cause of those low interest rates is debated; but one probable factor is the reduced cost of business investment in hardware and software-based “machines.” => 低利率的原因有待争议；但一个可能因素是基于硬件和软件的“机器”的商业投资的成本的下降。
If you can build a $170 billion company with just 5,000 software engineer man-years, you don’t need to borrow much money. => 如果建立一个1,700亿美元的公司只需要5,000软件工程师人年的，那么就无需大量借钱。

In short, ICT creates an economy that is both “hi-tech” and “hi-touch” – a world of robots and apps, but also of fashion, design, land, and face-to-face services. => 简言之，ICT创造了一��“高科技”和“高接触”的经济 — — 一个机器人和应用与时尚、设计、土地和面对面服务并存的世界。
This economy is the result of our remarkable ability to solve the problem of production and automate away the need for continual labor. => 这个经济是我们解决生产问题能力高超以及连续劳动需要被自动化排除的结果。
But it is an economy that is likely to suffer two adverse side effects. => 但这个经济可能带来两大副作用。
Major changes in financial and monetary policy, going far beyond those introduced in response to the 2008 crisis, are required to contain this danger. => 这需要金融和货币政策的重大变化来遏制，变化程度将令2008年危机所导致的应对措施黯然失色。
The Trade Delusion => 贸易的迷思
LONDON – Since 2008, global trade has grown slightly more slowly than global GDP. => 发自伦敦 — — 自2008年以来，全球贸易的增长幅度稍微落后于全球GDP的增长。
The Doha Round of World Trade Organization negotiations ended in failure. => 世界贸易组织多哈回合谈判以失败告终。
Transatlantic and transpacific trade negotiations are progressing slowly, held back by the resistance of special interests. => 在各特殊利益集团的阻挠之下，跨大西洋和跨太平洋的贸易谈判也步履维艰。

To be sure, for 65 years, rapid trade growth has played a vital role in economic development, with average advanced-economy industrial tariffs plummeting from more than 30% to below 5%. => 可以肯定的是，过去65年以来，贸易的快速增长在经济发展中扮演了至关重要的作用，使得发达经济体的各行业平均关税从超过30%暴跌到5%以下。
The creation of Europe’s single market facilitated increased intra-European trade. => 欧洲单一市场的建立促进了欧盟内部贸易的增长。
Japan, South Korea, and Taiwan achieved rapid economic catch-up on the basis of export-led growth. => 日本、韩国以及台湾以出口主导型增长实现了经济的快速赶超。
China has followed the same path over the last 30 years. => 中国在过去30年中遵循了同样的路径。
Trade grew about twice as fast as global output from 1990 to 2008. => 从1990年到2008年，贸易增速相当于全球产出增速的两倍。
But there is no reason why trade should grow faster than GDP forever. => 但是贸易不可能永远比GDP增长得更快。
Indeed, even if there were no trade barriers at all, trade might grow significantly more slowly than GDP in some periods. => 事实上，即使没有贸易壁垒，贸易增长也可能会在某些时期明显慢于GDP增长。
Several factors make it possible that we are entering such a period. => 有几方面因素使得我们正在进入这样一个时期。
For starters, there is the changing pattern of consumption in the advanced economies. => 首先，发达经济体的消费模式发生了变化。

Richer people spend an increasing share of their income on services that are either impossible to trade (for example, restaurant meals) or difficult to trade (such as health services). => 富人越来越多的把收入份额花费在服务上，这些服务要么是不可能进行贸易（例如，外出用餐 ） ， 要么是难以贸易（如卫生服务 ） 。
Non-tradable sectors tend to account for a growing share of employment and economic activity. => 非贸易部门在就业和经济活动中占据的份额越来越大。

For several decades, that tendency has been offset by ever more intensive trading of tradable goods, often passing through many countries in complex supply chains. => 几十年来，这一趋势一直被越发频密的可贸易商品交易所抵消，这些交易往往通过复杂的供应链在许多国家之间流通。
In the future, however, the shift to non-tradable consumption may dominate. => 然而在未来，非贸易消费可能转而占据主导地位。
Indeed, trade intensity may decline even for manufactured goods. => 事实上，甚至制造业商品的贸易频密度也可能会下降。
Trade is partly driven by differences in labor costs. => 贸易在一定程度上是由劳动力成本差异所驱动的。
China’s dramatic manufacturing growth reflected low wages up to now. => 目前为止，中国制造业的急剧增长反映了其低工资水平。
But as real wages in China and other emerging economies grow, incentives for trade will decline. => 但随着中国和其它新兴经济体实际工资的提高，贸易的激励因素将下降。
The more that global incomes converge, the less trade there may be. => 全球收入越是趋同，贸易的次数就越少。
Global trade as a share of GDP may therefore decline, but without adverse consequences for global economic growth. => 全球贸易作为全球GDP的组成部分，其比例可能因此下降，但不会对全球经济增长产生不利影响。
Rising productivity does not require relentlessly increasing trade intensity. => 生产率的提高无需不断增加贸易频密度。
Earth, after all, does not trade with other planets, yet its economy still grows. => 毕竟，虽然地球没有跟其他星球进行贸易，其经济却仍然保持增长。
Optimal trade intensity depends on many factors – such as relative labor costs, transport costs, productivity levels, and economy-of-scale effects. => 最优贸易频密度取决于许多因素 — — 如相对劳动力成本，运输成本，生产力水平，经济规模效应。
Trends in these factors might make reduced trade intensity not only inevitable but desirable. => 这些因素的变化趋势会令贸易频密度的降低变得不可避免，但却是有利的。
Even if that is true, international trade will still play a vital role, and preventing any reversal of past trade liberalization is essential. => 即使这是真的,国际贸易仍将发挥至关重要的作用，防止对过去贸易自由化进程的逆转是至关重要的。
But further trade liberalization is bound to be of declining importance to economic growth. => 但进一步的贸易自由化对经济增长的重要性必然会下降。
With industrial tariffs already dramatically reduced most potential benefits of trade liberalization have already been grasped. => 由于各行业关税都已大大减少，大多数贸易自由化的潜在好处已经被开发。
Estimates of the benefits of further trade liberalization are often surprisingly low – no more than a few percentage points of global GDP. => 估计进一步的贸易自由化的好处往往出奇地低 — — 不超过全球GDP的几个百分点。

That is small compared to the cost of the 2008 financial crisis, which has left output in several advanced economies 10-15% below pre-crisis trend levels. => 这相比2008年金融危机的影响来说极为微小，后者导致多个发达经济体的经济产出比危机前下跌了10~15 % 。
This implies that further progress in trade liberalization will be slow. => 这意味着贸易自由化的进一步进展将会放缓。

But slow progress is a far less important challenge to growth prospects than the debt overhang in developed economies, or infrastructure and educational deficiencies in many developing economies. => 但相对于发达国家所面对的债务，或者许多发展中经济体的基础设施和教育缺口来说，这一缓慢进展只能算是一个次要的发展障碍。
That reality often goes unacknowledged. => 事实的真相往往会被忽视。

The importance of past trade liberalization has left the global policy establishment with a bias toward assuming that further liberalization would bring similar benefits. => 过去的贸易自由化导致全球政策体制出现了一种偏见，以为进一步的自由化就能产生同样的结果。

But while the potential global benefits of trade liberalization have declined, reduced trade intensity might still impede economic development in some countries. => 但虽然贸易自由化所带来的潜在全球利益在缩小，但贸易频密度的降低将依然阻碍某些国家的经济发展。
Relying solely on that model will be more difficult in the future. => 在未来，单纯依靠这一模式将变得更为艰难。
That poses important challenges for development policy, which further trade liberalization can alleviate only marginally. => 这对发展政策的制定提出了严峻的挑战，而进一步的贸易自由化只是杯水车薪而已。
Rethinking the Monetization Taboo => 反思货币化戒条

LONDON – Now that the pace of the US Federal Reserve’s “tapering” of its asset-purchase program has been debated to death, attention will increasingly turn to prospects for interest-rate increases. => 发自伦敦 — — 如今人们已经对美联储“缩减”资产收购计划的步骤进行了充分的讨论，而注意力也将逐渐转向对利率上升的预期方面。

But another question looms: How will central banks achieve a final “exit” from unconventional monetary policy and return balance sheets swollen by unconventional monetary policy to “normal” levels? => 但同时又出现了另一个问题：央行们将如何达到一个退出非常规货币政策的最终“出口 ” ， 并把在非常规货币政策下过度膨胀的资产负债表恢复到“正常”的水平？
To many, a larger issue needs to be addressed. => 对许多人来说，一个更大的问题必须得到处理。
The Fed’s tapering merely slows the growth of its balance sheet. => 美联储的缩减仅仅是减缓了其资产负债表的增速。
The authorities would still have to sell $3 trillion of bonds to return to the pre-crisis status quo. => 如果想回到危机前水平的话，当局还要发行价值3万亿美元的债券。
The rarely admitted truth, however, is that there is no need for central banks’ balance sheets to shrink. => 但一个很少被承认的真相就是各大央行其实无需去缩减自己的资产负债表规模。
They could stay permanently larger; and, for some countries, permanently bigger central-bank balance sheets will help reduce public-debt burdens. => 它们可以长期保持更大的规模；而对一些国家来说，这种长期大规模状况将有助于减轻公共债务负担。

As a recent IMF paper by Carmen Reinhart and Kenneth Rogoff illustrates, advanced economies face debt burdens that cannot be reduced simply through a mix of austerity, forbearance, and growth. => 正如卡门·莱因哈特与肯尼思·罗格夫最近发表的一篇国际货币基金组织论文所指出的那样，那些发达经济都面临着一些无法仅仅借助一系列紧缩，拖延和增长就能消除的债务负担。
But if a central bank owns the debt of its own government, no net public liability exists. => 但如果一家央行也持有本国债券的话，那就再也不存在什么纯粹的公共债务责任了。
The government owns the central bank, so the debt is to itself, and the interest expense comes back to the government as the central bank’s profit. => 央行为政府所有，因此等于政府自己向自己借债， 而利息支出又以央行利息收入的形式返还给了政府。
This amounts to “helicopter money” after the fact. => 这等同于债务出现之后投放的“直升飞机货币 ” 。

In 2003, then-Fed Chairman Ben Bernanke argued that Japan, facing deflation, should increase public expenditure or cut taxes, funding the operation by printing money rather than issuing bonds. => 在2003年，时任美联储主席的本·伯南克认为面临通缩的日本应当增加公共支出或者减税，并通过印钞而非发行债券的方式来为这些措施注入资金。
This, he argued, was bound to increase national income, because the direct stimulative effect would not be offset by concern about future debt burdens. => 他认为这最终会增加国家收入，因为这种直接刺激的效应不会被对未来债务负担的担忧所抵消。
His advice was not followed; large Japanese deficits were in fact bond-financed. => 但他的建议却没有被采纳；大量的日本财政赤字其实是通过发债支撑的。
But the debts held by the Bank of Japan (BoJ) could still be written off. => 但日本银行所持有的债务却依然是可以被注销的。

In Japan’s case, this would reduce government debt by an amount equal to more than 40% of GDP today, and around 60% if implemented after the bond purchases planned for 2014. => 对日本来说，这将可以削减相当于当前GDP总额40%的政府债务，如果在2014年计划的债权购买计划后实施的话甚至可以达到60 % 。
Objections focus on two risks: central-bank losses and excessive inflation. => 反对的焦点集中在两大风险之上：央行的损失以及过度通胀。
But both of these outcomes can be avoided. => 但这两点后果其实都是可以避免的。
Central banks have bought government bonds with money on which they currently pay zero or very low interest rates. => 央行们用自身以零利率或者超低利率融来的钱去购买政府债券。
So, as interest rates rise, central banks might face costs exceeding their income. => 因此随着利率上升，央行可能会面临支出超过收入的状况。

But central banks can choose to pay zero interest on a portion of the reserves that commercial banks hold with them, even when they increase the policy interest rate. => 但即便央行提升了政策利率，它们依然可以选择去向那一部分由商业银行持有的储蓄支付零利息。

And they can require commercial banks to hold zero-interest reserves at the central bank equal to a defined proportion of their loans, thus preventing inflationary growth of private credit and money. => 它们也可以要求商业银行在央行持有相当于其贷款特定比例的零利率储蓄，并因此防止私人信贷和货币的通胀性增长。
Permanent monetization of government debts is undoubtedly technically possible. => 长期的政府债务货币化无疑是技术上可行的。
Whether it is desirable depends on the outlook for inflation. => 而这是否可取则取决于对通胀的预期。
Where inflation is returning to target levels, debt monetization could be unnecessarily and dangerously stimulative. => 当通胀恢复到目标水平时，债务货币化就可能变成一种不必要且危险的刺激手段。
Central-bank bond sales, while certainly not inevitable, may be appropriate. => 央行债务出售，虽然注定无法避免，但也可以是恰当的。
But if deflation is the danger, permanent monetization may be the best policy. => 但如果通缩是真正威胁的话，长期的货币化可能是最佳的政策。
I predict that Japan will, in effect, permanently monetize some government debt. => 我预测日本会在事实上将一些政府债务实施长期货币化。
That will not happen, and any attempt to reach that target would drive Japan into a severe depression. => 这种情况不会发生，而且任何试图实现这一目标的举措都将把日本带入一场严重衰退之中。
But the government does not need to repay the ¥140 trillion ($1.4 trillion) of its debt that the BoJ already owns. => 但日本政府不需要偿还日本银行已经持有的140万亿日元（折合1.4万亿美元）债务。
The BoJ will continue to increase its balance sheet until it achieves its 2% inflation target. => 日本银行将继续扩大其资产负债表直到达到2%的通胀目标。
It is precisely what happened to the Fed’s balance sheet after its wartime and postwar buying of US government bonds came to an end in 1951. => 而这也正是美联储的资产负债表在1951年结束购买美国政府战时和战后债券后所发生的情况。
Even as permanent monetization occurs, however, the truth may be obfuscated. => 即便长期货币化的情况出现，但真相或许会被掩饰掉。
Central banks can monetize debt while pretending not to. => 央行可以在假装没有的情况下把债务货币化。
The historical experience of Weimar Germany, or that of Zimbabwe today, illustrates the danger. => 过去德国魏玛政府，当今津巴布韦的遭遇都反映了这种风险。

As a result, even when permanent monetization occurs – as it almost certainly will in Japan and possibly elsewhere – it may remain forever the policy that dare not speak its name. => 因此，即便发生了长期货币化 — — 几乎可以确定日本会实施而其他国家也有可能 — — 但可能政策永远不会提到这一词汇。
Such reticence may serve a useful purpose. => 这种沉默或许将有利于实现一个有益的目的。
