But it must not blind central banks and governments to the full range of policy tools available to address today’s severe debt overhangs. => 但这也不应令央行和政府们忘记还有这类政策工具是可以用来应对当前的债务暴增问题的。
The Perils of Financial Freedom => 金融自由的弊端

LONDON – Back in 2007, China’s then-prime minister, Wen Jiabao, famously described his country’s economy as “unstable, unbalanced, uncoordinated, and unsustainable.” => 发自伦敦 — — 2007年，时任中国国家总理的温家宝指出“中国经济存在着巨大问题，依然是不稳定、不平衡、不协调、不可持续的结构性的问题。
Today, the imbalance remains, with the economy too focused on investment and too dependent on credit. => ”如今，不平衡状态依然存在，而中国经济则太过集中于投资领域并过度依赖于信贷。

China’s current leadership is committed to building a more balanced model, and believes that the market must play a “decisive role” in achieving that. => 当前的中国领导层承诺要建立一个更为均衡的发展模式，并相信市场会在实现这一目标的过程中扮演“决定性的角色 ” 。

But, while stronger market discipline is needed in some areas, Chinese officials should be under no illusion that free markets are a panacea for the financial sector. => 但当某些领域需要更强监管之时，中国官员们不应奢望自由市场会成为金融部门的一剂万能药。
Indeed, China’s current economic imbalances partly reflect the dangers created by competition in credit markets. => 事实上，中国当前的经济不平衡状况在某种程度上正是反映出由信贷市场竞争所产生的危机。

Even before the 2008 global financial crisis, China’s annual investment/GDP ratio was running at an exceptionally high 40%, and economists were calling for a transition to more consumption-led growth. => 即便是在2008年全球金融危机之前，中国的年均投资/GDP比率就达到极高的40%水平，而经济学家们也在呼吁向更消费导向的增长形势转型。
But the huge credit stimulus introduced in 2009 drove the economy further in the opposite direction. => 2012年上述比率上升到47 % ， 而工程建设已经占到了全部产值的40 % 。
Both China and the global economy benefited from that stimulus, which helped prop up overall demand in dangerously deflationary times. => 中国和全球经济都从这一刺激行动中受益，而这也在危险的通缩时期推高了总需求。

But it has led to significant wasted investment in heavy industry, real estate, and urban infrastructure, and leaves China facing the challenge of deleveraging and working out bad debts. => 但这也导致了在重工业，房地产以及城市基础设施建设方面的大量浪费，为中国留下了去杠杆化和坏账的挑战。
In many areas, improved market discipline does have an important role to play in addressing the structural causes of imbalance. => 在许多领域，市场纪律的强化确实在应对失衡状况的结构性原因方面发挥了重要作用。
Wasteful construction investment is encouraged by the under-pricing of rural land. => 压低价格的农村土地鼓励了过度浪费的建设投资。

The lack of a normal ownership relationship between the central government and state-owned enterprises (SOEs) allows the latter to pay minimal dividends and over-invest in business expansion. => 中央政府和国有企业之间正常所有权关系的缺失令后者可以只支付最低限度的红利并在业务发展方面过度投资。
Caps on interest rates on bank deposits result in household savers supplying a large subsidy to corporate borrowers. => 对银行存款利率设定的上限导致家庭储蓄者实际上是巨额补贴了企业贷款者。
And SOEs have better access to credit from state-owned banks than private companies do. => 国企也比私企更容易从国有银行得到贷款。

But the belief that financial liberalization will provide an easy route to a balanced and stable economy is a delusion, as Japan’s experience in the 1980’s illustrates. => 但日本在1980年代的经验证明，那种认为金融自由化就能使经济走向平衡稳定的想法是错误的。

When Japan relaxed constraints on its banking system in the 1980’s, the result was an enormous real-estate boom and subsequent bust, followed by two decades of slow growth and deflation. => 当日本在1980年代放松对银行系统的管制之后，借着就是一场巨大的房地产泡沫以及随后的经济破灭，结果就是持续20年的低速增长和通缩。

China’s per capita income is still only about a quarter of Japan’s in 1990; it would be a tragedy if it suffered a similar setback before completing the path to developed-country living standards. => 中国的人均收入在1990年仅相当于日本的1/4，如果中国在实现发达国家生活水平出现了类似的挫折，那必将是悲剧性的。
This reflects the interaction of two distinctively Chinese factors and one inherent feature of all banking systems. => 这反映出两大中国特色因素和所有银行系统的一个内在特点的互动结合。
The first Chinese factor is the authorities’ focus on “urbanization” as an end in itself, rather than as a byproduct of industrialization. => 第一大特色是当局强调“城市化 ” ， 但这种城市化本身就是目的，而非工业化的副产品。

The second is China’s decentralized approach to economic development, with strong competition between regions and cities often focusing on prestige urban infrastructure projects. => 其二是中国实现经济发展的去中心化手段，区域之间不断竞争，各城市都以宏大华丽的城市基础设施项目为荣。
These factors will drive construction booms and busts even if obvious market distortions are removed and market discipline is tightened. => 即便排除了明显的市场扭曲并强化市场纪律，这些因素依然会导致房产建设泡沫并最终破裂。
The pre-crisis Irish and Spanish banking systems proved just as capable as Chinese state-owned banks at funding excessive real-estate construction. => 危机前的爱尔兰和西班牙银行都和中国的国有银行一样拥有资助过度房地产建设的能力。
Caps on loan-to-value or loan-to-income ratios on real-estate loans should be used aggressively. => 应当大规模应用对贷款额/价值比和贷款额/收入比设置上限的方法。

Capital requirements for banks should reflect higher risk weights for real-estate lending than banks’ private assessments of credit risks suggest are appropriate. => 同时对银行资本金的要求应体现在对房地产贷款方面比银行内部信贷风险评估更高的风险权重。
Credit provision by shadow banks needs to be tightly regulated. => 影子银行的信贷供应必须严加规管。
The credit cycle is too important to be left to free markets. => 对信贷周期的控制能力至关重要，不可拱手让给自由市场。
China thus faces a difficult challenge. => 中国因此面对这一个严峻的挑战。

It must undergo a transition not to the Western model that produced the 2008 crisis, but to an entirely new model that combines elements of market discipline with strong public-policy constraints. => 它必须实施一个转型，不是朝向导致了2008年危机的西方模式，而是实现一个将某些市场管制因素和强大公共政策限制相结合的全新模式。
How smoothly that transition occurs matters for the whole world. => 这场转型能否平稳进行对全世界来说都非常重要。
By the early 2020’s, China’s GDP will be $20 trillion. => 到2020年代初期，中国的GDP将达20万亿。

If the credit/GDP ratio reaches 250% by then, total loans and debt securities would equal $50 trillion, which is more than three times the total of US mortgage debt in 2008. => 如果信贷/GDP比率在那时达到250 % ， 就意味着总贷款和债务证券价值将达到50万亿，比美国2008年是的次级贷规模还大3倍。
Today, much of that debt represents claims within the state sector – owed, for instance, by SOEs to state-owned banks. => 如今，大多数债务的偿付都在国有部门以内，比如国有企业和国有银行。

One hopes that the Chinese authorities understand the dangers as well as the benefits of free financial markets better than advanced-economy policymakers did ahead of the 2008 crisis. => 我们希望中国政府能比2008年危机前的发达经济体政策制定者们更好地认识到自由市场的优点和风险。
If not, another crisis – far more severe than the last – may become inevitable. => 如果不是的话，另一场危机 — — 而且比前一场更加剧烈 — — 将不可避免。
The Great Credit Mistake => 信用之谬大矣
LONDON – Before the financial crisis erupted in 2008, private credit in most developed economies grew faster than GDP. => 伦敦—2008年前，大部分发达经济体的私人信用增长都快于GDP。
Then credit growth collapsed. => 接着，私人信用增长崩了盘。
Whether that fall reflected low demand for credit or constrained supply may seem like a technical issue. => 私人信用增长的崩盘反映了需求低迷还是供给受限或许是个技术性问题。
But the answer holds important implications for policymaking and prospects for economic growth. => 但答案对决策和经济增长前景具有重要影响。
And the official answer is probably wrong. => 而官方答案可能是错的。
The prevailing view has usually stressed supply constraints and the policies needed to fix them. => 流行的观点通常强调供给受限以及纠正这一问题的政策。
An impaired banking system, it is argued, starves businesses, particularly small and medium-size enterprises (SMEs), of the funds they need to expand. => 该观点认为，受损的银行系统让企业困于缺乏扩张所需要的资金，特别是中小企业。
In September 2008, US President George W. Bush wanted to “free up banks to resume the flow of credit to American families and businesses.” => 2008年9月，美国总统小布什希望“解放银行以使信用重新流向美国家庭和企业。 ”
The stress tests and recapitalizations of US banks in 2009 were subsequently hailed as crucial to the recovery of both the banking system and the economy. => 2009年美国银行的压力测试和资本重组随后被称为是银行系统和经济复苏的关键。

By contrast, the European Central Bank’s inadequately tough stress tests in 2010 were widely panned for leaving eurozone banks too weak to provide adequate credit. => 相反，2010年欧洲央行压力测试不够严厉被广泛指为导致欧元区银行太疲软而无法提供重组信用的原因。

In the eurozone, it is hoped that this year’s asset quality review (AQR) and stress tests will finally dispel concerns about bank solvency and free up credit supply. => 在欧元区，人们希望今年的资产质量检查（asset quality review）和压力测试最终能够打消关于银行偿债能力的疑虑，解放信用供给。
A “credit crunch” – particularly in trade finance – was certainly a key reason why the financial crisis generated a real economy recession. => “信用动荡 ” — —特别是贸易融资信用 — — 毫无疑问是金融危机导致实体经济衰退的一个关键因素。

Taxpayer-funded bank rescues, higher bank capital requirements, and ultra-easy monetary policy have all been vital to overcome credit supply constraints. => 纳税人出资的银行援助政策、更高的银行资本要求以及极端宽松的货币政策都是克服信用供给受限的关键。

But there is strong evidence that once the immediate crisis was over, lack of demand for credit played a far larger role than restricted supply in impeding economic growth. => 但充分的证据表明，一旦迫在眉睫的危机过去，信用需求不足对阻碍经济增长的作用就会远远超过供给受限。

That argument is persuasively made by Atif Mian and Amir Sufi in House of Debt, an important new book that analyzes US data on a county-by-county basis. => 这一令人信服的观点由阿提夫·米安（Atif Mian）和埃米尔·苏菲（Amir Sufi）在《债务屋 》 （ House of Debt）中提出。
It was in those US counties, too, that local businesses cut employment most aggressively. => 地方企业削减人工最猛的也是这些县。
For SMEs, a shortage of customers, not a shortage of credit, constrained borrowing, employment, and output. => 对中小企业来说，缺少客户，而不是缺少信用，制约了它的借贷、雇用和产出状况。
And the customers were absent because the pre-crisis credit boom had left them over-leveraged. => 而之所以缺少客户，是因为危机前信用繁荣导致他们过度借贷。
In the UK, many business surveys from 2009-2012 told the same story. => 在英国，2009—2012年的多项商业调查也给出了同样的结论。
Poor customer demand was ranked well ahead of credit availability as a constraint on growth. => 客户需求萎靡在制约增长方面的作用远甚于信用易得性。
Economic growth can indeed continue to be severely depressed by a debt overhang even when credit supply is unrestricted and cheap. => 即使在信用供给不再受限并且十分低廉的情况下，经济增长也确实有可能继续陷于深度萧条。
Many Japanese companies were left overleveraged by the boom and bust in credit and real estate in the 1980s and early 1990s. => 20世纪80年代和90年代初，许多日本公司因为信用和房地产业的繁荣和萧条而陷于举债过度的境况。
By the late 1990s, the Japanese banking system was offering companies loans at near-zero interest rates. => 到20世纪90年代末，日本银行系统以几乎为零的利率向公司提供贷款。
But, rather than borrow to invest, firms cut investment to pay down debt, driving two decades of stagnation and deflation. => 但是，企业并未借钱投资，反而削减投资来偿债，因而助长了二十年的停滞和通缩。
Major progress in fixing these problems has already been achieved. => 纠正这些问题的主要进展已经实现了。
The ECB’s latest Monthly Bulletin documents this, citing multiple indicators of improved credit availability and pricing. => 欧洲央行的最新《月报 》 （ Monthly Bulletin）肯定了这一点，指���多重指标表明信用易得性和价格都在改善。

Nonetheless, the rate of decline in private-sector loans has accelerated over the last year – from -0.6% to -2% – and low demand is acknowledged to be the main driver of depressed credit growth. => 尽管如此，私人部门贷款收缩速度在去年仍出现了加快 — — 从-0.6%变为-2 % — —并且寻求低迷已被认定为信用增长受阻的主要原因。
Simultaneous private deleveraging and fiscal consolidation are restricting eurozone growth far more than remaining restrictions on credit supply. => 私人去杠杆化和财政整合的同时进行对欧元区增长的限制远过于信用供给持续受限。

That reflects a recurring tendency in official policy debates, particularly in the eurozone, to concentrate on fixable problems to the exclusion of more difficult issues. => 这表明官方政策争论（特别是欧元区内）再度集中于可解决的问题而不去顾及更加困难的问题。
Fixing impaired banking systems after a crisis is both essential and achievable. => 在危机后修补受损银行系统至关重要并且可以实现。

Moreover, even when public rescue costs are inevitable, they are typically small change compared to the economic harm wrought by the financial crisis and post-crisis recession. => 此外，虽然公共援助成本难以避免，但与金融危机和危机后衰退所带来的经济伤害相比，它们往往只是次要变化。
By contrast, a large debt overhang may be intractable unless policy orthodoxies are challenged. => 相反，大量债务积压非常棘手，除非挑战政策正统。
Japan offset private deleveraging in the 1990s by running massive public deficits. => 20世纪90年代，日本用大规模公共赤字抵消私人去杠杆化。

The US has pulled out of recession faster than the eurozone, not only – or even primarily – because it fixed its banking system faster, but because it pursued more stimulative fiscal policies. => 美国之所以比欧元区更快地摆脱衰退，不仅是因为 — — 甚至并非主要因为 — — 它更快地修补了银行系统，也是因为它采取了更具刺激性的财政政策。

But fiscal stimulus is constrained within the eurozone, where member countries no longer issue their own currency and “sovereign” debt therefore carries a default risk. => 但财政刺激却在欧元区受到了限制，欧元区成员国不再发行本国货币，因此“主权”债务有了违约风险。

Aggressive monetary expansion through quantitative easing is also far more complicated and politically contentious in a currency area with no federal debt for the central bank to buy. => 通过量化宽松实现的激进的货币扩张在欧元区也更加复杂、更具政治正义性，因为作为货币区的欧元区不存在可供中央银行购买的联邦债务。
To survive and thrive, the eurozone will need to become more centralized, with some common fiscal revenues, expenditures, and debts. => 要摆脱困境，实现复苏，欧元区就需要更加集中化，拥有一些共同财政收入、支出和债务。
Of course, this scenario implies immensely difficult political choices. => 当然，这一情景意味着非常艰难的政治抉择。
But the starting point for debate must be realism about the nature and severity of the problems facing the eurozone. => 但争论起点必须是现实地认清欧元区所面临的问题的性质和严重程度。
If eurozone policy assumes that fixing the banks will fix the economy, the next ten years in Europe could look like the 1990s in Japan. => 如果欧元区政策认为解决了银行问题就能解决经济问题，那么欧洲的未来十年将和日本的20世纪90年代一样。
Inequality by the Click => 鼠标带来的不平等

LONDON – Pope Francis warned in November that “ideologies which defend the absolute autonomy of the marketplace” are driving rapid growth in inequality. => 伦敦—教皇方济各在11月时警告说 ， “ 捍卫市场绝对自治权的意识形态”正在导致不平等性的快速扩大。
Is he right? => 他说得对吗？
In one sense, Francis was clearly wrong: in many cases, inequality between countries is decreasing. => 从一个角度看，方济各显然是错误的：在许多情形中，国家间的不平等性在下降。
The average Chinese household, for example, is now catching up with the average American household (though still with a long way to go). => 比如，中国普通家庭就在赶超美国普通家庭（尽管仍有很大差距 ） 。
But such examples do not negate the importance of rising inequality within countries. => 但这样的例子并不能证明国家内部不平等性扩大的问题不重要。
Both China and the United States are dramatically unequal societies – and are becoming more so. => 中国和美国都是非常不平等的社会，并且在变得越来越不平等。
In the US, the statistics are striking at both ends of the income distribution. => 在美国，收入分布两端的数字都令人震惊。
The bottom quarter of US households have received almost no increase in real (inflation-adjusted) income for the last 25 years. => 最底层四分之一的美国家庭在过去25年中的实际（经通胀调整的）收入几乎没有增长。
They are no longer sharing the fruits of their country’s growth. => 他们不再能够共享国家成长的果实。

The top 1% of Americans, however, have seen their real incomes almost triple during this period, with their share of national income reaching 20%, a figure not seen since the 1920’s. => 但是，同期最顶层1%美国人的实际收入几乎翻了三倍，占国民收入的比重达到了20 % ， 这是自20世纪20年代以来从未有过的现象。

In many emerging countries, rapid economic growth has raised living standards to at least some degree for almost everyone, but the share of the rich and ultra-rich is increasing dramatically. => 在许多新兴国家，高速经济增长至少在某种程度提高了几乎所有人的生活水平，但富人和超级富人所占比重在显著增长。

Once these countries approach the average income levels of developed economies, and their growth slows to typical rich-country rates, their future may look like America today. => 一旦这些国家达到发达国家的平均收入水平、增长下降到典型富裕国家水平，它们的未来可能将和美国的今天差不多。
Globalization explains some of the bottom-quarter income stagnation in the US and other developed economies. => 全球化在一定程度上解释了美国和其他发达经济体低层四分之一收入为什么停滞不前。
Competition from lower-paid Chinese workers has driven down US wages. => 来自收入更低的中国工人的竞争拉低了美国的工资。
But technological change may be a more fundamental factor – and one with consequences for all countries. => 但技术变迁可能是更为根本的因素，也是影响到所有国家的因素。
Technological change is the essence of economic growth. => 技术变迁是经济增长的源泉。

We get richer because we figure out how to maintain or increase output with fewer employees, and because innovation creates new products and services. => 我们变得更富是因为我们学会了如何用更少的雇员保持和增加产出，也是因为创新创造出了新产品和新服务。
Successful new technologies always cause job losses in some sectors, which are offset by new jobs elsewhere. => 成功的新技术总是会造成一些部门的就业损失，但其他部门的新岗位会抵消这一影响。
Tractors destroyed millions of agricultural jobs, for example, but tractor, truck, and car manufacturers created millions of new ones. => 比如，拖拉机毁掉了数百万农业工作岗位，但拖拉机、卡车和汽车制造商又创造了几百万个新岗位。
But new technologies come in subtly different forms, with inherently different economic consequences. => 但新技术略有不同，其经济后果也具有本质不同。
Today’s new technologies may have far more troubling distributional effects than those of the electromechanical age. => 今天的新技术比电机时代的技术具有高得多的破坏性分配效应。

Imagine that 30 years ago, someone had discovered a set of magic words enabling us to speak to any friend anywhere in the world – “abracadabra John” and you were talking to John, wherever he was. => 试想，30年前有人发明了能让我们与世界上任何一位朋友交谈的咒语 — — 只消念一句“约翰来 ” ， 你就能和约翰聊天了。
But, beyond that, no new jobs would have been created. => 但是，除此之外，不会有新就业岗位被创造出来。
Information and communication technology is not costless magic; but it is closer to it than were the innovations of the electromechanical age. => 信息和通信技术不是无成本的魔法；但与电机时代的创新相比，它们距离无成本魔法更近了。
The cost of computing hardware collapses over time in line with Moore’s law of relentlessly increasing processing power. => 计算机硬件成本遵循摩尔定律下降，于是处理能力不断地上升。
And once software has been developed, the marginal cost of copying it is effectively zero. => 而一旦软件被开发出来，复制它的边际成本几乎与零。

The consumer benefits of this technology are large relative to its price: the cost of each year’s latest computer, tablet, or smartphone is trivial compared to the cost of a new car in 1950. => 这项技术的消费者好处相对于其价格来说很大：每年的最新款电脑、平板和智能手机成本比起1950年的最新款汽车来根本不值一提。
But the number of jobs created is trivial, too. => 但创造的就业岗位数量同样也不值一提。
In 1979, General Motors employed 850,000 workers. => 1979年，通用汽车公司雇用了850,000名员工。
Today, Microsoft employs only 100,000 people worldwide, Google employs 50,000, and Facebook employs just 5,000. => 如今，微软公司全世界员工总数只有100,000人，谷歌是50,000人，Facebook只有5,000人。
These are mere drops in the ocean of the global labor market, replacing very few of the jobs that information technology has automated away. => 如此规模在全球劳动力市场的汪洋大海中只算得上一片小浪花，只相当于被信息技术“自动化”掉的岗位数量的零头。
But increased unemployment is not inevitable. => 但失业的增加并不是不可避免的。
There is no limit to the number of service jobs that we can create in retail, restaurants and catering, hotels, and an enormous variety of personal services. => 我们可以在零售、餐饮、饭店和各种个人服务行业创造出无限量的工作岗位。
But the wages that the market will set for these jobs may result in yet greater inequality. => 但市场为这些岗位准备的工资可能引起更大的不平等。
And there is no reason to believe that politicians’ all-purpose answer to the problem – “increase workforce skills” – will offset this tendency. => 没有理由认为政客的通用答案 — — “提升劳动力技能”能扭转这一趋势。
However many people learn superior IT skills, Facebook will never need more than a few thousand employees. => 不管多少人学习了尖端IT技能，Facebook永远也只需要几千名员工。
And access to high-paid jobs is likely to be determined not by absolute skill level, but by relative skill in a winner-take-all world. => 而能否获得高薪岗位可能不但取决于绝对技能水平，也将取决于在赢家通吃世界中的相对技能水平。
At least, however, IT products and services are very cheap, so even the relatively poor can afford them. => 但是，至少IT产品和服务非常便宜，因此即使是相对贫困的人也可以买得起。
That might make very unequal societies more stable than many fear. => 这或许能让非常不平等的社会比许多人所担心的更稳定。
Cowen may be right; the poor may not rebel. => 柯文也许是对的；穷人可能不会起义。
But extreme inequality should still concern us. => 但极端不平等仍让我们忧心忡忡。

So Pope Francis was right: despite capitalism’s undoubted success as a system for generating economic growth, we cannot rely on market forces alone to generate desirable social outcomes. => 因此教皇方济各是对的：尽管资本主义作为一种制度在创造经济增长方面毫无疑问是成功的，但我们不可能完全只依靠市场力量创造值得追求的社会结果。
All new technologies create opportunities, but free markets will distribute the fruits of some new technologies in dramatically unequal ways. => 所有新技术都创造机会，但自由市场分配新技术的果实的方式可能非常不平等。
Offsetting such outcomes will be a greater challenge today than it has been in the past. => 如今，如何抵消这一结果的挑战比以前更大了。
Protectionist Shadows over Solar Power => 笼罩太阳能的保护主义阴影

CAMBRIDGE – As July ended, a settlement was reached in the world’s largest anti-dumping dispute, with China agreeing to a minimum price for the solar panels that it exports to the European Union. => 坎布里奇 — — 世界最大的反倾销争端终于于7月底达成和解，中国同意以约定的最低价格向欧盟出口太阳能电池板。
Nonetheless, the settlement is a bad outcome for consumers – and for the environment. => 但和解对于消费者和环境而言都是不好的结果。
The China-EU dispute parallels a similar one between China and the United States. => 中国和欧盟的争端与中美争端非常相似。

China, citing its own finding of US dumping of polysilicon – a key input in the production of solar panels – into its market, has already retaliated by imposing import tariffs that could exceed 50%. => 中国方面则指出美国对华倾销生产太阳能电池板的关键材料多晶硅，并对美进口产品加征超过50%的报复性关税。
The solar-panel disputes may sound narrow and esoteric, but they go to the heart of the long-running debate over globalization. => 太阳能电池板争端看似狭隘深奥，但却直指全球化长期争论的核心议题。

Anti-globalization activists’ most powerful argument is that even if free trade is good for economic progress overall, it might undermine important public goods such as environmental protection. => 反全球化人士最有力的论据是即使自由贸易从总体上有利于经济增长，但也可能破坏环保等重要公共利益。

Under the well-known “race to the bottom” hypothesis, countries that are open to international trade are thought to adopt weaker environmental regulations than less open countries do. => 根据著名的“向下竞争”假说，对国际贸易开放的国家被认为实施了相对宽松的环保法规。
But trade can also have beneficial environmental effects. => 但贸易也可能对环境产生有利的影响。

Specialization in each country allows people to obtain more of what they want, which, especially at higher income levels, includes cleaner air and water. => 各国分工专业化使人们得到更多想要的东西，特别是当收入水平较高，清洁的空气和水就更符合人们的预期。
When trade brings down costs, it can benefit environmental goods just as much as it benefits other goods. => 贸易在降低生产成本的同时，也能够像惠及其他领域那样惠及环境领域。
So, is trade globalization, on balance, better or worse for the environment? => 那么，贸易全球化总体而言究竟对环境有害还是有利？

Some empirical studies of cross-country data find net beneficial effects on indicators of environmental degradation like local sulfur-dioxide air pollution. => 针对跨国数据的某些实证研究发现贸易全球化对当地二氧化硫空气污染等环境退化指标会产生积极的影响。
Provided that countries have effective governance institutions at the national level, trade and growth give them the means to clean their air. => 只要某国在国家一级拥有有效的治理机构，贸易和经济增长会使他们有办法清洁自己的空气。
The solar-power industry is a perfect example of how trade can benefit air quality. => 太阳能行业是贸易惠及空气质量的绝好实例。

Proponents, for their part, counter that temporary moderate subsidies would expand the industry, with economies of scale and learning-by-doing then bringing down costs sharply. => 太阳能支持者则针锋相对地提出暂时给予适度补贴将扩大行业规模，最终规模经济和经验积累将使成本大幅度降低。
The current embrace of protectionism threatens to reverse this progress. => 目前的保护主义可能逆转已经取得的进展。
But “findings” of “dumping” into foreign markets surely warrant some response, no? => 但“发现”针对国外市场的“倾销行为”当然需要做出回应，不是吗？
Actually, no. => 其实真的不是。
But that is not even the way anti-dumping laws are usually written, let alone applied. => 但反倾销法往往在起草时都没有遵守上述规则，更不用说执行。
Simply put, anti-dumping measures, such as the US and EU tariffs against Chinese solar panels, are a means of reducing, not fostering, competition. => 简言之，美欧等对中国太阳能电池板征收关税的反倾销措施是为了遏制，而不是促进竞争。
So, if predatory pricing is not the producers’ motive for selling below cost in these cases, what is? => 那么，如果掠夺性定价并不是生产者在上述案例中以低于成本价销售的动机，他们的动机究竟是什么？
The solar-panel industry worldwide – in China, Europe, and the US – is experiencing a glut of productive capacity. => 在中、欧、美以及全球范围内，产能过剩的问题正严重困扰着太阳能电池板行业。

As a result, global supply and demand are balanced at a market price that is below the long-term average cost per unit, which includes a share of the cost already incurred in building the factories. => 结果造成维持全球供需平衡的市场价低于将建厂成本计算在内的长期平均单位成本。
But that market price is not below the short-term cost of keeping the factories running once they are built. => 但上述市场价与工厂建成后维持运营的短期成本相比却并不低。

When the US or EU finds that China is “dumping” solar panels, or when China finds that the US is “dumping” polysilicon, they are using average cost rather than marginal cost. => 当美国或欧盟认定中国“倾销”太阳能电池板，或者当中国认定美国“倾销”多晶硅，他们所考虑的仅仅平均而非边际成本。
By this criterion, dumping occurs every time a store has a clearance sale. => 按照这一标准，每次商户清仓甩卖都属于倾销行为。
But a more revealing precedent is Japan’s VERs on exports of autos during this period. => 但日本在此期间针对汽车业实行自愿出口限制的先例则更有启迪意义。
American automakers had found it increasingly difficult to compete against smaller, more fuel-efficient Japanese imports. => 美国汽车制造商与更小更省���的日本进口车抗衡难度越来越大。
When free trade was eventually restored, American wallets and air quality benefited (and the US auto industry was forced to become more efficient). => 自由贸易最终恢复时，美国的钱包和空气质量因此而受益（美国汽车业也被迫变得更有效率 ） 。
Free trade in automobiles was good for the environment 30 years ago. => 30年前的汽车自由贸易对环境有利。
The same is true of trade in solar equipment today. => 如今的太阳能设备也同样如此。

Westerners should thank Chinese panel producers for their contribution to keeping solar power viable, not penalize them through protectionist anti-dumping measures. => 西方人应该感谢中国电池板生产商在保持太阳能竞争力中所起的作用，而不是通过贸易保护性质的反倾销措施对他们进行惩罚。
The Russian Godfather => 俄罗斯教父
WARSAW – Russian President Vladimir Putin is behaving like a Mafia boss. => 华沙—俄罗斯总统普京的行为就像是黑帮老大。
In invading, occupying, and finally annexing Crimea, he pointed Russia’s guns at Ukraine and said: your territorial sovereignty or your life. => 在入侵、占领最终吞并克里米亚的过程中，他将俄罗斯的枪口对准乌克兰，说：要领土主权还是要命。
So far, extortion has worked – and Putin knows it. => 目前，勒索取得了效果 — — 普京深知这一点。
Indeed, in his speech announcing the annexation of Crimea, Putin spoke his mind: his regime fears no punishment and will do whatever it pleases. => 事实上，在他宣布合并克里米亚的演讲中，普京说出了他的想法：他的政权不惧怕任何惩罚，想怎么着就怎么着。
Crimea is just the first step toward realizing his dream of revived Russian greatness. => 克里米亚只是恢复俄罗斯荣光的第一步。
His address in the Kremlin was a tissue of lies and manipulation, though a subtle analysis would be a waste of time. => 他的克里姆林宫演讲是一层谎言和操纵的面纱，但对此做详细分析只是浪费时间。

The simple fact is that the president of one of the world’s most powerful countries has embarked on a path of confrontation with the entire international community. => 简单的事实是，这位世界上最强大国家之一的总统在向全体国际社会选战。

His speech smacked of the fevered, paranoid world of Fyodor Dostoyevsky’s Demons, conjuring as it did a delusional alternative universe – a place that does not exist and has never existed. => 他的演讲颇有些陀思妥耶夫斯基的《恶魔 》 （ Demons）中的狂热、偏执的风格，好像他身处一个妄想的平行宇宙中，身处一个并不存在、也从未存在过的世界。

What does Kosovo, where the Albanians suffered persecution and ethnic cleansing, have in common with the situation in Crimea, whose people have never been oppressed by Ukrainians? => 科索沃与克里米亚有什么共同点？ 在科索沃，阿尔巴尼亚人遭遇了迫害和种族清洗，而克里米亚人从未遭到过乌克兰人的压迫。
What is the point in displaying open contempt for Ukraine’s government, parliament, and people? => 为什么要公然藐视乌克兰政府、议会和人民？
Why label Ukrainian authorities “fascist and anti-Semitic”? => 为什么要给乌克兰独裁者贴上“法西斯主义和反犹主义”的标签？
In Putin’s mind, the whole world has discriminated against Russia for the last three centuries. => 在普京看来，过去三百年中世界都看不起俄罗斯。
Russia’s bloody despots – Catherine II, Nicholas I, or Stalin – apparently never discriminated against anyone. => 俄罗斯的血腥暴君 — — 叶卡捷琳娜二世、尼古拉斯一世或斯大林 — — 显然从未看不起任何人。
Putin also warns that “you and we – the Russians and the Ukrainians – could lose Crimea completely.” => 普京还警告说“你们和我们 — — 俄罗斯人和乌克兰人 — — 可能彻底失去克里米亚。
Yet he fails to specify who – perhaps Poles and Lithuanians again? – are setting their sights on Sevastopol. => ”但他没有明确指明是谁 — — 或许又是波兰人和立陶宛人？ — — 在觊觎塞瓦斯托波尔。
Russia could not, according to Putin, leave the people of Crimea “alone in their predicament.” => 按普京的说法，俄罗斯不能置克里米亚人“孤独地深陷窘境 ” 。
“We want Ukraine to be a strong, sovereign, and independent country,” says Putin. => “我们希望乌克兰成为强大、主权和独立的国家 ， ” 普京说。
Stalin said the same thing about Poland in 1945. => 斯大林1945年对波兰说过同样的话。
This is the real end of history – the history of dreams about a world governed by democratic values and the market economy. => 这是真正的历史的终结 — — 由民主价值和市场经济治理世界之梦的历史。
It takes force to stop a thug, not sharp words or cosmetic sanctions. => 要阻止暴徒，必须诉诸武力，靠激烈的言辞和装模作样的制裁是没用的。
I commend and take pride in Poland’s prudent and determined policy and the attitude of its public, which do us great credit. => 我赞美并自豪于波兰审慎而果断的政策和波兰人民的态度，这让我们获得了卓著的声誉。
But we must recognize that the best quarter-century in the last 400 years of Polish history is about to end before our very eyes. => 但我们必须认识到，波兰过去四百年历史中最好的四分之一世纪就要在我们的眼前结束了。
A time of tectonic shifts has begun. => 结构转变的时期开始了。
We must appreciate what we have managed to achieve – and learn to protect it. => 我们必须珍视我们已经取得的成就，并学会保护它。
Mafia bosses often meet an unhappy fate, and I do not think that Putin will fare much better in the end. => 还帮老大通常结局都不好，我也不认为普京最后会有很好的下场。
Unfortunately, many people are likely to be hurt in the meantime, not least those who now support him. => 不幸的是，在此过程中有很多人会受到伤害，不止是现在支持他的哪些人。
Living with Climate Change => 与气候变化共存

ROTTERDAM – For anyone still undecided about the consequences of global warming, the summer of 2018, one of the hottest on record, should have tipped the scales. => 鹿特丹 — — 对所有仍在观望全球变暖后果的人而言，2018年的夏天，也是有史以来最热的夏天，应该已经倾斜了他们的天平。
Across far-flung longitudes and latitudes, regions are struggling with the fallout from large-scale climate-related events. => 在远隔万里的精度和纬度上，各地正在拼命应对大规模气候事件所造成的影响。

In the southern United States, cities and towns pummeled by Hurricane Florence in September were still drying out when Hurricane Michael brought more flooding in October. => 在美国南部，那些在9月曾遭到飓风佛罗伦萨袭击的城市和城镇却在10月飓风迈克尔携 更多洪水到来之前几近干涸。
In California, firefighters are battling the embers of the largest wildfire in state history. => 在加利福尼亚，消防人员正试图扑灭该州有史以来规模最大的山火余烬。
And in parts of Latin America, Europe, Africa, and Asia, agricultural output is in freefall following months of stifling heat. => 而在拉美、欧洲、非洲和亚洲的部分地区，在经历长达数月的闷热天气后，农产品产量正在出现自由落体般的下滑。
Cooler weather has done little to ease the suffering. => 天气逐渐凉爽几乎无法减轻这种痛苦。
According to the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, “moderate” to “exceptional” drought conditions cover 25.1% of the United States. => 据美国国家海洋及大气管理局统计 ， “ 中等”直至“异乎寻常”的干旱条件覆盖了25.1%的美国。

But “extreme” and “exceptional” drought – the worst categories – expanded to cover 6.3% of the country, up from 6% in mid-September. => 但“极端”和“异乎寻常”的干旱 — — 也就是最糟糕的一类 — — 规模扩大到覆盖该国领土的6.3 % ， 高于9月中旬的6 % 。
Regions in Australia also are struggling with the worst drought in a generation. => 澳大利亚许多地区也正在与一代人以来最严重的干旱作斗争。

In fact, for a growing number of people around the world, floods, landslides, and heatwaves – Japan’s summer in a nutshell – is the new normal. => 事实上，对遍布世界各地越来越多的民众而言，洪水、山体滑坡和热浪 — — 简而言之就是日本的夏天 — — 已经成为新常态。

A recent study in the journal PLOS Medicine projects a fivefold increase in heat-related deaths in the US by 2080; the outlook for poorer countries is even worse. => 公共科学图书馆医学杂志最近一项研究预测，2080年美国与炎热相关的死亡将增长五倍多；贫困国家所面临的前景将更加糟糕。
The climate debate is no longer about causes; fossil fuels and human activity are the culprits. => 原因不再是气候辩论的主要目标；罪魁祸首是化石燃料和人类活动。
Rather, the question is how billions of at-risk people and businesses can rapidly adapt and ensure their communities are as resilient as possible. => 相反，问题在于数十亿面临风险的民众和企业如何才能迅速适应并确保他们的社区能够尽可能地恢复。
Some communities have already recognized this, and local adaptation is well under way. => 有些社区已经认识到这一点，而当地的适应措施正在实施当中。

In Melbourne, Australia, for example, planners are working to double the city’s tree canopy by 2040, an approach that will lower temperatures and reduce heat-related deaths. => 例如在澳大利亚的墨尔本，规划人员正在尽一切努力到2040年实现该市树荫量翻倍，这种方法可以降低温度并减少热相关死亡。
These are just two of the many infrastructural responses that communities around the world have undertaken. => 这还仅仅是世界各地社区正在落实的众多基础设施对策中的两项。

But adapting to climate change will also mean managing the long-term economic fallout of extreme weather, and this is a requirement that countries are only beginning to take seriously. => 但适应气候变化还将意味着管理极端天气的长期经济影响，而各国才刚刚开始认真对待这样的要求。
Consider water scarcity. => 以水资源短缺为例。

According to a 2016 World Bank analysis, drought-related water crises in Africa and the Middle East could reduce GDP in these regions by as much as 6% by 2050. => 2016年世界银行分析显示，非洲及中东地区与干旱相关的水资源危机可能会使这些地区的国内生产总值到2050年下降达6 % 。
That would be painful anywhere, but it would be devastating in regions already rife with political turmoil and humanitarian crises. => 这在任何地方都足以令人痛苦，但在那些已经饱受政治动荡和人道主义危机折磨的地区，后果将会是灾难性的。
At the same time, rising sea levels will cause severe damage to coastal areas. => 与此同时，海平面上升将对沿海地区造成严重的破坏。

The decline in property values will have far-reaching implications not only for individual wealth, but also for the tax bases of communities and the industries that serve them. => 不动产价值的下降不仅将对个人财富产生深远的影响，还将拖累社区的税基和为房地产服务的行业的状况。

A related concern is that homes and businesses around the world will eventually become under-insured or even uninsurable, owing to the frequency of weather-related catastrophes. => 还有一个相关问题是，因为天气相关灾难的发生频率，世界各地的家庭和企业将最终陷入到保额不足甚至无法保险的窘迫境地当中。

ClimateWise, a global network of insurance industry organizations, has already warned that the world is facing a $100 billion annual climate risk “protection gap”. => ClimateWise是一家全球性的保险业机构网络，它已经警告，世界正在面临每年高达1，000亿美元的气候风险“保护不足 ” 。
No single international organization or authority has all the answers to the cascade of challenges that climate change has triggered. => 没有哪一个国际机构或政府能对气候变化所引发的一系列问题全部给出解决方案。
But some are taking key leadership roles and pushing governments and local communities to act with more urgency. => 但有人正在扮演关键领导角色，推动政府和当地社区更紧迫地采取行动。
Over the next 15 years, the world will need to invest some $90 trillion in infrastructure improvements. => 未来15年，世界各地将要投入约90万亿美元用于基础设施改造计划。
A Daughter of Dictatorship and Democracy => 独裁与民主的女儿

SEOUL – It is something of a cliché question in South Korea nowadays: Who would be the country’s next president if the election were held tomorrow, rather than in December 2012? => 首尔 — — 如果选举提前到明天，而不是2012年12月进行，谁将成为下一任国家总统已经成为韩国老生常谈的话题。
Numerous opinion polls show Park Geun-hye of the ruling Grand National Party (GNP) to be the leading candidate. => 不止一项民调显示执政大国家党候选人朴槿惠最有希望胜出。

If elected, she would be South Korea’s first woman president, and, for her rivals, her dominant position in the race is an uncomfortable but unassailable fact. => 如果成功当选，她将成为韩国首任女性总统，而且在她的对手看来，她在竞选中的优势地位虽然令人不快，但又不容置疑。
South Korean voters of all ages and regions have welcomed Park as a candidate for their country’s leadership. => 韩国各地各年龄段的选民都欢迎朴槿惠参选总统。

Her political style is both refreshing and relevant, because she comes across as sincere and forthright at a time when the public is hungry for moral leadership. => 她的政治风格既有价值又令人耳目一新，因为在公众渴望道德领袖的今天她给人留下了真诚坦荡的印象。
His daughter is proud of his legacy, which marked the beginning of South Korea’s economic boom. => 他的女儿为父亲取得的成就感到骄傲，在他执政期间恰好是韩国经济繁荣的开始。

Indeed, as a pillar of export-oriented modernity, Park Chung-hee was once lionized as the archetype of a modernizing political leadership in military-authoritarian states. => 事实上，作为出口导向型现代化的中流砥柱，朴正熙一度被奉为军事独裁国家现代化政治领袖的典型。

Park, who lost her first bid for the GNP’s nomination to Lee in 2007, needs to ensure that no rupture with her erstwhile rival knocks her off the path to victory in 2012. => 朴槿惠2007年在大国家党内部首轮候选人竞争中负于李明博，而她今天的当务之急是确保与昔日对手的决裂不会影响她在2012年的竞选中胜出。

An astute politician, Park did not hesitate to campaign wholeheartedly for Lee the last time around – a move that, as part of long-term political strategy, made perfect sense. => 作为精明的政治家，朴槿惠上次失利后毫不犹豫地全力为李明博助选 — — 这样的举动作为长期政治策略的组成部分是很有意义的。
To many South Koreans, the election is now Park’s to lose. => 在许多韩国人看来，总统竞选已经是朴的囊中之物。
No candidate on the horizon seems able to stop her. => 似乎没有哪位候选人能够阻挡她成功的步伐。
If she wins, it will be the result of her seriousness and tenacity, not her political heritage. => 如果当选，她制胜的法宝将会是严肃和韧性，而不是政治承袭。
No one in South Korea’s conservative movement doubts that Park is one of them. => 韩国保守运动的任何人都不怀疑朴是他们当中的一份子。
And, as an icon of the right, she is well aware that she cannot afford to betray her status. => 作为右翼势力的标志性人物，她比谁都清楚她不能背叛自己的位置。
Despite her charisma, Park is neither a Sarah Palin nor an Eva Peron. => 尽管拥有超凡的个人魅力，但朴既不同于萨拉·佩林也不同于伊娃·裴隆。

Indeed, she looks more like a Korean Margaret Thatcher – a lady not for turning, in Thatcher’s famous phrase, and with clearly thought-through political principles animating her actions. => 事实上，她更像是韩国的玛格丽特·撒切尔 — — 按照撒切尔的那句名言，一位不会转弯的女士。 深思熟虑的政治准则为她的一举一动注入活力。
Her administration would mark a fresh departure from the country’s troubled recent past. => 以她为首的政府将首次摆脱韩国近年来问题重重的过去。

Others take a flagrantly sexist stance, arguing that a woman president would be a non-starter as long as the North Korean regime continues to threaten national security. => 也有人明目张胆地采取性别歧视立场，声称只要北朝鲜政权继续威胁国家安全，女性总统就不可能取得成功。
Although these criticisms don’t seem to bother the electorate very much, Park’s path to victory may yet prove narrower than her supporters expect. => 尽管这些批评似乎对选民影响不大，但朴的胜利之路可能并没有其支持者所想像的那般宽阔。
She has been called the “Queen of Elections,” in particular since she won a campaign in 2006 after being slashed with a box cutter by a deranged man. => 2006年被一个疯子用美工刀砍伤后仍然赢得竞选为朴槿惠赢得了“选举皇后”的美誉。

Ms. Park once pledged to provide loans for working-class families from elementary school to college years, while contending that local universities should be empowered to have more autonomy. => 朴女士曾承诺为工薪家庭提供从小学到大学的贷款，同时提出地方大学应拥有更多自主权力。
She favors engagement policy and the six-party talks so as to resolve the nuclear troubles. => 她倾向于通过接触政策和六方会谈解决核问题。

Come presidential election-day in 2012, South Korean voters will pick the candidate who embodies pragmatism and centrism over a partisan or ideologue. => 2012年总统大选日到来时，韩国选民会把���投向务实温和的竞选者，而不是党派界线分明的空想家。
Park’s success will depend, in the end, on the effectiveness of her campaign in further defining her character along those lines. => 朴槿惠的成功终将取决于其竞选活动能否有效地凸显她在上述方面的特色。

Unlike former Peruvian dictator Alberto Fujimori’s daughter, who lost her presidential bid in Peru last month, Park is likely to defy her family’s tragic history. => 与上个月在秘鲁竞选中落败的前秘鲁独裁者阿尔贝托·藤森的女儿不同，朴槿惠可能改变其家族悲剧性的历史。
If she does, she will be Asia’s most powerful woman, perhaps the most powerful in the world, at the end of next year. => 如果真是这样，她将在明年年底成为亚洲、也许是全世界最有权力的女性。
A Day for Planetary Justice => 一个追求地球正义的日子

PRINCETON – What we are doing to our planet, to our children and grandchildren, and to the poor, by our heedless production of greenhouse gases, is one of the great moral wrongs of our age. => 发自普林斯顿 — — 我们现在对地球，对我们的子孙后代以及穷人的所作所为 — — 肆无忌惮地制造温室气体 — — 是我们这一代人所犯下的最大的道德过失。
On October 24, you can stand up against this injustice. => 但在10月24日这天，你可以对这种不公正的现象说一声“不 ” 。
October 24 is 350 Day. => 10月24日就是所谓的“350日 ” 。
It is a measure of the seriousness of our problem that CO2 is already at 386 ppm, and is rising by two ppm each year. => 而这一测量手段也同时凸显了当前问题的严峻性，因为目前二氧化碳含量已经达到了386ppm，并以每年2ppm的速度在不断增长。
We are approaching a point of no return, at which feedback loops will kick in and continue to warm the planet, no matter what we do. => 而我们正在走进一个死胡同，不论做出何种努力，这场恶性循环都将持续下去并使地球暖化。
The melting of arctic ice is one example. => 北极冰层的融化就是一个例子。
Four hundred years ago, explorers sought the legendary “Northeast Passage” across the north of Europe and Russia to China. => 在400年前，探险先驱们试图找到一条从北欧/俄罗斯方向通往中国的“东北航道 ” 。
They found the arctic ice impenetrable, and soon gave up their quest. => 但他们在发现北极冰层难以被贯穿之后放弃了这一尝试。
This year, commercial vessels successfully navigated the Northeast Passage. => 而就在今年，商船却成功打通了这条“东北航道 ” 。
That is one of many recent dramatic signs that our climate is changing and that our planet is warmer than it has been for a very long time. => 这个例子只是那些引人注目现象的其中之一，证明我们的气候正在改变而地球也比过去一个长时期变得更暖了。

But ice-free arctic waters are more than a symptom of global warming. They are themselves a cause of further warming: ice and snow reflect the sun’s rays. => 但再无冰块漂浮的北冰洋并不仅仅是全球暖化的表象，它们也将是进一步暖化的成因：须知冰和雪都是可以反射太阳光线的。
Other feedback loops pose a similar danger. => 而另一个循环则昭示了类似的危险。

But areas that used to be frozen are now thawing, releasing methane and thus contributing to further warming – and to further thawing, which releases more methane. => 但如今这些土地开始解冻并释放出沼气，并因此而导致进一步暖化 — — 以及进一步解冻和更多沼气的释放。
Developing nations are grasping just how outrageous the current distribution of greenhouse-gas emissions really is. => 发展中国家都意识到了当前温室气体排放量分配方案的不合理之处。
In fact, the world’s per capita emissions were 4,700 kilograms, or more than double the permissible limit. => 但事实上目前世界人均排放量已经高达4700公斤，是允许排放量的二倍有余。
But, while emissions in the rich nations were far above the permissible limit, Sri Lankan emissions were, at 660 kilograms, well below it. => 然而当富国的排放量远远超出限额之时，斯里兰卡的人均排放量却只有极低的660公斤。

This situation is an injustice of vast proportions, reminiscent of – and arguably much worse than – the now-repudiated colonialism of the Western powers in the nineteenth century. => 这种大范围的不公正不禁使人联想起如今遭到批判的西方列强的19世纪殖民主义行为 — — 甚至可能危害更甚。
The task of remedying it must begin at the meeting on climate change that will be held in Copenhagen in December. => 而对此的纠正措施必须在12月的哥本哈根气候会议上贯彻展开。

Many political leaders have expressed support for strong action on climate change, but what most of them regard as “strong action” will not be enough to get us back below 350 ppm. => 虽然许多政治家都赞成对气候变化采取强力行动，但其中大多数人所认为的“强力行动”并不足以把我们带回到350ppm的大气二氧化碳含量水平。
In some countries, including the United States, there are major political obstacles to taking even modest steps. => 而在包括美国在内的一些国家，即使想要采取更为温和的措施都要面对巨大的政治阻力。

On October 24, people in nearly every country will be taking action to raise awareness of the need for an international treaty to bring our atmosphere back to 350 ppm of CO2. => 在10月24日这天，几乎所有国家的人们都将采取行动，激发起对一项能带领人们重回350ppm的国际条约的必要性认识。

There will be climbers hanging banners high in the Himalayas, where the glaciers are melting, and scuba divers at Australia’s Great Barrier Reef, which is threatened by climate change. => 登山者将在冰川逐渐融化的喜马拉雅山上拉起横幅标语，而在遭到气候变化威胁的澳大利亚大堡礁，潜水员们也将有所宣示。
Churches will ring bells 350 times, 350 cyclists will circle towns, and, in many places, 350 trees will be planted. => 教堂将鸣钟350响，350名单车手将绕城骑行，而在许多地方将有350棵树的植树仪式。
At www.350.org you can find out what is happening near you and join in, or put your own idea online. => 通过www.350.org这个网站你可以查询到你附近人们的活动方案并参与其中，还可以在网上发表自己的点子。
But don’t just sit back and hope that others will do enough to make an impact. => 但不要选择袖手旁观，期待他人去完成一切。
One day your grandchildren will ask you: what did you do to meet the greatest moral challenge of your time? => 因为有一天你的孙子们会问 ： “ 当面对你那个年代最艰巨的道德挑战时，你都做了些什么？ ”
A Day of Liberation => 解放日

When I was seven years old, in 1960, my grandmother Angelica opened my eyes to the meaning of 8 May 1945, the day when Nazi Germany surrendered and World War II ended in Europe. => 在我七岁那一年，就是1960年，我的祖母安朱丽卡让我明白了1945年5月8日的意义：那一天纳粹德国投降，二战在欧洲结束。
We were spending our summer holidays in Normandy where the liberation of Europe from Nazism had started on D-Day, 6 June 1944. => 当时我们正在诺曼底度暑假。 在那里，欧洲挣脱纳粹统治的纪念日是从1944年6月6日盟国登陆西欧那一天算起的。
One evening, I listened to my parents and my grandmother talking about the past. => 一天傍晚，我听到父母和祖母在谈论过去。

I have forgotten the details of their conversation, but I can still hear my grandmother’s sigh of relief when she said “Thank God we lost that war!” => 我已不记得谈话的细节，但是耳边始终回响着当时祖母长舒了一口气说的那句话 ： “ 感谢上帝，我们输了那场战争。 ”
From a child’s perspective, it wasn’t self-evident that losing was a good thing. => 从一个孩子的角度看，把失败当成一件好事确实不容易理解。
But of course, my grandmother was right to equate defeat with liberation. => 但无疑，祖母把失败和解放等同起来是正确的。

The more I have thought about the lesson she taught me 45 years ago, the clearer I have seen another, less obvious dimension in what she said: It is “we” who lost the war. => 我对她45年前教给我的这一课思考的越多，就越能看清楚另外一个不太显露的层面：是“我们”输了这场战争。

In today’s Germany, an overwhelming majority subscribes to the proposition that 8 May 1945 was a day of liberation – not only for Europe, but also for Germany itself. => 今天的德国，绝大多数人赞成：不仅对于欧洲，对德国自身来讲， 1945年5月8日也是一个解放日。
Compared to public opinion in 1960, that’s certainly an enormous progress. => 相对1960年的公众看法而言，这当然是个巨大的进步。

But paradoxically, it may also contain an element of forgetfulness, because it tends to conceal the fact that liberation required a military defeat. => 但自相矛盾的地方在于， 这其中可能包含了一种叫作“健忘”的因素，因为它往往掩藏了一个事实：有解放就必然有军事上的胜利。
To use my grandmother’s parlance, it is not “us” who were the liberators, but “them”. => 引用我祖母的说法，解放者并不是“我们 ” ， 而是“他们 ” 。
The way people see the past tells us more about their present attitudes than about the past itself. => 人们看待过去的方式更多的告诉我们他们现在所持的态度，而不是过去本身。

A violent conflict in the past may survive as a war of memories in the present, as can be observed in the current dispute between China and South Korea on one side, and Japan on the other. => 过去的暴力冲突可能在今天，作为记忆中的战争，继续存活下去。 正如我们看到现在发生在中国、韩国和日本之间的冲突。
A war of memories, in turn, may sometimes lead to a violent conflict in the future. => 记忆中的战争，可能因此引发未来的暴力冲突。
Former perpetrators often try to de-legitimize their former victims’ moral superiority by claiming they were victims themselves. => 从前的罪人时常企图通过声明他们自己也是牺牲品来否定真正受害者那更优越的道德取向。
Far-right groups infamously dubbed the attack by which at least 30,000 people were killed “Dresden’s Holocaust of bombs.” => 极右势力卑鄙的导演了“德累斯顿大屠杀 ” ， 在侵袭中至少三万人被杀害。
Fortunately, their propaganda campaign has been a failure. => 幸运的是，他们的宣传活动以失败告终。
On the left side of the German political spectrum, the proposition that 8 May 1945 was a day of liberation remains unchallenged. => 在德国政坛的左派当中，关于把1945年5月8日看成解放日这一提法向来毋庸置疑。
However, it is sometimes repressed that the massive use of force had been necessary to achieve that result. => 然而，取得这一结果必须大规模使用武力，这一事实却时而被压置。
Left-wing pacifism tends to overlook this simple fact. => 左翼和平主义往往忽略这个清楚的事实。

Its slogan “Never again war!” is only half the truth – the other half is “Never again appeasement!” 8 May 1945 was not “zero hour,” as a popular saying in Germany goes. => 它的口号“再也不要战争！ ”只是真相的一部分，另一部分是“再也不要绥靖！

It had an antecedent, that is, a lack of pre-emptive resistance at home and abroad to the threat that built up in Nazi Germany during the 1930’s. => ” 。 1945年5月8日并不是德国流行说法所提及的“零时 ” ， 因为已经有先例，那就是：缺乏对20世纪30年代纳粹德国国内外威胁的“先发制人”的抵制。
There is yet another lesson to be learned. => 还有一个教训要吸取。
Yes, 8 May 1945 was a day of liberation to which the Soviet army contributed decisively. => 是的，1945年5月8日是苏军起到绝对性贡献作用的一个解放日。
But for millions of Central and East Europeans, liberation was followed by Stalin’s oppressive regime. => 但对于数以百万计的中欧和东欧人民来说，解放后，随之而来的是斯大林的高压统治。

The current war of memories between the Baltic republics and Russia, with regard to the international celebration in Moscow on 9 May this year, reminds Germany of a special historic responsibility. => 如今对波罗的海共和国与俄罗斯之间战争的记忆，是今年5月9日在莫斯科举行的国际庆典的主题，这让德国意识要负一个特殊的历史责任。
But excusing Nazi atrocities by pointing to Stalinist crimes is an intellectually and morally unacceptable stratagem. => 但是企图把矛头转向斯大林的罪行来为纳粹暴行辩护，无论在知性还是道义上都说不过去。

When Chancellor Schröder travels to Moscow for the Red Square celebrations, he should bear in mind Nazi Germany’s contribution to the Baltic tragedy. => 当施罗德总理来到莫斯科红场参加庆祝仪式的时候，他应该反思的是德国要为波罗的海诸国的悲剧承担多少责任。
On 8 May this year, public speakers will remind us how important it is not to forget. => 今年5月8日，公众的声音会提醒我们“不能忘记”有多重要。
They will stress that if the lessons of history are not learned, history is bound to repeat itself. => 他们会强调如果不吸取历史教训，历史就必然会重演。
All this is perfectly true. => 这些都是完全正确的。
But personally, I will also remember my grandmother’s sentence “Thank God we lost that war!” => 但是，作为个人来讲，我还要记住我祖母的那句话 ： “ 感谢上帝，我们输了这场战争。
Thank God – and thanks to all those brave Allied soldiers who sacrificed their lives for the sake of Europe’s liberty. => ”感谢上帝，还要感谢为保卫欧洲自由而牺牲了自己生命的所有盟军战士。
Crashing the SDR => 撕开SDR之口

SANTA BARBARA – The Chinese government’s campaign to have its currency, the renminbi, included in the International Monetary Fund’s reserve asset appears to be on the brink of success. => 圣芭芭拉—中国政府让人民币进入国际货币基金组织（IMF）储备资产的努力眼看就要成功了。

Last week, IMF staff formally recommended adding the renminbi to the basket of currencies that determines the value of its so-called Special Drawing Rights (SDRs). => 上周，IMF正是建议将人民币加入决定其所谓的特别提款权（SDR）价值的货币篮子中。

The addition of the renminbi to the basket, which currently includes the US dollar, the euro, the British pound, and the Japanese yen, would provide China with a boost to its prestige. => SDR篮子目前包括美元、欧元、英镑和日元，将人民币加入其中将让中国获得提高其声望的机会。
More important, it would advance the government’s efforts to internationalize the renminbi. => 更重要的是，这有利于中国政府的人民币国际化政策。
But it would also be a mistake. => 但这也是一个错误。
The decision to recommend the renminbi’s inclusion, far from having been made on sound economic grounds, can only be understood as political. => 建议纳入人民币并没有可靠的经济理由，只能视之为政治动作。
As such, the long-term consequences are likely to be regrettable. => 而这样的动作可能带来令人遗憾的长期后果。
On a purely technical basis, the renminbi’s qualifications for inclusion in the SDR basket are questionable. => 从纯理论角度，人民币是否有资格纳入SDR篮子颇为可疑。

Traditionally, the IMF has insisted on two criteria: a currency’s issuing country must be among the world’s leading exporters, and the currency must be “freely usable” – widely used and traded. => 传统上，IMF要求两个标准：货币发行国必须是世界领先的出口国；并且该货币必须“可自由使用 ” — —即被广泛使用和交易。
As the world’s largest exporter, China clearly meets the first condition. => 作为世界最大出口国，中国显然满足第一个条件。
The second, however, is probably still beyond its reach. => 但是，第二个条件仍无法满足。
The renminbi is by no means in the same league as the SDR basket’s four incumbent currencies. => 人民币仍无法与SDR篮子中现有的四种货币等量齐观。

In 2014, China’s currency ranked seventh in global central-bank reserves, eighth in international bond issuance, and 11th in global currency trading. => 2014年，人民币在全球央行储备中名列第七，国际债券发行量名列第八，国际货币交易量名列第十一。
So why did the IMF flip? => 那么，IMF的态度为何发生了转变？
The answer is obvious: China mounted a full-court press to change minds. => 答案显而易见：中国步步紧逼，迫使其改变态度。
In August, the currency’s exchange-rate regime was loosened slightly. => 8月份，人民币汇率机制略有放松。

Renminbi-denominated government bonds were issued in London, and plans were laid to create new trading platforms for the currency in several European financial centers. => 伦敦发行人民币计价政府债券，欧洲几大金融中心也纷纷提出建立新的人民币交易平台的计划。
And Chinese policymakers made it abundantly clear how unhappy they would be with a negative decision. => 中国决策者清楚地向世界表明，做出对其不利的决定将让他们十分不快。
Their pressure paid off. => 他们的压力起到了成效。
One by one, Western governments fell in line behind the renminbi, despite its practical limitations. => 西方政府纷纷加入了人民币阵营，尽管其实用性存在诸多限制。
The Fund got the message, and now the fix is in. => IMF收到了这一信息，现在做出了回应。
Many would argue that this is a positive development. => 许多人会说，这是一个积极的发展趋势。
Certainly, it mollifies China’s leaders, offering them a stronger incentive to continue to work within the existing international monetary regime. => 显然，这能够安抚中国领导人，让他们有更大的激励继续在现有国际货币机制之内行动。
The decision to add the renminbi to the SDR basket may have put that danger into remission. => 将人民纳入SDR篮子的决定将减轻这一危险。

On the other hand, the move sets a worrying precedent, injecting politics into a policy area that had been governed by objective economic considerations. => 另一方面，这一决定开启了令人但有的先例，让政治染指了一个此前完全由客观经济考量决定的政策领域。

Conceivably, over the longer term, China’s successful campaign could now open the door to lobbying by other governments to include their currencies as well. => 可以想象，从长期看，中国成功让人民币加入SDR篮子也开启了其他政府让本国货币加入SDR篮子的游说大门。
Why not add the Swiss franc or the Canadian dollar? => 为什么不加入瑞士法郎或加拿大元？
Or, for that matter, why not include the Russian ruble or Indian rupee? => 或者，出于同样的理由，为什么不加入俄罗斯卢布或印度卢比？
What was once the dignified preserve of obviously elite currencies could become the site of messy political battles for elevated status. => 曾经高高在上的公认精英货币俱乐部，现在成了提升地位的政治乱斗场。

Of course, it can be argued that China’s recent economic trajectory means that it is only a matter of time before the renminbi does become a match for the SDR’s incumbents. => 当然，你可能会说，近期中国经济运行轨迹表明人民币名正言顺成为SDR成员只是时间问题。
After all, international use of the currency has been growing exponentially. => 毕竟，对人民币的国际化使用呈现出指数增长之势。
But that optimistic assessment overestimates the renminbi’s prospects and illustrates the danger of linear extrapolation of the past into the future. => 但这一乐观评估高估了人民币的前景，正好说明了用过去线性推断未来的危险。
Likewise, use of the renminbi for the purpose of invoicing and settling trade with China is bound to continue growing. => 类似地，出于开发票以及结算对华贸易目的使用人民币的情况必定会继续增加。
Nor is inclusion of the renminbi in the SDR basket likely to provide as big a boost to the currency’s internationalization as many believe. => 加入SDR篮子是否能给人民币国际化带来巨大的提振也不像许多人认为的那样确定。
Some central banks may decide to follow suit, adding renminbi-denominated assets to their reserves to match the composition of the basket. => 一些央行也许会跟进，将人民币计价资产纳入其储备，以匹配SDR货币篮的组成。
But the increase will be marginal at best – some $40 billion in the next few years, according to the IMF’s calculations. => 但这一增量很小 — — 据IMF估计，未来几年也许只有400亿美元。
With global reserves now totaling more than $10 trillion, that is a mere drop in the proverbial bucket. => 目前全球储备总量为10万亿美元以上，400亿只是九牛一毛。
The political reasons for including the renminbi in the SDR are all too clear. => 将人民币纳入SDR的政治原因一清二楚。
Unfortunately, the risks of doing so are no less obvious. => 不幸的是，这样做的风险并不那么一清二楚。
A Defeat for International Tax Cooperation => 国际税收合作的挫折

Yet at the Third International Conference on Financing for Development, held in Addis Ababa last month, the momentum toward strengthening international tax cooperation came to an abrupt halt. => 但在上个月在亚的斯亚贝巴举行的第三届国际发展融资会议（International Conference on Financing for Development）上，强化国际税收合作的势头突然停止了。

Developed countries blocked a proposal at the conference to establish an intergovernmental tax body within the United Nations to replace the current UN Committee of Experts. => 发达国家在会上阻止了在联合国内部成立跨政府税收机构取代目前的联合国转接委员会的方案。
These countries insist that tax cooperation should take place exclusively under the leadership of the OECD, a body that they control. => 这些国家坚持税收合作只能在它们所控制经合组织的领导下进行。

Two years later, in 2004, the United Nations Economic and Social Council (ECOSOC) upgraded its “ad hoc group” of tax experts to a regular committee. => 两年后，2004年，联合国经济与社会委员会（ECOSOC）将其税收专家“临时小组”升级为常设委员会。

This meant that the experts would meet regularly and have an expanded mandate that went beyond merely updating a model double-taxation treaty. => 这意味着专家们将定期召开会议，其权限也将得到扩展，而不仅仅是更新双税条约（double-taxation treaty）样板。
That is a profoundly disappointing outcome. => 这是一个令人失望透顶的结果。
The developed countries have an argument – but not a convincing one. => 发达国家有它们的理由 — — 但是并不令人信服。
The OECD, whose members are essentially the world’s 34 richest countries, certainly has the capacity to set international standards on taxation. => 事实上由全球34个最富裕国家组成的经合组织显然有能力制定国际税收标准。

Yet the domination of a select group of countries over tax norms has meant that, in reality, the global governance architecture for taxation has not kept pace with globalization. => 但一小撮国家主宰税收规范意味着，在现实中，税收问题的全球治理结构早已与全球化脱节。

The Monterrey Consensus reached in 2002 included a call to enhance “the voice and participation of developing countries in international economic decision-making and norms-setting.” => 2002年所达成的蒙特雷共识（Monterrey Consensus）呼吁强化“发展中国家在国际经济决策和规范制定中的声音和参与 ” 。
But although the OECD invites some developing countries to participate in its discussions to establish norms, it offers them no decision-making power. => 但尽管经合组织邀请了一些发展中国家参与规范制定的讨论，却没有提供任何决策权力。
The OECD is thus a weak surrogate for a globally representative intergovernmental forum. => 因此，经合组织只是有全球代表性的跨政府论坛的劣等替代品。
Despite the disappointment in Addis Ababa, the call for reform of the international tax system is not likely to be silenced. => 尽管亚的斯亚贝巴会议令人失望，但国际税收制度改革的呼声不可能平息。
The Making of Euro-Jihadism => 欧洲圣战主义的形成
MADRID – The Belgian historian Henri Pirenne linked Europe’s birth as a Christian continent in the eighth century to its rupture with Islam. => 马德里 — — 比利时历史学家亨利·皮雷纳将欧洲这块基督教大陆的诞生与公元八世纪与伊斯兰教的决裂联系在一起。
Divorce is not an option these days. => 现阶段用离婚来解决问题已经并不现实。
But nor is the kind of marriage that the Islam scholar Tariq Ramadan advocates. => 但也不能容许伊斯兰教学者塔里克·拉马丹所宣扬的那种婚姻继续下去。
Europe would then not just tolerate Islam, but actually embrace it as an integral part of itself. => 那样欧洲就不仅要容忍伊斯兰教，而且还要在实际上接受它作为自身的有机组成部分。
The problem with Ramadan’s vision is that Europe is an overwhelmingly secular continent, with a profoundly forward-thinking approach to ethics. => 拉马丹愿景的问题在于欧洲是一块世俗势力占压倒性优势的大陆，在道德观方面有着深刻的前瞻性思维。
Islamic societies, by contrast, are both deeply religious and deeply embedded in the past. => 而伊斯兰社会则恰恰相反，拥有深刻的宗教色彩并且深深植根于过去。
Even Muslims who support the modernization of Islam would typically stop well short of Europe’s ethical vision. => 就连那些支持伊斯兰教现代化的穆斯林往往也会对欧洲的道德愿景望而却步。

But it is the United States that launched wars in Iraq and Afghanistan, offers unconditional support to Israel, and has repeatedly propped up Arab autocrats. => 但是美国发动了伊拉克和阿富汗战争、为以色列提供无条件支持并一再支持阿拉伯独裁者。
And it is Europe that has consistently criticized these policies – often harshly. => 欧洲一直对这些政策持批评态度 — — 往往言辞还非常激烈。
Yet America is not being subjected to a major surge of jihadist sentiment within its borders. => 但美国并没有遭受到境内圣战情绪高涨的打击。
It might have helped that US President Barack Obama backed away from some of these policies. => 美国总统巴拉克·奥巴马逐渐收回这些政策或许有助于缓解对美国的仇恨情绪。

The return to autocracy in Egypt in 2013, via Abdel Fattah el-Sisi’s coup d’état, certainly was not aided by the US or Europe, both of which supported the democratically elected Muslim Brotherhood. => 美国或欧洲肯定从未支持2013年埃及借助阿卜杜勒 - 法塔赫·塞西政变回归专制，美欧双方都对通过民主选举产生的穆斯林兄弟会表示支持。
Europe has offered even more direct help to Arab countries in recent years. => 近年来，欧洲甚至为阿拉伯国家提供了更多的直接帮助。
If it were not for Europe’s military intervention, Libyans would still be living under the tyrannical Muammar el-Qaddafi. => 如果不是欧洲的军事干预，利比亚人迄今将仍在残暴的卡扎菲统治下生活。
True, Europe could have done more to prevent the ensuing chaos in Libya. => 的确，欧洲本来可以付出更大努力来阻止利比亚随后发生的混乱。

But the people of Libya surely must take responsibility for the proliferation of competing militias that refuse to unite to save their state from total collapse. => 但利比亚民众无疑也应该对拒绝联合起来挽救国家陷入彻底崩溃命运的四处扩张的民兵武装负责。

More broadly, though the West – especially the US – has made grave policy errors in the Arab world over the last 50 years, external powers cannot be blamed entirely for the region’s meltdown. => 从更广义的角度讲，虽然西方 — — 尤其是美国 — — 过去50年来在阿拉伯世界的确犯下了严重的政策错误，但外部势力却不能完全对地区的危机负责。
That is the result of a profound civilizational crisis – one that can be redressed only by the people of the Arab world. => 目前的局势是一场深刻的文明危机的结果 — — 只有阿拉伯世界的民众才能解决它。

If Europe’s foreign policy is not responsible for the Arab world’s current turmoil, it certainly cannot be the reason for the rise of jihadism within its own borders. => 如果欧洲的外交政策并不承担阿拉伯世界当前局势混乱的责任，那么它无疑也不应是欧洲境内圣战主义崛起的理由。

The real problem lies at home: a disastrous deficit of effective policies related to social justice, education, housing, and employment for young European Muslims. => 真正的问题其实在于国内：在于严重缺乏与欧洲穆斯林青年社会正义、教育、住房和就业相关的有效政策。

Marginalization generates frustration, which is subsequently fed by growing Islamophobia and the rise of raucous right-wing movements throughout the continent. => 边缘化带来挫败感，日益严重的伊斯兰恐惧症和整个欧洲大陆吵吵嚷嚷的右翼运动崛起又为这种挫败感火上浇油。
This link is apparent in the fact that the majority of European jihadists come from underprivileged backgrounds. => 欧洲圣战者绝大多数来自底层证明了这种联系确实存在。
Not particularly well versed in the true teachings of Islam, and lacking opportunities to improve their lives, they become easy prey for extremists. => 他们既缺乏对伊斯兰教教义的真正理解，也缺乏改善生活的实际机会，因此非常容易成为极端分子的猎物。
The story of America’s Muslims is the measure of Europe’s failure. => 美国的穆斯林现状凸显了欧洲的失败政策。
Like most Americans, Muslims in the US maintain a certain amount of faith in the American dream. => 像绝大多数美国人一样，美国穆斯林仍然在一定程度上相信美国梦。

They are mostly middle class, and, despite all the talk about rising economic inequality, they have not given up on the belief that, in the US, hard work and initiative are rewarded. => 他们大多是中产阶级，而且尽管所有人都在谈论经济不��等日益严重，但他们并没有放弃在美国辛勤工作和积极主动就能得到回报的信仰。
America is a country of immigrants, with a dynamic economy that has enabled newcomers, time and again, to achieve great success. => 美国是一个移民之国，其充满活力的经济一次次的让新移民取得了巨大的成功。

In Europe, by contrast, improving one’s social standing has always been very difficult; and, at a time of economic stagnation and staggeringly high unemployment, it is not getting any easier. => 而欧洲的情况则恰恰相反，提升一个人的社会地位一向是相当困难的；而且在经济停滞和失业率惊人高企的情况下，提升社会地位的难度更是可想而知。
Socially, America also offers something to Muslims that Europe does not. => 在社会领域，美国也能赋予穆斯林某些欧洲无法赋予的宽容。
Its fundamentally religious culture enables Muslims to retain their identity to a far greater extent than in secular Europe. => 美国本质上的宗教文化使得穆斯林能比在世俗的欧洲在更大程度上保留对自身身份的认同。

Indeed, America’s core values – personal responsibility and constitutional patriotism – can be easier for Muslims to swallow than Europe’s more aggressively secular brand of liberalism. => 事实上，美国个人责任和宪法爱国主义的核心价值观相比欧洲更激进的世俗自由主义对穆斯林而言更容易接受。
As a result, integration and assimilation tend to be easier for Muslims in America. => 因此，穆斯林移民在美国的融合和同化更容易取得成功。
All of this suggests that Europe must look inward to address homegrown jihadism effectively. => 所有这些表明，欧洲必须自我审视才能有效解决内生性的圣战主义问题。
This does not mean that it should temper its secularism, much less its liberal values. => 这并不意味着它必须改变世俗主义，更不意味着要改变自由主义价值观。
Rather, Europe must breathe life into its own “European dream,” ensuring that all people have access to real opportunities to improve their lives. => 恰恰相反，欧洲必须为“欧洲梦”注入新的活力，确保所有人都有切实的机会改善自己的生活。
Otherwise, it will face a lost generation of millions of young Europeans – Muslim and otherwise. => 否则，它将面临着由成百上千万欧洲年轻人组成的失去的一代 — — 其中既包括穆斯林也包括欧洲其他民众。
The New Climate Economics => 新气候经济学
Last week, Mexico experienced simultaneous hurricanes in the Pacific and in the Gulf of Mexico that devastated towns and cities in their path. => 上周，墨西哥经历了太平洋和墨西哥湾飓风的同时袭击，飓风过境之处，村镇和城市俱毁。
Climate change will be a major driver of such events, and we risk much worse. => 气候变化是此类事件的重要因素，而且我们面临的局面越来越糟糕。
This puts a new debate center stage: how to reconcile increased action to reduce greenhouse gas emissions with strong economic growth. => 这把一个新争论带到了舞台中央：如何协调越来越多的行动以降低伴随强劲经济增长出现的温室气体排放。
It is a debate that is already mired in controversy. => 这一争论已经迷失在争议之中。

As most countries have started making serious investments in renewable energy, and many are implementing carbon prices and regulations, critics complain that such policies may undermine growth. => 大部分国家已开始动真格投资于可再生能源，许多国家更是开始实施碳定价和监管，与此同时，批评家指责这些政策会阻碍增长。

With the global economy still recovering from the 2008 financial crash, higher energy costs – not yet fully offset by greater energy efficiency – are worrying business and political leaders. => 全球经济仍在从2008年金融动荡中复苏，更高的能源价格 — — 无法通过提高能源效率充分抵消 — — 让商业和政治领袖颇为担心。
The advent of shale gas has confused the energy debate even more. => 页岩气的出现让能源争论更加扑朔迷离了。
If gas is substituted for coal, it can be a useful bridge to a low-carbon future. => 用气代替煤不失为通往低碳未来的捷径。
But astonishingly, it is coal, the dirtiest fuel, that is experiencing the sharpest increase in use. => 但是，令人震惊的是，用量增加最剧烈的恰恰是最肮脏的燃料 — — 煤。
Policy vacillation in some countries has not helped. => 一些国家的政策犹豫也不利于大局。
Advocates of stronger action respond that low-carbon investments can generate much stronger, cleaner growth. => 加强行动的支持者回应道，低碳投资可以带来强劲得多、洁净得多的增长。

They point to the savings available from energy efficiency, and to the market opportunities generated by clean-energy technologies as the processes of learning and discovery take hold. => 他们指出，随着学习和发现的进行，能源效率能带来节约，而清洁能源技术能带来市场机会。

And they propose green bonds and public investment banks to finance new infrastructure and jobs at a time when world interest rates are low and demand is depressed in many countries. => 他们建议发行绿色债券，敦促上市投资银行利用世界利率较低、许多国家需求受抑制的时机为新基础设施和就业提供资金支持。
That is regrettable. => 这实在令人遗憾。
Climate change is not a partisan issue, and climate policy is essentially market-based. => 气候变化并非派系之争，气候政策从根本上说也是基于市场的。

It is about correcting market failures so that markets and entrepreneurship can play their proper role of ensuring innovation and efficient resource allocation. => 这是关于纠正市场失灵从而使市场和企业家精神能够在保证创新和有效资源配置中扮演适当角色的问题。
In order to escape this impasse, we have helped to launch the Global Commission on the Economy and Climate. => 为了跳出这一僵局，我们协助成立了全球经济和气候委员会（Global Commission on the Economy and Climate ） 。

Its purpose is to provide authoritative new evidence concerning how governments and businesses can achieve stronger economic growth while simultaneously addressing climate risks. => 其目的是提供关于政府和企业如何在实现更强的经济增长的同时纠正气候风险的权威新证据。
Few governments or investors start from the standpoint of climate change. => 很少有政府或投资者以气候变化为出发点。
There is now a lot of experience around the world in this area. => 在这方面，全世界范围有许多经验可以遵循。
When the Stern Review on the economics of climate change was published seven years ago, the subject was largely theoretical. => 七年前关于气候变化经济学的《斯特恩报告 》 （ Stern Review）发布时，这个主题基本上还停留在理论阶段。
Now countries at all stages of development are pursuing new patterns of economic growth that take climate into account. => 如今，处于各个发展阶段的各国都在追求新的考虑气候问题的经济增长模式。
Germany, for example, is planning the world’s most ambitious low-carbon energy transition, based on energy conservation and renewables. => 比如，德国正在规划全世界最有雄心的低碳经济转型，该计划以节能和可再生为基础。
South Korea has made “green growth” a central economic goal. => 韩国将“绿色增长”制定为核心经济目标。
Mexico’s 2012 General Law on Climate Change has put it on course for a major increase in clean power. => 墨西哥2012年气候变化一般法（General Law on Climate Change）将大大提高清洁电力的用量。
China has placed the industrial development of green technologies at the top of its agenda. => 中国将绿色技术产业开发作为其日程的最优先项目。
Ethiopia is seeking to move to lower-carbon farming. => 埃塞俄比亚正在寻求发展低碳农业。
Brazil has significantly reduced the rate of deforestation in the Amazon. => 巴西极大地降低了亚马孙森林的采伐速度。
Some major businesses are providing powerful examples of what is possible. => 一些大企业提供了有力的例子，让我们知道可以做到什么程度。
Unilever has committed to the sustainable sourcing of agricultural and forest products. => 联合利华承诺使用可持续的农业和森林产品源。
Coca-Cola is phasing out all use of climate-polluting hydrofluorocarbons. => 可口可乐正在彻底停用污染气候的氢氟碳化合物。
The retail giant Wal-Mart is driving emissions reduction throughout its supply chain. => 零售巨头沃尔玛在其全供应链推动减排运动。
Meanwhile, the World Bank and the European Investment Bank have stopped lending to high-emission coal plants. => 与此同时，世界银行和欧洲投资银行也不再向高排放煤电贷款。
Yet genuine questions remain about how fast economies should move on to a low-carbon path, and the most effective way to do so. => 但真正的问题依然存在 — — 经济可以以多快的速度迈向低碳之路，以及什么通过什么办法实现最有效。
Some low-carbon policies have clearly been expensive, while other, apparently cost-effective options, have not been pursued at all. => 一些低碳政策显然代价十分高昂，而一些显然成本很低的选择则完全没有人实施。
Any structural transformation involves costs, trade-offs, and uncertainties, and it is vital that we understand these properly. => 任何结构性变化都包括成本、权衡和不确定性，合理地理解这些因素十分重要。
Powerful interests will, of course, oppose any low-carbon transition, dismissing and often drowning out those who stand to benefit. => 当然，强大的既得利益会反对一切低碳转型，打压甚至挤出低碳转型的受益者。
That makes it even more important to clarify the choices. => 这意味着澄清选择更加重要了。
As science makes clear how imperative the climate question is, it is time for economists and policymakers to explain how it can be answered. => 科学已经清楚地证明了气候问题的紧迫性，现在该轮到经济学家和决策者来解释如何应对这一紧迫性了。
The Mouse Click that Roared => 咆哮的鼠标
CAMBRIDGE – Until recently, cyber security has primarily interested computer geeks and cloak-and-dagger types. => 美国剑桥—直到最近，关注网络安全的还大多是电脑极客和阴谋论者。

The Internet’s creators, part of a small, enclosed community, were very comfortable with an open system in which security was not a primary concern. => 互联网的创造者 — — 他们属于一个封闭的小圈子 — — 对安全并非主要顾虑的开放系统感到十分满意。

A “cyber attack” can take any number of forms, including simple probes, defacement of Web sites, denial-of-service attacks, espionage, and destruction of data. => “网络攻击”可以以数不清的形式出现，包括简单的侵入、涂鸦网站、拒绝服务攻击、间谍活动和毁坏数据。
Cyber war and cyber espionage are largely associated with states, while cyber crime and cyber terrorism are mostly associated with non-state actors. => 网络战和网络间谍大多与国家有关，与此同时，网络犯罪和网络恐怖主义往往由非国家行动者发出。

The highest costs currently stem from espionage and crime; but, over the next decade or so, cyber war and cyber terrorism may become greater threats than they are today. => 目前，最大的成本来自间谍和犯罪；但是，在未来十年中，网络战和网络恐怖主义有可能成为比今天更大的威胁。
Moreover, as alliances and tactics evolve, the categories may increasingly overlap. => 此外，同盟和战术的演化，分类也可能日渐重叠。
Terrorists might buy malware from criminals, and governments might find it useful to hide behind both. => 恐怖主义可以从犯罪分子那里买来恶意软件，政府可能会在背后指使。
Some people argue that deterrence does not work in cyberspace, owing to the difficulties of attribution. => 有人认为，威慑在网络空间中并不管用，因为其来源难以确定。
But that is facile: inadequate attribution affects inter-state deterrence as well, yet it still operates. => 但这简直是信口开河：不充分的来源确定同样影响着国家间的威慑，但威慑仍然常常被使用。
China, for example, would lose from an attack that severely damaged the American economy, and vice versa. => 比如，中国可能因为严重危害美国经济的袭击中受到损失，反之亦然。
An unknown attacker may also be deterred by cyber-security measures. => 未知的攻击者还能被网络安全措施威慑。

If firewalls are strong, or redundancy and resilience allow quick recovery, or the prospect of a self-enforcing response (“an electric fence”) seems possible, an attack becomes less attractive. => 如果防火墙够强，或冗余性和恢复力足以让其快速回复，或有可能产生自我强化反应 （ “ 电围栏 ” ） ，实施攻击就会变得不再具有吸引力。
While accurate attribution of the ultimate source of a cyber attack is sometimes difficult, the determination does not have to be airtight. => 尽管准确地确定网络攻击的最终来源有时十分困难，但也不是一筹莫展。
Finally, a reputation for offensive capability and a declared policy that keeps open the means of retaliation can help to reinforce deterrence. => 最后，攻击能力的名声和公开宣布以牙还牙政策也有助于增强威慑。

Of course, non-state actors are harder to deter, so improved defenses such as pre-emption and human intelligence become important in such cases. => 当然，非国家行动者更难侦测，因此改善防线 — — 比如先发制人和人力情报 — — 在这类案件中就变得十分重要。
But, among states, even nuclear deterrence was more complex than it first looked, and that is doubly true of deterrence in the cyber domain. => 但是，在国家之间，即便是核威慑也比乍看上去更复杂，在网络空间中的威慑更是如此。
Given its global nature, the Internet requires a degree of international cooperation to be able to function. => 出于其全球性，互联网需要一定程度的国际合作才能运行。
Some people call for the cyber equivalent of formal arms-control treaties. => 有人呼吁制定互联网版的正式武器控制条约。
But differences in cultural norms and the difficulty of verification would make such treaties hard to negotiate or implement. => 但文化规范差异和查证困难将使这类条约难以谈判和实施。
At the same time, it is important to pursue international efforts to develop rules of the road that can limit conflict. => 与此同时，追求制定防止冲突的国际规则十分重要。
The most promising areas for international cooperation today most likely concern problems posed for states by third parties such as criminals and terrorists. => 如今，最有希望的国际合作领域是第三方给国家带来的问题，比如犯罪和恐怖主义。

But the US has argued that arms-control measures banning offensive capabilities could weaken defenses against attacks and would be impossible to verify or enforce. => 但美国认为限制攻击能力的武器控制措施会削弱针对攻击的防御，并且难以论证和强制实施。

Likewise, in terms of political values, the US has resisted agreements that could legitimize authoritarian governments’ censorship of the Internet – for example, by the “great firewall of China.” => 类似地，在政治价值方面，美国拒绝了可能让独裁政府审查互联网合法化的协定 — — 比如“中国防火长城 ” 。
Moreover, cultural differences impede any broad agreements on regulating online content. => 此外，文化差异阻止了任何监管在线内容的广泛协定。
Nonetheless, it may be possible to identify behaviors like cyber crime that are illegal in many domestic jurisdictions. => 尽管如此，在本国司法辖区内鉴别网络犯罪等非法行为仍是可能的。
Trying to limit all intrusions would be impossible, but one could start with cyber crime and cyber terrorism involving non-state parties. => 阻止一切侵入或许不可行，但可以从网络犯罪和非国家行动方参与的网络恐怖主义着手。
Here, major states would have an interest in limiting damage by agreeing to cooperate on forensics and controls. => 在这方面，通过同意在取证和控制方面达成一致来限制伤害符合大国的利益。
The transnational cyber domain poses new questions about the meaning of national security. => 跨国网络空间给我们带来了关于国家安全含义的新问题。
Some of the most important responses must be national and unilateral, focused on hygiene, redundancy, and resilience. => 一些最重要的应对措施必须是国家层面的、单方面的，专注于清扫、冗余性和恢复力。

It is likely, however, that major governments will soon discover that the insecurity created by non-state cyber actors will require closer cooperation among governments. => 但是，很有可能大国政府很快就会发现，由非国家网络行动者造成的不完全将要求各国政府间进行紧密合作。
A Practical Agenda for Revolutionary Times => 革命时代的务实日程
Those who are supposed to represent them should not ignore this anger and frustration any longer. => 他们的所谓代表们不应该继续忽视这一愤怒和失望了。
At the same time, the response from elites who regard themselves as the guardians of economic growth has sometimes made matters worse. => 与此同时，自视为经济增长的守护神的精英的反应有时令情况雪上加霜。

Earlier this month, the IMF, World Bank, and World Trade Organization published a joint report extolling the benefits of trade as a driver of productivity growth, competition, and consumer choice. => 本月早些时候，IMF、世界银行和世界贸易组织发布了一份联合报告，报告称赞贸易是生产率增长、竞争和消费选择的推进器。

The report’s argument in favor of free trade is not new, nor is its recommendation that “active labor-market policies” be used to cushion the blow of lost jobs and livelihoods. => 这一支持自由贸易的观点并不新鲜，而报告中所提出的用“积极的劳动力市场政策”支持丧失工作和生计的群体的建议也是了无新意。
What is new is that repeating these claims, without also addressing people’s deeper concerns, can now do more harm than good. => 新的情况是，反复强调这些观点，而不同时解决人们更深层次的担忧，很有可能弊大于利。
Global public opinion has changed dramatically in recent years. => 全球公共观点在近几年中发生了剧烈变化。
A majority of people worldwide – and up to 72% of people in France and Italy – now believe that the system has failed them. => 大部分世界人口 — — 法国和意大利已经高达72 % — —现在相信体系辜负了他们。

Moreover, only 29% of people across 28 countries now trust government leaders, while three-quarters of those surveyed say they trust reformers who would upend the status quo. => 此外，在28个国家中只有29%的群众信任政府领导人，而四分之三的受访者表示他们信任将颠覆现状的改革家。
These findings suggest that those defending free trade have lost credibility with the people they hope to persuade. => 这些发现表明，自由贸易的捍卫者已经失去了在他们希望说服的群众中的信誉。
Working-class voters have lashed out because they feel not just economically abandoned, but also socially disdained and culturally marginalized. => 工作阶级选民群情激奋，因为他们不但觉得自己在经济上遭到了抛弃，在社会上和文化上也遭到了鄙视和边缘化。
Their vote is the only means they have left to hit back at the establishment. => 他们的选票是他们眼中唯一可以反击建制的手段。
To address the public’s concerns requires a three-part agenda. => 解决公众担忧需要一套三部分的日程。
The first order of business should be to reach out to those who feel voiceless and unrepresented. => 首要任务是向觉得没人聆听和代表自己的群体抛出橄榄枝。
During the US presidential campaign, Donald Trump tapped into this sentiment when he vowed to punish any company that moves jobs to China or Mexico. => 在美国总统选战期间，特朗普就利用了这一情绪，承诺要惩罚所有将工作岗位迁往中国或墨西哥的公司。

As the filmmaker Michael Moore explained prior to the election, American working-class voters were desperate to hear someone promise to take on big business. => 电影制片人迈克尔·摩尔（Michael Moore）在大选前解释道，美国工作阶级选民急切地想听到有人承诺向大企业开刀。
The fact that it took a populist plutocrat to do it underscores the extent to which the American labor movement has been extinguished. => 由一位民粹主义财阀来做这件事这一事实让美国劳工运动的穷途末路表露无遗。
Political parties that originally emerged from the labor movement have long since shifted to the “center.” => 最初从劳工运动发展而来的政党早已转向了“中间派 ” 。
Second, the quality of work, and the status that it confers, must be improved. => 其次，工作的质量，以及工作所带来的地位，必须改善。
In wealthy countries, precarious, poorly paid, and even dangerous forms of employment are becoming increasingly common. => 在富裕国家，不稳定、低薪乃至危险的就业形式正变得日益普遍。

A recent Bloomberg Businessweek story describes how temporary workers at auto-parts factories in Alabama are paid just $7.25 per hour, and must work in hazardous conditions with no safety training. => 新一期《彭博商业周刊》上的一篇报道描述了亚拉巴马州汽车零件厂的临时工每小时只能挣7.25美元，并且必须在高风险环境中工作，还得不到安全培训。
In 2010, these workers suffered work injuries at a 50% higher rate than unionized auto-parts workers elsewhere. => 2010年，这些工人的工伤率比其他地方的非工会成员汽车零件工人高50 % 。
As the OECD has shown, “non-standard” work is proliferating globally. => 经合组织指出 ， “ 非标准”工作正在全球兴起。
This trend is contributing to deteriorating working conditions, making workers feel increasingly helpless and vulnerable. => 这一趋势导致了工作环境的恶化，让工人觉得越来越无助和脆弱。
Reversing it will require robust standards to ensure workplace safety, fair pay, and the right to enter into collective-bargaining arrangements. => 扭转这一状况需要制定严格的标准保证工作场所安全、公平薪资和参与集体议价安排的权利。

Governments will have to intervene to set these standards, as they did during the nineteenth and twentieth centuries to improve abysmal conditions in factories. => 政府需要干预制定这些标准，一如它们在十九和二十世纪干预改善恶劣的工厂环境。
Otherwise, businesses will not be able to behave decently, for fear of being undercut by unscrupulous competitors. => 否则，企业将无法体面地运行，因为它们面临着无良竞争者的恶性竞争。
Finally, more opportunities must be created for the next generation – and not just economic opportunities. => 最后，必须为子孙后代创造更多机会 — — 不仅仅是经济机会。
Since the 2008 financial crisis, many governments have reduced their investments in health, education, housing, and other forms of human capital. => 2008年金融危机以来，许多政府缩减了它们在卫生、教育、住房和其他形式的人力资本上的投资。
Many have also cut support for the unemployed, homeless, or indebted. => 许多政府还削减了对失业者、无家可归者和负债者的支持。
As a result, those who have fallen behind are deprived not just of resources, but, more important, the chance to pursue their aspirations. => 结果，落后群体不但被剥夺了资源，跟重要的是，也被剥夺了追求理想的机会。
As the IMF, World Bank, and WTO show in their report, free trade and globalization have certainly increased the size of the overall economic pie. => IMF、世界银行和世贸组织在它们的报告中指出，自由贸易和全球化毫无疑问扩大了经济蛋糕的总规模。
In theory, this should have expanded governments’ capacity to compensate those left behind and create the conditions for them to get ahead. => 理论上，这应该能提升政府补偿落后群体、为他们创造迎头赶上的条件的能力。
In fact, the opposite has happened, owing to government cutbacks since 2008. => 事实上，情况正好相反，原因就在于2008年以来政府的紧缩政策。
The establishment’s agenda has been failing for too long. => 建制派的日程早已失败多时。
And as elites continue to proclaim the benefits of free trade and globalization, they are merely widening the chasm of popular mistrust. => 而在精英们继续鼓吹自由贸易和全球化的好处的时候，他们只能不断地扩大公众的信任裂痕。
Over the past year, that mistrust has boiled over in many countries, with voters in one election after another rejecting the status quo. => 在过去的一年中，这一不信任在许多国家引爆，在一次又一次选举中，选民们都拒绝了现状。
Piecemeal curbs on globalization will not be enough to quell the revolt. => 零敲碎打的全球化限制不足以平息这场反动。

Instead, world leaders must leave their echo chamber, take ordinary people’s concerns seriously, diversify their views, and think about why so many have lost faith in the system. => 相反，世界领导人应该走出他们的回音室，认真对待普罗大众的担忧，多样化他们的观点，思考为什么如此多人失去了对体系的信念。
The Development Costs of Homophobia => 同性恋的发展成本
LONDON – As a gay man living in Nigeria, my biggest challenge was choosing between my sexuality and my job. => 伦敦—作为一个生活在尼日利亚的男同性恋，我最大的挑战是在性取向和工作之间做出选择。
In 2004, I was at the start of my acting career. => 2004年，我开始了我的表演生涯。
Whispers were making the rounds about my private life, and I decided it was time to come out. => 关于我的私生活流言蜚语不断，我决定是时候站出来了。
So I agreed to go on Nigeria’s most-watched television talk show to discuss my sexuality. => 因此我同意参加尼日利亚收视率最高的电视脱口秀讨论我的性取向。
Almost immediately, my character was eliminated. => 我的角色几乎马上就被取消了。
And when my job disappeared, so did my financial security. => 丢了饭碗的我也失去了财务保障。
Like many gay men and lesbians in Africa, my choice was between economic freedom and mental imprisonment. => 与非洲的众多男女同性恋一样，我必须在经济自由和精神禁锢之间做出选择。
This year, Nigeria and Uganda put in place draconian anti-gay laws, sparking a worldwide debate about human rights. => 今年，尼日利亚和乌干达都出台了严厉的反同性恋法律，激起了关于人权的全球争论。

This debate has also started at the World Bank, whose president, Jim Yong Kim, recently declared that “institutionalized discrimination is bad for people and for societies.” => 这场争论也在世界银行展开，行长金墉最近宣布“制度化歧视对人类和社会不利。 ”
Kim’s statement has invited criticism and controversy. => 金墉的表态招来了批评和争议。
But this assumes that homosexuality is “un-African.” => 但这一论断意味着同性恋是“不非洲”的。
In 2006, President Olusegun Obasanjo, then Nigeria’s president, was among the first to do so. => 2006年，尼日利亚时任总统奥巴桑乔（Olusegun Obasanjo）是第一批接受这一观点的领导人之一。
Uganda’s President Yoweri Museveni followed suit when signing the anti-gay bill into law in 2014. => 乌干达总统穆塞维尼（Yoweri Museveni）紧随其后，在2014年也签署了反同性恋法案。
