Pakistan recommends seeking an alternate venue for the negotiations with the Taliban, rather than abandoning reconciliation efforts altogether. => 巴基斯坦建议寻找其他地点与塔利班谈判，而不要一股脑儿放弃协调努力。

India’s former ambassador to Afghanistan, Vivek Katju, is confident that Afghan President Hamid Karzai’s anger at the Taliban’s gambit in Qatar will not delay negotiations for long. => 前印度驻阿富汗大使卡特居（Vivek Katju）信心满满地认为，阿富汗总统卡尔扎伊对塔利班卡塔尔策略的愤怒将长期推迟谈判。
(Indeed, Karzai has reportedly already met with Taliban representatives for secret talks aimed at restarting the stalled peace initiative.) => （事实上，卡尔扎伊已多次会见塔利班代表进行秘密谈判，目的是重启陷入停顿的和平计划。 ）

After all, the US has already accepted the Taliban’s unrealistic assurances that it will not use Afghanistan as a base from which to “foment trouble” – that is, execute terrorist attacks – elsewhere. => 毕竟，美国已经接受了塔利班不现实的保证 — — 不会利用阿富汗作为在别的地区“挑起麻烦 ” （ 即进行恐怖袭击）的基地。
Fortunately for the US, the Taliban is no longer a homogeneous group. => 对美国来说，幸事是塔利班不再是铁板一块的组织。
A decade of running and hiding from unrelenting surveillance and targeted drone attacks has caused the movement to splinter. => 十年来一刻不停地与监控和定向无人机攻击捉迷藏已经造成了塔利班内部的裂痕。

Yet, as the security expert Sajjan M. Gohel has observed, “the displaced and disillusioned Taliban youth of today” have “found solace and purpose in an extremely radical interpretation of Islam.” => 但是，正如安全专家高尔（Sajjan M. Gohel）所观察的 ， “ 流离失所、幻想破灭的今日塔利班青年”已经“在对伊斯兰教的极端激进的解释中找到了慰藉和目标。
The Taliban may no longer be a unified force, but they clearly remain a dangerous one. => ”塔利班可能不再是团结的军事力量，但显然仍是极其危险的。
All of these developments have put India in a difficult position. => 所有这些发展趋势让印度的处境极其艰难。
In order to make the best of a grim situation, India must be prepared to protect its own interests at all costs. => 为了尽量减轻不利情形，印度必须做好不惜一切代价捍卫自身利益的准备。
After all, as the US extricates itself from its Afghan quagmire, its own national interests will continue to trump all other considerations. => 毕竟，随着美国从阿富汗泥沼中脱身而出，其自身国家利益将继续压倒其他一切考虑。
But China, Pakistan, and Iran also have their own important national-security interests in Afghanistan that each will now do their utmost to guarantee. => 但中国、巴基斯坦和伊朗也有其重要国家安全利益在阿富汗，它们都会竭尽全力维护这一利益。

So, while US troops may be leaving Afghanistan, an end to the violence spawned by America’s war remains nothing more than a distant dream – especially for Afghanistan’s South Asian neighbors. => 因此，早美国军队可能离开阿富汗的同时，而由这场美国战争而形成的暴力平息局面也将化为一场泡影 — — 特别是对阿富汗的南亚邻国来说。
Afghanistan’s Customary Anguish => 阿富汗陋习所带来的痛苦
Collective decisions are taken by patriarchs in councils called jirgas, where all have to be in agreement. => 集体决策由jirgas委员会中的长老做出，所有人都必须服从他们的决策。

This agreement includes including collaborating or not with the Taliban, cooperating with the Coalition forces, accepting or refusing poppy eradication in a village. => 决策内容包括是否与塔利班和联盟武装合作，还包括接受或拒绝在村子里铲除罂粟。
Every act of an Afghan male’s life is integrated in a form of reciprocity, in which nothing is free. => 阿富汗男性生命中的一举一动均包含某种形式的互换，没有什么东西是不付出代价就可以得到的。

Melmastia, the basic tenet of hospitality means “I will give you shelter if you ask me to, even if you are a fugitive murderer; but, in exchange, you fight my battles.” => Melmastia（互惠互利）是人际交往的基本原则，它意味着“即使你是亡命天涯的杀人凶手，只要来求我帮助我也会为你提供栖身之所，但交换条件是，你必须为我战斗。
This sense of customary obligation is why so many of President Hamid Karzai’s cronies remain in place and Taliban leaders remain safe. => ”这种约定俗成的责任意识就可以解释为什么哈米德·卡尔扎伊总统的那么多亲信依然在位，也可以解释塔利班领导人为什么仍然安全。
Women are excluded from collective decision-making, as they are mere objects. => 女人被排斥在集体决策的过程之外，因为她们不过是没有思想的物品。

Girls are literally sold upon marriage (the father is paid money for his daughter’s labor and reproductive capacity) and join their husband’s household. => 女孩在结婚时基本上是待价而沽（父亲能为自己女儿的劳动和生育能力而得到报酬 ） ， 并在婚后进入丈夫的家族。
The younger the girl, the higher the price. => 越年轻的女孩售价就越高。
Marriage, especially in the provinces, is routinely consummated on pre-pubescent bodies. => 尤其是在阿富汗所属各省，结婚的通常都是尚在青春期的女孩。
Yet women are precious in their own way. => 但女性也有女性的宝贵之处。

A family’s principal “cultural capital” is its honor, which is ensured by denying women any opportunity to highlight male failings and therefore tarnish clan respectability. => 一个家族主要的“文化资本”是家族的荣耀，而保护家族荣耀必须确保不让女性有任何机会指出男性所犯的错误、从而玷污家族的名望。

As a result, women must be strictly secluded and made invisible when in public, for they are personally responsible for the desire that they could ignite in schools, hospitals, parks, or markets. => 因此，必须让女性彻底与世隔绝，不在公众场合抛头露面，因为女性出现在学校、医院、公园或市场可能点燃的欲望都要由她们自己负责。
The all-covering burqa ensures sufficient anonymity to permit women a certain amount of freedom in public space. => 把浑身上下包裹得严严实实的长袍可以很好地隐藏她们的身份，让她们一定程度上能在公共场所自由活动。
Every female simultaneously carries her father’s and her husband’s honor, and will stoically submit to all forms of violence committed in its name. => 每位女性同时肩负着父亲和丈夫的荣耀，对于所有以上述名义强加的暴力都必须无条件的服从。
This may mean dying in childbirth rather than risking the “dishonor” of giving birth in a public place, a hospital, in front of strangers. => 这或许意味着她们必须选择宁愿在生孩子的时候死去，也不能甘冒受辱的危险去医院这样的公共场所接受陌生人的帮助。
Going to court is practically unheard of, as it would mean renouncing family practices. => 上法院更是几乎闻所未闻，因为这意味着放弃家族决定权。

From the male point of view, resorting to outside police or judicial intervention would signify an inability to fight one’s own battles – an admission of defeat and a symbolic castration. => 从男性的角度看，求助于外来的警察或司法力量意味着没有能力独立作战 — — 这等同于承认失败并接受象征性的阉割。

This helps explain the intense corruption present in Afghan courts, where “honor” can be redeemed by bribing a judge to have a rapist or murderer released. => 这有助于解释阿富汗法院存在的严重腐败现象，人们相信可以通过贿赂法官释放强奸或杀人犯来赎回“荣耀 ” 。
As violence is strictly a private matter, relinquishing justice to state institutions could be an unacceptable humiliation. => 因为暴力纯属于私人事务，将裁决权拱手让给国家机构可以成为一种令人无法忍受的耻辱。
Customary law is not rigid in that it is made to fit round the demands of global economy. => 习惯法在最初诞生时并不死板，因为它需要适应全球经济发展的需求。

It has become more rigorous in it s applications due to the influence ofmilitant Islam, which seeks to use religious texts to legitimize escalating brutality, especially against women. => 后来在执行上越来越僵化死板主要是受到伊斯兰好战主义的影响，好战份子试图借助宗教教义来实现暴力升级、特别是使针对妇女的暴力合法化。

However, Farhang and privatized violence are precisely what Mohammad sought to ban through Koranic law, which went beyond the personal domain and instituted a code that gave some rights to women. => 但是，Farhang和个人暴力正是默罕默德希望通过古兰经法律禁止的行为，它已经超越了私人事务领域，制定了一部法规，并将某种形式的权利赋予了女性。

Similarly, whereas the Koran requires four eyewitnesses as proof of adultery, mere suspicion of some unregulated, potentially sexual conduct by a woman warrants stoning under customary law. => 同样，古兰经规定必须有四名目击证人才能证实通奸罪，但仅仅怀疑一名女性可能发生过违法性行为就足以按照习惯法的规则对其处以石刑。
Yet an awareness of alternatives is seeping in through the media, even in remote provinces. => 但即使是在最边远的省份，对于替代性选择的认识也正透过媒体逐渐地向人们渗透。
Iranian films and the much loved Indian TV serials, not to mention the occasional American film, influence peoples' expectations. => 伊朗影片和备受喜爱的印度连续剧，更不要说偶尔上映的美国电影都在潜移默化地影响着人们的看法。
Add to that the experience of having lived abroad as refugees in Pakistan and Iran. => 曾经在巴基斯坦和伊朗的难民生活经历也起到同样的作用。
Girls know that there are options to an unacceptable way of life: women are increasingly demanding more from life than what custom ordains. => 女孩们知道除接受无法容忍的生活方式外还有其他选择：在习俗规定的范围外，女性对生活提出了越来越多的要求。

This is especially true for those who have lived in Iran, a totally Muslim environment that allows women the freedom to study and work as well as access to adequate healthcare and family planning. => 那些曾经在伊朗生活的人尤其如此，那里虽然是纯而又纯的穆斯林环境，但却允许妇女自由地学习和工作，也可以享有充分的医疗和计划生育保障。

Once back in rural Afghanistan, forced into brutal marriages, many desperate women – especially returnees from Iran – resort to self-immolation. => 一旦返回到阿富汗农村，被迫接受野蛮的婚姻，许多绝望的女性 — — 特别是从伊朗回国的女性 — — 宁愿选择自我毁灭的道路。
Violence and murder of women are on the increase, perpetrated by men who feel that these alternatives pose a threat to their authority. => 针对妇女的暴力和谋杀呈上升趋势，因为犯罪的男性感到这些选择对他们的权威构成了挑战。
The West imagines that religion is the central issue in Afghanistan. => 西方人普遍认为宗教是阿富汗问题的核心。

But the heart of the matter is the preservation of ancient patriarchal rights that go back to Biblical times, reformatted to fit the demands of globalized capitalism. => 但问题的症结所在是保留了可以追溯到《圣经》时代的古老的宗族权利，上述宗族权利只是进行了某些调整来适应全球化资本主义的要求。

Governments and international aid organizations have failed to take into consideration the role of Farhang, perhaps because the power of unwritten law remains largely inconceivable in the West. => 政府和国际援助机构尚未将Farhang的作用纳入考虑，也许因为多数西方人无法理解不成文法律的力量。
But Afghanistan cannot begin to solve its many problems until it criminalizes the privatized violence of this antiquated code. => 但在惩罚这项古老规则引发的私人暴力之前，阿富汗的许多问题都无法得到解决。
Afghanistan’s Drug-Friendly Environment => 阿富汗适宜毒品的环境

But Karzai’s relationship with his sponsors has begun to sour, in part owing to charges that his government has failed to stop the resurgence of Afghanistan’s huge opium trade. => 但是卡尔扎伊与其资助人之间的关系已经开始恶化，一部分原因是由于他的政府未能阻止阿富汗大规模的鸦片贸易的兴起。
That lesson should have been absorbed and understood, not least by American strategists, long before the Taliban’s fall. => 在塔利班垮台以前，人们就应该吸取并记住这个教训，尤其是美国的战略家。

After all, desertification and deforestation helped fuel the rise, two decades earlier, of the Maoist guerilla group Sendero Luminoso (Shining Path) in Peru. => 毕竟，沙漠化和森林采伐促成了二十多年前秘鲁的毛泽东主义游击队Sendero Luminoso（光辉道路）的崛起。

Sendero, which supplemented its income with drug production and timber smuggling, deliberately chose drought-weakened and deforested mountain villages as the stronghold of its insurgency. => Sendero靠种植毒品和走私木材补充收入，刻意选择那些久经干旱、采伐过度的山地村庄作为他们叛乱的根据地。

Similarly, the Maoist insurgency in Nepal, which has claimed 10,000 lives, exploits the desperation of mountain villagers hit by flash floods – the result of deforestation higher up. => 同样，导致10,000多人丧生的尼泊尔毛泽东主义叛乱使得那些遭受骤发洪水袭击的山地村民彻底绝望，骤发洪水正是高地森林采伐的结果。

No Maoist group could ever gain a toehold in Afghanistan’s parched Pashtun south (these were, after all, people who, bare-knuckled, smashed the Soviets). => 没有毛泽东主义团体可以在阿富汗南部普什图族（Pashtun）干裂的土地上获得立足之地（毕竟这些人曾经赤手空拳击溃苏联 ） 。
But the Taliban’s rapid rise in the 1990’s was inextricably linked to the failure of irrigation systems. => 但是上世纪九十年代塔利班的迅速壮大与灌溉体系的失败不无关系。
Villagers whose crops shriveled and whose livestock died in a prolonged drought saw joining the Taliban as an economic opportunity. => 村民们的庄稼在一场持续干旱中枯萎、牲口也大批死亡，他们把加入塔利班看作一个改善经济的机会。
Had there been more irrigation, the Taliban’s gains might have been far less impressive. => 如果有更多的灌溉的话，塔利班所占有的也许就远没有那么令人印象深刻。
The Taliban are now an increasingly spent force, but lack of water reinforced the logic of opium production across its former strongholds in the south. => 如今，塔利班已是强弩之末，然而水源的缺乏更使它难以维系它在前南方大本营的鸦片生产流程。
Clear-cutting of old growth forests in the mountains bordering Pakistan may prove as problematic. => 巴基斯坦山区边界滥砍滥伐老熟森林的做法受到质疑。
These sorts of trees can be restored, given a concerted campaign and investment in nurseries to produce local varieties. => 如果人们齐心协力，投资培育开发本地树木品种，这些种类的树木就能重新恢复。
Loss of the ancient cedar, pine, fir, and oak forests on the slopes above is another matter. => 山坡上的古杉木、松树、枞树和橡树林的消失是另外一个问题。

This year’s snowmelt caused landslides and flooding – a warning of more soil erosion and destruction of arable land to come; hundreds died and thousands lost their livelihoods. => 今年的雪融水引发了山崩和洪水 — — 这是更多土壤遭受侵蚀以及耕地将被大量破坏的警告；数百人丧生于此，成千上万的人失去了生计。
Forestry has always been a problem in Afghanistan. => 阿富汗的森林一直是一个棘手问题。

In 1960, the United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization spoke of wasteful logging practices, such as “head-skidding” (in which a log is rolled downhill, ripping up plants and soil). => 1960年，联合国食品和农业组织（FAO）谈到了不经济的伐木行为，例如“ 木头滚滑法（head-skidding ） ” （即将木头滚下山去，同时将树木带着土壤连根拔起 ） 。
Aerial photographers were called in, and a large budget was set aside. => 航空摄影师被召来拍摄照片，结果预算被取消了。
But, in 1976, the FAO admitted in a new plan that forest and watershed management activities had “turned out to be quite limited.” => 但是1976年FAO在一项新计划中承认森林和水流域的管理行动“十分有限 ” 。
The 1976 plan called for sustainable logging and basic forest-fire control, but war intervened, costing Afghanistan half its forest cover. => 1976年计划呼吁可持续发展地伐木以及森林火灾的基本控制，但是战争爆发使阿富汗失去了一半的森林土地。
Up to 60% of the old growth forest in Nangahar, the second largest opium-producing province, may have been cut during the war years. => 第二大鸦片生产省楠阿哈省（Nangahar）有达60%的土地是老熟林，但它们在战争期间被砍伐一空。

Mujahedin factions and later the Taliban exported stands of fine-grained cedar by the truckload from Nangahar and surrounding provinces to Pakistan, often in return for arms. => 圣战组织的派系以及后来的塔利班用货车从楠阿哈省及周边地区向巴基斯坦出口品种优良的杉木，经常以此交换武器。
Illegal logging continues today, with only ineffectual efforts made to stop it. => 直至今日，由于没有有效措施，非法伐木仍在继续。
At the current rate, Afghanistan’s old growth forest could vanish within a decade. => 按照目前的速度，阿富汗的老熟林将在十年内消失尽贻。

The UN acknowledges the problem but is (rightly) unwilling to risk sending forestry experts into a tribal region where American and allied troops venture only in armored convoys. => 联合国认识到了这个问题，但是却不愿意冒风险将森林学专家派往一个连美国及其联军只有在武装护卫的情况下才敢冒险涉足的偏远部族地区。
Safety concerns and cost also limit intervention by international conservation organizations. => 安全问题及成本问题限制了国际保护组织的介入。
Illegal logging crews number 200 or more. => 但是这个计划看起来并不太可能有效。
They have chain saws and trucks. They are armed and work with the backing of drug and emerald smugglers – and often of local officials. => 非法伐木队共计200余人，他们有锯子和卡车，他们全副武装，并在毒品和翡翠走私者（通常是当地官员）的支持下工作。
The price of plank cedar in Lahore is incentive enough to corrupt, or kill, any Green Corps men brave enough to stand in their way. => 厚杉木在拉合尔（Lahore）的价格之高足以让他们去贿赂或杀害任何一个绿色团体中敢挡他们路的人。
Environmental issues are of paramount importance in marginal countries because their impact on human survival is immediate and direct. => 环境问题对边缘国家十分重要，因为它对人类生存具有立竿见影的直接影响。
Afghanistan’s Feminist Revolution => 阿富汗的女权主义革命

The law would permit marital rape, limit women’s movements – say, for work or study – without male permission, and even make it illegal for a woman to refuse to dress as her husband wishes. => 这项法律允许婚内强奸行为，限制在没有得到男性许可前提下女性的行动 — — 比如工作或者学习，甚至将女人拒绝像丈夫希望的那样穿衣打扮规定为非法。

The women, facing a crowd of furious men calling them “whores” and other epithets, marched two miles under a rain of abuse and delivered their petition against the law to legislators. => 这些妇女面对着用“妓女”和其他侮辱性绰号辱骂她们的愤怒的男人，在一片谩骂声中游行了两英里，向议员们表达了她们对这部法律的不满。
Both houses of Parliament had approved the law, and President Hamid Karzai signed it. => 议会上下两院都已经通过了这部法律，哈米德·卡尔扎伊总统也已经签字批准。
The law now affects only the Shia minority, but threatens to affect pending legislation that could restrict the rights of non-Shia women as well. => 这部法律目前只影响到什叶派少数族裔，不过或许会影响到可能限制非什叶派妇女权利的即将表决的法案。

When Western media sought quotes from the women, they frequently heard a Western-style feminist refrain: “These laws would make women into a kind of property.” => 当西方媒体采访游行妇女的时候，他们经常会听到与西方式女权主义类似的观点 ： “ 这部法律会把女人变成一种财产。
On the contrary, the feminism expressed by women such as these Afghani heroines should educate us in the West about our own shortcomings. => 恰恰相反，阿富汗女主人公们表达的女权主义思想应当教育西方人认识到自身的弱点。

The core theory with which emerging feminists in more traditional and religious societies are working is far different from that of Western feminism – and in some ways far more profound and humane. => 在传统并信奉宗教的社会中新兴的女权主义核心理论与西方的女权主义差别很大 — — 从某种角度来讲前者的人性化和深刻程度远远超过了后者。

Nor does it seem likely to emulate the splintered, individualized, solitary society – and the commodified sexual revolution – that Western, self-based feminism reflects. => 它似乎也不会步分裂、个性化、孤独社会 — — 以及西方自我中心的女权主义所反应的商业化性解放的后尘。

Simone de Beauvoir, whose seminal book The Second Sex laid the groundwork for post-war Western feminism, was an Existentialist who was neither a wife nor a mother nor a woman of faith. => 西蒙·德·波伏娃的著作《第二性》奠定了战后西方女权主义的基础，是一种既非妻子又非母亲亦非信徒的存在主义者形象。

The good news for all women, East and West, is that President Karzai, under intense international criticism – and not just Western criticism – changed the law less than one week after the march. => 对东西方妇女的好消息是卡尔扎伊总统在严厉的国际批评下 — — 这样的批评言论不只来自于西方 — — 在游行结束不到一周后就修改了这项法律。
This global uproar is a testament to how three decades of Western feminist challenges to leadership have changed the world for the better. => 这次国际动荡证明了三十年来西方女权主义者对领导权的挑战怎样让世界向好的方向发展。
But our (Western) moment of feminist leadership is over now – for good reasons. => 但我们（西方）把持女权主义领导地位的时代已经结束了 — — 而且之所以这样也有充分的理由。
We know by now what our problems are as women in the West, and we know the blueprint for solving them. => 我们现在知道西方女性的问题在哪里，而且也已经清楚解决之道。
What we lack now is not analysis, but the organizational and political will to do so. => 我们现在缺乏的不是分析，而是切实执行的组织和政治意愿。
So the leadership role is shifting to women in the developing world. => 因此领导权已经转移到发展中国家的妇女手中。

Their agenda is more pressing, and their problems, frankly, far more serious than ours, which makes it much more urgent for them to develop theories appropriate to the challenges they face. => 她们的任务更加紧迫，而且坦率地讲，她们的问题比我们严重得多，因此她们迫切需要发展与所面临挑战相适应的理论。
Afghanistan’s Opium War => 阿富汗的鸦片战争
When NATO leaders meet for their summit in Riga at the end of this month, there will be a ghost at the feast: Afghanistan’s opium. => 北约领导人本月底在里加召开首脑会议之时，将有一个魔鬼在会议徘徊，那就是阿富汗的鸦片问题。

Afghanistan is in danger of falling back into the hands of terrorists, insurgents, and criminals, and the multi-billion-dollar opium trade is at the heart of the country’s malaise. => 阿富汗正处于陷入恐怖份子、叛乱份子以及罪犯手中的危险，而几十亿美元的鸦片交易则是这个国家病症的核心所在。
Indeed, NATO’s top general, James Jones, has called drugs the “Achilles heel” of Afghanistan. => 确实，北约总司令琼斯把毒品称为阿富汗的致命弱点。

This year’s record harvest of 6,100 tons of opium will generate more than $3 billion in illicit revenue – equivalent to almost half of Afghanistan’s GDP. => 今年6100吨鸦片收成将会产生超过30亿美元的非法收入，几乎相对于阿富汗国民生产总值的一半。
Profits for drug traffickers downstream will be almost 20 times that amount. => 下游毒贩的利润将几乎是这个数目的20倍。
Opium money is corrupting Afghan society from top to bottom. => 鸦片收入正在从上到下腐蚀阿富汗社会。
High-level collusion enables thousands of tons of chemical precursors, needed to produce heroin, to be trucked into the country. => 高层勾结使得数以千吨用于制造海洛因的化学前体运入该国。
Armed convoys transport raw opium around the country unhindered. => 武装运输队在境内运输鸦片如入无人之境。
Sometimes even army and police vehicles are involved. => 有时，连军队和警察也卷入其中。
Guns and bribes ensure that the trucks are waved through checkpoints. => 武器和贿赂确保卡车得以通过检查站。
Opiates flow freely across borders into Iran, Pakistan, and other Central Asian countries. => 鸦片剂大摇大摆地越境进入伊朗、巴基斯坦以及其他中亚国家。
The opium fields of wealthy landowners are untouched, because local officials are paid off. => 由于买通了当地官员，富有地主们的鸦片种植地无人敢碰。
Major traffickers never come to trial because judges are bribed or intimidated. => 法官们受贿或者受到恐吓，因此毒贩头子们从来都是逍遥法外。
Senior government officials take their cut of opium revenues or bribes in return for keeping quiet. => 政府高官抽取鸦片收入或者贿赂以保持缄默。
Perversely, some provincial governors and government officials are themselves major players in the drug trade. => 某些省长以及政府官员竟然也是毒品贸易的主要经营者。
As a result, the Afghan state is at risk of takeover by a malign coalition of extremists, criminals, and opportunists. => 结果，阿富汗国家处在被极端份子、罪犯以及投机主义份子等组成的邪恶联盟接管的危险之中。
Opium is choking Afghan society. => 鸦片正在令阿富汗社会窒息。
Within Afghanistan, drug addiction is rising. => 在阿富汗境内，越来越多的人在吸毒。
Neighbors that used to be transit states for drugs are now major consumers, owing to similar dramatic increases in opium and heroin addiction. => 由于鸦片和吸食海洛因，过去是毒品中转地的地方现在成为了主要的消费地。
Intravenous drug use is spreading HIV/AIDS in Iran, Central Asia, and the former Soviet Union. => 使用注射毒品正在伊朗、中亚以及前苏联传播艾滋病。
What can be done? => 如何对付呢？
First, the veil of corruption in Afghanistan must be lifted. => 首先，必须揭开阿富汗的腐败面纱。 阿富汗人对于傲慢而又受到武装保护的大亨们已经不耐烦了。

It is time for the Afghan government to name, shame, and sack corrupt officials, arrest major drug traffickers and opium landlords, and seize their assets. => 现在，阿富汗政府应该点名、羞辱并且解雇那些贪官，逮捕主要的毒贩和鸦片地主，并且没收他们的资产。
Donors have trained police and prosecutors and built courts and detention centers. => 捐助国家们已经培训了警察、检察官，并且建造了法院和拘留中心。
Now it is up to the government to use the judicial system to impose the rule of law. => 现在，政府应当使用司法体系来实施法治。
It will be difficult, but not impossible, to re-establish confidence in the central government. => 重新建立对中央政府的信心将会是困难的，但并非不可能。
Putting major drug traffickers behind bars at the new maximum-security prison at Pul-i-Charki, near Kabul, would be a good start. => 把主要的毒品贩子关进靠近喀布尔的波尔-伊-查基的新的最高安全戒备的监狱将会是一个良好的开端。
Of course, Afghanistan does not bear sole responsibility for its plight. => 当然，阿富汗人对其灾难并不承担所有的责任。
The heroin trade would not be booming if Western governments were serious about combating drug consumption. => 如果西方国家政府严肃打击毒品消费，那么，海洛因交易就不会猖獗。
It is a bitter irony that the countries whose soldiers’ lives are on the line in Afghanistan are also the biggest markets for Afghan heroin. => 具有令人心酸的讽刺意味的是，那些向阿富汗派遣随时都有生命危险的士兵的国家同时也是阿富汗海洛因最大的市场。

Furthermore, Afghanistan’s neighbors must do more to stop insurgents, weapons, money, and chemical precursors from flowing across their borders into the country. => 而且，阿富汗的邻国必须多做工作，以制止反叛人员、武器、金钱以及化学前体跨境进入该国。
Coalition forces should take a more robust approach to the drug problem. => 联合部队应当对毒品问题采取更为强硬的手段。
Counter-insurgency and counter-narcotics are two sides of the same coin. => 反叛乱和反毒品是一个问题的两个方面。
Improving security and the rule of law must include destroying the opium trade. => 改善安全以及法治必须包括摧毁鸦片交易。

Allowing opium traffickers to operate with impunity gives them a free hand to raise money to pay for the arms and fighters battling the Afghan army and NATO forces. => 允许鸦片贩子肆无忌惮就让他们无所顾忌地筹款来支付军火以及同阿富汗和北约军队作战的份子。
The United Nations Security Council has authorized the International Security Assistance Force to take all necessary measures to fulfill its mandate. => 联合国安理会已经授权国际安全援助部队采取所有必要的手段来实现其使命。

NATO troops should be given the green light to help the Afghan army fight opium – destroy the heroin labs, disband the opium bazaars, attack the opium convoys, and bring the big traders to justice. => 应当授权北约部队帮助阿富汗军队与鸦片作战，即摧毁海洛因实验室，解除鸦片集市，袭击鸦片运输队，并且把大毒贩绳之以法。
And they should be given the tools and manpower to do the job. => 而且，应该给他们必要的装备和人员来完成使命。
There is no point in trying to win the hearts and minds of major drug traffickers. => 试图赢得主要毒贩的欢心是没有用处的。
Farmers are a different story. => 农民们则另当别论。
Forced eradication risks pushing farmers into the hands of extremists, and thus will not lead to the sustainable reduction of opium fields. => 强制毁田有可能把农民们逼入极端份子手中，从而不会导致鸦片地可持续的减少。
Indeed, as we have seen in some Andean countries, it can be counter-productive. => 实际上，正如我们在某些安达斯国家所见到的那样，这样做可能会适得其反。
Therefore, security and development must go hand in hand. => 因此，安全和发展必须并举。
To achieve this, Afghanistan needs more development assistance. => 为了实现这一目标，阿富汗需要更多的国际援助。

International support so far has been generous, but it is still well below per capita equivalents for other post-conflict situations – and the need is much greater. => 目前为止，国际支持是慷慨的，但是，还是远远低于其他战后形势的人均水平，而且，需求更大。
Farmers will be weaned off opium over the long term only if they have sustainable livelihoods. => 农民们只有具备了可以持久的生计才能长久地脱离鸦���。
At the moment, Afghanistan’s drug lords are prospering, and rural communities are suffering. => 目前，阿富汗的大毒枭们为所欲为，而农村社区则奄奄一息。
That situation needs to be reversed. => 这一局面必须得到扭转。
We must punish the traffickers and reward the farmers. => 我们必须惩治毒贩而奖励农民。
We cannot afford to fail in Afghanistan. => 我们无法在阿富汗失败。
Recent history has given us graphic evidence of what would happen if we do. => 最近的历史生动地告诉我们失败的结局是什么。
But any solution in Afghanistan depends on eliminating its opium. => 但是，任何阿富汗的解决之道都取决于消除其鸦片。
Afghanistan’s Terrorized Women => 暴力威胁下的阿富汗妇女

KABUL – Recently, the Afghan Independent Human Rights Commission (AIHRC) office in Kudoz province reported the rescue of a young woman who had been imprisoned in her in-laws’ dungeon for seven months. => 发自喀布尔 — — 最近阿富汗独立人权委员会（AIHRC）在库都兹省（Kudoz）的办事处报告了一起营救事件。
Over the past ten years, the AIHRC has received more than 19,000 complaints related to violence against women. => 在过去十年间，委员会收到了超过1.9万件与虐待妇女有关的申诉。

Despite making some progress in investigating the complaints and referring them to the justice system, as well as in raising public awareness about the issue, the challenges remain huge. => 尽管在调查这些申诉并移交司法机关的提升了公众对该事务关注度方面取得了一些进展，但我们所面对的挑战依然非常艰巨。
Since 2002, many efforts have been made to improve women’s lives in Afghanistan. => 自2002年以来，各界在改善阿富汗妇女待遇方面作出了许多努力。
But laws and policies alone are not sufficient to protect women from horrific domestic abuse. => 但仅靠法律和政策并不足以保护妇女免遭残酷的家族虐待行为。
Indeed, the Gul case is hardly the only well-publicized case. => 事实上，上面那宗案件只不过是曝光率最高的一个。

There was also Gulnaz, a young woman who was jailed for adultery after being raped by a relative (she was recently released after a presidential pardon, but may be forced to marry her attacker). => 还有一名叫古尔纳兹（Gulnaz）的年轻妇女在遭到亲戚强奸之后竟以通奸罪名入狱（虽然她最近得到总统特赦，但仍可能被迫要和强奸者结婚 ） 。
The husband of another young woman, Aisha, cut off her nose and ears when she ran away. => 而另一位叫阿莎的妇女试图从家里逃走，却被其夫捉回来残忍地割掉了鼻子和双耳。

Violence against women in Afghanistan persists for many reasons. First, the country has inherited a patriarchal tribal tradition that assumes women’s inferiority. => 而针对妇女的暴力行为之所以在阿富汗屡禁不止，是由许多原因的：首先，该国继承了一个男权部落传统，认为女性就是低人一等，并因此剥夺了女性的基本权利和自由。
Second, there is a strong political incentive to deprive women of their rights. => 其次，在政治上也存在强大的诱因去剥夺女性的权利。
Radical groups receive immense support from the large share of the population that opposes women’s rights. => 有极大数量的民众反对给于妇女权利，而这些人同时又为那些极端组织提供了强大的支持。
The Taliban, for example, have consistently used an anti-women policy to appeal to tribal and rural people. => 例如塔利班组织就一直利用一套压制妇女的政策来吸引部落和农村地区的民众。
Third, family pride and honor are deemed more important than a woman’s individual well-being and safety. => 第三，有些人把家族荣誉看得比妇女个人的幸福和安全更加重要。
For example, if family members beat or abuse a woman, she has few options. => 如果其他家庭成员虐打了家族中的一名妇女，她有几个选项。
Often, her only choice is to remain silent or risk disgracing the family. => 一般情况下，她只能在忍气吞声和令家族蒙羞之间选择。
If she does report the matter to the authorities, the case will almost certainly never be properly investigated, nor the perpetrators ever prosecuted. => 如果该名妇女把情况报告给了当局，这个案件几乎不会被认真调查，施暴者也不会被起诉。

Gul, for example, complained to the police about her abusive in-laws, but she was returned to the family when some of their influential contacts intervened. => 比方说在古尔一案中，古尔将自己所遭受的暴行报告给了警察，谁知在夫家认识的某些权势人物介入后，警察竟又把她送回了夫家。

Fourth, laws are often arbitrarily applied, and sharia (Islamic law) frequently takes precedence over civil legislation, resulting in widespread impunity for crimes of violence against women. => 其四，法律往往无法得到彻底执行，伊斯兰教法又经常凌驾于民法之上，使得那些针对妇女的暴力或罪行得以逍遥法外。
Finally, while the Taliban lost power ten years ago, discrimination and violence against women has occurred in Afghan society for centuries. => 最后，当塔利班政权在十年前倒台之时，对妇女的歧视和暴力已经在阿富汗存在了几个世纪之久。
Thus, despite some progress, public and official sensitivity to violence against women is only slowly emerging. => 尽管目前取得了一些进步，公众和官方对这些事件的敏感度也只是缓慢建立之中。
The Afghan government must take several steps to protect women fully. => 因此阿富汗政府必须采取一系列步骤去彻底保护妇女权益。
Above all, perpetrators of violence against women should be prosecuted and tried under due process of law. => 其中最重要的莫过于要将这些针对妇女的暴力行为予以起诉并在恰当的法律程序下进行审判。
This will require strengthening the rule of law and ending the prevailing culture of impunity. => 这就要求强化法治并消灭当前这种有罪不纠的文化。

That, in turn, requires educating the public further about human rights and women’s rights through school textbooks, continuing education courses, and a vigorous media campaign. => 这反过来要求通过教科书，继续教育课程和大型媒体宣传活动来进一步向公众传达关于人权和妇女权利的知识。
Perhaps most importantly, non-constitutional justice systems, such as sharia, must be monitored and checked, if not prohibited altogether. => 而或许更重要的是，要么将类似伊斯兰教法这样的非宪政司法系统全面禁止，要么对其进行检讨和修订。
As for Sahar Gul, her case must be thoroughly investigated, and the police and judiciary must commit to bringing her torturers to justice. => 对于莎哈尔·古尔来说，她的案件必须得到彻查，警察和法官必须尽全力将那些虐待她的人绳之于法。
Furthermore, Gul’s case, and others like it, should be studied in order to understand the roots of such crimes. => 此外也必须对这些案件进行研究以辨清这类犯罪的根源。
Until Afghanistan’s leaders begin to address this problem seriously, our country will continue to bear the scar of violence against women on its face. => 除非阿富汗领导人们开始认真处理这个问题，否则我们这个国家将继续因虐待妇女的罪行而蒙羞。
A Flat World and a Round Ball => 平面世界和圆的足球
With the final stage of the World Cup approaching, now is a good opportunity for a mid-tournament appraisal. => 世界杯最后阶段的比赛正在临近，现在是作出赛中评论的好时机。
This year’s Cup, unlike the previous one in Japan and South Korea in 2002, didn’t witness any real upsets in the first round. => 今年的世界杯与2002年上一届韩日世界杯不同，并没有在第一轮出现大冷门。
Switzerland and Australia surprisingly reached the elimination round, and the Asian and African teams disappointed somewhat, with only Ghana advancing. => 瑞士和澳大利亚进入十六强令人惊讶，而亚洲和非洲球队则多少令人失望，只有加纳队晋级。

There have been just two ugly matches so far, full of fouls, nasty attacks, and unnecessary aggression, as well as numerous yellow and red cards: Italy vs. the US, and Portugal vs. the Netherlands. => 目前为止，只有两场比赛，也就是意大利对美国和葡萄牙对荷兰丑陋不堪，充满犯规、下流的攻击、毫无必要的侵犯以及漫天飞舞的红黄牌。
Otherwise, we’re experiencing a wonderful Cup in Germany, in terms of both sportsmanship and the overall atmosphere. => 否则，我们正在体验一届无论是从体育角度还是整体气氛都是美妙的德国世界杯。
As for Germany and the Germans, one hardly recognizes one’s own country and people. => 至于德国和德国人，人们几乎不认识自己的国家和同胞。
Even Mother Nature has played along. => 即使是大自然母亲也随人意。

After a long winter and a non-existent spring, summer started promptly with the first kick-off – and virtually overnight, Germany has flaunted its sunniest and most delightful side. => 经过了漫长的冬天和稍纵即逝的春天后，随着首场比赛的开始，夏天即刻来临，而且几乎是一夜之间，德国呈现了最为阳光明媚和快乐的一面。
The weather is Mediterranean, and all of a sudden, so are the people. => 天气是地中海式的，而且连人也奔放。
The Cup’s organization has been exceptional (as was to be expected), with excellent police work giving hooligans hardly a chance. => 本届世界杯赛的组织工作是出类拔萃的（正如预料的一样 ） ， 警方的出色工作让足球流氓们无计可施。
The whole of Germany has been celebrating a never-ending party with guests from all over the world (which was not expected). => 德国全国都在与来自五湖四海的宾客们一道庆贺这场不散的聚会（这是没有预料到的 ） 。
And the German team has put on a wonderful display of heart warming and modern offensive soccer (which nobody could have expected!). => 而德国队则展现了令人暖人心的现代攻势足球（这是没有人预料到的！ ） 。
Years of bad news appear to have passed the Germans by without a trace. => 多年来的坏消息看起来已经过去，没有给德国留下痕迹。
But the Germans, undaunted by it all, simply keep celebrating one great soccer party with their newfound friends from all over the world. => 但是，德国民众对此毫无兴趣，只是继续和来自五湖四海新结交的朋友们一道庆贺这一足球盛会。
The black, red, and gold German tricolor adorns the entire country as never before, but almost nowhere are there nationalist undertones. => 德国国旗的三色黑、红和金色从来没有像现在这样在全国到处飘扬，但是，没有地方出现民族主义的意味。
In fact, the flags of many nations fly alongside German. => 实际上，许多国家的旗帜与德国国旗一同飘扬。
In Berlin, as in other large German cities, taxis sport the flags of their drivers’ home countries – from Angola to Saudi Arabia. => 在柏林以及其他德国大城市，可以看到出租车司机们展现祖国的国旗，从安哥拉一直到沙特阿拉伯。
Fans don not just their nations’ flags, but also fantastic costumes evocative of their home countries’ colors. => 世界各地的球迷们不仅披上他们的国旗，也披上他们各自国家颜色鲜艳的服饰。
Flags are flown in hope of victory, but also serve to dry the tears of defeat. => 挥舞国旗是为了报有胜利的希望，也是为了摸去国家队被击败的泪水。
In short, Germany during the World Cup is reminiscent of a Shakespearean midsummer night’s dream, with a touch of Woodstock to boot. => 总而言之，世界杯期间的德国让人想起了莎士比亚的仲夏夜之梦，还有伍德斯托克音乐节的气氛。
Outside the stadiums, public screenings of the games have become joyous mass “happenings.” => 在足球场外，大屏幕的比赛转播已经成为巨大的球迷欢乐“事件 ” 。
And how is the soccer? => 那么足球本身又如何呢？
This World Cup demonstrates three main developments that the sport has undergone. => 本届世界杯展现了足球运动所经历的三种主要发展趋势。
First, Europe and South America are more dominant than four years ago and remain the unchallenged great powers of international soccer. => 第一，欧洲和南美球队要比四年以前更为占据优势，而且保持为国际足球中无可挑战的大国。
So we must hope that the World Cup in South Africa in 2010 will finally bring greater global parity. => 所以，我们必须希望2010年的南非世界杯将最终带来更大的全球性的强手林立。
Second, international soccer is witnessing the advent of a new generation. => 第二，国际足球正在见证新的一代的来临。
Spain, Argentina, and Germany, to name but a few countries, have put forward very young teams that have played an impressive game. => 西班牙、阿根廷以及德国推出了非常年轻的球队，令人印象深刻。 这些只是其中一些队伍。
On the French, English, and Portuguese teams, too, it is the young players that have shone – despite the continuing presence of Zidane, Beckham, and Figo. => 尽管齐达内、贝克汉姆以及菲哥仍在场上，法国、英国以及葡萄牙队的年轻队员也夺人耳目。

Even the Brazilian squad is looking more aggressive and likely to score with young players like Robinho and Juninho than with their aging champions from 2002. => 巴西也看起来更加富有攻势，罗比尼奥和儒尼奥尔也比2002年以来正在老迈的冠军们更有可能进球。
This generational change is accelerated by a third development. => 这一世代改变由于第三个进展而加快进行。
At the top international level, soccer has become faster and more athletic, and the top teams can shrink space on the field more effectively. => 在国际水平的顶级，足球变得更快，更加要求运动性，顶级球队更为有效地压缩球场空间。
Here, soccer parallels today’s globalized markets, which make similar restructuring of national economies necessary. => 在这里，人们可以在足球和当今全球化的市场进程之间有相似的地方。 由于全球化的市场，各国经济类似的重组十分必要。

Unlike economic globalization, however, it remains to be seen whether this new, fast-paced style of soccer will prevail (after all, the young blood of Spain lost to the Old Boys of France). => 但是，与经济全球化不同的是，这一新的、快节奏足球是否能够获胜还有待观察（毕竟，血气方刚的西班牙输给了老迈的法国 ） 。
The sport and its fans will certainly profit if it does. => 体育和球迷肯定都会获益匪浅。

For now, we have a World Cup filled with soccer that is being shaped by a new, young generation both on and off the playing field – light-hearted, enthralling, and beautiful to watch. => 现在，这是一届由新的年轻一代在场上场下塑造的世界杯，这一代人轻松愉快、令人着迷而且美丽动人。
Let’s hope that when the last whistle blows at the final in Berlin on July 9, we Germans retain as much of this positive spirit as possible. => 让我们希望，当7月9日决赛哨音在柏林吹响的时候，我们德国人能够保持尽可能多的这种精神。
A Free Lunch for America => 美国的免费午餐
But, on the other side of the Atlantic, Americans have no reason to feel smug. => 但在大西洋的另一边，美国人就找不到任何自命不凡的理由了。
The US government can currently borrow for 30 years at a real (inflation-adjusted) interest rate of 1% per year. => 当前，美国政府的30年债务真实（经通胀调整的）利率为每年1 % 。
Suppose that – as seems to be the case – the simple Keynesian government-expenditure multiplier on this spending is only two. => 假设 — — 目前看来正是如此 — — 简单凯恩斯政府支出乘数 为2。

And, with tighter labor-force attachment on the part of those who have jobs, the unemployment rate thereafter would likely be about 0.1 percentage points lower in the indefinite future. => 此外，随着就业人口的劳动力附着效应收紧，失业率将在无穷期的未来中下降0.1个百分点。
The impressive gains don’t stop there. => 可观的好处还不仅于此。
Better infrastructure would mean an extra $20 billion a year of income and social welfare. => 更好的基础设施将意味着每年多产生200亿美元的收入和社会财富。
A lower unemployment rate into the future would mean another $20 billion a year in higher production. => 未来更低的失业率将意味着年产量提高200亿美元。
And half of the extra $1 trillion of goods and services would show up as consumption goods and services for American households. => 而额外产生的1万亿美元商品和服务中有一半会表现为美国家庭的消费品和服务。
So, what are the likely costs of an extra $500 billion in infrastructure spending over the next two years? => 那么，未来两年内增加5000亿美元基础设施支出的潜在成本又是多少呢？

For starters, the $500 billion of extra government spending would likely be offset by $300 billion of increased tax collections from higher economic activity. => 首先，5000亿美元额外政府支出可以用税收增加额抵消3000亿，这笔税收增量来自更高的经济活跃度。
So the net result would be a $200 billion increase in the national debt. => 因此净结果是国民债务水平将上升2000亿美元。

American taxpayers would then have to pay $2 billion a year in real interest on that extra national debt over the next 30 years, and then pay off or roll over the entire $200 billion. => 美国纳税人因此必须在未来30年内为这笔增加的债务付出每年20亿美元的真是利息，然后偿付2000亿美元本金或将债务展期。
The $40 billion a year of higher economic activity would, however, generate roughly $10 billion a year in additional tax revenue. => 但是，经济活动每年提高400亿美元会产生大约100亿美元的额外税收收入。
Households win, too, because they get to buy more and nicer things with their incomes. => 企业也是赢家，因为商品和工人将能够使用改善的基础设施。
Companies win, because goods and workers get to use the improved infrastructure. => 失业者也是赢家，因为不少人将得到工作。

The unemployed win, because some of them get jobs. And even bond investors win, because they get their money back, with the interest for which they contracted. => 甚至债券投资者也是赢家，因为他们拿回了借出去的钱，而且还获得合同中规定的利息。
So what is not to like? => 有什么不好的地方吗？
Nothing. => 没有。
How, you might ask, can I say this? => 你也许会问，我为什么这样说？
But there are two things different about today. => 但今天的情况有两点不同。
First, the US labor market is failing so badly that expanded government spending carries no resource cost to society as a whole. => 首先，美国劳动力市场出现了大失灵，以至于扩张的政府支出不会给作为一个整体的社会带来资源成本。
Second, bond investors are being really stupid. => 其次，债券投资者在现实中是很愚蠢的。

In a world in which the S&P 500 has a 7% annual earnings yield, nobody should be happy holding a US government 30-year inflation-adjusted bond that yields 1% per year. => 如今，标普500指数可以产生7%的年收益，因此理应无人问津美国政府的30年经通胀调整的债券 — — 收益率只有每年1 % 。
That six-percentage-point difference in anticipated real yield is a measure of bond investors’ extraordinary and irrational panic. => 这6个百分点的预期真实收益率差额便是债券投资者不同寻常的非理性恐慌的写照。
They are willing to pay 6% per year for “safety.” => 他们愿意为“安全”付出每年6%的利息。
Right now, however, the US government can manufacture “safety” out of thin air merely by printing bonds. => 不过，眼下��国政府可以仅凭印债券创造“安全 ” 。
A French Presidential Primer => 法国总统引言
The late British Prime Minister Harold Wilson used to quip that “a week is a long time in politics.” => 前英国首相哈罗德·威尔逊曾经说过 ， “ 从政治角度讲一个星期称得上是漫长的时光 ” 。

So, in the 30 or so weeks between now and the next French presidential election, any prediction made today could be reversed, and reversed again, before the vote. => 因此，从现在开始到下一次法国总统大选到来之前的30多个星期里，今天所做的任何预测都有可能在投票前发生逆转、再发生逆转。

But two candidates have emerged as clear and constant favorites in opinion polls: Nicolas Sarkozy on the right and Ségolène Royal on the left. => 但民意调查中有两位候选人一直遥遥领先：他们是右翼候选人尼古拉·萨尔柯齐(Nicolas Sarkozy)和左翼人士赛格莱娜·罗亚尔（Ségolène Royal ） 。
In fact, they have more in common than meets the eye, for each speaks of a rupture with the past while incarnating a form of continuity. => 实际上，他们除了引人注目之外还有其他共同之处，那就是两个人都提出要与过去决裂，但同时要体现出某种形式的继承。
For Sarkozy, “rupture” reflects both mundanely tactical and deeply personal choices. => 对萨尔柯齐来讲 ， “ 决裂”既反映了世俗的技巧，也是深层次的个人选择。
The 12 years of Jacques Chirac‘s presidency, together with France’s tradition of alternation in power, suggests a victory for the left. => 雅克·希拉克（Jacques Chirac）12年执政，以及法国领导层变动的传统，都表明胜利属于左翼党派。
Positioning himself as the candidate who represents a sharp break with today’s unpopular politics is the only means to escape that fate. => 将自己定位成与今天不受欢迎的政治决裂的候选人是避免厄运的唯一出路。
This is reflected in Sarkozy’s openly pro-American stance – an act of political courage in a France where anti-Americanism is running high. => 这在萨尔柯齐公开的亲美立场中有所反映¾在今天反美主义甚嚣尘上的法国，采取这样的立场需要很大的政治勇气。

Sarkozy’s message is that Chirac and Villepin were right in substance to oppose America’s military adventure in Iraq, but that their style was disastrously wrong. => 萨尔柯齐的立场是希拉克和维尔潘反对美国军事入侵伊拉克在实质上并没有错，但在形式上却错得一塌糊涂。
Thus, his deep admiration for “American values,” while sincere, implies no embrace of President George W. Bush. => 因此，他对“美国价值观”的深层崇拜尽管是真心流露，但却不意味着乔治·W·布什总统的所作所为能得到赞同。

It also reassures the French business community, which was shocked by Dominique de Villepin’s flamboyant opposition to the United States when he was Chirac’s foreign minister. => 萨尔柯齐的立场还给法国企业界人士吃下了定心丸，这些企业家被多米尼克·德维尔潘担任希拉克外长时与美国的公然对抗吓出一身冷汗。

At home, Sarkozy has aimed his message particularly at the young, issuing a patriotic call to the values of work and discipline, a counter-revolutionary revolution. => 在内政方面，萨尔柯齐把重点放在了青年人身上，力求唤起他们的爱国热情，建立勤于工作和遵纪守法的价值观，这是一场反对革命的革命。
In the case of Royal, the meaning of “rupture” is both more obvious and more visible. => 在罗亚尔看来 ， “ 决裂”的含义更加明确和清晰。
She is seeking to become the first woman President of the French Republic. => 她试图成为法兰西共和国历史上首位女性总统。
To achieve her goal, she prefers to emphasize her “essence,” thereby countering Sarkozy’s stress on his record as a “doer.” => 为了达到这一目的，她更愿意强调自己的“本质 ” ， 并以此来对抗萨尔柯齐的所谓“实干家”履历。
Her appeal to voters is simple: “I am a woman, and you have never tried a woman, so be modern and try one now.” => 她吸引选民的口号非常简单 ： “ 我是个女人，你们从来没选过女总统，现在就应该跟上潮流，试试女总统的执政能力。 ”
Hiding behind the originality (in French presidential politics) of her gender, Royal has avoided specifying a detailed program. => 躲在其性别（在法国总统政治中）的原创性背后，罗亚尔一直闪烁其辞，不愿说明详细的施政计划。
Thus, Royal’s program is her popularity. => 于是，人气就成了罗亚尔的法宝。
In foreign policy, one can only guess what her priorities would be. => 我们只能猜想她在外交上将做出何种安排。
As far as Europe is concerned, she seems as “agnostic” as Sarkozy, who, like her, incarnates a new generation of “post-European” leaders. => 在欧洲问题上，她似乎和萨尔柯齐一样讳莫如深，而后者和她一样，是新一代“后欧洲”领袖人物的代表。
In terms of values, Royal, too, seems to represent a rupture with May 1968, with her emphasis on discipline and family. => 在价值观方面，罗亚尔似乎也提倡与1968年5月革命决裂，而她着重强调的是法纪和家庭。
According to public opinion polls, Royal is the clear favorite of the left and the only candidate able to defeat Sarkozy. => 民意测验的结果显示，罗亚尔显然受到左翼党派的青睐，是唯一有可能击败萨尔柯齐的候选人。
Her support is particularly strong among women voters. => 女性选民对她的支持尤为热烈。

According to Royal’s Socialist critics, the “Hollywoodization” of politics from which she benefits entails a new approach in which leaders follow and followers lead. => 在罗亚尔的社会党批评者看来，令她受益匪浅的政治“好莱坞化”带来一种崭新的局面：那就是领导人哗众取宠，而普通公众反倒成了主角。
But the same criticism can be directed at Sarkozy. => 但同样的批评也可以指向萨尔柯齐。

Moreover, both candidates embody continuity – with Chirac’s Gaullist side for Sarkozy and with François Mitterrand for Royal – as much as rupture. => 不仅如此，两位候选人都在与过去决裂的同时，体现了政策的延续性¾萨尔柯齐���承了希拉克和戴高乐的政策，而罗亚尔则接过了弗朗索瓦·密特朗(François Mitterrand) 的社会主义衣钵。

Royal openly claims Mitterand’s legacy as she searches for legitimacy, while Sarkozy’s rejection of Chirac’s legacy has more to do with form than substance. => 罗亚尔在确立合法地位时公开声称要继承密特朗的事业，而萨尔柯齐对希拉克证见的排斥形式要远远大于实质内容。
To a large extent, Sarkozy can be seen as Chirac with more, whereas Royal is clearly Mitterrand with less. => 在很大程度上萨尔柯齐比希拉克更有能力，而罗亚尔则显然比密特朗逊色许多。
As in 2002, the winner next year will be whomever the electorate dislikes or fears less. => 与2002年时一样，明年获胜的将是选民们不那么憎恶和害怕的候选者。
But one way or the other, personalities will prevail over programs. => 但无论是谁最终当选，有一点可以肯定，那就是个性因素将成为凌驾于政治见解之上的决定性力量。

But both Japan and China recognize that further tension will serve neither country’s long-term interests. => 但日本和中国都已意识到：双边关系进一步紧张化不符合任何一方的长期利益。

Meanwhile, doubts still surround the political and institutional machinery the EU will need to realize these and other ambitious goals. => 同时，在欧盟实现其宏伟目标所需要的政治与制度机器上仍然疑云笼罩。

We believe, though, that the increased use of qualified majority voting by member governments embodied in the new treaty should also be applied to the ratification process itself. => 但我们认为新公约所规定的、正被各成员国越来越多地使用的有效多数票（qualified majority voting）方式，也应该适用于公约的批准过程本身。

That way, if a small minority of EU governments prove unable to ratify the treaty, it would not be torpedoed the way that its predecessor, the Constitutional Treaty, was in 2005. => 如此一来，即便欧盟少数的成员国政府不能批准该公约，那么它也不会像其前身《宪法公约》在2005年时一样前功尽弃。
How to Help the African Dust Bowl => 如何帮助非洲尘暴区
SEATTLE – Picture a small farm under a blazing hot sky. => 西雅图 — — 想象一下炎热的天空下有一家小农场。

An intense drought is afflicting the surrounding region, prospects for the next harvest are bleak, and the financial system lacks the capacity to provide the loans farmers need to get by. => 严重的干旱影响着周围地区，下一次收成前景十分暗淡，而金融系统却不具备为农民提供应急贷款的能力。
This scenario describes today’s southern Africa, which is in the grips of an epic drought. => 这副景象描绘的是今天的南部非洲，这里正在遭受一场历史性干旱的侵袭。
As it happens, it also describes eastern Nebraska in the “Dust Bowl” years of the early 1930s – a period through which my own family lived. => 这碰巧也是内布拉斯加州东部二十世纪三十年代初“尘暴”天气的写照 — — 这是我和家人的亲身经历。
My father, Ralph Raikes, was the first in his family to graduate from college. => 我的父亲拉尔夫·莱克斯是家族大学毕业的第一人。

After working for Standard Oil in California, he stopped by his parents’ farm on his way to Cambridge, Massachusetts, where he planned to pursue graduate studies at MIT. => 毕业后，他先在加利福尼亚标准石油公司就职，而后在他父母的农场中途停留，打算之后前往马萨诸塞州剑桥市攻读麻省理工学院的研究生学位。
He never made it. => 他没能实现这个愿望。
He had to stay in Nebraska and help my grandfather save the family farm from the banks, which had already repossessed one-third of the land. => 他被迫留在了内布拉斯加，帮助我的祖父挽救家庭农场免于被银行收回，当时银行已经收回了三分之一的土地。
The most important change my father made was in his mindset: he came to think of the farm not as a subsistence operation, but as a family business. => 我父亲最重要的改变在于心态：他没有把农场视作维持生计的小本经营，而是视作家族生意。

He turned to the University of Nebraska, where he had received his undergraduate degree, and acquired hybrid corn and other improved seeds that the university was developing. => 他求助于自己本科毕业的内布拉斯加大学，从那里拿到了这所大学正在研发的杂交玉米和其他改良种子。
Then he tracked inputs and weather conditions, which was rarely done at that time. => 而后他严密监控投入的生产资料及天气条件，这在当时是非常罕见的。
My father realized that he couldn’t go it alone, and that he would need better access to financing. => 我父亲意识到他不能单打独斗，他需要好的渠道进行融资。

So he helped guide – first as a customer, and later as an adviser and director – Farm Credit, a national banking cooperative network, in its efforts to help local farmers weather the Dust Bowl years. => 因此他协助创建了农业信贷协会 — — 最初是以客户的身份，后来逐渐成为顾问和董事，这是一套国家银行合作网络，其目的是帮助当地农民度过尘暴天气。

He also helped found the Nebraska Farm Business Association, which aggregated the data that he and his peers collected, so that they could determine best practices. => 他还协助建立了内布拉斯加州农场业协会，该协会对他和同行搜集的数据进行汇总，以便确定最佳的行为惯例。
And he worked together with my mother, Alice, who ran the family poultry business. => 他与我的母亲爱丽丝一起工作，我母亲负责经营家族的禽类企业。

Farm Credit and the University of Nebraska’s labs and greenhouses emerged out of United States government programs that had been created to improve the agriculture sector’s performance. => 农业信贷协会和内布拉斯加大学实验室及温室源于美国政府计划，目的是改善农业领域的业绩。
That sector was under water in 1933; with one-quarter of the population living on farms at the time, more investment was needed. => 1933年农业境况低迷；当时有1/4的人口以务农为生，迫切需要加大对这一领域的投资。

That year, Congress passed the first “farm bill,” the Agricultural Adjustment Act, which boosted investment in the rural economy and helped lift farm income by 50% within two years. => 那一年，国会通过了首部“农业法案 ” — —即“农业调整法案 ” — —推动了对农村经济的投资，成功地在两年内将农民收入提高了50 % 。
Federal farm programs treated farming as a business enterprise, enabling businessmen like my father to prosper. => 联邦农业计划将农场视为一种商业企业，从而使我父亲这样的商人能够兴旺发达。
Eighty years later, African farmers need to make the same switch, by treating their subsistence operations as family-owned enterprises. => 八年后，非洲农民需要做出同样的转变，把维持生计的小本经营看成家族产业。
But, as a recent report from the Alliance for a Green Revolution in Africa (AGRA) makes clear, government investment must follow the science. => 但非洲绿色革命联盟（AGRA）最近的一份报告表明，政府投资必须遵循科学原则。
Those 13 countries have experienced marked improvements in agricultural production, per capita GDP, and nutrition. => 这十三个国家的农业生产、人均国内总产值和营养状况均得到显著的改善。

Government investment paves the way for private-sector investment, and it could be a game-changer for African farmers, who have operated at subsistence levels for far too long. => 政府投资为私营部门投资铺平了道路，对长期以来停留在维持生计低水平上的非洲农民来说，这可能彻底改变游戏规则。
Only about 6% of rural households in Sub-Saharan Africa receive loans from financial institutions. => 只有6%的撒哈拉以南非洲农村家庭可以从金融机构那里获得贷款。
African farmers growing new crop varieties are increasing their yields by only 28%, compared to 88% for farmers in Asia. => 非洲农民种植新作物品种单产仅增加28 % ， 而亚洲农民的增长比例则高达88%左右。
My parents made certain that all five of their children graduated from college. => 我的父母确保他们的每一个子女都读到大学毕业。

Like them, farmers everywhere want to ensure that their children lead healthy, prosperous lives; and they all recognize the importance of education. => 像他们一样，世界各地的农民都希望确保自己的孩子过上健康、富足的生活；而且他们都认识到教育的重要性。
The farmers I have met around the world often just want to sell enough extra produce to pay their health bills and put their children through school. => 我在世界各地碰到的农民往往只希望出售足够的多余农产品来支付自己的医疗费用和送子女上学。
They take advantage of opportunities when they arise, and they position their children to reap larger profits in the future. => 他们在机会出现时紧紧抓住，他们努力确保自己的孩子能在未来能够获取更大的利润。
One hopes that an American story of economic progress, like that of my family, will soon be an African story, too. => 我们希望像我家这样的美国经济进步故事将会很快发生在非洲。
With so many new innovations becoming available, Africa’s family farmers need their governments to invest in their future. => 随着诸多创新成果集中上市，非洲家庭农场主需要他们的政府为他们的未来投资。
If they do, that future will look much better than today’s dusty and desperate reality. => 如果政府做到这一点，未来将比今天尘土飞扬的绝望现实要好得多。
Africa at Risk => 身处危险中的非洲
ADDIS ABABA – Climate change will hit Africa – a continent that has contributed virtually nothing to bring it about – first and hardest. => 亚的斯亚贝巴 — — 气候变化最先、也最沉重地打击了非洲这块从未造成过气候变化的大陆。
Aside from Antarctica, Africa is the only continent that has not industrialized. => 除南极洲以外，非洲恐怕是唯一一块尚未实现工业化的大陆。
Indeed, since 1980’s the industrialization that had taken place in Africa has by and large been reversed. => 事实上，在20世纪80年代以后，非洲大陆的工业化进程就总体而言已经发生了逆转。
Africa has thus contributed nothing to the historical accumulation of greenhouse gases through carbon-based industrialization. => 非洲也因此没有在以碳为基础的工业化温室气体积累中扮演任何角色。
Moreover, its current contribution is also negligible, practically all of it coming from deforestation and degradation of forests and farmland. => 此外，非洲目前的碳排放也微乎其微，非洲所有的碳排放几乎全部来自森林砍伐以及森林和农田的逐步退化。

Yet climate change will hit Africa hardest, because it will cripple the continent’s vulnerable agricultural sector, on which 70% of the population depends. => 但气候变化对非洲的打击却最大，因为它严重影响到非洲大陆脆弱的农业部门，而农业部门养活了70%的非洲人口。

All estimates of the possible impact of global warming suggest that a large part of the continent will become drier, and that the continent as a whole will experience greater climatic variability. => 对全球变暖可能影响的所有预测都表明非洲大部分地区将会更加干旱，而从整体而言非洲大陆将出现更为剧烈的气候变化。
We know what the impact of periodic droughts have been on the lives of tens of millions of Africans. => 我们已经知道周期性干旱对数千万非洲民众生活所造成的影响。
We can therefore imagine what the impact of a drier climate on agriculture is likely to be. => 因此我们可以想见气候变干可能对农业造成的影响。
Conditions in this vital economic sector will become even more precarious than they currently are. => 与现有状况相比，这一生死攸关的经济领域的稳定性将会进一步下降。
Africa will not only be hit hardest, but it will be hit first. => 非洲遭受的打击不但最重，而且也最早。
Indeed, the long dreaded impact of climate change is already upon us. => 实际上，人们已经在遭受惧怕已久的气候变化的影响。
The current drought covering much of East Africa – far more severe than past droughts – has been directly associated with climate change. => 东非绝大部分地区都在发生旱灾 — — 这场旱灾与气候变化有着直接的关系，而且也比以往更加严重。
The upcoming climate negotiations ought to address the specific problems of Africa and similarly vulnerable poor parts of the world. => 即将开始的气候谈判应当针对非洲和同样脆弱的世界贫困地区所出现的具体情况。
Second, adequate resources should be made available to poor and vulnerable regions and countries to enable them to adapt to climate change. => 其次，应该为贫困和脆弱的国家和地区提供充足的资源，以便使它们能够适应气候的变化。

Climate change, which was largely brought about by the activities of developed countries, has made it difficult for poor and vulnerable countries to fight poverty. => 总体而言由发达国家活动所造成的气候变化已经加大了贫困和脆弱国家战胜贫困的难度，导致发展环境进一步恶化。
It has created a more hostile environment for development. No amount of money will undo the damage done. => 由此造成的损失无论花多少钱都无法弥补。
But adequate investment in mitigating the damage could partly resolve the problem. => 但投入充足的资金减轻损失或许能够部分解决问题。

Developed countries are thus morally obliged to pay partial compensation to poor and vulnerable countries and regions to cover part of the cost of the investments needed to adapt to climate change. => 因此，发达国家也有义务向贫困脆弱国家及地区支付部分弥补气候变化所需投资的相关赔偿。
Various estimates have been made of the scale of investment required by those countries. => 人们对上述国家所要求的投资规模做出了各种猜想。
A transitional financing arrangement would be put in place for the period 2010-2015. => 2010－2015年间将实行过渡性融资计划。
Some argue that developed countries cannot come up with such sums, particularly given their current economic challenges. => 有人提出特别是在当前的经济困境下，发达国家拿不出这么大的数目。

But no one has so far argued that the cost of damage caused to the development prospects of poor countries and regions is less than the amount of compensation being offered to cover adjustment costs. => 但迄今为止还没有人提出贫困国家和地区发展前景所遭受的损失达不到支付调整费用的补偿额。
The reason is obvious: the damage caused is many times higher than the compensation being requested. => 原因非常明显：所造成的损失数倍于所要求补偿的数额。
Nonetheless, it is argued, whatever the real cost of the damage, developed countries currently cannot afford to provide that kind of money. => 即便如此，仍有人提出无论损失的实际数额怎样，发达国家目前都无法支付这笔金额。

But we all know that these countries and their national banks were able to spend trillions of dollars in a few months to bail out their bankers, who earned super-profits when the going was good. => 可我们都知道这些国家和它们的央行有能力在数月之内耗费数万亿美元的巨资来救助它们在经济运行平稳时赚取了超额利润的银行。
When the good times ended, taxpayers and governments were prepared to rescue them and to ensure that they continued to receive their extraordinary bonuses. => 好日子结束时，纳税人和政府准备救援它们，确保它们继续得到额外的津贴。
Clearly this is not about the availability of resources. It is about the inappropriate priorities in how resources are allocated. => 显然问题的关键并不在于有没有相关的资源，而在于资源分配的顺序恰不恰当。

I cannot believe that people in developed counties, when informed about the issues, would support rescuing bankers and oppose partial compensation for poor countries and regions. => 我无法相信发达国家的民众在了解事实真相后，会支持援助银行而反对对贫困国家地区给予部分的补偿。
I cannot believe that they will let such an injustice occur. => 我无法相信他们会放任这种不公平的现象。
If they are not expressing their outrage over the injustice of it all, it can only be because they are inadequately informed. => 如果他们没有表达对这种不公平现象的愤怒，那只能是因为他们还不完全了解事实的真相。
Three Humanitarian Challenges for Africa in 2018 => 2018年非洲的三大人道主义挑战
NAIROBI – In mid-2017, when a cholera outbreak in Somalia threatened to overwhelm local hospitals, health experts feared the worst. => 内罗毕—2017年年中，索马里爆发了一场祸乱，几乎让当地医院完全瘫痪，卫生专家做好了最坏的打算。
Somalia’s experience gives me great hope for Africa’s future. => 索马里的经验让我们的非洲的未来有了很大希望。
But it also serves as a reminder that local capacity is easily inundated during times of crisis. => 但它也提醒我们，地方能力很容易被危机吞噬。
While some parts of Africa have become self-sufficient in terms of public health, others continue to lean heavily on global aid. => 尽管一些非洲国家在公共卫生方面已能自给自足，但其他国家仍严重依赖国际援助。
For these areas, partnership is the best means of minimizing risks. => 对于这些地区，合作是实现风险最小化的最好办法。
In particular, three key challenges this year are likely to pose the severest tests of Africa’s ability to manage humanitarian crises. => 特别是，今年有三项主要挑战有可能对非洲管理人道主义危机的能力进行最严厉的检验。
The first challenge is violence in the Democratic Republic of the Congo. => 第一项挑战是民主刚果的暴力。
The violence has exacerbated food insecurity, with more than three million people severely undernourished. => 暴力加剧了粮食安全问题，三百多万人严重营养不良。
Unfortunately, the Kasai crisis is expected to worsen in 2018. => 不幸的是，预计在2018年，开赛危机还将继续恶化。

The second challenge this year is Somalia’s food insecurity, which, according to the Famine Early Warning Systems Network, is expected to intensify this year. => 今年的第二项挑战是索马里粮食安全问题，据饥荒早期预警系统网络的数据，索马里粮食安全问题在今年将加剧。
Below-average rainfall in 2017 stunted harvests, and most regions have not fully recovered. => 2017年，低于平均水平的降水妨碍了收成，大部分地区尚未完全恢复。

As humanitarian aid is channeled to the country, efforts must be made to target long-term solutions, such as improving agricultural output, educational access, and economic opportunity. => 在人道主义援助不断流向索马里之际，必须制定长期方案，如改善农业产出、普及教育和经济机会。

Historically, most aid to the country has been earmarked for emergency relief; even the collective cholera response was narrowly focused on short-term health. => 从历史上看，流入索马里的大部分援助用来进行紧急纾困；即使是集体霍乱响应措施，也狭窄地集中关注短期健康。
But Somalia desperately needs a more holistic, long-term development strategy. => 但索马里急需更加全局性的长期发展战略。
Finally, the very scourge that Somalia contained last year will continue to rear its head elsewhere in the region. => 最后，去年被索马里克服的灾难，今年将在域内其他地方急需肆虐。

Yemen’s cholera outbreak is now the largest in history, having already surpassed one million confirmed cases, and, despite years of international assistance, the threat continues to stalk Africa. => 也门霍乱疫情已经达到历史最大规模，确诊病例已超过一百万例，而尽管有多年来国际援助的支持，非洲也仍然饱受霍乱的威胁。

The Global Task Force on Cholera Control, which seeks to build local and international support for improved health care and sanitation, has published a global roadmap for ending cholera by 2030. => 霍乱控制全球任务组（Global Task Force on Cholera Control）负责为医疗和卫生设施的改善寻找本地和国际支持，它已经发布了2030年消灭或乱全球路线图。
Although that is an ambitious target, it is achievable if international organizations and local governments work together. => 尽管这是一个宏大的目标，但只要国际组织和地方政府齐心协力，仍然是可以实现的。

Natural and manmade crises will continue to plague Africa, but organizations like mine are working hard to bring about a brighter future through improved capacity building. => 自然和人为危机将继续在非洲肆虐，但我所在的和其他组织正在努力通过改善能力构建为非洲打造更加光明的未来。

To succeed, however, local and international development partners must reorient their thinking; humanitarian aid alone will not solve Africa’s myriad challenges. => 但要想获得成功，本地和国际发展伙伴必须改变思维：光靠人道主义援助不足以解决非洲为数巨大的挑战。
While money is clearly needed, it must be spent more strategically to improve structural weaknesses that perpetuate instability. => 资金显然是必要的，但花钱必须更有策略性，以改善造成持续动荡的结构性弱点。

For example, if more funding were devoted to community-level health care projects, local organizations would be better positioned to lead when outbreaks threaten. => 比如，如果更多的资金能够用于社区层面的医疗项目，本地组织就能在疫情爆发时更好地起到领导作用。

Put simply, the international development community must do more to invest in grassroots solutions, empowering Africans rather than treating them as subcontractors to their own suffering. => 简言之，国际发展社会必须加大对草根方案的投入，为非洲人民赋权，而不是将他们视为解决自身困难的转包商。
Not only are local organizations better positioned to navigate complex cultural and linguistic landscapes; they also have more to lose if they fail. => 本地组织更适合应付复杂的文化和语言环境；但如果它们失败的话，代价也更大。
Last year was devastating for many Africans, as millions suffered from drought, hunger, and violence. => 去年对于许多非洲人来说是灾难性的一年，数百万人蒙受了干旱、饥饿和暴力。
But in Somalia, a coordinated response to a serious health threat offered new hope for a more secure future. => 但在索马里，面对严重卫生威胁的协调响应让人们感到能够构建更安全的未来的新希望。
Africa, Climate Change, and the G-8 Summit => 非洲、气候变化和八国峰会

British Prime Minister Tony Blair has declared that the two issues at the center of the G-8 Summit this July will be African poverty and global climate change. => 英国首相托尼·布莱尔已经宣布，今年七月举行的八国峰会的两大主要议题将是非洲贫困与全球气候变化。
These may seem to be distinct issues. In fact, they are linked. => 这两个话题也许看起来大相径庭，但事实上，它们却是相互关联的。
A trip I took to a village in the Tigre region in northern Ethiopia shows why. => 我去了埃塞俄比亚北部的Tigre地区的一个村庄，这趟旅行能解释其中缘由。
One morning, I was taken to a dry riverbed at the village’s edge. => 一天早晨，我被带到村庄边缘一个干涸的河床。
Farmers were digging a pit in the riverbed, down to the water table approximately two meters below ground level. => 农民们正在河床中挖一个深坑，一直挖到地面以下两米多的水管处。

They explained that until recently this was a perennial river – one that flows throughout the year – but now the river stops flowing during the dry season. => 他们解释说，这条河不久之前还是一条四季不枯竭、全年流淌不息的河，但是现在这条河一到旱季就断流。
Only when the annual rains begin in the summer does water reappear in the river bed. => 只有在每年夏天的降雨来临之时，河床里才会有河水。
Until then, water-starved communities dig for water, if they can find it and if they can afford to pump it out. => 就是从那个时候开始，只要能够找到水源并且有足够的钱把水抽出来，缺水地区就会挖坑寻水。
In northern Ethiopia, as in much of Africa, the rain cycle has changed markedly in recent years. => 和非洲其他诸多地区一样，北埃塞俄比亚最近几年的雨循环已经发生显著变化。

Ethiopian village life has long depended on two crops, one during a short rain in March and April, and the main crop during the long rain in the summer months. => 埃塞俄比亚内的村庄长期以来依赖于两种农作物。 一种农作物生长于三月和四月的短雨季，而主要农作物则在夏天的长雨季中生长。
In recent years, the short rains have failed entirely, and long rains have been erratic. => 最近几年，短雨季已经完全消失，而长雨季也变得不再稳定。
Hunger is omnipresent. => 饥荒正在蔓延。
Perhaps half of the children are severely underweight. => 或许已有一半的儿童体重严重不足。

Much of arid sub-Saharan Africa, notably in the Sahel (the region just south of the Sahara desert), has experienced a pronounced drop in rainfall over the past quarter-century. => 撒哈拉沙漠以南的大部分干旱地区，尤其是Sahel（该地区就在撒哈拉沙漠南面 ） ， 过去25年的降雨量已经明显下滑。

Failures of rainfall contribute not only to famines and chronic hunger, but also to the onset of violence when hungry people clash over scarce food and water. => 降雨量的不足不仅导致了连年饥荒，还引发了暴力活动，饥饿的人们为争夺稀少的食物和水源而冲突不断。
When violence erupts in water-starved regions such as Darfur, Sudan, political leaders tend to view the problems in narrow political terms. => 当缺水地区，诸如达尔富尔和苏丹，爆发暴力活动时，政治领导人从狭隘的政治角度来看待问题。
If they act at all, they mobilize peacekeepers, international sanctions, and humanitarian aid. => 一旦行动，他们就会动用和平维护者、国际制裁和人道主义援助。

But Darfur, like Tigre, needs a development strategy to fight hunger and drought even more than it needs peacekeepers. Soldiers cannot keep peace among desperately hungry people. => 但是，与Tigre一样，对达尔富尔来说，比起和平维护者来说，它更需要一个能够抵抗饥荒和干旱的发展策略。
One course of action must be to help impoverished African regions to “adapt” to climate change and to escape the poverty trap. => 该行动必须要有一个能帮助贫瘠的非洲地区“适应”气候变化并脱离贫穷陷阱的过程。
Poor countries cannot afford these technologies on their own. => 贫穷国家本身无力担负这些技术的费用。
Nor should they have to. => 这也不应该由他们来承担。
Greater help for these countries to escape from extreme poverty has been promised for decades but has not been delivered. => 数十年来，向这些国家提供更多使其脱离极度贫困的承诺一再出现，却从未兑现。

In addition to adapting to climate change, the world must also reduce future risks to the planet by cutting back on emissions of greenhouse gases, which are the source of man-made climate change. => 除了要适应气候变化，全世界也必须减少温室气体的排放以降低这个星球未来所面临的风险。 温室气体正是人为气候改变的罪魁祸首。
While adaptation to climate change is necessary – because it is already occurring – this is not enough. => 虽然对气候变化的适应是必需的 — — 因为它已经发生了 — — 但这还不够。
The famines in Ethiopia and the violence in Darfur suggest what can lie ahead. => 埃塞俄比亚的饥荒和达尔富尔的暴力活动已经预示着将会面临的情况。
The best way to reduce long-term climate change is to reduce carbon emissions. => 减缓长期气候变化趋势的最佳方法是减少碳化物的排放。 这至少有三个办法： 改用非碳能源，诸如太阳能和核能。
Most likely, all three of these methods will have to play a role. => 很有可能，这三种方法都必须发挥作用。

The effort to reduce greenhouse gases will require decades of action, but, given the long lead times in overhauling the world’s energy systems, we must start now. => 要减少温室气体还需要很多努力，但是，鉴于改革全球能源系统需要很长时间，我们必须现在就开始。
Rich countries need to lead the way. => 富国应当担当起领头羊的任务。

Moreover, countries like Ethiopia are making valiant, indeed remarkable, efforts to overcome their problems, despite the lack of adequate, and long-promised, help from the world’s richest countries. => 此外，像埃塞俄比亚这样的国家正在采取坚定有效的措施来克服他们的问题，尽管没有得到来自世界最富有国家承诺许久的任何适当帮助。
Africans suffering from hunger and drought, and indeed poor people everywhere, have a right to ask much more of the US and other rich countries. => 正在遭受着饥荒和旱灾的非洲人民，以及世界各地的贫困人们，都有权利来向美国和其他富国提出更多要求。
Tony Blair is right to call on his rich-country colleagues to follow through on their unfulfilled promises. => 托尼·布莱尔号召他的富国同僚们来履行完他们未尽责的承诺，他做对了。
Capitalizing on Africa’s Demographic Dividend => 利用非洲的人口红利
LOMÉ – Africa is home to the world’s youngest and fastest-growing population. => 洛美—非洲拥有全世界最年轻、增长最快的人口。
But it is far from inevitable that it will do so. => 但这绝非定局。

For African countries to capitalize on this demographic dividend, the future workforce must be educated, trained, and have adequate employment opportunities. => 非洲国家要想利用这一人口红利，未来劳动力就必须接受教育和训练，并拥有充足的就业机会。
Putting all the pieces in place will not be easy. => 同时满足这些条件绝非易事。
These are uncertain times for the global economy. => 现时代是全球经济的不确定时代。
But as this slowdown gets priced in by stock markets around the world, new drivers of growth will emerge. => 但随着这一减速体现在全世界股票市场中，新的增长引擎也将浮现。
Africa is well positioned to become one of them. => 非洲非常有望成为新引擎之一。
According to the World Bank, six of the world’s ten fastest-growing economies are in Africa. => 据世界银行数据，全球增长最快的十个经济体中有六个在非洲。

Intra-African trade might be the gateway to future local and global growth, with the continent’s burgeoning population forging new opportunities across borders. => 非洲内部贸易可能成为未来本地和全球增长的门户，其生机勃勃的人口将带来众多跨国机会。
Most significantly, Africa’s labor force is on the verge of a dramatic expansion. => 最重要的是，非洲劳动力即将迎来大爆发。
Today, 60% of Africans are younger than 25, and 41% are under the age of 15. => 今天，60%的非洲人不到25岁，41%不到15岁。
By 2050, Africa’s youth population is expected to reach 840 million. => 到2050年，非洲青年人口预计将达到8.4亿。
But this massive pool of potential talent is a double-edged sword. => 但这一巨大的未来人才库是一柄双刃剑。
Despite strong GDP growth over the last ten years, the majority of young people in Africa could not capture economic opportunities. => 尽管过去十年GDP增长强劲，但非洲大部分年轻人无法抓住经济机会。

Furthermore, the African Union/OECD report Africa’s Development Dynamics 2018 highlights that if the underemployment trend continues, Africa’s young people will suffer the most. => 此外，非盟/经合组织报告《非洲发展动态2018 》 （ Africa’s Development Dynamics 2018）强调，如果失业趋势继续，非洲年轻人将受到最大冲击。

Failing to employ Africa’s young people fully could marginalize an entire generation and lead them down a path of disruption for which we may not be prepared. => 不能充分雇用非洲年轻人可能会造成整整一代人被边缘化，把他们推向他们未必准备好的破坏之路。
For countries to experience job-led long-term growth, the provision of quality opportunities in agriculture is vital. => 对于意在通过就业刺激长期增长的国家，提供高质量农业机会至关重要。
If that does not happen, and quality jobs remain scarce, the economic expansion of which Africa is capable will not happen. => 若非如此，如果高质量就业仍然稀缺，非洲本有能力实现的经济扩张就不会发生。
In other words, African governments are facing a deadline to match job growth with skills training. => 换句话说，非洲政府面临匹配就业增长与技能训练的最后期限。
Unfortunately, at the moment, few countries are addressing this challenge effectively. => 不幸的是，目前很少有国家能够有效地面对这一挑战。
According to the African Development Bank, the unemployment rate for young people in Africa is already double the rate for adults. => 据非洲开发银行，非洲年轻人失业率已高达成年人的两倍。
In fact, young people are being let down even before they start looking for work. => 事实上，年轻人在开始找工作之前便已经被淘汰。

Too many primary schools suffer from crippling teacher shortages, for example, and gender discrimination prevents millions of girls from even attending high school. => 比如，太多小学师资力量严重短缺，而性别歧视又让数百万女童根本无法上学。
To overcome these shortcomings will require significant investments of political and financial capital. => 要克服这些缺陷，需要投入巨大的政治和金融资本。
Some leaders are moving in this direction. => 一些领导人正在朝这一方向努力。
On the sidelines of the PPF, the focus fell on African youth. => PPF会场之外，焦点集中在了非洲年轻人身上。

The AU-EU Youth Cooperation Hub, one of 119 projects selected to participate in the Forum, attended the meeting to discuss the AU-EU Youth Agenda. => 作为被选中参与PPF的119个项目之一，非盟-欧盟青年合作中心（AU-EU Youth Cooperation Hub）参会讨论了非盟-欧盟青年日程。

One approach to capitalizing on Africa’s demographic boom is to expand the availability of training initiatives that pair employers’ needs with African talent. => 利用非洲人口红利的一个方法是扩大训练项目普及度，让雇主的需求与非洲人才相匹配。

As a former fellow with the Ibrahim Leadership program, I can attest to the transformative power of top-tier educational schemes and their value as incubators for job-related skills. => 作为 易卜拉欣领导力（Ibrahim Leadership）项目前成员，我能够证明优秀的教育计划的转变力，以及作为就业相关技能孵化器的价值。

Africa’s success relies on its ability to harness its demographic dividend by equipping its youth with technological and innovative skills, which will be a catalyst for economic growth. => 非洲的成功取决于其用技术和创新技能武装年轻人，成为经济增长的催化剂，从而抓住人口红利的能力。

This includes training and agriculture-focused programs to absorb skills along the value chains that connect raw materials to industries and markets across Africa. => 这包括通过训练项目和以农业为中心的计划，沿着从整个非洲的原材料到产业和市场的价值链吸收技能。
By 2030, one in every five people on the planet will be African. => 到2030年，全世界五分之一的人口都将生活在非洲。
Because of its size alone, Africa’s labor force will have the potential to drive global growth for decades. => 光是这一人口规模就决定了非洲劳动力将有望成为全球几十年增长的引擎。
But to do so, Africans must implement the necessary reforms today. => 但要实现这一点，非洲人必须从现在开始进行不要的改革。
As our demographic dividend matures, governments, institutions, and organizations must help position young people for success. => 随着我们的人口红利逐渐成熟，政府、机构和组织必须帮助年轻人做好成功的准备。
If African countries can meet this challenge, prolonged economic growth – at home and abroad – will be the reward. => 如果非洲国家能够战胜这一挑战，长期经济增长可期 — — 不管是国内还是国外。
Africa’s Path from Poverty => 非洲脱贫之路
BEIJING – All low-income countries have the potential for dynamic economic growth. => 北京—所有低收入国家都有实现充满活力的经济增长的潜力。

We know this because we have seen it happen repeatedly: a poor, agrarian economy transforms itself into a middle- or even high-income urban economy in one or two generations. => 我们知道这一点，因为过去曾经一再发生这一幕：贫穷的农村经济在一两代人的时间里摇身一变成为中等收入甚至高收入城市经济。
The key is to capture the window of opportunity for industrialization arising from the relocation of light manufacturing from higher-income countries. => 关键是抓住高收入国家轻型制造业重新布局带来的工业化机会窗口。
That was true in the nineteenth and twentieth centuries, and it remains true today. => 在十九和二十世纪是如此，今天仍然是如此。

That shift then allowed other low-income Asian economies – South Korea, Taiwan, Hong Kong, Singapore, and to some extent Malaysia and Thailand – to follow in Japan's footsteps. => 接着，这一转变又让低收入亚洲经济体 — — 韩国、中国台湾、中国香港、新加坡以及某种程度上的马来西亚和泰国 — — 效仿了日本的榜样。
China, of course, is the region's most recent traveler along this well-trodden path. => 当然，中国是这条老路上的最新旅客。

After more than three decades of breakneck economic growth, it has transformed itself from one of the poorest countries on earth to the world's largest economy. => 在经历了三十多年的高速增长后，中国已经从世界最贫穷国家之一转变为世界最大经济体。

And now that China, too, is beginning to lose its comparative advantage in labor-intensive industries, other developing countries – especially in Africa – are set to take its place. => 而如今，中国也开始失去其在劳动密集型行业的比较优势，其他发展中国家 — — 特别是非洲国家 — — 即将取代中国的位置。
Indeed, ever since the Industrial Revolution, the rise of light manufacturing has driven a dramatic rise in national income. => 事实上，自工业革命以来，轻型制造业的崛起驱动了国民收入的大幅上升。
The United Kingdom's economic transformation started with textiles. => 英国经济转型从纺织业开始。
In Belgium, France, Sweden, Denmark, Italy, and Switzerland, light manufacturing led the way. => 比利时、法国、瑞典、丹麦、意大利和瑞士都是轻型制造业领路。
Similarly, in the United States, cities like Boston, Baltimore, and Philadelphia became centers for producing textiles, garments, and shoes. => 类似地，在美国，波士顿、巴尔的摩和费城等城市也都曾经是纺织品、服装和鞋子的生产中心。
Until recently, few believed that Africa, too, could become a center for modern manufacturing. => 知道最近，仍很少有人相信非洲也可以成为现代制造业的中心。
But, with the right policies, there is no reason why African countries could not follow a similar trajectory. => 但是，有正确的政策，没有理由认为非洲国家不可能走上同样的轨迹。
Consider land-locked Ethiopia, which only ten years ago seemed to be an especially bad bet. => 以内陆国家埃塞俄比亚为例。 十年前，它看起来仍然毫无前途。
But then the country built an industrial park near Addis Ababa and invited the Chinese shoemaker Huajian to open a factory there. => 但随后它在亚的斯亚贝巴附近建设了一个工业园，邀请中国制鞋商华建国际前去设厂。
Huajian opened its doors in January 2012 with two production lines and some 600 workers. => 华建国际在2012年开张，拥有两条生产线和600名左右的工人。
By the end of the year, it had employed 2,000 Ethiopians and doubled the country's exports of leather shoes. => 到当年年底，华建国际雇用了2,000名埃塞俄比亚人，让埃塞俄比亚皮鞋出口翻了一番。
Today, the company has 3,500 workers in Ethiopia producing more than two million shoes a year. => 如今，华建国际在埃塞俄比亚有3,500名工人，每年生产超过两百万双鞋。
In 2013, spurred by Huajian's success, the Ethiopian government created a new industrial park, with space for 22 factory units. => 2013年，受华建国际成功的鼓舞，埃塞俄比亚政府建造了一个可容纳22个工厂单位的新工业园。
Within three months, all of them had been leased by export-oriented companies from Turkey, Korea, Taiwan, China, and elsewhere. => 不出三个月，所有单位被来自土耳其、韩国、中国台湾、中国和其他地区的出口导向型公司租赁一空。
The World Bank has provided $250 million to support the continued construction of these industrial parks. => 世界银行提供了2.5亿美元支持工业园的继续建设。
The Ethiopian success story is just the start. => 埃塞俄比亚的成功故事只是个开始。
As investors learn more about Africa, they will increasingly see what it has to offer. => 随着投资者对非洲了解的深入，他们将日益看到非洲的计划。
Indeed, the cost of labor in Africa is competitive enough that Ethiopia could attract companies from countries as poor as Bangladesh. => 事实上，非洲劳动力成本优势非常大，埃塞俄比亚甚至可以吸引孟加拉国等穷国的公司。
Africa has a surplus of agricultural labor and too few other jobs. => 非洲农业劳动力过生，其他工作岗位又过少。
As foreign firms launch operations in the labor-intensive sectors in which Africa has a comparative advantage, they will train the local workforce. => 只要外国企业在非洲拥有比较优势的劳动密集型行业开展经营，就能训练本地劳动力。
Some workers will become managers. => 一些工人将变为管理者。
They will become familiar with the technology and learn how to maintain consistent quality in the production line. => 他们将熟悉技术，学习如何维持生产线的质量。
They will establish contacts with international buyers and investors. => 他们将与国际买家和投资者签订合同。
And, eventually, some of them will be able to raise capital and start firms of their own – export companies owned and operated by Africans. => 最终，他们中的一些人将能够筹集资本自己创业 — — 非洲人拥有和经营的出口公司。
Mauritius shows the path ahead. => 毛里求斯就是很好的例子。
In the 1970s, the government set up industrial parks to process textiles and garments for export. => 20世纪70年代，毛里求斯政府建设了工业园生产纺织品和服装以供出口。
At the time, most of the owners were from Taiwan or Hong Kong; today, more than 70% of the island's industrial companies are locally owned. => 当时，一些工厂的所有者来自中国台湾和中国香港；如今，毛里求斯70%以上的工业公司为本国所有。
A carefully focused export strategy is crucial. => 谨慎而集中的出口战略至关重要。

The international development community and many African governments want to work toward regional integration, linking the markets of 55 African countries. => 国际发展机构和许多非洲国家政府希望朝地区一体化方向努力，将55个非洲国家的市场联系起来。
This might have its advantages, but it should not be a priority. => 这也许会带来优势，但不适合作为当务之急。
Africa today accounts for just 1.9% of global GDP, compared to 21% for the United States and 23% for Europe. => 如今，非洲只占全球ＧＤＰ的１.９ ％ ， 而美国为21 % ， 欧洲为23 % 。

Developing countries must use their limited resources in the most effective way, and there is no question where the most attractive opportunities in Africa are to be found. => 发展中国家必须将有限的资源用在效率最高的地方，毫无疑问，非洲最诱人的机会还有待发现。
With the right growth strategy, far-reaching change can come within a person's lifetime – sometimes more than once. => 有了正确的增长战略，我们在有生之年就可以看到深远的变化 — — 甚至多次变化。
My native Taiwan is now a high-income economy. => 我的出生地台湾如今已是高收入经济体。
But when I was born there, in 1952, the island was poorer than almost every country in Africa. => 但在1952年我出生时，台湾岛比非洲几乎所有国家都要穷。
Then it happened to me again. => 后来我再一次经历了这一转变。
I moved to mainland China in 1979, when the country's per capita income was less than one-third of Sub-Saharan Africa's. => 1979年我来到中国大陆，当时，中国大陆人均收入只有撒哈拉以南非洲的不到三分之一。
Today, China has become an upper-middle-income country, and it is on track to become a high-income country by 2020. => 如今，中国已成为中高收入国家，并且极有可能在2020年步入高收入行列。
My hope is that I can witness a third economic transformation in my lifetime, this time in Ethiopia and other countries in Africa. => 我希望能在我的有生之年看到第三次经济转型 — — 在埃塞俄比亚和其他非洲国家。
If they stay on the tried and tested path of those who have gone before, there is every chance that I will. => 如果它们能够坚持其他国家已经尝试并考验过的道路，我的这一愿望实现的可能性相当大。
The Promise of Digital Health => 数字医疗的憧憬
BASEL – Africa has changed remarkably, and for the better, since I first worked as a young doctor in Angola some 20 years ago. => 巴塞尔—自20年前年轻的我在安哥拉行医以来，非洲已经发生了天翻地覆的变化 — — 越变越好。
But no change has been more obvious than the way the continent has adopted mobile technology. => 但变化最显著的地方还是非洲的移动技术。
The benefit of mobile technologies lies in access. => 移动技术的优势在于通道。

Barriers like geographical distance and low resources, which have long prevented billions of people from getting the care they need, are much easier to overcome in the digital age. => 地理距离和资源匮乏等障碍长期阻碍数十亿人获得他们所需要的看护，而在数字时代，这些障碍可以轻易克服。
And, indeed, there are countless ways in which technology can be deployed to improve health-care access and delivery. => 事实上，技术可以通过数不清的方式用于改善医疗普及和实现（access and delivery ） 。
Of course, this is not new information, and a growing number of technology-based health initiatives have taken shape in recent years. => 当然，这并非什么新消息，并且近几年来也取得了越来越多的基于技术的医疗创新。
But only a few have reached scale, and achieved long-term sustainability; the majority of projects have not made it past the pilot phase. => 但只有少数创新形成了规模并实现了长期可持续性；大部分项目尚未渡过实验阶段。
The result is a highly fragmented landscape of digital solutions – one that, in some cases, can add extra strain to existing health systems. => 结果是数字方案呈现出高度的碎片化特征 — — 在某些例子中，这给现有医疗体系带来了额外的约束。
The first step to addressing this problem is to identify which factors breed success – and which impede it. => 解决这一问题的第一步是并别那些因素能带来成功 — — 以及哪些因素阻碍成功。
Here, perhaps the most important observation relates to how the solution is linked to the reality on the ground. => 在这方面，最重要的观察与方案如何与现实联系起来有关。
After all, technology is an enabler for the innovation of health-care delivery, not an end in itself. => 毕竟，技术只是医疗实现的创新的促成因素，其本身绝非终点。
Solutions that focus on end-users, whether health practitioners or patients, have the best chance of succeeding. => 注重终端用户 — — 不管是医生还是患者 — — 的方案最有可能取得成功。

Fundamental to this approach is the recognition that what users need are not necessarily the most advanced technologies, but rather solutions that are easy to use and implement. => 这一方法的关键是认识到用户需要的东西未必是最先进的技术，而是便于使用和实施的方案。

In fact, seemingly outdated technologies like voice and text messages can be far more useful tools for the intended users than the latest apps or cutting-edge innovations in, say, nanotechnology. => 事实上，看似过时的技术，如语音和文字短信，可以成为对预期用户极为有用的工具，远比最新APP或（比如）纳米技术的尖端创新更有用。

Consider the Community-based Hypertension Improvement Project in Ghana, run by the Novartis Foundation, which I lead, and FHI 360. => 以加纳基于社区的高血压改善计划为例。 该计划由我所领导的诺华基金会（Novartis Foundation）和FHI 360负责运营。

The project supports patients in self-managing their condition through regular mobile medication reminders, as well as advice on necessary lifestyle changes. => 该计划支持患者通过定期移动医疗提醒功能，根据必要的生活方式改变建议进行自我管理。

This approach is successful because it is patient-centered and leverages information and communication technology (ICT) tools that are readily available and commonly used. => 这一方法取得成功的原因是它已患者为中心，并利用现成和常用的信息和通讯技术（ICT）工具。
In a country where mobile penetration exceeds 80% but only a few people have smartphones, such simple solutions can have the greatest impact. => 加纳的移动电话渗透率超过80 % ， 但只有少数人拥有智能手机，但如此简单的方案仍起到了最大的效果。
For health practitioners, digital solutions must be perceived as boosting efficiency, rather than adding to their already-heavy workload. => 对医疗工作者而言，数字方案必须让他们感到能够增加效率，而不是徒增已经十分沉重的工作负担。

Co-creating solutions with people experienced in delivering health care in low-resource settings can help to ensure that the solutions are adopted at scale. => 与富有在低资源条件下实现医疗服务的经验的人士合作制定方案有助于确保方案可以形成规模化实施。

The network connects frontline health workers with a simple phone call to consultation centers in referral hospitals several hours away, where doctors and specialists are available around-the-clock. => 该网络让一线卫生工作者一个电话就能接通数小时里程之外的转诊医院咨询中心，那里的医生和专家随时候命。
To realize the full potential of digital health, solutions need to be integrated into national health systems. => 为了充分实现数字医疗的潜力，解决方案必须与国家卫生系统相结合。
Only then can digital technology accelerate progress toward universal health coverage and address countries’ priority health needs. => 惟其如此，数字技术才能加快全民医疗覆盖和解决国家紧迫医疗需求的进程。
Collaboration across the health and ICT sectors, both public and private, is essential. => 医疗和ICT的合作 — — 包括私人和公共合作 — — 至关重要。
