Multidisciplinary partnerships driven by the sustained leadership of senior government officials must guide progress, beginning at the planning stage. => 必须通过高级政府官员的持续领导推动的多学科合作来指引进程，第一步是规划阶段。

Intra-governmental collaboration, dedicated financing for digital health solutions, and effective governance mechanisms will also be vital to successful strategies. => 致力于为数字卫生解决方案提供融资的政府间合作以及有效的治理机制也是成功战略的关键。
Digital technologies offer huge opportunities to improve the way health care is delivered. => 数字技术为我们提供了改善医疗实现方式的巨大的机会。
If we are to seize them, we must learn from past experience. => 要想把握这些机会，我们必须从过去的经验中汲取教训。

By remaining focused on the reality of end-users and on priority health needs, rather than being dazzled by the latest technology, we can fulfil the promise of digital health. => 通过专注于终端用户的现实和最重要的医疗需求，而不是迷失于最新技术，我们能够实现数字医疗的憧憬
Confronting Africa’s Water Challenge => 直面非洲的水资源挑战
ABIDJAN – Water is essential for life, and yet it is scarce in many parts of the world. => 阿比让 — — 水对生命而言必不可少，但世界许多地区都面临水资源稀缺。

Owing to the effects of climate change, Africa is experiencing its worst drought since 1945, especially in Southern Sudan, Somalia, Ethiopia, and Northern Nigeria. => 由于气候变化的影响，非洲正在经历1945年来最严重的干旱，尤其是在南苏丹、索马里、埃塞俄比亚和北尼日利亚等地区。
These fragile areas now need the global community’s support. => 上述脆弱地区现在需要国际社会的支持。

We need to build resilient systems to ensure access to potable water for all people, and to improve water-delivery and sanitation provisions in Africa’s rapidly growing urban areas. => 我们需要建设能确保为所有人提供饮用水的弹性系统，并在非洲快速发展的城市区域改善供水和卫生设施。
We should begin by expanding Africans’ capacity to harness wastewater. => 我们首先应当从提高非洲人利用废水的能力开始。
IUWM efforts require a significant initial investment, and come with steep capital and operational costs. => 综合性城市水资源管理模式需要大量的初期投资，之后的资金和运营成本同样是十分可观的。
Only a few African cities collect and treat any more than 20% of the wastewater generated through centralized wastewater-management systems. => 目前仅有少数几个非洲城市通过集中废水管理系统搜集并处理超过20%的废水。
The remaining 80% constitutes a huge untapped source of potentially valuable liquid and solid waste. => 其余80%具有潜在价值的大量液体和固体废物完全没有被加以利用。
With the right investment, foresight, and commitment, this underappreciated resource can create jobs and deliver sustainable growth. => 如果有恰当的投资、远见和承诺，上述被严重低估的资源可以创造就业并带来可持续增长。
Water will also play a key role in reaching the High 5s’ industrialization and sustainable-farming objectives. => 同时，水资源还将在实现High 5s工业化和可持续农业目标方面发挥关键的作用。

In Yaoundé, Cameroon, the AfDB helped to protect some 300,000 people and their property by reducing the frequency of floods from 15 incidents per year to just three. => 在喀麦隆首都雅温得，非洲开发银行通过将每年发生洪灾的频率从15次降低到仅仅3次来为 300,000民众及其财产提供保护。

And with a $40 million sanitation project, the AfDB helped to lower the proportion of the city’s malaria-afflicted population from 16% to 12%. => 而且非洲开发银行投资的一项4，000万美元的卫生项目协助将雅温得市疟疾感染的人口比例从16%降到12%左右。

All AfDB-supported wastewater-management systems follow sustainability strategies to ensure that they enhance economic gains, benefit local communities, and remain affordable. => 所有非洲开发银行支持的废水管理系统都遵循可持续发展原则，以确保能提高经济收益、惠及当地社会并让当地民众负担得起相应的费用。
These projects also help countries to harness and use waste flows, by converting sewage to biogas and fertilizer. => 这些项目还通过将污水转化为沼气和化肥来帮助相关国家利用废水和废物。

Meanwhile, the AfDB’s African Water Facility (AWF) complements its project-finance work by attracting downstream investments in water infrastructure. => 不仅如此，非洲开发银行的非洲水利设施（AWF）项目还通过吸引下游资金投向水利基础设施很好地补充了其项目融资工作。
In February, flooding and strong winds from Tropical Storm Dineo devastated the coast of Mozambique and had a severe impact on the local population. => 今年2月，热带风暴迪尼奥造成的洪水和飓风摧毁了莫桑比克海岸，严重影响了当地民众的生产生活。

But just a few weeks later, the AWF launched a feasibility study to improve livelihoods and climate-change resilience throughout Mozambique’s Inhambane Province, where the storm struck. => 但短短几星期后，非洲水利设施计划就启动了一项可行性调查，目的是改善遭受风暴袭击的莫桑比克伊尼扬巴内省适应气候变化的能力和民众生活。

In collaboration with the Global Water Partnership, the AWF is implementing IUWM systems in five African cities, including Kinshasa in the Democratic Republic of Congo and Marondera in Zimbabwe. => 非洲水利设施计划与全球水体合作伙伴组织一道，正在包括刚果民主共和国的金沙萨和津巴布韦马龙德拉在内的非洲五大城市推行综合性城市水资源管理项目。
In the DRC alone, IUWM systems can be expected to improve water delivery and sanitation for 17 million people by 2030. => 截止2030年，仅在刚果民主共和国一地，综合性城市水资源管理系统就可望帮助1，700万人改善供水和卫生设施。

The Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation is also tapping into the AfDB’s expertise, by providing an $18 million grant to fund Phase II of the AfDB’s Urban Sanitation Program. => 比尔和梅林达·盖茨基金同样在利用非洲开发银行的专业知识，通过提供1，800万美元的赠款来支持非洲开发银行第二阶段的城市卫生项目。
Africa’s wastewater-management challenges are substantial and complex. => 非洲面临的废水管理挑战巨大而又复杂。

But the AfDB is determined to provide opportunities that pay dividends for African communities – in public health, improved sanitation, economic development, and environmental protection. => 但非洲开发银行决心为非洲民众提供能够带来红利的机会，无论涉及到公共保健、卫生改善、经济发展还是环境保护。
Improving the quality of life for all Africans will require political commitment, public-private partnerships, and robust public involvement. => 改善所有非洲人的生活质量需要政治决心、公私合作以及积极的公众参与。
With the High 5s framework, the AfDB is working to bring these three ingredients together. => 在High 5s框架下，非洲开发银行正在努力将所有三项要素加以整合。

All stakeholders – in Africa and internationally – must redouble our efforts to ensure clean, affordable water for all, and to support African countries suffering through a historic drought. => 非洲和全球所有利益相关方必须加倍努力，确保为所有人提供洁净廉价的日常用水，并且为正在遭受着历史性旱灾的非洲国家提供援助。
We have a moral obligation to do so. => 这样做是我们的道义义务。
After all, water means life. => 毕竟，水和生命是联系在一起的。
Is Africa Still Rising? => 非洲仍在崛起吗？
WASHINGTON, DC – Between 2000 and 2014, Africa grew at a strong clip, fueling belief in the narrative of an “Africa rising.” => 华盛顿—从2000年到2014年，非洲实现了强劲增长，这带来了一种“非洲崛起”的信念。
Such skepticism is, to some extent, understandable. => 从某种程度上说，这样的怀疑不难理解。
Moreover, the continent's three largest economies – Angola, Nigeria, and South Africa – have experienced major declines in performance. => 此外，非洲的三个最大经济体 — — 安哥拉、尼日利亚和南非，表现都出现了大幅下滑。
Last year, Angola and South Africa’s economies stagnated, while the Nigerian economy actually contracted for the first time since 1991. => 去年，安哥拉和南非经济出现停滞，而尼日利亚出现了1991年以来的首次实际萎缩。
The latest projections suggest that these economies will experience tepid recoveries in the coming years. => 最新预测表明，这些经济体未来几年的复苏也将非常缓慢。
But Africa’s skeptics have overlooked a number of important factors. => 但非洲怀疑派忽视了许多重要因素。

For starters, when one sets the three largest economies aside, Sub-Saharan Africa’s aggregate-growth rate for this year rises from 2.5% to almost 4%. => 首先，如果你剔除掉三个最大的经济体，那么今年撒哈拉以南非洲总体增长率就能从2.5%增加到近4 % 。
That is faster than the 3.5% rate at which the global economy is currently growing. => 这一数字高于当前全球经济增长率3.5 % 。
In fact, five of the ten fastest-growing economies in the world are in Africa. => 事实上，全世界十个增长最快的经济体中，有五个来自非洲。

And over the next five years, around half of all Sub-Saharan economies will expand at an average rate similar to or higher than that which prevailed during the “Africa rising” heyday. => 而在未来五年中，大约一半的撒哈拉以南经济体将实现不亚于“非洲崛起”顶峰时期的平均增长率。
Furthermore, high commodity prices were just one factor in the region’s strong economic performance between 2000 and 2014. => 此外，高企的大宗商品价格只是2000—2014年间该地区经济表现强劲的一个因素。

Many African countries have made vast improvements to macroeconomic management, governance, and the business environment, and entrepreneurship is on the rise. => 许多非洲国家在宏观经济管理、治理和营商环境方面取得了巨大进步，企业家精神也在蓬勃发展。
Even with lower commodity prices, these developments will continue to bolster many African economies. => 即使大宗商品价格有所下跌，这些发展趋势仍能够支撑许多非洲经济体。
Today’s skepticism may reflect lasting memories from a darker period, and fears that Africa’s progress has not been sufficiently consolidated. => 今天的怀疑论也许体现了对黑暗时代的记忆，以及对非洲的进步没有得到充分巩固的担忧。

From the 1970s to the mid-1990s, dictators ruled in many African countries, and the institutions necessary for sustaining strong economic growth were fragile at best. => 从20世纪70年代到90年代中期，许多非洲国家由独裁者统治，维持强劲经济增长所需要的制度十分脆弱。
With civil wars constantly shredding the social fabric in many countries, the continent experienced decades of tepid economic growth. => 内战不断地摧残着许多国家的社会结构，几十年来，整个非洲经济增长十分缓慢。
By 2000, it had been reduced to what The Economist called “Hopeless Africa.” => 到2000年，非洲已经沦为《经济学人 》 （ The Economist）所谓的“没有希望的非洲 ” 。
But those days are gone. => 但这些都是老黄历了。
Policymakers across the continent have sustained the 1990s-era reforms that set the stage for the subsequent period of high growth. => 非洲决策者保持着20世纪90年代的改革，为后续高速增长打下了基础。

Although there is still much work to be done, the economic and business environment in many African countries has continued to improve, and institutions and governance have grown stronger. => 尽管还有很多工作有待完成，但许多非洲国家的经济和营商环境持续改善，制度和治理也变得更加强大。
ICTs have also unleashed a wave of innovation and entrepreneurship across the continent. => 信息和通讯技术还在非洲释放出一股创新和企业家精神的浪潮。
These positive trends are not likely to be reversed, and will continue to improve the economic conditions in Africa, even if commodity prices do not rebound. => 这些积极的趋势很难逆转，将继续改善非洲的经济环境，即使大宗商品价格无法反弹。
After all, the region’s economic growth averaged 5.6% between 2000 and 2004, before commodity prices had begun their rapid ascent. => 毕竟，2000—2004年间，大宗商品价格的迅速上涨尚未开始，非洲地区的平均增长率仍高达5.6 % 。
But that is not to say Africa will be spared from daunting challenges in the years ahead. => 但这并不是说非洲能够在未来多年里不必面临艰巨挑战。
Globally, the economic environment will become less favorable for African economies. => 放眼全球，经济环境对非洲经济体更加不利了。

In the major advanced economies, interest rates will soon rise, and the political backlash against globalization may force governments to abandon their past commitments to development assistance. => 在主要发达经济体，利率很快就会上升，而针对全球化的政治反对力量可能迫使政府放弃过去许下的发展援助承诺。

In light of all this uncertainty, African policymakers should look inward, by focusing on policies to mobilize national resources and finance their economic agendas. => 面临所有这些不确定性，非洲决策者应该向内看，专注于动员国家资源和经济日程融资政策。
Those agendas should include a number of key priorities. => 这些日程应该包括一系列关键性重点。

African countries need to diversify their economies to withstand future shocks better, while also accelerating the pace of industrialization across the continent. => 非洲国家需要实现经济多样化，以更好地抵御未来冲击，同时，整个非洲还需要加快工业化步伐。
Governments will have to find a way to create decent jobs for the 11 million people now entering the region’s labor force every year. => 政府必须找到办法为每年加入劳动力大军的1,100万非洲人创造体面的工作。
And they will need to enact policies to reduce poverty, and ensure that prosperity is shared across all cohorts of society. => 它们还需要采取措施减少贫困，确保繁荣被全体社会所共享。
These are particularly important goals for Angola, Nigeria, and South Africa. => 对安哥拉、尼日利亚和南非来说，这些目标尤其重要。

Angola and Nigeria need to become far less reliant on oil; and South Africa still needs to implement far-reaching reforms to address structural problems that have plagued it since the apartheid era. => 安哥拉和尼日利亚需要大幅降低对石油的依赖；南非仍然需要实施重大改革措施以解决自种族隔离时代以来困扰它的结构性问题。
Seeing these projects through will require competent political leaders who are committed to the principles of good governance. => 真心实意地推行这些工程需要有能力的领导人坚守好治理原则。
Failure could result in an extended period of low growth. => 失败可能导致长期低增长。
But even if Africa’s three largest economies do end up in the doldrums, it will not necessarily seal the fate of the “Africa rising” story. => 但即使非洲最大的三个经济体最终陷入萧条 ， “ 非洲崛起”的故事也未必可以全盘否定。
After all, “Africa rising” need not mean “all” of Africa. => 毕竟 ， “ 非洲崛起”不必是“全部”非洲的崛起。

From the 1960s to the 1990s, the “Asian Tigers” narrative referred only to Hong Kong, Singapore, South Korea, and Taiwan, excluding other developing countries in Asia, such as China. => 从20世纪60年代到90年代 ， “ 亚洲小龙”叙事也仅限于香港、新加坡、韩国和台湾，中国在内的其他亚洲发展中经济体都不在其列。

Similarly, African economies are increasingly differentiating themselves, and should thus be evaluated individually, on the merits of their respective economic policies. => 类似地，非洲各经济体本身之间的差异日益扩大，因此，应该根据各自的经济政策的利弊，对它们进行单独的评估。
Africa Still Rising => 非洲仍在冉冉升起
JOHANNESBURG – Is the honeymoon over for African economies? => 约翰内斯堡 — — 非洲经济体的蜜月期是否已经结束？

Less than a decade ago, it seemed that the continent’s economic dreams were beginning to come true, with many countries experiencing impressive GDP growth and development. => 不到十年前，随着许多国家取得惊人的GDP增长和发展，非洲大陆的经济之梦似乎正在变成现实。
Now, as the harsh reality of the continent’s vulnerability to challenging external conditions has set in, sustaining that growth has proved difficult. => 现在，随着非洲大陆在充满挑战的外部环境面前的脆弱性逐渐显现，现有的增长速度已经很难保持。
But a deeper look suggests that things may not be as bad as they seem, for two key reasons. => 但深层次观察表明局势也许不像看上去那样严重，得出这样的结论有两个主要原因。
First, though average growth has declined, some African economies have thrived in recent years. => 首先，虽然平均增速有所回落，但某些非洲国家在近年来实现了蓬勃发展。

That demographic trend could unlock future growth by advancing economic diversification, spurring domestic consumption, and supporting industrialization. => 这样一种人口趋势完全可能通过推进经济多样化、刺激国内消费和支持产业化来达到解锁未来经济增长的目的。
And many lower-growth countries could head down a similar path. => 而且许多低增长国家也可以走上类似的道路。
New research by the McKinsey Global Institute (MGI) shows that spending by Africa’s consumers and businesses already totals $4 trillion. => 麦肯锡全球研究院（MGI）最新研究成果 显示非洲消费者和企业的支出总额已经达到4万亿美元。
By 2025, private spending could reach $5.6 trillion – $2.1 trillion by households, and $3.5 trillion by businesses. => 截止2025年，私人开支可能达到5.6万亿美元 — — 其中2.1万亿美元来自家庭部门，而其余3.5万亿美元则来自企业。
This represents a huge opportunity for Africa���s manufacturers. => 这为非洲制造企业创造了巨大的机会。

We believe that Africa can almost double its manufacturing output, to nearly $1 trillion, by 2025, with about 75% of that growth tied to production for local markets. => 我们认为截止2025年非洲几乎可以实现制造业产出翻番，而相关增长中75%与当地市场生产密切相关。
The question is whether manufacturers will manage to exploit the growth potential that lies in front of them. => 问题在于制造企业能否充分利用摆在他们面前的增长潜力。
African firms have not yet proved capable of meeting existing domestic demand. => 非洲企业尚未用事实证明自己具备满足现有国内需求的能力。
Africa even imports 15% of the cement it uses, despite having abundant raw materials to make it at home. => 甚至连非洲所用水泥的15%都要依靠进口，尽管非洲拥有充足的原材料可以实现国内生产。
To be sure, African business has made great strides in recent years. => 可以肯定，非洲企业在近年来取得了长足的进步。
Today, 400 African companies have annual revenue of more than $1 billion, and 700 have annual revenue of more than $500 million. => 今天，四百家非洲企业实现年收入超过10亿美元，另外还有七百家年收入超过5亿。
On the whole, these large companies are growing faster – and generating higher profits – than their global peers. => 总体而言，与世界其他国家的同行相比，这些大企业正在快速成长 — — 取得的利润也越来越可观。
But there is still a long way to go. => 但距离实现目标还有很长的路要走。
Large African (excluding South African) firms’ average annual revenue of $2 billion is half that of large firms in Brazil, India, Mexico, and Russia. => 大型非洲企业（除南非外）20亿美元的平均年收入仅为巴西、印度、墨西哥和俄罗斯等国的一半。
And Africa only has about 60% of the large firms it needs to put it at the same level as the emerging economies. => 而非洲还要增设40%的大型企业才能与其他新兴经济体等量齐观。

One key factor limiting firms’ growth is the fragmented nature of the African market, which currently comprises mostly small economies with only limited economic and political linkages. => 限制企业增长的一个关键因素是非洲市场四分五裂，现有的非洲市场主要由经济和政治联系有限的小型经济体构成。
There are eight partly overlapping regional trade zones, none of which includes more than half of Africa’s countries. => 目前部分区域重叠的区域贸易区共有8个，却没有一个囊括了超过一半的非洲国家。
Only Egypt, Morocco, Nigeria, and South Africa rank in the top 100 of MGI’s Global Connectedness Index. => 只有埃及、摩洛哥、尼日利亚和南非在麦肯锡全球研究院的全球联通指数中跻身前100位。
Beyond excessive trade barriers, Africa suffers from inadequate transport links and limits on the free movement of people. => 除贸易壁垒高企外，人员自由流动和交通联系匮乏同样困扰着非洲。
Africans need visas to travel to more than half the countries on their own continent. => 非洲人前往自己大陆的一半以上国家还需要签证。
The recent launch of the African Union passport is a step in the right direction – but it is only one step. => 近期推出的非洲联盟护照是朝正确方向迈出的一步 — — 但也仅仅是一步而已。

A more integrated market would not only enable African companies to create the economies of scale they need to compete; it would also be far more appealing to institutional investors. => 加强市场融合不仅将为非洲企业创造出竞争所需的规模经济；还可以在很大程度上吸引机构投资者。
Building such a market must therefore be a top priority for African leaders, as they seek to unleash the continent’s economic potential. => 建设这样的市场因此必须成为非洲领导人的首要任务，这样才能释放非洲大陆的经济潜能。
Equally important, Africa’s leaders must work to improve the business environment. => 非洲领导人必须努力改善营商环境，这一点同样重要。
Though some progress has been made on this front in the last two decades, non-tariff barriers remain high. => 尽管过去二十年来这方面已经取得了一定进步，但非关税壁垒依然很高。
Indeed, regulatory issues are still cited as a serious deterrent to investment. => 事实上，监管问题依然严重制约着投资。

Many African businesses – nearly half of companies in Nigeria, and more than one-third in Angola and Egypt – highlight unreliable electricity supplies as a major challenge. => 许多非洲企业 — — 尼日利亚企业的将近一半、安哥拉和埃及的超过1/3 — — 强调电力供应不可靠对他们构成严重挑战。
And almost 40% of firms surveyed by the World Bank lament the constraints imposed by competition from informal firms. => 接受世界银行调查企业中近40%对非正规企业竞争带来的限制深表遗憾 。
Some of these issues could be addressed relatively quickly. => 其中某些问题解决起来速度较快。
Consider the strides Rwanda has made since 2007, when it established a development board to improve its business environment. => 比如从2007年设立发展委员会改善营商环境以来卢旺达已经取得了很大进展。
As a result, Rwanda’s global ranking for the ease of doing business jumped from 143 in 2008 to 32 in 2014. => 结果导致卢旺达的全球营商环境排名从2008年的第143位跃升至2014年的第32位。
This success can surely be replicated elsewhere in Africa. => 非洲其他国家无疑也可以复制这样的成功。
With the right policies, a relentless focus on execution, and a great deal of determination, Africa can still rise. => 只要政策对路、执行到位、决心不动摇，非洲仍然有崛起的机会。
Africa’s Arrival => 非洲发展的时刻到了
NEW YORK – The African Development Bank (AfDB) has just published its African Economic Outlook for 2018. => 纽约 — — 非洲开发银行刚刚发布了其2018年非洲经济展望报告。
Africa’s rise has been a long time coming. => 人们一直在等待非洲的崛起。
In the 1960s, hopes were high. => 世纪60年代，外界抱有很高的希望。

The remarkable leaders of the independence generation – such as Ghana’s Kwame Nkrumah and Kenya’s Jomo Kenyatta – received advice from the world’s top economists. => 独立一代的杰出领袖 — — 包括加纳的克瓦米·恩克鲁玛和肯尼亚的乔莫·肯雅塔 — — 得到了世界顶级经济学家的顾问服务。
The Caribbean-born Nobel laureate Arthur Lewis became Nkrumah’s Chief Economic Adviser. => 加勒比出生的诺贝尔奖得主阿瑟·刘易斯曾担任恩克鲁玛的首席经济顾问。

In India, we read about these leaders’ friendship with our own post-independence prime minister, Jawaharlal Nehru, and the hope for a new dawn for all emerging economies. => 在印度，我们读懂了这些领导人与我们自己的后独立期总理尼赫鲁的友谊，也看到了所有新兴经济体新的曙光。
And many emerging economies did indeed take off. => 而许多新兴经济体也确实走上了腾飞之路。
In the late 1960s, some East Asian economies surged ahead. => 20世纪60年代末，一些东亚国家快速发展。
Beginning in the early 1980s, China began its decades-long rise. => 20世纪80年代初开始，中国也踏上了长达十年的崛起之路。
And, from the early 1990s, India’s economy also began to grow robustly, with annual rates reaching the 9% range by 2005. => 而从20世纪90年代早期，印度经济也开始强劲增长，2005年的年增长率高达9 % 。
But Africa remained stagnant, mired in poverty. => 但非洲仍停滞不前，深陷于贫困当中。

Ironically, it was the continent’s resource wealth that hampered economic progress, as it fueled conflicts among governments and insurgents eager to control it. => 颇具讽刺意味的是，这块大陆的资源财富因为引发了政府和急于控制这些财富的武装分子之间的冲突而阻碍了经济进步。
The resulting political instability attracted outsiders keen to exploit governments’ weakness. => 由此造成的政局动荡吸引了热衷于利用政府弱点的外来者。
Finally, at the turn of the twenty-first century, things began to change for Africa. => 最终，在21世纪之交，非洲的局面开始发生变化。
A few dynamic leaders, democratic stirrings, and emerging regional cooperation led to a decline in poverty and a pickup in growth. => 一些有活力的领导人、活跃的民主事件和新兴的地区合作导致贫困下降、经济增长率上升。
Commodity exporters faced a setback around 2014, when prices plummeted. => 大宗商品出口国在2014年前后因为价格大幅下挫而经历了某些挫折。

But this turned out to be a blessing in disguise, because it forced countries to diversify their economies and increase production – factors that supported renewed growth. => 但这却逐渐演变成一件变相的好事，因为这迫使各国增加产量并实现经济多元化 — — 而这些因素又支撑了新的增长。
According to the AfDB report, Africa’s 54 economies grew by 2.2% in 2016, on average, and 3.6% in 2017. => 非洲开发银行报告显示，非洲54个经济体2016年平均增长2.2 % ， 2017年则增长3.6 % 。
And these figures are not wishful thinking: in 2016, Ethiopia’s GDP grew by 7.6%. => 这些数字并不是一厢情愿的痴心妄想：2016年，埃塞俄比亚的GDP增长7.6 % 。
Of course, serious challenges remain. => 当然，非洲仍然面临严峻的挑战。
South Africa, the continent’s strongest economy, is now facing the difficult task of tackling its deep-rooted corruption. => 这块大陆最强劲的经济体南非现在正面临着解决根深蒂固的腐败的艰巨任务。
More broadly, many African countries need to find ways to create more employment – and fast. => 更广义的看，许多非洲国家需要想方设法快速创造更多就业。
The share of the working-age population is rising faster in Africa than in any other region. => 非洲劳动年龄人口比例的上升比其他任何地区都快。
This “demographic dividend” has immense potential. => 这一“人口红利”可能带来巨大的潜能。
But if job creation stalls, the unemployed or under-employed are likely to become frustrated – a recipe for conflict. => 但如果就业创造停滞不前，失业或就业不足者很有可能会感到沮丧 — — 并进而造成冲突。
Consider the case of Tanzania. => 以坦桑尼亚为例。
Thanks to President John Magufuli’s effort to mobilize more domestic revenue to support increased development spending, the economy is doing well. => 多亏约翰·马古夫里总统努力调动更多国内收入来支持追加发展开支，该国经济目前表现良好。
The same is true of Ethiopia. => 埃塞俄比亚的情况也是一样。

In the last couple of decades, the country has made great strides in export-led growth, supported by a growing industrial sector and large investments from China. => 过去几十年，在工业持续增长和来自中国的巨额投资的支持下，该国的出口拉动型增长已经取得了长足的进步。
Now, it is poised to take over as the economic powerhouse of East Africa. => 现在，埃塞俄比亚已经注定成为东非的经济强国。

Yet the urban youth unemployment rate stands at 23.3%. Left unchecked, this situation could easily end up fueling ethnic conflict and political turmoil. => 但城市青年失业率维持在23.3 % ： 如果不加以控制，这种情况很可能导致种族冲突和政治动荡。

Another, related challenge concerns resource mobilization: countries need funds to invest in infrastructure, human capital, and the creation of trade and digital links within and beyond Africa. => 另一个相关挑战涉及资源调配：各国需要资金投资于非洲内外的基础设施、人力资源以及贸易和数字联系的创造。

The AfDB report estimates that, for infrastructure investment alone, the continent needs some $170 billion per year, which is $100 billion more than is currently available. => 非洲开发银行报告预计仅基础设施投资一项，非洲大陆每年就需要约1，700亿美元，这比现有资金高出一千亿之多。
As it stands, Africa receives a total of about $60 billion in foreign direct investment each year. => 目前，非洲每年能获得总共约600亿美元的外国直接投资援助。
To close the gap, African governments must attract more money. => 非洲政府必须吸引更多资金来弥补这一差距。
The challenges are daunting, to say the least. => 至少可以说，挑战是艰巨的。
But there are lessons that African countries can learn from one another. => 但非洲国家可以相互吸取经验。
For example, Ghana’s smooth transfer of power after the December 2016 election set a positive democratic example. => 例如，加纳在2016年12月选举后权力顺利移交树立了民主制度的积极榜样。
Nigeria’s Lagos State and Tanzania have done a good job of mobilizing internal resources for development. => 尼日利亚的拉各斯州和坦桑尼亚在调动内部资源谋求发展方面做的非常不错。

Add to that the emergence of an indigenous intelligentsia in the region, exemplified by organizations like the AfDB, and it seems that Africa’s moment may have arrived at last. => 加之像非洲开发银行等机构所代表的地区本土知识阶层的崛起，目前的情况似乎是非洲的发展机会可能最终到来了。
Africa’s Schooling Without Learning => 非洲的校内失教问题

He swore not only to do away with admissions fees, but also to provide free textbooks and meals, the cost of which had often remained a barrier for the poorest students. => 他不仅宣誓要免除学费，还提供免费的教科书和膳食 — — 这两者过往总会成为阻止那些最贫困学生入学的障碍。
Even in 2014, only 37% of the nation’s students were enrolled in secondary school, owing to high fees. => 即使是在2014年，在高昂的收费下全国只有37％的学生入读中学。
The president’s move is thus an inspiring example that Ghana’s neighbors should follow. => 而总统的这一举动则是诸邻国应当仿效的一个鼓舞人心的榜样。
Unfortunately, despite progressive reforms like these, students across Africa still face other steep barriers to a truly comprehensive education. => 不幸的是，尽管实施了这些渐进式改革，非洲的学生们在实现真正全面教育方面依然面临这其他严重阻碍。
In Ghana, for example, poor and rural children are unlikely to reap the full benefits of their new access to secondary education. => 就算在加纳，贫穷和农村的孩子依然难以从新的中学教育政策中得益。
The situation is arguably worse elsewhere on the continent. => 非洲大陆其他地区的情况可能更糟。
The issue is not only lack of access to schools, but also lack of good schools. => 问题不仅在于无法进入学校就读，也在于缺乏好学校。
In Sub-Saharan Africa, it is estimated that 88% of children and teenagers will enter adulthood without basic literacy. => 在撒哈拉以南非洲地区，有88％的儿童和青少年在不具备基本识字能力的情况下就进入成年阶段。
This constitutes a moral and development crisis that demands immediate action. => 这就构成了一个需要立即采取行动应对的道德和发展危机。
The World Bank, which similarly raised the issue of “schooling without learning” in a new report, has corroborated my view. => 世界银行在其新发布的一份报告中同样提出了“来到学校却未能接受教育”的问题，同样证实了我的看法。
We cannot expect students to learn from poorly educated, poorly paid teachers. => 我们不能指望那些从受过良好教育，薪酬微薄的老师那里学到什么东西。

We must also invest more in resources for schools and learning across the board, from scholarships for poor students to new libraries and classroom equipment. => 我们还必须投入更多的资源 — — 包括从贫困学生奖学金到新的图书馆和教室设备 — — 来全方位地提升学校和学习状况。

With so many African governments already failing to provide equal, high-quality access to education for their citizens, this is not a challenge that they can take on alone. => 由于很多非洲国家政府都无力为公民提供平等而高质量的受教育渠道，所以这不是一个它们能去独立承担的挑战。
Fortunately, with the launch of the UNESCO report, several partners have already stepped up. => 幸运的是，随着联合国教科文组织报告的面世，几个合作伙伴已经站了出来。

French President Emmanuel Macron is perhaps the most prominent of those who have promised to make investment in education in Africa a high priority. => 而法国总统埃马纽埃尔·马克龙（Emmanuel Macron）也许是承诺将非洲教育投资作为优先选项的国家元首中最为突出的一位。

As the UN’s main educational and cultural organization, UNESCO itself will play a key role in promoting initiatives to bring free, high-quality schooling to students across the continent. => 作为联合国的主要教育和文化组织，教科文组织本身将在推动为非洲大陆学生提供免费，高质量的学校教育方面发挥关键作用。

And whoever takes over UNESCO, following the election of a new director-general next month, will have a make-or-break opportunity to craft the right agenda to meet this challenge. => 在下个月选举上台执掌教科文组织的新任总干事也将有机会制定正确的议程来应对这一挑战。

Currently, the organization is mired in a financial crisis and internecine disputes, and it will need a leader who has the vision to solve both internal and external problems. => 当前该组织陷入了财政困局和内部纠纷之中，它需要一位具有眼光去解决内部和外部问题的领导者。

Notably, France’s candidate, former Minister of Culture and Communication Audrey Azoulay, has put both UNESCO’s internal crisis and education at the top of her agenda. => 值得注意的是，法国的候选人，前文化交流部长奥黛丽·安祖拉（Audrey Azoulay）将教科文组织的内部危机和教育置于其议程的首位。

She has singled out the financial crisis as the biggest threat facing UNESCO and has stressed the need for greater dialogue with members in arrears, like the United States. => 她将财政困局列为教科文组织面临的最大威胁，并强调需要与美国等拖欠会费的成员国进行更多的对话。

In her previous governmental roles, Azoulay helped launch a global plan for cultural diversity through books and introduced plans to protect cultural heritage in conflict zones. => 在其以前担任的政府角色中，安祖拉协助发起了一项通过书籍宣传全球文化多样性计划并提出了保护冲突地区文化遗产的计划。

Azoulay also has called for UNESCO to treat education as a catalyst for development and gender equality, and as the best way to help combat the “radicalization of the mind.” => 她还呼吁教科文组织将教育作为促进发展和性别平等的催化剂，也是协助打击“思想激进化”的最佳途径。

If elected, she has promised to put Sustainable Development Goal 4 – universal quality education – at the heart of UNESCO’s mission, with a special focus on Africa. => 她承诺如果当选的话会将可持续发展目标4 — — 普适性的高质量教育 — — 作为教科文组织的核心使命，并会特别关注非洲。

The preamble to the Constitution of UNESCO declares, “Since wars begin in the minds of men, it is in the minds of men that the defenses of peace must be constructed.” => 《联合国教科文组织宪章》序言部分指出 ： “ 由于战争发端于人们的心灵，所以应当在人们心中建立起对和平的捍卫。
Unfortunately, in Africa, we know all too well what happens when efforts to construct the defenses of peace ultimately fail. => ”不幸的是，在非洲我们都知道在构建捍卫和平的努力最终失败后会产生什么后果。

Islamist insurgents continue to pose a threat to Mali, where in 2013, they set fire to a library holding thousands of priceless historical manuscripts in the ancient cultural center of Timbuktu. => 伊斯兰武装分子持续对马里施加威胁，在2013年他们就在纵火烧毁了位于廷巴克图古带文化中心区的一座藏有数千部无价历史手稿的图书馆。

The incident was not only a devastating blow to world heritage; it was also a reminder of Africa’s history as a center for cultural exchange, literacy, and learning, and a call to action. => 这一事件不仅是对世界文化遗产的一个沉重打击啊；也提醒了人们非洲曾是一个文化交流，文学和教育的中心，且亟待行动去拯救。
The stakes for Africa are high. => 非洲承受的风险极高。

Our children are threatened not only by lack of access to schools, but also by lack of opportunities to learn, and by the loss of irreplaceable fragments of their rich history. => 我们的孩子不仅受到无力入学的威胁，还缺乏学习的机会, 更失去了自身丰富历史中不可替代的部分。
Africa’s Year of Opportunity => 非洲的机遇之年
GENEVA – We are still near the start of 2018, and already it feels like tension and disorder will be the year’s defining characteristics. => 日内瓦 — — 我们刚刚进入2018年年初，就已经感受到紧张和混乱将成为这一年的决定性特点。

From anti-immigration policies in the United States to flaring geopolitical hotspots in the Middle East and East Asia, disruption, upheaval, and uncertainty seem to be the order of the day. => 从美国的反移民政策到中东和东亚引人瞩目的地缘政治热点，破坏、动荡和不确定性似乎在当下司空见惯。
But at least one metric offers reason for cautious optimism: economic growth. => 但至少一个指标让我们有理由保持谨慎乐观：那就是经济发展。
The International Monetary Fund estimates that global growth will reach 3.7% this year, up from 3.6% in 2017. => 国际货币基金组织估计今年的全球经济增长将达到3.7 % ， 高于2017年的3.6 % 。
It was fitting that Lagarde made that observation in Addis Ababa, because it is in Africa where the rays of prosperity are shining brightest. => 拉加德在亚的斯亚贝巴得出这样的结论是正常的，因为繁荣之光在非洲闪耀得最为亮眼。
In fact, I predict that 2018 will be a breakout year for many – though not all – African economies, owing to gains in eight key areas. => 事实上，因为八个关键领域的增长，我预测2018年将成为许多 — — 虽然并不是全部 — — 非洲经济体的突破之年。
For starters, Africa is poised for a modest, if fragmented, growth recovery. => 首先，即使断断续续，非洲也即将实现缓慢的经济复苏。
Following three years of weak economic performance, overall growth is expected to accelerate to 3.5% this year, from 2.9% in 2017. => 在经历三年经济表现疲弱的考验后，总体增长预计将从2017年的2.9%加速至今年的3.5 % 。
This year’s projected gains will come amid improved global conditions, increased oil output, and the easing of drought conditions in the east and south. => 今年的预期增长主要来自于全球环境改善、石油产量增加以及东南部非洲地区旱灾的缓解。
To be sure, growth will be uneven. => 可以肯定，增长并不平衡。
While nearly a third of African economies will grow by around 5%, slowdowns are likely in at least a dozen others. => 虽然近1/3的非洲经济体将实现约5%的增长，但还有十多个非洲国家的经济增长可能放缓。
Sharp increases in public debt, which has reached 50% of GDP in nearly half of Sub-Saharan countries, are particularly worrying. => 近半数撒哈拉以南非洲国家公共债务激增至GDP的50 % ， 这种状况特别令人焦虑。
But, overall, Africa is positioned for a positive year. => 但总体而言，非洲将迎来积极的一年。
Second, Africa’s political landscape is liberalizing. => 第二，非洲的政治格局正在实现自由化。

Some of Africa’s longest-serving presidents – including Zimbabwe’s Robert Mugabe, Angola’s José Eduardo dos Santos, and the Gambia’s Yahya Jammeh – exited in 2017. => 某些非洲任期最长的总统于2017年退位 — — 包括津巴布韦的罗伯特·穆加贝、安哥拉的何塞·爱德华多·多斯桑托斯和冈比亚的叶海亚·贾梅。
In South Africa, Jacob Zuma’s resignation allowed Cyril Ramaphosa to become president. => 在南非，雅各布·祖马的辞职让西里尔·拉马福萨成为总统。

In January, Liberians witnessed their country’s first peaceful transfer of power since 1944, when former soccer star George Weah was sworn into office. => 1月，利比亚民众目睹了自1944年以来第一次权力的和平转移，前足球明星乔治·维阿宣誓就职总统。
All of these gains will be tested, however, as voters in 18 countries go to the polls this year. => 随着今年有18个国家的选民参与投票，所有这一切进步都将经受考验。

Adding to Africa’s story of divergence will be continued political fragility in a number of states, including the Central African Republic, Burundi, Nigeria, South Sudan, and Somalia. => 不少非洲国家继续处于政治脆弱状态将进一步扩大非洲的差异，包括中非共和国、布隆迪、尼日利亚、南苏丹和索马里。

A third source of optimism is Africa’s agricultural sector, where the potential of smallholder farmers, the majority of whom are women, is finally being realized. => 第三个乐观来源是非洲的农业产业，那里的小农潜力终于得以实现，其中绝大部分是妇女。
African agricultural output is forecast to reach $1 trillion by 2030. => 非洲农业产量预计到2030年将达1万亿美元。
This maturation could not have come at a more opportune time; roughly two-thirds of Africans depend on agriculture to make ends meet. => 这样的成熟期恰恰出现在最恰当的时机；约2/3的非洲民众依靠农业来维持生计。

Large tracts of uncultivated land, a youthful workforce, and the emergence of tech-savvy “agropreneurs” – agricultural entrepreneurs – are lifting production and transforming entire economies. => 大片未开垦的土地、年轻劳动力和技术精湛的“农业企业家 ” （ agropreneurs）的出现正在提升产量并改革整个经济体。
Fourth, Africans are benefiting from technological disruption. => 第四，非洲民众正在从技术破坏中受益。
With more than 995 million mobile subscribers, Africa’s increasing connectivity is being used to power innovation. => 非洲手机用户已超过9.95亿，不断发展的信息互联正在实现加速创新的目的。
Key sectors like farming, health, education, banking, and insurance are already being transformed, greatly enhancing the region’s business landscape. => 农业、医疗、教育、银行和保险等关键部门已经开始转型，这极大地改善了该地区的商业格局。
And with the G20 and the OECD working to stop tax avoidance, Africa may soon benefit from global efforts to end shady accounting. => 随着20国集团和经合组织竭尽全力打击逃税，非洲可能很快就会从全球打击会计黑幕的工作中受益。
Sixth, Africa’s energy sector is set to thrive. => 第六，非洲的能源行业注定会蓬勃发展。

While 621 million Africans still lack reliable access to electricity, innovations like renewables, mini-grids, and smart metering are bringing power to more people than ever before. => 虽然6.21亿非洲人仍然缺乏可靠的电力供应，但可再生能源、微型电网和智能电表等创新正在使越来越多的人享受到能源的便利。
In South Africa, renewable energy has taken off; the price of wind power is now competitive with coal. => 在南非，可再生能源事业已经起飞；风电价格现在已经与煤电价格具有同等的竞争力。
Ethiopia, Kenya, Morocco, and Rwanda are also attracting large investments in renewable energy. => 埃塞俄比亚、肯尼亚、摩洛哥和卢旺达也吸引了大量可再生能源投资。
A seventh area showing signs of progress is education. => 显示出进步迹象的第七个领域是教育。

To be sure, Africa’s educational offerings remain dismal; more than 30 million children in Sub-Saharan Africa are not in school, and those who do attend are not learning as much as they could. => 可以肯定，非洲的教育产品水平仍然很低；撒哈拉以南非洲地区高达3，000万儿童失学，即使那些上学的儿童也没有学到足够多的知识。

But many African leaders and publics have recognized these deficiencies; in some countries, such as Ghana, education has even become a deciding issue for voters. => 但许多非洲领袖和民众已经认识到上述缺陷；在以加纳为代表的某些国家，教育甚至已经成为选民投票的决定性问题。
As the Education Commission highlights, some countries are boosting investments in education. => 正如教育委员会所强调的那样，某些国家正在加大对教育领域的投资。
This represents an opportunity to align learning outcomes with future employment needs. => 这创造了一个使学习成果与未来就业需求相协调的机遇。
But with over a billion young people living in Africa by 2050, greater investment in education is urgently needed. => 但因为到2050年将有超过10亿年轻人生活在非洲，因此迫切需要加大对教育领域的投资。
Finally, greater attention is being paid to developing a pan-African identity, and African fashions, films, and foods are expanding to new markets. => 最后，人们越来越重视打造泛非身份，而非洲时装、电影和食品正在向新市场进军。
As these cultural connections grow, Africa’s soft power will continue to rise and extend far beyond the continent. => 随着文化联系的不断发展，非洲的软实力将继续增加并强势辐射非洲大陆以外地区。
In many corners of the world, 2018 is shaping up to be yet another disappointing year, as inequality and poverty continue to fuel anger and populism. => 在世界许多角落，2018年正逐渐成为令人失望的一年，因为不平等和贫困继续助长愤怒和民粹主义。
Africa will not be entirely immune from such developments. => 非洲将不会在这样的事态发展面前完全免疫。
Nonetheless, the continent’s inhabitants have at least eight good reasons – far more than most people elsewhere – to be optimistic. => 但尽管如此，非洲大陆居民至少有八个充分的理由保持乐观，其他地方的绝大多数人都没有这样的运气。
Resetting the Africa-Europe Relationship => 重置非洲-欧洲关系

“Words won’t convince migrants to stay at home,” European Parliament President Antonio Tajani said. “We must give them a chance to have a decent life.” => “光靠说无法让移民留在家里 ， ” 欧洲议会主席塔雅尼（Antonio Tajani）说 ， “ 我们比给他们过上体面生活的机会。
Tajani is right. => 塔雅尼是对的。
Unfortunately, his approach is not. => 不幸的是，他的方针是错的。

For almost 60 years, well-meaning foreign governments, many of them European, have poured huge sums of money into Africa, with little to show for it. => 近60年来，初衷良好的外国政府 — — 其中许多来自欧洲 — — 向非洲投入了巨额资金，但收效甚微。

Lasting solutions to Africa’s development challenges require funding, to be sure, but they also demand a significant recalibration in relations with foreign partners. => 非洲发展挑战的持续解决方案当然需要资金，但也需要对与外国合作伙伴的关系做出重要调整。
And Africa’s relationship with Europe may require the biggest overhaul of all. => 其中非洲与欧洲的关系最需要调整。
The problem goes much deeper than money; one might even say it’s philosophical. => 问题比金钱深刻得多；甚至有人会说这是个哲学问题。
Africa and Europe have a very old relationship, marked by complexity and pain. => 非洲和欧洲的关系由来已久，充满了复杂性和阵痛。

Europe imposed its system of governance, values, and more recently, approaches to trade, long claiming that Africans need to be trained, to modernize, and to emphasize “capacity building.” => 欧洲将它的治理体系、价值观，后来又将它的贸易方针强加给非洲，一直说非洲人需要训练，需要现代化，需要强调“能力建设 ” 。
This patronizing partnership has run its course, and it is crucial that we change the dynamic. => 这一庇护式的合作关系早已不合时宜，改变这一动态至关重要。
Meetings like the fifth African Union-European Union summit, which wrapped up last week in Abidjan, Côte d’Ivoire, are a good start. => 第五次非盟-欧盟峰会于上周在科特迪瓦的阿比让落下帷幕。 类似的会议是很好的起点。
The meeting, which focused on “investing in youth,” put a spotlight on the complex links between the sides. => 在这次非盟-欧盟峰会上 ， “ 投资于年轻人”成为焦点主题，也让人们看到了双方的复杂联系。
One conclusion was clear: the EU’s current answer to addressing migration from Africa is outdated. => 一个清晰的结论是：欧盟当前的非洲移民问题解决方案已经过时了。
If Europe’s strategy to solve its migration challenges relies on money alone, it will fail. => 如果欧洲用来解决移民挑战的战略完全依赖金钱，那是注定要失败的。
We are a long way from the lopsided dynamic that defined African-European relations during the colonial era. => 殖民地时代的倾斜的非欧关系早已一去不复返了。
Today, Europe may need Africa more than Africa needs Europe, especially if one considers human capital. => 如今，欧洲需要非洲甚于非洲需要欧洲，特别是在人力资本方面。
Over the next 15 years, some 440 million Africans will enter the job market, compared to 72 million in Europe. => 在未来十五年中，有4.4亿非洲人将进入劳动力市场，而欧洲只有7,200万人。
Africa’s job seekers will need work, and Europe will have it. => 非洲的求职者需要工作，而欧洲有工作。
An aging population is already putting a squeeze on Europe’s growth, and vacancies are forecast to multiply amid a shrinking labor pool. => 老龄化的人口已经开始影响欧洲的增长，而随着劳动力人数的下降，岗位空缺预计将成倍增长。
There is even a strong possibility that, in the long run, it will be African young people who pay for the care of European pensioners. => 甚至很有可能，从长期看，欧洲退休者的看护需要非洲年轻人来买单。
These demographic differences underscore the potential benefits of rethinking economic and political relations. => 这些人口差异意味着重新思考经济和政治关系具有很大的潜在收益。
Without migration, the redistributive policies on which European welfare states depend will be unable to withstand the current rate of aging. => 如果没有移民，欧洲福利国家所依赖的再分配政策将无法面对当前的老龄化率。

Migration policies that emphasize mobility are essential to support European industries, household consumption and, ultimately, the financing of social benefits. => 强调流动性的移民政策是支持欧洲工业、家庭消费以及最终的社会福利融资的关键。

Of the 375,000 students from the continent who study abroad each year, many will establish businesses and find their own place in a globalized economy upon graduation. => 每年有375,000非洲学生出国留学，其中很多人毕业后将会创业并在全球化的经济中找到一席之地。

There is already growing competition in the US, Canada, China, the Middle East, and Africa itself to attract these highly educated and mobile students. => 美国、加拿大、中国、中东以及非洲本身都已经开始日益激烈地争夺这些受过良好教育的高流动性学生。
Just as sixteenth-century Europe needed African gold, twenty-first-century Europe cannot do without the African diaspora. => 正如十六世纪的欧洲需要非洲的黄金，没有非洲侨民，二十一世纪的欧洲将步履维艰。

Which other world region can offer similar market potential for European industries faced with declining demand and or subdued growth in both their domestic and traditional export markets? => 除了非洲，世界上还有哪个地区能够为饱受需求下降和/或国内和传统出口市场增长纷纷放缓之苦的欧洲国家提供类似的市场潜力？

That is why it is more important than ever that Europe not engage in an administrative bean-counting exercise, in which other economies will always appear stronger. => 因此，对欧洲来说，欧洲切不可陷入政治算计，在这方面它争不过其他经济体。

Instead, the EU should commit to mutually beneficial employment schemes that maximize the strengths of people and cultures on both continents, notably through skills transfer. => 相反，欧洲应该致力于互惠共赢的就业机制，从而实现两大洲人员和文化优势最大化，最主要的就是要通过技能转移实现。
Europe’s recognition of its need for Africa is a necessary paradigm shift, leading, one hopes, to reasoned collaboration. => 欧洲承认其对非洲的需要是必不可少的范式转变，我们希望，这能够带来理性的合作。
In an increasingly uncertain world, Africa and Europe can set the foundations for a smarter partnership by changing the basis of their cooperation. => 在一个日益不确定的世界中，非洲和欧洲能够通过改变合作基础，为更加明智的伙伴关系奠定基础。
Failure to do so will be costly. => 如果无法实现这一点，代价将相当高昂。
But most of that cost will be borne by Europe. => 但大部分代价都会由欧洲来承担。
With alternative partners already courting their talent, it is not Africa that will be hurt the most by the missed opportunity. => 其他合作伙伴早已开始追逐人才，失去机会影响最大的并不是非洲。
Gender Equity for Africa’s Scientists => 非洲科学家的性别平等
KIGALI – A girl in Ethiopia could grow up to engineer a new method for improving agricultural yields, if only she could meet the right mentor. => 基加利 — — 一位埃塞俄比亚女孩只要能找到合适的导师，长大就可以设计出提高农作物产量的新方法。
A young woman in Malawi has ideas for new cancer treatments, but will never apply them if she is pushed out of school. => 一位马拉维青年女性有治疗癌症的新想法，但如果被迫离校将永远无法付诸实施。

And a girl in Rwanda has all the skills to create a mathematical model to mitigate droughts; all she needs is a research grant to help her pay for college. => 而一位卢旺达女孩掌握了创造数学模型缓解干旱的所有技能; 她需要的仅仅是一笔研究捐款来帮助她上大学。
There is a global gender imbalance in science, technology, engineering, and mathematics – the so-called STEM disciplines. => 在科学、技术、工程和数学领域都存在着全球性别失衡现象 — — 这就是所谓的STEM法则。
But in Africa, this imbalance is doing more than threatening individual futures. => 但在非洲，不仅是个人未来正受到这种失衡的威胁。
It is also depriving the continent of talents and contributions needed to drive development and progress. => 它还剥夺了推动这块大陆发展和进步所需的人才和贡献。
A 2011 African Development Bank report finds that “getting women into science and technology ultimately promises to benefit society as a whole.” => 2011年一份非洲开发银行的报告显示“让女性参与科学和技术最终有利于整个社会。 ”
Gender equity in STEM is achievable, and many African scholars are showing the world how to do it. => 科学、技术、工程和数学领域的性别平等可以实现，许多非洲学者正在向世界展示他们如何以身作则。
But they need help, and programs that offer scholarships and support are among the best ways to achieve parity in the sciences. => 但他们需要帮助，而提供奖学金和支持的相关计划是实现科学平等的最佳方式。

The causes of Africa’s STEM gender imbalance are often compared to a leaky pipe: girls start out with interest and aptitude, but drop out of the disciplines at various points in their education. => 非洲在科学、技术、工程和数学领域失衡的原因往往被比作一根漏水的水管：女孩开始时充满了兴趣和天赋，但却在教育的各个阶段被迫退学。

Early data from a Mastercard Foundation initiative aimed at reversing these trends show that a comprehensive approach to plugging the leaks can make a difference. => 来自万事达基金会旨在扭转上述趋势行动的早期数据表明全面采取措施来堵住漏洞能够使整个局面得到改观。
Success begins with acknowledging that gender equity in STEM matters. => 承认科学、技术、工程和数学领域存在的性别平等问题是成功的开始。
“Science needs us” is how Armanda Kouassi, an industrial engineer and former Mastercard Foundation scholar, puts it. => “科学需要我们”是前万事达基金会学者兼工业工程师阿曼达·库瓦希的言辞。
“With different ideas and perspectives come better solutions and thinking that can move scientific innovations forward and benefit the whole of Africa.” => “不同的理念和视角可以带来更好方案和思维，从而推动科学创新向前发展并惠及整个非洲。 ”
Kouassi is right. => 库瓦希说的完全正确。
Africa cannot afford to squander its young, female talent. => 非洲承受不起浪费年轻女性人才的损失。
Sub-Saharan Africa faces a shortfall of some 2.5 million engineers, technologists, mathematicians, and scientists. => 撒哈拉以南非洲面临高达250万名工程师、技术人员、数学家和科学家的短缺。

This dearth of expertise threatens a number of Sustainable Development Goals, such as food security, health care, clean water and sanitation, energy, and infrastructure. => 这种专业知识的缺乏可能威胁几项可持续发展目标的实现，例如粮食安全、医疗卫生、清洁饮水、卫生设备以及能源和基础设施。
Removing gender barriers to STEM requires African governments to make equity in the sciences a priority. => 消除科学、技术、工程和数学领域的性别障碍需要非洲政府优先关注科学平等问题。

Nowhere is this happening more successfully than in Rwanda, where our collective experience has helped more than 1,250 girls and young women excel in STEM disciplines. => 在这方面卢旺达做得最为成功，我们的集体经验已经帮助超过1，250名女孩儿和青年女性在上述学科领域取得优异的成绩。
The African Institute for Mathematical Sciences (AIMS), in Rwanda’s capital, Kigali, is one of these agents of change. => 位于卢旺达首都基加利的非洲数学科学研究所是这场变革的推动力量之一。

The school believes that the next Einstein could be an African woman, an educational approach that informs its comprehensive strategy to plug leaks in the STEM development pipeline. => 该校认为下一个爱因斯坦可能是一位非洲女性，这种教育方法反映了其堵住科学、技术、工程和数学领域发展渠道漏洞的全方位战略。

To attract more female students, 30% of the school’s scholarships are reserved for female applicants, and the school aspires to reach 50% in the near future. => 为吸引更多女性学生，该校将30%的奖学金预留给女性申请者，而学校希望这一比例能在不久的将来达到50 % 。

Similarly, Carnegie Mellon University Africa (CMU-Africa), also in Kigali, is championing change by allocating 30% of its scholarships to young women. => 同样设在基加利的非洲卡内基梅隆大学（CMU-Africa）正在通过将30%的奖学金分配给年轻女性来推动变革的发生。

These commitments will have a positive effect on the entire institution, as CMU-Africa seeks to increase dramatically enrollment of female scientists. => 上述举措将对整个教育体制产生积极的影响，因为非洲卡内基梅隆大学正在积极采取措施大幅提高女性科学人才的入学率。

Finally, the Forum for African Women Educationalists (FAWE) in Rwanda has funded the education of 1,200 girls enrolled at the country’s top-performing secondary schools specializing in STEM subjects. => 最后，卢旺达非洲女性教育人士论坛（FAWE）已经资助了在该国优秀高中学习科学、技术、工程和数学等学科领域的1，200名女性学生接受教育。
Of these students, an estimated 70% are expected to study science at the university level. => 在这些学生中，估计有70%有望考上大学学习理科专业。
Despite these positive developments, quotas alone will not achieve parity. => 尽管事态出现了这些积极的进展，但单纯依靠配额仍无法达到平等的目的。
To make lasting gains, opportunities outside the classroom are also needed. => 需要课堂以外的机会才能获得持久的收益。
FAWE Rwanda also works with teachers to develop gender-responsive pedagogical methods. => 卢旺达非洲女性教育人士论坛还与教师合作开发以性别特点为基础的教学方式。
Inequalities faced by girls and young women in African education cannot be erased overnight. => 非洲女孩和年轻女性在教育领域所面临的不平等不可能一夜间消除。

As Rebecca, a Mastercard Foundation scholar from Uganda, remembers, “When I was at my school, the boys used to call us ‘half-men,’ because if you’re a lady and you go for sciences, you’re a half-man.” => 正如乌干达万事达基金会学者丽贝卡所回忆的那样 ， “ 我在校期间，男生曾经称我们为‘假小子 ’ ， 因为如果你是一名女生而且学习理工科，你就是假小子。
But, Rebecca adds, “It was cool being a science student.” => ”但丽贝卡补充道 ， “ 学习理科是一件很酷的事。 ”
Africa needs more women who share Rebecca’s enthusiasm for STEM. => 非洲需要更多像丽贝卡一样热爱科学、技术、工程和数学学科的女性。

To ensure that science remains appealing to girls, schools, governments, and industries must cooperate to educate teachers and mentors, and allocate funding to close the gender gap. => 为确保科学对女性的吸引力，学校、政府及各行各业都必须齐心协力教育教师和辅导员，同时拨款弥补性别差距。
As professionals working to improve African education, we couldn’t agree more. => ”作为竭尽全力改善非洲教育的专业人士，她的观点我完全同意。
Liberal Democracy in Africa Can Wait => 非洲自由民主可以等
YAOUNDÉ – Africa’s policymakers understand that strong economic and political leadership is essential to growth and stability. => 雅温得—非洲决策者明白，强大的经济和政治领导是增长和稳定的关键。
For years, African economies have fared better than expected, owing to a commitment to improving governance. => 多年来，非洲经济表现一直好于预期，这便是致力于改善治理的结果。
The question now is how to sustain the momentum. => 现在的问题是如何保持这一势头。
Current strategies do not provide an adequate answer. => 当前的战略没有提供充分的答案。

Although leaders at a recent African Economic Conference in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, committed to keeping governance reforms at the top of Africa’s agenda, they offered no blueprint. => 在最近的埃塞俄比亚亚的斯亚贝巴非洲经济会议上，领导人承诺继续将治理改革列为非洲日程的重中之重，但他们并没有给出路线图。
Development practitioners have long debated which model offers the best framework for reform. => 长期以来，发展实践家一直在争论那种模式是最好的改革框架。

Put simply, “governance” refers to a dynamic framework of rules, structures, and processes that help a government manage its economic, political, and administrative affairs. => 简言之 ， “ 治理”指的是一个动态规则、结构和过程框架，以帮助政府管理经济、政治和行政事务。
But which principles a government focuses on varies by approach. => 但对于政府应该注重哪些原则，不同的方法有不同的看法。

The model championed by the West places a premium on human rights and democracy, while the one advocated by China is more concerned with political stability and economic growth. => 西方所领衔的模式优先关注人权和民主，而中国所主推的模式更关注政治稳定和经济增长。
The rationale is that the Beijing Model is better for Africa in the short and medium term. => 原因在于北京模式在短期和中期对非洲更有利。
And, while it might not be popular to admit, Trump has a point. => 尽管承认这一点未必讨好，但特朗普不无道理。
Simply put, food, shelter, health, and good sanitation are more relevant for most Africans than the right to vote. => 简言之，粮食、住所、健康和良好的卫生设施对于大部分非洲人来说要比投票权更加重要。
Moreover, only a moderately wealthy population, with a healthy middle class, can adequately demand the rights that democracy provides. => 此外，只有当人口比较富裕，并形成了一个健康的中产阶级时，才能充分地要求民主所提供的权利。
Paradoxically, the fastest way to build a strong middle class in Africa would be to move toward the hierarchy of principles that China’s model promotes. => 讽刺的是，在非洲构建强大中产阶级的最佳方式便是在各个层面采取中国模式所推行的原则。

For Africa to reorient its governance approach, and embrace a post-Washington Consensus, its leaders must commit to improving institutional effectiveness and economic management. => 对非洲来说，调整治理方针、接受后华盛顿共识需要其领导人致力于改善机构效率和经济管理。
The first set of reforms would involve establishing clear lines of sovereignty with international partners. => 第一组改革应该包括与国际合作伙伴划定明确的主权边界。
Africa’s relationship with Western donors, for example, has historically placed individual rights over national rights. => 比如，非洲与西方捐助国的关系，在历史上将个体权利置于国家权利之上。
But in my view, individual rights should not supersede sovereign ones. => 但在我看来，个体权利不应该超越主权权利。
Punishing entire countries for laws that affect a minority is counterproductive. => 因为影响少数人的法律而惩罚整个国家效果会适得其反。
As a Ugandan government spokesman said at the time, the bank “should not blackmail its members” to adopt Western values. => 当时，乌干达政府发言人表示，世界银行“不应该绑架其成员”接受西方价值观。
Yet, when governance models are judged solely through the lens of the Washington Consensus, there is very little alternative. => 但是，当治理模式完全以华盛顿共识的标准来评判时，就几乎别无选择。
Along the same lines, the second set of reforms pertains to prioritizing economic rights over political rights. => 同时，第二组改革优先考虑经济权利而非政治权利。
For example, politicians who manage an economy well should not be subject to term limits. => 比如，管理经济的政客不应该有任期限制。
Neither Singapore nor China is a democracy; but leaders in both countries have used their political power to improve living standards. => 不管是新加坡还是中国，都不是民主国家；但两国领导人运用他们的政治权力去改善生活水平。
Forcing leaders to step down in the middle of economic reforms seems counterproductive. => 在经济改革进行中期迫使领导人下台可能起到适得其反的效果。
These are not far-fetched ideas. => 这些都不是牵强附会。

Today, leaders in Rwanda, which is widely considered an African success story, have improved stability by moving away from the Washington Consensus approach to governance. => 如今，在被广泛认为是非洲成功故事之一的卢旺达，领导人通过放弃华盛顿共识的治理方针，成功改善了稳定。
Politically, Rwanda is strong, disciplined, and organized, but it is not liberal. => 从政治上看，卢旺达强大、有组织、有纪律，但不自由。
The landslide reelection of President Paul Kagame last year had more to do with power than democracy. => 总统卡加梅在去年的大选中以压倒性优势连任与其说源自民主，不如说源自权力。
Although Kagame remains popular, his government was criticized for stifling free speech and human rights in the run-up to the vote. => 尽管卡加梅保持着很高的支持率，但他的政府被批在选举期间扼杀言论自由、压迫人权。
We should be intellectually honest and call a spade a spade. => 我们应该在理智上保持坦诚，实话实说。
Rwandans should not be ashamed to value economic and administrative strength more than fair elections. => 卢旺达人民不必因为重视经济和行政强势甚于公平选举而感到羞愧。
The question for other African states seeking to reform their governance models, then, is how much of Rwanda’s approach to emulate. => 因此，其他非洲国家寻求改革治理模式时所面临的问题是在多大程度上效仿卢旺达的方针。
Neither the Washington Consensus nor the Beijing Model has all the answers. => 华盛顿共识也好，北京模式也好，都不是答案的全部。

But, as Rwanda has demonstrated, if discipline and strong leadership are improving lives and delivering public goods, perhaps liberal democracy should be a long-term priority. => 但是，卢旺达证明，如果纪律和坚强的领导能够改善生活、提供公共品，那么也许自由民主应该作为一项长期的重点。
Health Coverage Must Not Ignore Africa’s Elderly => 医疗保险不能忽视非洲的老年人
DAR ES SALAAM – My grandmother is 76, and my grandfather is 83. => 达雷斯萨拉姆 — — 我的祖母76岁，祖父83岁。
They have lived fruitful lives together, cultivating crops and grazing cattle in a remote village in the hills of southwest Uganda. => 他们在乌干达西南部山区的一个偏远村庄里共同生活，边养牛边种植农作物。
But whenever I think of them, I am more in awe of their good health than their hard work. => 但每当我想起他们，我更佩服他们的健康体魄而非辛勤劳作。
Then, because they were recently dropped from their health-insurance plan due to age, they must cough up more money to foot the bill for treatment. => 而后，由于他们最近因超龄而被迫退出医疗保险计划，他们必须自己掏更多钱来支付医疗账单。
In other words, for my grandparents – and for many older Africans – a visit to the doctor is onerous, costly, and exceedingly rare. => 换言之，对于我的祖父母 — — 和许多非洲老年人来讲 — — 看医生不仅麻烦、昂贵而且非常罕见。
Access to health care is an obsession for experts in international development. => 医疗服务普及度几乎已经成为困扰国际发展专家的强迫症。
And yet, most of the attention centered on mothers, newborns, and children; elderly populations in developing countries were largely ignored. => 但母婴及儿童吸引了绝大部分注意力；讨论基本对发展中国家的老年人口视而不见。
Failure to address this omission would leave an increasing share of the population without access to affordable health care. => 如果解决不了这一遗漏问题，越来越多的非洲人口将无法获得平价的医疗保健。

According to the World Bank, life expectancy in Sub-Saharan Africa has risen steadily in recent decades, from just 40 years in 1960 to 60 years today. => 世界银行数据显示，撒哈拉以南非洲地区的预期寿命近几十年来一直稳步上升，从1960年的仅40岁上升到今天的60岁。
If this trend continues, the number of Africans living past their 60th birthday will more than double by 2050. => 如果这一趋势得以沿续，那么到2050年活过60岁生日的非洲人会比现在翻一番。
This is of course good news; longevity is a key indicator of human development. => 这当然是个好消息；长寿是人类发展的一项关键指标。
But Africa’s elder boom will be a disaster if living longer means living sicker because of inadequate health care. => 但如果寿命延长意味着因医疗条件不足而罹患疾病 ，那么非洲的老年人口膨胀将带来灾难性的后果。
In Uganda, many rural health-care centers lack the personnel, supplies, and infrastructure to meet the needs of older patients. => 在乌干达，许多农村医疗中心满足老年患者需求的人员、物资和基础设施都十分匮乏。
Small clinics typically refer their oldest patients to the closest big hospital, which is often many miles away. => 小珍所通常会将最年长的患者转到最近的大医院，而大医院通常距离都在几英里开外。

Traveling by motorcycle over rough terrain can worsen health conditions; but with no other options, the frail must choose between a bumpy ride on the back of a bike and no treatment at all. => 在崎岖山路上骑摩托车可能导致健康条件恶化；但因为没有其他选择，体弱者必须在骑车经受颠簸和放弃治疗之间作出选择。
It’s hard to blame those who opt for the latter. => 难怪有人选择后者。

According to a 2010 survey by doctors at the Mulago National Referral Hospital in Kampala, boda-bodas are Uganda’s leading cause of road-related injuries. => 2010年坎帕拉姆拉哥国家转诊医院医生发起的一项调查显示，boda-bodas是乌干达道路伤害的主要原因。

During the survey period, motorcycle passengers accounted for 41% of the hospital’s 1,500 trauma cases, and riders’ injuries consumed 62.5% of the hospital’s surgery budget. => 在调查期间，摩托车乘客占该院1，500起创伤病例的41 % ， 而骑车者的伤害占该院手术预算的62.5 % 。
Given the dangers of travel, it is no wonder that my grandparents are reluctant to seek medical care. => 鉴于路上可能面临的危险，难怪我的祖父母不愿寻求医疗服务。
Of course, the biggest obstacle to health care in Uganda – like everywhere else – is money. => 当然，像其他地方一样，钱才是乌干达医疗保健最大的障碍因素。

In 2015, researchers at Makerere University found that household income is the main determinant of elderly people’s access to and use of health-care services. => 2015年，马克雷雷大学的研究人员发现家庭收入是老年人获取并使用医疗保健服务的主要决定因素。
The story is similar in the United States, where average annual health-care costs have been increasing for decades. => 美国的情况也十分类似，平均每年的医疗保健成本近几十年来一直处于增加当中。

But while older patients in the US can turn to Medicare (which accounted for 15% of federal spending in 2017), the elderly in most African countries have less government support. => 但虽然美国的老年患者可以借助联邦医疗保险（2017年占联邦开支的15 % ） ，但多数非洲国家的老年人却缺乏政府支持。
Still, a dearth of dedicated resources does not mean that Africa’s leaders must ignore their older constituents. => 尽管如此，专属资源的欠缺并不意味着非洲领导人一定要忽视老年选民需求。
By combining elder-care services with existing programs, health benefits can be extended to underserved populations. => 通过将老年人护理服务与现有计划相结合，可以将健康福利拓展到服务欠缺的人口。
For example, single-sector initiatives, like HIV/AIDS treatment schemes, could include elderly-friendly health-care components. => 例如，像艾滋病毒/艾滋病治疗计划等单一领域计划可以纳入方便老年人的医疗保健元素。

Health-care workers who serve expectant and new mothers could also be trained to provide in-home care for the elderly in multigenerational households. => 服务孕妇和新妈妈的卫生保健工作者也可以接受培训后在几代人共同生活的家庭为老年人提供上门医疗服务。

These types of initiatives would not require vast sums of money; rather, the most important factor in launching them is political support and effective program integration. => 上述类型的计划不需要巨额资金；相反，启动该计划的最重要因素是政治支持和有效的项目整合。
Developing countries have made considerable gains when it comes to improving health care for the young. => 发展中国家在改善年轻人的医疗服务方面已经取得了重大的进步。
Now, we must do the same for the elderly. => 现在，我们必须为老年人提供同样的服务。
In Uganda, the government’s national health-care strategy could easily be strengthened by adding seniors to the list of so-called vulnerable groups. => 在乌干达，将老年人列入所谓的弱势群体名单可以轻易实现对政府 国家医疗保健战略的强化。
Finally, community health-insurance schemes must be overhauled to prevent the exclusion of poor older patients. => 最后，为防止将贫困老年患者排除在外，必须对社区医疗保险计划进行彻底的改革。

To maintain coverage and protect the elderly from financial ruin, reforms are needed to create plans that are financially sound and drawn from a larger pool of subscribers. => 为确保为老年人提供医疗服务并保护老年人避免财务破产，我们需要改革制定在财务上可行并扩大用户基数的保险计划。
We all yearn to live long, healthy, productive lives – just as my grandparents have. => 人人都渴望像我的祖父母那样过上长寿、健康和有效率的生活。
But without lifelong access to quality health care, longevity will be more luck than science. => 但如果没有终身高质量的医疗保健，就只能凭借运气而非科学来实现长寿。
The integrity of any society can be judged by how well it treats its youngest and oldest members. => 如何对待最年轻和最年长的社会成员可以判定社会的健全程度。
That calculus applies to governments, too. => 这样的推论同样适用于政府。
Africa’s Must-Do Decade => 非洲这十年必须要做的事

VIENNA – Since 2000, Africa has recorded impressive rates of economic growth, owing largely to development assistance and a prolonged commodity boom. => 维也纳 — — 自2000年来，主要因为发展援助和商品的长期繁荣，非洲的经济增长速度令人印象深刻。

While the continent shows great diversity in the socioeconomic trajectories, growth rates have generally masked an underlying lack of structural transformation. => 尽管非洲大陆在社会经济的发展路径方面表现出极大的多样性，但增长率往往掩盖了背后结构转型的缺失。

Wherever industrialization has occurred, it has reliably improved economic diversification and helped to nurture, strengthen, and uphold the conditions for competitive growth and development. => 无论工业化发生在哪里，它都勿庸置疑地促进了经济多样化，有助于培育、加强和维护竞争性发展和增长所需的环境。
In recent decades, some developing countries – mainly in Asia – have managed to industrialize. => 近几十年来，一些发展中国家 — — 主要分布在亚洲 — — 成功地完成了工业化进程。
But, despite repeated attempts, African countries have not. => 但尽管也曾反复尝试，非洲国家仍未能完成工业化进程。
In 2014, the Asia and Pacific region’s share of value added in global manufacturing was 44.6%, whereas Africa’s was just 1.6%. => 2014年，亚太地区占全球制造业增加值的比重为44.6 % ， 而非洲则仅有区区1.6 % 。
With South Africa as its only industrialized country, Sub-Saharan Africa is the least industrialized region in the world. => 因为只有南非一个工业化国家，撒哈拉以南非洲成为全世界工业化程度最低的地区。

For African countries to achieve sustainable development, they will have to increase substantially the share of industry – especially manufacturing – in their national investment, output, and trade. => 非洲国家要想实现可持续发展，就必须在国家投资、生产和贸易等领域大幅增加工业 — — 尤其是制造业 — — 的比重。

And, to their credit, most African countries already recognize that such a transformation is necessary to address a wide range of interconnected challenges that they are now confronting. => 值得肯定的是，绝大多数非洲国家已经认识到要想解决它们目前所面临的一系列相互关联的挑战，就必须进行这样的转型。
One such challenge is population growth. => 其中一个挑战是人口的增长。
More than half of the continent’s 1.2 billion people are under the age of 19, and almost one in five are between the ages of 15 and 24. => 非洲大陆12亿人有超过一半年龄在19岁以下，而且几乎1/5的人年龄在15到24岁之间。
Each year, 12 million new workers join the labor force, and they will need the tools and skills to ensure their future livelihoods. => 每年都有1，200万新增劳动力加入到劳动力队伍，他们需要相应的工具和技能来确保未来的生活水平。
Industrialization is the key to helping Africa’s fast-growing population realize a demographic dividend. => 工业化是帮助非洲快速增长的人口实现人口红利的关键要素。
A related challenge is migration. => 与之相关的挑战是移民。
Many of Africa’s most ambitious and entrepreneurially minded young people are joining others in migrating north. => 许多非洲国家最雄心勃勃并富于创业精神的年轻人正在和其他人一道向北方移民。
But no country, especially in Africa, can afford to lose so much talent and potential. => 但没有哪个国家，尤其是非洲国家，能够承受得了一下子失去这么多的人才和潜能。
Industrialization alone cannot resolve the migration crisis, but it can address one root cause, by creating jobs in the countries of origin. => 仅靠工业化无法解决移民危机，但却可以通过在原籍国创造就业机会的方式来化解其中一个根本原因。
A third challenge is climate change, which weighs heavily on countries where agriculture is still the primary sector for employment. => 第三个挑战是气候变化，气候变化严重影响到仍然以农业作为主要就业领域的国家。

To confront the threat, Africa will need to develop and adopt green technologies, while channeling more investment into resource efficiency and clean energy. => 要想面对这一挑战，非洲需要发展和应用绿色技术，同时为资源效率和清洁能源领域吸引更多投资。

With the right investments, African countries can reduce the cost of delivering power to rural areas, and contribute to global efforts to reduce emissions and mitigate the effects of climate change. => 如果有充足的投资，非洲国家可以降低向农村输电的成本，并贡献于减排和缓解气候变化影响的全球性事业。
In short, Africa must industrialize, and it must do so in a socially inclusive and environmentally sustainable manner. => 总之，非洲必须实现工业化，而且必须以能确保社会包容和环境可持续的方式。
As it happens, the United Nations General Assembly has declared 2016-2025 to be the Third Industrial Development Decade for Africa. => 事实上，联合国大会已经宣布2016-2025年为非洲工业发展第三个十年。

During IDDA III, the United Nations Industrial Development Organization, which I lead, will spearhead the new approach to sustainable development sketched above. => 在工业发展第三个十年期间，由我领导的联合国工业发展组织将率先落实上面提到的可持续发展新方式。

UNIDO has put its full support behind partnerships for mobilizing resources, and is offering a tested model for African countries to follow: the Programme for Country Partnership (PCP). => 联合国工业发展组织全力支持合作伙伴调动资源，同时为非洲国家提供了国家伙伴关系项目（PCP）这样一个经过验证的模式。

UNIDO’s PCP provides countries with technical assistance, policy advice, and investments to help them design and implement industrialization strategies. => 联合国工业发展组织的国家伙伴关系项目为各国提供协助其设计并推行工业化战略的技术援助、政策咨询和投资。
The program was launched in 2014, and is already being successfully implemented in two African countries – Ethiopia and Senegal – and in Peru. => 该项目于2014年启动，并已经在埃塞俄比亚和塞内加尔等两个非洲国家得到成功实施。
The PCP provides a multi-stakeholder partnership model that can be adapted to each country’s national development agenda. => 国家伙伴关系项目提供了一种以多利益相关方为基础的伙伴关系模式，可以根据各国的国家发展议程进行调整后加以实施。

Priority sectors are typically chosen for their job-creation, investment, and export potential, and for their access to necessary raw materials. => 人们通常会选择能创造就业岗位、吸引投资和具有出口潜力的部门作为优先投资对象，还有一个条件就是原材料必须容易获取。
The PCP approach is designed to maximize the impact of all partner programs and projects that are relevant to industrial development. => 国家伙伴关系项目旨在令与工业发展相关的所有伙伴项目和计划的影响力得到最大限度的发挥。
To that end, strategic partnerships with financial institutions and the business sector are particularly important. => 为了实现这一目的，与金融机构和企业部门建立战略伙伴关系尤为重要。
With these in place, African countries can marshal additional resources for infrastructure, innovation, expertise, and new technologies. => 有了这些，非洲国家就可以筹集更多资源用于基建、创新、专业知识和新技术项目。
UNIDO’s goal is to make the PCP model the mainstream approach for all African countries. => 联合国工业发展组织的目标是使国家伙伴关系模式成为所有非洲国家采用的主流模式。
We stand ready to support Africa on its path to inclusive and sustainable industrial development – during IDDA III and beyond. => 我们随时准备支持非洲走向包容性和可持续的工业发展 — — 无论是在非洲工业发展第三个十年期间还是以后。
Africa’s Decade of Industrialization => 非洲的工业化十年
VIENNA – In today’s interdependent global economy, Africa remains a weak link. => 维也纳—在当今互相依存的全球经济中，非洲仍然是弱环。
Africa is by no means destined to lag behind the rest of the world economy. => 非洲绝不是注定要拖世界经济的后腿。
On the contrary, it could easily become a global economic powerhouse – and within the next decade. => 相反，它很有希望成为世界经济的发动机 — — 并且未来十年就能实现。
But, to fulfill its economic potential, Africa must industrialize. => 但是，要想实现其经济潜力，非洲必须工业化。
For the first time, the G20 placed industrialization in Africa – and all of the Least Developed Countries (LDCs) – on its agenda. => G20第一次将非洲 — — 以及全部最不发达国家 — — 的工业化列上日程。
The African Union’s Agenda 2063 also supports this drive. => 非盟的2063年日程也支持非洲工业化。

The recent UN General Assembly resolution declaring 2016-2025 the Third Industrial Development Decade for Africa is yet another push in this direction. => 最新的联合国大会决议将2016—2025年列为非洲工业发展的第三个十年，这是这一方向上的最新进展。
All of these declarations and commitments are an important first step. => 所有这些宣言和承诺都属于重要的第一步。
The question is how. => 问题在于如何做到。
The short answer is money and action. => 简单的答案是金钱和行动。
We must challenge the international community and development partners to back their words with real financial commitments. => 我们必须敦促国际社会和发展合作伙伴兑现真金白银的融资承诺。
And we must build partnerships to operationalize programs that will enable Africa to become the world’s next main engine of economic growth. => 我们必须构建合作伙伴关系执行能让非洲成为世界下一个经济增长主要引擎的计划。
Such programs must recognize and tackle the acute challenges the continent faces. => 这些计划必须承认和解决非洲所面临的尖锐挑战。
The economic growth experienced in recent decades has not been structurally driven, sustainable, or fully inclusive. => 近几十年来的经济增长并非结构性驱动，不可持续，也不完全包容。
Indeed, growth rates vary widely across the continent, and not all Africans are benefiting. => 事实上，非洲国家的增长率彼此大相径庭，也并不是所有国家都在受益。

Though the middle class in Africa has expanded markedly in recent years, generating a consumer boom and boosting domestic investment, many people still struggle to make a living. => 尽管非洲中产阶级在近几年中迅速扩大，形成了一波消费繁荣，也提振了国内投资，但许多人仍在艰难度日。
Unemployment rates are high, especially for young people and women – a reality that drives many Africans to head north. => 失业率高企，特别是年轻人和妇女 — — 这个现实让许多非洲人向北方迁移。

To keep them home, Africa’s economies must move beyond producing raw materials to build dynamic and competitive manufacturing sectors with higher value added. => 要想留住这些人，非洲经济体就不能只是生产原材料，也要构建充满活力和竞争力的增加值更高的制造业。
Here, Africa must draw on the opportunities presented by participation in global and regional value chains. => 在这方面，非洲必须抓住参与全球和地区价值链的机会。
New and innovative industrial-development strategies, as well as carefully tailored measures to attract foreign direct investment, must be introduced. => 必须引入新的创新性工业发展战略，以及精心设计的吸引外国直接投资的措施。
Of course, to develop such strategies and participate effectively in industrial value chains, Africans need knowledge. => 当然，制定这些战略和有效参与工业价值链需要知识。
Investment in education and skills training is imperative to facilitate successful and lasting industrialization. => 教育和技能培训投资是成功而持续的工业化的关进。
Knowledge of other countries’ experiences will also help Africa to avoid the pitfalls of unbridled industrialization – particularly environmental damage. => 了解其他国家的经验也有助于非洲避免自由放任的工业化的弊端 — — 特别是环境破坏。
Africa must ensure that its industrial-development strategy includes effective environmental safeguards. => 非洲必须确保其工业发展战略中包括有效的环境保护措施。
Africa is well placed to industrialize. => 非洲的处境十分有利于工业化。
It also benefits from a highly educated diaspora. => 非洲也从受过良好的教育的侨民中获益。
But industrialization is never automatic. => 但工业化不会从天上掉下来。

Governments must step up to address market failures, while planning, implementing, and enforcing industrial policies that address the shortcomings of previous ineffective versions. => 政府必须出手解决市场失灵，同时规划、实施和执行解决此前低效方案的短板的产业政策。
They must then institutionalize these new policies in national and regional development strategies. => 它们还必须将这些国家和地区发展战略制度化。

To succeed, governments will need adequate capacity, competence, and legitimacy to mobilize and interact with all stakeholders, thereby creating an attractive investment climate. => 要想成功，政府必须有足够的能量、能力和合法性动员相关利益方并与之互动，从而建立有吸引力的投资气候。
The necessary reforms will open the way for public-private partnerships, which can provide investment for infrastructure development and maintenance. => 实施必要的改革能打开公私合作之门，而公私合作能提供基础设施开发和维护投资。
A recent report, prepared for the Hangzhou G20 Summit, features a number of recommendations for Africa. => G20杭州峰会的报告为非洲列出了许多建议。

It suggests support for agriculture and agribusiness development and linking them with other sectors, as well as measures to boost resilience to price shocks. => 报告提出要为农业和农商企业发展提供支持，让它们与其他部门形成连接，并采取措施加强对价格冲击的恢复力。

Furthermore, the report emphasizes the need to deepen, broaden, and update the local knowledge base, invest in energy- and material-resource efficiency, and promote green technologies and industries. => 此外，报告强调需要深化、广化和更新地方知识储备，投资于提高能源和原材料效率，以及促进绿色技术和产业。

Other recommendations relate to trade and regional integration, leveraging domestic and external finance, and promoting what it calls the “New Industrial Revolution.” => 其他建议包括贸易和地区一体化、利用本地和外部资金、促进所谓的“新工业革命”等。

My numerous meetings with African leaders and visits to dozens of countries across the continent have convinced me that Africa is committed to industrialization. => 我与非洲领导人进行过数不清的会晤，也访问过数十个非洲国家，这些经历使我相信，非洲有工业化的决心。
In fact, the process is already underway in many countries, including Ethiopia, Ghana, Rwanda, and Senegal. => 事实上，工业化在许多国家已经开始了，包括埃塞俄比亚、加纳、卢旺达、塞内加尔等。
By offering our commitment and support, we can enable these countries to realize inclusive and sustainable development for the benefit of everyone. => 通过提供我们的承诺和支持，我们能让这些国家实现包容和可持续的发展，让所有人都从中获益。
A Roadmap for African Industrialization => 非洲工业化路线图
ABIDJAN – Africa is at a crossroads. => 阿比让—非洲正站在十字路口。

Six of the world’s ten fastest-growing economies are now located in the region, and the continent’s GDP is expected to grow at a rate of 4.1% this year, up from 3.6% in 2017. => 今天，世界十个增长最快的经济体有六个在非洲，今年非洲GDP 增长预计将达4.1 % ， 而2017年为3.6 % 。

Yet Africa’s economic growth has not been accompanied by a commensurate level of job creation, which has particularly negative implications for women and young people. => 但非洲经济增长并未带来相称的就业创造，这对妇女和年轻人的影响尤为消极。
In fact, today’s jobless growth could even reverse the gains made in eradicating poverty in recent years. => 事实上，今天的无就业增长甚至可能抹杀近几年来所取得的减贫进展。

The problem is that Africa’s growth, while impressive, has been volatile, because it has been driven mainly by high commodity prices, rather than by manufacturing. => 问题在于，非洲的增长虽然耀眼，但很不稳定，因为其主要系受到大宗商品价格高企而非制造业驱动。
The economic effects of this imbalance should not be underestimated. => 这一失衡的经济影响不可低估。

Among other things, it explains why a region that produces about 75% of the world’s cocoa accounts for just 5% of the nearly $100 billion annual chocolate market. => 它和其他因素一起导致了非洲产出全世界75%的可可，却只占近每年价值1,000亿美元的巧克力市场的5 % 。

Despite its vast natural resources, Africa will remain at the mercy of commodity prices and trade flows until it undertakes a profound structural transformation. => 尽管拥有大量自然资源，非洲仍然需要靠大宗商品价格和贸易流吃饭，除非它实现深层次结构转换。

The time has come for Africa to unlock its true economic potential by following in the footsteps of every modern economy and undertaking the transition from agriculture to manufacturing. => 非洲应该尽快循着所有现代经济体的轨迹，完成从农业到制造业的转型，释放其真正的经济潜力。
Africa’s manufacturing sector is the weakest link in its ongoing integration into the global economy. => 在非洲融入全球经济的过程中，制造业是最弱的一环。
Today, primary products (raw materials) comprise 62% of Africa’s total exports, the highest share in the world. => 今天，初级商品（原材料）占了非洲总出口额的62 % ， 这一比例为全球最高。
Clearly, Africa must start catching up. => 显然，非洲必须开始赶超。

Fortunately, there is already a global consensus that industrialization matters, and that it is in everyone’s interest for Africa to become the global manufacturing power it ought to be. => 幸运的是，全球化很重要已是全球共识，而让非洲成为其应该成为的全球制造力量符合所有人的利益。
With its “High 5 Agenda,” the African Development Bank (AfDB) has made industrialization a top priority. => 非洲开发银行（AfDB）提出了“五项重点日程 ” ， 将工业化列为最重要的工作。
Likewise, industrialization is a key component of the African Union’s “Agenda 2063.” => 类似地，工业化也是非盟“2063日程”的重要组成部分。
And, in 2016, the United Nations General Assembly declared 2016-2025 the “Third Industrial Development Decade for Africa.” => 2016年，联合国大会宣布2016—2025年为“非洲工业发展的第三个十年 ” 。
But such pronouncements are meaningless in the absence of concrete action. => 但如果不拿出切实行动，这些宣告都毫无意义。

To change the region’s economic trajectory, African policymakers must focus on three key areas: industrial policies, infrastructure financing, and leadership. => 要改变非洲的经济轨迹，非洲决策者必须聚焦于三个关键领域：产业政策，制造业融资，以及领导力。
We now know that industrial policies can be effective in boosting growth. => 我们现在知道，产业政策对于刺激增长十分有效。
The question is whether states possess the capacity to implement the policies they design. => 问题在于国家是否具备实施它们制定的政策的能力。

If they do, they can channel resources toward industry and marshal available technologies to create synergy between the agriculture and manufacturing sectors. => 如果具备，它们可以引导资源流向工业，利用可以利用的技术实现农业和制造业的协同。
A number of African countries have already moved in this direction. => 不少非洲国家已经开始朝这一方向努力。
Ethiopia, for example, has created special economic zones, where it has lowered production costs by investing in infrastructure. => 比如，埃塞俄比亚成立了特别经济区，通过基础设施投资降低生产成本。
As a result, the country has emerged as Africa’s largest hub for textile manufacturing, attracting major players like H&M and Primark. => 结果，埃塞俄比亚成为非洲最大的纺织品制造中心，吸引了H&M和普利马克（Primark）等服装大牌。

Similarly, Rwanda’s Kigali Special Economic Zone, which exempts firms from taxes for ten years, has attracted a $20 million investment from Volkswagen for a new vehicle-assembly plant. => 类似对，卢旺达的基加利特别经济区（Kigali Special Economic Zone）拥有十年免税权，吸引大众汽车公司投资2,000万美元建立了新的汽车组装厂。
But industrialization cannot happen without power, roads, and railways, which is why infrastructure must be a key focus. => 但工业化不可能在没有电力、公路和铁路的情况下凭空出现，因此，基础设施也必须是关键。
As of now, the AfDB pegs Africa’s infrastructure gap at $130–170 billion per year. => 目前，AfDB认为非洲基础设施缺口在每年1,300—1,700亿美元。
Closing it will require not just more financing, but also more innovative thinking, particularly concerning joint public-private efforts. => 填补这一缺口不仅需要更多的融资，也需要创新思维，特别是公私合作方面的创新思维。
To that end, the AfDB has expanded its portfolio for financing new infrastructure projects in several countries. => 在这方面，AfDB扩大了多国新基础设施项目的贷款。

As part of our “New Deal on Energy for Africa,” we have scaled up investment in renewable energy and put $265 million toward developing two solar-power plants in Morocco. => 作为我们的“非洲能源新政”的一部分，我们增加了在可再生能源方面的投资，并拿出2.65亿美元用于开发墨西哥的两座太阳能电厂。

In Côte d’Ivoire, where demand for energy is surging by 8-9% annually, we are investing $60 million to bring a new 44-megawatt hydropower plant onstream. => 在科特迪瓦，能源需求以每年8—9%的速度飙升，我们投资了6,000万美元在上游建立了一座新的44百万瓦的水电站。
African countries should make such investments now to reap the demographic dividend of the continent’s population bulge in the years ahead. => 非洲国家应该多做这样的投资，从而在未来多年内实现非洲人口膨胀所带来的人口红利。
No country has ever undergone economic modernization without industry. => 没有一个国家可以在没有工业的情况下实现经济现代化。
But, more to the point, no functional industrial sector has ever emerged in the absence of strong, committed leadership. => 但说得更透彻些，如果没有强大坚定的领导力，就不会有能正常运转的工业部门。
Consider Mauritius, which in the 1970s was a low-income mono-crop economy with a per capita GDP of just under $250. => 以毛里求斯为例，20世纪70年代，它还是一个低收入的单一作物经济体，人均GDP只有250美元。
Today, Mauritius is an upper-middle-income country with a more diversified economy and a per capita GDP of around $9,600. => 如今，它已是中上收入国家，经济实现了多样化，人均GDP高达9,600美元。
It is often cited as a model of economic success in Africa. => 它经常被视为非洲经济成功的榜样。
How did this come about? => 这一切是如何造就的？
As former Mauritian Prime Minister and President Anerood Jugnauth has put it, “There is no miracle. => 毛里求斯前首相兼总统贾格纳特说 ： “ 没有奇迹。
It is due simply to hard work, discipline, and will.” => 无非是努力工作、纪律和意志。
Leaders who want to develop a strong manufacturing base must have the political will to distribute resources fairly and pull the private sector along. => ”想要发展强大制造业基础的领导人必须具备政治意志公平分配资源并与私人部门携手共进。
Mauritius experienced its fair share of challenges in moving from low-end manufacturing to technology-intensive goods and services. => 毛里求斯在从低端制造业向技术密集型商品和服务转变时也遇到了各种挑战。
But it now stands as an example of what committed leadership can accomplish. => 但如今，它已成为坚定的领导力能够取得什么成就的范例。
Other African countries would do well to emulate it as they pursue their own economic transformations. => 其他非洲国家在追求各自的经济转型时，若能效而仿之，必能取得成效。
All told, Africa is well placed to seize many of the opportunities that the global economy offers emerging markets. => 总而言之，非洲大有希望能够抓住全球经济给新兴市场带来的诸多机会。
It already has the resources and the labor; now it needs committed leaders like Jugnauth who will implement the right policies. => 它拥有资源和劳动力；现在，它需要贾格纳特这样的坚定的领导人来实施正确的政策。
Africa’s Alternative Path to Development => 非洲的另一条发展路径

WASHINGTON, DC – Recent projections indicate that several Sub-Saharan African countries will experience robust economic growth over the next five years. => 发自华盛顿特区 — — 最近的几项预测指出几个撒哈拉以南非洲国家将在未来五年中实现强劲的经济增长。
By 2023, around one-third of the region’s economies will have grown at an average annual rate of 5% or higher since 2000. => 从2000年到2023年间，该地区约有1/3的经济体将达到5％甚至更高的年均增长率。
And yet, as The Economist observed last year, Africa’s development model “puzzles economists.” => 但正如《经济学人》杂志在去年观察到的那样，非洲的发展模式“让经济学家们感到困惑 ” 。
After all, only four of the continent’s high-growth countries are natural-resource dependent. => 毕竟该大陆只有四个高增长国家是资源依赖型的。
Nor is overall performance due primarily to industrialization, as traditional development models would have predicted. => 此外总体的发展也并不像传统发展模式所预测的那样主要由工业化所推动。
What, then, explains the strong economic performance? => 那么又该如何解读这一强劲经济表现呢？

Africa owes this structural transformation not to traditional industries, but to new developments in tradable services and agro-industries that resemble traditional industrialization. => 非洲这种结构性转型并非来自于传统工业，而是类似传统工业化进程的可贸易服务业和农业产业的新发展。
Aside from horticulture and agro-business, these new industries include information and communication technology-based services (ICT) and tourism. => 除园艺和农产品业务外，这些新兴产业还包括基于信息和通信技术的服务业和旅游业。
This is a departure from the historical norm. => 这就与历史常态背道而驰。

But in Africa, manufacturing as a share of total economic activity has stagnated at around 10%, with economic activity moving from agriculture to services. => 但在非洲，制造业占经济活动总量的比例一直停留在10％左右，经济活动也从农业直接跳到了服务业。

And because the rate of productivity growth in services is only about half that of manufacturing, the aggregate productivity gains needed for sustained growth have fallen relatively short. => 由于服务业的生产率增长只有制造业的一半左右，因此实现持续增长所需的总体生产率增加值也相对较少。
This process of premature deindustrialization is not unique to Africa. => 这种过早的去工业化进程可不是非洲独有的。
But it is more consequential for the continent, given the scale of its development challenges. => 但考虑到非洲所面临的各项发展挑战的规模，这一进程对这块大陆的意义极为重大。
Owing to its young, rapidly growing labor force, Africa now needs to create more than 11 million jobs in the formal economy every year. => 由于其劳动力大军普遍年轻且增长迅速，非洲现在还需要每年在正规经济中创造超过1100万个就业岗位。
In Kenya, Rwanda, Senegal, and South Africa, the ICT sector is flourishing. => 在肯尼亚，卢旺达，塞内加尔和南非，基于信息和通信技术的服务业都实现了蓬勃发展。
In Rwanda, tourism is now the single largest export activity, accounting for about 30% of total exports. => 在卢旺达，旅游业已经成为规模最大的单一出口活动，占到了该国出口总额的近30 ％ 。

Ethiopia, Ghana, Kenya, and Senegal are all integrated into global horticultural value chains, and Ethiopia has become a leading player in global flower exports. => 埃塞俄比亚，加纳，肯尼亚和塞内加尔都融入了全球园艺价值链，而埃塞俄比亚也已晋身为全球花卉出口的主要参与者。
