As these smokestack-less industries have grown, they have generated new patterns of structural change that are distinct from those of East Asia’s manufacturing-led transformation. => 随着这些无烟工业的发展，它们产生了与东亚制造业主导型转型不同的新结构变化模式。
But, if properly stewarded, they could play the same role in Africa’s development as manufacturing did in East Asia. => 如果进行适当的统筹管理，这些工业也可以在非洲的发展中扮演和东亚制造业一样的角色。
According to John Page, one of the editors of Industries Without Smokestacks, Africa’s growing service sectors share these same characteristics. => 正如《无烟工业》的编者之一约翰·佩奇（John Page）所说，非洲不断增长的服务部门具备相同的特点。
In addition to being tradable, they have higher productivity and can absorb large numbers of moderately skilled workers. => 除了可交易外，它们还具有较高的生产力，可以吸收大量中等技术工人。
And like manufacturing, they also benefit from technological change and economies of scale and agglomeration. => 像制造业一样，它们也受益于技术变革和经济的规模集聚效应。
Moreover, Africa’s smokestack-less service sectors have the added advantage of being less vulnerable to automation. => 此外，非洲这些无烟服务部门还具有不易受工业自动化影响的优势。

Notwithstanding automation’s many benefits, it presents challenges for countries where the overriding priority is to create a sufficient number of formal-sector jobs. => 尽管自动化有许多好处，但也为那些首要任务是创造足够数量正规部门就业岗位的国家提出了挑战。

While economists have been increasingly confident that Africa’s development model will be different from that of East Asia, they have been less certain about what shape it will take. => 虽然经济学家越来越确信非洲的发展模式会与东亚不同，但他们对这种模式的最终形式还不确定。
An industries-without-smokestacks model offers one possible answer. => 为此一个无烟工业模式则提供了一个潜在的答案。

The development of industries without smokestacks can occur alongside efforts to develop those with smokestacks, thus offering a multifaceted approach for Africa to achieve structural transformation. => 无烟工业的发展可以与发展有烟工业的努力齐头并进，从而为非洲实现结构转型提供一个多方面多层次的路径。
Banking on African Infrastructure => 寄希望于非洲的基础设施建设

This is a particular concern for Africa, where, since the Seychelles issued its debut Eurobond in 2006, the total value of outstanding Eurobonds has grown to nearly $35 billion. => 对非洲而言这种担忧尤其严重，自塞舌尔2006年发行首支欧元债以来，尚未偿还的欧元债总值已经增长到近350亿美元。

But if the Fed’s ongoing withdrawal of stimulus has frayed African nerves, it has also spurred recognition that there are smarter ways to finance development than borrowing in dollars. => 但如果说美联储持续退出刺激计划已经挑动了非洲国家的神经，同时也令人们意识到有比借美元债更加明智的发展融资方法。
Of the available options, one specific asset class stands out: infrastructure. => 在现有方案中，有一种特定的资产类别脱颖而出：那就是基础设施建设。

Africa, which by 2050 will be home to an estimated 2.6 billion people, is in dire need of funds to build and maintain roads, ports, power grids, and so on. => 非洲预计到2050年人口将达26亿左右，因此急需资金来修建和维护道路、港口、电网等基础设施。
Yet, if the recent past is any guide, the capital needed will be difficult to secure. => 但如果说过去有任何经验可以借鉴，那就是筹措所需资金绝不是一项轻而易举的任务。

Between 2004 and 2013, African states closed just 158 financing deals for infrastructure or industrial projects, valued at $59 billion – just 5% of the total needed. => 在2004到2013年间，非洲国家仅实际完成了158项基础设施或工业项目的融资交易，总值590亿美元 — — 仅占所需资金总额的5 % 。
Given this track record, how will Africa fund even a fraction of the World Bank’s projected requirements? => 鉴于这样的过往经历，非洲能否筹措到世界银行预测要求的哪怕一小部分资金都存在很大变数。
The obvious source is institutional and foreign investment. => 最明显的资金来源是机构和国外投资。

But, to date, many factors, including poor profit projections and political uncertainty, have limited such financing for infrastructure projects on the continent. => 但到目前为止，许多因素，包括盈利预测不佳和政治不稳定，都对非洲大陆基础设施项目的融资能力构成了严重的限制。
Investment in African infrastructure is perceived as simply being too risky. => 对非洲基础设施项目投资被视为高风险的选项。
Companies from the private sector are also profitably financing projects on the continent. => 来自私营部门的企业同样可以在非洲大陆基础设施项目融资当中有利可图。
But these are the exceptions, not the rule. => 但这些皆属例外，而非规则。
Fully funding Africa’s infrastructure shortfall will require attracting many more investors – and swiftly. => 充分筹措资金解决非洲的基础设施短缺问题需要迅速吸引更多的投资者。

To succeed, Africa must develop a more coherent and coordinated approach to courting capital, while at the same time working to mitigate investors’ risk exposure. => 要想取得成功，非洲必须制定一种更为协调一致的方法来讨好资本，并同时竭尽全力控制投资者的风险敞口。
Public-private sector collaborations are one possibility. => 公共和私营部门合作提供了一种可能性。

For example, in the energy sector, independent power producers are working with governments to provide electricity to 620 million Africans living off the grid. => 例如，在能源领域，独立的电力生产企业正在与政府合作为6.2亿尚未接入电网的非洲民众提供电能。

Privately funded but government regulated, these producers operate through power purchase agreements, whereby public utilities and regulators agree to purchase electricity at a predetermined price. => 这些电力生产企业由私人出资并接受政府监管，通过电力采购协议来完成运营，公共事业部门和监管机构在电力采购协议中同意以事先约定的价格采购电力供应。
There are approximately 130 such producers in Sub-Saharan Africa, valued at more than $8 billion. => 撒哈拉以南非洲地区约有130家这样的电力生产企业，总值超过80亿美元。
In South Africa alone, 47 projects are underway, accounting for 7,000 megawatts of additional power production. => 仅南非一地就在开展47个相关项目，总共可以达到7000兆瓦的新增电力产能。
Similar private-public partnerships are emerging in other sectors, too, such as transportation. => 交通运输等其他部门也正在出现类似的公私合作关系。
Among the most promising are toll roads built with private money, a model that began in South Africa. => 其中最有前景的当属最早出现在南非的由私人投资兴建的收费公路。

Not only are these projects, which are slowly appearing elsewhere on the continent, more profitable than most financial market investments; they are also literally paving the way for future growth. => 这些在非洲大陆其他地方逐渐出现的项目不仅比多数金融市场投资更有利可图；而且正在事实上为未来的经济增长铺平道路。
Clearly, Africa needs more of these ventures to overcome its infrastructure challenges. => 显而易见，非洲需要更多这样的合资公司才能迎接基础设施所带来的挑战。

That is why I, along with other African business leaders and policymakers, have called on Africa’s institutional investors to commit 5% of their funds to local infrastructure. => 因此我和非洲商业领袖及决策者共同呼吁非洲机构投资者将5%的资金用于投资当地的基础设施。
We believe that with the right incentives, infrastructure can be an innovative and attractive asset class for those with long-term liabilities. => 我们相信只要激励措施得当，基础设施对那些拥有长期负债的机构而言完全可以成为创新且有吸引力的资产类别。
One sector that could lead the way on this commitment is the continent’s pension funds, which, together, possess a balance sheet of about $3 trillion. => 能够领导这一目标的部门之一是非洲大陆的养老基金，该部门合计拥有约3万亿美元的资产负债表。

The 5% Agenda campaign, launched in New York last month, underscores the belief that only a collaborative public-private approach can redress Africa’s infrastructure shortfall. => 上个月在纽约启动的5%议程行动强调了这样一种理念，即仅有公私合作方式能够改变非洲的基础设施短缺。
For years, a lack of bankable projects deterred international financing. => 多年以来，缺乏银行贷款项目阻碍了国际融资。

But in 2012, the African Union adopted the Program for Infrastructure Development in Africa, which kick-started more than 400 energy, transportation, water, and communications projects. => 但2012年，非洲联盟通过了非洲基础设施开发计划，启动了超过400个能源、交通运输、水资源和通讯项目。
It was a solid start – one that the 5% Agenda seeks to build upon. => 这是一个相当不错的开始 — — 也是5%议程行动赖以存在的基础。
But some key reforms will be needed. => 但必须进行某些关键领域的改革。
A high priority of the 5% Agenda is to assist in updating the national and regional regulatory frameworks that guide institutional investment in Africa. => 5%议程行动的重要目标是协助升级国家和地区监管框架，从而引导非洲的机构投资。
Similarly, new financial products must be developed to give asset owners the ability to allocate capital directly to infrastructure projects. => 同样，必须开发新的金融产品，以便资产所有者能够将资金直接划拨给基础设施项目。

Unlocking new pools of capital will help create jobs, encourage regional integration, and ensure that Africa has the facilities to accommodate the needs of future generations. => 解锁新的资金池将有助于创造就业机会、鼓励区域一体化及确保非洲拥有能满足子孙后代需求的基础设施项目。
But all of this depends on persuading investors to put their money into African projects. => 但所有这些都取决于能否说服投资者将资金投入非洲建设项目。
As business leaders and policymakers, we must ensure that the conditions for profitability and social impact are not mutually exclusive. => 身为商界领袖和决策者，我们必须确保赚取利润和社会影响的条件能够相互融合。
When development goals and profits align, everyone wins. => 如果发展目标能够和利润保持一致，那么所有人都是赢家。
Freeing Africa’s Internet => 解放非洲的互联网
WASHINGTON, DC – Much to the dismay of the government in Addis Ababa, “Zone 9” has become a household name in Ethiopia. => 华盛顿—让亚的斯亚贝巴政府大吃一惊的是 ， “ 第九区 ” （ Zone 9）成了埃塞俄比亚一个家喻户晓的名字。

Since 2012, this small group of journalists-turned-online activists has used social media to campaign for political freedoms and civil liberties in their country. => 2012年以来，这个线上记者活跃分子团体利用社交媒体要求国家实现政治自由和公民自由。
Ethiopia’s government is not alone in seeking to consolidate political power by restricting what citizens say online. => 埃塞俄比亚政府不是唯一一个试图通过限制公民的网络言论来巩固政治权力的政府。
Across Africa, governments are enacting legislation to restrict Internet access and outlaw criticism of elected officials. => 放眼非洲，许多政府都实施了限制互联网接入、将对当选官员的批评入罪的法律。
Digital campaigners face myriad censorship tactics, including “Border Gateway Protocol” attacks, “HTTP throttling,” and “deep packet inspections.” => 数字活动家面对各种审查技术，如“边界网关协议”攻击 、 “ HTTP限流”和“深层封包检测”等。
The irony, of course, is that censorship rarely quiets the disaffected. => 当然，讽刺的是审查很少能够让不满噤声。
At the moment, however, few of Africa’s leaders are listening. => 但此时此刻，很少有非洲领导人在聆听。
Leaders in nine of the 18 African countries that held elections in 2016 placed some level of restriction on the Internet to limit dissent. => 在2016年举行了选举的18个非洲国家中，有九个国家的领导人实施了某种程度的互联网限制以遏制异见。
Four days prior to Uganda’s presidential vote in February, President Yoweri Museveni cut access to mobile payment services and social media sites. => 2月份乌干达总统选举投票前四天，总统穆塞韦尼切断了移动支付服务和社交媒体网站。

In August and September, Gabon’s president, Ali Bongo, seeking to project an atmosphere of calm to the international community, shut down Internet access overnight. => 8月和9月，加蓬总统班戈意欲在国际社会面前营造平静的氛围，关闭了夜间互联网接入。
Internet blackouts like these violate people’s human rights and undermine democratic processes. => 这类断网行为违反了人权，也破坏了民主进程。

Last year, the United Nations Human Rights Council approved a resolution affirming that, “rights that people have offline must also be protected online, in particular freedom of expression.” => 去年，联合国人权委员会通过了一项决议，重申“人们在线下的权利，在线上也必须得到保护，特别是言论自由。 ”
Most African governments try to justify Internet embargoes by arguing that the restrictions are necessary to ensure public safety and security. => 大部分非洲政府用辩称断网是为了确保公共安全和安保而不得已而为之。
Museveni, for example, claimed that blocking Internet access was the only way to protect visiting heads of state during his swearing-in ceremony. => 比如，穆塞韦尼宣称切断互联网接入是在其就职典礼上保护来访的各国首脑的唯一办法。
But he presented no evidence linking social media accessibility and security in Uganda, or anywhere else. => 但他没有拿出任何证据证明社交媒体接入和乌干达或其他任何国家的安全有什么联系。
With several key African elections coming up, Internet shutdowns are again on the horizon. => 随着多个非洲国家重要选举的临近，断网也再次走进人们的视野。

In Zimbabwe, where President Robert Mugabe, who is 93, is expected to run for his eighth term in mid-2018, a government-led crackdown appears inevitable. => 在津巴布韦，93岁的总统穆加贝预计将履任其第八个总统任期（从2018年年中开始 ） ， 政府主导的镇压行动看来已是势在必行。
For decades, Mugabe has relied on intimidation and violence to stifle political dissent. => 几十年来，穆加贝依靠恐吓和暴力扼杀政治异见。
It is not surprising, then, that he has already begun taking a hostile approach to online activism. => 因此，毫不奇怪，他早已对在线活动持敌对态度。

Last year, his government shut down the Internet in the middle of political protests, and vowed to arrest anyone caught generating or sharing “abusive or subversive material on social media.” => 去年，他的政府在政治示威期间关闭了互联网，并宣称要逮捕所有制造或分享“社交媒体上的诽谤或颠覆性材料”的人。
But citizens are not helpless. => 但公民并非无望。
While governments issue orders to cut off Internet access, only telecommunications companies have the ability to hit the “kill switch.” => 政府固然可以下令断网，但只有通讯公司有能力按下“死亡开关 ” 。

Moreover, civil-society groups, the African Union, and the UN should do more to condemn national legislation that aims to normalize restrictive Internet policies. => 此外，公民社会团体、非洲联盟和联合国应该加大力度谴责旨在将限制互联网的政策常规化的立法。

Just as it launched a model law on access to information in 2013, the African Union should provide new guidance to states on how to safeguard the right to assemble and express views online. => 2013年，非盟发布了信息接触示范法，如今，它应该为各国提供新的指引，教它们如何捍卫在线收集和表达观点的权利。
Finally, new continent-wide measures are needed to ensure that Africans’ online rights are recognized and respected by their governments. => 最后，需要新的洲级措施确保非洲在线权利得到政府和承认和尊重。
Such interventions are needed now more than ever. => 这些干预比以往任何时候都更加需要。

The Kenyan, Zimbabwean, and Ethiopian legislatures are currently considering laws that would permit significantly greater government control over Internet access. => 肯尼亚、津巴布韦和埃塞俄比亚立法机关正在考虑显著扩大政府互联网接入管制权的立法。

Last year, Tanzania adopted legislation that has already been used to charge individuals with crimes who have criticized President John Magufuli on social media. => 去年，坦桑尼亚实施了一项立法，被用来对在社交媒体上批评总统马古富力的个人提起刑事指控。

Whether governments bar citizens from gathering in public, signing petitions, or accessing the Internet and posting on social media makes no difference. => 不管政府是禁止公民公开集会、签署请愿书，还是禁止公民接入互联网并在社交媒体上发帖，并没有什么区别。
All such measures are designed to strip citizens of their rights. => 所有这些措施都是为了剥夺公民的权利。
The battle for freedom, as Zone 9 has shown, is no less real when the public square is the digital domain. => 第九区表明，为了自由的斗争在数字领域和在公共广场上一样真实。
Capturing Africa’s High Returns => 抓住非洲的高回报机遇
WASHINGTON, DC – Since 2000, at least half of the world’s fastest-growing economies have been in Africa. => 华盛顿 — — 自2000年来，至少半数世界增长最快的经济体来自非洲地区。
And by 2030, Africa will be home to 1.7 billion people, whose combined consumer and business spending will total $6.7 trillion. => 而截至2030年，非洲将拥有17亿人口，其消费和商业支出的总额将高达6.7万亿美元。
Seven years ago, the Harvard Business Review pointed out that Africa is also home to many of the world’s biggest opportunities. => 七年前，哈佛商业评论就曾指出非洲是全世界最大的机遇所在地。
And yet, despite its tremendous business potential, Africa has not risen to the top of Western business leaders’ agendas. => 但尽管商业潜力巨大，非洲却并没有被西方商业领袖作为议程的重中之重。
In fact, between 2014 and 2016, US exports to Africa fell by almost half, from $38 billion to $22 billion. => 事实上，从2014到2016年间，美国对非洲出口骤降近半，从美元380亿下降到美元220亿。

And while the United Kingdom’s investments on the continent more than doubled between 2005 and 2014, reaching £42.5 billion ($57.6 billion), only 2.5% of its total exports are to Africa. => 而尽管英国对非洲大陆的投资在2005到2014年间增长超过一倍，达到425亿英镑（合576亿美元 ） ， 但针对非洲的出口总额仅占2.5 % 。

Western countries are quickly losing ground to China, which increased its exports to Africa more than sevenfold – to $103 billion – from 2005 to 2015. => 西方国家面对中国的挑战正迅速丧失优势，从2005到2015年间，中国对非洲的出口增长了七倍以上 — — 高达1，030亿美元。
If Western businesses hope to keep up, they will need to tap into the African countries and sectors with the highest potential for growth. => 如果西方企业想要跟上中国的脚步，他们就必须充分利用非洲增长潜力最大的国家和部门。

By 2030, more than half of Africa’s population will reside in seven countries: Nigeria, Ethiopia, the Democratic Republic of Congo, Egypt, Tanzania, Kenya, and South Africa. => 到2030年，非洲超过一半的人口将居住在七个国家：包括尼日利亚、埃塞俄比亚、刚果民主共和国、埃及、坦桑尼亚、肯尼亚和南非。

But, more important, 43% of Africans will belong to the middle or upper classes, up from 39.6% in 2013, implying considerably higher demand for goods and services. => 但更重要的是，43%的非洲人将上升至中上阶层， 而该数据在2013年仅为39.6 % ， 而这意味着对商品和服务的需求将大幅增加。
By 2030, household consumption is expected to reach $2.5 trillion, up from $1.1 trillion in 2015. => 截止2030年，家庭消费预计将达到2.5万亿美元，而2015年的家庭消费总额仅有1.1万亿。
Nearly half of that $2.5 trillion will be spent in three countries: Nigeria (20%), Egypt (17%), and South Africa (11%). => 其中三个国家将占到这2.5万亿美元消费总额的近半数：他们是尼日利亚（20 % ） 、埃及（17 % ） 和南非（11 % ） 。
But there will also be lucrative opportunities in Algeria, Angola, Ethiopia, Ghana, Kenya, Morocco, Sudan, and Tunisia. => 但阿尔及利亚、安哥拉、埃塞俄比亚、加纳、肯尼亚、摩洛哥、苏丹和突尼斯均存在能提供丰厚回报的机遇。
Any one of these countries would be a good bet for companies seeking to enter new markets. => 上述国家中的任何一个都可以提供开拓新市场的良好机会。

By 2030, the sectors generating the most value in Africa will be food and beverages ($740 billion), education and transportation ($397 billion), and housing ($390 billion). => 截至2030年，食品饮料（7，400亿美元 ） 、 教育交通（3，970亿美元）和住房（3，900亿美元）将成为非洲创造最大价值的行业。
For its part, the African Development Bank can help investors find promising projects through its Program for Infrastructure Development in Africa. => 在这方面，非洲开发银行可以通过其非洲基础设施发展计划帮助投资者找到前景广阔的项目。

Another major growth area between now and 2030 will be in African business-to-business spending, which will reach $4.2 trillion, up from $1.6 trillion in 2015. => 非洲企业对企业支出将成为从现在起到2030年另外一个主要增长领域，该支出总额将达4.2万亿美元，而2015年仅有美元1.6万亿。

The expected growth in agriculture and agricultural processing reflects the fact that food and beverages will constitute the largest share of total household spending. => 农业及农产品加工业的预期增长反映了食品饮料将占据非洲家庭开支最主要份额的现实。
Moreover, 60% of the world’s unused arable land is in Africa, which still contributes a meager share of worldwide agricultural exports. => 不仅如此，地球60%的闲置土地均位于非洲，即便如此，非洲仍然能为世界农业出口尽一份微薄之力。
That means there is a lot of room for growth. => 这意味着非洲拥有巨大的增长潜力。

As of 2012, the African countries with the highest agricultural value-added in terms of annual growth included Burkina Faso, Ethiopia, Nigeria, Mali, Mozambique, Rwanda, and Tanzania. => 截止2012年，农业增加值年增长率最高的非洲国家包括布基纳法索、埃塞俄比亚、尼日利亚、马里、莫桑比克、卢旺达和坦桑尼亚。
In addition, Angola, Morocco, and South Africa now all have sizable markets, and have committed to expanding their agricultural sectors. => 不仅如此，安哥拉、摩洛哥和南非现在都拥有规模庞大的市场，并致力于扩大其农业部门的实力。
According to the Harvard Business Review, Africa also has the potential to become “the world’s next great manufacturing center.” => 据哈佛商业评论报道，非洲同样具备成为“世界下一个大型制造中心的潜力 ” 。

China is expected to lose from 85-100 million low-cost, labor-intensive manufacturing jobs by 2030, and Africa stands to capture many of them. => 截至2030年，中国预期将丧失8，500万到1亿个低成本、劳动密集型的就业岗位，而非洲将成为其中许多岗位的承接地。
This helps to explain why manufacturing will be the second-largest sector in terms of business-to-business spending. => 这有助于说明企业对企业支出的第二大领域为什么是制造业。
South Africa, Egypt, and Nigeria are already becoming promising places to invest in these areas. => 南非、埃及和尼日利亚已经成为投资上述领域的新兴之地。
And investors will also be able to find high returns and favorable business environments in Ethiopia, Morocco, and Rwanda. => 投资者也能在埃塞俄比亚、摩洛哥和卢旺达找到高回报和有利的商业环境。
Africa is the world’s last frontier market, and Western businesses need to start taking advantage of its tremendous potential, as Chinese firms already are. => 非洲是世界最后一块前沿市场，西方企业需要效仿中国，开始发掘其所拥有的巨大潜力。

Doing business in Africa will also create sustainable jobs and advance the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals to eliminate poverty and hunger. => 在非洲开展业务还能在创造可持续就业机会的同时推动完成联合国消灭饥饿和贫困的可持续发展目标任务。
And that, too, will be good for the bottom line. => 而这归根结底也是件好事。

As the Business and Sustainable Development Commission has shown, pursuing the SDGs “could raise trillions in new market opportunities in ways that extend prosperity to all.” => 正如商业及可持续发展委员会所表明的那样，实现可持续发展目标“能够以一种令所有人都兴旺发达的方式开拓价值数万亿美元的全新市场机遇。 ”
Strengthening African Science => 加强非洲的科学

Any good leader knows that scientific discovery and innovation fuels progress, facilitates development, and can help tackle issues like food insecurity, water shortages, and climate change. => 优秀领导人都知道，科学发现和创新驱动进步、促进发展，还有助于解决粮食不安全、水短缺和气候变化等问题。
And yet most African governments are failing to fund research and development adequately in their countries. => 但大部分非洲国家政府都没有为国内研究和开发提供足够的资金。
According to the UNESCO Institute for Statistics, countries in Sub-Saharan Africa spend, on average, just 0.5% of GDP on research and development. => 据联合国教科文组织统计局，撒哈拉以南非洲各国平均研发支出仅占GDP的0.5 % 。
In the West, the share is closer to 3%. => 在西方，这一比例接近3 % 。
This disparity underscores the development challenges that Africans face. => 这一差距构成了非洲所面临的发展挑战。
Africa is home to 15% of the world’s population and 5% of its GDP, but accounts for a paltry 1.3% of total research spending. => 非洲人口占世界的15 % ， GDP占5 % ， 但研究总支出只占1.3 % 。
To be sure, these trends are not universal; some African governments are investing heavily in science-led innovation. => 平心而论，这些趋势并非放之非洲而皆准；一些非洲政府中金投资于科学驱动的创新。
In South Africa, for example, authorities have pledged to double R&D spending by 2020 – to 1.5% of GDP. => 比如，在南非，当局承诺到2020年将研发支出提高一倍，至GDP的1.5 % 。
This follows a 2016 commitment by African heads of state to increase science and technology budgets to at least 1% of GDP by 2025. => 在此之前，2016年非洲各国首脑承诺到2025年至少将科学技术预算提高到GDP的1 % 。
A handful of countries – including Kenya, Rwanda, and Senegal – are working hard to reach this funding threshold. => 少数国家 — — 包括肯尼亚、卢旺达和塞内加尔 — — 正在努力达到这一拨款阈值。
Africa also benefits from generous research-related aid and international support. => 非洲也从慷慨的研究相关援助和国际支持中获益。
One of the top donors, the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, has invested more than $450 million in African science initiatives over the last decade. => 贡献最大的捐助者之一比尔和梅琳达·盖茨基金会在过去十年中位非洲科学项目投入了4.5亿多美元。
Projects include a $306 million program to boost crop yields and a $62.5 million grant to improve health outcomes. => 这些项目包括一个3.06亿美元的作物增产计划和一笔6,250万美元的健康改善资金。
Unfortunately, many African governments lack the resources to fund programs that could build on these gains. => 不幸的是，许多非洲政府缺少为可以在这些收益的基础上更进一步的项目提供资金的资源。
Simply put, a new, more collaborative approach to African science is urgently needed. => 简言之，非洲科学急需更有合作精神的新方案。
Africa’s leaders have pooled their science resources before. => 非洲领导人曾经集中过他们的科学资源。
It was an ambitious goal that yielded early results. => ”这是一个宏伟的目标，并已经产生了早期结果。
Between 2005 and 2014, continent-wide spending on R&D increased, while research output more than doubled in many countries. => 2005—2014年，非洲研发支出实现增长，许多国家的研究产出不止翻番。
Since then, however, progress has stalled. => 但此后进展陷入了停滞。

The recent meeting in Rwanda, hosted by President Paul Kagame and organized by the Next Einstein Forum, was designed to help get the agenda back on track. => 最新的卢旺达会议由下一个爱因斯坦论坛（Next Einstein Forum）组织，总统卡加姆主持，旨在帮助该日程重回正轨。

But summits are only part of the solution; governments must also commit to improving research quality, and they can start by focusing attention on three key areas. => 但峰会只是解决方案的一部分；政府还必须致力于改善研究质量，它们可以从关注三个关键领域开始。
First, Africa’s leaders must engage with CEOs, philanthropists, and donors who understand the long-term value of investing in science. => 首先，非洲领导人必须与了解科学投资的长期价值的CEO、慈善家和捐赠者合作。
Innovation is expensive, and seed money will be needed to help strengthen the continent’s scientific capacity. => 创新是昂贵的，需要种子基金帮助强化非洲的科学能力。
Second, African universities and institutions should align their research agendas with national and regional goals. => 其次，非洲大学和机构应该理顺研究日程与国家和地区目标的关系。
Last but not least, countries should encourage entrepreneurship within research organizations. => 第三，各国应该鼓励研究组织内部的企业家精神。
One way to do this is by establishing commercialization offices, which could help scientists bring their research to market. => 一个办法是建立商业化办公室，商业化办公室有助于科学家的研究面向市场。

Boosting Africa’s scientific capabilities will require the continent’s leaders to do more than ask tough questions at summits; they must also allocate more funding and forge new partnerships. => 提高非洲的科学实力需要非洲领导人不仅仅要在峰会上提出尖锐的问题；他们还必须配置更多的资金，构建新的合作关系。
To overcome Africa’s human development challenges, African governments must invest in the people who can overcome them. => 要克服非洲的人类发展挑战，非洲政府必须投资于能够克服这些挑战的人。
The High Cost of Food Monopolies in Africa => 非洲粮食垄断的高昂代价
LAGOS – In May, global food prices increased 1.2%, reaching their highest level since October 2017. => 拉各斯—5月，全球粮食价格上涨1.2 % ， 达到了2017年10月以来的最高水平。
This upward trajectory is having a disproportionate impact in Africa, where the share of household income spent on food is also rising. => 这波涨势正在给非洲造成非常大的影响，家庭用于粮食的支出比例也节节攀升。

To ensure food security, governments must work quickly to reverse these trends, and one place to start is by policing the producers who are feeding the frenzy. => 为了确保粮食安全，政府必须迅速行动起来扭转这些趋势，一个起点是整顿囤积居奇的生产商。
According to data compiled by the World Economic Forum, four of the world’s top five countries in terms of food expenditure are in Africa. => 据世界经济论坛收集的数据，全世界粮食支出最高的五个国家有四个在非洲。

Nigeria leads the list, with a staggering 56.4% of household income in 2015 spent on food, followed by Kenya (46.7%), Cameroon (45.6%), and Algeria (42.5%). => 尼日利亚高居榜首，2015年56.4%的家庭收入用在了食品上，其次是肯尼亚（46.7 % ） 、喀麦隆（45.6 % ） 和阿尔及利亚（42.5 % ） 。

By comparison, consumers in the United States spend the least globally (6.4%), far less than people in emerging economies like Brazil (16%) and India (30%). => 相比而言，美国消费者的支出为全球最低（6.4 % ） ，远低于巴西 (16 % ) 和印度 (30 % ) 等新兴经济体。
One reason for the distortion is the price of food relative to income. => 如此扭曲的一个原因是相对于收入的粮食价格。
As Africa urbanizes, people are buying more imported semi- or fully processed foods, which cost more than locally produced foods. => 随着非洲日渐城市化，人们开始购买更多进口半加工或全加工食品，这些食品比本地生产的食品更贵。
And in most countries, wages have not kept pace with inflation. => 而在大部分国家，工资赶不上通货膨胀。
In turn, prices for most commodities have risen. => 反过来，大部分大宗商品价格节节上涨。
These prices hit consumers both directly and indirectly (owing to pass-through of higher input costs by food conglomerates and service providers). => 这些价格直接间接地影响着消费者（通过推高食品生产集团和服务提供商的投入品成本传导 ） 。

The Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) has long argued that food security and fair pricing depends on markets that are free from monopolistic tendencies. => 联合国粮农组织一直强调，粮食安全和公平定价取决于市场不能走向垄断。
And yet, in many African countries, this advice has rarely been heeded. => 但是，在许多非洲国家，这一建议很少有人会听。
To be sure, this is not a new problem. => 平心而论，这并不是什么新问题。
And, despite the considerable attention such cases have received, the underlying problems persist. => 而尽管这些案件引起了广泛关注，其根本问题顽固依旧。
According to the World Bank, more than 70% of African countries rank in the bottom half globally for efforts to protect “market-based competition.” => 据世界银行，超过70%的非洲国家在全球保护“基于市场的竞争”行为排行榜上位于后半部分。
While 27 African countries and five regional blocs do have antitrust laws on the books, enforcement is rare. => 27个非洲国家和5个地区已经有了成文的反垄断法，但几乎没有执法可言。
The remaining countries have no regulations at all and have made little progress in drafting them. => 其他国家根本没有反垄断规则，连起草工作都鲜有国家在推进。
There is one notable exception: South Africa. => 南非是一个显著的例外。

Since 1998, the country’s Competition Act has prohibited any company controlling at least 45% of the market from excluding other firms or seeking to exercise control over pricing. => 1998年以来，南非竞争法禁止任何公司通过排斥其他企业或寻求操纵价格控制45%或以上的市场份额。
Other countries should follow South Africa’s lead. => 其他国家应该效仿南非的榜样。
Companies and special-interest groups will always seek to benefit from the absence of regulation. => 公司和特殊利益集团永远不会停止寻求钻监管的空子获益。
The need for reform is greatest in countries like Nigeria and Ghana, where food expenditures are high and food-industry pressure is most pronounced. => 尼日利亚和加纳等国家最需要改革，在这些国家，粮食支出比例畸高，粮食安全压力最大。
Fortunately, there is growing recognition of the need to address these challenges. => 幸运的是，越来越多的人开始认识到必须解决这些挑战。
Unregulated markets in competition context constitute the otherwise ‘legitimate’ vehicle for both financial and social extortion.” => 竞争环境中的不受监管的市场沦为金融和社会敲诈的‘合法’外衣。 ”

Such a policy would save households in these countries over $700 million (2015 US dollars) a year, with poor households gaining disproportionately more than rich ones. => 这一政策将为这些国家的家庭每年节省超过7亿美元（2015年美元 ） ， 贫穷家庭所得到的好处要远大于富裕家庭。
Ultimately, it is the responsibility of political leaders to protect consumers from collusion and price-fixing. => 说到底，保护消费者免受勾结和价格固定影响是政治领导人的责任。

There is no question that Africa’s businesses need space to innovate and grow, but their success should never come at the cost of someone else’s next meal. => 毫无疑问，非周期也需要通过创新实现增长的空间，但它们的成功决不能以某些人的下一顿饭为代价。
The Cancer Threat to Africa’s Future => 非洲未来的癌症威胁

CHICAGO – One of the most pressing public-health challenges in Africa today is also one of the least reported: cancer, a leading cause of death worldwide. => 芝加哥 — — 当今非洲最紧迫的公共卫生挑战之一也是报道最少的：那就是癌症，世界各地最主要的死亡原因。
Every year, some 650,000 Africans are diagnosed with cancer, and more than a half-million die from the disease. => 每年都有约650,000非洲人被确诊患有癌症，并有超过50万人因这种疾病而死亡。

Within the next five years, there could be more than one million cancer deaths annually in Africa, a surge in mortality that would make cancer one of the continent’s top killers. => 未来五年内，非洲可能每年都有超过100万人因癌症死亡，死亡率激增将使癌症成为非洲大陆最主要的致死疾病。
Throughout Sub-Saharan Africa, tremendous progress has been made in combating deadly infectious diseases. => 在整个撒哈拉以南非洲地区，人们在打击致命传染病方面取得了重大的进步。
Unfortunately, similar gains have not been made in the fight against non-communicable diseases (NCDs), including cancer. => 不幸的是，在抗击包括癌症在内的非传染性疾病（NCDs）的过程中并没有取得类似的进步。
Today, cancer kills more people in developing countries than AIDS, malaria, and tuberculosis combined. => 今天，癌症在发展中国家致死的人口数量比艾滋病、疟疾和肺结核加起来还要多。
But, with Africa receiving only 5% of global funding for cancer prevention and control, the disease is outpacing efforts to contain it. => 但由于非洲仅获得全球癌症预防和控制资金的5 % ， 遏制癌症的努力根本赶不上这种疾病的蔓延速度。
Just as the world united to help Africa beat infectious disease outbreaks, a similar collaborative approach is needed to halt the cancer crisis. => 正如全世界联合起来帮助非洲遏制传染病爆发一样，必须采取类似的手段来遏制这场癌症危机。
Surviving cancer requires many things, but timely access to specialists, laboratories, and second opinions are among the most basic. => 癌症患者生存需要许多东西，但及时得到专家、实验室和补充诊疗意见却是最基本的。

Yet, in much of Africa, a lack of affordable medications, and a dearth of trained doctors and nurses, means that patients rarely receive the care they need. => 但在非洲绝大部分地区，廉价的药品、训练有素的医生和护士都极为短缺，这意味着患者很少能够得到他们所需要的护理服务。

On average, African countries have fewer than one trained pathologist for every million people, meaning that most diagnoses come too late for treatment. => 平均而言，非洲国家每百万人口仅有不到一位训练有素的病理学家，这意味着绝大多数人无法在癌症尚可治疗期间获得准确的诊断服务。
According to University of Chicago oncologist Olufunmilayo Olopade, a diagnosis of cancer in Africa is “nearly always fatal.” => 按照芝加哥大学肿瘤学家Olufunmilayo Olopade的说法，非洲的癌症诊断“几乎总是致命的 ” 。

Building health-care systems that are capable of managing infectious diseases, while also providing quality cancer care, requires a significant investment in time, money, and expertise. => 建设能够管理传染性疾病、同时也能提供优质癌症护理服务的医疗保健系统需要在时间、金钱和专业知识方面进行巨大的投入。
Fortunately, Africa already has a head start. => 幸运的是，非洲已经有了一个不错的开头。
National efforts are also strengthening pharmaceutical supply chains, improving medical training, and increasing the quality of diagnostic networks. => 非洲各国也在强化药品供应链、改善医疗培训并提升诊断网络的服务质量。
Still, Africans cannot face down this threat alone. => 但非洲人仍然无法独自面对这样的威胁。

That is why the American Society for Clinical Pathology, where I work, is cooperating with other global health-care innovators to attack the region’s growing cancer crisis. => 我所在机构美国临床病理学会因此正在与其他全球医疗保健创新机构合作来遏制非洲地区癌症危机的蔓延势头。

Together, we have brought immunohistochemistry, a key diagnostic tool, to seven regional laboratories, an effort we hope lead to more timely cancer diagnoses and greatly improve the quality of care. => 我们已经一起将重要诊断工具“免疫组织化学染色法”带到了7家地区实验室，我们希望这样可以更及时地作出癌症诊断并极大地改善护理质量。
To complement these technical efforts, the ACS is also training African health-care professionals how to carry out biopsies and deliver chemotherapy. => 美国癌症协会还培训非洲专业医疗人士如何进行活检和化疗，以补充上面所提到的技术性工作。
That initiative, funded by Novartis, is viewed as a pilot program that could expand to other regional countries. => 这项由诺华资助的计划被视为有可能向其他区域国家拓展的一项试点工作。

Finally, our organizations are advocating for enhanced cancer-treatment guidelines in national health-care planning efforts, protocols that we believe are essential to improving health outcomes. => 最后，我所在机构正在倡导在国家医疗保健计划工作中强化癌症治疗的指导原则，我们认为这样的条款规定能在改善医疗效果的过程中发挥至关重要的作用。

These initiatives are in conjunction with other undertakings, such as a joint ACS-Clinton Health Access Initiative program to broaden access to cancer medications. => 上述条款与美国癌症协会-克林顿联合健康计划相结合，以扩大癌症治疗药物的普及度。

When the world took notice that infectious diseases like HIV/AIDS, polio, and malaria were ravaging Africa, action plans were drawn up and solutions were delivered. => 当世界各国意识到艾滋病毒/艾滋病、小儿麻痹症和疟疾等传染性疾病在非洲肆虐，我们制定了行动计划并积极付诸行动。
Today, a similar global effort is needed to ensure that every African with a cancer diagnosis can get the treatment they need. => 今天，人们必须推进类似的全球工作，以确保每位被确诊患有癌症的非洲人都能得到所需的治疗服务。

Now, as then, success depends on coordination among African governments, health-service providers, drug makers, and non-governmental organizations. => 现在和当时一样，非洲政府、医疗服务提供商、制药企业和非政府组织之间的合作决定了抗击癌症能否取得成功。

There is no place on Earth that is immune from the dread of a cancer diagnosis; wherever the news is delivered, it is often devastating to recipients and their families. => 地球上没有哪个地方不对癌症诊断充满恐惧；无论哪里的患者得到消息，对接受者及其家庭来说会产生灾难性的后果。
But geography should never be the deciding factor in patients’ fight to survive the disease. => 但地理位置永远不应成为患者与癌症斗争的决定性因素。
Cancer has been Africa’s silent killer for far too long, and the global health community must no longer remain quiet in the face of this crisis. => 癌症作为非洲沉默的杀手已经太久，而面对这场危机全球医疗界绝对不应再保持沉默。
Investing in Africa’s Educators => 投资非洲的教育者
Those who work in the education sector on the continent have to seek solutions that are faster, cheaper, and can be scaled up. => 非洲教育工作者必须找到更迅速、更廉价并且能够推广的解决方案。
Too often, though, expedient approaches prove shortsighted, and fail to engage local leaders who hold the keys to economic and social progress. => 但是，权宜之计往往相当短视，无法让座位经济和社会进步的关键的地方领导者参与进来。
Too often, grassroots-level voices, reflecting firsthand experience addressing their communities’ problems, are ignored. => 草根的声音往往被忽视，而这些声音又往往反映了解决发声者所在社区的问题的第一手经验。
When global leaders gather in Hamburg this week for the G20 summit, the new G20-Africa Partnership will take center stage. => 本周，全球领导人将在汉堡举行G20峰会，新的G20-非洲合作计划将成为中心议题。

But those committed to helping Africa should focus squarely on the nuts and bolts of aid and development – and that means investing in local leadership. => 但致力于帮助非洲的仁人志士应该将注意力对准援助与发展的要害 — — 而这意味着投资于地方领导力。
Sadly, the best-funded aid organizations in Africa are often run by Westerners, or by Africans who have extensive ties to the West. => 悲哀的是，在非洲，资金充裕的援助组织往往由西方人负责管理，而不是由于西方关系密切的非洲人负责管理。

I recently spoke to several entrepreneurs who shared anecdotal evidence that organizations in Africa with a Western co-founder raise more than twice the funds of African-run organizations. => 我最近从几位企业家那里获知，有西方联合创始人的非洲组织，能够筹集到比由非洲人负责管理的组织多一倍的资金。
This financial prejudice is visible elsewhere, too, and it is perpetuating the dearth of local talent. => 这一金融偏见随处可见，导致地方人才永久性流失。
The pro-Western bias should worry everyone working to build better communities for our children. => 对于任何致力于为儿童创造更好的社区的人来说，亲西方的偏见值得忧虑。

Personal experience is the best way to create agents for change, because it underpins people’s long-term, personal investment in dismantling systems that exacerbate inequity and injustice. => 个人经验是最好的变化催化剂，因为它能够在一个不平等和不公平不断加剧的分崩离析的系统中支持人们的长期个人投资。
What would it look like if the leaders overhauling such systems were cultivated from the very communities that needed them most? => 如果修补这些系统的领导者正是从最需要他们的社区中长大，情况会怎么样？
Some organizations are answering that question already. => 一些组织已经开始回答这个问题了。

More than 12,000 people have applied to join Teach For Nigeria, a national organization that recruits, trains, and places young teachers in high-need schools. => 12,000多人申请加入尼日利亚教育计划（Teach For Nigeria ） 。 这是一个全国性组织，招募和培训年轻教师，然后分配到急需他们的学校。
We call this powerful grouping of change-agents “collective leadership,” and we believe it is the only way to ensure positive, lasting change. => 我们将这个强大的变化推动者群体成为“集体领导者 ” ， 我们相信这是确保持续的积极变化的唯一方法。

Inadequate investment in locally led initiatives is one of the two ways in which we fail to ensure that those who are most affected by inequity have pathways to address it. => 地方领导的计划的投资不足是我们无法保证受不平等性影响最大的群体能够找到办法纠正这个问题的两大原因之一。
The second is the failure to invest in children. => 另一个原因是我们没有投资于儿童。
In Uganda, 70% of children do not complete primary school. => 在乌干达，70%的儿童无法完成小学学业。
Basic education is the foundation for our lifelong ability to analyze information, present ideas and opinions, and challenge the world around us. => 基础教育是我们分析信息、形成思想和观点、挑战周边世界的终身能力的基础。
And yet, in too many African communities, we are failing to invest in laying those foundations. => 但是，在太多非洲社区，我们并没有致力于投资这些基础。

Across the continent, educational attainment is sharply stratified: while 82% of children from the wealthiest families complete primary school, only 28% of children from the poorest families do. => 在整个非洲，入学率分层明显：82% 的富裕家庭儿童可以完成小学教育，而最贫穷家庭儿童的这一比例只有28 % 。

If the future of the continent is to be shaped by, or with, those who have most acutely experienced its challenges, programs like Teach for Nigeria and Teach for Ghana are essential. => 如果非洲的未来将由被这一挑战伤害最深的人所决定或影响，那么尼日利亚教育计划和加纳教育计划等项目就是至关重要的。
Imagine what could be accomplished if efforts to place local recruits in low-income schools were expanded. => 想象一下，如果能够将本地招募的教师分配到低收入学校的措施得到推广，会发生生么。

Some argue that education is meaningless if graduates cannot find work; in fact, job creation in Africa will be a major topic of discussion at the G20 summit. => 有人指出，如果毕业了找不到工作，那么教育就毫无意义；事实上，非洲就业创造也将是G20峰会的一个重大议题。

But while investment in business development and job creation is crucial for economic vitality and growth, it won’t happen without an educated workforce. => 但是，尽管企业发展和就业创造投资对于经济活力和增长至关重要，但如果没有受过教育的劳动力，一切都是空谈。
A robust job market presupposes a sufficient number of skilled workers to fill available jobs. => 强健的就业市场首先需要有足够多的高技能工人填补现成的工作岗位。
But in Sub-Saharan Africa, only 58% of children complete primary school. => 但在撒哈拉以南非洲，只有58% 的儿童能够从小学毕业。
This is why, when G20 leaders discuss new economic development strategies for Africa, they should focus on investment in education. => 正因如此，G20领导人在讨论新的非洲经济发展战略时，应该关注教育投资。
But, more important, they should seek to ensure that resources make it to those who rely on local leadership and innovation. => 但更重要的是，他们应该确保资源用于依靠地方领导力和创新的人。
Empowering the Other Half of Africa’s Economy => 赋权非洲经济的另一半
But, two decades later, Africa remains divided along a key fault line: gender. => ”但是，二十年过去了，仍然有一条断层线将非洲一分为二，那就是性别。

To realize Nyerere’s vision of a strong, dignified continent, Africa needs a new era of liberation, one that is fueled by the economic empowerment of the continent’s women. => 要想实现尼雷尔的让非洲成为一个强大的、有尊严的大洲的愿景，非洲需要一个自由的新时代，为非洲妇女经济赋权能够为这个时代增添动力。

It is obvious that while many Africans have benefited from political emancipation – the legacy of Nyerere’s generation – poverty remains a significant obstacle. => 显然，尽管许多非洲人从政治解放中获益 — — 这是尼雷尔这一代人留下的遗产 — — 但贫困仍然是一个巨大的障碍。
Unleashing the employment potential of African women is the best way to overcome it. => 释放非洲妇女的就业潜力，是克服这一障碍的最佳办法。

As it stands, Africa’s women continue to be underrepresented in key industries and executive roles, owing to workplace discrimination and patriarchal expectations at home. => 目前，非洲妇女在重要行业和管理岗位上仍然鲜有代表人物，造成这一现象的原因是职场歧视和父权家庭。
But while women are essential to the continent’s progress, they are still too often regarded as being secondary. => 但是，尽管妇女对于非洲的进步至关重要，她们仍然常被视为二等公民。

Women must therefore claim their right to sit where decisions are made, and to shape the policies, plans, and strategies that will affect their lives and the lives of Africans for generations to come. => 因此，妇女必须主张她们参与决策的权利，主张她们参与影响她们以及未来非洲人民生活的政策、计划和战略的权利。
Studies have shown that if more women had access to male-dominated occupations in Africa, worker productivity would rise by as much as 25%. => 研究表明，如果更多的非洲妇女能够获得男性主宰的职位，劳动生产率将提高多达 25 % 。
That would be good for the overall economy, but also for women in general, as it would open up new avenues for social empowerment. => 这对于总体经济来说是一个好消息，对一般妇女来说也是好消息，因为这会打开新的社会赋权之门。

When women participate in the job market and engage actively in business or political decision-making, patriarchal power dynamics shift, elevating the social status of women. => 如果妇女能够进入就业市场，积极参与商业或政治决策，父权社会的动态就会发生改变，提高妇女的社会地位。
Economic equality also challenges accepted beliefs, and dispels harmful myths that perpetuate narrow definitions of gender norms. => 经济平等也在挑战现有的信念，消除让狭隘的性别规范大行其道的有害的传说。
In other words, bringing more women into the workplace leads to an emancipation of mindset – in men and women alike. => 换句话说，让更多妇女进入职场，能够带来解放思维 — — 不管是对男性还是对女性。
What Nyerere so eloquently said of Africa as a whole is no less true for its women: unity is the key to realizing our potential. => 尼雷尔对于非洲的雄辩之辞，对于非洲妇女同样成立：联合是实现我们的潜力的关键。

When we come together as generators of wealth, it becomes impossible for us to go unrecognized for our economic contributions and marginalized in our entrepreneurial endeavours. => 当我们拧成一股绳，成为财富的创造者，我们的经济贡献就不会得不到承认，我们在我们的创业努力中也不会被边缘化。

At the Graça Machel Trust, we are joining together with civil-society actors, the private sector, and governments across the continent to lead a new economic liberation movement for women. => 在格拉夏·马谢尔信托，我们与全非洲的公民社会行动方、私人部门和政府合作，领导着一场妇女经济解放运动。

Divided, we are weak, but together, Africa’s women have the ability to confront and overcome the barriers that have kept us from full participation in our respective economies. => 分则弱，但如果我们能够合在一起，非洲妇女就有能力面对和克服让我们无法充分参与到各自经济中的障碍。
There is power in networks. => 网络存在力量。

The inaugural Women Advancing Africa Forum will take place this week in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania, and will convene more than 250 women leaders from across the continent. => 妇女推动非洲论坛将于本周在坦桑尼亚达累斯萨拉姆正式起航，届时将有来自非洲各地的250多位妇女领袖与会。
We aim to emerge from the Forum with a common agenda for our participation as full economic actors. => 我们的目标是通过论坛形成一个共同日程，让我们成为全面的经济参与者。
It has been just over 20 years since Nyerere encouraged us to work toward African unity. => 尼雷尔鼓励我们致力于非洲的联合不过20年。
Today, Africa’s women are helping to shape the policies and practices that will bring about economic and social liberation in their respective countries. => 如今，非洲妇女正在影响能给各自国家带来经济和社会解放的政策和实践。
We have some way to go before African unity is fully realized. => 充分实现非洲联合还有很长的路要走。
But enabling women to become full partners in Africa’s economic future, is among the best ways to ensure that we succeed. => 但让妇女成为非洲经济未来的全面伙伴，则是确保我们能够成功的最佳办法之一。
Capitalizing on Africa’s Youth Dividend => 利用非洲的年轻人红利
It was a pivotal moment in South Africa’s history, as young people rose to demand quality and accessible education. => 这场运动也是南非的一个历史转折点，年轻人开始站起来要求高品质的普及教育。

But a crucial question was missing from the debate over fees and curricular relevance: how can changes to higher education empower Africa’s youth to drive the continent’s economic transformation? => 但这场关于学费和课程的争论遗漏了一个关键问题：更高的教育程度如何让非洲青年赢得力量，推动非洲经济转型？
For Africa, the question is no longer “if” students are taught, but “what.” => 对非洲来说，学生受到教育已经不是“是否”的问题，而是学到“什么”的问题。
Technical and vocational education and training (TVET) programs have also suffered from neglect. => 技术和在职教育和培训（TVET）也因为不受重视而蒙受损失。

Today, these initiatives are marked by outdated courses and rote learning methods that fail to prepare young people for the demands of the twenty-first-century job market. => 如今，这些项目课程陈旧，学习方法呆板，无法让年轻人适应二十一世纪就业市场的需求。
Though neglected, it is these skills that enable young people to become adaptable, lifelong learners. => 尽管这些技能不受重视，但它们能让年轻人成为适应能力卓著的终身学习者。
The mastery of soft skills correlates to improved outcomes in school, work, and life. => 掌握软技能与学业、工作和生活结果的改善之间存在相关性。
Yet, until recently, training in soft skills has not been integrated into formal education systems on the continent. => 但是，直到最近，软技能的训练仍然没有纳入非洲的正规教育体系中。
Fortunately, that is changing. => 幸运的是，情况正在起变化。

These adjustments are coming at a critical time for Africa, where many countries are experiencing a demographic dividend of declining fertility rates and rising productivity. => 这些调整的到来正逢非洲的关键时刻。 许多非洲国家正在经历生育率下降、生产率提高的人口红利。
In particular, these changes mean more opportunity for young people as they prepare to enter the job market. => 特别是，这些变化意味着年轻人在准备进入就业市场时可以获得更多机会。
But to succeed on the job, young people must have the skills and education that a modern economy requires. => 但要取得职场成功，年轻人必须具备现代经济所要求的技能和教育。

One of the continent’s most successful efforts already underway is the USAID-funded Akazi Kanoze Youth Livelihoods Project, designed by the Education Development Center (EDC) in Boston. => 目前，非洲正在实施的最成功的项目之一是美国国际开发署赞助的阿卡兹·卡诺泽年轻人生计计划（Akazi Kanoze Youth Livelihoods Project ） ， 该计划由波士顿的教育发展中心（Education Development Center ，EDC）制定。

The focus on personal development, interpersonal communication, and leadership training has ensured that students are well equipped to enter the labor market upon graduation. => 其注重个人发展、人际沟通和领导力培训的做法确保了学生充分做好了一毕业就能进入劳动力市场的准备。
Rwanda’s Ministry of Education has already moved to integrate elements of the program in TVETs across the country. => 卢旺达教育部已经准备将该计划的药物纳入到全国TVWT项目中。

The government recently integrated Akazi Kanoze’s approach in the national curriculum to equip secondary and TVET students with the soft skills they require to succeed. => 卢旺达政府最近在全国课程体系中纳入了阿卡兹·卡诺泽计划的方法，让中等学校和TVET学生具备取得成功所需要的软技能。
National exams in the 2018-2019 academic year will also reflect the new competency-based curriculum. => 2018—2019学年国家统考也将体现新的基于能力的课程。

Since 2009, Akazi Kanoze trainings have prepared more than 37,000 youth for work, with more than 65% of participants in the initial round of training employed six months after graduation. => 2009年以来，阿卡兹·卡诺泽计划培训了37,000多位年轻人，其中65%的首轮培训参与者在毕业后六个月内找到了工作。

Based on the success of integrating soft skills into the curriculum in Rwanda, The MasterCard Foundation and EDC will launch a similar program in Senegal later this year. => 基于在卢旺达取得了将软技能纳入课程的成功，万事达卡基金会和EDC将在今年晚些时候在塞内加尔启动一项类似的计划。
Case studies from Skills at Scale highlight six components to a successful skills-training initiative. => 来自《大规模技能》的案例研究强调了成功的技能培训计划的六个要素。
Change is not without challenge. => 改变不是没有挑战的。
Adapting models of skills training to vastly different education systems across Africa will take time. => 调整技能培训模式依适应非洲多变的教育体系需要时间。
It will also be difficult to ensure that intensive training models reach all young people, including those no longer in school. => 确保密集培训模式触及所有年轻人，包括早已不在上学的人也将十分困难。
New curriculum content also requires developing new teaching and learning materials. => 新的课程内容还要求开发新的教学和学习材料。
Achieving scale also requires a markedly different approach to training teachers than is currently on offer in most African school systems. => 实现规模还需要采取与大部分非洲学校体系现行做法截然不同的方法去培训老师。
Trainings must go beyond traditional, one-off approaches, by providing ongoing teacher support. => 培训必须超越传统的一次性方法，而要持续提供教师支持。
New pedagogies also require continual supervision and practice, especially early on. => 新的教学法还需要洲级监督和实践，特别是在早期。
The old “cascade” model of teacher training simply won’t work. => 旧的教师培训“阶梯 ” （ cascade）模式已经完全失去了效果。

African governments, with support from the international community, can help students’ transition from school to work by relying on a curriculum that elevates the importance of soft skills. => 在国际社会的帮助下，非洲政府可以通过强调软技能的重要性的课程，帮助学生从校园到工作岗位的转型。
If done well, these changes can ensure young people are positioned to drive Africa’s future prosperity. => 如果顺利的话，这些变化能够确保年轻人推动非洲的未来繁荣。
Africans deserve a forward-looking education system, not one that remains stuck in the past. => 非洲人民理应获得具有前瞻性，而不是陷在过去难以自拔的教育体系。
As students in South Africa demonstrated last year, the continent’s youth will settle for nothing less. => 南非学生在去年已经证明，只有这样才能令非洲年轻人满足。
A Big Bond for Africa => 非洲大债券
LAGOS – The countries of Sub-Saharan Africa have reached a critical juncture. => 拉各斯—撒哈拉以南非洲诸国走到了关键时刻。

Strained by a collapse in commodity prices and China’s economic slowdown, the region’s growth slipped to 3.4% in 2015 – nearly 50% lower than the average rate over the previous 15 years. => 受困于大宗商品价格暴跌和中国经济减速，2015年该地区增长率下滑到3.4 % — —比此前15年的平均水平低了近50 % 。
The estimated growth rate for 2016 is lower than the population growth rate of about 2%, implying a per capita contraction in GDP. => 2016年预计增长率更是低于2%左右的人口增长率，这意味着人均GDP将有所下降。
Sustained economic growth is essential to maintain progress on reducing poverty, infant mortality, disease, and malnutrition. => 持续的经济增长对于保持降低贫困、婴儿死亡率、疾病和营养不良等方面的进步至关重要。
It is also the only way to create sufficient good jobs for Africa’s burgeoning youth population – the fastest growing in the world. => 保持经济增长也是为不断膨胀的年轻人口创造足够的优质岗位的唯一办法 — — 非洲年轻人口增长率为世界之最。

One way to sustain growth and create jobs would be to collaborate on planning and implementing a massive increase in infrastructure investment across Africa. => 保持增长、创造就业的一个办法是在整个非洲共同规划和实施大规模增加基础设施投资。
Public infrastructure is particularly important. => 公共基础设施尤其重要。
Major regional projects are also needed to knit together Sub-Saharan Africa’s many tiny economies. => 撒哈拉以南非洲的许多微型经济体也需要通过大型地区项目联系在一起。

This is the only way to create the economies of scale needed to increase the export potential of African agriculture and industry, as well as to reduce domestic prices of food and manufactured goods. => 这是创造规模经济的唯一办法，而国模经济则是提升非洲农业和工业出口潜力，以及降低食品和制造品的国内价格的必要条件。

Yet aid from Africa’s traditionally generous foreign donors, including the United States and Europe, is now set to shrink, owing to political and economic constraints. => 但传统的慷慨出资者，包括美国和欧洲，目前都因为政治和经济约束而准备缩减援助。
But there may be a solution that helps Africa recover its growth in a way that Western leaders and their constituents find acceptable. => 但也许存在一种办法，可以帮助非洲增长恢复，并且被西方领导人和他们的选民所接受。

We call it the “Big Bond” – a strategy for leveraging foreign aid funds in international capital markets to generate financing for massive infrastructure investment. => 我们称之为“大债券 ” — —利用外国援助资金作为国际资本市场杠杆，为大规模基础设施投资筹集融资。
Specifically, donors would borrow against future aid flows in capital markets. => 具体而言，出资者可以在资本市场中，根据未来援助流贷款。
That way, they could exploit current low interest rates at home, as they generate new resources. => 如此，它们可以利用目前本国的低利率来开源。
With 30-year US Treasury rates of about 3%, donors would have to securitize only about $5 billion to raise $100 billion. => 30年美国国债利率大约在3 % ， 出资者只需要证券化大约50亿美元，就能筹集1,000亿美元。

That money could come from the $35 billion in annual official development assistance (ODA) to Africa (which totals about $50 billion) that takes the form of pure grants. => 这笔钱可以来自每年对非洲的纯捐赠形式的350亿官方发展援助（ODA，总量大约为500亿美元 ） 。
Donors would pass on the interest cost to African countries, reducing their own fiscal costs. => 出资者可以将利息成本砖家给非洲国家，降低它们自身的财政负担。
For African countries, the terms would be better than those provided by Eurobonds. => 对非洲国家来说，条件也要优于欧元债券所提供的条件。
In fact, as audacious as it may sound, passing on the interest costs to recipient countries could actually bolster their debt sustainability. => 事实上，尽管这听上去有些冒险，将利息成本转嫁给受资国实际上可以加强它们的债务可持续性。
Moreover, far longer maturities and grace periods, compared to market finance, would ease growing pressure on foreign-exchange reserves. => 此外，与市场融资相比远远更长的期限和宽限期将缓解对外汇储备的压力。
Frontloading aid in this way is not new. => 这种形式的前置援助并非新事物。
Doing so in the early 2000s to finance vaccines saved millions of lives in the developing world. => 21世纪初，以这种方式进行的疫苗融资拯救了数百万发展中国家的生命。
Such projects could also be co-financed by private investors. => 这些项目也可以与私人投资者合作共同融资。
Moreover, the Big Bond could help to reinvigorate the relationship between donors and African countries. => 此外，大债券有助于重振出资者和非洲国家之间的关系。

The Big Bond approach represents a much-needed update to the ODA framework – one that supports higher and more sustainable growth in recipient countries, while lowering the burden on donor countries. => 大债券方针是代表着ODA框架所急需的一个升级方向 — — 它能支持受资国更高、更可持续的增长，同时减轻出资国的负担。

At a time when aid is under political pressure, perhaps such a bold approach to maximizing the efficiency of donor resources is exactly what the world needs. => 如今，援助饱受政治压力，或许这一大胆的最大化援助资源效率的方针正是全世界所需要的。
Accelerating Africa’s Energy Transition => 加快非洲能源转型
PARIS – For much of Africa, the transition from fossil fuels to cleaner forms of energy is seen as an environmental imperative. => 巴黎—在非洲大部，从化石燃料向更清洁的能源形式的转型被视为一项环境当务之急。

With fossil fuels comprising a majority – as high as 70% in some cases – of the energy mix, the situation on the continent is indeed ecologically dire. => 化石燃料在一些地区占能源构成的大多数 — — 高达70 % — —非洲的形势确实非常不利于生态。
But Africa’s energy transition is economically urgent as well. => 但从经济上说，非洲也迫切需要能源转型。
Each year, oil subsidies consume 1.5% of the continent’s GDP – roughly $50 billion. => 非洲每年的石油补贴高达500亿美元左右，相当于全洲GDP的1.5 % 。
That is enough money to provide solar power to some 300 million people. => 这笔钱足以为3亿人提供太阳能。

If the continent could rebalance its energy portfolio, moving away from hydrocarbons slowly, those subsidies could be reallocated in ways that would yield both environmental and economic benefits. => 如果非洲能够实现能源组合再平衡，逐渐摆脱碳氢化合物，那么这些补贴就能转作其他用途，产生环境和经济效益。
Today, neither oil exporters nor importers are adequately insulated from price shocks. => 如今，石油出口国和进口国都无法避免受到价格冲击的影响。
When oil prices declined rapidly in 2015, for example, Africa’s energy importers spent less on oil, while exporting countries suffered financially. => 2015年，比如，石油价格迅速下跌，非洲能源进口国的石油支出有所下降，而出口国则蒙受经济损失。

When prices rebounded, the relationship switched: energy-exporting countries’ revenues inched up, while importing countries struggled to maintain consumption levels. => 当结果反弹时，关系正好相反，能源出口国收入增加，而进口国难以维持消费水平。
This is a needless cycle. => 这是一个毫无必要的循环。
Integrating cleaner power into national energy systems would not only raise local capacities; it would also free up hydrocarbons for export. => 将更清洁的电力纳入国家能源体系不但能够提高地方产能；还能释放更多碳氢化合物用于出口。
The resulting revenue could then be invested into new forms of greener power. => 由此获得的收入可以投资于新型绿色电力。
Such a transition, which would require cooperation with the oil sector, promises to boost socioeconomic progress. => 这一转型需要石油部门的合作，有望对社会经济进步起到刺激作用。
Among the biggest benefits would be the electrification of areas that, under current distribution systems, are literally in the dark. => 收益最大的某些地区的电气化。 在这些地区，以目前的配电系统，可以说是还生活在黑暗时代。
Today, just 30% of Africa has access to reliable electricity. => 如今只有30%的非洲地区能够获得可靠电力。
But, with a total capacity estimated at around ten terawatts, installed solar capacity in Africa could broaden access dramatically. => 但非洲建成太阳能装机容量据估计达到了十万亿瓦，可以大大扩大电力的普及。
In fact, according to some estimates, the increase in solar generation by 2030 could range from 15 to 62 gigawatts. => 事实上，据某些估算，到2030年，太阳能发电量可以提高15到62十亿瓦。

Electrifying agricultural areas would facilitate the storage and transportation of farmed products, improve food security, and increase farmers’ earning capacity. => 电气化农业区能够便利农作物的储存和 运输，改善粮食安全，提高农民的收入能力。
In the drive to rebalance Africa’s energy mix, the continent maintains one crucial advantage over developed economies: a clean slate. => 在实现能源组合的再平衡的过程中，非洲拥有一个相对于发达经济体的重要优势：非洲是一块白板。
The relative absence of legacy investments is the principal reason why green power is Africa’s best energy option. => 历史包袱相对较小是使绿色电力成为非洲最佳能源选择的主要原因。
Evidence of this potential can be found in the few photovoltaic power plants that have begun operating in Africa. => 这一潜力有多大？ 从非洲已经开始运行的少数光伏发电厂可见一斑。

For example, the Senergy 2 solar plant in Senegal sells electricity to the Senegalese power utility at a price that lowers the cost of the energy mix by 50%. => 比如，塞内加尔的Senergy 2太阳能电站向塞内加尔电网出售的电价能让能源总成本下降50 % 。
Similar solar solutions are being implemented by African telecoms to electrify communication towers. => 类似的太阳能方案也被非洲电信公司用于给通讯塔供电。

The best way to accelerate the transition from hydrocarbons to greener forms of energy would be to redirect a portion of national oil subsidies to renewables. => 加快从碳氢化合物到绿色能源的转型的最佳办法是将一部分国家石油补贴用于可再生能源。
This would create stronger incentives to reduce fossil-fuel consumption, while encouraging investment and growth in green-energy output. => 这将带来更强的激励去降低化石燃料消费，同时鼓励绿色能源产出的投资和增长。

For Africa’s rural regions, moreover, such policies would help bring communities out of darkness and lead to the installation of other critical infrastructure that economic growth requires. => 此外，对非洲农村地区来说，这类政策还有助于让社区摆脱黑暗，建造其他经济增长所需要的重要基础设施。

But while renewables hold the key to Africa’s long-term prosperity, the continent’s transition to cleaner power should not lead to an immediate, full-scale repudiation of hydrocarbons. => 但尽管可再生能源是非洲长期繁荣的关键，非洲向清洁电力的转型也不应该立刻一刀切地否定碳氢化合物。
The oil sector will still have an important role to play. => 石油部门仍将扮演重要的角色。
The industry’s experience on the continent will be needed to navigate the energy transformation. => 非洲需要石油业的经验来完成能源转型。
And, because fossil fuels will remain part of the continent’s energy mix, the oil sector must be encouraged to clean up its own act. => 而由于化石燃料仍然是非洲能源组合的一部分，因此也必须鼓励石油业向清洁化方向发展。
This may sound like an impossible alliance. => 这听上去像是一个不可能的联盟。
Cooperation between old and new energy industries may be the only engine that is capable of powering Africa forward. => 新旧能源业的合作可能是能够推动非洲向前的唯一引擎。
Africa’s Vaccination Test => 非洲的疫苗考验
Fulfilling that commitment will be no easy feat. => 兑现这一承诺绝不容易。
Immunization is not just a health issue; it is also an economic challenge. => 免疫不仅是一个卫生问题，也是一个经济挑战。
The case for vaccination is strong. => 支持疫苗的理由很充分。
Globally, an estimated 2-3 million child deaths and 600,000 adult deaths are prevented annually through immunization. => 全球而言，每年有约200-300万儿童死亡和60万成人死亡通过免疫得以预防。
Moreover, immunization is considered one of the most cost-effective public-health interventions for reducing child morbidity, mortality, and disability. => 此外，免疫被认为是性价比最高的降低儿童患病、死亡和残疾的公共卫生干预措施。
A recent study estimates that every dollar spent on vaccination will save $16 in costs of illnesses averted. => 一项最新研究估算，花在疫苗上的每一美元可以节约16美元的疾病预防成本。
Accounting for the value individuals place on longer and healthier lives, net returns on investments in immunization soar to some 44 times the cost. => 考虑到个人对更长的寿命和更健康的生活的重视，免疫投资的净回报高达成本的44倍。
And net returns exceed costs for all vaccines. => 并且净回报超过所有疫苗的成本。
Significant progress has been made. => 我们已经取得了长足进步。
In 2014, 86% of children were immunized against diphtheria, tetanus, and pertussis, compared to less than 5% in 1974. => 2014年，86%的儿童接受了白喉，破伤风，百日咳免疫，而1974年还不到5 % 。
And there have been extraordinary advances in the number and kinds of vaccines that are available. => 在可用疫苗的数量和种类方面也取得了重大突破。
Yet, worldwide, an estimated 18.7 million infants are not being reached by routine immunization services. => 但是，全球而言，仍有约1,870万婴儿不能获得常规免疫。
The problem, of course, is access. => 当然，问题在于普及。
Detailed analysis of immunization reveals significant disparities within and across countries. => 非洲各国的详细免疫分析表明，各国国内和各国之间存在巨大差异。

Routine immunization coverage remains particularly low in Africa; indeed, it has stagnated over the last three years, against a backdrop of weak and under-resourced health systems. => 非洲常规免疫覆盖率仍然非常低；事实上，该覆盖率在过去三年保持停滞，原因是卫生体系薄弱、资源不足。
As a result, one in five African children still do not receive lifesaving vaccination. => 结果，非洲五分之一的儿童仍得不到救命的疫苗。
In 2014, an estimated 42% of all global deaths from measles were in Africa. => 2014年，大约42%的全球麻疹致死病例发生在非洲。
Most of Africa’s under-immunized children live in Nigeria, Ethiopia, the DRC, South Sudan, and Guinea. => 大部分免疫不足的非洲儿童生活在尼日利亚、埃塞俄比亚、民主刚果、南非、埃塞俄比亚和几内亚。
Poor people, those living in rural areas, and families with lower education levels comprise the majority of those who are not reached. => 穷人、农村人口和教育层次较低家庭占未得到免疫覆盖儿童的大部分。
Clearly, money is a leading factor shaping immunization outcomes. => 显然，钱是决定免疫结果的首要因素。

Beyond inadequately financed health systems, which remain weak and inefficient, especially in rural areas, African countries face challenges in affording new, more expensive vaccines. => 除了资金不足、依然薄弱和低效的卫生体系（特别是在农村地区 ） ， 非洲国家还面临无力承担更加昂贵的新疫苗的挑战。
New vaccines should be enabling us to save more lives. => 新疫苗应该让我们得以拯救更多声明。

Yet Médecins Sans Frontières estimates that the introduction of new vaccines made it 68 times more expensive to vaccinate a child in 2014 than in 2001 in most African countries. => 但无国界医生组织估计，引入新疫苗导致大部分非洲国家2014年接种一名儿童的成本比2001年增加了68倍。
Another study showed that in 2001, the total cost of the original set of six World Health Organization-recommended vaccines was less than one dollar. => 另一项研究表明，2001年世界卫生组织最初推荐的六种疫苗总成本不到一美元。
In 2014, the number of WHO-recommended vaccines had risen to 11 – and the cost had reached about $21 for boys and $35 for girls. => 2014年，世卫组织推荐的疫苗种类增加到11种 — — 成本也高达男孩约21美元，女孩约35美元。

The added costs of delivery, currently estimated at about $25 per child, bring the total cost of fully immunizing a child today to $50-60. => 如今，打疫苗的新增成本 — — 目前大约为每名儿童25美元 — — 让一名儿童获得充分免疫的总成本达到了50—60美元。

That same study found that, in many low- and middle-income countries, immunization budgets are currently insufficient to sustain vaccination programs, much less incorporate the new costlier vaccines. => 同一项研究表明，在许多中低收入国家，目前的免疫预算不足以维持疫苗项目，更不用说纳入新的昂贵疫苗了。

As several health ministers pointed out in Addis Ababa, high vaccine prices force poor countries’ governments to make tough choices about which deadly diseases they can afford to prevent. => 一些国家的卫生部长在亚的斯亚贝巴指出，高昂的疫苗价格迫使穷国政府需要作出承担预防哪些致命疾病的成本的艰难选择。
Without eligibility for the lower prices obtained by Gavi, many of these countries may not be able to afford newer vaccines. => 许多失去了获得Gavi的低价的国家可能无法承担更新的疫苗。

In order to cope with this challenge, African political leaders have committed to invest in the continent’s capacity to develop and produce its own vaccines. => 为了应对这一挑战，非洲政治领导人已承诺投资建设非洲开发和生产自己的疫苗的能力。
But this is a long-term strategy that will require coordinated regional investment planning, market development, and stronger regulatory capabilities. => 单这一长期战略需要互相协调的地区投资规划、市场开发和更强的监管能力。
In the short to medium term, African countries would do well to look into the power of collective bargaining to strike better deals for needed vaccines. => 在短期和中期，非洲国家最好着眼于集体讨价还价力量，为需要的疫苗争取更好的合同。

While Africa can and should do more to improve vaccination, the global community also has a responsibility to make a concerted effort to bring down vaccine costs. => 非洲可以也应该为改善疫苗做出更多，单全球社会也有责任共同努力降低疫苗成本。
The recently announced reduction in the price of pneumococcal vaccine is a step in the right direction, but it is not enough. => 最新宣布的降低肺炎球菌疫苗价格的决定是迈向正确方向的一步，但仍不足够。

Without collective action, equitable and sustained access to immunization in Africa will remain a major problem – and children’s lives will continue to be lost. => 如果不采取集体行动，平等且持续地为非洲提供免疫仍将是一个重大问题 — — 儿童的生命也将继续流失。
Africa’s Avoidable AIDS Crisis => 可以避免的非洲艾滋病危机
“This is a land,” they sang, => 最近，我在乌干达最大的艾滋病医院目睹了一场盛大的生命礼赞。 表演者是一群非洲年轻人，有歌手、鼓手和舞者，年龄从8岁至28岁不等。
“Where beautiful people => “这片土地上生活着美丽的人民 ， ” 他们唱道，
Laugh and dance in harmony. => “他们微笑，他们舞蹈，一切是那么和谐。
Africa. => “非洲。
O Africa.” => 哦，非洲。 ”

And, indeed, these young people laughed and danced not only in harmony but with a joie de vivre that lit up their faces and filled us all with happiness. => 而事实上，这些年轻人的笑容和舞蹈不仅和谐，而且带有一种生存之乐，使他们脸上放出光彩，也使我们所有人充满欢乐。
Listening, it was hard to imagine that they could easily be dead – and would be, if not for this clinic. => 听吧，很难想象死亡离他们近在咫尺 — — 而如果没有这座医院的话，他们也许早已离开人世了。
Each of those splendid performers is living with HIV. => 这些出色的表演者都是艾滋病病毒（HIV）携带者。
Some arrived at the clinic so ill that they could scarcely walk. => 其中一些人来到这家医院的时候已经病得无法走路了。
Others showed few symptoms but, having tested positive, came to be treated. => 其他人来的时候虽然没有什么症状，但检查均呈阳性。
They were mothers and fathers, sisters and brothers, children and grandparents. => 他们中有的是父母亲，有的是兄弟姐妹，有的是祖孙。
All were alive and healthy for one reason only: the Joint Clinical Research Center in Kampala, and the drugs that it provides them. => 他们能够活下来，完全是因为位于坎帕拉的这家联合临床研究中心及其提供的药物。
Uganda was the epicenter of the AIDS epidemic. There the scourge began in earnest; there (as elsewhere in Africa) it exacts its highest toll. => 乌干达是艾滋病流行的中心地带，是艾滋病最先爆发的地方，也是（和非洲其他地区一样）艾滋病发病率最高的地方。
Yet Uganda is also a success story. => 但乌干达在防治艾滋病方面做的很好。

A decade ago, fewer than 10,000 people were taking the new generation of antiretroviral drugs that suppress the disease and offer the promise of a normal life. => 十年前，只有不到10 000人能够获得新一代艾滋病特效药抗逆转录酶病毒药物从而转危为安。

Today, that figure is 200,000, thanks in large measure to generous support from the United States (under its PEPFAR program) and the Global Fund in Geneva. => 今天，这一数字达到了200 000，这离不开美国（通过其PEPFAR项目）和日内瓦全球基金的慷慨支持。
We have seen similarly encouraging progress elsewhere. => 其他地方也能看见类似的可喜进展。

South Africa, with the largest number of people living with HIV, has spent nearly $1 billion over the past year in an ambitious counseling and testing campaign to roll back the epidemic. => HIV携带人口数量最多的南非去年花费了近10亿美元用于艾滋病咨询和检查项目，以此来对其进行控制。
But there is a new and growing danger that these advances might not be sustained. => 但一个新的威胁已经出现并在日益严重，使得这些进步有可能无法持续。
Peter Mugyenyi, who runs the Joint Clinical Research Center, told me that part of the problem is the sheer weight of numbers. => 联合临床研究中心主任彼得·莫缘依（Peter Mugyenyi）告诉我，问题的一部分是数字的分量太轻。
In Uganda, only about half of those with HIV/AIDS are being treated. => 在乌干达，只有一半的艾滋病患者/HIV携带者获得了医治。
Meanwhile, money for treatment is drying up. => 同时，医疗资金正在枯竭。
Because of the global recession, some international donors are threatening to cap their financial support. => 由于全球衰退，一些国际赞助者警告将对财务支持进行限制。
Countries such as Malawi, Zimbabwe, and Kenya, as well as Uganda, are requesting assistance for emergency drug supplies. => 马拉维、津巴布韦、肯尼亚和乌干达等国家正在要求紧急药物供给援助。
In Kampala, Dr. Mugyenyi has begun placing new patients on a waiting list. => 在坎帕拉，莫缘依医生已经开始将新的求医者纳入候诊名单中。
As many as seven million Africans who should be getting treatment for HIV are not. => 多达700万本应获得HIV治疗的非洲人没能获得治疗。
Worldwide, the number is about 10 million. => 而全球高达1 000万人。

Compounding the problem: donors have also been shifting their focus from AIDS to other diseases, because there is a sense that more lives can be saved more cheaply. => 雪上加霜的是，赞助者现在开始转向其他疾病，因为他们感觉这样可以用更少的钱救更多的人。
At a time when we should be scaling up to meet the AIDS challenge, we are dialing back. => 眼下正是一鼓作气击败艾滋病的时候，我们却自己打了退堂鼓。
In our global war on AIDS, the international community is on the verge of snatching defeat from the jaws of victory. => 在对艾滋病的斗争中，国际社会正在将唾手可得的胜利拱手让出。
Those who rallied to the fight are alarmed. They fear that the impressive gains of the last decade will be lost. => 这使得仍在战斗的斗士感到十分不安，担忧过去十年来取得的骄人战绩将付之东流。
“We are sitting on a time bomb,” Dr. Mugyenyi told me. => “我们正坐在定时炸弹上 ， ” 莫缘依医生告诉我。
Every day, he is forced into moral choices that no one should have to make. => 每天，他都面临着本可避免的良心选择。
How do you choose to treat a young girl but not her little brother? => 你怎么忍心治疗一个小女孩而放弃她的弟弟？
How do you turn away a pregnant mother, sitting with her children, crying for help? => 怎么忍心放弃和孩子坐在一起、乞求帮助的怀孕母亲？
Surely we can do better. => 毫无疑问，我们可以做得更多。
In Kampala, I promised my young friends that I would do everything I could to help. => 在坎帕拉，我向我的年轻朋友们承诺将尽我所能提供帮助。

In Washington recently, the United Nations rolled out an action plan that should dramatically accelerate progress on maternal and child health, including HIV. => 最近，联合国在华盛顿推出了一项旨在大幅加强母婴健康的行动计划， 其中就包括了艾滋病防治。
I left Uganda with a snatch of song that still echoes within my heart. => 在我离开乌干达的时候，那些歌声仍然在我心头萦绕。
Its inherent truth would be obvious, had you been there to see: => 歌声所表达的感情如此强烈，只要你到了那里，一定可以感受到：
We are still useful. => 我们仍是有用之材，
To our countries, to our families. => 能为国家和家庭做出贡献。
All we need is a way to live our days, => 我们需要活下去，
All we need is to survive in Africa. => 在非洲活下去。
Yes, times are hard. => 是的，世事艰难。
That is all the more reason to act out of compassion and with generosity. => 因此我们更加需要放开胸怀，不吝同情。
Africa’s Diaspora to the Rescue => 非洲海外移民拯救非洲

Almost everywhere, the media translates academic conclusions into graphic illustrations of brutality and despair in places such as Guinea and the Democratic Republic of Congo. => 几乎在每一个地方，媒体都在用几内亚和刚果民主共和国等地充满残暴和绝望气息的生动故事对这个学术结论进行着诠释。
But there is another, woefully under-reported, side to the story. => 但这个故事还有另外一个侧面，而媒体对这个侧面的报导却严重不足。

African countries that were locked out of international capital markets for most of the past five decades have largely been spared the twin woes of financial turmoil and economic downturn. => 过去50年来一直被封锁在国际资本市场外的非洲在很大程度上避开了金融动荡和经济衰退的双重困境。
The continent’s economies experienced a slowdown, but not a recession. => 非洲大陆的经济增长有所放缓，但却并没有陷入大规模的经济衰退。
Indeed, according to McKinsey & Company, Africa was the third-largest contributor to world economic growth in 2009, after China and India. => 事实上，根据麦肯锡公司的统计，非洲是2009年世界经济增长的第三大贡献者，非洲的贡献仅次于中国和印度。
Moreover, several African countries have received ratings from credit agencies, which has opened up global financial centers to them. => 此外，有几个非洲国家已经得到信用机构评级，这意味着信用机构的全球金融中心已经对这几个非洲国家开放。
In some cases, these ratings have proved equivalent to or higher than those of countries such as Turkey or Argentina. => 在某些情况下，非洲国家的评级已经超过了土耳其或阿根廷，或者至少也与之相当。
Stock exchanges are being established across the continent. => 非洲大陆到处都建立了证券交易所。
These developments have combined to improve African countries’ macroeconomic performance dramatically. => 这些成就共同改善了非洲国家的宏观经济状况。
Inflation has been halved since the 1990’s, and foreign-exchange reserves have increased 30%. => 20世纪90年代通胀降低了一半，而外汇储备则呈现30%的增长。
Public finances showed a 2.8%-of-GDP surplus in 2008, compared to a 1.4%-of-GDP deficit in 2000-2005. => 公共财政在2008年出现了占GDP2.8%的盈余，2000－2005年公共财政赤字在GDP中的占比曾为1.4 % 。
Savings rates are between 10% and 20%, and external debt has decreased from 110% of GDP in 2005 to 21% in 2008. => 储蓄率徘徊在10－20%之间，而外债则从2005年占GDP的110%下降到2008年占GDP的21 % 。
Since 2000, sub-Saharan African countries have achieved economic growth of 5-7%. => 从2000年以来，撒哈拉南部非洲国家已经实现了5-7%的经济增长。
Many factors have contributed to this upturn. => 多重因素共同促成了这次经济回暖的现状。
Emerging-market demand has pushed up commodity prices. => 新兴市场需求推高了商品价格。
Urbanization has given rise to a dynamic informal sector. => 城市化造就了一个活跃的非正规部门。
But transfers from the African diaspora stand out as the most significant contributing factor. => 但经济恢复最重要的贡献因素是世界各地非洲人的汇款。

For sub-Saharan African countries, remittances increased from $3.1 billion in 1995 to $18.5 billion in 2007, according to the World Bank, representing between 9% and 24% of GDP and 80-750% of ODA. => 根据世界银行的统计，撒哈拉以南非洲国家的汇款数额从1995年的31亿美元增长到2007年的185亿美元，这一数字的GDP占比在9%到24%之间，官方发展援助占比则为80－750 % 。
In this respect, there are three different strategies in place in Africa. => 在这方面，非洲目前存在三种不同的对策。
This approach, also adopted by Italy, contributes to reducing costs and increasing the overall volume of funds for beneficiaries. => 这种方式也被意大利所采用。 它有助于降低成本，增加受益人收到的汇款总额。
Finally, the Francophone approach relies on two types of monopoly. => 最后，两类垄断构成了法语国家对策的基础。
The first is enjoyed by Western Union, which controls up to 90% of the total formal transfer volume within Africa’s 16-member Franc Zone. => 其一是西联的垄断地位，该机构控制了非洲法郎区16国正式汇款高达90%的份额。
The second monopoly is exercised in the banking sector. => 法语国家的另外一重垄断存在于银行机构。
All other local banks have adopted the same approach, severely restricting access to financial services for households and entrepreneurs. => 当地其他银行也采用同样的策略，这严重限制了家庭和企业获取金融服务。

Despite the increasing importance of remittances from Italy, Spain, and the United States, the largest share in absolute terms still originates from France. => 尽管来自意大利、西班牙和美国的汇款占比越来越大，但绝对意义上的最大额度依然来自于法国。

Official statistics for 2009 are likely to show that migrants’ remittances fell sharply, as the global recession severely eroded job opportunities abroad. => 2009年的官方数据很可能显示移民汇款总额出现大幅度下降，下降的原因是全球经济衰退严重侵蚀了国外的就业机会。
Africa’s Dictator-Diplomat => 非洲的独裁者外交家

BRUSSELS – The recent death in Brussels of Ethiopian Prime Minister Meles Zenawi finally brings to light what lay behind his mysterious two-month disappearance from public life. => 布鲁塞尔—最近，埃塞俄比亚首相泽纳维（Meles Zenawi）在布鲁塞尔逝世，他近两个月以来从公众视野消失之谜终于随之解开。
Ethiopia’s government had strenuously denied rumors of serious ill health caused by liver cancer. => 埃塞俄比亚政府一直在否认关于他身患严重肝癌的传闻。

Now that the worst has, indeed, proven true, Ethiopia and all of East Africa will need to learn to live without the stabilizing influence of its great dictator-diplomat. => 如今，随着最坏的消息最后得到了证实，埃塞俄比亚和整个东非也因此需要学会如何在没了这位伟大的独裁外交家的稳定影响力的情况下生活。
Meles was certainly both. => 泽纳维毫无疑问兼具了双重身份。
Meles’s own political provenance as the leader of the Tigrayan People’s Liberation Front was Marxist-Leninist. => 泽纳维以提格雷人民解放阵线（Tigrayan People’s Liberation Front）领导人出身，其政治背景是马克思列宁主义的。
But, when the Cold War ended, so, too, did his dogmatism. => 但是，随着冷战的结束，他也抛弃了马列主义教条。

Once a basket-case associated in the world’s eyes only with famine and drought, Ethiopia has become one of Africa’s largest economies – and without the benefit of gold or oil. => 埃塞俄比亚曾是饥饿和干旱的代名词，但现如今它已成为非洲最大经济体之一 — — 而且是在不靠黄金和石油的情况下取得的。
Perhaps more important than Meles’s domestic achievements was his diplomatic record. => 也许比泽纳维的国内成就更重要的是他的外交记录。

He was an indispensable ally of the West in the fight against Islamist terrorism, culminating in Ethiopia’s military operation in neighboring Somalia in 2006. => 他是西方必不可少的对抗伊斯兰恐怖主义的盟友，2006年埃塞俄比亚对邻国索马里的军事行动是这一角色的巅峰之作。

More recently, Meles coordinated efforts with Kenya to stage limited strikes against the al-Shabaab militia, which has waged an unrelenting war to turn Somalia into a fundamentalist Islamic theocracy. => 最近，泽纳维与肯尼亚一起合作对青年军（al-Shabaab）进行了有限打击。 青年军一直在试图把索马里转变为原教旨伊斯兰神权国家。
At the same time, Meles courted China as both an investor and as a hedge against the West’s criticism of his human-rights record. => 与此同时，泽纳维还吸引中国，既作为投资者，也作为西方对其人权纪录批评的挡箭牌。

Meles will be sorely missed in Hargeisa, as he planned to run a Chinese-financed gas pipeline through Somaliland territory from the Ogaden to the coast. => 泽纳维将会被哈尔格萨（Hargeisa）人民永远铭记，因为他计划在索马里兰领土上建造一条从奥加登（Ogaden）到海边的输气管道，资金由中国提供。
The great stain on Meles’s record will always be his intolerance of dissent. => 对持异见者的不容忍是泽纳维的一大污点。
To be sure, his human-rights record was far better than the Derg’s. => 平心而论，他的人权纪录比军政府好多了。
For example, he allowed a private press to flourish, and in 2000 he became the first Ethiopian leader to hold multi-party parliamentary elections. => 比如，他允许私人出版社的经营，在2000年，他还成为首位主持多党议会选举的埃塞俄比亚领导人。

Moreover, compared to neighboring Eritrea under President Isaias Afewerki or Omar al-Bashir’s Sudan, his regime was by no means the worst offender in the region. => 此外，与阿费沃尔基（Isaias Afewerki）总统治下的厄立特里亚和巴希尔的苏丹等邻国相比，他的政权绝对称不上是该地区的头号罪犯。
Nor was there much evidence of personal enrichment or widespread corruption. => 埃塞俄比亚也没有多少中饱私囊和腐败横行的证据。
At the same time, he imposed increasingly strict central control on his ethnically and linguistically diverse country. => 与此同时，对于他统治的在种族和语言上多样化程度极高的国家，他采取了越来越严格的中央控制。

Although nominally governed by “ethnic federalism,” where this threatened secession, as in Oromia or the Ogaden, Meles was quick to ignore the constitutional set-up. => 尽管名义上埃塞俄比亚是“民族联邦制”国家，但若出现分裂危险 — — 比如奥罗米亚（Oromia）和奥加登 — — 泽纳维很快就放弃了这一宪法规定。
Although he strengthened religious freedom and peaceful coexistence between Muslims and Christians, the human-rights situation in Ethiopia remained poor. => 尽管他加强了宗教自由和穆斯林和基督徒之间的和平共存，但埃塞俄比亚的人权状况依然很差。
For example, groups like Freedom House and Human Rights Watch have documented widespread official repression of the Oromo people. => 比如，自由之家和人权观察等组织就报告说奥罗莫族遭受了普遍的官方压迫。
In the Horn of Africa, there is no leader of his stature who could ensure the stability and strong governance that the region so desperately needs. => 在非洲之角，没有人能像他那样能够确保该地区继续的稳定而强硬的治理。
Hailemariam Desalegn, Meles’s foreign minister, will take over Ethiopia’s government. => 泽纳维的外交部长德萨勒恩（Hailenmarian Desalegn）将执掌埃塞俄比亚政府。
For his admirers and critics alike, Meles leaves behind a potent political legacy. => 毁也好，誉也罢，泽纳维身后留下了强有力的政治遗产。
He will be remembered as an African leader of major historical significance: visionary, despotic, and indispensable. => 他将作为具有重大历史影响力的非洲领导人被人铭记：远见卓识、暴虐专横又不可或缺。
Africa’s Economic House Divided => 难以维系的非洲经济
DAKAR – The world economic downturn and financial-market tremors have strained budgets across Africa. => 达喀尔 — — 世界经济衰退和金融市场震荡已经导致非洲国家预算紧张。
With the exception of Ghana, and a few other states, in 2009 most African countries’ fiscal balances deteriorated. => 除加纳和少数几个其他国家之外，2009年绝大多数非洲国家的财政收支状况均呈现恶化态势。
In 2009, aggregate GDP growth in Africa averaged 1.6%, down from about 5.7% during the 2002-2008 period – but growth all the same. => 2009年，非洲各国合计平均GDP增长为1.6 % ， 较之2002－2008年间的5.7%有所下降，但仍然呈现增长态势。

Moreover, several African countries continued to implement long-term reforms to improve their business and investment climate, despite the daunting challenges presented by the crisis. => 此外，尽管面临金融危机的严峻挑战，但一些非洲国家仍继续推进改善商业和投资环境的长期改革措施。

Of course, numerous downside risks – adverse weather shocks, military conflict, and political turmoil – still can undermine the hard-earned benefits of this social and economic record. => 当然，恶劣天气的冲击、军事冲突和政治动荡等多种下行风险仍然可以破坏这一社会经济记录的来之不易的收益。
But it is the dichotomized nature of their economies and finances that represents Africa’s most intractable structural imbalance. => 但让非洲最棘手的结构性失衡却是其经济和金融结构的二元化属性。
Frankly, two Africa’s are emerging: a modern economy and a cash-based economy. => 坦率地说，有两个非洲正在崛起： 一个是现代经济的非洲，而另一个则是以现金为基础的经济。
National payment systems operate electronic-based payment products and services. => 国家支付系统推出一系列电子支付产品和服务。
Banks are provided with a facility to monitor their positions in real time and hence make cost-effective investment decisions. => 这套系统为银行提供实施监管头寸的相关工具，从而辅助它们做出符合成本效益原则的投资决策。
So far, only a few registered financial institutions, primarily offshoots of Western commercial banks, have access to such payment-system facilities. => 目前，只有西方商业银行分支机构等少数几家注册金融机构获准使用这套付款系统设施。

Non-banking financial institutions such as foreign exchange bureaus, post offices, and micro-finance lenders are not admitted, even when they are financially sound and sustainable. => 外汇局、邮局和小额信贷机构等非银行金融机构即使财务健全、有持续发展能力也没有资格进入。

These agreements lock out non-banking entities from the highly lucrative market for migrant remittances from the African diaspora, which remain a key engine of growth. => 上述协议将非银行机构排除在利润丰厚的非洲散居移民汇款市场之外，而散居移民汇款一直是非洲经济增长的重要引擎。
Yet rapid urbanization everywhere in Africa has given rise to a dynamic informal sector unconnected to the modern economy. => 但非洲各地快速城市化已经催生出一个与现代经济无关的活跃的非正规部门。
Although marginalized by African officials, this cash-based economy is a major contributor to the continent’s productive capacity. => 虽然被非洲官员边缘化，但上述以现金为基础的经济仍然是这块大陆生产率的主要贡献者。
It employs more than 90% of the workforce and is home to 75% of the retailers. => 这个部门吸纳了超过90%的劳动者和75%的零售业者。
But, despite the pivotal economic role that the informal sector plays, it has no access to conventional bank loans. => 但尽管上述非正规部门发挥了如此关键的经济作用，它仍然不具备获得传统银行贷款的资格。
Micro-finance institutions provide the only credit lines open to informal operators. => 微型金融机构提供了向非正规经营者们开放的唯一的信贷额度。
The micro-finance business model is based on lending that is guaranteed by the group. => 集体担保贷款是小额信贷的惯用商业模式。 这种模式进而转化为减轻信贷风险并鼓励付款纪律的休戚相关的网络和支持机制。

Nigeria has refrained from signing any exclusive agreements with Western Union and others, and its newly consolidated banking industry is making significant inroads across the region. => 尼日利亚已经拒绝与西联和其他企业签订独家协议，这个国家最新完成整合的银行业在区域内的进展非常迅速。

Rwanda, too, has enacted regulations that eliminate exclusive agreements, opening doors for micro-finance institutions to become payment-service providers. => 卢旺达也已经通过了废除独家协议的法规，并向小额信贷机构敞开大门，吸纳它们加入支付服务提供商的队伍。
The South African Reserve Bank has created a special platform within its national payment system for micro-finance institutions and non-banks. => 而南非储备银行已经在国家支付系统内部为小额信贷及非银行机构建立了一个特别的平台。
Malawi’s national payments system is directly accessible to non-bank participants, including third-party service providers. => 马拉维的国家支付系统直接对包括第三方服务提供商在内的非银行参与者开放。
It will also help facilitate access by the poorest to financial services, thus helping to reduce the high proportion of the un-banked population. => 这样也有助于底层贫困人口使用金融服务，从而降低不使用银行服务的人口比例。
All of this will invariably spur development and integration of national financial systems and intra-regional trade. => 所有这些总能促进国家金融系统和区内贸易的发展和整合。
Moreover, economic integration and increased intra-regional trade are the best entry point into global markets for all countries. => 此外，经济整合和加强区域贸易是所有国家进军全球市场的最佳切入点。
When it comes to analyzing what ails Africa, it is customary to dwell at length on the continent’s traumatic past. => 每每谈到对非洲存在问题的分析，人们总是习惯于不厌其烦地历数这块大陆满是创伤的过去。
Abraham Lincoln once said that a house divided cannot stand. => 亚伯拉罕·林肯曾经说过“不顺则不立 ” 。
