There is an economic corollary to this: an economic house divided cannot prosper. => 这句话在经济领域的推论是： 繁荣只能来自于高效顺畅的经济关系。
Africa’s Hard Black Gold => 非洲的硬黑金
LAGOS - Few infrastructure services in the developed world may be as taken for granted as electric power. => 拉各斯 - - 在发达国家中，没有什么基础设施服务项目比电力更为普及、人们更为习以为常的了。
To consumers in industrialized countries, uninterrupted power supply is a given. => 对于工业化国家的消费者而言，不中断的电力供应是天经地义的。

Not so in much of Africa, which experiences some of the world’s greatest power deficits, and where only two in ten people have access to electricity. => 但是这在非洲并非如此。 非洲的几个地方是全世界电力短缺最为严重的，只有百分之二十的人口有电力供应。
There is no shortage of hydropower plants for electricity generation in Africa. => 非洲并不乏水电站发电。
However, many of these plants are unable to keep up with rapid population growth and attendant increases in demand. => 但是，许多这些电站无法跟上快速人口增长以及随之而来的需求增加。

Furthermore, they are prone to frequent drought, which reduces their output significantly, leaving many as little more than decorative infrastructure landmarks. => 而且，这些电站还要受到频繁的干旱影响。 干旱会大幅度降低电力产量，使得很多电站成为基础设施点缀而已。
Increasingly burgeoning populations in countries like Nigeria and Ghana imply a greater extraction of water resources for power generation. => 尼日利亚和加纳等国人口越发膨胀，意味着要加大抽取水资源用于发电。
Rapid expansion of agricultural activity is requiring more and more water all across the continent. => 农业活动迅速扩大，对整个非洲大陆的用水提出了更高的需求。

Other resources like fuel oil, diesel, light crude, solar, and gas are also available as means of electricity generation, but their costs are all quite prohibitive. => 燃油、煤油、轻原油、太阳能以及天然气等其他资源也可以用于发电，但是它们的成本过高，无法供应。
These factors make a good argument for coal as a cheap alternative source of Africa's power. => 这些因素使得人们可以提出使用煤炭作为便宜的非洲电力替代资源。

Coal has historically played a crucial role as a source of energy worldwide, and has several important advantages over other fossil fuels.  First is its relative abundance. => 在历史上，煤炭作为全世界的能源来源发挥了关键作用，而且对于其他矿物燃料拥有几个重要的优势。
The current level of proven coal reserves worldwide stands at roughly 850 billion tons. => 首先是煤炭储量相对丰富。 目前全世界探明的煤炭储量大约是8500亿吨。
Africa has about 50 billion tons. => 非洲有大约500亿吨。
Coal is also much more widely distributed geographically than any other fossil fuel. => 煤炭要比其他任何矿物燃料分布更为广泛。
Worldwide energy demand has increased by more than 50% since 1980, and is expected to grow annually by 1.6% between now and 2030. => 从1980年以来，全球能源需求增加了50%以上，而且预计将会从现在起到2030年每年增加1.6 % 。

More than 70% of this new demand will come from developing countries, with fossil fuels projected to account for about 80% of total energy demand by the end of this period. => 这一新需求的70%以上来自发展中国家。 预计，矿物燃料将在这一期间末占全部能源需求的大约80 % 。
Coal is the world’s fastest growing fossil fuel, with annual production increasing by 6.4% since 2004. => 煤炭是世界上增长最快的矿物燃料，从2004年以来年产量递增6.4 % 。
It is already the dominant source of power generation in some very important energy-consuming nations. => 在某些十分重要的能源消费国家中，煤炭已经统领电力来源。
Much of the future increases in coal-fired electricity generation will come from strategically important developing countries like China and India. => 中国和印度等战略上重要的发展中国家将会是未来煤炭发电增长的主要国家。

In 2006 alone, China added about 93,000 megawatts of coal- fired electricity generating capacity, and this trend is expected to continue as the country tries to meet its huge energy needs. => 仅仅在2006年，中国增加了大约93000百万瓦特的煤炭发电产量，而且这一趋势预计将会随着中国努力满足其巨大的能源需求而继续。
Even in many developed countries, coal still accounts for a large share of power generation. => 即使在许多发达国家，煤炭依然占据发电量的很大一部分。
Coal plants currently provide more than half of America’s electricity supply. => 美国电力供应的一半以上来自于煤电厂。
Denmark, which houses some of the most efficient coal-fired power plants in the world, equally relies on coal for half of its electricity production. => 丹麦拥有一些全世界最为高效的煤电厂，其煤炭发电占据半壁河山。
The same is true for Germany, which is home to some of the most efficient pulverized coal combustion units in Europe. => 德国也是一样，它拥有一些欧洲最为高效的粉煤燃烧电厂。
Poland uses coal for 98% of its electricity production, and South Africa uses coal for about 50% of its electricity production. => 波兰电力生产的98%使用煤炭，而南非则为大约一半。

Unlike prices for coal, which is abundant and dispersed geographically, gas prices are subject to significant volatility, and the long-term trend in the face of fossil fuel depletion is uncertain. => 煤炭储量丰富，分布广泛。 与煤炭价格相比，天然气价格波动巨大，而且，在矿物燃料殆尽的情况下，其长期趋势也不明朗。
In contrast, coal prices are more stable, and may remain that way for a long time. => 比较而言，煤炭价格更为稳定，也可能持续很长一段时间。
Apart from electric-power generation, coal also has wide application in a number of industries. => 除了发电，煤炭还广泛应用于其他几个产业。
It is pivotal in both steel and cement production. => 它是钢铁和水泥生产的关键要素。
Moreover, the use of wood by Africa’s growing population is causing increasingly rapid deforestation in many countries. => 而且，非洲越来越多的人口使用木材正在许多国家造成森林迅速退化。
There is significant potential domestic demand for coal briquettes to replace wood for cooking and domestic and industrial heating. => 煤饼的潜在需求巨大，以取代木材用于做饭、家用和工业取暖。
The demand outlook thus appears favorable for the coal industry, creating significant investment opportunities. => 因此，煤炭产业的需求前景颇佳，从而创造巨大的投资机遇。
Clearly, there are environmental drawbacks from the use of coal as an energy resource, and these concerns are far too important to overlook. => 很明显，使用煤炭作为一种能源会产生环境倒退，而且人们不能忽视这些巨大的担忧。
The massive reserves notwithstanding, coal is still a finite resource. => 尽管储藏巨大，但是煤炭依旧是有限资源。
It must be mined with greater efficiency and with a view to mitigating the environmental impact. => 因此，必须更为高效地开采煤炭并且顾及减少环境影响。
Fortunately, much greater attention is paid today to mine safety and the management of the by-products of coal use. => 所幸的是，如今人们对煤矿安全以及管理煤炭使用的副产品更为关注。

With acid rain and other public-health hazards linked to coal combustion, more technologies are emerging for reducing harmful emissions from power plants. => 酸雨和其他公共健康危害与煤炭燃烧有关，越来越多的技术正在涌现以减少发电厂的有害排放。

Developing countries have lagged behind in this process, but, with the common threat of global warming, there is now growing pressure to adopt conservation policies. => 发展中国家在这一进程中已经落后，但是，随着全球变暖的共��威胁，现在采纳保护环境政策的压力越来越大。
Africa's mineral-rich countries must exploit their abundant natural resources. => 非洲矿物储量丰富的国家必须利用它们丰富的自然资源。
They must use coal to advance their economic development. => 它们必须使用煤炭来推进经济发展。
Failure to do so would be a missed opportunity at a time when African countries must avail themselves of all available resources for poverty reduction. => 当前，非洲国家必须利用所有可资利用的资源脱贫，否则就会坐失良机。
Africa’s Immunity => 非洲的免疫
ACCRA – The United States suffers rising job losses. => 阿克拉—越来越多的美国人丢掉了工作。
Britain nationalizes its banks. => 英国对银行实行国有化。
Once high-flying small economies like Ireland, Hungary, and Iceland break down. => 爱尔兰，匈牙利，冰岛等一度腾飞的小型经济体垮掉了。
Even robust China and India are experiencing slower growth, curtailed ambitions, and broken dreams. => 甚至连生机勃勃的中国和印度也在放慢增长速度，雄心被抑制，美梦正破碎。
Yet, in sub-Saharan Africa, there are few hints of the global financial crisis that is consuming the capitalist world. => 但是，在撒哈拉以南的非洲地区，却几乎看不到全球金融危机的影响，虽然这场危机正在毁掉资本主义世界。
In fashionable African cities, residential home prices remain stratospheric. => 在时髦的非洲城市，住宅房屋的价格依然高不可攀。

A typical Western-style house in Kampala or Accra, for example, now costs an astonishing two to three times the price of a comparable home in, say, Cleveland or other cities in the American heartland. => 例如，比起克里夫兰或是美国心脏地带其他城市里类似的房子，坎帕拉和阿克拉城里一栋典型的西式房屋现在的价格要高出一到两倍，这令人惊奇。
While home prices are crashing from Madrid to Dublin and Miami to Los Angeles, African prices remain near or at record-high levels. => 从马德里到都柏林，从迈阿密到洛杉矶，房价一路狂跌，而非洲房价却接近或者正处于有史以来的最高水平。
African banks, meanwhile, are rock-solid compared to their debt-heavy counterparts in the US and Europe. => 与此同时，比起身负重债的美国和欧洲银行，非洲银行坚如磐石。

Even government deficit spending – long the bane of Africa – seems positively puny compared to the massive debts that the US and some European countries face. => 和美国以及一些欧洲国家面临的巨额债务相比，甚至连政府的赤字开支—长久以来这一直是非洲的祸害—似乎也完全是微不足道的。

And yet there are good reasons to believe that it is just a matter of time before Africa and its peoples experience the ill effects of the global crisis. => 尽管如此，仍然有可靠的原因让我们相信非洲和它的人民将会吞下全球危机的恶果，这只是个时间问题而已。
From Ghana to Kenya, governments are having increased difficulty in raising money for infrastructure projects and selling official debt. => 从加纳到肯尼亚，政府为基础设施项目融资和出售政府债务时面临的困难正在增加。

Foreign investment in sub-Saharan Africa, which reached record levels in recent years, is retreating, which is evidence of investor caution, not any underlying lack of optimism about the region. => 近年来，外国在撒哈拉以南地区的投资创下新高，但这些投资正在撤出。 这意味着投资者开始谨慎行事，他们不再掩饰对这个地区缺乏信心。

And exports of raw materials to China, India, Europe, and the US – a key factor in Africa’s recent growth surge – may suffer simply because the global slowdown means less consumption everywhere. => 向中国，印度，欧洲和美国出口原材料是非洲最近经济飙升的一个关键因素，但这种出口可能受挫，因为全球经济下滑意味着每个地区都会减少消费。
All of these factors suggest that an African financial bust is possible. => 所有这些因素都表明非洲可能发生金融破产。
Popular equity investments, such as shares in Safaricom, are already trading at unexpectedly low levels. => 流行的股权投资，例如Safaricom里面的股份，已经在以低得出乎意料的水平进行交易了。

If real estate prices were to fall dramatically, a chain reaction could occur, taking down big and small investors alike, and over time causing wide suffering to ordinary Africans. => 如果地产价格急剧下降，就会发生连锁反应，大小投资者同样受困，一段时间过后还会给许多普通非洲民众带来痛苦。

Even assuming stability in real estate prices, the global crisis surely will cause a fall in remittances by Africans working good jobs in Europe, the US, Canada, Australia, and the Middle East. => 即使假设地产价格稳定，全球危机也必然会导致在外工作的非洲人士减少汇款。 这些人工作优渥，呆在欧洲，美国，加拿大，澳大利亚和中东。

Remittances are already believed to be falling, which makes sense: immigrants in rich countries are and will be disproportionately hurt by slowing economic activity. => 人们已经相信汇款额会下降，这不难理解：经济活动减缓正在，而且将要，极大伤害迁往富裕国家的移民。
Immigration itself may even slow dramatically, depending on the length and depth of the economic slowdown. => 基于经济衰退的长度和深度，甚至移民活动本身也会急剧减少。
Fewer Africans working in rich countries will automatically translate into less money circulating in African countries. => 当在富裕国家工作的非洲人数量减少时，这自然会导致在非洲国家里流动的钱也会变少
The decline in remittances, however, cuts both ways. => 然而，减少汇款具有正反两面作用。
Remittances have long spurred inflation in many parts of Africa. => 长期以来，汇款刺激了非洲很多地方的通货膨胀。
A Ugandan doctor working in Norway, for instance, cares little about the cost of a beer in Kampala. => 例如，一位在挪威工作的乌干达医生很少关注坎帕拉一瓶啤酒的价格。
He is also willing – and able – to pay more than a local doctor for services and, of course, a home in Uganda. => 和一位当地医生相比，他愿意并且能够为接受服务—当然还有一个在乌干达的家—支付更多的钱。
Fewer remittances flowing into Uganda could mean less economic activity – or simply lower prices. => 流入乌干达的汇款减少意味着经济活动减少，或者就是价格降低。

President Barack Obama, acting as if the latter scenario remains likely, is betting on large-scale government spending to prop up the real economy. => 总统巴拉克·奥巴马现在的行事风格就像后一种情况可能发生一样，他打赌大规模的政府开支将支撑起实体经济。
If his administration succeeds, the chances that Africa will remain relatively unscathed will grow. => 如果他的政策成功了，就会相应增加非洲得以幸免的机会。
Even if Obama fails, however, Africans should escape the worst of the global crisis, for both good reasons and bad. => 不过，即使奥巴马失败了，非洲也应该能逃出全球危机的最重灾区，其原因好坏参半。
Another factor working in Africa’s favor is its private companies’ and consumers’ low dependence on borrowed money. => 另外一个对非洲有利的因素是这里的私人公司和消费者很少依赖借来的钱。
People tend to pay cash for goods and services, however costly. => 人们倾向于用现金来支付货物和服务，不论有多贵。
In the US, loans for cars and homes – loans that now aren’t being paid back – are the major factor behind the financial crisis. => 在美国，买房买车的贷款（那些现在收不回来的贷款）是金融危机后面的主要���素。
In Africa, very few people borrow money for such purchases. => 而非洲只有极少数人借钱买这些东西。
Africa’s cash-based economy has in the past constrained development. => 过去，非洲以现金为基础的经济阻碍了发展。
After all, by allowing people to spend more than they have, borrowed money can fuel growth. => 毕竟，通过允许人们超前消费，借来的钱可以为经济助燃。
But today, Africa’s pay-as-you-go practices are a powerful defense against financial contagion. => 但今天，非洲“现收现付”的习俗成了抵御金融危机蔓延的有力保障。
Ensuring Africa’s Continued Rise => 确保非洲继续崛起
LAGOS – Africa’s rise is in danger of faltering. => 拉各斯—非洲的崛起有夭折的危险。

Ensuring the wealth and wellbeing of the continent’s residents will not be easy; but there is much that policymakers can do to put Africa back on an upward trajectory. => 确保非洲居民的财富和福祉绝非易事；但决策者可以想很多办法帮助非洲重回向上轨迹。
First and foremost, policymakers must secure the financing needed to pursue sustainable development in an uncertain global environment. => 首先也是最重要的是，决策者必须确保所需要的资金在不确定的全球环境中追求可持续发展。
The World Bank estimates that Africa will require at least $93 billion a year to fund its infrastructure needs alone. => 世界银行估计，光是基础设施资金，非洲每年就至少需要930亿美元。
Climate-friendly, sustainable infrastructure will cost even more. => 气候友好型可持续基础设施的成本更高。

And yet, as long as global growth remains weak, Africans cannot count on developed countries to fully honor their commitments to help attain the Sustainable Development Goals. => 但是，只要全球增长持续低迷，非洲人就无法指望发达国家充分兑现它们帮助实现可持续发展目标的承诺。
Africa must rapidly develop its own resources, beginning by nearly doubling tax revenues. => 非洲必须迅速开发其自身的资源，第一步是将税收收入提高近一倍。
Across Sub-Saharan Africa, tax revenues account for less than one-fifth of GDP, compared to more than one-third in OECD countries. => 在整个撒哈拉以南非洲，税收收入还不到GDP的五分之一，而经合组织国家这一比例高达三分之一以上。
This means there is plenty of room for improvement. => 这意味着还有巨大的改善空间。
From 1990 to 2004, for example, Ghana reformed its tax system and raised revenues from 11% to 22% of GDP. => 比如，从1999年到2004年，加纳改革了其税收制度，税收收入占GDP之比从11%增加到22 % 。
Admittedly, such progress is difficult; in Nigeria, we saw an opportunity in raising non-oil tax revenues, but struggled to seize it. => 诚然，取得这样的进步是困难的；在尼日利亚，我们也看到了提高非石油税收收入的机会，但难以抓住它。
Another source of domestic resources is the roughly $380 billion in pension assets held by just ten African countries. => 另一个国内资源是十个非洲国家所持有的大约3,800亿美元退休金资产。
Policymakers should be leveraging these considerable sums. => 决策者应该利用这一数量可观的资金。
At the same time, African countries will have to find a way to diversify their economies. => 与此同时，非洲国家必须找到办法实现经济多样化。

Diversification requires investment in the future, in the form of education and well-developed infrastructure, including telecommunications, power, roads, rail, and water. => 多样化需要为未来投资，如教育和发达的基础设施（通讯、电力、公路、铁路、水道等 ） 。

There are plenty of models to follow: Dubai, Singapore, Thailand, Malaysia, Mexico, Indonesia, and South Korea are all admired by Africans as economies that managed to transform themselves. => 可以效仿的榜样很多：迪拜、新加坡、泰国、马来西亚、墨西哥、印度尼西亚和韩国都是非洲人民所景仰的成功实现转型的经济体。
Dubai, for example, set out more than three decades ago to prepare for a future without oil. => 比如，迪拜三十多年前就开始为没有石油的未来做准备。
South Korea and Singapore, which had few natural resources on which to rely, are no less inspiring. => 韩国和新加坡都没有天然资源可以依赖，但它们的例子也十分鼓舞人心。

The secret behind these countries’ success is relentlessly focused leaders, whether entrenched but benign dictators or democratically elected politicians with a shared vision of a broad-based economy. => 这些国家成功的背后是坚持不懈的领导人，不管是长期执政但温和的独裁者，还是对宽基础经济有着共同愿景的民选政客。
As the necessary measures for diversification are implemented, policymakers must ensure that the economic growth they are pursuing creates jobs. => 在实施必要的多样化措施的同时，决策者必须确保他们所追求的经济增长能创造就业。
Sadly, this has not always been the case. => 悲哀的是，事实未必如此。
Much of the recent growth has benefited only a few, leaving many behind – most notably young people and women. => 近期的大量增长只是肥了一小撮人，而将大部分人排斥在外 — — 特别是年轻人和女性。

From 2006 to 2013, inequality rose in many of the continent’s most important economies, including South Africa, Nigeria, Ghana, Tanzania, and Rwanda. => 从2006年到2013年，非洲的许多最重要经济体，包括南非、尼日利亚、加纳、坦桑尼亚和卢旺达等，不平等性都有所上升。
These were challenges that we were starting to address in Nigeria when I was finance minister. => 我担任尼日利亚财政部长时，已经开始解决一些挑战。
We knew that we needed not just to secure growth, but also to improve the quality of that growth. => 我们知道我们不但需要确保增长，还需要改善增长的质量。
To that end, policymakers must ensure that growth is channeled into sectors that create jobs, such as agriculture, manufacturing, and services. => 在这方面，决策者必须确保增长被引导到创造就业的部门，如农业、制造业和服务业。
They may also have to redistribute income and strengthen social safety nets to protect better those at the bottom of the ladder. => 他们还必须重新分配收入和强化社会安全网，以更好地保护底层人群。
Matching skills to job opportunities will be crucial. => 让技能与就业机会相匹配至关重要。

Some 70% of Africa’s population is under 30, and the continent is home to half the world’s primary-school-age children who have been deprived of the opportunity to study. => 大约70%的非洲人口还不到30岁，非洲辍学小学适龄儿童占世界的一半。

Offering Africa’s children basic reading, writing, and technology skills, as well as vocational, technical, and entrepreneurial training, must be a top priority. => 让非洲儿童拥有基本的阅读、写作和技术技能并获得职业、技术和创业培训必须成为重中之重。

Weak health-care systems must also be strengthened in order to tackle the endemic diseases that sap productivity, such as malaria, as well as improving preparedness for outbreaks of deadly epidemics. => 拙劣的医疗体系也必须强化，以解决制约生产力的地方性疾病（如疟疾）以及改善对致死传染病爆发的预防工作。
The stakes are high. => 兹事体大。
The World Bank estimates the Ebola outbreak shrank the economies of Sierra Leone, Guinea, and Liberia by 16%. => 世界银行估计，埃博拉疫情的爆发让塞拉利昂、几内亚和利比里亚经济萎缩了16 % 。
As the world economy sputters, African countries will have to develop trade with one another. => 世界经济形势堪忧，非洲国家必须发展彼此之间的贸易。
In 2013, African goods and services accounted for just 16% of trade within the continent, and just over 3% of world trade. => 2013年，非洲商品和服务只占非洲内部贸易的16%或世界贸易的3%略多。
One problem is that most African countries produce the same type of commodities and trade them with very little value-added. => 一个问题是大部分非洲国家生产同类商品，并以极少量附加值进行贸易。
Policymakers must encourage greater specialization; differentiated goods and services will add value and volume to trade. => 决策者必须鼓励提高专业化；多样化的商品和服务能够自增加贸易的价值和量。
Logistics pose another obstacle to intra-African trade. => 物流是非洲内部贸易的另一障碍。

Policymakers must make it easier to move goods across borders, by improving connectivity between countries and reducing bureaucratic hurdles and administrative costs. => 决策者必须改善国家之间的联系，降低官僚障碍和行政成本，从而让商品跨国运输更加便利。

For example, road transport tariffs across Africa are estimated at $0.05-$0.13 per ton-kilometer, compared to the average of $0.01-$0.05 for all developing countries. => 比如，非洲公路运输关税据估计在每吨千米0.05—0.13美元，而所有发展中国家的平均水平为0.01—0.05美元。

The Rift Valley Railway project, which will eventually link Mombasa on the Kenyan coast to Kampala in Uganda, is a good example of the benefits that investments in transportation could provide. => 最终将连接肯尼亚蒙巴萨海滨和乌干达坎帕拉的东非大裂谷铁路工程很好地说明了交通投资所能提供的好处。
The African Development Bank estimates that it will double the volume of trade between the two countries, while reducing marginal costs by 30%. => 非洲开发银行估计它将让两国间贸易量翻一番，同时将边际成本降低30 % 。

As they make these investments, policymakers must not forget that much of Africa’s recent growth can be credited to good macroeconomic policies and sound economic management. => 在做出这些投资的同时，决策者也绝不能忘记近期非洲的大部分增长要归因于良好的宏观经济政策和可靠的经济管理。
Extending the continent’s rise will require strengthening the continent’s economic fundamentals. => 延长非洲的崛起需要强化非洲经济基本面。
This means ensuring that prices in the economy are correct, starting with the exchange rate. => 这意味着确保经济中的价格是正确的。 首先是汇率。
Africa’s potential can hardly be overstated. => 非洲的潜能是无穷的。
The continent is well placed to build diversified economies based on low-carbon, sustainable infrastructure. => 非洲很适合构建基于低碳可持续基础设施的多样化经济。
But policymakers cannot simply assume that Africa’s rise will continue. => 但决策者不能想当然地认为非洲能持续崛起。
They must take the right steps to ensure that it does. => 他们必须采取正确的措施保证这一点。
Africa’s Urban Farmers => 非洲的城市农夫们
A nurse, Wangari counts on income from farming to raise money to buy more land – for more farming. => 作为一名护士，尤妮斯希望用种地所赚来的钱来购买更多土地 — — 然后再种更多的地。
Even though Wangari lives in Kenya’s capital, she is able to reap hundreds of dollars a year in profit from cash crops grown with the help of relatives. => 虽然生活在肯尼亚首都，但尤妮斯每年都能在亲戚帮助下从经济作物种植中获利数百美元。
Her initial stake – drawn from her nursing wages of about $350 a month – has long since been recovered. => 而启动资金则是她当护士每月约350美元工资 — — 不过这笔本钱早就收回来了。

Wangari is one of thousands of urban workers in Kenya – and one of hundreds of thousands, even millions, across Africa – who are increasing their incomes through absentee agriculture. => 尤妮斯是成千上万名生活在肯尼亚的“城市农夫”中的一员 — — 而在非洲大陆则有数十万到数百万这样的人 — — 他们靠“远程”务农来增加自己的收入。
With prices for basic foodstuffs at their highest levels in decades, many urbanites feel well rewarded by farming. => 由于基础食品的价格达到了几十年中来的最高水平，许多城里人都觉得靠务农来挣钱还是报酬颇丰的。
Absentee agriculture also bolsters national pride – and pride in traditional diets – by specializing in vegetables specific to the region. => 远程务农也因此增强了人们的民族自豪感，同时也并通过对某些地区特产蔬菜的关注而提升了对传统饮食的自豪感。

“For too long our country has been flooded with imported food and Westernized foods,” Wangari says. “This is our time to fight back – and grow our own.” => “进口食品和西式食物已经在我们国家泛滥太久了 ” ， 尤妮斯说 ， “ 现在是我们发起反击，种植自己的食物的时候了。
In Nigeria, former President Olusegun Obasanjo has a huge diversified farm and has pushed for policies to help absentee farmers prosper. => 在尼日利亚，前总统奥卢塞贡·奥巴桑乔就拥有一个从事多种经营的巨大农场，并推行一系列政策来帮助那些远程农夫成功创业。
In Uganda, Vice President Gilbert Bukenya routinely travels the country, promoting higher-value farming, such as dairy production. => 在乌干达，副总统吉尔伯特·布坎尼亚在全国例行走访途中也着力推广更高价值的农业经营方式，比如奶制品生产。
To be sure, absentee farming by elites and educated urban workers can’t solve all of Africa’s urgent food needs. => 有一点可以确定，那就是由精英和受过教育的城市人所构建的远程农业无法解决当前非洲所有迫在眉睫的食品问题。
Moreover, absentee farmers face unexpected problems. => 此外，这些远程农业从业者们还会遇到意想不到的难题。
Without her help, I might not have farmed at all. => 如果没有她的帮助，我也许根本无法进行耕作。
Even with mother’s help, I have worries. => 但即使在母亲的帮助下我依然有诸多担忧。
Although I grew up around wheat fields, my knowledge of farming is thin. => 虽然自小在麦田周围长大，可我关于农耕的知识却十分贫瘠。
Fertilizer and spraying were both more expensive than I thought. => 肥料和杀虫剂的价格都比我想象的要贵。
While my wheat stalks are sprouting on schedule, I now fear that at harvest time – in November – prices will fall and I won’t recoup my costs. => 当一棵棵麦苗正按部就班地发芽时，我却开始担心到了11月收获时小麦价格会跌，那我就连本都收不回来了。
One key tool is the mobile phone. => 这时最关键的工具就是手机。
My hopes for success are buoyed by my ability to call my mother inexpensively and discuss the farm. => 我重新浮现出对成功的希冀，因为我能给母亲打电话同她商量农场的事情，电话费也不贵。
We even decided over the phone what kind of pesticide to use and which tractor company to hire. => 我们甚至在通话中决定用哪种杀虫剂以及雇佣哪家拖拉机公司。
Because they know both the tastes of fellow city dwellers and rural conditions, many urban farmers are succeeding. => 由于这些城市农夫对城市居民的喜好以及农村的状况都很熟悉，所以其中许多人都取得了成功。
In fact, some city dwellers don’t even bother with acquiring land or gaining distant help. Certain crops can be grown in their own homes. => 事实上，一些城市居民根本无需担心购买土地或者获取远程协助的问题，因为一些特定种类的农作物在他们自己家中就可种植。
James Memusi, an accountant, grows mushrooms in a spare bedroom, selling them to nearby hotels and supermarkets. => 会计师詹姆斯·麦姆锡就利用家里一间空卧室种植蘑菇，并将收获卖给临近的饭店和超市。

Nevertheless, most people living in Africa’s cities have access to land in the countryside, which is why Liberia’s government rightly highlights the potential for farm expansion. => 不过大多数住在非洲城市里的人都有办法在农村弄到土地，这就是为什么利比里亚政府如此肯定地强调农业的拓展潜力。
In a new advertising campaign rolled out this summer, the authorities declared, “The soil is a bank; invest in it.” => 在今年夏天发起的一项新运动的推广中，官方就是这样宣传的 ： “ 土地就是座银行，往里面投资吧！ ”
In Liberia, the main push is to reduce imports of staples such as rice and tomatoes. => 在利比里亚，主要动力是为了降低类似大米和西红柿等主食的进口额。

In more prosperous countries, African elites are motivated by a complex interplay of national pride, dietary concerns, and the pursuit of profit. => 而在一些更为富裕的国家，非洲的精英们被相互作用的复杂原因驱动着，这些原因之中既掺杂国家自豪感和对食品短缺的担忧，又出于利益的驱使。
In Zambia, for example, Sylva Banda ignited a craze for authentic traditional meals two decades ago with a chain of popular restaurants. => 比方说希尔维亚·班达20年前在赞比亚开了一系列广受喜爱的餐馆，用真正的本地菜引领起一股时尚潮流。

Now, ordinary Lusakans want to cook similar meals in their own homes, driving demand for farmers who produce such delicacies as dried pumpkin, “black jack” leaves, and fresh Okra. => 而现在，普通卢萨卡市民也想要在家中自己烹饪相似的菜肴，这就需要越来越多的农民们去生产更多的精细食品，比如南瓜干 、 “ 黑杰克”菜叶和新鲜秋葵。
Similarly, in Nairobi, Miringo Kinyanjui, another woman entrepreneur, is supplying unrefined – and more nutritious – maize and wheat flour. => 类似的，在内罗毕有一位名叫米林格·金亚朱尼的女企业家正在生产更有营养的粗磨玉米面和小麦粉。

In another move to distinguish her ingredients from Western versions, Kinyanjui also sells through grocery stores flour flavored with Amarathan, a green vegetable that grows around Kenya. => 而将她供应的食品同西方食品进一步区分开来的则是金亚朱尼同样通过食品店售卖一种“阿玛拉桑”口味的面粉，而“阿玛拉桑”是一种在肯尼亚全国都有种植的绿色蔬菜类植物。
The revival of traditional foods has attracted the attention of large multinational corporations. => 传统食品的重新流行吸引了许多跨国公司的注意。

Last year, Unilever’s Kenyan branch ran a “taste our culture” campaign in support of its line of traditional East African herbs and spices. => 就在去年，联合利华公司驻肯尼亚的子公司就启动了一项“品尝我们的文化”活动来推广他们混合了东非香草和香料的一系列产品。

Such campaigns go hand-in-hand with expanded farming, because sellers of these foods prefer nearby growers – even if these growers increasingly live in the city. => 这些活动都与农业规模的扩大紧密相关，因为这些卖家都更偏爱临近的种植者，即便这些“农夫”越来越都是些城里人。
Building Africa’s Scientific Talent => 培养非洲的科学人才
TORONTO – Ten years ago, South African physicist Neil Turok made a bold prediction: the world’s next Einstein will be from Africa. => 发自多伦多 — — 十年前，南非物理学家尼尔·图罗克（Neil Turok）做出了一个大胆的预言：下一位爱因斯坦将来自于非洲。
A decade later, it is worth considering whether the continent is any closer to finding the next global genius. => 如今十年已过，也是时候思考一下非洲大陆是否更接近于诞生下一个全球性天才了。
Statistically, there is indeed a high probability that it will happen. => 从统计上来说这确实很有可能。
By 2050, 40% of the world’s young people will be African. => 到2050年，世界上40％的年轻人将是非洲人。
By virtue of demographics alone, it stands to reason that Africa is destined to generate prodigies in science or technology. => 仅就人口结构统计数据来看，非洲注定会产生众多科学技术方面的神童。
Africans have led the world in science before. => 非洲人曾一度在科学上领先世界。
In fact, some of humanity’s greatest innovations – from vaccines to brain surgery – were pioneered by Africans. => 事实上，一些人类最伟大的创新 — — 从疫苗到脑手术 — — 都是由非洲人开创的。

One of the oldest measuring devices ever used, the Lebombo Bone, was carved by people believed to have lived some 35,000 years ago in modern-day eSwatini (Swaziland). => 迄今为止发现的最古老测量设备之一列彭波骨（Lebombo bone）被考证为大约3.5万年前生活在当今伊斯瓦蒂尼（原名斯威士兰）的人类所造。
In other words, mathematics itself is an African invention. => 换句话说，数学本身就是非洲的发明。
With these visionaries now gone, Africa needs a new brain trust to inspire future generations of ethical and public-spirited researchers. => 随着这些有远见者纷纷离世，非洲需要一批新智囊团来激励未来一代具备道德和公益精神的研究人员。
But how do we ensure Africa discovers, supports, and develops innovative, game-changing scientists? => 但是我们如何确保非洲能去发现，支持和培养出那些改变游戏规则的创新科学家？
At the moment, however, too many of Africa’s young researchers see no option but to go abroad for school and work. => 然而目前非洲的许多年轻研究人员别无选择，只能出国学习和工作。
That can change, but only with concrete investments in homegrown talent. => 这个局面可以被改变，但只能通过对本土人才的切实投资来改变。
This means rethinking the entire education system in Africa. => 这意味着要对整个非洲教育体系进行重新思考。
Three priorities stand out. => 而其中有三个事项必须优先解决
First, African countries need to fix the knowledge pipeline. => 首先，非洲国家需要修复知识输送管道。
Second, Africa needs indigenous knowledge creation. => 其次，非洲需要实现立足本地的知识创造。
This requires facilitating both fundamental and applied research and creating the necessary infrastructure for the dissemination of research outcomes. => 这需要同时促进基础和应用研究，并为研究成果的传播创造必要的基础设施。
This could include making more funding available to researchers and research institutions, as well as promoting open sources for knowledge sharing. => 这将包括为研究人员和研究机构提供更多资金以及推动开源性的知识共享。
The third priority is putting knowledge into practice. => 第三个优先事项是将知识付诸实践。
A good example is Zipline, which deploys drone technology to deliver blood transfusions to remote areas of Rwanda. => 对此滑索公司（Zipline）就是一个很好的例子，它采用无人机向卢旺达的偏远地区输送血液。
After successfully deploying the technology in Rwanda, it is currently being rolled out in Ghana. => 该技术在卢旺达成功部署后目前正被引入加纳。
Zipline has saved hundreds of lives and demonstrated the potential of technology transfer with large-scale impact. => 它挽救了数百人的生命，并展示了具备大规模影响力的技术转让所能发挥出来的潜力。
The NEF focuses on convening Africa’s innovators to highlight breakthrough discoveries and catalyze scientific collaboration for human development. => 论坛致力于召集非洲的创新者去彰显突破性发现并促进人类发展方面的科学合作。
With so many complex issues vying for attention today, Africa will need innovative education and research models. => 在有许多复杂问题都要得到关注的今天，非洲需要整套创新的教育和研究模式。
Improving African Women’s Health Through Financial Inclusion => 通过金融包容改善非洲女性健康

ACCRA – In late October, the World Health Organization’s Regional Office for Africa signed an agreement with the United Nations International Telecommunication Union (ITU). => 阿克拉—去年10月，世界卫生组织非洲地区办公室与联合国国际电信联盟（ITU）签署了一份协议。
The aim of the unlikely partnership is to encourage the use of digital services “to save lives and improve people’s health.” => 这一看似不可能的合作关系的目标是鼓励使用数字服务“拯救生命、改善人民健康 ” 。
But perhaps the pact’s most innovative feature is the vow to merge financial inclusion strategies with modern health-care delivery. => 但也许该协议最具创新性的部分在于它承诺将金融包容策略与现代医疗服务相结合。
Financial inclusion is a proven pathway to improving people’s health, especially the health of women in developing countries. => 金融包容是证实了的改善人民健康的有效方法，特别是发展中国家女性的健康。
Women who can easily access bank accounts or cash payment options tend to invest more in their businesses and families. => 能够轻松获得银行账户或现金支付选项的女性，往往会为她们的企业和家庭投入更多。
In turn, they live healthier, more satisfying lives. => 反过来，她们也生活得更健康、更满足。

Yet, too often, initiatives like the one signed in October focus on one or the other – e-health or financial products like insurance. => 但是，常常发生的情况是，类似10月份签署的协议这样的计划，总是关注其中之一 — — 电子健康（e-health）或金融产品（如保险 ） 。

Because Africans’ ability to earn and save money can be the difference between good care and no care at all, this represents a missed opportunity to help patients and build more resilient communities. => 非洲人赚钱和存钱的能力决定了他能获得好医疗还是根本看不起病，因此这是一个被错过的帮助患者、构建恢复力更强的社会的机会。
The cost of this choice is disproportionately high for Africa’s women. => 这一选择给非洲女性造成的代价尤其高昂。
In Nigeria, for example, 400,000 women live with obstetric fistula, a disabling condition often caused by complications in childbirth. => 比如，在尼日利亚，有400,000女性身患产瘘，这是一种致残的分娩并发症。
In Tanzania, some 8,000 women die annually during pregnancy or delivery; most of these deaths could be prevented. => 在坦桑尼亚，每年都有大约8,000女性死于妊娠或分娩；这些死亡大部分是可以避免的。
And, across the continent, women’s life expectancy at birth is just 58 years, compared to more than 80 years in developed countries. => 而就整个非洲而言，女性出生寿命预期只有58年，而发达国家高达80多年。
Progress is being made to connect women’s health solutions and financial inclusion. => 人们正在努力将女性健康方案与金融包容联系起来，并在不断取得进步。
Through programs like these, development experts can advocate for digital solutions as a means of social and financial empowerment. => 通过类似于此的计划，发展专家能够宣传作为社会和金融赋权手段的数字方案。
Unfortunately, cooperation like the pact signed in October is the exception, rather than the norm. => 不幸的是，类似于10月所签署的协议的合作计划只是例外，而不是常例。

Banks, regulators, finance ministries, and telecommunications companies all frequently gather to consider financial inclusion without the local and global health community. => 银行、监管者、财政部门和电信企业都在频繁开会讨论金融包容性，但并没有将本地和全球医疗界包括进去。
This must change if we are to build more inclusive platforms for African patients and clients. => 如果我们想要为非洲患者和客户建立更加包容性的平台，这一点必须改变。
The first step is to identify missed opportunities. => 第一步是认识错失的机会。
A big one stems from the disparate approaches to bringing financial services and digitized health care to rural parts of Africa. => 一个大机会是采取不同方法将金融服务和数字化医疗服务推广到非洲农村地区。
At the moment, banks and mobile network operators are working to expand their digital banking services to unbanked and under-banked clients. => 目前，银行和移动网络运营商正致力于扩大数字银行服务，以覆盖没有银行账户或银行服务不足的客户。
At the same time, community health workers (CHWs) are operating in these regions to prevent, treat, and refer patients to clinics. => 与此同时，社区卫生工作者（CHW）正在这些地区展开预防、治疗和分诊工作。
Combining these efforts makes sense, because both initiatives rely heavily on trust. => 将这些措施相结合非常有意义，因为两项计划都非常依赖信任。
Through pre-established networks, CHWs could augment their e-health offerings with financial products, like mobile cash payment systems. => 通过预先构建的网络，CHW能够利用金融产品，如移动现金支付系统来扩大电子健康服务覆盖面。
Broadening digital disease management and access to health information to include financial wellbeing would create natural synergies. => 扩大数字疾病管理和健康信息普及以纳入金融福祉能产生自然的协同效应。
While there are some concerns that adding responsibilities to CHWs could undermine health-care quality, a fragmented approach to prosperity is even more damaging. => 有人担心增加CHW的责任会拖累医疗质量，但碎片化的繁荣观弊端更大。

Once opportunities for expansion are identified, other issues will need to be addressed before women’s health and financial inclusion programs can be widened. => 在认识到扩大的机会后，在女性健康和金融包容性计划得到推广之前，还需要解决其他问题。
For starters, a lack of sex-disaggregated data makes it difficult to draft policies based on health quality and financial need. => 首先，缺乏按性别区分的数据导致难以根据健康质量和金融需要来制定政策。

Although some countries, such as Burundi and Senegal, are working to improve their gender-specific data collection, a broader, more coordinated push is needed. => 尽管布隆迪和塞内加尔等国家正致力于改善具体的性别数据收集，但仍需要范围更广、更具协作性的计划。
Raising the region’s financial literacy will be another challenge. => 增进地区的金融知识是另一项挑战。
The ability to understand and execute matters of personal finance is the weakest link in transforming women’s opportunities through financial inclusion. => 理解和执行个人金融事务的能力是通过金融包容改变女性机会的链条上的最弱一环。

Moreover, financial literacy is a pre-requisite for the rollout of financing initiatives, such as programs that support women-led small and micro-enterprises. => 此外，金融知识是启动融资计划 — — 如支持女性领导的小微企业 — — 的先决条件。

If financial literacy levels can be raised, women can access resources such as land and credit, tools that hold the keys to business development, social mobility, and personal growth. => 如果能够提升金融知识水平，女性就能获得土地和信用等资源，这些工具是商业发展、社会流动性和个人成长的关键。
Progress has been made in leveling the playing field, but these gains must be sustained. => 在构建公平竞技场方面，我们取得了一些进步，但必须保持势头。
The agreement between the WHO and the ITU will help promote wealth creation in parts of Africa where access to health care and financial services is lacking. => 世卫组织和ITU的协议有助于促进缺乏医疗和金融服务的非洲地区的财富创造。
To maintain this momentum, deeper commitments are needed, especially from the global health community. => 要保持这一势头，需要更深度的承诺，特别是来自全球医疗界的承诺。

But, however African governments proceed in digitizing their health and financial services offerings, women’s needs must remain at the center of any solution. => 但是，不论非洲各国政府如何推进健康和金融服务数字化，女性的需要都必须作为他们的方案的核心。
Closing the Youth Apathy Gap => 填补青年冷漠缺口
That commitment will be virtually impossible to fulfill, unless political participation by young people increases considerably. => 除非年轻人的政治参与能够显著增长，否则这一承诺几乎不可能实现。
Young people are critical to progress. => 年轻人是进步的关键。

As US President Barack Obama put it in a 2015 speech in Nairobi, “no country can achieve its full potential unless it draws on the talents of all its people.” => 美国总统巴拉克在2015 年的内罗毕演讲中指出 ， “ 除非一个国家能够依赖全体人民的才华，否则它就无法实现全部潜能。
And youth now comprise a large share of those people – 18% of the world’s population, to be precise. => ”如今，青年构成了这些人民中的很大一部分 — — 准确地说，他们占据了世界人口的18 % 。
The share is even larger in much of the developing world. => 在大部分发展中国家，这个比例还会更高。
The median age of Africa’s population is just 19.5 years. => 非洲人口的中位年龄只有19.5岁。

Given their numbers, not to mention rising education and literacy rates, young people can make a world of difference, shaping political discourse and electoral outcomes. => 从这些数据看 — — 更不用说不断提高的教育水平和识字率了 — — 年轻人能够改变世界，影响政治进程和选举结果。
But that requires them to be engaged and active. => 但这需要他们参与和活跃。
In the United Kingdom, most young people wish to remain in the European Union. => 在英国，大部分年轻人想要留在欧盟。

As a Lord Ashcroft poll showed, 73% of those aged 18-24, and 62% of those aged 25-34, voted accordingly in last year’s referendum. => 阿什克罗夫特勋爵（Lord Ashcroft）调查表明，73%的18—24岁群体，以及62%的25—34岁群体，在去年的全民公决中投票赞成留欧。
But most young British did not actually show up to cast their votes, allowing the UK’s older, predominantly pro-Brexit cohorts to win the day. => 但大部分英国年轻人实际上并没有行使投票权，这使得英国年长者 — — 他们大多支持退欧 — — 赢得了胜利。

Presumably having learned their lesson from the Brexit referendum, young Britons contributed to an unexpected victory for Labour in June’s snap general election. => 想必是从退欧公投中汲取了教训，英国年轻人在6月份的临时大选中帮助工党赢得了出人意料的胜利。
In Kenya’s presidential election, held last month, 51% of registered voters were below the age of 35 years. => 在上个月举行的肯尼亚总统选举中，51%的注册选民年龄低于35岁。

Although the Supreme Court annulled the results and ordered a fresh vote, owing to electoral irregularities and illegalities, large numbers of young people are likely to turn out again. => 尽管最高法院因为选举违规和违法行为推翻了结果，勒令重新投票，但大量年轻人可能会再次走向投票箱。
Unfortunately, Kenya is the exception that proves the rule. => 不幸的是，肯尼亚只是一个证明了规则的例外。
Political apathy among young people, like that seen in the Brexit referendum, remains pervasive worldwide. => 年轻人的政治冷漠 — — 就像英国退欧公投所表现的那样 — — 仍然在全球范围内普遍存在。

This sense of disempowerment is threatening to turn the developing world’s youth bulge into a youth curse – with serious potential consequences. => 这种失权（disempowerment）感有可能让发展中世界的青年膨胀（youth bulge，即青年占人口多数的现象）演变为青年诅咒 — — 并带来严重的潜在后果。

The Arab Spring uprisings, which led to violence and instability in most affected countries, were fueled largely by desperate young people demanding rights and opportunities. => 阿拉伯之春暴乱导致了大部分受影响国家陷入暴力和动荡，其背后的主要推动力正是绝望的年轻人要求权利和机会。
To avoid such outcomes, young people need to be part of their countries’ political life, able to advance their own vision of the future. => 要避免这样的结果，年轻人必须成为国家政治生活的一部分，能够推动他们自己的未来愿景。
As young Kenyans repeated during the recent election campaign, “If you are not at the table, you are on the menu.” => 就像肯尼亚年轻人在最近的选战中一再强调的 ， “ 不入庙堂，便为鱼肉。 ”
So what can be done to increase political awareness and participation among young people? => 那么，如何提高年轻人的政治意识和参与呢？
Though somewhat dysfunctional, these institutions have helped to empower Kenyan youth, driving the high election turnout last month. => 尽管这些机构功能未必完善，但仍有助于赋权肯尼亚青年，为上个月选举的高投票率立下了功劳。
But perhaps the most effective approach to closing the apathy gap focuses on initiatives led by young people themselves. => 但填补冷漠缺口的最有效的方针集中在由年轻人自己领导的项目上。

In Nigeria, young people spearheaded the Not Too Young to Run campaign, which led to a constitutional amendment lowering the minimum age for candidates. => 在尼日利亚，年轻人领衔发起了“起步永不早 ” （ Not Too Young to Run）运动，该运动促使尼日利亚修改宪法，降低候选人的最低年龄。
Their success inspired a global campaign to support young people’s right to run for office. => 他们的成功启发了一场全球运动，支持年轻人主持政府部门的权利。

Jiactivate, in which I am engaged as National Chairperson, aims to serve as a platform that amplifies young Kenyans’ voices, offering them easier ways to take action. => 我以全国理事长（National Chairperson）的身份参与了Jiactivate，我们的目标是充当一个放大肯尼亚年轻人的声音的平台，让他们更加方便地采取行动。

To inspire more such initiatives, there must be a deliberate effort to engage with youth in a way that supports real political engagement, not tokenism and empty rhetoric. => 要想启发更多的类似项目，必须有意识地采取措施，以支持真正的政治参与的方式与年轻人合作，而不是做表面文章和空喊口号。
That survey showed that, while 27% of respondents had never engaged politically, 26% had attended an event and 34% had posted on social media. => 这份调查表明，27%的受访者从未参与过政治，但26%出席过政治事件，34%发布过社交媒体。

For example, by creatively using social media to collect, collate, and amplify young people’s priorities in the Kenyan elections, Jiactivate helped spur their interest in politics. => 比如，Jiactivate创造性地利用社交媒体收集、整理和放大年轻人在肯尼亚选举中的重点关注点，提高了他们对政治的兴趣。
Nonetheless, many Kenyans who were popular on social media did not make much of an impact on the election’s outcome. => 尽管如此，许多在社交媒体上广受欢迎的肯尼亚人，并没有对选举结果产生多少影响。
Translating social media energy into effective action in the real world remains a daunting challenge. => 将社交媒体的能量转化为真实世界中的有效行动仍然是一个艰巨的挑战。
Increasing youth involvement in politics will require sustained commitment and hard work. => 提高青年的政治参与度需要持续的努力和艰苦奋斗。
But, far from a deterrent, this should serve as a powerful incentive to get started. => 但是，这不应该成为阻力，而应该成为刺激我们开始行动的强大动力。
No one is more affected by past, present, and future policies than young people. => 年轻人是受过去、现在和未来政策影响最大的群体。
They must take their seat at the table, not wait until one is offered. => 他们必须跻身庙堂，而不能坐等施舍。
The Transformative Power of Africa’s Youth => 非洲青年的变革力量

One young man said he planned to put more computers into primary schools; another had set up a network to connect rural job seekers in the urban tumult of Dakar, Senegal’s capital. => 其中一位年轻人说他计划为小学配备更多电脑；另外一位则在塞内加尔首都达卡尔的城市混乱中建立起了联系农村求职者的网络。
After they finished sharing their plans, I congratulated them, and said that their parents must be very proud. => 在听完他们的计划后，我对他们表示祝贺，说他们的父母肯定是非常自豪的。
But instead of accepting the compliment, they demurred. => 但他们非但没有接受赞美，反而陷入了沉默。
For ambitious young Africans, there are many obstacles to success. => 对于雄心勃勃的非洲年轻人来说，需要克服许多障碍才能取得成功。
The journey to a job – whether formal or informal, entrepreneurial or traditional – is often a solitary one. => 无论从事正式或非正式、创业或传统工作，求职的旅程往往都充满了孤独。
Many young people lack access to skills training or even a favorable social environment to try something new. => 许多年轻人缺少技能训练，甚至得不到有利的社会环境来尝试新鲜事物。

As I was reminded that day in Senegal, helping young people find gainful employment is the most important thing that the international community can do to help Africa develop. => 那天在塞内加尔的经历提醒我，帮助年轻人找到有价值的工作是国际社会能够帮助非洲发展的最重要的事务。
Africa is home to the world’s largest population of young people. => 非洲拥有全世界数量最大的年轻人口。
In about 25 years, those young people will be part of the biggest workforce in the world, with more than 1.1 billion people of working age. => 在未来25年间，这些年轻人将成为世界劳动大军的主力，其中有超过11亿工作年龄人口。
By some forecasts, 11 million people will enter Africa’s labor market each year for the next decade, most of whom will be first-time job seekers. => 某些预测认为，未来十年，每年将有一千一百万人进入非洲劳动力市场，其中绝大多数都是首次求职者。

If African countries boost job growth and equip young people with employable skills, this youth bulge can deliver rapid, inclusive, and sustainable economic growth to the continent. => 如果非洲国家促进就业增长并用就业技能武装年轻人，这股年轻人大潮可以为非洲大陆带来快速、包容和可持续的经济增长。
In turn, millions would have the opportunity to lift themselves out of poverty. => 反过来，成百上千万人或许有机会摆脱贫困。
But Africa cannot achieve this future alone. => 但非洲无法凭借一己之力实现这样的未来目标。
At the Mastercard Foundation, we believe that, if Africa is to reach its potential, gaps in two keys areas must be closed. => 在万事达基金会，我们认为如果想让非洲充分发挥其潜力，那么有两大关键领域的差距必须得到弥补。
The first area is access to financial products and services. => 第一个领域是获取金融产品和服务。
According to the World Bank, some two billion people around the world currently lack such access. => 据世界银行统计，世界各地约有20亿人目前无法获得金融产品和服务。

In Sub-Saharan Africa, just 34% of adults have a bank account, making it difficult for people to put money aside for unplanned events, like a bad harvest, or to save for school. => 在撒哈拉以南非洲地区，仅有34%的成年人拥有银行户头，这种状况为人们储蓄资金以备不时之需带来了困难，比如遇到农作物歉收或者为了积攒学费的需要。
This must change, with Africans gaining not only better access to banking systems, but also improved financial literacy. => 这种状况必须改变，非洲民众不仅应当拥有更好的金融系统，而且应当提高金融素养。
The second key challenge that must be addressed is exclusion from secondary and higher education. => 必须解决的第二个关键问题是排斥中等和高等教育。
While progress has been made in some regions, only about one-third of Africa’s young people graduate from high school. => 尽管某些地区已经取得了进展，但从高中毕业的年轻人仅占约三分之一左右。

Girls are particularly disadvantaged; according to UNESCO, in Sub-Saharan Africa, an estimated nine million girls under the age of 11 have never been to school, compared to six million boys. => 这方面女孩儿尤其弱势；据联合国教科文组织统计，在撒哈拉以南非洲地区，估计有900万11岁以下女童从未接受过学校教育，而从未上过学的男童仅有600万左右。

Already, a new generation of educated and ethical entrepreneurs, like those I met in Senegal, is emerging across Africa, demonstrating a profound commitment to building a stronger Africa. => 就像我在塞内加尔所遇到的那样，非洲各地正在涌现新一代受过教育且讲道德的企业家，体现了建设更强大非洲的深远的目标。

Some of our program’s graduates have even established community projects in their villages to address HIV/AIDS or to build shelters for orphans and young children. => 我们课程的某些毕业生已经在自己的村里设立了应对艾滋病毒/艾滋病的社区计划，还有人修建了孤儿和幼儿收容机构。

Those of us working in the field of international development can help level the playing field even more, by giving young Africans from all backgrounds an opportunity to lead in transformative ways. => 我们这些国际发展领域工作者可以协助进一步创造公平环境，赋予所有背景的非洲年轻人机会以变革的方式进行领导。
If we succeed, Africa’s dreamers of today will be the catalysts of positive change tomorrow. => 如果我们能够取得成功，非洲今天的梦想家将成为明天积极变革的催化力量。
Africa’s Defining Challenge => 非洲决定性的挑战
ADDIS ABABA – Africa has the youngest population in the world, and it’s growing fast. => 亚的斯亚贝巴 — — 非洲有全世界最年轻的人口，而且正在快速增长之中。
By 2055, the continent’s youth population (aged 15-24), is expected to be more than double the 2015 total of 226 million. => 到2055年，非洲大陆的年轻人口（15到24岁）预计将比2015年的总人数2.26亿翻两番以上。
Yet the continent remains stubbornly inhospitable – politically, economically, and socially – to young people. => 但年轻人在非洲大陆却仍然面临着不友好的政治、经济和社会环境。

The success of African governments’ efforts to address this will be the single most important factor determining whether the continent prospers or suffers in the coming decades. => 非洲国家政府能否解决这一问题将成为今后几十年非洲大陆繁荣或是萧条的唯一最重要的决定因素。

A business-as-usual approach would risk exposing Africa not only to economic underperformance and a brain drain, but also to criminality, political and social unrest, and even armed conflict. => 如果继续采用一切照旧的做法，那么非洲不仅需要面对经济疲软和人才外流，而且可能面对犯罪活动猖獗、政治和社会动荡乃至爆发武装冲突。
But Africa can thrive if its governments act now to tap the energy and dynamism of the burgeoning youth population. => 但如果非洲政府立即采取行动激发新一代年轻人的能量和活力，将会给非洲大陆带来繁荣。

What is needed is a comprehensive policy agenda, comprising demographically informed measures that address political, cultural, and economic exclusion in a synchronized manner. => 我们需要制定全面的政策议程，充分考虑到相关的人口因素，同步解决政治、文化和经济领域青年人所面临的排斥和困境。

That is the world’s largest age gap between governors and the governed, and it raises concerns about how well decision-makers understand the needs and aspirations of young people. => 这创造了全世界执政者和被执政者之间最大的年龄差，并引起了人们对决策者能否理解年轻人期望和需求的担心。

It does not help that a tradition of gerontocracy prevails in many countries, meaning that young people’s political participation and influence is restricted on cultural grounds. => 许多国家在传统上盛行老人政治也让问题变得更加严重，这意味着年轻人的政治参与和影响力受制于文化因素。
Much work also remains to be done on the economic front. => 经济方面也还有许多任务需要完成。

According to the African Development Bank, 12 million young people entered Africa’s labor force in 2015, but only 3.1 million jobs were created. => 据非洲开发银行统计，2015年有1，200万年轻人加入非洲劳动者队伍，但却仅仅创造了310万个就业岗位。
That means that millions of young people were left without a stake in the economy. => 这意味着数以百万计年轻人的一切经济利益都被剥夺。
In the short and medium term, it will be virtually impossible to create enough jobs to meet the needs of the unemployed and vulnerably employed. => 中短期来看，几乎不可能创造就业机会来满足失业和弱势群体的就业需求。
Africa does not have a large labor-intensive manufacturing sector to absorb its mushrooming young population. => 非洲并不具有能大量吸纳年轻人口的大规模劳动密集型制造业。
But there are programs that can help. => 但有些项目可以起到一定的缓解作用。
Still, given the dearth of opportunities at home, many young Africans view migration as a chance for social mobility. => 但鉴于国内机会的严重匮乏，许多非洲年轻人依靠移民来争取社会流动性。
Yet, as the CEO of a major company based in Sub-Saharan Africa recently lamented to me, acquiring work visas for Africans is extremely difficult. => 但撒哈拉以南非洲一家大企业的首席执行官最近曾对我抱怨，为非洲人争取工作签证是一项极其困难的任务。
In fact, it can be easier to get a work visa for a British citizen than for, say, a Ghanaian with the same skills. => 事实上，英国公民或许能比具有同等技能的加纳公民更容易地取得工作签证。

Africa’s vision for economic integration, as set out in the African Union’s Agenda 2063, cannot be realized without labor migration that creates African careers paths for young people. => 如果没有为非洲年轻人拓展职业道路的劳工移民政策，就很难实现非洲联盟2063年议程所规划的非洲经济一体化的前景。
Yet, contrary to popular belief, young people are not migrating from Africa exclusively for economic reasons. => 但与外界的普遍认识不同，年轻人并非仅仅出于经济原因才选择移民。
Rather, they are motivated by the promise of opportunities for genuine self-improvement and the freedom to decide who to be and how to live. => 相反，他们希望寻找真正的自我完善机会以及决定自我身份和生活方式的自由。
That is certainly what led me to leave Africa and head to Europe at a young age. => 我年轻时肯定因为这些因素才离开非洲来到欧洲。

In fact, the desire for self-improvement through migration is a key element of the human story – one that no desert, sea, or artificial barrier has been able to quell. => 事实上，通过移民实现自我完善的愿望是人类经历的一个关键要素 — — 任凭沙漠、海洋抑或人为的屏障都无法阻隔。
Political and cultural exclusion intensifies it. => 政治和文化排斥加剧了这种现象。
Given this, any strategy that does not address the broader environment of marginalization is a bridge to nowhere. => 因此，任何无法真正解决边缘化大环境的策略都根本行不通。
So far, Africa seems to be sleepwalking into a future of lost opportunity and, potentially, serious instability. => 到目前为止，非洲似乎在梦游中进入到一个丧失机会、而且可能极端不稳定的未来。

And Africa’s international partners have remained preoccupied with containing migration from the continent, rather than addressing its underlying causes. => 而且非洲的国际伙伴似乎一直专注于限制来自非洲大陆的移民，而不是关注产生移民问题的根本理由。
But there may be reason for hope. => 但我们仍有理由满怀希望。
The fifth European Union-Africa Summit, to be held later this year, will focus squarely on the continent’s young people. => 今年晚些时候即将召开的欧盟非洲首脑会议势必将关注的重点放在非洲大陆的年轻人身上。
Likewise, the African Union’s theme for 2017 is “Harnessing the Demographic Dividend Through Investments in Youth.” => 同样，非盟2017年的工作主题是“通过投资年轻人挖掘非洲的人口红利 ” 。
To paraphrase Martin Luther King, Africa confronts the fierce urgency of now. => 借用马丁·路德·金的话讲，非洲现在正面临着万分紧急的时刻。
There is such a thing as being too late. => 有的时候太晚就一切都来不及了。
Listening to Africa’s Future Farmers => 聆听非洲未来农民
NAIROBI – Africa is in the midst of a youth employment crisis. => 内罗毕—非洲陷入了一场青年就业危机。
By 2035, some 350 million new jobs will be needed, and agriculture, the continent’s biggest industry, could provide the bulk of them. => 到2035年，非洲需要大约3.5亿个新工作岗位，其最大产业农业能够提供其中的大部分。
But at the moment, young Africans are shunning life on the farm for work in the city. => 但目前，非洲年轻人正在离开田间地头，来到城市中工作。
If Africa’s employment gap is to be closed, agribusinesses must find ways to recruit younger hands. => 要想填补非洲就业缺口，农业企业必须设法招募更年轻的人手。

This challenge was the focus of my research as part of the Youth Think Tank, a youth-led research initiative in partnership with Restless Development Uganda and the Mastercard Foundation. => 这一挑战是我的研究重点。 这项研究是由年轻人领衔、研究计划青年智库（Youth Think Tank）与不懈开发乌干达（Restless Development Uganda）和万事达卡基金会（Mastercard Foundation）合作开展的计划的一部分。
In a recent report, we examined the experiences of young African agriculturalists in seven countries. => 在最新报告中，我们考察了非洲多国年轻农业专家的经验。
And what we discovered is that the best way to entice young people back to the farm is by improving access to and engagement with emerging technologies. => 我们发现，吸引年轻人重回农场的最佳办法是让他们能够获得和利用新兴技术。

Many of the young people with whom we spoke said that their biggest obstacle to a career in farming is learning the digital and technical skills necessary to succeed in today’s agricultural market. => 与我们交流的许多年轻人说，他们务农的最大障碍是学习在当今农业市场中获得成功所必须的数字和科技技能。
It stands to reason, then, that if more young people could master digital skills, more would find work in the field. => 因此，如果更多年轻人能够驾驭数字技能，就自然会有更多人在田间地头找到用武之地。
To understand how important technology is to the young African farmer, consider competition for land. => 要理解技术对非洲年轻农民的重要性，可以考察以下土地竞争。

Most farmland is acquired through hereditary or communal distribution systems, and when new plots are allocated, they are typically smaller than those provided to previous generations. => 大部分农地通过遗产或公共分配制度获得，而新分配农地往往大小不如此前所分的农地。
To remain profitable, younger growers must produce larger crops from smaller spaces, which requires innovation. => 要保持盈利能力，年轻农民必须在更少的土地上种出更多庄稼，而这就需要创新。
Our study found that in many cases, the best solutions for young farmers are already being designed by young people. => 我们的研究发现，在许多情况下，对年轻农民来说最好的办法已经在年轻人的开发之中。
For example, in Kenya, one vegetable grower turned her kitchen garden into a vertical farm to increase its output. => 比如，在肯尼亚，一位菜农把她的裁菜园改造为垂直农场以增加产出。
Today, she runs her own business designing, fabricating, and installing similar structures for a variety of customers. => 如今，她经营着自己的企业，为各种客户设计、制作和安装类似的结构。
Another interviewee created a mobile app to help farmers connect with local seed and fertilizer suppliers. => 另一位受访者开发了一个移动应用帮助农民与本地种子和肥料供应商联系。
Unfortunately, these types of youth-driven innovations rarely receive the necessary political or financial backing to make them viable and scalable. => 不幸的是，这些年轻人推动的创新很少能够获得必要的政治和财务支持实现生存和扩张。
Despite having great ideas, most young agricultural innovators do not feel supported in their efforts. => 许多年轻农业创新者拥有了不起的想法，但难以获得支持。
Young people can help solve Africa’s unemployment challenges, but those closest to the problem have yet to be made part of the solution. => 年轻人能够助力解决非洲的失业问题，但最接近问题的人却无法成为解决方案的一部分。
Our research suggests several strategies to achieve this outcome. => 我们的研究建议了一些实现这一结果的策略。
For starters, young people need places to engage with like-minded innovators. => 首先，年轻人需要与创新同道交流的场所。

Recognizing this, policymakers and the private sector should work together to create incubation centers and ideation hubs to help young people build, discuss, and access farm-related technologies. => 认识到这一点，决策者和私人部门应该合作建立孵化中心和创意枢纽（ideation hub）帮助年轻人构建、讨论和接触与农场相关的技术。

Moreover, those who promote new farm technologies should travel to the places where young people gather, to provide hands-on, audience-specific training. => 此外，推进新农场技术的人应该亲身体验年轻人聚集的场所，提供亲身体验、为受众量身定制的培训。
If the newest farm gadgets and tools are marketed only on social media, as is often the case, uptake in rural areas will remain weak. => 如果最新农场技术和工具旨在社交媒体上兜售（通常正是如此 ） ， 农村地区对这些技术和工具的吸收便无法提高。
Next, young people need access to financial products and services to help them turn their ideas into marketable businesses. => 还有，年轻人需要得到金融产品和服务，以助他们将概念转化为可以在市场推广的业务。
And, finally, countries must find ways to involve their youth in early stages of the technology-development pipeline. => 最后，各国必须设法在技术发展的早期阶段就让年轻人参与进来。
As the experience of the Kenyan gardener illustrates, young people are often the best judges of what will deliver long-term, practical results. => 前述肯尼亚菜农的经验表明，年轻人常常是哪些概念能带来长期切实效果的最佳评判者。

Last year, I had the privilege of presenting these findings at the Global Youth Economic Opportunities Summit in Washington, DC. => 去年，我有幸在华盛顿的全球青年经济机会峰会（Global Youth Economic Opportunities Summit）上展示这些发现。
I spoke about the role young people play in Africa’s economy, and the importance of soliciting their views on the future of African agriculture. => 我谈到了年轻人在非洲经济中的作用，以及收集他们关于非洲农业的未来的观点的重要性。
It was an important first step in bringing young peoples’ ideas to the table. => 这是将年轻人的概念摆上台面的重要的第一步。
But much work remains to be done. => 但还有很多工作需要完成。

According to the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations, the average age of an African farmer today is about 60, while 60% of the population is under the age of 24. => 据联合国粮农组织，非洲农民的平均年龄目前为60岁左右，而60%的非洲人口不到24岁。
To breathe new life into Africa’s farms, the entire industry must innovate. => 要向非洲农场注入新鲜血液，整个农业都必须创新。
And, as our research shows, the best way to do that is by working much more closely with those who have the most to gain from progress. => 而我们的研究表明，实现创新的最佳办法是与从进步中获益最多的群体进行更加紧密的合作。
After Assimilation => 同化以后
Human migration is as old as history. Even migration to distant places and remote cultures is nothing new. => 人类的迁徙与我们的历史一样悠久，即便移民到遥远、陌生的国度也毫不新奇。
In the nineteenth century, millions of Europeans sought liberty and prosperity in the Americas, notably in the United States. => 19世纪，成百上千万的欧洲人前往美洲，特别是美国寻找自由和繁荣。
What is new today is the scale of migration, often across huge cultural divides - and often without a definite aim. => 但今天的移民规模是前所未有的，移民们常常跨越了巨大的文化障碍－而且没有特定的目标。
The African boat people in the Mediterranean are often not even sure whether they want to be in Italy, Germany, or Britain. => 地中海的非洲船民常常不清楚自己想去哪里：意大利、德国还是英国。
Once upon a time, North America, notably the US, seemed to provide the answer. => 曾几何时，北美洲，特别是美国，成了解决问题的样板。

It was that of the "melting pot": different peoples made their own contribution to American culture, but, above all, they made every effort to accept what they found and integrate. => 他们提出了"熔炉"概念：不同的人为美国文化做出自己的贡献，但最重要的是，他们尽力接受现实，融入美国社会。

More recently, this has changed, giving rise to a process described by Arthur Schlesinger, the historian and former aide to President John F. Kennedy, in his book The Disuniting of America. => 可近来情况却有所变化，约翰·F·肯尼迪总统的前助理、历史学家阿瑟·施莱辛格在其著作《美国的分裂》中描述的问题开始初现端倪。

No longer are all US citizens Americans. They have become hyphenated Americans: Italian-Americans, African-Americans, Hispanic-Americans, and so on. => 美国公民不再都是美国人，而是要在前面加上特定的修饰语：意大利裔美国人、非洲裔美国人、西班牙裔美国人等等等等。
The ingredients of the melting pot are separating. => 美国熔炉的各个部分开始四分五裂。
Even in Israel, the last true immigration country - at least for Jews - assimilation is no longer so easy. => 即使在最后一个真正的移民国家以色列－至少对犹太人来讲确实如此－文化融合也不再是件易事。
Recent newcomers from Russia have their own political party, and old Europeans have become a distinct minority. => 不久前到来的俄国新移民成立了自己的政党，而那些欧洲老移民成了当然的少数民族。
Israel and America continue to have mechanisms to integrate new migrants. => 以色列和美国仍然具备融合新移民的机制。

Language is an important underlying factor, and in Israel, there is the army, while in America, the values embodied in the Constitution still represent a shared secular faith. => 语言是个重要的根本因素，此外以色列还有军队，而美国宪法蕴藏的价值观仍然代表着共同的社会信仰。
But these mechanisms are weakening everywhere, and are virtually non-existent in European countries. => 但这样的机制正在全球范围内逐渐削弱，在欧洲国家更是几乎不复存在。
Modern societies are characterized by acute problems of belonging. => 归属问题成了现代社会最严重的危机。

They don't offer the implicit, unconscious ties of community that citizens felt in the past. As a result, people have begun to cling to other, more primordial group identities. => 人们再也无法像过去那样感觉到含蓄却潜移默化的整体联系，结果导致他们开始固守其它更原始的团体特征。
They resist assimilation, fearing that it will rob them of their identity without offering a new one. => 他们拒绝同化，害怕文化的融合不仅带不来新的归属感，还会把原来的身份也无情地夺走。
What then is the alternative to assimilation? => 那么除同化外还有什么其它的选择？
The "salad bowl" of so-called multiculturalism is no real alternative, because it does not provide the necessary glue that binds communities together. => 所谓的多文化主义"沙拉"并不是真正的选择，因为它提供不了联结团体所必须的粘合剂。
All the ingredients remain separate from the outset. => 所有的部分从一开始就四分五裂。

The public space is multicultural in terms of people's backgrounds, but is governed by agreed values, even a common language, whereas the people's private lives are - to use an ugly word - ghettoized. => 公共领域中人们的背景非常多元化，但却奉行共同的价值观甚至讲同样的语言，而人们的私生活却－用个不太好听的字眼来形容－形形色色。
In theory, this is a distinctly second-best solution to the cultural consequences of migration; in practice it is the best answer we have. => 从理论上讲，这是解决移民问题的次优方案，但从实际来看，这是我们现有的最佳做法。
But it cannot be had for nothing. => 但这也绝不是唾手可得。
Even the necessary minimum of a common language requires a deliberate effort, to say nothing of certain rules of behavior. => 因为即便想满足共同语言的最低限度也需要努力，更不用说建立特定的行为规范了。

This is clearly easier in London and New York than it is in smaller towns or even in the capitals of countries where the world language of English is not spoken. => 如果比起小城镇甚至是非英语国家的首都，这样的现象在伦敦和纽约等城市肯定更为普遍。

Berlin's Turkish community and the North African communities around Paris seem increasingly separate, with their own public sphere and often language. => 柏林的土耳其人和巴黎周边的北非人似乎越离越远，每个民族都有自己的公共领域，也都有自己的语言。

Where this happens, an explosive condition can arise, a kind of separatism within, not by historically separate groups but by newcomers against natives. => 如果出现了这种情况，就会产生蕴含着分离主义的爆炸性局面，这不是古已有之的团体对立，而是新移民与当地人之间的对立。

If we are forced to abandon the hope of assimilation, our efforts should concentrate on creating a public space to which all contribute and that all enjoy. => 如果我们被迫放弃同化的希望，那么就必须集中力量创造所有人为之奉献并共同享受的公共环境。

Ideally, this should be an expanding public space, for in the end, the element of unity in a modern society is the guarantee of its citizens' liberty. => 理想状况下，这种公共环境应该持续发展，因为归根结底，现代社会的团结因素是公民自由的最终保障。
After Austerity => 紧缩之后

NEW YORK – This year’s annual meeting of the International Monetary Fund made clear that Europe and the international community remain rudderless when it comes to economic policy. => 纽约—今年的IMF年会清楚地表明，欧洲和国际社会对经济政策还是一头雾水。
Confidence, it was repeatedly said, needs to be restored. => 需要重塑信心这一点被反复重申。
Worse, seldom is it explained how to square the circle. => 更糟糕的是，这不啻缘木求鱼。
How can confidence be restored as the crisis economies plunge into recession? => 在危机经济体深陷衰退的时候，如何重塑信心？
How can growth be revived when austerity will almost surely mean a further decrease in aggregate demand, sending output and employment even lower? => 在紧缩几乎肯定会进一步拖累总需求、使产出和就业继续恶化的时候，如何重塑增长？
This we should know by now: markets on their own are not stable. => 现在我们需要知道的是，市场不能靠自己稳定下来。
Not only do they repeatedly generate destabilizing asset bubbles, but, when demand weakens, forces that exacerbate the downturn come into play. => 市场不但一再造成不稳定的资产泡沫，当需求疲软时，市场还会形成加剧下滑趋势的力量。
Unemployment, and fear that it will spread, drives down wages, incomes, and consumption – and thus total demand. => 失业以及对失业蔓延的担心压低了工资、收入和消费，从而拖累了总需求。

Decreased rates of household formation – young Americans, for example, are increasingly moving back in with their parents – depress housing prices, leading to still more foreclosures. => 家庭形成速度的下降 — — 比如，年青一代美国人越来越多地搬回家去和父母同住 — — 抑制了房价，导致了更多的人被剥夺了按揭权。

States with balanced-budget frameworks are forced to cut spending as tax revenues fall – an automatic destabilizer that Europe seems mindlessly bent on adopting. => 实行平衡预算框架的国家被迫削减预算，因为税收收入降低了 — — 这就是欧洲一根筋地力行不懈的“动摇器 ” （ destabilizer ） 。
There are alternative strategies. => 我们可以采取替代措施。

Some countries, like Germany, have room for fiscal maneuver. Using it for investment would enhance long-term growth, with positive spillovers to the rest of Europe. => 德国等国家拥有财政机动的空间，用之进行投资可以提振长期增长，并对欧洲其他国家形成积极的溢出效应。
Europe as a whole is not in bad fiscal shape; its debt-to-GDP ratio compares favorably with that of the United States. => 整体而言，欧洲的财政状况并不差：其债务-GDP比率比美国还要好。
If each US state were totally responsible for its own budget, including paying all unemployment benefits, America, too, would be in fiscal crisis. => 如果美国的每个州都需要对自身预算完全负责（包括支付所有失业保险 ） ， 那么美国也将爆发财政危机。
The lesson is obvious:  the whole is more than the sum of its parts. => 美国的经验是显而易见的：部分之和大于整体。

There are already institutions within Europe, such as the European Investment Bank, that could help finance needed investments in the cash-starved economies. => 欧洲内部已经有了合适的机构（如欧洲投资银行）可以帮助资金受困国为必须的投资融资。
The EIB should expand its lending. => 欧洲投资银行应该加大贷款力度。
Europe’s single-minded focus on austerity is a result of a misdiagnosis of its problems. => 欧洲之所以一根筋地死抓紧缩不放，是因为他们误诊了问题。
Greece overspent, but Spain and Ireland had fiscal surpluses and low debt-to-GDP ratios before the crisis. => 希腊确实是指出过度，但西班牙和爱尔兰在危机前财政都有盈余，债务-GDP比率也���低。
Giving lectures about fiscal prudence is beside the point. => 大谈审慎财政可谓使错了力。
Taking the lectures seriously –  even adopting tight budget frameworks – can be counterproductive. => 把这一点当真，甚至采取严厉的预算框架只能适得其反。
The consequences of Europe’s rush to austerity will be long-lasting and possibly severe. => 欧洲忙不迭采取紧缩措施的后果将持续很长时间，而且可能会很严重。
If the euro survives, it will come at the price of high unemployment and enormous suffering, especially in the crisis countries. => 如果欧元可以幸存下来，那也是以高失业和多重痛苦（特别是对危机国家来说）为代价的。
And the crisis itself almost surely will spread. => 而危机本身几乎肯定会蔓延开来。
As a result, society’s most valuable asset, its human capital, is being wasted and even destroyed. => 因此，社会最宝贵的资产 — — 人力资本正在被浪费甚至摧毁。

Young people who are long deprived of a decent job – and youth unemployment in some countries is approaching or exceeding 50%, and has been unacceptably high since 2008 – become alienated. => 年轻人长期找不到体面的工作 — — 一些国家年轻人失业率正在达到或超过50 % ， 且自2008年以来便一直处于难以接受的高水平 — — 对社会产生了离心感。
When they eventually find work, it will be at a much lower wage. => 即使他们最终找到了工作，工资也会低得多。
Normally, youth is a time when skills get built up; now, it is a time when they atrophy. => 通常，青年时代是积累技能的时期，而现在的年轻人却在流失技能。

So many economies are vulnerable to natural disasters – earthquakes, floods, typhoons, hurricanes, tsunamis – that adding a man-made disaster is all the more tragic. => 如此多的国家在自然灾害面前束手无策 — — 地震、洪水、台风、飓风、海啸，等等 — — 而人造灾难更是雪上加霜。
But that is what Europe is doing. => 但这正是欧洲做的事情。
Indeed, its leaders’ willful ignorance of the lessons of the past is criminal. => 事实上，欧洲领导人故意忽视历史教训可以说是一种犯罪。
The pain that Europe, especially its poor and young, is suffering is unnecessary. => 欧洲 — — 特别是欧洲穷人和年轻人 — — 所正在经历的痛苦是完全可以避免的。
Fortunately, there is an alternative. => 幸运的是，我们可以找到替代方案。
But delay in grasping it will be very costly, and Europe is running out of time. => 但迟迟不行动将带来高昂的代价，而欧洲正在浪费宝贵的时间。
Immunization Independence => 接种独立
WASHINGTON, DC – The first years of this century have been heady ones for global health. => 华盛顿—本世纪的头十几年是全球卫生的黄金时代。

But now some of the countries that have benefited from these programs face a new challenge: sustaining the gains they have made once external support is withdrawn. => 但如今一些从这些计划中获益的国家面临一个新挑战：在失去外部支持后继续保持已经取得的成果。
Ultimately, it is on the basis of this transition that donors’ initiatives – and the health aid enterprise as a whole – will be judged. => 说到底，出资人的项目 — — 以及作为一个整体的卫生援助事业 — — 都要根据这一转变来予以评判。
Consider Gavi, the Vaccine Alliance. => 以疫苗联盟Gavi为例。
When a country’s annual per capita income rises above a certain threshold – currently $1,580 – it becomes ineligible for Gavi support. => 年人均收入达到一定标准 — — 目前是1,580美元 — — 的国家就无法获得Gavi支持。
Of course, Gavi doesn’t just cut off funding all at once. => 当然，Gavi不会立即切断资金。
Support is phased out over a period of several years. => 支持会在几年的时间里逐步结束。

During this transition period, countries rapidly increase their financial contribution to their immunization programs and prepare to assume full responsibility. => 在这个过渡期中，国家要大幅增加免疫计划的财政投入，并准备好完全自力更生。
This approach, which enables Gavi to concentrate its resources on countries with the greatest need, has been in place since 2010. => 这一方针自2000年以来实施至今，让Gavi能够将资源集中于最需要的国家。

But it is now being put to a stern test: one-third of the 73 countries to which Gavi extends support are either in the midst of the transition process or have just completed it. => 但如今，它面临着严峻的考验：在73个Gavi延长支持的国家中，有三分之一要么正处于过渡期，要么刚刚结束过渡期。

The group includes countries as different from one another as Armenia, Bhutan, Honduras, and Vietnam, as well as India and Nigeria, which have the largest birth cohorts. => 这些国家情况各异，如亚美尼亚、不丹、洪都拉斯、越南，也包括出生率最高的国家，如印度和尼日利亚。
The Gavi model is now under the microscope. => Gavi模式正在被放在显微镜下观察。
Will countries be able to continue purchasing and delivering the vaccines that were introduced with Gavi support? => 这些国家能够继续购买和普及通过Gavi支持引入的疫苗吗？
Equally important, will that commitment hold up over time? => 同样重要的是，这一事业能够坚持下去吗？
If government budgets are cut, will immunization be protected, along with other essential health services? => 如果政府预算被削减，接种能与其他基本卫生服务一起得到保护吗？
Will countries be able to introduce new lifesaving vaccines as they become available? => 当新的救命疫苗面世时，各国能够引入它们吗？
Will they sustain and strengthen disease surveillance, so that outbreaks are detected and addressed quickly? => 它们能够保持和强化疾病监控，以使疾病的爆发得以发现并迅速控制吗？

The answers to these questions are important not only for the countries themselves, but also for their neighbors, which could be put at risk by backsliding on immunization. => 这些问题的答案不仅对于这些国家本身十分重要，对于它们的邻国也很重要，因为邻国可能因此出现免疫退步的情况。
After all, infectious diseases do not respect national boundaries. => 毕竟，传染病是不会尊重国界的。
The recent yellow fever epidemic in Angola, for example, spread to its much poorer neighbor, the Democratic Republic of Congo. => 比如，最近安哥拉爆发的黄热病疫情就传播到了比它穷得多的邻国民主刚果。

The experiences of countries that have “graduated” from Gavi assistance will also hold important lessons for other international health programs and their beneficiaries. => 从Gavi援助中“毕业”的国家的经验也给其他国际卫生项目及其受益国提供了重要的教训。
With so much at stake, international agencies must do whatever they can to prepare countries for “life after Gavi.” => 兹事体大，国际机构必须竭尽全力为这些国家准备好“没有Gavi的日子 ” 。

For some of these countries, especially those that have adopted many new vaccines, obtaining adequate and sustainable financing is one of the most daunting challenges posed by the transition. => 对其中一些国家，特别是引入了大量新疫苗的国家，获得并保持足够的资金是这一转型最艰巨的挑战。

Although immunization programs require only a relatively small share of health budgets and yield exceptionally high economic returns, securing the needed financing requires careful planning. => 尽管免疫计划只需要花费卫生预算的相对较小比例，并且能够带来极高的经济回报，但保证所需资金仍然需要仔细的规划。
A new resource can help countries as they wrestle with this challenge. => 新资源有助于各国战胜这一挑战。
It does not prescribe one way forward, but rather provides relevant information and expert analysis. => 它不指定某种做法，而是提供相关信息和专家分析。
Countries can then evaluate options in light of their own circumstances, and advocates can ask the right questions. => 各国可以据此根据各自所处环境评估各种选项，推广者也可以提出正确的问题。
With Gavi support, close to 580 million children have been immunized since 2000, and more than eight million future deaths have been averted. => 在Gavi的支持下，2000年以来有接近5.8亿儿童获得了接种，超过八百万起未来死亡得到避免。
These are impressive gains that are worth celebrating. => 这是值得庆祝的令人瞩目的成就。

But only if countries successfully negotiate the transition from Gavi support can they be confident that future generations will enjoy the same health protections. => 但只有各国成功度过取消Gavi支持的过渡期，它们才会有信心让子孙后代获得同样的健康保护。
After Kyoto => 京都议定书之后
The Kyoto Protocol treaty has now entered into force for the 126 nations who have joined it so far. => 《京都议定书》已对参加该协议的126国生效。

Now is the time to start thinking about how to engage all nations, including large emitters, in conversations about what to do after the treaty’s expiration in 2012. => 现在是时候考虑如何使所有的国家，包括那些气体排放大国，参与讨论2012年，即该议定书失效后的应对方法了。

This is exactly what the European Commission did recently by providing its first strategy for a post-Kyoto era, which will be discussed by the European Council next March. => 这正是欧盟执委会最近针对后京都时代提出的第一个策略所要做的，这一策略将在三月份交由欧盟理事会讨论。

But first, all countries must integrate climate concerns into policy planning, and improve their governance in key sectors such as energy, infrastructure, and transport. => 但是首先，所有国家必须将对气候的关注与政策制定融合一体，加强对能源、基础设施和交通等重要部门的控制。

In other words, we must act in accordance with the recognition that climate change and its effects on people in both rich and poor countries remains a threat to global security. => 换言之，在对气候变化有所认识并且意识到它给发达国家和贫困国家人民带来的影响将对全球安全构成威胁这一点后，我们必须采取相应措施。
At the end of the day, the long-term approach is likely to include a rules-based system, an incentives system, and investments in technology change. => 最后，这一长期计划应该包括一个标准式系统、一个激励体系以及技术改革所需的投资资金。
Increasingly, adaptation at the national level will be recognized as a major issue that will require appropriate funding. => 国家对此计划的应用将日益成为一个需要充足资金的主要项目。
Dealing with the impacts of climate change and with emission reductions should not be mutually exclusive, but complementary. => 对气候变化影响和减排量这两个问题的处理并非相互排斥，而是互补的。
Looking ahead to the post-Kyoto world offers us the chance to start a new dialogue and to look at new options on climate change. => 对后京都时代的展望将让我们有机会开启一场新对话，并开始寻求解决气候变化问题的新方案。

This would require increasing investments in energy research and development for new and improved technologies – a process that needs to be supported by stronger public-private partnerships. => 这将需要在能源研究和开发新型技术方面持续加大投入 — — 需要更为强有力的公私营机构的合作予以支持。

Up to now, with only 15% of the world’s population, rich countries have been responsible for more than 75% of global carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions, and thus most of the environmental damage. => 目前为止，只占世界人口15%的发达国家却排放了占世界总量75%以上的二氧化碳，是大部分环境破坏的罪魁祸首。
However, it is the developing countries – and thus the world’s poor – who are most vulnerable. => 然而，发展中国家，也就是全世界的贫困人民 — — 却饱受苛责。

It is unrealistic to ask poor countries, where more than 1.6 billion people do not have access to clean energy and technologies, to bear the costs associated with the much needed technological change. => 要那些居住在贫困国家、无法获得清洁能源和技术的16亿人民去承担技术改革所需的费用是不现实的，尽管这样的技术改革非常必需。

Working with partners, the World Bank is supporting financial strategies to assist developing countries in meeting the costs caused by climate change. => 世界银行与其合作伙伴一起，正致力于为发展中国家提供金融策略以帮助他们支付气候变化带来的费用。

To date, over $1 billion dollars in Global Environment Facility (GEF) grants, together with about $8 billion in co-financing, have been committed to programs related to climate change. => 迄今为止，来自全球环境基金（GEF）的十亿多美元资金，与80亿美元的联合资金一起，已承诺将用于气候变化相关的项目。
Without a regulatory framework beyond 2012, the window of opportunity for initiating project-based transactions will close by 2006/2007. => 若2012年后还没有一个管理框架出台，那么创立一个项目式交易的机会之窗将在2006或2007年之前关闭。
Therefore, projects need to be operational at the latest by 2007. => 因此，该项目必须在2007年之前进入操作阶段。

The World Bank has been instrumental in advancing carbon finance as a viable development tool, and in facilitating private-sector participation in the market. => 世界银行已经开始将碳资金当作一项可行的发展工具来加以促进推动，并且鼓励私营机构加入此市场。

The Bank is focused on representing the interests of its borrowing countries, helping them to develop assets for carbon trading according to their own priorities. => 世界银行将重点放在维护其债国的利益之上，帮助他们根据各自的优势来发展碳贸易的资产。

According to a recent World Bank-supported survey of companies interested in carbon finance, only one in five respondents declared that they were interested in buying post-2012 emissions reductions. => 根据最近由世行资助的一项对有意碳资金的公司的调查来看，只有五分之一的公司宣称他们有兴趣购买2012年后的减排量。
After Paris => 巴黎之后

Just why the Islamic State decided to stage its attacks now is a matter for conjecture; it may well be that it is going global to compensate for its recent loss of territory in Iraq. => 伊斯兰国为什么要组织袭击现在仍停留在猜测阶段；很有可能是因为它因为最近在伊拉克丧失领土而追求全球报复。
But whatever the rationale, what is certain is that a clear response is warranted. => 但不管原因如何，可以确定的是必然会有明确的反应。
Actually, the challenge posed by the Islamic State calls for several responses, as there is no single policy that promises to be sufficient. => 实际上，伊斯兰国所构成的挑战需要多重反应，因为没有哪项单独的政策足以应对。
Multiple efforts are needed in multiple domains. => 我们需要多重领域的多重反应。
One is military. => 其一是军事。
More intense attacks from the air against Islamic State military assets, oil and gas facilities, and leaders are critical. => 加大针对伊斯兰国军事资产、石油和前燃气设施以及领导人的空中打击力度至关重要。
But no amount of air power on its own will ever get the job done. => 但不论多大的空中力量也无法单枪匹马解决战斗。
A substantial ground component is needed if territory is to be taken and held. => 如果想要占领并守住领土，就必须大量派遣地面部队。
Unfortunately, there is no time to build a partner force on the ground from scratch. => 不幸的是，已经没有时间从零开始建设一支地面友军。
This has been tried and failed, and Arab states are unable or unwilling to constitute one. => 曾经做过这一尝试，但以失败告终，而阿拉伯国家也无法或不愿组建这样一支地面部队。
The Iraqi army has also come up short. => 伊拉克军队让人失望。
Iran-backed militias only make matters worse. => 伊朗支持的民兵只能让事情变得更糟。
The best option is to work more closely with Kurdish troops and select Sunni tribes in both Iraq and Syria. => 最佳的选择是与库尔德军队更加紧密地合作，并遴选伊拉克和叙利亚的逊尼派部落。
Such an effort must be collective. => 这一方针必须以集体行动的方式落实。
The packaging matters less than the results. => 如何组织不重要，结果更重要。
Symbolic declarations of war, though, ought to be considered with caution, lest the Islamic State appear to be winning every day it does not lose. => 但象征性地宣战要慎之又慎，以免造成伊斯兰国不输便是赢的表象。
A diplomatic component is no less essential to any response. => 外交反应的重要性不下于任何其他反应。
Syrian President Bashar al-Assad is a recruiting tool for the Islamic State and must go. => 叙利亚总统巴沙尔·阿萨德是伊斯兰国招募人手的工具，他必须下台。
But any successor government must be able to maintain order and not permit the Islamic State to exploit a power vacuum, as it has done in Libya. => 但继任政府必须能够维持秩序，不允许伊斯兰国利用权力真空，重蹈利比亚的覆辙。
Moreover, orderly political change can be brought about only with Russian and Iranian support. => 此外，有序的政治变革必须在俄罗斯和伊朗的支持下进行。

One near-term option worth exploring is a coalition government still headed by a representative of the Alawite minority, a concession that could well be the price of moving Assad out of power. => 一个值得探索的短期选择方案是成立一个仍以阿拉维少数派代表为首的联合政府，这是让巴沙尔远离权力的必要的让步。

In principle, and over time, a more representative national government could come about, although talk of holding elections in 18 months is fanciful under any scenario. => 理论上，借以时日，可能产生一个更具代表性的国家政府，尽管不论在何种情形下，要在18个月内举行选举都只是幻想。
But reaching a compromise along these lines could well be impossible. => 但在这些方面形成妥协也许非常困难。

This is why increased military effort is needed to bring about larger and more secure enclaves that could better protect civilians and take the fight to the Islamic State. => 因此，必须加码军事手段建立更大更多的飞地以更好地保护平民和打击伊斯兰国。
Syria is not a normal country in any sense, and it will not be for a long time, if ever. => 不论从何种角度看，叙利亚都不再是正常国家，并且在相当长的一段时间（如果不是永远的话）都无法成为正常国家。
A Syria of enclaves or cantons is a more realistic model for the foreseeable future. => 在可预见的未来，一个由飞地和根据地组成的叙利亚才是更加现实的模式。

Other indispensable elements of any effective strategy include expanded help for or pressure on Turkey to do much more to stem the flow of recruits to the Islamic State. => 有效战略的其他不可或缺要素包括给予土耳其更大的帮助或压力，令其花更大的力气阻止应募者流入伊斯兰国。
And Turkey, along with Jordan and Lebanon, need more financial assistance as they shoulder the bulk of the refugee burden. => 土耳其以及约旦和黎巴嫩需要更多的金融支持，因为它们承担了大部分难民负担。
Arab and Muslim leaders can do their part by speaking out to challenge the Islamic State’s vision and delegitimize its behavior. => 阿拉伯和穆斯林领导人也可以做出贡献，挑战伊斯兰国的愿景、破坏伊斯兰国行为的合法性。
There is also a domestic dimension to policy. => 国内政策也大有可为。
Homeland security and law enforcement – increasing protection both at borders and within them – will have to adjust to the increased threat. => 祖国安全和执法情况 — — 加强边界和内部保护 — — 必须根据日益严重的威胁作出调整。

Retail terrorists – individuals or small groups carrying out armed attacks against soft targets in open societies – are extremely difficult to deal with. => 零散恐怖分子 — — 针对开放社会的软目标实施武装袭击的个体或小集团 — — 最难对付。

The threat and the reality of attacks will require greater social resilience and quite possibly a rebalancing of individual privacy and collective security. => 袭击的威胁和现实需要更大的社会恢复力，也许还需要平衡个人隐私和集体安全之间的关系。
What is also required is a dose of realism. => 除此之外还需要现实主义。
The struggle against the Islamic State is not a conventional war. => 与伊斯兰国的斗争不是一场传统战争。

We cannot eradicate or destroy it any time soon, as it is as much a network and an idea as it is an organization and a de facto state that controls territory and resources. => 我们无法短时间内根除或消灭伊斯兰国，因为它有一个网络、一套思想，也因为它是一个控制着领土和资源的组织、一个事实上的国家。
Indeed, terrorism is and will continue to be one of the scourges of this era. => 诚然，恐怖主义是并将继续是现时代一场灾难。

The good news, though, is that the threat posed by the Islamic State to the Middle East and the rest of the world can be dramatically reduced through sustained, concerted action. => 但好消息是，伊斯兰国给中东和世界其他地区所造成的威胁可以通过持续的集体行动大幅削弱。
The main lesson of the attack on Paris is that we must be prepared to act over time and place alike. => 巴黎袭击的主要教训是我们必须随时随地做好行动准备。
After Pax Americana? => 美式和平之后

NEW YORK – It has become popular to suggest that when the dust settles from the global financial crisis, it may become clear that the United States-led post-war world has come to an end. => 纽约 - - 一段时间以来，有人热衷于说当全球金融危机尘埃落定之时，美国主导的战后世界将会结束。
If so, the global system that has secured peace, security, openness, and economic growth over the past six decades could be in grave danger. => 如果这样，在过去六十年中确保了和平、安全、开放以及经济增长的全球体制就会处于严重危险之中。

The US military’s protective umbrella gave large swaths of the world a vacation from war, making it easier for them to focus on economic growth and regional integration. => 在美国大学接受教育的外国学生把有关自由市场、创业精神以及民主的新观点带回国内。 美国军队的保护伞让世界上的大部分地区免于战火，使得这些地区更为容易地专心致志地从事经济增长和地区联合。
