The point was driven home at the 7th Asia-Europe Meeting (ASEM) in Beijing this autumn, where European and Asian leaders began exploring ideas for a new global financial structure. => 今年秋天在北京举行的第七次亚欧首脑会议证明了这一点。 在这次会议上，亚欧各国领导人开始研究建立新的全球金融结构。
Despite talk about American decline, the world is not prepared for a post-American era. => 尽管人们谈论美国衰落，但是世界对后美国时代还是没有做好准备。

If the US were to play a relatively smaller role in world affairs, and no other system was created to pick up the slack, these values could be at risk. => 如果美国在世界事务上发挥相对较小的作用而且没有建立其他制度来弥补空缺，那么，这些价值观就会受到危险。

Do countries around the world believe that they will be better off if the global trade system breaks down or international shipping lanes become less secure? => 世界各国是否相信，如果全球贸易体系崩溃或者国际航运线路不再安全它们的日子会更好呢？

Unless other countries become more willing to step forward for the common good, a post-American world could quickly become a far more frightening environment than what it would replace. => 除非其他国家更加愿意为人类共同事业挺身而出，否则，后美国的世界将会马上要比原先的更为令人害怕。

Even at the apex of American power, America’s greatness was always based on inspiring others, and the opportunities for building market share in that particular category remain unlimited. => 即使在美国鼎盛时期，其伟大之处也是鼓舞激励他人，而在这一特殊领域中建立市场份额的机会还是不可限量。
Closing the prison at Guantánamo and reaffirming America’s commitment to international law and human rights will also be an important step in this direction. => 关闭关塔纳摩监狱并且重申美国对国际法和人权的承诺也将是这一方向的重要一步。
The world wants to believe in an America that lives up to its own best values. => 世界想要相信遵守自身最佳价值观的美国。
The prospect of a truly global community of nations working together to achieve the greater good for all is indeed exciting. => 国际社会各国共同努力实现共同事业这一前景的确令人激动。

But, although America has been far from perfect over the last six decades, the end of the pax Americana has the potential to create a dangerous void in international affairs. => 但是，尽管美国在过去六十年中并非完美无缺，美式和平的终结有可能在国际事务中造成危险的真空。

If the world is going to shift in the direction of a new and more globally democratic system, other nations will need to meaningfully step forward to assume new responsibilities. => 如果世界转向一个新的、更为全球性民主的体制，那么，其他国家就需要有效地采取行动承担新的责任。

It is in America’s and the world’s interest that they do so.  The evidence of this will be seen not only in global institutions but also in places like Darfur, Zimbabwe, and Burma. => 它们这样做符合美国和世界的利益。 不仅在全球性机构、而且在达尔富尔、津巴布韦以及缅甸等地方都可以得到验证。
After the Guns of August => 八月冲突之后
The Middle East is a place where the dust hardly ever settles. => 中东战争的尘埃从未落定。
Let’s start with the United States. => 就从美国说起吧。
President George W. Bush has been short on neither initiatives nor catchy slogans and acronyms. => 乔治·W·布什总统既拿不出可行的方案，也提不出令人心动的口号和名词。

But like all his previous initiatives since the terrorist attacks on New York and Washington almost five years ago now, the NME ran into trouble from the outset. => 但正如他在五年前纽约和华盛顿遭袭后提出的所有计划一样 ， “ 新中东计划”从一开始就麻烦重重。
Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice announced its birth while rejecting an immediate ceasefire in Lebanon. => 国务卿康多莉扎·赖斯在宣布该计划诞生的同时，否决了黎巴嫩立即停火的提案。

Her poor timing made the initiative appear heartless, as thousands of civilians were being uprooted, killed, or maimed by Israel’s efficient but ruthless artillery and air force. => 她不恰当的时间选择让新计划毫无诚意可言。 在这项计划诞生的同时，成千上万的平民百姓在以色列高效但却无情的炮火和空袭中流离失所、无辜丧命或者身负重伤。
This so embarrassed the three Arab NME partners that each raced to distance itself from the US-sponsored initiative. => “新中东计划”令三位阿拉伯伙伴深感不安，它们都迫不及待地同这项由美国提出的计划划清界限。

Egypt’s heir apparent Gamal Mubarak followed suit in the fourth week of the fighting by heading a 70-member delegation on a solidarity visit to Beirut. => 黎以交战进入第四个星期时，埃及政权当然的继承人贾迈勒·穆巴拉克(Gamal Mubarak)也站到了黎巴嫩一边，率领70人的代表团访问贝鲁特。
As for America, anything it touches in the Middle East has become radioactive, even for longstanding clients and friends. => 至于美国，它在中东的举手投足无一例外地臭名昭著，即便是长期委托人和朋友也避之唯恐不及。

In the course of maneuvering to delay the UN ceasefire, Bush and Rice continually reiterated the need for a Security Council resolution that deals forcefully with “the roots of the problem.” => 在为推迟联合国停火协议四处游说的同时，布什和赖斯翻来覆去地强调必须通过一项安理会决议，用武力来应对“问题的根源 ” 。

Of course, for them and for Israel, this was Hezbollah and the need to eradicate or at a minimum disarm it and force its fighters to a safe distance from settlements and towns in northern Israel. => 勿庸置疑，对美国和以色列来讲，这个根源就是黎巴嫩真主党，必须将其彻底消灭，至少也要解除武装，迫使真主党的战士远离以色列北部的城镇和犹太定居点。
This and numerous other resolutions seeking redress for injustices toward Palestinians have been ignored by the US. => 试图改变巴勒斯坦人所受不公正待遇的上述以及其他决议美国全都置之不理。
Thus, for 300 million Arabs and more than one billion Muslims the “root cause” of the Middle East conflict is not Hezbollah. => 正因为如此，对3亿阿拉伯人和10多亿穆斯林来说，黎巴嫩真主党并不是中东战争的“最终根源 ” 。
As its leader, Hassan Nasrallah aptly put it, “We are just a reaction to chronic injustice.” => 真主党领袖哈桑·纳斯鲁拉(Hassan Nasrallah)形容得十分贴切 ， “ 真主党只不过是长期不公所缔造的产物。 ”
It may well be that there is more than one root cause – every party to the conflict has a favorite one. => 冲突的根本原因很可能不只一种¾各方对此都有着不同的说辞。
There is no point in belaboring whose pain is greater or whose root cause is deeper. => 分析哪一方的痛苦更剧烈或根源更深刻没有任何意义。
In fact, arguing over grievances merely drives the sides further apart. => 事实上，对不满情绪无休止的争论只会使各方离得更远。

The long overdue UN Resolution 1701 may, with its adoption, indicate that all parties are fatigued, or could no longer withstand international pressure. => 迟来太久的联合国第1701号决议的生效可能表明各方都已经感到疲惫，抑或是再也忍受不了国际上的压力。
This is good news for all concerned and provides an opportunity to tackle each party’s “root cause.” => 这对各方来讲都是好消息，给它们带来了解决各自根源问题的一次机遇。
Seizing the opportunity requires that humility rather than moral supremacy prevails. => 抓住这次机遇需要虚怀若谷，而不是盲目自大。

Empathy, not ethnocentrism, should be the order of the day now that the guns are falling silent and we have rediscovered the limits of military force. => 在炮火逐渐平息、武力界限再度浮现的时刻，需要设身处地地为对方考虑，而不是盲目愚蠢的自我中心。

But if we have learned anything at all from the tragic assassinations of the region’s greatest peacemakers, Anwar Sadat and Yitzhak Rabin, it is that the guns do not remain silent for long. => 但如果中东地区最伟大的和平使者安瓦尔·萨达特和伊扎克·拉宾被刺的悲剧曾经留给过我们什么教训，那就是战火熄灭的时间不会太长。
After the Millennium Development Goals => 千年发展目标之后

CAMBRIDGE – In 2000, 189 countries collectively adopted the United Nations Millennium Declaration, which evolved into a set of concrete targets called the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs). => 美国剑桥—2000年，189个国家一致接受了联合国千年宣言，并将其纳入了被称为千年发展目标（MDG）的一系列具体计划中。
As the deadline approaches, development experts are debating a new question: What comes next? => 随着截止期的临近，发展专家们开始讨论新的问题：接下去怎么办？
It is virtually certain that many of the MDGs will not have been met by the end of 2015, but there have been striking successes in some areas. => 几乎可以肯定的是，很多MDG在2015年底之前是实现不了的，但在不少领域还是取得了极大的成功。

For example, the goal of halving extreme poverty (measured by the number of people living on less than $1.25 a day) will likely be achieved ahead of time, largely thanks to China’s phenomenal growth. => 比如，将极端贫困减少一半（以每天生活费不到1.25美元的人群数量为衡量标准）的目标就有可能提前完成，其中中国的显著增长功不可没。
At the same time, there is little evidence to suggest that those successes were the result of the MDGs themselves. => 与此同时，没有证据显示这些成功是MDG本身的结果。

China implemented the policies that engineered history’s greatest poverty eradication program prior to, and independently from, the Millennium Declaration and the MDGs. => 中国的史上最伟大减贫计划因国内政策而起，发生于千年宣言和MDG之前，也独立于后两者。
Clearly, however, the MDGs were a public-relations triumph, which is not to belittle their contribution. => 不过，毫无疑问，MDG称得上公关胜利，这么说并不是要贬低它们的作用。
Like all worthwhile PR efforts, the MDGs served to raise awareness, galvanize attention, and mobilize action – all for a good cause. => 与所有有价值的公关活动一样，MDG有助于提高认识、吸引注意力和动员行动，均是积极影响。
They amplified the global conversation about development and defined its terms. => 它们扩大了关于发展问题的全球对话，并决定了对话的主题。
And there is evidence that they got advanced countries to pay more attention to poor nations. => 有证据表明，它们还使发达国家更加关注穷国。
Indeed, the MDGs possibly had their clearest impact on aid flows from rich to poor countries. => 事实上，MDG最显而易见的影响可能就在于富国向穷国的援助流。
However, aid was not directly linked to performance and results, and it is much more difficult to know whether it had the desired impact overall. => 不过，援助与表现和效果并不直接相关，了解援助是否达到了理想效果要困难得多。
The MDGs encompass eight goals, 21 targets, and 60 indicators. => MDG包括八个大目标（goal ） ， 21个小目标（target）和60项指标。

Much criticism has focused on the use of these numerical targets and indicators, which, skeptics argue, are misspecified, mismeasured, and divert attention from equally important areas. => 许多批评的矛头指向这些数量化的小目标和指标。 质疑者认为，它们的方向和衡量手段都是错误的，导致了注意力从其他同等重要领域移开。
But these complaints miss the point. => 但这些指摘并没有抓住重点。
Any effort that is concrete and implementable needs to monitor the results, and setting clear numerical targets is the best way to do so. => 任何具体且可实施的目标都需要检测结果，而设置清晰的数量目标是检测结果的最佳方法。
Still, a central paradox plagues the MDGs. => 但仍有一个核心悖论困扰着MDG。
The Millennium Declaration was meant to be a compact between the world’s rich and poor countries. => 千年宣言不啻发达国家和贫穷国家之间的契约。

Poor countries promised to refocus their development efforts while rich countries pledged to support them with finance, technology, and access to their markets. => 贫穷国家承诺重新调整发展努力，而发达国家承诺向它们提供金融、技术和市场渠道支持。
But, oddly, of the eight goals, only the last one deals with “global partnership,” or what rich countries can and should do. => 但是，奇怪的是，在八个大目标中，只有最后一个是关于“全球合作 ” ， 即发达国家可以和应该怎么做的。
Why we need a global effort to convince developing countries to do what is good for them is not clear. => 为什么我们需要全球措施来使发展中国家相信怎样做才是最好的？
Poverty reduction and human development should be the first order of business for governments in these countries, with or without the MDGs. => 这个问题还没有明确答案。 减贫和人类发展应该是这些国家政府的首要职责，不管有没有MDG都是如此。
It is true, of course, that these governments often pursue different goals, for political, military, and other reasons. => 当然，实事求是地说，出于政治、军事和其他原因，这些国家的政府通常会追求不同的大目标。
But it is wishful thinking to believe that they can be persuaded to act otherwise by international declarations that lack enforcement mechanisms. => 但认为可以通过缺少强制机制的国际宣言说服它们改变做法纯属一厢情愿。

If we have learned one thing in the development business, it is that real reform cannot be bought with donors’ money, let alone with vague promises of money. => 如果说发展事务对我们有什么教育意义的话，那就是真正的改革不可能是赞助者的金钱带来的，更不用说只是虚无的承诺资金支持了。

Equally problematic, the MDGs implicitly assume that we know how to achieve development targets, and that only resources and political will are missing. => 同样有问题的是，MDG隐含地假设我们知道如何达到发展小目标，所缺乏的只是资源和政治意愿。

But it is doubtful that even well-intentioned policymakers have a good handle on, say, how to raise secondary-school completion rates sustainably or reduce maternal mortality. => 但即使是有心的决策者，他是否能处理好（比如）持续提高中学完学率和降低产妇死亡率等问题仍然值得怀疑。

Many development economists would argue that significant improvements in governance and political institutions are required before such goals can be achieved. => 许多发展经济学家会说，在大目标可以实现之前，必须发生治理和政治制度的重大进步。

The most that rich countries can do is to provide an enabling environment for the benefit of developing countries that are willing and able to take advantage of it. => 发达国家最能给出的援助是提供促进性的环境，让愿意且有能力利用该环境的发展中国家收益。
These considerations suggest an obvious direction for the next iteration of the MDGs. => 这些考虑清晰地给出了下一代MDG的方向。
First, a new global compact should focus more directly on rich countries’ responsibilities. => 首先，新的全球契约应该更直接地专注于发达国家的责任。
Second, it should emphasize policies beyond aid and trade that have an equal, if not greater, impact on poor countries’ development prospects. => 第二，它应该强调援助和贸易之外的、对贫穷国家的发展前景具有同样（如果不是更大）推动的政策。

Notice that most of these measures are actually aimed at reducing damage – for example, climate change, military conflict, and financial crime – that otherwise results from rich countries’ conduct. => 注意，这些措施的大部分实际上都是为了减少发达国家援助行为的伤害 — — 比如气候变化、军事冲突和金融犯罪。
“Do no harm” is as good a principle here as it is in medicine. => “不产生伤害”这一医学格言在这里同样是一条很好的原则。
This kind of reorientation will not be easy. => 制定这样的新目标绝非易事。
Advanced countries are certain to resist any new commitments. => 发达国家必然会抵制新承诺。
But most of these measures do not cost money, and, as the MDGs have shown, setting targets can be used to mobilize action from rich-country governments. => 但这些措施大多并不需要金钱，MDG也表明，设定小目标可以用于动员发达国家政府的行动。

If the international community is going to invest in a bold new public-relations initiative, it might as well focus on areas where the potential payoffs are the greatest. => 如果国际社会欲投资雄心勃勃的新公关计划，那么把目光集中在潜在收益比最高的领域是不错的选择。
After the Promised Land => 追逐理想之地

LONDON – At the height of the Arab uprisings last spring, many Europeans were gripped by nightmare visions of a tsunami of migrants crashing against the continent’s shores. => 伦敦 — — 去年春天，在阿拉伯起义愈演愈烈之际，许多欧洲人被大批移民将涌入欧洲的可怕远景困扰。

The wave never hit, but its specter fed a tenacious anti-immigrant populism that has concealed an important new trend: migration to Europe – and to the United States – has largely stalled. => 事实并非如此，但是这种恐惧感催生了强烈的反移民民粹主义，这掩盖了一种重要的新趋势：移民欧洲和美国基本上停滞了。
In many countries, more immigrants are leaving than are arriving, owing mainly to the economic crisis that has drained jobs in the West. => 对于许多国家而言，移民国外的人要比入境的移民要多，这主要是因为经济危机导致西方的就业岗位减少。
That reversal is one of the great under-reported stories of 2011 (and of the preceding two years), and the numbers are startling. => 这种倒退的情况是2011年（以及2011年之前的两年）报道严重不足的地方之一，各项数据令人吃惊。
Consider Spain, which is on track to lose more than a half-million residents by 2020. => 拿西班牙来说，到2020年，其居民将减少50多万。
By contrast, between 2002 and 2008, Spain’s population grew by 700,000 a year, driven largely by immigration. => 相比之下，2002年至2008年期间，西班牙的人口每年增长70万，这主要得益于移民。
The trends are similar elsewhere in Europe. => 欧洲其他国家的趋势也大同小异。

While this fact alone will not quiet opponents of immigration, it does give countries more breathing room to repair and strengthen badly broken systems for receiving and integrating newcomers. => 尽管这一事实无法让移民的反对者守住嘴巴，但是它让各国有了更多的余地，修复和加固严重受损的制度，以便接受新移民并让他们融入本国。

Although rapidly aging Western countries are unable to attract the immigrants they need, they allow millions who are already there to suffer discrimination and abuse. => 尽管快速老龄化的西方国家无法吸引其所需的移民，但是它们还让数百万已经移居于此的移民遭受歧视和虐待。
Detentions and deportations take place under sometimes terrible conditions. => 有时在极其恶劣的环境下扣押和驱逐出境。

Meanwhile, the international community collectively fails to protect vast populations of vulnerable migrants, such as the millions stranded by the recent conflicts in North Africa. => 与此同时，国际社会都没有保护大量易受伤害的移民群体，比如因最近北非冲突陷入困境的数百万人。
Undoubtedly, rising anti-immigrant populism must be confronted. => 毋庸置疑，日益高涨的反移民民粹主义情绪必须加以遏制。
While polling suggests that attitudes are influenced more by ethnicity than religion, both help to define identities and mindsets. => 但是民调显示，民众的态度较之宗教，更多的是受到种族的影响，种族和宗教都有助于确定身份和思维模式。
Political parties in France, Switzerland, and the Netherlands (to name a few) have run successful campaigns that scapegoat immigrants. => 法国、瑞士和荷兰等国的政党都成功地发起了嫁祸移民的运动。
Moreover, governments from Alabama to Hungary are passing laws that undermine what should be migrants’ rights. => 此外，从亚拉巴马到匈牙利，各地政府正在通过法律，削弱移民应有的权利。
Italy recently adopted harsh “emergency” decrees that target migrants by making undocumented entry and residence a criminal offense. => 最近，意大利采取了针对移民的严厉的“紧急”法案，将非法入境和居住视为犯罪。
Anti-immigrant rhetoric from the political extremes has fed into mainstream political discourse. => 政治极端派反移民的言论已经进入政治讨论的主流。
European leaders trip over themselves to declare, one more forcefully than the next, that multiculturalism is dead. => 欧洲领导人搬起石头砸自己的脚并且一浪高过一浪地宣布，多元文化主义已经灭亡。

Dutch politician Geert Wilders, whose Freedom Party is informally part of the governing coalition, did them one better by being charged with incitement to anti-Muslim hatred. => 荷兰政客格特•怀尔德是自由党人，自由党不是正式执政联盟的一部分，他受到了激起反穆斯林敌意的指控，比其他人做的要好。
In the US, alligator-filled moats and electrified border fences have featured in the current presidential campaign. => 在美国边境，壕沟中都是短吻鳄，还有带电的围栏，这显示出了当前总统竞选的特色。

Such attacks on immigration might offer some instant political gratification, but their net result is to cleave societies whose cohesion is already seriously challenged by the economic crisis. => 这样对移民进行攻击或许能够带来一些即时的政治利益，但是最终结果必定会使社会分裂，而社会的凝聚力已经受到了经济危机严重影响。
Growing discrimination in employment, housing, and education affects not just immigrants and their children; it harms our societies as a whole. => 在就业、住房和教育方面日益严重的歧视问题不仅会影响移民及其后代，也不利于我们整个社会。
With the lull in net immigration, we now have a window of opportunity to address these shortcomings. => 由于净移民停滞，现在我们拥有了克服这些不足的机会之窗。

Debunking the myths about migration – that most immigrants enter unlawfully, for example, or that immigration displaces existing workers – would be a good place to start. => 揭露移民方面的错误 — — 比如，大多数移民非法入境或移民导致现有工人失业 — — 是一个良好的开端。
It would also be useful to explain that immigration is necessary for prosperity and growth in almost all OECD countries. => 移民几乎对所有经合组织成员国的繁荣和经济增长都必不可少，这种解释也是非常有用的。
The gaps in these countries’ labor markets – from software specialists to physicians to home health aides – will be immense. => 这些国家的劳动力市场 — — 从软件专家、医生到家庭医疗助理等 — — 将出现巨大的缺口。
The priorities are clear. => 优先任务非常清楚。

We need to understand better how our economies will evolve in the coming decades, and to redesign our educational systems to produce workers with usable skills. => 我们需要更好地了解自己的经济体在今后数十年将如何演化，需要重新设计我们的教育体制，从而培养出掌握有用技能的工人。
And, where it is clear that immigrants will be needed, we must be able to identify, welcome, integrate, and protect them. => 此外，在明确需要移民的地方，我们必须能够认可、欢迎并保护他们，让他们融入到我们当中来。

Meanwhile, our most fundamental institutions – schools, police, and the courts – must be re-engineered to reflect and respond to the diversity of our communities, which is now a fact of life. => 与此同时，我们最基本的机构 — — 学校、警察局和法院 — — 必须重新调整以反映和应对我们社区的多样性，这是如今的真实生活。
Countries must learn to work together to achieve these goals, few of which can be reached by going it alone. => 各国必须学会互相合作实现这些目标，单打独斗能实现的目标寥寥无几。
If our toolbox were empty, our inaction might be understandable. => 如果我们的工具箱空空如也，那么我们无所作为或��可以理解。
But examples of smart migration practices abound. => 但是采取明智移民举措的例子比比皆是。
Canada and the Philippines, for instance, have a well-functioning accord that protects the rights of temporary workers. => 譬如，加拿大和菲律宾拥有保护临时工权利的协议，效果相当好。
Sweden has developed legislation that minimizes bureaucracy for companies that need foreign workers. => 瑞典已经通过立法，为需要外国工人的公司尽量简化了行政手续。
And important advances have been made in ensuring that immigrant children receive the education that they need to become full members of society. => 在确保移民的孩子接受成为正式公民所需的教育方面也取得了重要进展。
Progress is being made on the global level as well, despite the economic crisis and populist headwinds. => 尽管受到经济危机和民粹主义的影响，全球而言还是取得了进展。

Meanwhile, the Global Forum on Migration and Development, established in 2007, has quickly become an important means of fostering knowledge and partnerships. => 与此同时，成立于2007年的移民与发展全球论坛迅速成为了增加知识和增进伙伴关系的重要途径。

The reason for growing international cooperation is simple: countries everywhere are affected by migration, and, increasingly, they are experiencing immigration and emigration simultaneously. => 国际合作日益增多的原因很简单：世界各国都受到移民的影响，移民入境和本国居民移居海外在同时进行着。

Indeed, roughly one-third of migrants nowadays move between developed countries; one-third move between developing countries; and only one-third move from the developing to the developed world. => 实际上，目前约三分之一的移民在发达国家之间流动；三分之一的移民在发展中国家之间流动；只有三分之一的移民在发展中国家和发达国家之间流动。
Highly skilled workers, such as bankers and engineers, are flocking to China. => 有高技能的工人，比如银行家和工程师，蜂拥去了中国。
Mexico, known primarily as a country of emigration, is home to millions of migrants from Central America. => 墨西哥以主要的移民出口国出名，现在有来自中美洲的数百万移民在此安家。
Millions of people in Southeast Asia venture to the Middle East to work, but millions more cross borders within the region. => 有数百万东南亚人冒险到中东工作，但是还有数百万人跨境到该地区的其他国家。
The list goes on. => 这样的例子不胜枚举。
When it comes to migration, we are all in the same boat – and that boat is leaking. => 关于移民，我们都坐在同一条船上，而这条船是漏水的。
Starting in 2012, countries should redouble their efforts to fix it. => 从2012年开始，各国必须加倍努力解决这个问题。
A Future without Precedent => 前所未有的未来
JERUSALEM – In my nearly nine decades of life, I cannot recall a time in which the past was so irrelevant to policymaking. => 耶路撒冷—以我将近90岁的年纪，想不起有哪个时候的决策与过去如此毫无关联。
All of today’s significant developments went unpredicted by anyone. => 今天的一切重大发展都是所有人前所未见的。
Experts studied the past, but, constrained by old paradigms, they could not discern the future. => 专家们研究过去，但他们被旧范式限制住了头脑，无法清醒地看到未来。
The only certainty is that the future will be defined by scientific progress and innovation, which cannot be known ahead of time. => 唯一确定的是，未来将由科学进步和创新决定，但科学进步和创新是无法预知的。

As a result, the traditional power of states and leaders is declining; in today’s global economy, innovators, not politicians, wield the most influence. => 因此，传统的国家和领袖权力在削弱；在当今全球经济中，创新者，而不是政客，才拥有最大的影响力。
The globalized economy affects every state, yet no single state can determine the outcomes, because science and technology are borderless. => 全球化经济影响着所有国家，但没有哪个国家能够单枪匹马决定结果，因为科学技术是无国界的。

Global companies wish to do business worldwide, eroding not just sovereignty, but also racism and prejudice, as well as significantly weakening nationalism. => 全球公司希望在全世界范围开展业务，这不但削弱了主权，也削弱了种族主义和偏见，并极大地抑制了民族主义。
The young leaders who created Facebook and Google have had a greater global impact than many statesmen and generals. => 创立Facebook和谷歌的青年领袖要比许多政治家和将军拥有更大的全球影响力。
These young people are also the leaders of erupting political protest movements. => 这些青年人也是风起云涌的政治示威运动的领导人。

The “Arab Spring,” the tent demonstrations in Israel, Occupy Wall Street, and the protests in Russia reveal not a clash of civilizations, but a battle of generations. => “阿拉伯之春 ” 、 以色列的露营示威 、 “ 占领华尔街”以及俄罗斯大游行所揭示的并不是文明的冲突，而是代际战争。
The young generation understands that the way states and economies are currently run is unfit for the new era. => 年青一代明白，国家和经济的现有运行模式已经落后于新时代了。

Yet there are political “hitchhikers” who want to exploit the recent awakening, not by promoting an agenda of freedom, but by imposing a different type of coercion. => 但也有意在利用当下觉醒潮的“政治浪人 ” ， 他们不推行自由日程表，反而实行另一种形式的高压。
In the Arab world, it is mainly extreme Islamists who are hijacking the young generation’s wave, stealing their revolution. => 在阿拉伯世界，极端伊斯兰主义者正在绑架年青一代的运动，窃取革命果实。
Israel has reacted positively to the will of the young generation, but it cannot and should not intervene in events in the Arab world. => 以色列积极响应年青一代的志愿，但不能也不应该干预阿拉伯世界的事务。

Our hearts are with the rebelling youngsters and their legitimate yearning for freedom and basic rights to express themselves, choose their leaders, and earn their own living. => 我们的心与叛逆青年们在一起，支持他们对自由和表现自己、选择自己的领导人、自力更生过自己的生活的权利的诉求。

Israelis wait for the day when our country will no longer be the region’s only democracy, because being an island of prosperity in a sea of poverty is unnatural. => 以色列人期待着我们的祖国不再是该地区唯一民主国家的那一天，因为成为贫困汪洋中的繁荣孤岛是极不自然的。

Yet there is a real concern that the extremists, who are politically well organized, are seeking to gain control by the ballot over less-organized liberals, thus preventing peace and stability. => 但是，我们也有现实顾虑：有着良好政治组织的极端主义者正在寻求通过投票打败组织松散的自由派赢得控制权，从而阻止和平与稳定。
Fundamentalist radicals cannot provide real solutions to the region’s basic problems. => 原教旨主义激进派不可能为该地区的基本问题提供现实解决方案。
The social changes now underway threaten their way of life, which includes discrimination against women and a ban on modern education. => 当今社会的变化正在威胁他们的生活 — — 歧视妇女、禁止现代教育。
But only profound reforms of traditional authority can pave the way towards freedom and growth. => 但唯有对传统权威的深远改革才能铺平通向自由和增长之路。

Israel can serve as an example to others striving to reach economic prosperity and social freedom, because its success is due to the fact that the country had absolutely nothing at the start. => 对于正在追求经济繁荣和社会自由者，以色列可以作为一个样板，因为以色列的成功可以说完全是从一无所有起家的。
We returned to our homeland, rich with history, but devoid of natural resources. => 我们回到了我们的故乡，这里有着丰富的历史，但自然资源贫乏。
Israel was left with only one resource: its human capital. => 以色列只有一种资源：人力资本。
So we invested in education and science, and today we have the world’s highest percentage of scientists and patents per capita. => 因此我们投资于教育和科学，而如今，我们拥有全世界最高比例的科学家和人均专利数量。
Roughly 95% of our agriculture is hi-tech. => 我们的农业95%是高科技农业。
We use less water and yield more crops per acre than any other country in the world. => 我们用更少的水种出比世界上其他国家更多的粮食亩产。
What Israel can do, others can do as well. => 以色列能够做到的，其他国家也能做到。
We will gladly offer a helping hand to whoever is willing to reach for it. => 只要愿意向这方面努力，我们十分乐意施以援手。
Together, in peace with our neighbors, we can create a region of hope, development, and success. => 与邻邦保持和平，我们就可以开创一个希望、发展和成功的地区。
In particular, we must do everything in our power to end the conflict with the Palestinians. => 尤其重要的是，我们必须尽一切力量终结与巴勒斯坦的冲突。
Israel was not born, and it is not Israel’s destiny, to govern another people. => 以色列不是生来就主宰其他民族的，这也决不是以色列的命运。

We are sincerely interested in the establishment of a Palestinian state living peacefully side-by-side with Israel, the democratic state of the Jewish people. => 我们真心实意地乐意看到能与犹太人民主国家以色列手拉手和平相处的巴勒斯坦国的建立。
The international community can support these efforts by providing incentives to countries that choose freedom and progress. => 国际社会可以通过向选择自由和进步的国家提供激励来支持我们的努力。
At the same time, determined and decisive policies must be taken against extremists. => 与此同时，必须对极端分子采取坚决果断的政策。
Iran also uses proxies to instigate terror against moderate forces in the Palestinian Authority, Lebanon, and Iraq. => 伊朗还通过其代理人教唆人们对巴勒斯坦权力机构、黎巴嫩和伊拉克的温和派大搞恐怖主义。
If Iran is successful in its plan to acquire nuclear weapons, its leaders could shake the Middle East and encourage more extremism and violence. => 如果伊朗成功地实现其获得核武器的计划，那么其领导人将能够震慑中东，掀起更多的极端主义和暴力。
Israel will defend itself if Iran continues to call for its destruction. => 如果伊朗继续倒行逆施，以色列将坚决捍卫自己。
However, the threat is not to Israel alone; Iran is a danger to the peace and stability of the entire world. => 不过，感到威胁的并非只有以色列；伊朗是全世界和平与稳定的潜藏危机。

The world’s democracies have declared that they will not allow Iran to possess nuclear arms; it is their duty to follow through on that commitment, before doing so becomes impossible. => 民主国家已经宣布，不会容忍伊朗拥有核武器；民主国家应该坚决履行这一承诺，不能等到大势已去才有所动作。
Beyond the short-term challenges ahead, we all have a duty to profoundly change the way we prepare our children to cope with today’s new world. => 除了眼前的短期挑战，我们所有人都有责任彻底改变我们为子孙后代准备的应对当今新世界的方法。

In an era where yesterday has become almost irrelevant and we can hardly predict tomorrow, the role of education must allow all children to reach their highest potential. => 在一个过去几乎毫无关联、未来几乎无法预测的时代，并需通过教育让所有孩子获得充分的潜能开发。
Today’s educators should inspire our children towards creativity and innovation. => 现时代的教育者应该激发孩子的创造力和创新力。
Self-expression is as important as free expression. => 自我表现与言论自由一样重要。
I write this in the 88th year of my life, but not because I have learned from experience. => 我已88岁之龄写下这篇文字，但我之所以这么说，并非是出于我的经验。
On the contrary, experience is overrated, often constraining the courage needed to face tomorrow and build an unprecedented new world. => 相反，经验的作用被高估了，通常会阻挠直面明天、建设前所未有的新世界所需要的勇气。
The future is already here; there is no point in looking back. => 未来就在那里，没有必要回头看。
Against Simplification => 反对简单化
NEW YORK – It is said that Americans have a genius for simplification. => 纽约 — — 都说美国人善于将事情简单化。
Gradually, however, the quest for it has become a global trend, one that continues to conquer new territories, just as blue jeans once did. => 但是，追求简单化早已逐渐成为一种全球趋势，简单化之风逾吹愈劲，就像当年的牛仔裤风尚。
The speed of our daily life is visibly increased – and not for the better – by this unstoppable evolution. => 在这一不可阻挡的变化的影响下，我们的日常生活节奏在加快，这一点谁都能看出，但生活并没有因此变得更好。
The tyranny of pragmatism seems to mark all of the complex dilemmas of our time. => 实用主义大行其道似乎已成为现时代复杂困境的共同特征。
Too many valid choices are ignored or skirted through the routine of short-cuts. => 人们总是希望走捷径，这使得许多有效选择被忽略和屏蔽了。
Nowhere is this trend more damaging than in today’s mercantile approach to art. => 说到这一趋势的害处，没有比艺术的商业化更大的了。

Just imagine what might have happened with the works of, say, Proust, Kafka, Musil, Faulkner, or Borges had they been subjected to mass-market competition like shoes or cosmetics. => 想象一下，将普鲁斯特、卡夫卡、穆西尔、福克纳和博尔赫斯像鞋子和化妆品那样置于畅销市场的竞争中去会是怎样一幅情景。

Culture is a necessary pause from the daily rat race, from our chaotic and often vulgar political surroundings, and it is a chance to recover our spiritual energy. => 文化是快节奏生活中必须的调节剂，让我们从混乱可鄙的政治环境中暂时得到解脱；同时也让我们的精神力量得到恢复。
The theme, style, and echo of his work says a lot, I think, about our simplified world. => 我认为，他的作品的主题、风格以及反响是对我们简单化世界的写照。
The novel is Blinding, by Claudio Magris. => 这部小说名叫《炫目 》 （ Blinding ） ， 克劳迪奥·马格里斯（Claudio Magris）著。

Hailed in Europe as one of the great novels of the twentieth century, Blinding arrived in America only after a great delay, and never received the attention that it deserved. => 本书在欧洲大受欢迎，被目为20世纪的伟大作品之一，但很晚才进入美国，而且一直没有受到应有的关注。
Unfortunately, that is no surprise. => 不幸的是，这一点都不令人奇怪。

The number of literary translations done nowadays in the United States is, according to a United Nations report, equal to that of Greece, a country one-tenth the size. => 根据联合国的报告，如今美国文学翻译数量和希腊相当，而希腊只是一个只有美国十分之一的小国。
They are imprisoned for their Stalinist allegiance; when they are finally allowed to return to Italy, their old comrades refuse to accept them. => 他们因效忠斯大林而被捕；而当他们最终获准返回意大利时，又被意大利老同志们拒绝了。
The book’s plot spans two centuries of revolution. => 该书的情节跨越了两个世纪的革命。
Then, suddenly, => 然后，突然地，

“the party vanished, overnight, as if all of a sudden a giant sponge had drained the entire sea, Adriatic and Austral, leaving litter and clots of mud, and all the boats stranded. => “党垮台了，在一夜之间垮台了，就好像是一块巨大的海面吸干了整个亚得里亚海和南海，留下一地狼藉，所有的船都搁浅了。
How can you go home again if the sea has been sucked down a vast drain that opened up beneath it, emptying it who knows where, into a void? => 当海洋被海底的巨大排水口吸干，成为一片没人知道身居何处的滩涂时，你又怎能找到归途？
The earth is arid and dead, but there won’t be another one, nor another heaven.” => 地球成了荒芜的不毛之地，但你找不到第二个地球，也找不到第二个天堂。 ”
Are all the extremists searching for a new coherence, for a lost illusion of togetherness and a new hope of resurrection? => 所有的极端主义都在寻找新的一致，寻找失落的团结幻觉，寻找复兴的新希望吗？
Can we ever forget September 11, 2001, the start of a bloody century in which the mystical force of hatred and destruction has recovered its strength? => 我们可能忘记2001年9·11，拉开了神秘的仇恨和毁灭力量死灰复燃的血腥世纪的那一天吗？
Is this the “rebel” response to an overly globalized, incoherent, and ultimately disturbing reality? => 这是对过度全球化、不和谐以及令人不堪烦扰的现实的“叛逆”吗？

If so, their barbarism demands scrutiny – in relation to both historical precedent and to our modernity – rather than merely being labeled “monstrous” (though it certainly is that). => 如果是的话，他们的野蛮行径就必须仔细审查 — — 既要考察他们的历史渊源，也要研究他们与我们的现代性的关系 — — 而不是给他们贴上“恶魔”的标签（尽管这在所难免）了事。

The new religious militants, fighting in the name of their particular and peculiar God, seem as fanaticized as the Fascists, Nazis, and Communists of earlier decades. => 新的宗教激进分子是在各自不同的上帝名义下斗争的，正如几十年前的法西斯主义、纳粹主义和共产主义狂热。

It is a fascinating story about the conflict between ideals and reality, or Utopia and humanness; about being faithful to a cause and betraying it; and about sacrifice and solidarity. => 这是一个梦幻般的故事，它讲述了理想和现实（或者说乌托邦和人性）的冲突，讲述了信仰和背叛的，讲述了牺牲和团结。
It is also a rich and original literary achievement that challenges today’s consumerist ethic. => 这也是一部具有丰富内涵的反对当今消费主义思想的原创文学大作。

By renouncing simplicity, it also repudiates today’s prevailing confusion of information with literature, of facts with creativity, and best-selling products with true works of art. => 这部小说断然否定简单化，也否定了当今的流行思潮 — — 混淆信息与文学、现实与创造力以及畅销作品与真正艺术品。
An Agenda for Resolving the US-China Conflict => 化解美中冲突的议程
The alternatives pose grave risks for both countries: an ever-escalating trade war, a cold war, or even a hot war. => 替代选择会给双方都带来严重的风险：不断升级的贸易战、冷战，甚至是一场真正的战争。
These risks can be avoided, but only if both leaders are willing to engage in principled compromise. => 上述风险可以避免，但前提是两国领导人都愿意作出有原则的妥协。
There is no question that a serious conflict has been building for a long time. => 毫无疑问，长期以来一直存在着严重的冲突。
Contrary to the US narrative, the problem is not the outsize bilateral trade deficit between the world’s two largest economies. => 与美国的说法相反，问题并不在于世界前两大经济体之间双边贸易逆差过大。
That is largely an outgrowth of macroeconomic imbalances that afflict both sides: China saves too much and the US saves too little. => 而主要在于困扰两国的宏观经济失衡：中国储蓄太多，而美国则储蓄过少。
These saving disparities give rise to multilateral trade imbalances that cannot be resolved by bilateral efforts. => 上述储蓄差异导致了双边努力所无法解决的多边贸易失衡。
The US had merchandise trade deficits with 102 countries in 2017, whereas China had trade surpluses with 169 countries in 2016. => 2017年美国与世界102个国家出现商品贸易逆差，而2016年中国则与世界169个国家拥有贸易盈余。
Squeeze one part of the multilateral imbalance for a deficit country or a surplus saver, and it simply gets allocated to other trading partners. => 如果单纯挤压赤字国或盈余储蓄国多边不平衡的某个部分，那么贸易不平衡分配给其他贸易伙伴将会是唯一的结局。
For the US, this would lead to higher-cost imports – the functional equivalent of a tax hike on consumers. => 对美国而言，这将导致抬高进口成本 — — 类似于向消费者征税所起到的作用。
For China, it would spell increased export penetration into other markets. => 而对中国而言，这意味着增加对其他市场的出口渗透率。
Fixation on the blame game of bilateral trade imbalances overlooks the possibility that this is a classic struggle of codependency. => 将注意力集中在就双边贸易失衡而相互指责忽略了这是一种经典的相互依存斗争的可能性。
Yes, China has long relied on the US as the major source of external demand for its export-led economy. => 诚然，中国长期以来一直依赖美国作为其出口导向型经济的主要外部需求来源。
And, as America’s third largest and most rapidly growing export market, China has become an increasingly important source of demand for US firms. => 而作为美国第三大、同时也是增长最快的出口市场，中国已经成为美国企业越来越重要的需求来源地。
The codependency framework is important because it underscores the need for joint resolution and compromise. => 相互依赖的框架非常重要，因为它强调了联合解决和相互妥协。
As in interpersonal relationships, economic codependency can be destabilizing and ultimately destructive. => 就像在人际关系中，经济依赖可能会破坏稳定，并最终带来毁灭性的后果。
When one partner changes course, the other, feeling scorned, lashes out in response. => 当伙伴国之一改弦更张时，另一个感觉受到轻视的伙伴所做出的反应很可能是猛烈攻击。

China, in this case, is the change agent – shifting its growth model from manufacturing to services, from exports to internal consumption, and from imported technology to indigenous innovation. => 现阶段，中国扮演了变革因素 — — 将其增长模式从制造业转向服务业、从出口转向内部消费，并从进口技术转向自主创新。
At the same time, China is also moving from surplus saving to saving absorption, leaving it less to lend to its deficit partner, the US. => 与此同时，中国还从盈余储蓄转向储蓄吸收，这导致它不再有那么多钱为美国这个赤字伙伴国提供借贷。
Uncomfortable in its own skin, the US feels threatened by a partner that is changing the rules of this relationship. => 不安的美国感受到了来自伙伴国的威胁，因为这个伙伴国正在改变设定的关系。

While Trump has acted on those threats far more aggressively than his predecessors, there can be no mistaking the bipartisan US sentiment now aligned against China. => 虽然特朗普对上述威胁所采取的行动远比自己的前任更加激进，但不容置疑的是，在中国问题上美国现在的两党情绪正在达成高度的统一。

According to a September 2018 Axios survey, fully 80% of Republicans – long the party most supportive of free trade – believed that increased tariffs would be good for the US. => 据2018年9月进行的一次爱可信调查显示，占总数80%的共和党人 — — 共和党长期以来一直是自由贸易的最大支持者 — — 认为提高关税将会对美国有益。
At a time of ever-escalating threats and counter-threats, the imperative of compromise cannot be understated. => 在这样一个不断升级的威胁和反威胁时代，决不能忽视妥协的必要性。

The upcoming meeting between Trump and Xi provides an opportunity to reframe the conflict as a strategic challenge for the world’s two leading economies. => 特朗普和习近平即将举行的会晤提供了重新定义美中冲突，并使之成为世界两大主要经济体所面临的战略挑战的机会。
Four possible avenues to consider: => 我们必须考虑四种可能的途径。
Market access: After ten years of tortuous negotiations, the time for a breakthrough on a US-China bilateral investment treaty (BIT) is at hand. => 市场准入：经过长达十年的曲折谈判，美中双边投资协议（BIT）现在正面临着突破的时机。
Both sides would need to offer concessions. => 双方均需要做出让步。
Saving: Both countries need to commit to responsible macroeconomic adjustments. => 储蓄：两国均需要承诺作出负责任的宏观经济调整。
The US needs to save more, reversing the reckless budget-busting trajectory reinforced by last year’s ill-timed, outsize tax cuts. => 美国需要加强储蓄，彻底逆转去年不合时宜的大规模减税所带来的不计后果的破坏预算的轨迹。
Rebuilding saving, rather than tariffs, is the most effective strategy to reduce trade deficits with China or any other trading partner. => 重建储蓄而非关税是减少与中国或其他任何贸易伙伴贸易赤字的最为有效的策略。

At the same time, China needs to save less, putting its vast pool of capital to work funding the country’s social safety net, which is essential for consumer-led economic rebalancing. => 与此同时，中国需要减少储蓄，利用所积累的海量资金来建设该国的社会安全网，这与由消费者主导的经济再平衡之间有着至关重要的联系。

The two countries should take the lead in forging a global cyber accord, complete with pooled metrics of cyber incursions, attack-reduction targets and a robust dispute-resolution mechanism. => 两国应率先制定全球网络协议，上述协议应包括网络入侵、缓解攻击目标和强有力的争端解决机制等汇总指标来加以综合考虑。
Dialogue: It is terrific that the two presidents are meeting again after their earlier tête-à-têtes in Beijing and at Mar-a-Lago. => 对话：两位总统在早前北京和海湖庄园举行的两次会晤后再次举行会晤无疑是件幸事。
Those gatherings follow more formal engagements such as the Strategic and Economic Dialogue. => 那些会晤遵循更为正式的安排，如战略和经济对话。
But all of these efforts have been episodic events that are long on glitz and short on substance. => 但所有这些努力其实都逃脱不了偶发的性质，虽然光彩夺目，但却缺少实质。
In light of contentious recent developments between the US and China, it is hard to be optimistic that a meaningful breakthrough is at hand. => 鉴于美中之间近期充满争议的事态发展，人们很难对双方取得有意义的突破保持乐观的态度。
An agenda of substance should be used as a checklist against any accord that may be struck by Trump and Xi. => 应当对照一份实质性的内容清单来检验特朗普和习近平可能达成的任何协议。
The world is watching. => 全世界都在拭目以待。
The Age of Hyper-Uncertainty => 超级不确定性时代

BERLIN – The year 2017 will mark the 40th anniversary of the publication of John Kenneth Galbraith’s The Age of Uncertainty. => 柏林—2017年是约翰·肯尼斯·加尔布雷斯（John Kenneth Galbraith）的《不确定性的时代 》 （ The Age of Uncertainty）出版四十周年。
Forty years is a long time, but it is worth looking back and reminding ourselves of how much Galbraith and his readers had to be uncertain about. => 四十年很长，但值得回首并提醒我们自己加尔布雷斯和他的读者有多大的不确定。

In 1977, as Galbraith was writing, the world was still reeling from the effects of the first OPEC oil-price shock and wondering whether another one was in the pipeline (as it were). => 1977年，在加尔布雷斯写作这本书的同时，世界仍在第一次欧佩克石油冲击的影响中挣扎，也不知道会不会有第二次冲击（后来发生了 ） 。

Meanwhile, efforts to rebuild the Bretton Woods international monetary system had collapsed, casting a shadow over prospects for international trade and global economic growth. => 与此同时，重建布雷顿森林国际货币体系的努力以失败告终，给国际贸易和全球经济增长前景蒙上一层阴影。
That’s how things looked in 1977, anyway. => 无论如何，1977年的情况就是这样。
Viewed from the perspective of 2017, however, the uncertainty of 1977 seems almost enviable. => 但是，从2017年的视角看，1977年的不确定性简直令人嫉妒。
In 1977, there was no President Donald Trump. => 1977年，没有唐纳德·特朗普总统。

Jimmy Carter may not go down in history as one of the best US presidents, but he did not threaten actions that placed the entire global system at risk. => 吉米·卡特也许不是美国历史上最好的总统个，但他没有威胁要采取让整个全球体系陷入危险的行动。
He did not turn his back on America’s international commitments such as NATO and the World Trade Organization. => 他没有背弃北约和世界贸易组织等美国的国际责任。

Nor did Carter go to war with the Federal Reserve or pack its board with sympathetic appointees willing to sacrifice sound money to his reelection prospects. => 卡特也没有向美联储宣战，或用同情他、愿意牺牲可靠货币助他连任的人选填充美联储理事会。
On the contrary, he appointed Paul Volcker, a towering pillar of monetary stability, as chairman of the Board of Governors. => 相反，他认命了货币稳定的中流砥柱保罗·沃尔克（Paul Volcker）为美联储理事会主席。
And although Carter did not succeed in balancing the federal budget, he didn’t blow it up, either. => 而尽管卡特没能成功地平衡联邦预算，但他也没有弄得一团糟。

Whether Trump slaps a tariff on Chinese goods, repudiates the North American Free Trade Agreement, packs the Federal Reserve Board, or undermines fiscal sustainability remains to be seen. => 特朗普是否会对中国商品课以关税、废除北美自由贸易协定、用自己人填充美联储理事会，或者损害财政可持续性仍有待观察。
Conceivable outcomes range from mildly reassuring to utterly catastrophic. => 差可令人放心到十足的灾难都有可能。
Who knows what will happen? => 谁知道会发生什么？
By today’s standards, Carter was the embodiment of predictability. => 从今天的标准看，卡特简直是可预测性的化身。
In 1977, moreover, the prospects for European integration were rosy. => 此外，1977年，欧洲一体化前景光明。
Denmark, Ireland, and, most notably, the United Kingdom had recently joined a rapidly growing European Community. => 丹麦、爱尔兰以及最受瞩目的英国刚刚加入茁壮成长中的欧洲共同体。
The EC was attracting members, not losing them. => 欧共体吸引着新成员，而不是失去它们。
It was a club that countries sought to join precisely in order to achieve faster economic growth. => 它是一个俱乐部，国家之所以加入其中，正是为了实现更快的经济增长。
Moreover, to buttress its common market, the EC had just established a regional monetary system, the suggestively named “snake in the tunnel.” => 此外，为了支持共同市场，欧共体刚刚成立了区域货币体系，并暗示性地命名为“隧道蛇 ” 。

While this was far from a perfect monetary system, it had one very positive attribute: countries could leave in hard economic times, and rejoin if and when the outlook brightened. => 尽管这远非完美的货币体系，但有一个非常积极的特性：各国可以在经济艰难时期离开，并在前景恢复光明后重新加入。
In 2017, in contrast, negotiations over Brexit will continue to cast a dark cloud of uncertainty over the European Union. => 相反，2017年，围绕英国退欧的谈判将继续成为飘荡在欧盟上空的一朵乌云。
How those negotiations will proceed and how long they will take are anyone’s guess. => 这些谈判如何进行、将消耗多长时间，我们都只能猜测。

Moreover, the main questions raised by Britain’s decision to leave – whether other countries will follow and, indeed, whether the EU itself has a future – remain far from resolved. => 此外，英国退出欧盟的决定所带来的主要问题 — — 其他国家是否会效仿，以及，事实上欧盟自身还有没有未来 — — 也远未解决。
Meanwhile Europe’s monetary house remains half built. => 与此同时，欧洲货币大厦仍然处于烂尾状态。
In 1977, uncertainties emanating from emerging markets were not on commentators’ radar screens. => 1977年，源自新兴市场的不确定性根本提不起评论家的兴趣。

Developing countries in Latin America and East Asia were growing, although they depended increasingly on a drip feed of foreign loans from money-center banks. => 拉丁美洲和东亚的发展中国家正在成长，尽��越来越依赖货币中心银行的外币贷款续命。
China, still largely cut off from the world, did not figure in this discussion. => 中国仍然基本与世隔绝，不再人们的讨论范围中。
And even if something went wrong in the Third World, developing countries were simply too small to drag down the global economy. => 而即便第三世界出现某些状况，发展中国家规模实在太小，不足以拖累全球经济。
The situation today couldn’t be more different. => 今天的情况大相径庭。
What happens in China, Brazil, or Turkey doesn’t stay in China, Brazil, or Turkey. => 中国、巴西或土耳其的情况所影响到的绝不仅限于中国、巴西或土耳其。

On the contrary, developments in these countries have first-order implications for the world economy, given how emerging markets have accounted for the majority of global growth in recent years. => 相反，这些国家的形势将给世界经济带来最为重大的影响，因为近几年来新兴市场一贯贡献着全球增长的大部分。
China has an unmanageable corporate-debt problem and a government whose commitment to restructuring the economy is uncertain. => 中国存在一个难以管理的公司债务问题，政府关于调整经济结构的承诺也处于不确定中。
Turkey has a massive current-account deficit, an erratic president, and an unstable geopolitical neighborhood. => 土耳其存在巨大的经常账户赤字，有一位反复无常的总统，还有一个不稳定的地缘政治周边。
And if political scandals were export goods, Brazil would have a clear comparative advantage. => 而如果政治丑闻可以出口的话，巴西将拥有明显的比较优势。
Although The Age of Uncertainty was about much more than the year 1977, it captured the tenor of the times. => 尽管《不确定性的时代》跟多地是关于1977年的著作，但它抓住了时代的主旨。
But if Galbraith were writing the same book in 2017, he probably would call the 1970s The Age of Assurance. => 但如果加尔布雷斯在2017年写作这本书，他可能会将20世纪70年代称为《确定的时代 》 。
A German Europe? => 德国的欧洲？
LISBON/RIGA – Is the Europe that is emerging from the euro crisis a German one? => 里斯本/里加 — — 欧元危机中的欧洲成了德国的欧洲？

During the euro crisis, power in the European Union seems to have shifted towards national capitals in general, and towards one national capital in particular: Berlin. => 欧元危机期间，欧洲联盟的力量似乎已经向主要国家首都转移，尤其是柏林。

But, with Germany introverted, France downgraded, and Britain semi-detached, the big story in European foreign policy is that the time has come for the little guy who thinks big. => 但是，德国转内，法国降级，英国半独立，在欧洲外交政策的大故事Ａ是，让小家伙有大作用的时候到了。
In this Europe, the important moves are now sometimes made in Stockholm or Warsaw, not only in Berlin, Paris, or London. => 在欧洲，这一重要举措不仅出现在柏林、巴黎或伦敦，现在也有时出现在斯德哥尔摩或华沙。

And, with major foreign-policy issues on Europe’s doorstep – whether in Egypt, Belarus, or now Syria – useful European initiatives are to be welcomed, regardless of where they originate. => 欧洲门槛上的重大外交政策问题 - 无论是在埃及，白俄罗斯，或现在的叙利亚 – 实用的欧洲倡议是受欢迎的，无论它们源于何方。
Germany, in foreign policy as well as in economics, can exert decisive leadership in the EU – when it wants to. => 德国无论在外交政策还是在经济上，都可以在欧盟中发挥决定性的领导地位。
For example, together with Poland, it led the EU’s attempt to develop a coordinated approach to Russia, and it flexed its muscles on Serbia. => 例如，它与波兰一起，带领欧盟试图建立与俄罗斯的协调关系，并延伸向塞尔维亚。

But, on other issues – for example, Libya – Germany did not so much lead as use its newfound room for maneuver to follow its own preferences in the face of other EU members. => 但是，在其他问题上，例如利比亚，德国没有为了自身利益在其他欧盟成员面前太多地使用回旋的新余地。

So the answer today to Henry Kissinger’s famous question about whom he should call when he wants to speak to Europe, is not necessarily “the German chancellor.” => 所以，今天对于基辛格著名问题有关当他想与欧洲对话时该找谁的答案不必再是德国总理了。

While Berlin is increasingly imposing its economic preferences on others in the eurozone, it is not prepared to use military force as a foreign-policy tool, as it demonstrated in the case of Libya. => 虽然柏林在欧元区不断加强其经济上对别国的影响，但它不准备使用武力作为外交政策工具，正如它在利比亚所做的那样。
Moreover, Germany, it seems, is becoming a “geo-economic power” driven by the needs of its export sector. => 此外，德国似乎因其出口部门的需求驱动而成为一个“地缘经济力量 ” 。
By using economic means to pursue its foreign-policy ends, Germany is gradually turning its back on its European partners. => 用其经济手段来实现外交政策目的，德国正逐渐背向其欧洲伙伴。
Meanwhile, as France experiences a loss of power relative to Germany on economic issues, it continues to play a decisive role in foreign policy. => 与此同时，法国经历了相对德国来说在经济问题上权力的损失，它仍在外交政策上发挥决定性的作用。

France led the Libya operation, and is doing much the same with attempts to impose stronger sanctions against Iran and provide support for the United Nations in Côte d’Ivoire. => 法国引导利比亚运作，并试图对伊朗实施更严厉的制裁，正如其提供对联合国在科特迪瓦的支持一样。
But France’s unilateral approach often antagonizes its European partners. => 但法国的单边主义做法往往使其与欧洲伙伴敌对。
For example, French President Nicolas Sarkozy preempted a common European position on the Palestinian statehood bid at the UN in September. => 例如，9月份，法国总统萨尔科齐在联合国巴勒斯坦建国投票中抢占了欧洲共同立场。
In other words, even when France leads, it does not always do so in a constructive way. => 换句话说，即使由法国来领导，它也并不总是用这样建设性的方式.
Apart from the decisive role that it played in Libya alongside France, Britain is becoming increasingly marginal in European foreign policymaking. => 除了与法国一起在利比亚发挥了决定性的作用，英国在欧洲外交决策中变得日益边缘化。
On other issues, such as engaging “strategic partners” – China and Russia in particular – the United Kingdom is often a follower as well. => 在其他问题上，如搞“战略伙伴 ” — —特别是对中国和俄罗斯 — — 英国往往也是支持者。

As the “big three” increasingly pursue their own narrowly defined national interests, however, other EU member states are emerging as leaders in key foreign-policy fields. => “三巨头”越来越追求自己狭隘的国家利益，而其他欧盟成员国正在成为重要外交政策领域的领导者。
Poland, too, is emerging as a foreign-policy leader. => 波兰，也逐渐成为外交政策的领导者。
Poland has also led on European defense (though it declined to take part in the military intervention in Libya). => 波兰也领导了欧洲防务（尽管它拒绝参加在利比亚的军事干预 ） 。
This reflects the strength of the Polish economy, which is expected to grow by more than 3% in 2012 – faster than almost anywhere else in the EU. => 这反映了波兰经济的实力���预计在2012年增幅将超过3 ％ - 比欧盟别的大部分国家更快。
For example, on Iran (with exceptions like Greece), Europeans have united around a clear policy and collective positions, such as an oil embargo. => 例如，对伊朗（希腊除外 ） ， 欧洲各国都共有一个明确的政策和一致的立场，如石油禁运。
So, Poland and Sweden:  Europe needs your leadership. => 因此，波兰和瑞典：欧洲需要你们的领导。
But that might not be enough in an EU with more than 500 million citizens. => 但在一个拥有500多万公民的欧盟来说这是远远不够的。
Other EU states need to follow their example in order to make European foreign policy truly effective and influential. => 欧盟其他成员国需要以他们为榜样，使欧洲的外交政策有真正的效力和有影响力。
A German Glimmer in a Global Boom => 全球经济繁荣中的德国曙光
In 2004, the world economy grew at a rate of 5.1%, the fastest pace in the last 28 years. => 2004年，世界经济增长5.1 % ， 为过去28年中最快。 Ifo的世界经济景气指标来源于对90个国家的1200名专家进行季度调查。

In 2005, growth is estimated to have been about 4.3%, and a similar rate can be expected in 2006, marking a period of sustained rapid global growth unseen since the 1970’s. => 2005年，预计增长大约4.3 % ， 预计2006年也会有类似的增长率。 这将是自上世纪七十年代以来所没有出现的全球经济快速持续增长的时期。
But the boom is not uniform. => 但是，这一繁荣并不平衡。
However, in the Asian countries, including China, the optimism is unbroken. => 但是，包括中国在内的亚洲国家却都很乐观。
The same is true for Eastern Europe, the ex-Soviet states, and Latin America. => 东欧、前苏联国家以及拉丁美洲国家也是如此。
The big surprise is Europe, which, unlike in 2004 and the first half of 2005, now seems to be catching up with the rest of the world. => 令人惊讶的是欧洲。 与2004年很2005年上半年不同的是，欧洲看起来正在赶上世界其他地方。

Whereas growth was a miserable 1.5% in 2005 in the 15 “old” members of the European Union, Ifo expects EU-15 growth to accelerate to 2.1% in 2006. => 2005年15个“老”欧盟成员的增长率尽管只有可怜的1.5 % ， Ifo预计，欧盟15国在2006年的增长将会加快到2.1 % 。
To be sure, economic performance will vary widely among EU countries. => 的确，欧盟成员国的经济表现差异巨大。

While Italy will be the laggard, with only 1.1% growth, the Irish rocket will not lose its force, pushing real GDP up by about 4.8%. => 意大利居于人后，只有1.1 % ， 爱尔兰火箭般的发展速度不会降低，其实际GDP将增长大约4.8 % 。 总体而言，与欧盟较小的国家相比，欧盟大国仍然差强人意。
But even Germany, Europe’s biggest economy, is experiencing an upswing. => 但是，即使是欧盟最大的经济体德国也在上升。
After five years of stagnation, the economy is finally on the move. => 经过5年的滞胀，德国经济终于开始复苏。
The driving force is external demand, as Germany, the world’s second-largest exporter, profits from the global boom. => 外在需求是经济复苏的驱动力量。 德国作为全球第二大出口国从全球繁荣中受益巨大。
Exports increased by 6.2% in 2005 and are expected to increase by 7.4% in 2006. => 2005年出口增长6.2 % ， 预计2006年可达7.4 % 。
However, as we saw in 2004 and 2005, exports are not enough to create substantial growth if domestic demand does not follow. => 但是，正如我们在2004年和2005年所看到的那样，如果国内需求跟不上的话，出口并不足以创造可持续的增长。
The good news for Germany is that investment demand is now growing, too. => 德国的好消息是投资需求也在增长。
While the second half of 2005 was already quite good, Ifo expects investment in equipment to grow by a healthy 6% in 2006. => 2005年下半年已经很好，Ifo预计，设备投资在2006年会健康地增长6 % 。
After many years of contraction, investment in construction also will rise slightly. => 经历数年的萎缩，建筑投资也将略有增长。
Total investment growth is expected to reach 2.9% – weak by past standards, but nonetheless a promising salve for the wounded German mood. => 整体投资增长预计达到2.9 % ， 这按照过去的标准而言是软弱的，但是对于受伤的德国情绪而言却是大有希望的宽慰。

Moreover, any investment growth is vital for Germany, which, according to the latest OECD statistics, currently suffers from the world’s lowest share of net investment in national income. => 而且，对于德国而言，任何投资增长都是至关重要的。 根据经合组织最新统计数据，德国的净投资在全国收入中所占的份额目前是全球最低的，因此深受其害。

Even if Germany remains the world’s laggard, rising investment demand as such will contribute to GDP growth, which Ifo estimates at 1.7% in 2006. => 即使德国仍然滞后于全球经济，如此增长的投资需求将会为GDP增长作出贡献。 Ifo估计，德国2006年的GDP增长率为1.7 % 。
That number looks small compared to most other countries. => 与其他大多数国家相比，这一数字相形见绌。
In fact, all EU countries except Italy and the Netherlands will grow faster. => 实际上，除了意大利和荷兰以外的所有欧盟国家都将提速。
But everything is relative: Germany’s trend growth rate is just 1.1%, and the country has been the slowest growing EU country since 1995. => 但是，所有的事情都是相对的：德国的趋势增长率仅为1.1 % ， 而且自1995年以来一直是欧盟国家中增长最慢的国家。
Measured against a disappointing past, even Germany is currently experiencing an economic boom. => 与令人失望的过去相比，即使是德国目前也在经历经济繁荣。
Indeed, even German unemployment, which has been rising in cycles since 1970, will decline slightly in 2006, from 4.8 to 4.7 million. => 德国的失业人数自1970年以来一直循环上升，即使如此，失业人数也会在2006年略微下降，从480万下降到470万。

In fact, the government may even have contributed a bit to the good economic data by announcing a serious effort to consolidate Germany’s own public finances – a prerequisite for investor confidence. => 实际上，莫克尔政府通过宣布有力措施巩固德国自身的公共财政而甚至可能为良好的经济数据作出了贡献。 巩固自身的公共财政对于投资者信心而言是前提条件。
The real test for the German government is the labor market. => 德国政府真正的考验是劳动力市场。
Most observers now agree that Germany needs something like the American earned-income tax credit. => 大多数观察家现在都认为，德国需要类似美国那样的所得税抵扣。
That would widen the wage distribution, create jobs, and maintain the living standard of the poor. => 这将会扩大工资分配，创造就业机会，并且维持穷人的生活水准。
Merkel announced in her inaugural speech in the Bundestag that her government will introduce such a system in 2006. => 莫克尔在德国议会所作的就职演说中宣布，她的政府将将在2006年实施这一制度。

In the long term, that would be more promising for the EU – and for the global economy – than the demand-driven performance that Germany is currently enjoying. => 从长远来看，这对欧盟和全球经济而言要比德国目前所处的由需求驱动的经济表现更加有前途。
Is Pensioner Populism Here to Stay? => 年长者民粹主义会成为常态吗？

MILAN – The right-wing populism that has emerged in many Western democracies in recent years could turn out to be much more than a blip on the political landscape. => 发自米兰 — — 近年来在许多西方民主国家中崛起的右翼民粹主义或许不仅仅是政治版图中的昙花一现。
It turns out that older voters are rather sympathetic to nationalist movements. => 事实证明年长的选民对民族主义运动相当同情。
Older Britons voted disproportionately in favor of leaving the European Union, and older Americans delivered the US presidency to Donald Trump. => 投票支持脱欧的年长英国人要高于其所占人口比例，而年长的美国人则将总统大权交到了特朗普手里。
Neither the Law and Justice (PiS) party in Poland nor Fidesz in Hungary would be in power without the enthusiastic support of the elderly. => 如果没有老年人的热情支持，波兰的法律和正义党以及匈牙利的青年民主联盟都不会上台。
And in Italy, the League has succeeded in large part by exploiting the discontent of Northern Italy’s seniors. => 在意大利，联盟党在很大程度上成功利用了意大利北部老年群体的不满情绪。

Among today’s populists, only Marine Le Pen of France’s National Rally (formerly the National Front) – and possibly Jair Bolsonaro in Brazil – relies on younger voters. => 在当下的民粹主义者中，只有法国国民联盟（前身为国民阵线）的马琳·勒庞 — — 或许还有巴西的贾伊尔·波尔索纳罗（Jair Bolsonaro ） — —会依赖年轻选民。
Next spring, this age-driven voting pattern could drive the outcome of the European Parliament election. => 到了明年春天，这种年龄驱动型投票模式可能会影响到欧洲议会的选举结果。
This is surprising, given that memories of World War II and its legacy should be fresher for older generations. => 这点有些出乎意料，因为照理来说老一代人应该对第二次世界大战的记忆及其遗产更为熟知。
Nevertheless, their skepticism toward democratic EU institutions may explain their receptiveness to authoritarian leaders. => 然而，他们对欧盟民主机构的怀疑可能解释了他们对专制领导人的接纳行为。
Most likely, a growing sense of insecurity is pushing the elderly into the populists’ arms. => 最有可能的是，日益增加的不安全感正在将老年人推向民粹主义者的怀抱。

Leaving aside country-specific peculiarities, nationalist parties all promise to stem global forces that will affect older people disproportionately. => 而在针对每个国家各自特点的许诺之外，各民族主义政党都承诺要遏制那些对老年人构成不成比例影响的全球性力量。

For example, immigration tends to instill more fear in older voters, because they are usually more attached to traditional values and self-contained communities. => 比如说，年长选民一般会对移民产生更多的恐惧，因为他们通常更加依赖于传统价值观和自给自足的社区。
Likewise, globalization and technological progress often disrupt traditional or legacy industries, where older workers are more likely to be employed. => 同样全球化和技术进步经常会冲击一些传统或遗留行业，而这些行业更有可能雇用老年人。
The rise of the digital economy, dominated by people in their twenties and thirties, is also pushing older workers to the margins. => 由20~30岁人群主导的数字经济也在把老年工人推向边缘。

But, unlike in the past, crumbling pension systems can no longer absorb such labor-market shocks. The result is that older workers who lose their job are condemned to long-term unemployment. => 但与过去不同的是，摇摇欲坠的养老金体系再也无法吸收这种劳动力市场冲击，结果是老年工人一旦失去工作就将陷入长期失业。
Moreover, pensioners now have reason to worry about threats to their retirement benefits from their own children. => 此外，养老金领取者现在也有理由担心自己后代的退休福利待遇会受到威胁。

Young people, frustrated with socioeconomic systems that are clearly tilted in favor of retirees, are increasingly calling for fairer intergenerational redistribution of scarce resources. => 年轻人对明显偏向退休人员的社会经济体系感到沮丧并日益呼吁对稀缺资源进行更公平的代际再分配。

For example, Italy’s Five Star Movement, which governs in a coalition with the League, recently called for a “citizen’s income” that would be available to all unemployed people regardless of age. => 比如与意大利联盟党联合执政的五星运动党最近提出要对所有失业人士 — — 无论年龄 — — 发放“公民收入 ” 。
So, while right-wing populists have attracted older voters, left-wing populist have gained a following among younger generations. => 可见虽然右翼民粹主义者吸引了年长的选民，但左翼民粹主义者也在年轻一代中赢得了追随者。

By backing right-wing populists, older voters hope to return to a time when domestic affairs were insulated from global forces and national borders were less porous. => 通过支持右翼民粹主义者，年长选民希望回到那个内政不太受全球势力左右且国界不那么容易被穿越的时代。
At the heart of today’s nationalist politics is a promise to preserve the status quo – or even to restore a mythical past. => 当前民族主义政治的核心是承诺要保持现状 — — 甚至回到那个虚无缥缈的过去。
Hence, nationalist politicians often resort to nostalgic rhetoric to mobilize their older supporters. => 因此民族主义政治家经常诉诸一些怀旧言论来鼓动自己那些年长支持者。
For his part, Trump has pledged to bring back jobs in the American Rust Belt, once the center of US manufacturing. => 比如特朗普就承诺要将就业职位带回到曾经是美国生产中心的北部铁锈带地区。
Likewise, there could be no clearer symbol of resistance to change than his proposed wall on the US-Mexico border. => 同时也没有什么比他提出的美墨边境墙更具有明确的抵制变革象征意义了。

And his crackdown on illegal immigration and ban on travelers from predominantly Muslim countries signals his commitment to a “pure” American nation. => 而他对非法移民的打击以及针对主要穆斯林国家公民的入境禁令则标志着他对一个“纯粹”美国国家的承诺。

Similarly, in continental Europe, right-wing populists want to return to a time before the adoption of the euro and the Schengen system of passport-free travel within most of the EU. => 同样在欧洲大陆，右翼民粹主义者希望回归到欧元和大部分国家申根无护照旅行制度实施之前的年代。

And they often appeal directly to older voters by promising to lower the retirement age and expand pension benefits (both are flagship policies of the League). => 他们通常会用降低退休年龄和扩大养老金福利（这两者都是意大利联盟党的主要政策）的承诺来直击年长选民。
In the United Kingdom, the “Leave” campaign promised vindication for those who have been left behind in the age of globalization. => 在英国 ， “ 脱欧”运动承诺要为那些被全球化时代抛弃的人做主。
Never mind that it also touted the idea of a free and independent “Global Britain.” => 不过它也大肆吹嘘要建立一个自由和独立的“全球性英国 ” 。
The Brexiteers are not known for their consistency. => 脱欧者的善变也不是什么新鲜事了。
At any rate, to the extent that today’s populist wave is driven by demographics, it is not likely to crest anytime soon. => 无论如何，由于当前的民粹主义浪潮是由人口统计数据推动的，因此这一趋势不太可能会迅速到达顶点。
In graying societies, the political clout of the elderly will steadily grow; and in rapidly changing economies, their ability to adapt will decline. => 在日渐老龄化的社会中老年人的政治影响力将稳步增长，但在快速变化的经济中他们的适应能力又会下降。

As a result, older voters will demand more and more socioeconomic security, and irresponsible populists will be waiting in the wings to accommodate them. => 因此年龄较大的选民将寻求越来越多的社会经济安全感，而不负责任的民粹主义者正时刻准备着去安抚他们。
Can anything be done? => 那我们对此有何对策？

To stem the nationalist tide, mainstream parties urgently need to devise a new social compact that addresses the mounting sense of insecurity among older voters. => 为了遏制民族主义潮流，主流政党迫切需要设计一种新的社会契约以疏解老年选民日益增长的不安全感。

They will need to strike a better balance between openness and protection, innovation and regulation; and they will need to do so without falling into a regressive populist trap. => 它们需要在开放和保护、创新和监管之间取得更好的平衡；而且需要在避免陷入民粹主义倒退陷阱的情况下做到这一点。
The answer is not to suffocate global forces, but to render them more tolerable. => 答案不是要扼杀全球性力量，而是让它们变得更加可以接受。
Citizens of all ages need to be equipped to face current and future disruptions. => 所有年龄段的公民都需要具备应对当前和未来冲击的能力。

In this sense, it is better to empower the elderly than simply to protect them. Most advanced economies simply cannot afford massive new benefits for an oversized interest group. => 从这个意义上讲，与其只是保护老年人，不如去赋予他们权力，因为大多数发达经济体根本无法为这么一个超大型利益集团带来巨大的新利益。
And besides, a policy that makes people reliant on some form of external support is morally questionable, at best. => 此外一项让人们依赖某种形式外部支持的政策至少在道德上是有问题的。
Subsidies to the most vulnerable should remain a last resort. => 那些对最弱势群体的补贴应当是最后的手段。
In many ways, older voters’ infatuation with populists is a cry for help. => 在许多方面看来，年长选民对民粹主义者的迷恋其实是一种求救的呼声。
It is up to enlightened politicians to respond to it constructively. => 而开明的政治家应该对此建设性的回应。
A Global Agenda for Seven Billion => 70亿人的全球日程

NEW YORK – Late next month, a child will be born – the 7th billion citizen of planet Earth. We will never know the circumstances into which he or she was born. => 纽约 — — 下个月晚些时候出生的某个孩子将成为地球的第70亿位公民。 我们不会知道他会出生在什么环境中。

We do know that the baby will enter a world of vast and unpredictable change – environmental, economic, geopolitical, technological, and demographic. => 但我们知道，这个孩子进入的是一个面临着不可预料的大变局的世界，不管是环境、经济、地缘政治、技术，还是人口。
The world’s population has tripled since the United Nations was created in 1945. => 自联合国于1945年成立以来，世界人口已经翻了三倍，并且仍在增长，人口一起增长的是土地、能源、食品和水源压力。

In the next five years, we need to create a new economic vision for sustainable development and forge global consensus on a binding climate change agreement. => 在未来五年中，我们需要创造一个新的可持续发展愿景，在有约束力的气候变化协议问题上达成全球一致。
Prevention as a framework for international cooperation is a second opportunity. => 作为国际合作框架的预防是第二大机会。

This year, the UN peacekeeping budget will total $8 billion. Think of what we could save by avoiding conflicts – by deploying political mediation missions, for example, rather than troops. => 今年联合国维和预算总额为80亿美元。 想想看，我们能够通过避免冲突剩下多少钱 — — 比如用政治调解代替维和部队。
We know how to do this. => 我们知道怎样做这件事。
Our record proves it – in Guinea, Kenya, and Kyrgyzstan. => 我们在圭亚那、肯尼亚和吉尔吉斯斯坦的工作记录就是明证。

A third imperative is building a safer and more secure world. In this effort, we must be courageous in standing up for democracy, human rights, and peace. => 第三大使命是打造一个更安全、更稳定的世界。 在这个问题上，我们必须提起勇气捍卫民主、人权和和平。

This year was one of signature achievements in restoring and securing peace – in Côte d’Ivoire, Darfur, Egypt, and elsewhere. But hatred and bloodshed still stand in the way of our vision for peace. => 今年是在重塑并确保和平取得标志性成就的一年 — — 在科特迪瓦、达尔富尔、埃及以及其他地区。 但仇恨和杀戮仍然是我们的和平愿景之路上显而易见的障碍。
In the Middle East, we must break the stalemate. => 在中东，我们必须打破僵局。
Palestinians deserve a state. => 巴勒斯坦人理应拥有自己的国家。
Israel needs security. => 以色列需要安全感。
Both want peace. A negotiated settlement can produce these outcomes, and the UN is a platform for forging such a peace. => 双方都盼望和平。 谈判解决方案可以创造这些结果，而联合国就是打造和平的平台。
The fourth big opportunity is supporting countries in transition. => 第四大机会是支持转型国家。
This year’s dramatic events in North Africa and the Middle East inspired people around the globe. => 今年在北非和中东所发生的重大事件鼓舞着全球人民。
Let us help make the Arab Spring a true season of hope for all. => 让我们携手让阿拉伯之春成为人类希望的源泉。
Syria is a special concern. => 叙利亚是个特别的问题。
For six months we have seen escalating violence and repression. => 这半年以来，我们看到那里的暴力和镇压在不断升级。
The government has repeatedly pledged to undertake reforms and listen to its people. It has not done so. => 叙利亚政府一再承诺实施改革、听取人民的意见，但始终不见实践。
The moment to act is now. => 是时候采取措施了。
The violence must stop. => 暴力必须停止。
Last but not least is the imperative of working with and for women and young people. => 最后一项使命是与女性和年轻人携手共进。
Women hold up more than half the sky and represent much of the world’s unrealized potential. => 女性顶起的不止半边天，她们代表着大部分人类为意识到的潜能。
We need their full engagement – in government, business, and civil society. => 我们需要完全接纳女性 — — 不管是政府、商业还是公民社会。
Seven billion people now look toward the United Nations for solutions to the world’s great global challenges. => 如今，70亿人看着联合国，希望它拿出解决方案应对世界重大挑战。
They hold different religions and backgrounds but common dreams and aspirations. => 他们的信仰和背景各不相同，但梦想和愿望是一样的。
Our global future depends on bringing these individual talents and universal rights together in common cause. => 地球的未来取决于将个人天赋和普世权利集中于共同事业下。
Let our common agenda begin. => 让我们启动共同日程吧。
A Global Consensus Against Terrorism => 全球反恐舆论
But there is much more going on at the UN than investigations. => 但是除了调查之外，联合国内还在经历更多事情。

Reform is in the air – in part because of the scandal, but also because of the UN’s inability to deal effectively with challenges ranging from Rwanda and Kosovo to Iraq and, most recently, Sudan. => 改革气氛弥漫 — — 一部分由于丑闻，同时也因为联合国在处理从卢旺达、科索沃到伊拉克以及最近苏丹问题上表现出来的无能和无效性。

Even the UN’s most ardent supporters now recognize that change is called for if the organization is to make a significant contribution to international peace and security. => 即使是联合国最忠实的支持者，现在也开始意识到，如果联合国要对国际和平与安全做出重要贡献的话，就必须有所改变。
Some of the reform talk concerns the UN Security Council’s composition. => 一些有关改革的讨论涉及到联合国安理会的构成。
The Security Council represents what the World War II Allies believed the post-war world would look like and how it should be run. => 安理会代表了二战同盟军所认同的战后世界格局以及如何管理这个世界。

This helps to explain why a much-weakened France was made a permanent member of the Council – and why Germany and Japan (and a not-yet independent India) were not. => 这有助于解释为何一个力量已经大为削弱的法国能够成为安理会的常任理事国 — — 而德国和日本（以及还未独立的印度）却不能。
Defending the Security Council’s current make-up is impossible; the need for change is beyond debate. => 维持安理会目前的构成状态是不可能的，改变的需求无可争议。
But coming up with an approach that gains broad international support will prove extremely difficult. => 但是要通过一种获得广泛国际支持的途径来达成此目标极度困难。

Great Britain and France will resist being replaced by a single EU seat, while making Germany a permanent member would only exacerbate the problem of Europe’s relative over-representation. => 大英国和法国将会抵制他们两国被一个欧盟席位所取代，并且将德国推上常任理事国成员议席只会加剧欧洲相对的超额代表。
Clearly, fixing the Security Council will require considerable time and political effort. => 显然，确定安理会需要大量的时间和政治努力。
This will prove more difficult than it first sounds. => 这做起来可比第一次听到的时候难多了。
Historians have the luxury of debating whether terrorism may have been justified in certain situations in the past. => 历史学家对恐怖主义可能在过去某些情形下被合理评价进行过大量辩论。
We do not. => 我们不用这么做。
Modern terrorism is too destructive to be tolerated, much less supported. => 现代恐怖主义太具破坏性以至于我们已经不能容忍，不能再对它有任何支持了。
Weapons of mass destruction – nuclear, biological, and chemical weapons – are just that, and no cause can excuse their use. => 正是这些大规模杀伤性武器 — — 核武器、生物武器以及化学武器，没有任何原因可以成为使用这些武器的借口。
Terrorism is even less justified given that political avenues exist nowadays for pursuing political aims. => 考虑到现存的为达成政治目的而使用的政治途径，恐怖主义更欠正当。
Palestinians can negotiate their future relationship with Israel and can count on American, Russian, European, and UN assistance. => 巴勒斯坦能与以色列就他们未来的关系进行谈判，并能依赖于美国、俄罗斯、欧洲和联合国的援助。
Iraqis have elected their own representatives and are poised to write their constitution. => 伊拉克人已经选举出了他们自己的代表，正准备起草他们的宪法。
No one pursuing reasonable goals and who is prepared to compromise can argue that terrorism is his or his group’s only option. => 没有任何一个寻求合理目标或准备和解的人可以辩称恐怖主义是他的或他们党派的唯一选择方案。
The world has already taken some important steps against terrorism. => 全世界已经采取了一些重要的措施来反对恐怖主义。

A dozen international conventions and numerous UN resolutions commit governments to oppose hostage taking, the hijacking of civilian aircraft, and terrorism more broadly. => 12个反恐怖主义公约和诸多联��国决议要求各国政府更广泛地抵制绑架人质、劫持民用航班以及恐怖主义。

Similarly, the mandate of the Financial Action Task Force, created in 1989 to curb money laundering, has grown and become focused mainly on curbing terrorist financing. => 同样，为打击清洗黑钱而成立于1989年的“国际金融特别行动组 ” （ Financial Action Task Force）已经羽翼丰满，并把重点主要放在了打击恐怖主义融资上面。

What is missing is a new, 13th convention that closes the loophole that seems to permit governments to decide what constitutes terrorism and what does not. => 允许政府来决定什么是恐怖主义的构成是一个漏洞，现在缺少的是一个新的第13个公约来弥补这一漏洞。

Broad agreement is needed that any intentional killing of civilians and noncombatants is unacceptable, and that its perpetrators and supporters must be punished. => 我们需要在广范围内达成一致，任何故意杀害平民及非战斗人员的行径都是不可接受的，任何罪犯或帮凶必须接受严惩。
Of course, such a convention will not prevent all future acts of terrorism. => 当然，这样一个公约并不能防范将来所有的恐怖主义行动。
But ideas matter. => 但是这个观念很重要。
Terrorism needs to be de-legitimized in the way that slavery has been. => 恐怖主义应当像奴隶制一样被定为非法化。
We are taught early on in our lives that the end cannot justify the means. => 我们自小就被教育，即使目标正确，也不能不择手段。
It is time to put this principle into effect before many more innocent lives are lost. => 在更多的无辜生命丧失之前，是时候将这条准则付诸实施了。
A Global Green New Deal => 全球绿色新政
But this would be a devastating mistake of immediate, as well as inter-generational, proportions. => 但是这将会是一个错误，其影响马上就会形成，而且会持续几代人。

In the past, concern for the environment was viewed as a luxury; today, it is a necessity – a point grasped by some, but by no means all, economic architects yet. => 如今，这是一项必需品。 有些人认识到了这一点，但是，并不是所有的经济规划者也都有这样的意识。
The Republic of Korea, which is losing jobs for the first time in more than five years, has also spotted the green lining to grim economic times. => 韩国在五年来第一次出现了失业上升的情况，但是也在严峻的经济时期中发现了绿色内容。

President Lee Myung-Bak’s government plans to invest $38 billion employing people to clean up four major rivers and reduce disaster risks by building embankments and water-treatment facilities. => 李明博总统计划投资三千八百亿美元，雇佣人工清理四条主要的河流并且通过建设防护以及水处理设施来减少灾害风险。
The package also counts on investments in hybrid vehicle technologies. => 这一计划还大力投资于混合燃料汽车技术。
Similar pro-employment “Green New Deal” packages have been lined up in China, Japan, and the United Kingdom. => 中国、日本以及英国也有类似促进就业的“绿色新政”计划。

They are equally relevant to developing economies in terms of jobs, fighting poverty, and creating new opportunities at a time of increasingly uncertain commodity prices and exports. => 这些计划对于发展中国家在就业、减少贫困并且在原材料价格和出口形势越发不确定的时候创造新的机遇同样重要。

In South Africa, the government-backed Working for Water initiative – which employs more than 30,000 people, including women, youth, and the disabled – also sees opportunity in crisis. => 南非政府支持的治水计划雇佣三万人以上，包括妇女、年轻人以及残疾人。 这一计划也在危机中看到了机遇。

The country spends roughly $60 million annually fighting invasive alien plants that threaten native wildlife, water supplies, important tourism destinations, and farmland. => 南非每年大约花费六千万美元清除威胁本国野生动物、水供应、重要旅游景点以及农地的外国侵入植物。
This work is set to expand as more than 40 million tons of invasive alien plants are harvested for power-station fuel. => 随着四千多万吨侵入植物被割除用于发电燃料，这一计划将会扩大。

As a result, an estimated 500 megawatts of electricity, equal to 2% of the country’s electricity needs, will be generated, along with more than 5,000 jobs. => 结果，将会产生大约五百千瓦的电力，相当于国家用电需求的百分之二，同时还会创造出五千个工作岗位。

So it is clear that some countries now view environmental investments in infrastructure, energy systems, and ecosystems as among the best bets for recovery. => 因此，某些国家现在把在基础设施、能源系统以及生态系统上的环境投资视为经济复苏的最佳手段。

Others may be unsure about the potential returns from investing in ecosystem services such as forest carbon storage or in renewable energy for the 80% of Africans who have no access to electricity. => 还有一些国家或许并不十分清楚投资于生态系统服务的潜在回报。
Still others may simply be unaware of how to precisely follow suit. => 这些包括森林二氧化碳储存或者为没有电的百分之八十的非洲人提供可再生能源。

In early February, the United Nations Environment Program will convene some of the world’s leading economists at the UN’s headquarters in New York. => 二月上旬，联合国环境规划署将在纽约联合国总部召集某些世界主要经济体国家开会。 会议上将会推出全球绿色新政计划。
The Global Green New Deal, which UNEP launched as a concept in October 2008, responds to the current economic malaise. => 联合国环境规划署在2008年十月推出了全球绿色新政这一概念，目的是应对当前的经济危机。

Blindly pumping the current bail-out billions into old industries and exhausted economic models will be throwing good money after bad while mortgaging our children’s future. => 把目前的救市资金盲目地投入到旧产业以及穷途末路的经济模式中就是浪费钱财并且把子孙后代的未来用作抵押。

Instead, political leaders must use these windfalls to invest in innovation, promote sustainable businesses, and encourage new patterns of decent, long-lasting employment. => 相反，政治领导人必需利用这些难得的机遇来投资于创新、促进可持续企业并且鼓励新的、体面而又长久的��业模式。
A Global Growth Bargain => 全球增长协议
LONDON – US President Barack Obama caught the imagination of the world when he talked recently of a new “Sputnik moment.” => 发自伦敦 — — 美国总统奥巴马最近用一场关于新“卫星时刻”的演说勾起了全世界的想象。
Yet Asia’s growth also gives the West unprecedented economic hope. => 但亚洲地区的增长也为西方都带来了前所未有的经济曙光。

In this decade, the world will be transformed yet again by the rise of the Asian consumer. By 2020, Asia’s domestic markets will be twice the size of America’s. => 在未来十年内，世界将在亚洲消费者群体的崛起中再一次发生转变。 预计到2020年，亚洲各国的国内市场规模将达到美国的两倍。
The world’s middle class will have swelled from one billion consumers to three billion. => 世界中产阶级的数量也将由10亿增长到30亿。
The opportunities for growth in Europe and the US from this additional global demand are enormous. => 这一新增需求也为欧美地区的增长创造了可观的机遇。
But neither Europe nor the US is in a strong enough position to take best advantage of these new markets. => 但欧美两地似乎都尚未准备好以最佳状态投入这些新市场。

Obama’s investment plan could be the foundation stone for a formal global agreement that delivers higher levels of growth to all corners of the world and creates millions of new jobs. => 奥巴马的投资计划将可能成为一份正式全球协议的奠基石，而该协议不但会为全球各地带来更高程度的增长，还将创造数百万个新就业职位。
I believe that such an agreement could boost the world economy by around 3% by 2014 – and lift 100 million people out of poverty. => 我个人认为这样一项协议将在2014年提升世界经济增长约3 % — —并使1亿人摆脱贫困。
I presented this plan when I chaired the G-20 in London in 2009. => 我在2009年主持伦敦G20峰会时就提出了这一计划。

I wanted East and West to commit to a formal strategy to deliver more enduring results than those promised by the rescue packages that we were putting together at the time. => 我希望东西双方能致力于提出一个能产生更多长期效果的正式战略，而不仅仅是那些在危机时共同承诺的拯救计划。
Our attention was focused on preventing recession from turning into depression. => 我们的注意力集中在防止衰退转变成萧条。
I argued that this was also the moment to pioneer a more lasting framework of growth. => 我认为这同时也是一个创设更长久发展框架的好时机。

In the end, no agreement was possible on a shared growth objective, and there has not yet been enough political will for the coordinated action to achieve it. => 但在会议结束之前，各方并未达成一个共同发展目标的共识，也缺乏足够的政治决心去合作实现之。
The global growth agreement that evaded us in 2009 remains the unfinished work of the G-20. => 而2009年未能达成的全球发展计划至今尚未完成。
Front-loaded public investment could be funded through an enhanced European Investment Bank. => 前期的公共投资可以通过一个增强的欧洲投资银行来进行。
If other Asian countries do likewise, and agree to create a level playing field for exporters, we could create around 50 million additional jobs. => 如果其他亚洲国家能够效仿并同意为出口商创造一个平等的平台，我们就能额外创造大约5000万个职位。
Of course, in the West, an investment plan invites criticism from those who prefer that we do nothing but talk about growth strategies. => 当然，在西方，这样的投资计划都会招来那些只爱空谈发展计划却不愿动手者的批评。

Indeed, critics argue that raising public investment conflicts with the drive to reduce deficits, and warn of higher interest rates on the back of further spending. => 事实上，批评认为增加公共投资与减少赤字的目标相冲突，并担忧政府进一步增加开支的行为会导致利率升高。
But critics are wrong about the impact on the deficit of focused investment. => 但这些批评错误估计了集中投资对赤字所产生的影响。

My extrapolation of the IMF model shows that Western countries can boost their long-term GDP growth significantly by increasing their levels of capital investment over a three-year period. => 依据世界货币基金组织的经济模型，我推断西方国家可以通过在3年内提高投资水平来推动长期的GDP增长。

An annual stimulus equivalent to just 0.3% of GDP yields a return in the US of 0.8% in economic growth at its peak in 2013, and 0.4% in Europe. => 一个仅等同于GDP0.3%的年度刺激计划可以为美国的GDP带来0.8%的贡献，并在2013年达到顶峰，而同样的计划则能让欧洲的GDP取得0.4%的增长
It also underscores the importance of the G-20 and the IMF in seeking global consensus now. => 同时也有助于凸显出G20和世界货币基金组织在达成全球共识方面的重要性 。
The West is well placed to play its part in global renewal. => 西方在全球经济重建方面其实早已准备就位。
Its extraordinary workforces produce world-class goods and services. => 它的优秀劳动力能提供世界级的商品和服务。
But the West’s workforce must not be condemned to policies that willfully produce a decade of slow growth and low employment. => 但这些劳动力不应被那些蓄意导致长达10年的低速增长和高失业率的政策所拖累。
That would be a human tragedy, not just an economic disaster. => 如果那样的话，这不但是一场经济灾难，更是一场人类悲剧。
A Global Perfect Storm => 全球完美风暴

NEW YORK – Dark, lowering financial and economic clouds are, it seems, rolling in from every direction: the eurozone, the United States, China, and elsewhere. => 纽约—不管往哪个方向看，金融和经济都是阴云密布：欧元区、美国、中国概莫能外。
Indeed, the global economy in 2013 could be a very difficult environment in which to find shelter. => 事实上，到2013年，全球经济可能出现极其困难的情况，没人能独善其身。

Moreover, fiscal and sovereign-debt strains are becoming worse as interest-rate spreads for Spain and Italy have returned to their unsustainable peak levels. => 此外，随着西班牙和意大利利差回到再次达到不可持续的峰值水平，财政和主权债务紧张正在恶化。
Farther to the west, US economic performance is weakening, with first-quarter growth a miserly 1.9% – well below potential. => 在更远的西方，美国经济表现也在萎靡，一季度增长率只有区区1.9 % ， 远低于潜在增长率。
And job creation faltered in April and May, so the US may reach stall speed by year end. => 此外，4月和5月就业增长不振，因此美国可能会在年底陷入停滞。

Moreover, political gridlock over fiscal adjustment is likely to persist, regardless of whether Barack Obama or Mitt Romney wins November’s presidential election. => 此外，不管是奥巴马还是罗姆尼赢得11月总统大选，关于财政调整的政治僵局都可能会持续下去。

In the east, China, its growth model unsustainable, could be underwater by 2013, as its investment bust continues and reforms intended to boost consumption are too little too late. => 在东方，中国的增长模式是不可持续的，如果投资不振情况期许而提振消费的改革来的太晚、力度太轻，则可能将于2013年陷入衰退。

At the same time, the lack of structural reforms in emerging markets, together with their move towards greater state capitalism, is hampering growth and will reduce their resiliency. => 与此同时，新兴市场结构性改革的缺位以及向国家资本主义的演进正在妨碍它们的增长、削弱它们的韧性。

Finally, long-simmering tensions in the Middle East between Israel and the US on one side and Iran on the other on the issue of nuclear proliferation could reach a boil by 2013. => 最后，在中东，以色列和美国与伊朗关于核浓缩问题的紧张对峙可能在2013年爆发。
The current negotiations are likely to fail, and even tightened sanctions may not stop Iran from trying to build nuclear weapons. => 当前的谈判可能会失败，即使收紧制裁可能也阻止不了伊朗制造核武器。

With the US and Israel unwilling to accept containment of a nuclear Iran by deterrence, a military confrontation in 2013 would lead to a massive oil price spike and global recession. => 由于美国和以色列不愿意用威慑的方式牵制有核的伊朗，因此2013年可能爆发军事冲突，这将导致油价的暴涨和全球衰退。

These risks are already exacerbating the economic slowdown: equity markets are falling everywhere, leading to negative wealth effects on consumption and capital spending. => 这些风险已然对经济减速起到了推波助澜的作用：各国股市都在下跌，导致了消费和资本支出的负财富效应。

Borrowing costs are rising for highly indebted sovereigns, credit rationing is undermining small and medium-size companies, and falling commodity prices are reducing exporting countries’ income. => 重债国的借贷成本在声声，信贷配额正在挤压中小企业，而商品价格的下跌正在拖累出口国的收入。
Increasing risk aversion is leading economic agents to adopt a wait-and-see stance that makes the slowdown partly self-fulfilling. => 风险厌恶度的上升正在导致经济行为人采取静观其变的立场，而这给经济减速带来了某些自我实现的效果。

Compared to 2008-2009, when policymakers had ample space to act, monetary and fiscal authorities are running out of policy bullets (or, more cynically, policy rabbits to pull out of their hats). => 与2008—2009年相比 — — 当时决策者拥有充足的行动空间 — — 货币和财政当局的手段快要用尽了（或者，更讽刺地说，快要黔驴技穷了 ） 。
Monetary policy is constrained by the proximity to zero interest rates and repeated rounds of quantitative easing. => 货币政策已经撞上了零利率和一轮又一轮量化宽松的南墙。
Indeed, economies and markets no longer face liquidity problems, but rather credit and insolvency crises. => 事实上，经济和市场所面临的问题早已不再是流动���，而是信用和偿债能力危机。
Meanwhile, unsustainable budget deficits and public debt in most advanced economies have severely limited the scope for further fiscal stimulus. => 与此同时，大部分发达国家的不可持续的预算赤字和公共债务水平严重掣肘了进一步财政刺激的空间。
After all, a weaker currency and better trade balance in some countries necessarily implies a stronger currency and a weaker trade balance in others. => 毕竟，一国货币贬值和贸易平衡的改善必然意味着其他国家货币升值和贸易平衡的恶化。
As a result, sovereign risk is now becoming banking risk. => 结果，主权风险正在演变为银行风险。
Indeed, sovereigns are dumping a larger fraction of their public debt onto banks’ balance sheet, especially in the eurozone. => 事实上，不少国家（特别是欧元区）正在把越来越多的公共债务转移到银行的资产负债表上。
