Unfortunately, Germany resists all of these key policy measures, as it is fixated on the credit risk to which its taxpayers would be exposed with greater economic, fiscal, and banking integration. => 不幸的是，德国阻挠着所有这些关键性政策措施，因为进一步的经济、财政和银行一体化会让其纳税人暴露于信用风险中。
As a result, the probability of a eurozone disaster is rising. => 结果，欧元区灾难的发生可能性变大了。
And, while the cloud over the eurozone may be the largest to burst, it is not the only one threatening the global economy. => 尽管欧元区顶上的阴云最为可怖，但这并不是唯一威胁全球经济的因素。
Batten down the hatches. => 我们还是未雨绸缪为妙。
A Global Solutions Network => 全球解决方案网
NEW YORK – Great social change occurs in several ways. => 纽约—社会发生深刻变迁的方式不一而足。
A technological breakthrough – the steam engine, computers, the Internet – may play a leading role. => 技术突破 — — 蒸汽机、计算机和互联网 — — 可能起到了领导作用。
Visionaries, such as Mahatma Gandhi, Martin Luther King Jr., and Nelson Mandela, may inspire a demand for justice. => 理想家 — — 比如圣雄甘地、马丁·路德·金和纳尔逊·曼德拉 — — 则受着公正要求的鼓舞。
Political leaders may lead a broad reform movement, as with Franklin Roosevelt and the New Deal. => 政治领导人也可能引领广泛的改革运动，比如富兰克林·罗斯福和他的新政。
Our own generation urgently needs to spur another era of great social change. => 我们这一代人迫切地需要发生又一次伟大社会变革时代。
This time, we must act to save the planet from a human-induced environmental catastrophe. => 这一回，我们必须从人类导致的环境灾难中拯救地球。
Each of us senses this challenge almost daily. => 可以说，我们每一个人每一天都在感受这一挑战。

Heat waves, droughts, floods, forest fires, retreating glaciers, polluted rivers, and extreme storms buffet the planet at a dramatically rising rate, owing to human activities. => 热浪、干旱、洪水、森林大火、冰川消融、河流污染、极端暴风肆虐地球的频率越来越高，而这一切都是人类活动导致的。
Our $70-trillion-per-year global economy is putting unprecedented pressures on the natural environment. => 全球经济每年产生70万亿美元的产值，同时也对自然环境产生着前所未见的压力。

We will need new technologies, behaviors, and ethics, supported by solid evidence, to reconcile further economic development with environmental sustainability. => 我们需要有扎实证据支撑的新技术、新行为和新伦理来协调未来经济发展和环境可持续性。

United Nations Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon is taking on this unprecedented challenge from his unique position at the crossroads of global politics and society. => 联合国秘书长潘基文正在承担这一前所未有的挑战 — — 他身居一个独一无二的位置，战在全球政治和社会的十字路口上。
In the past two decades, governments have come up short on solutions to environmental threats. => 在过去二十年中，政府一直没能拿出应对环境挑战的方案。
Politicians have failed to implement properly the treaties adopted at the 1992 Earth Summit. => 政客没能很好地实施1992年地球峰会通过的跳跃。
To empower global society to act, Ban has launched a bold new global initiative, for which I am grateful to volunteer. => 为了增加全球社会行动的能量，潘基文抛出了一项雄心勃勃的新全球计划，我很高兴地自愿为之奔走。
The UN Sustainable Development Solutions Network is a powerful effort to mobilize global knowledge to save the planet. => 联合国可持续发展解决方案网（Sustainable Development Solutions Network）是潘基文的力作，意在动员全球知识拯救地球。

The idea is to use global networks of knowledge and action to identify and demonstrate new, cutting-edge approaches to sustainable development around the world. => 该计划的想法是利用全球知识和行动网识别和展示全世界的高精尖方法可持续发展新方法。
The network will work alongside and support governments, UN agencies, civil-society organizations, and the private sector. => 该网将配合并支持政府、联合国机构、公民社会团体和私人部门。

Humanity needs to learn new ways to produce and use low-carbon energy, grow food sustainably, build livable cities, and manage the global commons of oceans, biodiversity, and the atmosphere. => 人类需要学习新方法制造和使用低碳能源、可持续地种植粮食、建设宜居城市、治理全球共有的海洋、生物多样性和大气。
But time is running very short. => 但时间紧迫。

Today’s mega-cities, for example, already have to confront dangerous heat waves, rising sea levels, more extreme storms, dire congestion, and air and water pollution. => 比如，如今的大都市已面临着危险的热浪、海平面上升、极端风暴数量增加、可怕的拥挤以及空气和水污染等问题。
Agricultural regions already need to become more resilient in the face of increased climate volatility. => 农业区也需要更强的应对气候波动增加的能力。
Universities have a special role to play in the new UN knowledge network. => 大学在这一新的联合国知识网中起着特殊的作用。

Exactly 150 years ago, in 1862, Abraham Lincoln created America’s “land-grant” universities to help local communities to improve farming and the quality of life through science. => 150年前的1862年，亚伯拉罕·林肯创造了“政府授地 ” （ land-grant）大学，以帮助当地社区通过科学改善农业和生活质量。

Today, we need universities in all parts of the world to help their societies face the challenges of poverty reduction, clean energy, sustainable food supplies, and the rest. => 如今，我们需要全世界的大学帮助所在社会应对减贫、清洁能源、可持续食品供给等挑战。

By linking together, and putting their curricula online, the world’s universities can become even more effective in discovering and promoting science-based solutions to complex problems. => 通过互相连接以及将课程挂上网络，全世界大学可以在发现和促进基于科学的复杂问题解决之道方面变得更加高效。
The world’s corporate sector also has a significant role to play in sustainable development. => 全球公司部门在可持续发展方面也起着重要作用。
Now the corporate sector has two faces. => 如今，公司部门有着两副面孔。

It is the repository of cutting-edge sustainable technologies, pioneering research and development, world-class management, and leadership in environmental sustainability. => 它是高精尖可持续技术储备库、研发活动先锋、世界级管理的先行者、环境可持续性的领导者。

Yet at the same time, the corporate sector lobbies aggressively to gut environmental regulations, slash corporate-tax rates, and avoid their own responsibility for ecological destruction. => 但与此同时，公司部门也在大力游说放松环境监管、降低公司税率、逃避它们应付的生态毁灭责任。
Sometimes the same company operates on both sides of the divide. => 有时候，同一家公司同时扮演着两方面的角色。
We urgently need far-sighted companies to join the Sustainable Development Solutions Network. => 我们迫切需要具有远见卓识的公司加入到可持续发展解决方案网中来。

These companies are uniquely placed to move new ideas and technologies into early-stage demonstration projects, thereby accelerating global learning cycles. => 这些公司在将新思想和新技术转化为早期示范工程方面能起到独一无二的作用，从而加快全球学习周期。
Sustainable development is a generational challenge, not a short-term task. => 可持续发展是几代人都将面临的挑战，不是一朝一夕可以解决的问题。
The reinvention of energy, food, transport, and other systems will take decades, not years. => 能源、食品、运输和其他系统的更新换代需要几十年，而不是几年。
But the long-term nature of this challenge must not lull us into inaction. => 但该挑战的长期性质并不是我们不作为的理由。

We must start reinventing our productive systems now, precisely because the path of change will be so long and the environmental dangers are already so pressing. => 正是因为变革需要极长时间，而环境风险已经迫在眉睫，我们才必须从现在就开始重塑我们的生产系统。
In the post-2015 era, the fight against poverty and the fight to protect the environment will go hand in hand, reinforcing each other. => 2015年以后，全世界将携手共同抵抗贫困和保护环境。

Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon has already initiated several global processes to help establish the new post-2015 goals in an open, participatory, and knowledge-based way. => 秘书长潘基文已经启动了数项全球计划以帮助全世界以开放性、参与式、以知识为基础的方式设定面向2015年后的新目标。
The Secretary General’s launch of the Sustainable Development Solutions Network is therefore especially timely. => 因此，秘书长启动可持续发展解决方案网的举动可谓正逢其时。

Not only will the world adopt a new set of goals to achieve sustainable development, but it will also have a new global network of expertise to help achieve those vital objectives. => 全世界不但将接受新的可持续发展目标，还将拥有新的全球专家网络来实现这些关键目标。
A Good Rate Hike for Europe => 欧洲升息的灵丹妙药

But it is precisely the lack of economic reform at home that has made Italy one of the least competitive states in the euro-zone economy. => 然而，正是国内经济改革的匮乏使得意大利沦为了欧元区内最缺乏竞争力的国家。

Soaring energy prices, for example, have become a leading inflation risk. => 节节攀升的能源价格，举例来讲，成了导致通货膨胀的首要危险因素。
But higher energy prices, by themselves, will not cause the ECB to pull the interest-rate trigger. => 但仅仅是能源价格上涨本身还不足以使欧洲央行调整利率。
The key will be so-called “second-round effects” – whether growing crude prices lead to higher wage demands from trade unions. => 关键问题是所谓的“次轮效应”¾那就是原油价格上涨会不会导致工会提出增加报酬的要求。

Should this change, the ECB will have to raise rates even if Europe’s economic growth remains slack. => 但如果情况有变，那么即便经济增长依然迟缓，欧洲央行也不得不采取升息的措施。
The good news is that economic growth in the euro-zone economy appears to be picking up (even in Italy). => 好消息是：欧元区国家的经济增长似乎正趋于好转（意大利也不例外 ） 。
How will the ECB react to better economic news? => 欧洲央行对经济的恢复又将做何反应？
Some on the Governing Council have grown uncomfortable that euro-zone interest rates have stayed so low, at 2%, for so long (more than two years). => 监管理事会的某些成员已经对两年多来欧元区利率维持在2%的低水准颇有微辞。
True, there is no inflation problem in the short run, but the ECB’s monetary policy focuses on the medium term. => 没错，短期内不会出现通货膨胀，但欧洲央行的货币政策更加关注中期的目标。

This would be bad news for the German economy, which could delay possible ECB interest rate hikes. => 这对德国经济是个坏消息，因为它可能延迟欧洲央行利率的迅速飙升。

Jewish fundamentalists obstruct any peace process that is left in the Middle East and build more illegal settlements. => 犹太原教旨主义者极力阻挠中东仅存的和平进程，继续建设非法定居点。

That is the most important message for everyone, atheists included, to take from the Christian story of Christmas. => 所有人，包括无神论者，都应该从基督的圣诞故事中领会这种最重要的精神涵义。
A Gravity Test for the Euro => 欧元重力测试

CAMBRIDGE – Although I appreciate that exchange rates are never easy to explain or understand, I find today’s relatively robust value for the euro somewhat mysterious. => 坎布里奇 — — 尽管我赞同汇率问题很难解释或理解清楚，但仍然对眼下欧元相对稳健的价值感到有些不解。

Do the gnomes of currency markets seriously believe that the eurozone governments’ latest “comprehensive package” to save the euro will hold up for more than a few months? => 难道货币市场真的相信，欧元区各国政府最新的欧元拯救“完整方案”能维持几个月？
The new plan relies on a questionable mix of dubious financial-engineering gimmicks and vague promises of modest Asian funding. => 新计划颇不靠谱，它依赖于可疑金融工程伎俩和从亚洲适量融资的含糊承诺。

So how is it that the euro is trading at a 40% premium to the US dollar, even as investors continue to view southern European government debt with great skepticism? => 那么，既然投资者仍对南欧政府债务充满疑虑，为何欧元对美元仍有40%的溢价？
I can think of one very good reason why the euro needs to fall, and six not-so-convincing reasons why it should remain stable or appreciate. => 在我看来，欧元必须下跌这一观点有一个非常充分的理由，而欧元应该维持稳定甚至升值有六个不那么令人信服的理由。
Let’s begin with why the euro needs to fall. => 让我们从欧元为何必须下跌开始。

Absent a clear path to a much tighter fiscal and political union, which can lead only through constitutional change, the current halfway house of the euro system appears increasingly untenable. => 在缺乏形成更紧密的财政和政治联盟的明确道路的背景下 — — 这一点只有通过修宪才能实现 — — 当前的欧元体系只是半吊子工程，且正在变得越来越难以为继。
It seems clear that the European Central Bank will be forced to buy far greater quantities of eurozone sovereign (junk) bonds. => 显然，欧洲央行将被迫购买数量甚巨的欧元区主权（垃圾）债券。

That may work in the short term, but if sovereign default risks materialize – as my research with Carmen Reinhart suggests is likely – the ECB will in turn have to be recapitalized. => 这样做在短期可能有效，但如果主权违约风险成为现实 — — 根据我和卡门·莱因哈特（Carmen Reinhart）的研究，这很有可能 — — 那么欧洲央行自身也将需要资本重组。

And, if the stronger northern eurozone countries are unwilling to digest this transfer – and political resistance runs high – the ECB may be forced to recapitalize itself through money creation. => 此外，如果较稳健的北欧国家不愿意承担转移成本 — — 政治阻力相当大 — — 欧洲央行可能被迫用印钞来实现自身的资本重组。
Either way, the threat of a profound financial crisis is high. => 无论如何，爆发深度金融危机的风险很高。
Given this, what arguments support the current value of the euro, or its further rise? => 既然如此，支持欧元维持当前水平甚至有所升值的观点有哪些呢？

First, investors might be telling themselves that in the worst-case scenario, the northern European countries will effectively push out the weaker countries, creating a super-euro. => 首先，投资者可能会告诉自己，在最坏情形下，北欧国家将抛弃疲软国家，创造新的超级欧元。

But, while this scenario has a certain ring of truth, surely any breakup would be highly traumatic, with the euro diving before its rump form recovered. => 但是，尽管这一情景不能说完全没有可能，但欧元区的分崩离析将是高度灾难性的，欧元得先跌到底才能复苏。

Although it may be difficult to connect the dots, it is perfectly possible that a huge euro crisis could have a snowball effect in the US and elsewhere. => 尽管很难将当初的美元和现在欧元联系在一起，但巨型欧元危机仍大有可能在美国和其他地区造成连锁反应。

Perhaps the transmission mechanism would be through US banks, many of which remain vulnerable, owing to thin capitalization and huge portfolios of mortgages booked far above their market value. => 或许传递机制会是美国银行 — — 许多美国银行仍然十分脆弱，因为它们的资本充足率很低，手中的按揭组合簿记价值也远高于市场价值。
Third, foreign central banks and sovereign wealth funds may be keen to keep buying up euros to hedge against risks to the US and their own economies. => 第三，外国央行和主权财富基金可能乐于继续购买欧元，以对冲美元和自身经济的风险。
Government investors are not necessarily driven by the return-maximizing calculus that motivates private investors. => 政府投资者与私人投资者不同，并不一定按最大回报的标准投资。
Fourth, investors may believe that, ultimately, US risks are just as large as Europe’s. => 第四，投资者可能会认为，说到底，美国的风险一点都不比欧洲小。
True, the US political system seems stymied in coming up with a plan to stabilize medium-term budget deficits. => 确实如此，美国政治体系在达成稳定中期预算赤字计划方面受到了阻碍。

Moreover, investors might be worried that the US Federal Reserve will weigh in with a third round of “quantitative easing,” which would further drive down the dollar. => 此外，投资者还可能担心美联储会考虑实行第三轮“量化宽松 ” ， 这将进一步压低美元。
For the eurozone’s southern periphery, however, today’s euro rate is very difficult to manage. => 但是，对欧元区南部外围国家来说，现在的欧元汇率是难以为继的。
But, because the overall value of the euro has to be a balance of the eurozone’s north and south, one can argue that 1.4 is within a reasonable range. => 但是，由于欧元的整体价值必须平衡南欧和北欧，因此，可以说1.4处于一个合理的区间内。
Finally, investors might just believe that the eurozone leaders’ latest plan will work, even though the last dozen plans have failed. => 最后，投资者可能认为，尽管此前的诸多计划都以失败告终，但欧元区领导人的最新计划终将见效。

Abraham Lincoln is credited with saying “You can fool some of the people all of the time, and all of the people some of the time, but you cannot fool all of the people all of the time.” => 林肯有句名言 ： “ 你可以一直欺骗一些人，可也以一度欺骗所有人，但你不可能一直欺骗所有人。
A comprehensive euro fix will surely arrive for some of the countries at some time, but not for all of the countries anytime soon. => ”完整的欧元修复计划会在某个时候在某些国家出现，这是肯定的，但不可能一下子在所有国家出现。

So, yes, there are plenty of vaguely plausible reasons why the euro, despite its drawn-out crisis, has remained so firm against the dollar so far. => 因此，你可以找出大把雄辩理由证明为何欧元尽管存在旷日持久的危机，但到目前为止仍然维持着对美元的坚挺。
But don’t count on a stable euro-dollar exchange rate – much less an even stronger euro – in the year ahead. => 但展望明年，别指望欧元-美元汇率能保持稳定，至于欧元走强的可能性，那就更渺茫了。
A Green Alternative to Austerity? => 一个紧缩的绿色替代项?
OXFORD – While austerity in Europe faces increasing social resistance, in principle it has the merit of simplicity. => 发自牛津 — — 虽然欧洲紧缩政策面临的社会阻力与日俱增，但至少该政策在原理上还具备简单直接的优点。

As the debate on fiscal consolidation versus growth intensifies, it is clear that there is little agreement on how to kick-start the economy, beyond fielding broad stimulus packages. => 而随着巩固财政还是确保增长的辩论日趋激烈，显然除了实施大规模刺激政策之外，在如何启动经济方面并未形成多少共识。
One idea is that environmental technology might feed a virtuous cycle of innovation and employment. => 一项理念随之产生，认为环保科技可以推动一个创新与就业的良性循环。
To some, green growth evokes a countryside covered with windmills and urban roofs lined with solar panels. => 在某些人看来，绿色增长就意味着遍布乡村的风车以及城市屋顶上的太阳能电池板。
But it is broader than that. => 但这其实只是冰山一角。
Still, it is easier to find exciting anecdotes than it is to show how they scale up to revitalizing an entire economy. => 但相对于演示这些技术如何扩大并使整个经济重焕生机，讲故事显然更加容易。
Moreover, there is a great diversity of narratives on the green economy – and their proliferation is likely to grow. => 此外，对绿色经济的不同故事描述之间也大相径庭，而且这些分歧还有不断加大之势。

The conference will unleash new arguments about green jobs, growth, cost increases, cost reductions, changes in values, consumer choice – green this and green that. => 该会议也将释放出一批关于绿色职位、增长、成本增加、成本削减，价值观转变和消费者选择的新论点 — — 什么都离不开绿色。

As a co-author of A New Growth Path for Europe, a report commissioned by the German government, I am guilty of contributing to this cacophony of complementary perspectives on green growth. => 作为德国政府主持撰写的报告《一条欧洲新增长路径》的合著者，笔者很抱歉在本已众说纷纭而又互为补充的绿色增长前景预测方面又增添了一把声音。
The European Climate Foundation had already published its Roadmap 2050, A Practical Guide to a Prosperous, Low-Carbon Europe. => 欧洲气候基金会已经发表了《2050路线图，一个实现繁荣低碳欧洲的实用指南 》 。
All take somewhat different approaches and offer different recommendations, making it hard for policymakers to see the forest through the trees. => 上述所有报告都采取了某种不同的研究路径并提出了各式各样的建议，也令政策制定者们如坠五里雾中。

And, at the root of this multiplicity of perspectives lays the fact that economics struggles to explain how growth and innovation move an economy as a whole. => 而这些预测之所以五花八门，根源就在于经济学也无法完美解释增长和创新是如何令一个经济整体向前推进的。

The macroeconomic models on which policymakers depend are solid tools in times of smooth and incremental evolution, but green growth is not about gradual change. => 在平稳且渐进式发展的时代，宏观经济模型是政策制定者们的可靠工具，但绿色增长却不属于渐进式变革的范畴。

For example, the European Union’s goal of achieving an 80% reduction in greenhouse gas emissions by 2050 implies a complete overhaul of EU infrastructure in just a few decades. => 举个例子，欧盟在2050年实现温室气体减排80%的目标必然意味着在未来短短几十年内对联盟境内各类基础设施进行全面升级改造。

We simply do not yet have sufficiently precise insights into how all of its elements interact during times of far-reaching change, whether it be a financial crisis or a growth spurt. => 我们只不过尚未具备足够的深刻洞察力去理解在一场遥远的变革 — — 不管是一场金融危机还是爆发式增长 — — 中所有的因素将如何互动。
Yet, the studies of green growth mentioned above all appear to provide such explanations. => 但上述提及的所有关于绿色增长的研究似乎都提供了这类解释。
So, what do they really tell us? => 那么他们究竟告诉了我们些什么？
In practice, each is limited to just one or two aspects of the economy, and describes how these interact. => 但实际操作中，每一项研究都仅仅局限于经济中的一个或两个方面，并对它们的互动方式进行了解释。
Growing Green and Decent Jobs looks at the relationship between investment and jobs. => 《增加绿色且体面的工作》研究了投资与就业之间的关系。
A New Growth Path for Europe examines the impact of expectations and learning-by-doing. => 《一条欧洲新增长路径》解释了预期以及边干边学所产生的影响。
Roadmap 2050 focuses on greening the power system. => 《2050路线图》则把目光集中在能源系统的绿色化之上。
The authors then make a leap of faith to derive conclusions about the economy as a whole. => 随后各报告的作者们都对作为一个整体的经济下了一个大胆的结论。

But, while the value of these studies is in the light that they shed on the parts, the ensuing headlines invariably are about the whole, articulated in terms of GDP and jobs. => 但当这些研究的价值体现在对各部分的解释之上时，随后的核心却总是关于整体，而整体则是用GDP和就业来进行衡量的。

Each of the studies describes a part of a green economy, but none can capture the whole – not because they are deficient, but because it is simply beyond our capability. => 每一项研究都解释了绿色经济的一部份，没有一个能涵盖整体 — — 这不是因为这些研究有缺陷，只不过因为这件事已经完全超出了我们的能力之外。
That said, the fact that one cannot prove conclusively how green growth would work does not mean that we should give up on the idea. => 这说明，虽然人们尚未可以确凿证明绿色增长是有效的，但也不意味着我们应当放弃这个理念。

We know from history that waves of innovation, from the steam engine to the information and communications revolution, have led to dramatic increases in economic growth. => 我们都从历史上中看到过那些革新的浪潮，从蒸汽引擎到信息与通信革命，都引发了激动人心的经济增长。

We cannot prove that a wave of environmental innovation will have a similar effect, but the studies of the parts make such an outcome highly plausible. => 我们无法证明一股环境革新的浪潮会产生类似的效应，但针对不同部分的研究使得这样一个结果更有说服力。
As humans, we are uniquely equipped to make decisions on the basis of ambiguous information – in fact, we do it all the time. => 作为人类，我们都拥有依据模糊信息做出决定的独特能力 — — 事实上我们无时无刻都在这样做。
A big pile of green-growth reports demonstrates the plausibility of this path to recovery from an historic economic crisis. => 一大叠绿色发展报告都展示了这条把全世界从一个历史性的经济危机中实现复苏的路径的说服力。
It is now up to us to realize its potential. => 而如今也是我们将其潜力变成现实的时候了。
Green growth offers a realistic alternative to the faltering austerity approach to overcoming the current economic crisis. => 相对于当前步履蹒跚的经济危机紧缩应对政策，绿色增长提供了一个现实的替代选项。
Policymakers should incorporate this thinking into the “beyond austerity” narrative that is taking shape in a growing number of key EU member states. => 而政策制定者们也应当把这一理念合并到当前在各欧盟主要成员国中日渐成形的“超越紧缩”述事中去。
Ethics and Agriculture => 伦理与农业
MELBOURNE – Should rich countries – or investors based there – be buying agricultural land in developing countries? => 墨尔本—发达国家（或那里的投资者）应该购买发展中国家的农地吗？
This amounts to 1.7% of the world’s agricultural land. => 这相当于世界农地面积的1.7 % 。

Most of these purchases have been made in Africa, with two-thirds taking place in countries where hunger is widespread and institutions for establishing formal land ownership are often weak. => 大部分农地买卖发生在非洲，其中三分之二发生在饥饿蔓延、缺少正式土地所有权框架的国家。
The purchases in Africa alone amount to an area of agricultural land the size of Kenya. => 非洲的农地买卖量相当于肯尼亚的总面积。

It has been claimed that foreign investors are purchasing land that has been left idle; thus, by bringing it into production, the purchases are increasing the availability of food overall. => 外国投资者宣称自己购买的是闲置土地，因此，通过让这些土地形成产出，土地买卖增加了粮食供应量。
On average, per capita income in the countries that are the source of these investments is four times higher than in the target countries. => 平均而言，投资来源国的人均收入比投资目标国高出四倍。
More than 40% of such projects aim to export food to the source country – suggesting that food security is a major reason for buying the land. => 40%以上的投资目的是向投资来源国出口粮食 — — 这表明粮食安全是购买土地的主要原因。
Oxfam International calls some of these deals “land grabs.” => 国际乐施会（Oxfam International）将部分交易称为“抢地 ” 。

Its own report, Our Land, Our Lives,indicates that, since 2008, communities affected by World Bank projects have brought 21 formal complaints alleging violations of their land rights. => 其报告《我们的土地，我们的生命 》 （ Our Land, Our Lives）显示，自2008年以来，受世界银行项目影响的社会共提出了21次指责破坏其土地权利的正式投诉。
Oxfam also wants the Bank to ensure that these land deals do not undermine either local or national food security. => 乐施会还呼吁世界银行保证这些土地交易不能破坏当地和国家粮食安全。

The Bank rejected the idea of a moratorium on its own work with investors in agriculture, arguing that this would target precisely those who are most likely to do the right thing. => 世界银行拒绝中止其与农业投资者的合作，表示这类合作将明确定位于最有可能把事情作对的人和组织。
One may ask whether transparency and the requirement that local landholders consent to a sale is enough to protect people living in poverty. => 你也许会问，有了透明度以及必须有当地地主愿意出售的要求就足以保护生活在贫困中的呃人们了吗？
Supporters of free markets will argue that if local landowners wish to sell their land, that is their choice to make. => 自由市场的支持者会说，如果当地地主愿意出售他们的土地，那么这就是他们的自主选择。
After all, we do not allow poor people to sell their kidneys to the highest bidder. => 毕竟，我们不能允许穷人向出价最高者出售肾脏。
Of course, hardline supporters of free markets will say that we should. => 当然，一根筋的自由市场支持者会说我们应该允许。
But, at the very least, it needs to be explained why people should be prohibited from selling kidneys, but not from selling the land that grows their food. => 但是，无论如何，必须解释人们为什么应该被禁止出售肾脏而可以出售长出粮食的土地。
Most people can live without one kidney. => 大部分人都可以在失去一个肾脏的情况下活着。
No one can live without food. => 但没人可以在没有粮食的情况下活着。
The World Bank may indeed be more concerned about local landholders’ rights than other foreign investors are. => 事实上，与其他外国投资者相比，世界银行也许能够更关心当地地主的权利。
One such case belatedly came to the attention of the United Nations Human Rights Committee. => 一宗此类案件终于引起了联合国人权委员会的注意。
But the evictions took place in 2001, and the villagers are still living in extreme poverty. => 但驱赶行为发生在2001年，被驱赶的村民至今仍生活在极端贫困中，他们没有得到侵权补偿，不管是乌干达还是德国。
Are we to believe that landholders fare better with Chinese or Saudi investors? => 我们可以指望当地地主从中国或沙特投资者手中获得更好的补偿吗？
The Rise of the Food Barons => 食品大亨的崛起

BERLIN – The industrial-agriculture sector has long faced criticism for practices that contribute to climate change, environmental destruction, and rural poverty. => 柏林—长期以来，工业农业（industrial-agriculture sector）一直被人诟病加剧了气候变化、环境破坏和农村贫困。
And yet the sector has taken virtually no steps to improve quality and sustainability, or to promote social justice. => 但给行业几乎没有采取任何措施改善质量和可持续性，或促进社会公平。
Given the high profits and vast political power of these companies, changes to the status quo are not in their interest. => 这些公司利润丰厚，炙手可热，改变现状可不符合它们的利益。

Moreover, market concentration in the agriculture sector is on the rise, owing to increased demand for the agricultural raw materials needed in food, animal feed, and energy production. => 此外，拜粮食、饲料和能源生产的农业原材料需求增长所赐，农业的市场集中度也在升高。
The biggest players in these sectors have been buying out their smaller competitors for years. => 多年来，这些行业中的最大牌公司一直在收购规模较小的竞争对手。
But now they are also buying out one another, often with financing provided by investors from completely different sectors. => 但如今，它们同时也在互相收购，融资常常来自完全不同行业的投资者。
“Baysanto” alone would be the proprietor of almost every genetically modified plant on the planet. => 光是“拜山都”一家，就几乎囊括了全世界所有的转基因作物。
With other large mergers also being announced, the global agriculture market at the end of 2017 could look very different than it did at the beginning. => 随着其他大型收购案的不断宣布，到2017年底，全球农业市场将与年初发生天翻地覆的变化。
The agrotechnical sector is experiencing some of the same changes as the seed sector. => 农业技术行业正在经历与种子行业类似的变化。
The five largest corporations account for 65% of the market, with Deere & Company, the owner of the John Deere brand, in the lead. => 五家最大的公司控制了65%的市场，约翰迪尔（John Deere）商标所有人迪尔公司在这方面一马当先。
In 2015, Deere & Company reported $29 billion in sales, surpassing the $25 billion that Monsanto and Bayer made selling seeds and pesticides. => 2015年，迪尔公司披露的销售额为290亿美元，超过了卖种子和杀虫剂的孟山都和拜耳的250亿美元销售额。
The most promising new opportunity for food corporations today lies in the digitization of agriculture. => 如今，食品公司最憧憬的新机会在于农业数字化。
This process is still in its early stages, but it is gathering momentum, and eventually it will cover all areas of production. => 农业数字化过程仍处于初级阶段，但正在起势，最终将涵盖所有产品领域。
To maximize the benefits of these new technologies, the companies that already dominate the value chain have begun cooperating with one another. => 为了实现新技术效益最大化，已经占据价值链主导地位的公司早已开始彼此合作。
The John Deeres and Monsantos have now joined forces. => 约翰迪尔们和孟山都们已经结成了联盟。

But while this possible future bodes well for some of the world’s largest companies, it leaves the environmental and social problems associated with industrialized agriculture unsolved. => 但这样的未来可能固然有利于少数世界性大公司，并不能解决工业化农业遗留下来的相关环境和社会问题。
Most farmers, particularly in the global South, will never be able to afford expensive digital-age machinery. => 大部分农民，特别是全球南方地区的农民，永远买不起昂贵的数字时代机器。
The maxim “grow or go” will be replaced with “digitize or disappear.” => “要么成长，要么离开”的格言将变成“要么数字化，要么消失 ” 。
At that point, just a few companies will determine everything that we eat. => 到那时，少数几家公司就能决定我们吃的一切。
Indeed, the same market-concentration problem applies to other links in the value chain, such as agricultural traders and supermarkets. => 事实上，相同的市场集中问题在价值链的其他环节也存在，比如农业贸易商和超级市场。

And even though food processing is not yet consolidated on a global scale, it is still dominated at the regional level by companies such as Unilever, Danone, Mondelez, and Nestlé. => 而尽管食品加工尚未出现全球规模的整合，但在地区层面上，联合利华、达能、蒙德利兹（Mondelez）和雀巢的公司已经实现了主宰。

These companies make money when fresh or semi-processed food is replaced by highly processed convenience foods such as frozen pizza, canned soup, and ready-made meals. => 随着新鲜和半加工食品被速冻披萨、汤罐头和即食肉制品等深加工食品所取代，这些公司也赚了个盆满钵满。
While lucrative, this business model is closely linked to obesity, diabetes, and other chronic diseases. => 尽管利润丰厚，但这一商业模式很容易导致肥胖、糖尿病和其他慢性疾病。
Meanwhile, corporations are amassing market power at the expense of those at the bottom of the value chain: farmers and workers. => 与此同时，这些公司赢得市场权力以价值链底层 — — 农民和工人的牺牲为代价。

International Labor Organization standards guarantee all workers the right to organize, and they prohibit forced and child labor and proscribe race and gender discrimination. => 国际劳工组织规则保障所有工人都有组织工会的权利，也禁止强迫劳动和童工以及种族和性别歧视。

But labor-law violations have become the norm, because efforts to enforce ILO rules are often quashed, while trade union members are routinely threatened, fired, and even murdered. => 但违反劳动法的情况司空见惯，因为国际劳工组织规则的执行力往往很弱，而工会成员常常受到威胁、解雇甚至谋杀。
In this hostile climate, minimum-wage, overtime-pay, and workplace-safety standards are openly neglected. => 在如此不利的环境下，最低工资、加班费和工作场所安全标准被公然无视。

And women, in particular, are at a disadvantage, because they are paid less than their male counterparts and often must settle for seasonal or temporary jobs. => 妇女尤其不利，因为她们的薪酬低于男性同事，从事的也常常是季节性或临时性工作。
Today, half of the world’s 800 million starving people are small farmers and workers connected to the agricultural sector. => 如今，全世界8亿吃不饱饭的人中有一半是小农和农业相关工人。
Their lot will hardly improve if the few companies already dominating that sector become even more powerful. => 如果极少数已经成为行业主宰的公司继续获得更大的权力，他们的境况将难以改善。
How to Feed the World => 如何养活世界
PRAGUE – Hunger has wracked humanity since time immemorial. => 布拉格—从远古时代开始，饥饿一直困扰着人类。

Nearly every major society has been shaped by famine; one estimate suggests that China suffered drought or flood-induced starvation in at least one province almost every year from 108 BC to 1911. => 几乎所有主要社会都受到饥荒影响；有人估算，从公元前108年到公园1911年间，每一年中国都至少有一个省出现旱灾或洪灾导致饥荒的情况。
Yet the struggle against hunger is a battle that humanity could finally win. => 但与饥饿的斗争是一场人类最终能够取得胜利的斗争。

More cereals were produced annually in the last quarter of the twentieth century than in any preceding period, and more grain will be harvested this year than at any time in history. => 二十世纪最后四分之一的谷物年产量要比此前任何一个时期都要高，而今年的谷物产量更是要高于历史上任何一年。
Since 1992, the number of hungry people worldwide has plummeted by more than 200 million, even as the human population grew by nearly two billion. => 自1992年以来，全球饥民数量减少了两亿多，尽管人口数量增加了近二十亿。
But enormous challenges remain. => 但仍有诸多挑战。
Affordable, nutritious food is one of people’s top priorities everywhere, and one in nine people still do not get enough food to be healthy. => 平价营养食物是所有人类最要紧的事，而有九分之一的人类仍然无法获得足够的食物保持健康。
With today’s population of 7.3 billion expected to reach 8.5 billion by 2030 and 9.7 billion in 2050, food demand will increase accordingly. => 今天的73亿人口预计到2030年将变为85亿，到2050年将变为97亿，食物需求也将相应增长。
Along with more mouths to feed, stresses on food supplies will include conflicts, economic volatility, extreme weather events, and climate change. => 随着有更多的肚子需要填饱，食物供给的压力将来自冲突、经济动荡、极端天气事件、气候变化等。
Between 1930 and 2000, agricultural output in the United States quadrupled, with productivity growth outstripping that of manufacturing. => 从1930年到2000年，美国农业产出翻了两番，农业生产率增长比制造业更快。

Developing countries have begun sharing in these gains: responsible for next-to-none of the world’s fertilizer consumption in 1960, by 2000 they used more than industrialized countries. => 发展中国家也开始分享这些收益：1960年，它们的化肥消费占比可以忽略不计，到2000年，它们的化肥使用量已经超过了工业化国家。
The World Bank has found that productivity growth in agriculture can be up to four times more effective in reducing poverty than growth from other sectors. => 世界银行发现，农业生产率增长���减少贫困的作用是其他部门生产率增长的四倍。
So how do we keep up this progress? => 那么，我们如何保持这一势头？
Investment in research and development is vital. => 研究和开发投资至关重要。
Achieving these targets would be worth nearly $3 trillion in social good, implying an enormous return of $34 for every dollar spent. => 实现这些目标相当于实现3万亿美元的社会公益，即每一美元支出带来34美元的巨额回报。

Scientific breakthroughs also play a key role in fighting specific nutritional challenges such as vitamin A deficiency, the leading cause of preventable childhood blindness. => 科学突破也在战胜具体的营养挑战方面起着关键作用，比如维生素A缺乏症，它是引起可预防儿童失明的主要原因。
Another way to increase agricultural productivity is through labor. => 另一个增加农业生产率的方法是通过劳动力。
Investing around $9,000 per worker over two decades could boost agricultural productivity by 10%. => ”在二十年的时间里对每位工人投资大约9,000美元能够让农业生产率提高10 % 。

Bangladesh is an instructive case, because it is susceptible to flooding and the effects of climate change, and its agricultural productivity lags behind other developing and middle-income countries. => 孟加拉国的例子很有说明意义，因为它极易受到洪水和气候变化影响，而其农业生产率也落后于其他发展中和中等收入国家。

Unsurprisingly, the Bangladeshi prime minister’s office is striving to lead in global innovation, sustaining an agriculture innovation lab that shares best practices and ideas. => 毫不奇怪，孟加拉国总理办公室正致力于引领全球创新，建立了一座共享最佳实践和思想的农业创新实验室。

Copenhagen Consensus has worked with the world’s largest NGO, BRAC, to find out the policy wishes of people living in rural Bangladesh, including the “ultra-poor” with whom BRAC works closely. => 哥本哈根共识中心与全球最大的非政府组织BRAC合作了解孟加拉国农村地区人口 — — 包括BRAC共组人员与之近距离共事的“极端贫困”人口 — — 想要什么政策。

These laborers, housewives, and others, some of whom live on the equivalent of $0.60-0.70 or less a day, are seldom given a place at the table to discuss policy. => 这些劳动者、家庭主妇和其他人员每天的生活费不超过0.6—0.7美元，他们的声音很少在政策讨论拥有一席之地。

Across nine rural forums in far-flung parts of the country, the participants overwhelmingly spoke with one voice, calling for the same policy priority: increased agricultural productivity. => 在孟加拉国偏远地区的九个论坛上，参与者一边倒地发出一个声音，提出了同一个政策重点要求：提高农业生产率。

“Everyone knows Rangpur has a Monga problem,” said a local from Chandpara in the Rangpur division, using the Bengali term for the annual cyclical phenomenon of seasonal hunger. => “众所周知，朗布尔（Rangpur）地区存在孟加（monga）问题 ” ， 朗布尔省钱德帕拉（Chandpara）的一位当地人如是说 ， “ 孟加”是孟加拉语，指年复一年发生的季节性饥饿现象。
“We cannot feed our people two times a day – we need to increase our agricultural productivity.” => “我们的人一天吃不上两顿饭 — — 我们需要提高农业生产率。 ”

A Mukimabad villager had the same vision for Bangladesh: “We need crops and seeds which are not vulnerable to salinity and flood so that we do not have to die from food shortages.” => 一位木吉玛巴德（Mukimabad）村民持有同样观点 ： “ 我们需要抗盐碱和洪水的庄稼和种子，这样我们才不会死于食物短缺。 ”
Humanity’s fight against hunger can be won. => 人类可以打赢与饥饿的战争。
Great progress has been made, but the world needs more agricultural R&D and higher productivity. => 人类已经取得了巨大的进步，但世界需要更多农业研发和更高的生产率。

As a rural villager from Deukhola, near the Brahmaputra River in remote northern Bangladesh, starkly put it: “Our survival depends on it.” => 孟加拉国北部偏远地区布拉马普特拉河附近的德克霍拉（Deukhola）的一位农民尖锐地指出 ， “ 我们的生存就系于此。
We would do well to listen. => ”聆听能让我们做得更好。
An Arab Marshall Plan => 阿拉伯马歇尔计划
OXFORD – The wave of revolts that swept across the Arab world two years ago were fueled by demands for freedom, bread, and social justice. => 牛津—两年前席卷阿拉伯世界的革命风潮的推动力来自自由、面包和社会公正的要求。
But, although the revolutions toppled dictators and transformed societies, these core objectives remain as distant as ever. => 但是，尽管革命颠覆了独裁者、改变了社会，但这些核心目标扔像从前一样遥远。

In fact, the economic challenges facing the Arab Spring countries have become even more pressing, weighing heavily on these countries’ political prospects. => 事实上，阿拉伯之春国家面临的经济挑战甚至变得更加紧迫了，严重地影响着这些国家的政治前景。
Unemployment has nearly doubled in Tunisia and Egypt, and foreign direct investment has dried up across the Arab world. => 突尼斯和埃及的失业率几近翻番，整个阿拉伯世界的外国直接投资几乎枯竭。
Tourism revenues, while resilient, are declining, and fiscal challenges remain considerable. => 旅游收入随虽然坚挺，但也在下降，财政挑战也依然严峻。
But the economic urgency is not reflected in the policy response, which has been painfully slow or non-existent. => 但经济紧迫性并未反映在缓慢（如果不是没有的话）的政策反应中。
For example, Egypt’s fiscal deficit will exceed 11% of GDP this year. => 比如，埃及今年的财政赤字将超过GDP的11 % 。
But the country’s leaders have been stalling on the terms of a much-needed International Monetary Fund loan. => 但该国领导人还在急需的IMF贷款条件上扯皮。

The government’s reduction of fuel subsidies last year was not followed by additional reforms, and the required tax increase was delayed soon after President Mohamed Morsi announced it. => 政府在去年削减了燃料补贴，但并未增加进一步的改革，总统穆尔西在宣布实施必要的增税后马上把这一措施推迟了。
Almost all political stakeholders in Egypt, as in the other Arab countries in transition, recognize the need for economic reform. => 埃及几乎所有的政治相关利益者（其他阿拉伯过渡国家也一样）都知道经济改革的必要性。
But neither citizens nor policymakers appear willing to bear its social and political costs. => 但人民和决策者都不希望承担改革的社会和政治成本。

In a charged and uncertain political climate, in which new crises erupt on a daily basis, it is unsurprising that economic reform has been postponed repeatedly. => 在敏感而不确定的政治气候下 — — 几乎天天爆发新危机 — — 经济改革一再中止并不令人奇怪。
Politicians know that macroeconomic stabilization and social cohesion can be irreconcilable in the short run. => 政客们明白，宏观经济稳定和社会团结在短期是不可调和的。

Slashing food and energy subsidies in order to reduce fiscal strain is unlikely to win favor in a country like Egypt, where 40% of per capita income is allocated to food. => 削减食品和能源补贴以降低财政负担不可能让你在埃及赢得支持，因为埃及人均收入的四成用于食品。
Politics is thus constraining efforts to strengthen public finances. => 因此，政治成了加强财政健康的约束。

At the same time, narrow IMF prescriptions threaten to exacerbate political instability, with citizens no longer afraid to take to the streets to demonstrate their dissatisfaction. => 与此同时，狭隘的IMF药方有放大政治动荡的可能，人民已不再惮于走上街头表达自己的不满。
But such a move is far too risky for an individual politician, or even a single country, at a time of economic uncertainty and high unemployment. => 但是，在经济不确定性和失业高企的时期，这样一场运动对政治家个人甚至个别国家来说风险太大。
It is much easier to reform subsidy programs when the economy is expanding. => 一旦经济开始扩张，改革补贴计划就会容易得多。
Moreover, building competitive markets is essential to ensuring sustainable GDP growth. => 此外，建设竞争市场是确保可持续GDP增长的关键。
To this end, regional trade barriers, which are more pervasive in the Arab world than even in Sub-Saharan Africa, must be dismantled. => 在这方面，地区贸易壁垒 — — 阿拉伯世界的这个问题甚至比撒哈拉以南非洲还要普遍 — — 必须打破。
By agreeing to the pact, Arab countries would commit to reforming their subsidy systems and to reducing restrictions on cross-border economic exchange. => 通过同意这一契约，阿拉伯国家将能致力于改革补贴制度、减少跨国经济往来限制。
The regional dimension of prosperity has long been ignored in the Arab world. => 繁荣的地区维度在阿拉伯世界长期受到忽视。
But weak regional linkages limit small firms’ growth potential, forcing them to depend on state patronage. => 但微弱的地区联系局限了小企业的增长潜力，迫使它们依赖国家支持。
And, while Tunisia’s situation seems to be the most promising, a crippling investment shortfall is threatening to derail reform efforts there. => 而尽管突尼斯的状况似乎最为乐观，但要命的投资短缺有可能使改革夭折。
With Europe mired in crisis, capital flows from Tunisia’s resource-rich Arab neighbors are its best hope. => 在欧洲饱受危机折磨的前提下，来自资源丰富的阿拉伯邻国的资本流入是突尼斯最大的希望。
Furthermore, Arab countries must ratchet up development spending. => 除此之外，阿拉伯国家必须逐渐增加发展支出。
New investment vehicles, such as sovereign wealth funds and Islamic finance, can contribute financing to credit-starved firms. => 新投资实体，比如主权财富基金和伊斯兰金融也可以帮助信用饥渴的企业融资。
At the same time, Arab countries must streamline current aid efforts. => 与此同时，阿拉伯国家必须让当前援助措施合理化。

For too long, Arab governments have simply thrown money at problems, with the rich Gulf countries effectively subsidizing their troubled neighbors’ public services. => 长期以来，阿拉伯国家政府总是把钱浪费在问题上，富有的波斯湾国家实际上补贴着它们陷入麻烦的邻国的公共服务。
Over the last two years, Saudi Arabia has provided more than $3 billion to Yemen. => 过去两年来，沙特向也门提供了30多亿美元。
Qatar has provided  $5 billion to Egypt since 2011, with a promise of $3 billion more. => 卡塔尔自2011年以来向埃及提供了50亿美元，并承诺还将提供30亿美元。
And the United Arab Emirates recently pledged $2.5 billion to Bahrain. => 阿联酋最近也承诺向巴林提供25亿美元。
But unconditional aid only delays reforms, because it weakens budget constraints, which reduces pressure on policymakers and creates moral hazard. => 但无条件的援助只能拖延干戈，因为这削弱了预算约束，从而减轻了决策者的压力，创造了道德风险。
The Arab Spring has exposed fault lines that run not just through individual countries, but also through the entire region. => 阿拉伯之春暴露了不仅存在于个体国家之间、也存在于整个地区的断层线。
This calls for redefining relationships not only between citizens and states, but also among Arab countries. => 这不但需要重新定义人民和国家间关系，也需要重新定义阿拉伯国家之间的关系。
Above all, it is no longer prudent to divide Arab countries between donors and recipients, or between resource-rich and resource-poor countries. => 最重要的是，将阿拉伯国家分为赞助过和受赞助国或资源富裕国和资源贫乏国已不再合适。
The Ahistorical Federal Reserve => 反历史的美联储
BERKELEY – Economic developments over the past 20 years have taught – or ought to have taught – the US Federal Reserve four lessons. => 伯克利—过去20年的经济发展教给 — — 或者应该教给 — — 美联储四个教训。
Yet the Fed’s current policy posture raises the question of whether it has internalized any of them. => 但美联储当前的政策姿态让人们质疑他们是否消化了其中任何一个。

The first lesson is that, at least as long as the current interest-rate configuration is sustained, the proper inflation target for the Fed should be 4% per year, rather than 2%. => 第一个教训是，至少在当前利率保持调整态势的情况下，美联储合理的目标通胀应该是每年4 % ， 而不是2 % 。
The Fed protests that to change its inflation target even once would erode the credibility of its commitment to ensuring price stability. => 美联储反对说，改变通胀目标，哪怕一次，会有损于其确保物价稳定的承诺的信誉。
But the Fed can pay now or it can pay later. => 但美联储可以现在付出代价，也可以随后付出代价。

After all, what good is credibility today when it means sticking tenaciously to a policy that deprives you of the ability to do your job properly tomorrow? => 毕竟，如果今天的信誉意味着坚持限制你明天游刃有余地完成任务的能力的政策，还有什么有点可言？
Then-Fed Chair Alan Greenspan recognized this in the 1990s. => 20世纪90年代，时任美联储主席艾伦·格林斯潘（Alan Greenspan）发现了这一现象。
He rightly judged that pushing for faster growth and lower unemployment was not taking excessive risks, but rather harvesting low-hanging fruit. => 他正确地判断，推动加快增长和降低失业不会带来过度风险，反而是唾手可得的果实。
The current Fed appears to have a different view. => 现任美联储似乎持有不同观点。

The third lesson is that yield-curve inversion in the bond market is not just a sign that the market thinks that monetary policy is too tight; it is a sign that monetary policy really is too tight. => 第三个教训是债券市场收益率曲线反转不仅仅是市场认为货币政策过紧的信号；它就是货币政策过紧的信号。
But 2006, just before the financial crisis hit, was supposed to be different, too. => 但在2006年，就在金融危机爆发前夕，人们也以为这次不一样了。
(And there were plenty of times before then that were supposed to be different, too.) => （在此之前也有许多次人们认为这次不一样。
History suggests that this time is highly unlikely to be different – and that it will not end well if the Fed continues to believe and behave otherwise. => ）历史表明，这次不太可能不一样 — — 如果美联储继续这次会不一样，解决肯定不会好。
The fourth lesson similarly reflects developments extending back further than 20 years. => 第四个教训同样反映了可追溯到20多年前的发展趋势。
Back in the 1980s, it was not unreasonable to argue that the next large shock to the US macroeconomy was likely to be inflationary. => 20世纪80年代，有充分的理由认为下一场对美国宏观经济的大冲击可能是会引起通胀。
It is much more difficult to reasonably argue that today. => 今天做出这样的判断依据不再。

But, at least as I see it, right now the Fed’s process of getting from a realistic view of the economy to an appropriate monetary policy does not seem to be functioning well at all. => 但是，至少在我看来，现在美联储从经济的现实观点到合适货币政策的转变过程运行一点都不好。
Perhaps it is time for the Fed to place its internal discussions in a more explicit framework. => 也许美联储应该在更加明确的框架中进行内部讨论。

The problem for optimal control methods is that the real world is not some closed system where economic relationships never change, or where they change in fully predictable ways. => 优化控制方法的问题是真实世界是一个比较封闭的系统，经济关系从不改变，或者以完全可预测的方式改变。

The most effective – and thus the most credible – monetary policy is one that reflects not only the lessons of history, but also a willingness to reconsider long-held assumptions. => 最有效 — — 因此也是最可信 — — 的货币政策不但要反映历史教训，也要反映反思长期以来的假设的意愿。
A History Lesson for Koizumi => 给小泉的一堂历史课

Once again, protests against Japanese Prime Minister Junichiro Koizumi’s annual visit to the Yasukuni shrine are breaking out in China as well as South Korea. => 中国和韩国又一次爆发了反对日本首相小泉纯一郎一年一度参拜靖国神社的抗议活动。
Even some in Japan are becoming critical of Koizumi. => 甚至日本一些人也开始对小泉持批评意见。

While the public remains negative about Chinese outbursts against Japan, a recent survey indicates that more than 70% of Japanese view the current state of Japan-China relations as unacceptable. => 虽然公众仍旧觉得中国人对日本爆发愤怒不可理喻，但是最近一项调查显示70%多的日本人认为日中关系当前的这种状态不可接受。
More people are not supporting Koizumi’s annual pilgrimage to Yasukuni, with seven former prime ministers jointly demanding that he refrain from the visits. => 更多的人不支持小泉每年参拜靖国神社，七位前首相联合要求他放弃参拜。
Yet Koizumi remains defiant. => 然而小泉却一意孤行。

Moreover, Chief Cabinet Secretary Shinzu Abe, the front-runner to succeed him, has openly declared that he will continue to visit the shrine as prime minister. => 而且，最有可能接任他的内阁官房长官安倍晋三已经公开宣布他担任首相后将继续参拜靖国神社。
Foreign Minister Taro Aso, another possible successor to Koizumi, has called for the Japanese Emperor to pray at Yasukuni. => 另一个可能接替小泉的人，外相麻生太郎呼吁日本天皇去参拜靖国神社。
So pessimism appears to be settling in, and the deadlock over Yasukuni appears to be deepening. => 尽管局势似乎如此悲观，靖国神社僵局似乎正在加深。
But the past can bring us more than just troubles of this kind. => 但是历史不仅仅能够给我们带来现在这种困境。
Even on the issue of Yasukuni, there are positive lessons to be learned. => 甚至是在靖国神社问题上，也有积极的经验可供我们学习。
Consider Yasuhiro Nakasone, Koizumi’s predecessor in the 1980’s. => 想一想小泉20世纪80年代的前辈中曾根康弘首相吧。
Both are master politicians who remained popular and served long terms in office. => 两人都是精明的政治家，一直很受欢迎，执政时间也很长。
Both are conservative and nationalistic, advocating the revision of the constitution and an assertive political and military role for Japan abroad. => 两人都是保守派，信奉民族主义，鼓吹修改宪法和日本在海外发挥更大的政治和军事作用。
But a crucial difference between Nakasone and Koizumi is often overlooked: their handling of the Yasukuni controversy and relations with China. => 但是中曾与小泉之间一个重要的差别却常常被忽视,那就是他们处理靖国神社争议和对中关系的方法。

Nakasone broke the taboo by being the first prime minister to worship at the Yasukuni shrine in his official capacity on August 15, 1985, the fortieth anniversary of the end of World War II. => 1985年8月15日、第二次世界大战结束40周年纪念日那天，中曾根康弘打破禁忌成为了第一位在职期间参拜靖国神社的首相。
The decision triggered a severe response from China, where students held demonstrations against his visit. => 这个决定激起了中国强烈的反应，学生对他的参拜举行示威游行。
Bilateral relations were frozen. => 双边关系被冻结。
But, instead of capitalizing on domestic resentment over China’s criticisms, Nakasone decided not to visit Yasukuni again. => 但是，中曾根康弘没有利用国内对中国批评的不满，而是决定不再参拜靖国神社。
He chose to mend relations with China by focusing on the positive aspects of bilateral ties. => 他选择修复与中国的关系，重点关注双边联系中积极的方面。
This genuine embrace of reconciliation provided much-needed support to Chinese leaders, who were eager to control anti-Japanese sentiments. => 这种真诚的拥抱和解为中国领导人提供了急需的支持，他们正急于控制国内的反日情绪。

Hu praised Nakasone’s courage and warned Chinese youth publicly that if they “think merely of the well-being of their own country… they are not sober-minded patriots.” => 胡耀邦赞扬了中曾根康弘的勇气并公开警告中国年轻人如果他们“只考虑自己国家的利益，就不是头脑冷静的爱国者。 ”
Nakasone emerged from the crisis and was recognized as a capable statesman in managing Japan’s diplomacy with China. => 中曾根康弘成功地摆脱了这场危机，作为一位政治家，被认为善于处理日本与中国的外交关系。
There was no accusation that Nakasone was “selling out” to Beijing. => 没有人指责中曾为了北京而“出卖国家 ” 。
Nor were his conservative, nationalist, and pro-American credentials damaged. => 他的保守主义、民族主义和亲美倾向的政治形象也没有受到损害。
This episode suggests that Koizumi’s hardline position isn’t the only option. => 这段插曲表明小泉的强硬立场并不是唯一的选择。
Unfortunately, Koizumi and his allies are not prepared to move forward on the Yasukuni issue. => 不幸的是，小泉和他们的盟友不准备在靖国神社问题上更进一步。
As Foreign Minister Aso recently put it: “The more China voices [opposition], the more one feels like going there. => 正如外相麻生太郎最近指出的那样 ： “ 中国反对的声音越强，日本人越觉得应该去参拜。
It’s just like when you’re told ‘Don't smoke cigarettes,’ it actually makes you want to smoke.” => 这就好像当有人告诉你‘不要抽烟’时，实际上却让你更想抽烟。 ”
Israel versus America versus Iran => 以色列、美国和伊朗
TEL AVIV – Israel’s concern about the specter of a nuclear Iran has now degenerated into a crisis of confidence concerning the United States. => 特拉维夫—以色列对有核伊朗这一幽灵的担忧不欠已经变成了一场对美国的信心危机。

Prime Minister Binyamin Netanyahu has embarked on a campaign to force President Barack Obama to set a red line that Iran must not cross, lest it risk unleashing an American military response. => 总理内塔尼亚胡在一次活动中强迫奥巴马设置一条伊朗不得跨越的红线，否则美国将采取军事干预。

Implicit threats of a unilateral Israeli attack, together with conspicuous meddling in the US presidential election campaign, have compounded Netanyahu’s effort to twist Obama’s arm. => 暗示以色列将单方面采取军事袭击以及赤裸裸地干预美国大选，这些举动表明内塔尼亚胡在和奥巴马较劲。
But, equally important, the dispute underscores their different objectives. => 但是，同样重要的是，这一争议体现了它们不同的目标。
For Israel, war with Iran is not about neutralizing an existential threat; it is about reasserting its regional status. => 对以色列来说，和伊朗开战并不是为了消灭一个已经存在的威胁，而是为了重建其地区地位。

Indeed, they probably contemplate land incursions into Iran, and possibly a decisive – and, from their perspective, long overdue – showdown with Hamas in Gaza and Hezbollah in Lebanon. => 事实上，他们可能已经在考虑从陆上突入伊朗，并（这方面或许已经谋划已久了）对加沙地区的哈马斯和黎巴嫩真主党予以决定性打击。

Though determined to prevent Iran from acquiring nuclear weapons, even if doing so requires military action, the US weighs the consequences of a military showdown in very different terms. => 美国不会接受伊朗拥有核武器，即使为此采取军事行动也在所不惜。 尽管如此，美国对军事行动后果的评估与以色列大不相同。
The fallout from a war in Iran would pin down the US in the Middle East for years to come, undermining its new strategic priorities. => 与伊朗开战的不良影响将在多年内对美国的中东地位造成危险，破坏其新的战略要务。
To guarantee that Iran never acquires a nuclear bomb, the US would need to maintain military pressure on Iran for several years. => 为了保证伊朗永远不会有核弹，美国需要在多年内保持对伊朗的军事压力。
The pre-Arab Spring paradigm that framed the Middle East as being divided between “moderates” and “extremists” has become obsolete. => 前阿拉伯之春时代的范式 — — 中的你可以分为“温和”和“极端”两大阵营 — — 已是老黄历了。
The Islamist governments that have emerged from the downfall of America’s puppet regimes are no friends of an Iranian nuclear empire. => 趁美国傀儡政权倒台而出现的伊斯兰政府并不是伊朗核帝国的盟友。
But, in their struggle to survive, they must channel popular anti-Americanism. => 但是，在生存斗争中，它们必须疏导流行的反美主义。

For Egyptian President Mohamed Morsi, that imperative meant placating the angry mob that recently attacked the US embassy rather than merely condemning the violence. => 对埃及总统穆尔西来说，这一要求意味着必须对最近袭击美国大使馆的暴徒进行安抚，而不仅仅是谴责暴力。
It would be impossible to rule out a regional war. => 这样一来，地区战争就不可避免了。
The main problem facing a military operation in Iran is the need to ensure its legitimacy. => 对伊朗采取军事行动的一个主要问题是必须保证这么做的合法性。
China and Russia would never allow the US to secure a United Nations mandate for an attack. => 中国和俄罗斯绝不会让美国促使联合国通过军事打击的决议。
The dire legacy of Iraq and Afghanistan weighs heavily on the Western democracies. => 伊拉克和阿富汗战争的可怕结局将对西方民主国家造成重大影响。
The saddest part of the story is Israel’s utter indifference to the need to build international legitimacy for its drive to stop Iran’s nuclear program. => 最悲观的部分在于以色列在为阻止以色列核计划的行动营造国际合法性方面具有完全不同的需求。
Netanyahu thinks in bold military terms, not in terms of geopolitical strategy. => 内塔尼亚胡认为应该采取断然军事手段，而不是地缘政治战略博弈。
His careless Palestine policy has left Israel with few friends in the international community, let alone in the Arab Middle East. => 他的鲁莽巴勒斯坦政策已经让以色列在国际社会中失去了所有朋友，更不用说阿拉伯中东地区的友邦了。
Indeed, many regard Netanyahu’s Iran obsession as nothing more than a successful ploy to divert attention from the Palestinian issue. => 事实上，许多人认为，内塔尼亚胡在伊朗问题上纠缠不休无非是成功将注意力从巴勒斯坦问题上转移的伎俩。
And only that outcome can secure the international goodwill that both Israel and the US will need for a showdown with Iran. => 而只有赢得了阿拉伯世界的好感，才能保证国际社会肯定以色列和美国遏制伊朗的意图。
A Human Rights Crime In Gaza => 加沙的人权犯罪

Israeli bombs and missiles periodically strike the encapsulated area, causing high casualties among both militants and innocent women and children. => 以色列对这个被围困的地区不时的轰炸以及发射的火箭弹给那里的武装人员和无辜的妇女儿童都造成了巨大的伤亡。
On a recent trip through the Middle East, I attempted to gain a better understanding of the crisis. => 在我最近对中东地区的穿梭访问中，我试图对这场危机有更好的理解。

One of my visits was to Sderot, a community of about 20,000 in southern Israel that is frequently struck by rudimentary rockets fired from nearby Gaza. => 其间我访问了斯德罗社区，这是一个位于以色列南部、大约有20000人口的社区，经常遭到来自临近的加沙的那些劣质火箭弹的袭击。
I condemned these attacks as abominable and an act of terrorism, since most of the thirteen victims during the past seven years have been non-combatants. => 我谴责这些袭击为可恶和恐怖行为，因为过去七年间的13位牺牲者大多数是非武装人员。
Subsequently, I met with leaders of Hamas, both a delegation from Gaza and the top officials in Damascus, Syria. => 随后我会晤了哈马斯的领导人，有来自加沙的代表团以及来自叙利亚大马士革的高级官员。
Hamas then made a public proposal of a mutual ceasefire restricted to Gaza, which the Israelis considered and also rejected. => 后来哈马斯公开提出双方只在加沙地区实现停火，对此以色列表示愿意考虑，但最后还是拒绝了。
There are fervent arguments heard on both sides concerning blame for a lack of peace in the Holy Land. => 双方内部对于无法在圣地实现和平都充满着激烈的争论。

Israel has occupied and colonized the Palestinian West Bank, which is approximately one-fourth (28.5%) the size of the nation of Israel as recognized by the international community. => 以色列已经占领并且殖民化了巴勒斯坦的西岸地区，其面积大约相当于以色列被国际社会认可的国土面积的四分之一（28.5 % ） 。

Some Israeli religious factions claim a right to the land on both sides of the Jordan River, and others aver that their 205 settlements with some 500,000 people are necessary for “security.” => 一些以色列的宗教派别宣称以色列对约旦河两岸的土地都拥有权利，还有一些人坚称他们居住着大约50万人口的205个定居点需要“安全 ” 。
All Arab nations have agreed to full recognition of Israel if it will comply with key United Nations resolutions. => 所有的阿拉伯国家都同意如果以色列愿意遵守主要的联合国决议，它们就将完全承认以色列。

This holds promise of progress, but despite the brief fanfare and positive statements at the peace conference last November in Annapolis, Maryland, a retrogression has occurred in the process. => 这让我们看到了取得进展的希望，但是尽管去年11月份在马里兰州的安那波利斯和平会议上发表了令人鼓舞宣言，和平进程还是出现了倒退。

Nine thousand new Israeli settlement housing units have been announced in Palestine, the number of roadblocks within the West bank has increased, and the stranglehold on Gaza has been tightened. => 以色列宣布将在巴勒斯坦建设9000套新的居住单元，设在西岸地区的路障数量还在增加，而对加沙的压制则更紧了。

It is one thing for other leaders to defer to the US on the crucial peace negotiations, but the world must not stand idle while innocent people are treated cruelly. => 其他国家的领导人遵从美国在至关重要的和平谈��上的地位是一回事，但是另一方面当无辜的民众受到残酷的虐待时世界绝不能袖手旁观。

It is time for strong voices in Europe, the US, Israel, and elsewhere to speak out and condemn this human rights tragedy among the Palestinian people. => 现在是欧洲、美国、以色列和其他地区发出强烈的声音，齐声谴责发生在巴勒斯坦人民身上的这场人权悲剧的时候了。
A Hundred Years of Superconductivity => 超导百年
This spring marked the 100th anniversary of the discovery of superconductivity – the ability of materials to carry electrical current with no loss. => 此举也成为了超导现象100周年纪念的标志性事件。 所谓超导，就是物质携带电流却不造成损失的能力。
Currents set up in superconducting wires can exist for years without any measurable decay. => 超导线中的电流可以存在数年都不出现可测量的衰减。
Because of this property, superconductors have unique features that can be exploited in many ways. => 这种特性使得超导体拥有了可供多方面利用的独有特征。

They can carry enormous amounts of current, making them ideal for urban power grids. And, when wound into coils, they can produce extremely strong magnetic fields. => 它们可以携带巨量电流，非常适用于城市电网，而被卷成线圈时又能制造出极其强大的磁场。
Such superconducting magnets have been applied in a variety of technologies. => 这些超导磁体被应用到一系列技术当中。
The best-known examples are the magnets that drive the magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) machines found in most hospitals. => 最广为人知的就是驱动医院磁共振成像系统（MRI）的磁体。

Perhaps the most exotic are the huge magnets used to accelerate particles in the Large Hadron Collider, which seeks to discover the fundamental principles of matter. => 最鲜为人知的或许是欧洲大型强子对撞机中用于加速粒子的巨型磁体，而该设备则被利用来探索物质的基本原理。

Despite their great promise, however, superconductors have limits, the primary one being that most superconduct at very low temperatures – indeed, near absolute zero (-273 ºC). => 虽然拥有巨大的前景，但超导体也存在自身的限制，其中最主要的一点就是大多数超导现象只有在极低温环境下才能实现 — — 事实上就是接近绝对零度 （ - 273摄氏度 ） 。
Such temperatures can be achieved only through liquid-helium cooling. => 而这种温度只能通过液氦冷却来实现。

Thus, Swiss researchers caused excitement in 1986 by announcing the discovery of superconductivity in an oxide of copper at twice the temperature of the previous record holder. => 因此当瑞士研究人员在1986年宣布发现了一种可以在比前纪录保持者高一倍的温度下实现超导的铜氧化物时，全世界都为之一振。
Shortly thereafter, researchers in the United States found a related material that superconducts above the temperature at which air liquefies. => 不久之后美国研究人员也发现了一种可以在高于气体液化温度的情况下实现超导的相关物质。
As Time magazine proclaimed in May 1987, with the discovery of these so-called “cuprates,” the superconducting revolution had begun. => 正如《时代》杂志在1987年5月正式宣布的那样，随着这类名为“高温超导铜氧化物”的发现，我们已经迎来了超导的革命。
Alas, the revolution soon bogged down. => 无奈这场革命却很快陷入了低潮。
Cuprates are notoriously difficult materials to work with, because they are very brittle. => 这类铜化合物非常难以使用，因为它们极为易碎。
Although none of them superconduct at temperatures as high as liquid air, they may ultimately be better materials with which to work. => 虽然这些材料都未能在高于气体液化温度的情况下实现超导，但他们可能会最终成为可供应用的更佳材料。
Given the vast number of combinations of elements that can form compounds, there is a good chance that better superconductors await our discovery. => 考虑到不同元素间可以组合出成千上万种化合物，因此更好的超导材料很可能就在不远处。
In the coming years, superconductors are expected to play a growing role in technology. => 超导体预计将在未来科技中扮演日渐重要的角色。

Already, “second generation” cuprate wires are being used to make high-capacity cables for electric-power transmission, and lighter-weight generators for wind turbines. => “第二代”高位超导铜氧化物导线已经被用于制造利于电力传输的高能电缆以及风力涡轮的更轻量发电机。
Stronger superconducting magnets are leading to the development of MRIs with more sophisticated diagnostic capabilities. => 强超导磁体推动下的MRI技术发展使得医学诊断更加精确。

Superconductors are being used for levitated trains in high-speed rail transport, and as microwave filters for improved signal bandwidth in cellular base stations. => 超导体被运用于高速悬浮列车，还可以制成微波过滤器来提高蜂窝电信基站的信号带宽。
The discovery of a new superconductor with enhanced properties could lead to even greater technological innovation. => 一个拥有更优秀特性的新超导体的发现可能会带来更重大的技术革新。
This brings us to the intellectual challenge of superconductors. => 这是我们所面临的关于超导体智力挑战。
It took 46 years from the discovery of superconductivity to the 1957 Bardeen, Cooper, and Schrieffer (BCS) theory of how the phenomenon occurs. => 从发现超导现象到1957年巴丁-库珀-施里弗（BCS）关于该现象如何产生的理论发表足足用了46年。

Along the way, a number of famous physicists tried and failed to get the answer – Albert Einstein, Werner Heisenberg, and Richard Feynman being notable examples. => 沿着这条道路，一大批著名物理学家前赴后继地追寻这个答案 — — 爱因斯坦，沃纳·海森堡和理查德·费曼则是他们的杰出代表。
Discovering the solution required the development of advanced theoretical techniques. => 解开这个难题需要依靠先进理论工具的发展。
What had been difficult to figure out was how to get electrons to superconduct. => 其中较为困难的则是如何使电子显示超导性。
The basic discovery of BCS was that if the electrons pair up, those couples could indeed superconduct. => 巴丁-库珀-施里弗理论的基本发现则是如果电子能两两配对，那么这些电子对就能实现超导。
Fortunately, the mechanism for such coupling was known. => 幸运的是，这种配对的机制已经被发现了。
The suspicion, though, is that this is not the case in the new superconductors. => 但也有人认为这不会是新超导体的特性。

And, unlike BCS theory, in which the pairs are isotropic – with identical properties in all directions in space – the pairs in cuprates are strongly anisotropic, resembling a cloverleaf. => 跟巴丁-库珀-施里弗理论中电子对都是等方性的（即空间中所有方向都具有同样特性）不同的是，高温超导铜氧化物的电子对是强烈各向异性的，类似一个四面立体交叉的结构。
How can one pair electrons without ions holding them together, thereby enabling higher-temperature superconductors? => 如何能在缺少离子的情况下让电子对互相连结在一起，并以此实现高温超导体？

While ideas about this abound, new theoretical breakthroughs most likely will be needed to develop the machinery required to solve such electron-electron theories, perhaps even involving black holes. => 当关于这点的理论设想层出不穷之时，必须在解释这类电子-电子理论的体系（甚至包括黑洞）上取得新的理论突破。
Whatever the theory turns out to be, it is certain to revolutionize physics. => 但无论这一理论将如何发展，它都注定将催生物理学的革命。
Lies, Damned Lies, and AI => 谎言、该死的谎言和人工智能
CAMBRIDGE – Algorithms are as biased as the data they feed on. => 剑桥 — — 算法和算法所依赖的数据一样带有偏见。
And all data are biased. => 而且一切数据都是带有偏见的。
Even “official” statistics cannot be assumed to stand for objective, eternal “facts.” => 即使是“官方”统计数据也不能被认定代表客观永恒的“事实 ” 。

The figures that governments publish represent society as it is now, through the lens of what those assembling the data consider to be relevant and important. => 政府发布的数字代表着当前的社会状况，在那些搜集数据的人看来代表着重要性和相关性。
The categories and classifications used to make sense of the data are not neutral. => 被用于理解数据的范畴和分类并不是中立的。
Just as we measure what we see, so we tend to see only what we measure. => 就像我们只衡量我们所看到的那样，我们往往会对衡量范畴以外的东西视而不见。

As algorithmic decision-making spreads to a wider range of policymaking areas, it is shedding a harsh light on the social biases that once lurked in the shadows of the data we collect. => 就像算法决策扩散到更大范围的决策领域一样，它正在刺眼地暴露出曾经藏在我们搜集数据阴影中的社会偏见。

By taking existing structures and processes to their logical extremes, artificial intelligence (AI) is forcing us to confront the kind of society we have created. => 通过将现有结构和流程纳入其逻辑极值，人工智能（AI）正迫使我们正视我们所创造的社会。

The problem is not just that computers are designed to think like corporations, as my University of Cambridge colleague Jonnie Penn has argued. It is also that computers think like economists. => 问题不仅在于我在剑桥大学的同事詹妮·潘所提出的，设计计算机的初衷是让它像企业一样思考，而是计算机也在模仿经济学家的思考方式。
An AI, after all, is as infallible a version of homo economicus as one can imagine. => 毕竟，人工智能是人类想象范围内从不出错的经济人。

It is a rationally calculating, logically consistent, ends-oriented agent capable of achieving its desired outcomes with finite computational resources. => 它是一种能够合理计算、逻辑连贯并以目标为中心的代理，能够利用有限的计算资源实现其期望中的局面。
When it comes to “maximizing utility,” they are far more effective than any human. => 如果说到“效用最大化 ” ， 它们的有效性超过任何人。
“Utility” is to economics what “phlogiston” once was to chemistry. => “效用”之于经济学就像是曾几何时“燃素”之于化学一般。

Early chemists hypothesized that combustible matter contained a hidden element – phlogiston – that could explain why substances changed form when they burned. => 早期的化学家们假设可燃物质含有一种隐蔽元素 — — 也就是燃素 — — 这就可以解释物质为什么在燃烧时会发生形式改变。
Yet, try as they might, scientists never could confirm the hypothesis. => 但尽管竭尽全力，这一假设却永远无法被科学家们证实。
They could not track down phlogiston for the same reason that economists today cannot offer a measure of actual utility. => 化学家无法证明燃素的存在，同理今天的经济学家也无法测量实际效用。
Despite not existing, utility is a powerful construct. => 尽管并不存在，但效用却是一种强势结构。
It seems only natural to suppose that everyone is trying to do as well as they can for themselves. => 人们似乎自然而然地认为，每个人都在尽一切可能为自己的利益打算。

Moreover, economists’ notion of utility is born of classical utilitarianism, which aims to secure the greatest amount of good for the greatest number of people. => 此外，经济学家的实用概念源于古典功利主义，而为最多人获取最大的利益是古典功利主义的目标。

Like modern economists following in the footsteps of John Stuart Mill, most of those designing algorithms are utilitarians who believe that if a “good” is known, then it can be maximized. => 正如现代经济学家追随约翰·斯图尔特·密尔的脚步一样，绝大多数算法设计者都是功利主义者，他们相信如果知道有“好处 ” ， 那么就可以将好处最大化。
But this assumption can produce troubling outcomes. => 但这种假设可能造成的结果却会令人不安。
For example, consider how algorithms are being used to decide whether prisoners are deserving of parole. => 比如，假设使用算法来决定囚犯是否应当获得假释。

An important 2017 study finds that algorithms far outperform humans in predicting recidivism rates, and could be used to reduce the “jailing rate” by more than 40% “with no increase in crime rates.” => 2017年一项重要的研究发现，算法在预测累犯率方面的成效远远高于人类，并且可以用来将“监禁率”降低40%以上，同时“并不导致犯罪率的增加 ” 。
In the United States, then, AIs could be used to reduce a prison population that is disproportionately black. => 于是在美国，人工智能可以被用于改变黑人监禁人口不成比例的状况。
But what happens when AIs take over the parole process and African-Americans are still being jailed at a higher rate than whites? => 但如果由人工智能接管假释程序后，非洲裔美国人的监禁比例仍然高于白人该怎么办？
Highly efficient algorithmic decision-making has brought such questions to the fore, forcing us to decide precisely which outcomes should be maximized. => 高效的算法决策令这些问题脱颖而出，并迫使我们准确地决定究竟应当最大化哪些结果。
Do we want merely to reduce the overall prison population, or should we also be concerned about fairness? => 我们是单纯地想要减少总体监禁人口，还是也应当对公平给予恰当的关注？
Whereas politics allows for fudges and compromises to disguise such tradeoffs, computer code requires clarity. => 尽管政治可以允许回避和妥协来隐藏这种权衡，但计算机代码却必须清晰明了。
That demand for clarity is making it harder to ignore the structural sources of societal inequities. => 这种对清晰的要求使得人们对社会不公平的结构性来源更加难以忽视。

In the age of AI, algorithms will force us to recognize how the outcomes of past social and political conflicts have been perpetuated into the present through our use of data. => 在人工智能时代，算法将迫使我们清晰地认识过往社会和政治冲突的结果如何能够通过我们对数据的利用而延续到现在。
Thanks to groups such as the AI Ethics Initiative and the Partnership on AI, a broader debate about the ethics of AI has begun to emerge. => 多亏人工智能道德倡议和人工智能合作伙伴等团体，关于人工智能道德更广泛的讨论已经开始出现。
But AI algorithms are of course just doing what they are coded to do. => 但人工智能算法当然仅仅是按照编码来工作。

The real issue extends beyond the use of algorithmic decision-making in corporate and political governance, and strikes at the ethical foundations of our societies. => 真正的问题不仅仅限于企业和政治治理领域对算法决策的运用，同时也在抨击我们社会的道德基础。

While we certainly need to debate the practical and philosophical tradeoffs of maximizing “utility” through AI, we also need to engage in self-reflection. => 在我们当然要对通过人工智能实现效用“最大化”所需的实践和哲学权衡展开辩论的同时，我们也需要进行自我反思。
Algorithms are posing fundamental questions about how we have organized social, political, and economic relations to date. => 算法正在提出迄今为止我们如何组织社会、政治和经济关系的根本性问题。
We now must decide if we really want to encode current social arrangements into the decision-making structures of the future. => 我们现在必须决定，我们是否真的希望将现有的社会安排编入到未来的决策机制。
Given the political fracturing currently occurring around the world, this seems like a good moment to write a new script. => 鉴于目前世界各国正在发生的政治分裂，这似乎是开启全新篇章的最好时机。
A Better Global Framework to End AIDS => 一个更好的消灭艾滋病全球框架
STOCKHOLM, GENEVA – This week, we celebrate the tremendous progress that has been made in the struggle against HIV and AIDS. => 斯托克霍姆、日内瓦—本周，我们为对抗艾滋病方面所取得的进步而欢呼。
In many countries with strong health systems, HIV is no longer a death sentence, but a chronic condition. => 在许多具备强有力的卫生体系的国家，艾滋病早已不再等同于死刑，而只是一种慢性病。
And Africa has reached a critical milestone: each year, there are now more Africans starting HIV treatment than being infected. => 非洲也抵达了临界点：如今，每年开始治疗艾滋病的非洲人数量已经超过了被感染人数。
Still, even as we celebrate, we must also mourn the 1.1 million people who lost their lives to the disease this year. => 但是，在我们欢呼的同时，仍然要为今年因为艾滋病而丧生的110万人默哀。
HIV still infects 6,000 people every day, and AIDS remains a leading cause of death among children, adolescents, and women in Africa. => 每一天都有6,000人感染艾滋病毒，艾滋病也仍然是非洲儿童、青少年和妇女的主要死因之一。
The movement against AIDS has inspired all of us to help the people who continue to be left behind, and to commit to ending AIDS once and for all. => 打击艾滋病运动激发我们所有人帮助落后人群，并致力于一劳永逸地消灭艾滋病。
But funding parts of the global health system is not enough. => 但为全球卫生体系筹资是不够的。

The international community must take a more holistic view and reinforce a global-response architecture that features a clear division of labor and seamless cooperation among various stakeholders. => 国际社会必须采取更加全面的视角，加强全球响应安排，这一安排必须对各利益相关方做出明确的分工和紧密的合作。

Sweden is proud to continue its support for the Global Fund; at the replenishment conference in September, it pledged 2.5 billion krona ($271 million). => 瑞典为一直支持全球基金而感到骄傲；在9月的筹资会议上，瑞典承诺出资25亿克朗（2.71亿美元 ） 。

Providing the necessary support will require donors to coordinate with one another, so that all parts of the existing architecture for managing global health issues are adequately funded. => 提供必需的支持需要出资方彼此合作，以使全球卫生问题的当前安排的各个部分都能获得充足的资金。
This will then ensure that all countries – and, more importantly, all people – receive the support they need. => 这反过来将确保所有国家 — — 以及更重要的所有人民 — — 都能获得需要的支持。

UNAIDS is setting a powerful example for international collaboration, by organizing partners around a common 2016-2021 Strategy to end AIDS. => 联合国艾滋病规划署为国际合作树立了强有力的榜样，它组织各方为消灭艾滋病的2016-2021年战略的共同目标而努力。

This unique and innovative partnership brings together 11 co-sponsoring UN agencies, each with diverse sector-specific expertise, and mobilizes various government stakeholders. => 这一独特的创新合作安排集合了11家联合国机构共同出资，它们各自具备多样化的具体部门的专业经验，并动员各大全球利益相关方。

One of UNAIDS’ tasks is to encourage national governments to keep AIDS high on their public-health agendas, and to invest in joint efforts to end the disease. => 联合国艾滋病规划署的任务之一是鼓励国家政府将艾滋病列为公共卫生日程重点，并联手投资于消灭这种疾病。

It is also the only organization with a mandate to set norms and standards for the global response to AIDS, which means that it plays a key role in the current international framework. => 它是唯一一个拥有制定全球艾滋病应对措施规范与标准的权力的组织，这意味着它在目前的国际安排中起着关键性作用。
UNAIDS maintains a close partnership with the Global Fund. => 联合国艾滋病规划署与全球基金保持着紧密合作。

UNAIDS engages with civil society at all levels, by leveraging the international AIDS response to promote equality, dignity, and human rights around the world. => 通过利用国际艾滋病应对计划促进全世界的平等、尊严和人权，联合国艾滋病规划署与各个层面的公民社会进行合作。
As such, UNAIDS works to expand the political space for – and investment in – civil society. => 在这些合作中，联合国艾滋病规划署致力于为公民社会扩大政治空间和投资。
Sweden and UNAIDS will work together to ensure that the international AIDS response continues to transform – and save – lives. => 瑞典和联合国艾滋病规划署将携手致力于确保国际艾滋病应对措施能够继续改变 — — 并拯救 — — 生命。
We will safeguard and empower women and girls, and make sure that vulnerable populations’ voices are heard. => 我们将保护和赋权给妇女和女孩，确保脆弱人口的声音得到聆听。
But, at the same time, the international community must strengthen the existing framework for managing global-health issues. => 但是，与此同时，国际社会必须强化管理全球卫生问题的现有框架。

It is time for the international community to meet that challenge, by pledging to support our global health infrastructure, so that no agency – and no country or person – is left out. => ”国际社会应该直面这一挑战，承诺支持我们全球卫生基础设施，所有机构 — — 以及所有国家和个人 — — 都要参与进来。
AIDS, NCDs, and the ABCs of Organizing => 艾滋病、非传染性疾病和组织学的“ABC”

GENEVA – Non-communicable diseases (NCDs), like heart disease, stroke, cancer, diabetes, and chronic lung disease, are responsible for 70% of all deaths. => 日内瓦—非传染性疾病（NCD ） ， 如心脏病、中风、癌症、糖尿病和慢性肺病等，造成了全部死亡案例的70 % 。

There is incontrovertible evidence that tobacco use, inactivity, unhealthy diets, and excessive alcohol consumption increase the odds of dying prematurely from an NCD. => 无可反驳的证据证明，吸烟、不运动、不健康饮食和饮酒过度会增加因NCD而过早死亡的风险。
And yet, despite widespread knowledge of the risks, global obesity goes largely unchecked, while tobacco and alcohol use continue to rise. => 但尽管这些风险早已众所周知，全球肥胖率仍居高不下，而烟草和酒精消费量在不断增加。
It is against this backdrop that networks of NCD alliances met December 9-11 at the second Global NCD Alliance Forum, in the United Arab Emirates. => 在这一背景下，NCD联盟网络于12月9—11日在阿联酋召开了第二届全球非传染性疾病联盟论坛。
As they search for solutions to bring NCDs under control, they should look for inspiration to the movement to fight AIDS. => 在我们寻找控制NCD的方法的过程中，应该着眼于消灭艾滋病运动的经验。
People living with and affected by HIV continue to drive response efforts, and their unique form of mobilization has been instrumental to progress. => 携带艾滋病毒并受其影响的人不断地推动着响应措施，而他们独特的动员形式也有助于进步。
While the battle is not over, AIDS activists know that it can be won. => 尽管革命尚未成功，但艾滋病活跃分子知道胜利一定属于他们。
Similarly, a mobilized NCD movement can turn the tide against that epidemic. => 类似地，动员起来的NCD运动能够改变潮流。

Yet, in 2015, Richard Horton, the editor of The Lancet, described the NCD community as needing an “electric shock to its semi-comatose soul.” => 但是 ， 《 柳叶刀》杂志编辑理查德·霍顿（Richard Horton）在2015年将说NCD界需要“给你他们的半昏迷的灵魂来一次电击。
He added: “But who has the courage to deliver it?” => ”他还说 ， “ 但谁有兴趣来担当电击者？ ”
We believe there are lessons to be learned from AIDS activists. => 我们相信，艾滋病活动家的很多经验可以借鉴。

As global attention focuses on NCD prevention, those seeking to control preventable illnesses should look to the “ABCs” of AIDS organizing for guidance. => 随着NCD的防治获得全球关注，寻求控制可预防疾病的人应该借鉴艾滋病组织的“ABC ” 。
The first letter that the NCD community should consider is “A,” for activism. => NCD界需要考虑的第一点是A，即活动（activism ） 。
Anyone over 40 will recall images of AIDS activists performing “die-ins” at scientific meetings around the world. => 40岁以上的人都能想起艾滋病活跃分子在全球科学会议上的“装死示威 ” 。

In the United States, AIDS activists took to the streets, even shutting down the Food and Drug Administration’s headquarters for a day in October 1988. => 在美国，艾滋病活跃分子走上街头，甚至在1988年10月的某日令食品和药品监督局总部关门 。
Globally, activists lobbied governments and pharmaceutical companies to make medicines more affordable. => 全球而言，活跃分子游说政府和制药公司降低药品价格。
This activism continues, and should serve as a model for action on NCDs. => 这些活动还在继续，并理应成为NCD活动的榜样。
Next, the NCD community must adopt a bolder approach to budgets – the “B” of the AIDS movement’s strategy. => 其次，NCD界必须果断推进制定预算（budget ） ， 即艾滋病运动战略中的B。
Civic organizing and grassroots activism may fuel early energies, but organizing and sustaining a broad-based coalition takes money. => 公民组织和草根活动或许能够注入早期能量，但组织和维持广大联盟需要资金。
The AIDS movement was clear about this from the beginning, and lobbied for resources to support its advocacy and accountability effectively. => 艾滋病运动从一开始就非常明确这一点，并有效地游说资源以支持其主张和责任。
“C” is for coalitions: the AIDS movement was quick to understand that progress would come only with diverse support. => C则是联盟（coalition ） ： 艾滋病运动很快就认识到，只有获得了多样化的支持，才能取得进步。

Activists established links between people living with HIV and those with other concerns, such as women’s rights, intellectual property, nutrition, and housing. => 活跃分子建立起艾滋病携带者和其他问题关注者（如女权、知识产权、营养和住房等）之间的联系。

Issue-specific coalitions and campaigns work best when they bring together government insiders and outsiders, to combine perspectives and expertise. => 不同问题的联盟和运动，如果能够将政府内部人士和外部人士联合起来，形成观点和专业知识的合力，则能够起到最大的效果。
The AIDS movement also understood that a holistic response to the epidemic was essential. => 艾滋病运动还认识到，要让支持得到推广，对于这种传染病必须采取整体响应措施。
Thus, “D,” the underlying determinants of health, was to draw attention to the interconnectivity of the drivers of challenge. => 因此，D — — 成功的决定因素（determinant ） — —是要吸引对挑战的联动性的关注。

Similarly, links were forged between groups working on poverty, gender, and nutrition – factors that played a role in driving the AIDS crisis. => 类似地，致力于贫困、性别和营养问题 — — 这些都是助推艾滋病危机的因素 — — 的相关组织之间也形成了联系。
NCDs are no less isolated in their causality, and similarly require a multi-sector approach to prevention. => NCD的致病原因不是孤立的，同样也要求多管齐下的预防之道。
Engagement – “E” – was what helped the AIDS movement become so influential. => 参与（engagement ） — —E — — 给了艾滋病运动巨大的影响力。
For example, UNAIDS remains the only United Nations agency with seats on its board for representatives from civil society. => 比如，联合国艾滋病规划署仍然是唯一一个理事会中有来自公民社会代表的联合国机构。

This norm is so powerfully embedded in the AIDS movement that it would be almost unthinkable for an AIDS meeting to take place without representation from the community. => 这一范式被强力嵌入在艾滋病运动中，没有艾滋病携带者代表参与的艾滋病会议几乎是不可想象的。

Disease prevention movements must also develop persuasive narratives, and “F” – framing the issue – was essential to the AIDS community’s effort to gain support from political leaders. => 疾病预防运动还必须发展出有说服力的叙事，而F — — 界定（frame）问题 — — 是艾滋病界赢得政治领导人支持的关键。
In particular, access to AIDS treatment was framed as a matter of economic justice. => 特别是，获得艾滋病治疗被界定为一个经济正义的问题。

Framing the narrative this way led to a dramatic reduction in the price of medicines, so much so that more than half of people living with HIV in low- and middle-income countries are in treatment. => 如此界定叙事令药品价格大幅下降，让一大半中低收入国家的艾滋病携带者能够获得治疗。
An equally important framing issue for AIDS, which is highly relevant to the NCDs movement, is that of responsibility. => 一个对艾滋病 — — 对NCD运动也是如此 — — 同样重要的界定问题是责任。

The AIDS community worked hard to shift the focus from blaming individuals’ lifestyle choices to putting the onus on the state for providing health care and removing legal discrimination. => 艾滋病界努力让人们的关注焦点从谴责个人生活方式选择转移到要求国家担负提供医疗和消除法律歧视上。
In the AIDS debate, gender – our movement’s “G” – was a significant focal point. => 在艾滋病争论中，性别（gender ） — —即我们的运动中的G — — 是一个重要焦点。
HIV was initially seen as a “gay disease,” and gender identity was embedded in the DNA of the AIDS movement early on. => 艾滋病一开始被视为“同性恋病 ” ， 而性别身份从一开始就烙印在了艾滋病运动的DNA中。
Gender dimensions of NCDs are no less important; one only has to consider how alcohol and tobacco are marketed to understand that. => NCD的性别问题也同样重要；只要想想酒精和烟草的营销手段便可了解这一点。
Gender, therefore, must become a focus of NCDs prevention efforts. => 因此，性别应该成为NCD预防的重点。
Finally, “H” – human rights – was the bedrock of the AIDS response. => 最后，H — — 人权（human right ） — —是艾滋病响应机制的基石。
Campaigns were launched against discrimination in workplaces, schools, and health centers. => 艾滋病活跃分子发动了反对职场、校园和医院的歧视的运动。
Strategic litigation helped ensure equality under the law. => 策略性诉讼帮助确保了法律面前人人平等。
The AIDS movement refused to hold major conferences in countries with punitive laws against people living with HIV. => 艾滋病运动拒绝在对携带艾滋病毒的人实施惩罚性法律的国家召开大会。
The NCD movement could take a similar tack by, for example, refusing to meet in countries that fail to restrict advertising of junk food to children. => NCD运动也应该采取同样的策略，比如拒绝在不限制面向儿童的垃圾食品广告的国家召开大会。

The list of AIDS lessons could continue throughout the alphabet, but ending with “H” is apt, given that human rights drove the response, and should drive the response to NCDs. => 艾滋病运动的教训可以写全整个字母表，但在H结尾比较合适，因为人权推动了艾滋病响应机制，也应该推动NCD响应机制。
Poverty, exclusion, and social and economic marginalization put people at higher risk for HIV. => 贫困、排斥以及社会和经济边缘化让人们更容易感染艾滋病毒。
It is no different for NCDs. => NCD也是如此。
The early mainstream reaction to the AIDS epidemic was to ask, “Why don’t those people make better choices?” => 人们对艾滋病的早期主流反应是问“为什么那些人没有做出更好的选择？
The AIDS movement made clear that that was the wrong question. => ”艾滋病运动证明了这是一个错误的问题。
Today, with 70% of the planet at risk of premature death from preventable illnesses, “those people” are many of us. => 今天，70%的地球人面临因为可预防疾病而过早死亡的风险 ， “ 那些人”就是我们自己。
The NCD and AIDS communities can learn from one another. => NCD和艾滋病界可以互相学习。
We are a stronger movement when we join forces. => 当我们加入这股力量之中，就形成了一个更加强大的运动。
The views expressed here do not necessarily reflect those of UNAIDS. => 本文不代表联合国艾滋病规划署观点。
Aid Works => 援助是有用的
NEW YORK – The critics of foreign aid are wrong. => 纽约—对外部援助的批评是错误的。

A growing flood of data shows that death rates in many poor countries are falling sharply, and that aid-supported programs for health-care delivery have played a key role. => 越来越多的数据表明，很多国家贫困人口的死亡率在迅速下降，卫生援助项目居功至伟。
Aid works; it saves lives. => 援助是有用的，它能够拯救生命。
Let’s turn back the clock a dozen years. => 让我们从12年前开始。
In 2000, Africa was struggling with three major epidemics. => 2000年，非洲饱受三大传染病的肆虐。
AIDS was killing more than two million people each year, and spreading rapidly. => 艾滋病每年夺走200万以上生命，并在快速蔓延。
Malaria was surging, owing to the parasite’s growing resistance to the standard medicine at the time. => 由于寄生虫对传统药物的抗药性越来越强，疟疾出现了大爆发。
Tuberculosis was also soaring, partly as a result of the AIDS epidemic and partly because of the emergence of drug-resistant TB. => 结核病也在肆虐，一部分是由于艾滋病所致，一部分是因为具有抗药性的结核病的出现。

In addition, hundreds of thousands of women were dying in childbirth each year, because they had no access to safe deliveries in a clinic or hospital, or to emergency help when needed. => 此外，每年有数十万妇女在分娩时丧命，因为她们无法在安全的诊所和医院中生产，也得不到所需的紧急救援。
These interconnected crises prompted action. => 这些危机刺激了行动。
The United Nations’ member states adopted the Millennium Development Goals in September 2000. => 联合国各成员国在2000年9月通过了千年发展目标（MDG ） 。
Three of the eight MDGs – reductions in children’s deaths, maternal deaths, and epidemic diseases – focus directly on health. => 在MDG的八大目标中，有三个直接关注卫生状况，即减少儿童夭折、难产致死和传染病致死。
Likewise, the World Health Organization issued a major call to scale up development assistance for health. => 类似地，世界卫生组织也大力呼吁加大卫生发展援助力度。
And African leaders, led by Nigeria’s president at the time, Olusegun Obasanjo, took on the challenge of battling the continent’s epidemics. => 以时任尼日利亚总统奥巴桑乔为首的非洲领导人接受了与非洲大陆传染病作战的重任。
Nigeria hosted two landmark summits, on malaria in 2000 and on AIDS in 2001, which were a crucial spur to action. => 尼日利亚举办了两次标志性峰会，即2000年的疟疾峰会和2001年的艾滋病峰会，这两次峰会在促进采取行动方面居功至伟。

At the second of these summits, then-UN Secretary-General Kofi Annan called for the creation of the Global Fund to Fight AIDS, TB, and Malaria. => 在第二个峰会中，时任联合国秘书长安南呼吁建立全球抵抗艾滋病、结核病和疟疾基金（Global Fund to Fight AIDS, TB, and Malaria ） 。
The Global Fund began operations in 2002, financing prevention, treatment, and care programs for the three diseases. => 该全球基金于2002年开始运作，为这三种疾病的预防、治疗和看护提供融资。

High-income countries also finally agreed to reduce the debt owed by heavily indebted poor countries, allowing them to spend more on health care and less on crippling payments to creditors. => 高收入国家也最终形成协议，同意免去重债穷国的债务，减轻它们的还债负担，将更多的钱用于卫生项目。
The United States also took action, adopting two major programs, one to fight AIDS and the other to fight malaria. => 美国也采取了行动，出台了两大项目，一个针对艾滋病，另一个针对疟疾。
The UN General Assembly backed many of the project’s recommendations, which were then implemented in numerous low-income countries. => 联合国大会通过了该项目的多项建议，并开始在多个低收入国家实施。
Donor aid did start to rise sharply as a result of all of these efforts. => 在这些努力的推动下，捐赠援助的确出现了蓬勃发展。
In 1995, total aid for health care was around $7.9 billion. => 1995年，卫生援助总额约为79亿美元。
