This inadequate level then crept up slowly, to $10.5 billion by 2000. => 这一远远不够的援助水平缓慢地增加着，2000年上升到了105亿美元。

By 2005, however, annual aid for health had jumped another $5.9 billion, and by 2010, the total had grown by another $10.5 billion, to reach $26.9 billion for the year. => 但是，到了2005年，年度卫生援助大涨59亿美元，而到了2010年，援助总额在增加105亿美元，达到了269亿美元。

The expanded funding allowed major campaigns against AIDS, TB, and malaria; a major scaling up of safe childbirth; and increased vaccine coverage, including the near-eradication of polio. => 资金的充裕使得抵抗艾滋病、结核病和疟疾的项目得以启动、安全分娩得到了大普及，也增加了疫苗的覆盖面，小儿麻痹症基本上被消灭了。
Many innovative public-health techniques were developed and adopted. => 许多创新性卫生技术被开发出来并得到了使用。
The public-health successes can now be seen on many fronts. => 如今，公共卫生领域的诸多方面都可以看到进步。
Around 12 million children under five years old died in 1990. => 1990年，有1200万不到5岁的儿童夭折。
By 2010, this number had declined to around 7.6 million – still far too high, but definitely an historic improvement. => 到了2010年，该数字下降至760万左右 — — 依然很高，但毫无疑问是历史性的进步。
The MDGs for health could be achieved even in many of the world’s poorest countries. => 卫生相关MDG即使在世界最贫困国家也能够实现。
Unfortunately, at every step during the past decade – and still today – a chorus of aid skeptics has argued against the needed help. => 不幸的是，在过去十年所采取的每一个步骤中（现在也不例外 ） ， 总有一群援助怀疑者对必要的援助指手画脚。
Their attacks have been relentless (I’ve faced my share). => 他们的攻击是冷血的（包括对我的攻击 ） 。
The opponents of aid are not merely wrong. => 援助的反对者不仅仅是错误的。
A decade of significant progress in health outcomes has proved the skeptics wrong. => 十年来卫生成果的巨大进步已经证明，怀疑者是错的。
Aid for health care works – and works magnificently – to save and improve lives. => 卫生援助在拯救生命、改善生活方面是有用的，而且很有用。
Let us continue to support these life-saving programs, which uphold the dignity and well-being of all people on the planet. => 让我们继续支持这些生命挽救计划，提升所有地球人的尊严和福利。
The AIIB and Global Governance => 亚投行和全球治理

HONG KONG – Despite official American and Japanese opposition, 57 countries have opted to be among the founding members of the China-led Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank (AIIB). => 香港—尽管有美国和日本官方的反对，57个国家选择了成为中国发起的亚洲基础设施投资银行（亚投行）创始成员。
Regardless of what naysayers believe, this remarkable turn of events can only benefit global economic governance. => 不管对此持怀疑态度者的观点如何，这一令人瞩目的变局有利于改善全球经济治理。

According to former US Treasury Secretary Larry Summers, the AIIB’s establishment “may be remembered as the moment the United States lost its role as the underwriter of the global economic system.” => 美国财政前部长拉里·萨默斯（Larry Summers）指出，亚投行的成立“也许将以美国失去其全球经济体系担保人地位的时刻被人铭记。
Who is right will depend largely on the decisions that the AIIB’s top shareholders make regarding its operating structure. => 谁对谁错在很大程度上取决于亚投行大股东对其运营结构所做的决定。

So far, the AIIB has not sought to amend the principle that the largest contributor to a multilateral organization gets the largest say in running it. => 目前，亚投行并没有试图改变一条国际组织通行原则，即多边组织的最大贡献者获得最大的运营话语权。
Just as the US dominates the World Bank and Europe leads the International Monetary Fund, China will head the AIIB. => 正如美国主导世界银行、欧洲领导国际货币基金组织（IMF）一样，中国也将主导亚投行。
This implies a larger global leadership role for China – which the world, including its traditional powers, should welcome. => 这意味着中国会承担更多的全球领导作用。 全世界，包括其中的传统力量，应该欢迎这一变化。
After all, global leadership is not just a matter of might; it also reflects the provision of global public goods. => 毕竟，领导全球并不仅仅是实力问题，它也包括了为全球提供公共品服务。
But massive debts have lately undermined the ability of the US – not to mention Europe and Japan – to continue making such large contributions. => 但如今，巨大的债务制约了美国 — — 更不用说制约了欧洲和日本 — — 继续做出如此巨大的贡献的能力。
Fortunately, China is willing and able to fill the gap. => 幸运的是，中国愿意也有能力填补这个空白。

In fact, China might have done so within the Bretton Woods institutions, were the distribution of voting rights within them not skewed so heavily toward the incumbents, who still enjoy veto power. => 事实上，中国本可以在布雷顿森林机构内填补这一空白，但这些机构内部的投票权太过倾向于目前当权的发达国家，它们仍享有否决权。
For example, China has a 3.8% voting share in the IMF and World Bank, even though it accounts for more than 12% of world GDP. => 比如，中国在IMF和世界银行中的投票权比例只有3.8 % ， 尽管其占全球GDP比例已高达12%以上。
The United Kingdom and France – which are one-third the size of China – each have a 4.3% share. => 英国和法国 — — 经济规模只有中国的三分之一却都拥有4.2%的投票权。

With the incumbents unwilling to bring China’s voting share in line with its economic might, China had little choice but to launch its own institution. => 目前的发达国家当权者不愿意给予中国与其经济实力相称的投票权，中国别无选择，只能成立自己的机构。
But the AIIB has its own objectives, which do not align precisely with those of, say, the World Bank. => 但亚投行有其自身的、与世界银行等不完全一致的目标。

While the US “pivots” to the east, China is pirouetting west, applying the lessons of its development to its trading partners across Eurasia and beyond. => 在美国向东“转”的同时，中国正在向西迈进，将它的发展经验传播给欧亚地区及之外的贸易伙伴。
Perhaps the most important of these lessons is that connectivity is vital to economic growth. => 也许这些经验中最重要的便是连通性（connectivity）对经济增长的关键作用。

According to estimates by HSBC, the “one belt, one road” initiative could end up costing as much as $232 billion – just under two-thirds of the World Bank’s balance sheet in 2014. => 根据汇丰银行的估算 ， “ 一带一路”工程最终可能耗资2,320亿美元 — — 几乎相当于2014年世界银行资产负债表规模的三分之二。
The $100 billion AIIB will play a central role in this effort. => 资本金预计达到1,000亿美元的亚投行将在其中扮演核心角色。
Nonetheless, it will compete with them, owing to its distinctive – and probably more efficient – approach to lending. => 尽管如���，亚投行将与其他机构展开竞争，因为它的贷款方针不同，也许效率更高。

In the late 1980s, the World Bank began to implement the Washington Consensus, pushing for economic and political liberalization, without sufficient regard for local political or economic realities. => 20世纪80年代末，世界银行开始实施华盛顿共识，追求经济和政治自由化而不再充分考虑地方政治或经济现实。
The acid test of the AIIB’s effectiveness will be its governance model. => 亚投行成效的严峻考验将是其治理模式。

The World Bank has wasted far too much time re-organizing itself under various presidents, without recognizing the fundamental problem with its own governance structure. => 世界银行浪费了太多时间不断由新任行长展开对自身的行政重组，而没有认识到其治理结构的根本性问题。

Even if the AIIB does not deliver as promised, its establishment is an important reminder that in a fast-changing world, economic governance cannot remain stagnant. => 即使亚投行没有给出其承诺的结果，其成立也可以作为一个重要的提醒，让我们知道，在快速变化的世界中，经济治理不能停滞不前。
If Western leaders really do believe in innovation, competition, and meritocracy, they should welcome the AIIB. => 如果西方领导人真的相信创新、竞争和英才治国，他们就应该欢迎亚投行。
AIPAC in Decline => 美以公共事务委员会的衰落
MADRID – The American Israel Public Affairs Committee’s lobbying power in the United States is undeniable. => 马德里 — — 在美国，美以公共事务委员会的游说力量不可否认。
But AIPAC’s supposed ability to control US policy decisions is a Potemkin village myth, cultivated by friends and rivals alike. => 但该委员会对美国决策所谓的控制力其实不过是盟友和对手共同制造的虚假神话。
In fact, thanks to Israeli Prime Minister Binyamin Netanyahu, AIPAC’s influence is under threat – though Netanyahu himself will be just fine. => 事实上，虽然以色列总理内塔尼亚胡本人毫发无损，但他的所作所为却对委员会的影响力构成了威胁。
Claims about AIPAC’s clout have long shaped analysis of US foreign policy. => 美以公共事务委员会影响力之说一直对美国外交政策分析产生影响。
For example, Steve Walt and John Mearsheimer, in their notorious essay “The Israel Lobby,” asserted that AIPAC manufactured the Iraq War. => 比方说，沃尔特·史蒂夫和约翰·米尔斯海默在其臭名昭著的论文“以色列游说势力”中断言该委员会是伊拉克战争的始作俑者。
The truth about AIPAC – that it is influential, but far from invulnerable – has recently been revealed, both to the public and to the group itself. => 最近发生的事情令公众和委员会自身看清了其影响力不凡但远非无懈可击的本来面目。

Having been pushed by Netanyahu into an unwinnable fight against US President Barack Obama’s administration over its nuclear deal with Iran, AIPAC is now crumbling under the weight of its own hubris. => 因为被内塔尼亚胡推入到一场反对奥巴马政府与伊朗达成核协议的不可能打赢的战争，美以公共事务委员会现在在狂妄自大的重压下摇摇欲坠。
In fact, AIPAC has never overcome resolute opposition from an American president, particularly in a matter of US national security. => 事实上，尤其当事关国家安全时，美以委员会从未战胜过美国总统的坚决反对。

It failed to stop Jimmy Carter from selling F-15 Eagle fighters to Saudi Arabia in 1978, or to prevent Ronald Reagan from supplying AWACS reconnaissance planes to the Saudis three years later. => 它未能阻止卡特1978年向沙特出售F-15鹰式战斗机，也未能阻止三年后里根将预警侦察机出售给沙特。
Indeed, Obama even used a tactic similar to that of George H.W. Bush to win the day. => 事实上，奥巴马甚至采用了与乔治·H·W·布什同样的致胜战术。
He also put AIPAC in the same category as the Republicans who “were responsible” for leading the US into the Iraq war. => 他还将委员会和共和党人划归一类，指责其应对将美国拖入伊拉克战争负责。
Of course, the nuclear deal involved more than just the US and Iran. => 当然，核协议所涉及的不仅是美国和伊朗。
Yet that is the objective that Netanyahu set for AIPAC. => 但这就是内塔尼亚胡为委员会设定的目标。
The row over the Iran deal is bound to be a watershed moment for American Jews, among whom sharp divisions have formed. => 伊朗协议所引发的分歧注定会成为分裂美国犹太群体的标志性时刻。
AIPAC represents a striking anomaly in the life of American Jews. => 委员会代表美国犹太人生活中突出的反常现象。

It is increasingly identified with the Republican agenda and Israel’s evangelical Christian supporters, even though polls have repeatedly shown that Jews are America’s most liberal ethnic group. => 尽管民意调查一再显示犹太人是美国最自由的族群，但委员会却越来越贴近共和党议程和以色列福音派基督教支持者。
The truth is that American Jews largely opposed the Iraq war. => 事实是美国犹太人大多反对伊拉克战争。
They overwhelmingly vote for the Democratic Party. => 他们压倒性地投票支持民主党。
They define their religion as moderate and liberal, with many upholding gay rights and abortion, both anathema to evangelical Christians. => 他们将自身宗教定位为温和自由，不少人崇尚同性恋权利和人工流产，这两者在福音派基督教看来都是一种诅咒。
The majority of American Jews even support the creation of a Palestinian state. => 大多数美国犹太人甚至支持建立一个巴勒斯坦国。
And, although they are far from united on the Iran deal, the agreement’s supporters outnumber its opponents. => 而且虽然他们对伊朗协议的看法远谈不上一致，但支持协议的人明显多于反对者。
Much of the blame for the damage that has been done – to AIPAC, American Jewish communities, and even the US political process – falls on Netanyahu. => 内塔尼亚胡应该对委员会、美国犹太群体甚至美国政治进程所遭受的损失负责。
But he is unlikely to face retribution for any of it. => 但他不太可能遭到任何报复。
On the contrary, the Obama administration has already begun the discussions it promised on upgrading Israel’s strategic capabilities. => 相反，奥巴马政府已经开始探讨履行其提升以色列战略实力的承诺。

As Arab countries throughout the Middle East melt down – with increasingly significant spillover effects in the West – Israel continues to represent a stable regional partner for the US. => 在中东阿拉伯国家相继崩溃对西方影响越来越显著的情况下 — — 以色列将继续扮演美国稳定合伙人的角色。

More dangerous, Netanyahu could achieve his next goal: preventing a strategic détente between the US and Iran that would enable cooperation in resolving major regional conflicts, from Yemen to Syria. => 更危险的是，内塔尼亚胡可能会实现他的下一个目标：阻止美国和伊朗缓和战略关系 及解决从也门到叙利亚的主要地区冲突。
After all, Obama’s victory on the nuclear deal may have been inevitable, but it was far from easy. => 毕竟，奥巴马在核协议问题上的胜利或许不可避免，但却绝非垂手可得。
As a result, America’s cold war with Iran is likely to persist. => 结果是美国与伊朗的冷战可能无法结束。
The Dawn of Climate-Friendly Air Travel => 气候友好型航空旅行的黎明

MONTREAL – As the world becomes increasingly interconnected, demand for air travel is growing, with more than 30,000 new large aircraft expected to take to the skies in the next few years. => 蒙特利尔—随着世界日益互通，航空旅行需求也在增长，未来几年预计将有超过30,000架新的大飞机上天。
Fortunately, now is the perfect time to decouple aviation emissions from air-travel growth. => 幸运的是，现在是让航空排放与航空旅行增长脱钩的理想时机。
When implemented, it will be the first carbon-emissions cap on a global industry that does not noticeably increase costs for consumers. => 该措施实施后将是第一项不给消费者带来成本显著上升的全球行业排放上限。
And airlines will purchase emissions reductions from other economic sectors, thus funneling billions of dollars into low-carbon development around the world. => 航空公司将从其他经济部门购买减排量，从而引导数十亿美元用于全球低碳发展。

Some 64 countries have already signaled their willingness to sign on to the ICAO agreement, and together they account for nearly 80% of expected growth in CO2 emissions above 2020 levels. => 有64个国家已经表示愿意在ICAO协定上签字，它们加起来占二氧化碳排放量预期增长超过2020部分的近80 % 。

That isn’t 100%, but it’s a great start, and we can expect more countries to join when they see others reaping the benefits of low-carbon development. => 100%固然没有达到，但这是个良好的开端，我们期待更多的国家在看到其他国家收获低碳发展的益处后也能加入。

However, the framework decided in Montreal is not complete, and crucial details need to be worked out quickly so that airlines can begin to plan how they will meet the new environmental targets. => 但是，在蒙特利尔所确定的框架并不完整，必须加快制定关键细节，以使航空公司能够开始着手规划如何实现新环境目标。

Developed countries have already offered to help implement the GMBM, which, it is hoped, will pave the way for investments in emerging economies that are becoming new aviation powerhouses. => 发达国家已经提出了帮助实施GMBM的方案，希望可以扫清投资于正日益成为新航空大国的新兴经济体的道路。
If the countries can leapfrog over old technologies, they can become new leaders in carbon-smart flying. => 如果可以跨越旧技术，就能成为碳职能（carbon-smart）飞行的新领导者。
They should seize the opportunity before them and join the ICAO framework so that their manufacturers have a clear and predictable path forward. => 它们应该抓住眼前的机会，加入ICAO框架以使其生产商得到明确可预测的前进方向。
At the Paris climate talks last year, we witnessed the power of global collective action to address climate change. => 在去年的巴黎气候谈判上，我们看到了全球合作解决气候变化问题的力量。

With the Paris climate agreement on track to enter into force in the coming months – more rapidly than anyone ever thought possible – we still have that momentum. => 随着巴黎气候协定距离几个月后生效越走越近 — — 比任何人所预想的都要快 — — 我们仍保持着这一势头。
The ICAO agreement is the next wave in the international battle against climate change. => ICAO协定是对抗气候变化的国际战争的新一波浪潮。
Together, the two agreements will boost our chances of delivering environmentally sustainable economic growth. => 这两个协定加起来将增加我们实现环境可持续经济增长的机会。

By cleaning up our carbon footprint now, future generations of air travelers from all countries will be able to look out their window onto a healthy planet. => 通过从现在开始明确我们的碳足迹，未来航空旅行者不管来自哪个国家，都能够从舷窗看到健康的地球。
Europe’s Airpocalypse => 欧洲空气启示录
SINGAPORE – European policymakers like to lecture the rest of the world on air pollution. => 新加坡—欧洲决策者喜欢给世界其他地区上空气污染课。
Asia, and China in particular, is a favorite target for criticism. => 亚洲，特别是中国是他们最喜欢的目标。
When it comes to air pollution, however, Europe might consider doing less talking and more listening. => 但是，在空气污染问题上，欧洲还是少说多听为妙。
Air pollution is a growing concern across Europe. => 空气污染正在日益成为全欧洲关注的问题。

In 2010, some 600,000 European citizens died prematurely because of outdoor and indoor air pollution, and the economic costs have been put at $1.6 trillion, roughly 9% of the European Union’s GDP. => 2010年，大约600,000欧洲公民因为室外和室内空气污染而过早死亡，而经济成本更是高达1.6万亿美元，相当于欧盟GDP的9%左右。
London and Paris suffer from particularly severe air-quality problems. => 伦敦和巴黎因为严重的空气质量问题而损失惨重。
Nitrogen dioxide levels in some parts of London regularly reach 2-3 times the recommended limit. => 伦敦某些地方的二氧化氮水平有时高达建议上限的2—3倍。
In the United Kingdom, air pollution kills some 29,000 people a year, putting it second only to smoking as a cause of premature death. => 在英国，空气污染k每年要杀死29,000人左右，是仅次于吸烟的第二大过早死亡原因。

Paris may be even worse off; in March, after air-pollution levels surpassed Shanghai’s, the city imposed a partial driving ban and introduced free public transportation. => 巴黎的情况比伦敦还要糟糕；3月，巴黎空气污染水平超过上海，不得不实施局部限行并推出免费公交。
Sadly, Europe’s policymakers do not seem up to the challenge. => 悲哀的是，欧洲决策者似乎并未直面挑战。
George Osborne, the UK’s chancellor of the exchequer, has argued against British leadership in the fight against climate change. => 英国财政大臣乔治·奥斯本（George Osborne）反对英国在对抗气候变化中其领导作用。
“We are not going to save the planet by shutting down our steel mills, aluminum smelters, and paper manufacturers,” he declared in 2011. => “我们不会为了拯救地球而关掉我们的轧钢厂、炼铝厂和造纸厂 ， ” 他在2011年说道。
Osborne is not alone. => 奥斯本不是一个人。
The EU’s proposed standards regulating toxic emissions from coal plants are even less strict than China’s, Greenpeace reports. => 据绿色和平组织报告欧盟计划采取的限制火电厂有害气体排放的标准甚至还没有中国严格。
Yet various European politicians have called for watering them down even further, with Hungary suggesting that they be scrapped altogether. => 但许多欧洲政客还要求进一步降低标准，匈牙利认为应该完全放弃监管。
To be sure, air pollution levels in Asia are truly worrisome. => 平心而论，亚洲空气污染水平确实值得担忧。
The continent is home to nine of the world’s ten most polluted countries, according to Yale University’s 2014 Air Quality Ranking. => 根据2014年耶鲁大学空气质量排名，世界十大污染最严重国家中有九个位于亚洲。
New Delhi is ranked as the most polluted city on earth, with air pollution exceeding safe levels by a factor of 60. => 新德里位列地球城市污染程度榜第一名，空气污染超过安全水平60倍。
Owing to Beijing’s unhealthy air, foreign companies pay a “hardship bonus” of up to 30% to employees working there. => 由于北京的空气危害健康，外国公司必须向驻北京员工支付高达30%的“困难费 ” 。
But at least policymakers in Asia have recognized the problem and are taking steps to address it. => 但至少亚洲决策者认识到了这一问题，并在采取行动解决它。
China, for example, has declared a “war on pollution.” => 比如，中国宣布要打一场“污染之仗 ” 。
By 2017, Beijing – once dubbed “Greyjing” by the international media – will spend some CN¥760 billion ($121 billion) to combat air pollution. => 到2017年，曾经被国际媒体戏称为“霾都”的北京将斥资7,600亿元人民币治理空气污染。
At the heart of China’s measures are improved public transportation, green trade, and a revision of the energy mix. => 中国的措施的核心是改进公共交通、绿色贸易和改变能源结构。
The share of non-fossil fuels in primary energy consumption is expected to increase to 20% by 2030. => 非化石燃料占初级燃料消费量的比重到2030年将上升到20 % 。
These targets are likely to be rigorously implemented, given strong political support from the very top. => 这些目标有可能得到严格实施，因为它们得到了最高层的强力政治支持。

Meanwhile, in India, the state governments in Gujarat, Maharashtra, and Tamil Nadu are about to launch the world’s first cap-and-trade schemes for particulates. => 与此同时，载运毒，古吉拉特、马哈拉施特拉和泰米尔纳德等邦准备实施世界上首个微粒配额和交易机制。
India’s Supreme Court even suggested an extra charge on privately owned diesel vehicles in New Delhi. => 印度最高法院甚至建议对新德里私家柴油机动车征收附加费。
Other parts of Asia are also taking steps to improve air quality. => 其他亚洲国家也在采取措施改善空气质量。
Vietnam aims to construct eight urban rail lines in the coming years. => 越南目标在未来几年中建设八条城市轨道交通线。
Bangkok, which has been tackling air pollution since the 1990s, has planted 400,000 trees. => 曼谷从20世纪90年代便开始治理空气污染，种植了400,000株树木。
And Japan is offering subsidies for hydrogen cars and creating new pedestrian-only areas. => 日本也采取了氢燃料汽车补贴，开辟新的步行区域。
Europe, as one of the world’s wealthiest regions, ought to be at the forefront of the effort to promote environmental sustainability. => 作为世界最富有地区之一的欧洲理应站在促进环境可持续性的最前沿。
When it comes to air pollution, however, Europe’s policymakers should stop preaching to others and focus on fixing their own problems. => 但是，在空气污染问题上，欧洲决策者应该停止好为人师，专注于解决自身问题。
A Japanese Metamorphosis? => 日本的转型？
For most of the last decade, the DPJ was not seen as a viable alternative to the LDP, although they appeared to form a pseudo-two-party system. => 过去10年来，尽管伪两党体系已经初见规模，但民主党一直被看作自民党可能的替代党派。
Twenty years after the Cold War’s end, Japan will at last have a post-Cold War system of government. => 冷战结束20年后，日本终于即将建立起后冷战时期的政府体系。

The Japanese public, even now, remains uncertain about the DPJ’s ability to govern and is skeptical of its rosy programs of wealth redistribution, which lack solid funding. => 即便现在，日本公众仍然对民主党的执政能力和缺乏资金支持的财富再分配的诱人计划持怀疑态度。
The public is also fully aware that the ideologically fragmented DPJ lacks a pragmatic, coherent foreign and security policy => 公众也非常清楚在意识形态上壁垒分明的民主党不具备现实、连贯的外交和安全政策。
Yet the DPJ will form the next government because of public disgust with the LDP. => 但公众对于自民党的厌恶情绪却使民主党登上了下届政府宝座。

For the last four years, the LDP had shown itself to be utterly unresponsive to the key issues of popular concern: pensions, unemployment, and the fraying social safety net. => 四年来，自民党彻底无视公众所关注的养老金、失业和社会安全网损坏等关键性问题。
Moreover, the LDP was plagued by a string of minor scandals and consistent bungling. => 此外，自民党还受到一系列丑闻的困扰，并一如既往地表现出拙劣的执政能力。
The LDP’s need for three different prime ministers in the space of little more than a year made plain that the party’s power nucleus had melted down. => 自民党在短短一年多的时间里更换三名首相充分说明该党的权力核心已经解体。
Indeed, immediately after the election, the budget estimates for the next fiscal year are due. => 实际上，这次选举刚刚结束，下一年度的财政预算案就必须提交。
The figures that will be presented are the result of a lengthy process, in which the bureaucracy closely consulted with LDP. => 提交的预算数字需要经过繁琐的程序，在此期间需要官僚体系与自民党密切配合。
But time is short, and few of new DPJ lawmakers possess the legislative experience and budgetary expertise to make that happen. => 但时间太过短暂，并且没有多少民主党立法人员掌握达到目标所需的立法经验和预算知识。

Unfortunately, the DPJ scrapped an LDP-sponsored civil-service reform bill, which would have allowed the DPJ to replace mandarins with an army of political appointees. => 令人遗憾的是，民主党否决了一项由自民党提出的公务员改革法案，这项法案本可以允许民主党用政治特派员取代官僚家族。
The DPJ, despite its manifesto, seems unprepared to tame the mandarins, and so may be forced to rely on them. => 尽管表面上态度坚决，但民主党似乎还没有准备好驯服各级官僚，因此可能最终不得不接受以他们为依托。
The ascendency of the mandarins is a legacy of Japan’s unique historical development dating back to its early modern period. => 官僚家族的优越地位可以追溯到日本现代化早期独特的历史发展道路。
Unlike in Europe, Japan developed its state before building a strong civil society. => 和欧洲不同的是，日本在强大的公民社会形成之前就已经建立了国家。

Indeed, full-fledged “society”-building started only after the 1868 Meiji Restoration, which tipped the balance of power definitively in favor of the state. => 实际上，全方位的“社会”建设在1868年明治维新之后才真正开始，从而导致权力的天平彻底地向国家方向倾斜。

As a result, the mandarins survived WWII and the postwar American occupation relatively undamaged, and they will strive to survive the DPJ government as well. => 官僚家族因此相对完好地度过了二战和战后的美国占领，此次他们同样也能安然度过民主党政府的任期。
They will most likely succeed. => 他们很有可能再次成功逃脱。

Since the LDP, recently with a coalition partner, controlled the Diet, the legislative process was simply the interaction between LDP lawmakers and mandarins, centered in the LDP’s headquarters. => 自从自民党不久前与联盟伙伴共同控制议会以后，立法过程就成了以自民党总部为核心的自民党立法人士和官僚家族之间的互动。
The Diet’s role was merely pro forma. => 议会不过起到了形式上的作用。
Indeed, under the LDP-led one-party-dominant system, this extra-constitutional mechanism became an integral part of Japan’s government polity. => 实际上，在自民党领导的一党专政制度下，上述宪法外机制已经成为日本政府政体不可分割的组成部分。
The DPJ government will collide head-on with the mandarins, partly because the party will find it hard to recruit sufficiently qualified policymakers. => 民主党政府将直接与官僚体系发生碰撞，部分原因是民主党难以招募到足够数量的合格决策者。

Moreover, perhaps in anticipation of a change in power, the mandarins have moved forward the annual personnel changes in the major ministries’ top administrative positions. => 此外，或许是预见到了权力的变化，官僚家族已经推动了主要部委高层行政职务的年度人员更替过程。
And what of the LDP? => 那么自民党的境况又将如何？
Having fallen from power, it will lose its control of the redistribution of government funds. => 失去权力后，它将无法控制政府资金再分配。
Only by recruiting new blood and reorganizing itself with a solid ideological platform will an LDP comeback be possible. => 只有通过吸收新鲜血液和重建牢固的意识形态，自民党才有可能重新执政。
The birth of the DPJ government can yet be a turning point. => 民主党政府的诞生仍然可以是一次转折。
A major power shift in favor of “society” has taken place. => 一次有利于“社会”的权力转型已经发生。
A Jobless Recovery? => 失业问题困扰下的复苏？
CAMBRIDGE – Who will suffer the longest and the most from the implosion in 2008-2009 of Wall Street and the ensuing world recession? => 剑桥 — — 2008至2009年华尔街风暴和紧接着的全球衰退中，谁会受到最长期、最猛烈的打击？
Not the bankers and financiers who created the disaster. => 不是造成这场灾难的银行家和金融家。
Some financiers, like Bernard Madoff, will go to prison for fraud. => 某些金融家会因欺诈入狱，例如伯纳德·麦道夫。
The big losers from this economic disaster are workers in the advanced countries that bought into the laissez-faire flexibility of American-style capitalism. => 这场经济灾难的大输家是那些认同美式资本主义放任自流政策的发达国家的工人。
From 2007 to October 2009, the United States lost nearly eight million jobs, which reduced the employment-population ratio from 63% to 58.5%. => 从2007年到2009年10月，美国失去了近800万个工作岗位，就业人口率从63%下降到58.5 % 。
Advanced Europe, Canada, and Japan also suffered major job losses that will last for a long time. => 欧洲的发达国家、加拿大和日本也遭受了严重的失业问题，并且会持续相当长的时间。

Spain, which allows for widespread temporary contracts, has had the biggest increase in unemployment, because Spanish workers can be fired as quickly as those in the US. => 允许临时合同广泛存在的西班牙失业率增幅最大，因为西班牙的工人被炒鱿鱼的速度堪比美国工人。

Some countries – for example, Germany, Sweden, and South Korea – have “hidden” their joblessness by paying firms to keep workers on the payroll. => 某些国家 — — 例如德国、瑞典和韩国 — — 付钱给公司，让他们留住正式职员，从而“隐藏”了失业问题。
This can work in the short term, but it cannot be sustained over time. => 这种做法在短期内可能有效，但不能长期维持。
From the 1980’s through the mid-2000’s, employment has increasingly lagged GDP in economic recoveries. => 从上世纪80年代，一直到21世纪第一个十年中叶，就业率的恢复越来越落后于GDP。
Sixteen years after the crisis, the unemployment rate was 6.2% – more than triple the rate in 1990. => 这场危机过后16年，失业率达到6.2 % — —是1990年的三倍还多。
Employment recovered, but primarily in “non-regular” jobs with limited benefits, low wages, and little job security. => 就业率恢复了，但主要是靠福利有限、低工资、且几乎没有就业保障的“非正式”工作。
Inequality in Korea rose from moderate levels to second highest (behind the US) among advanced OECD countries. => 韩国的贫富差距从中等水平跃升至经合组织发达国家中的第二高（仅次于美国 ） 。
Weakness in the job market takes a huge toll on economic and personal well-being. => 就业市场的虚弱对经济的健康和个人的幸福造成了巨大损害。

Young people seeking their first jobs and experienced workers who lose jobs in a weak job market suffer economic losses that will last their entire lives. => 在虚弱的就业市场上寻找第一份工作的年轻人和工作经验丰富的失业者受到的经济损失将影响他们的一生。
Studies of happiness show that unemployment reduces happiness by as much as the loss of a family member. => 幸福指数的研究表明，失业对幸福感的打击不亚于失去一名至亲。
It is difficult to see the US re-attaining full employment anytime soon. => 美国很难在不久的将来重新实现充分就业。
From 1993 to 1998, the US created millions of jobs, which raised the employment rate by 5.4 percentage points. => 从1993年到1998年，美国创造了数百万的工作岗位，就业率上升了5.4个百分点。
If employment began rising at this rate in 2010, it would take until 2015 before it reached its pre-recession level. => 如果就业率在2010年开始以这个速度上升，要到2015年才能重新达到衰退前的水平。
And slow recovery in the US will drag down recovery in other advanced countries, reducing their employment as well. => 美国经济的缓慢复苏将会拖累其他发达国家，降低他们的就业率。
A long, painful period of high unemployment runs counter to what most experts believed the flexible US economic model would ever produce. => 漫长而痛苦的高失业率与大多数专家心目中以为灵活的美国经济模式会带来的后果背道而驰。
Many OECD countries initiated various kinds of flexibility reforms in the hope of improving their economies along US lines. => 许多经合组织国家启动了各种各样的灵活化改革，希望按照美国的模式改善自己的经济。
The view that flexibility is the key factor in employment is no longer tenable. => 将灵活性视为保障就业关键因素的观点再也站不住脚了。

In its 2009 Employment Outlook , the OECD took a hard look at its favored policy reforms and found them deficient in helping countries adjust to a finance-driven recession. => 经合组织在2009年《就业展望》中仔细审视了他们偏爱的政策改革，结果发现这些改革不足以帮助各国适应金融业引起的衰退。
So the lesson from the recession is clear. => 经济衰退给我们的教训已经显而易见。
The weak reed in capitalism is not the labor market, but the financial market. => 资本主义的弱点不在于劳动力市场，而在于金融市场。
Moreover, globalization means that the US capital market’s failure spreads misery around the world. => 而且，全球化意味着美国的资本市场衰退会在全球范围内造成极大影响。

We owe it to workers victimized by this recession to reinvent finance so that it works to enrich the real economy, instead of enriching only the financiers. => 我们亏欠因这场衰退而受到伤害的工人，有必要彻底改造金融制度，使之推动真正的经济发展，而不是仅让金融家中饱私囊。
This means changing the incentives and rules that govern the financial sector. => 这意味着改变金融部门的激励制度和规则。
Since other countries’ economies and jobs are also at stake, they owe it to their citizens to press the US to deliver meaningful financial reforms. => 其他国家的经济和工作岗位同样危如累卵，因此他们为了各自的公民也必须敦促美国进行有意义的金融改革。
France’s Midsummer Night’s Dream => 法国的仲夏夜之梦
PARIS – Bastille Day, the French national holiday, was glorious this year. => 巴黎—巴士底日是法国的国定假日。 今年，这个日子无比光荣。

The military parade, dominated by the celebration of “victory” in Mali and the joint participation of African and United Nations troops, had the perfection of a gracious, albeit muscular, ballet. => 以庆祝马里“胜利”和非洲和联合国军队联合参与为主题的军事游行堪称优美的芭蕾表演 — — 尽管这是肌肉版芭蕾。

The classical concert that preceded the magisterial fireworks that ended the day was the closest thing to a French version of the Proms in London, mixing light classical and popular songs. => 那一天的压轴表演是古典音乐会及随后的庄严的火花。 音乐会堪称法国版伦敦逍遥音乐会（Proms in London ） ， 结合了轻古典乐和流行歌曲。
The Eiffel Tower imbued the evening with its magic. => 埃菲尔铁塔用它的魔力照耀着这个夜晚。
Paris, in case anyone had any lingering doubts, remains the capital of the world – or so it seemed for a night. => 不管你是谁，心存何疑虑，在那个晚上，巴黎仍是世界之都。
The melancholia that began to seize France many years ago was all but forgotten. => 缠上法国多年的压抑被忘得一干二净。
The celebration of the glory of the past, mixed with popular English songs of the present, seemed to indicate renewed national confidence. => 对昔日荣光的庆祝，伴随着英语流行歌曲和表演，似乎在彰显重生的民族自信。
What was the meaning of this moment of grace? => 这一优美时刻有着什么意义？
Even if the positive emotions remain only fleeting (as seems most likely), they were real and palpable. => 即使积极情绪最终只会消失殆尽（这是最有可能的情形 ） ， 它们也是真实而容易捕捉的。
The French seemed to be in the mood to celebrate. => 法国人沉浸在喜庆之中。
Of course, it could simply have been the weather; a gorgeous summer has finally settled in after a miserable spring. => 当然，也许原因仅仅是天气 — — 在经历了痛苦的春天后，灿烂的夏天终于到来。
But it might also have been one of those natural turning points, a collective and spontaneous decision to say: “Enough of depression, let’s move on.” => 但这或许也是自然转折点之一，是集体性的同时决定 ： “ 受够了压抑，让我们前进吧。
We French may not be what we used to be, the celebrants seemed to be saying, but we are still much more than people think we are. => ”庆祝者似乎在说，法国人或许已不再是昔日的法国人，但我们仍比人们所认为的更好。

We have a great revolutionary past that still conveys universal values – liberty, equality, fraternity – and an army that, as in Mali, continues to make a difference in the world. => 我们有伟大的革命的过去，这一过去仍在传达普世价值 — — 自由、平等、博爱；我们有军队，马里证明我们的军队仍能给世界带来不同。
One can draw two lessons from this collective form of escapism. => 在这一集体逃避现实中，你可以发现两点。
The first is that, beyond the many layers of depression and distrust in France, there is potential for a new and collective departure. => 第一点，在法国内部的多重压抑和不信任之外，还有一层潜在的新的集体出发。
This would require, of course, less cynical political elites who can transcend their petty ambitions and divisions for the sake of the country. => 当然，这要求有更加坚定的政治精英，为了国家的命运牺牲自己的小野心和小异议。
The second lesson, even more obvious, is that reality cannot be changed with a simple public spectacle. => 第二点更加明显，那就是现实不可能因为一场精彩的公共表演而改变。
France is not Imperial Rome, where panem et circenses made a fundamental difference. => 法国不是罗马帝国，面包和游戏（panem et circenses）就能造成根本性的不同。
It is a weakened democracy mired in an economic and social crisis so deep that it verges on becoming an identity crisis. => 法国是一个削弱了的民主国家，困于深刻的经济和社会危机，站在身份危机的边缘。
He, too, was in a reassuring mood. => 奥朗德也是一副踌躇满志的样子。
According to Hollande, the economic upturn – la reprise – had just started, and hope was around the corner. => 在奥朗德看来，经济好转 — — 复苏（la reprise ） — —才刚刚开始，希望的曙光刚刚显现。
His tone and message had changed. => 他的语调和说辞发生了改变。

He was no longer the “normal man” of his election campaign and tenure until now; instead, he tried to present himself, like his predecessor, Nicolas Sarkozy, as a superhero. => 他不再是竞选期间和就任至今的那个“普通人 ” ； 相反，他试图让自己像他的前任萨科齐，成为超级英雄。
Of course, given his personality and low public-approval ratings, his address was the least convincing event of the day. => 当然，从他的人格和低公共支持度看，他的演讲是巴士底日最无说服力的事件。
Who could have said with certainty that the economic upturn announced by Hollande was real rather than aspirational? => 谁能拍着胸脯说奥朗德所宣布的经济好转是现实而不是愿望？
Beyond his message’s wishful thinking, the public’s reaction to the messenger was a mixture of disbelief and indifference. => 除了奥朗德话中的一厢情愿，公众对奥朗德的反应时不信任和冷漠。
Seeing the behavior of friends, all French, listening with me to Hollande, I was reminded of another moment. => 看着和我一起听奥朗德讲话的朋友（都是法国人）的行为，我想起了另一个时刻。
It was December 31, 1989, and I was in the Soviet Union. => 那是1989年12月31日，当时我在苏联。
I had found myself in a restaurant in the old city of Suzdal, listening to President Mikhail Gorbachev’s “New Year wishes.” => 我在苏兹达尔（Suzdal）老城的一家餐馆，听总统戈尔巴乔夫的“新年祝词 ” 。

I was moved: The man who symbolized glasnost and perestroika, who had allowed the peaceful emancipation of most of Eastern and Central Europe, was speaking. => 我感慨万千。 这个象征公开（glasnost）和改变（perestroika ） 、 允许东欧和中欧和平演变的人正在讲话。
But I was alone in paying attention to him. => 但我是唯一一个专心听他讲话的人。
The restaurant’s customers, like my French friends now, could not have cared less. => 餐馆里的其他食客，就像现在我的法国朋友，对戈尔巴乔夫的讲话一点都不关心。
Their president had become background noise. => 他们的总统变成了背景噪声。
Has Hollande become, in this sense, a French Gorbachev? => 从这个角度讲，难道奥朗德成了法国的戈尔巴乔夫？
For the left and the Greens, he is close to being a traitor. => 对左派和绿党来说，他近乎卖国贼。

These voters chose him a year ago not only because he was not Sarkozy, but because he incarnated the values of the true left, even if his centrist moderation seemed a bad omen. => 这些选民一年前之所以选择他，不仅是因为他不是萨科齐，也是因为他是真左翼价值的化身，尽管他的中间道路温和立场并非吉兆。
Voters of the center or even the center-right are disappointed, too, by their president’s lack of charisma, if not sheer incompetence. => 中间派选民甚至中右翼也感到失望，因为总统缺乏魅力（如果不是彻底无能的话 ） 。
After a year of Hollande, France is witnessing a fundamental political revolution. => 奥朗德上台一年后，法国正在发生根本性的政治革命。
During the half-century of the Fifth Republic, a bipartisan system of left and right has traditionally prevailed. => 在第五共和国半个世纪的历史中，左派和右派的两党制已经成为了传统。
But now France is becoming a country dominated by a “tripartite system” of more or less equal strength: the left, the right, and the extreme right. => 但如今法国正在变成由“三党制”主宰的国家，左派，右派和极右派或多或少地同样强大。
What Bastille Day revealed, even briefly and superficially, is that the potential to unite France exists. => 巴士底日表明 — — 尽管迹象既虚弱又肤浅 — — 团结的法国的潜在力量是存在的。
But doing so requires more than shallow promises. => 但这样做需要的不仅仅是流于表面的承诺。
A Kick-Off for Peace? => 开启和平

Yerevan – Armenian President Serzh Sargsyan’s recent invitation to Turkish President Abdullah Gul to visit Yerevan to watch a football match together was historic. => 埃里温 - - 亚美尼亚总统萨尔基相最近邀请土耳其总统居尔访问埃里温一同观看足球赛，这是具有历史意义的事件。
Given the two countries’ long-strained relations, this visit would have been remarkable at any time. => 鉴于两国关系长期僵持，这一访问在任何时候都是不同寻常的。

But coming as it does only one month after the alarming Russian-Georgian confrontation, it may offer real hope that tensions in the volatile Caucasus region can be eased. => 但是这是在触目惊心的俄国和格鲁吉亚冲突仅仅一个月以后，因此，这次访问也许会给人们确实的希望，也就是高加索地区动荡不安紧张局势可以得到缓解。
Of course, ancient and difficult issues divide Armenia and Turkey. => 当然，亚美尼亚和土耳其之间的恩怨由来已久，错综复杂。
But now is the moment for both countries to put the past aside in order to address their common security concerns. => 但是现在两国应该摒弃前嫌，处理共同的安全关切。
In the new context set by the war in Georgia, the urgency of Turkey becoming a real bridge between the nations of the Caucasus is not lost on anyone. => 格鲁吉亚战争带来了新的环境，因此，人们都清楚土耳其急于想要成为高加索地区国家之间真正的桥梁。
This expectation is an inevitable consequence of Turkey’s geography and history. => 这一期望是土耳其的地理和历史所决定的。

Situated figuratively between modernity and tradition, secularism and Islam, and democracy and tyranny, Turkey also is an actual physical bridge between East and West. => 土耳其被比喻成为介于现代和传统、世俗和伊斯兰以及民主和专制之间，而且它在地理上也是东西方之间的桥梁。
For the peoples of the Caucasus, Turkey marks our path to Europe. => 对于高加索地区的人民而言，土耳其标志着我们通向欧洲的道路。
It is a NATO member, bordering the three Caucasus republics that have NATO Individual Partnership Action Programs. => 土耳其是北约成员国，与三个高加索地区国家接壤，这三个国家都有北约单个伙伴行动计划。
It aspires to join the European Union, and would bring the EU to our three borders, even as we, too, aspire to join one day. => 土耳其渴望加入欧盟并且将会把欧盟带到我们的三个边境。 甚至我们也渴望有朝一日加入欧盟。
Indeed, Turkey has never missed an opportunity to present itself as a regional broker. => 确实，土耳其从来就没有错过机会成为地区调停人。
Immediately after the collapse of the Soviet Union, Turkey proposed the Black Sea Economic Cooperation. => 苏联解体后，它马上就提议建立黑海经济合作组织。
Now, in the immediate wake of the Russia-Georgia crisis, Turkey’s leaders have stepped forward once again to take a leadership role in the Caucasus. => 现在俄国和格鲁吉亚危机刚刚结束，土耳其领导人再次站出来在高加索地区发挥领导作用。

The world must fervently hope that the Turkish proposal for a Caucasus Stability and Cooperation Platform is more serious and sustained than previous similar efforts. => 全世界热切希望土耳其提出的高加索稳定和合作平台比以往的类似建议更为严肃认真和持久。
But, in order to succeed, Turkey must firmly pursue a pledge from all the region’s players to repudiate the use of force in settling their disputes. => 但是，为了成功，土耳其必须紧紧寻求本地区所有国家的承诺，在解决争端中放弃使用武力。

If this pledge is adopted and respected, conflicts in the region will be viewed in a wholly different, more tolerant context, marking a historic breakthrough to peace. => 如果这一承诺获得通过并且尊重，那么，人们就可以完全不同而且更为宽容的眼光来审视这一地区的各种冲突。 这将标志着朝向和平的历史性突破。
In fact, why not take the idea of such a pact one step further? => 实际上，为何不把这一协议主张更推进一步呢？
We in this region can, and I believe should, call for a non-aligned Caucasus, free of security blocs and adversarial alliances. => 我相信，本地区国家应该而且能够呼吁建立不结盟的高加索地区，没有安全结盟或者敌对联盟。
After all, security alliances and guarantees only create dividing lines, with their attendant security challenges. => 毕竟，安全挑战伴随着这些安全联盟和保证，只会制造分歧。
Our countries and peoples have, throughout history, lived under a common umbrella for far longer than we have been divided. => 我们的国家和人民在历史上一直生活在一个共同的结构之下，长于分裂的时间。
Today, we share a common vision of European integration, and it is in this broader context that our conflicts should be resolved. => 今天，我们共有欧洲联合的愿景。 正是在这一更广大的背景之下我们的冲突才应该得以解决。

French President Nicolas Sarkozy’s and German Chancellor Angela Merkel’s visits to Georgia and Russia proved that there is no substitute for Europe insofar as the Caucasus is concerned. => 法国总统萨尔科奇和德国总理默克尔对格鲁吉亚和德国的访问证明，对于欧洲而言，高加索地区是不可替代的。
Only Europe can play the role of honest broker in the region’s atmosphere of suspicion and intolerance. => 只有欧洲才能够在这一地区怀疑和没有宽容的气氛下发挥真正的调停人作用。
But, at the end of the day, we ourselves must be willing to work toward a region of peace and cooperation. => 但是最终，我们自己必须愿意努力建立地区和平及合作。
The Caucasus is too small a space for closed borders and explosive conflicts. => 高加索地区并不辽阔，难以容得边境封锁和爆炸性冲突。
In fact, real peace in the Caucasus requires two key strategic transformations. => 实际上，高加索地区的真正和平需要实现两个关键性的战略转变。
One is a lesson from history: Russia’s strategic interests here cannot be ignored. => 第一是吸取历史教训。
To believe and behave otherwise would lead to regional chaos. => 俄国在这一地区的战略利益不得忽视，否则将会导致地区混乱。
The other lesson is that Turkey and Armenia cannot remain adversaries forever. => 第二个教训是土耳其和亚美尼亚不能永远为敌。
There must be normalization in our relations in order for the Caucasus to coalesce into a functional region. => 两国关系必须正常化才能让高加索联合成为一个可以运作的地区。
Ironically, both Russia and the United States recognize that this is in their interest. => 具有讽刺意味的是，美俄两国都承认这符合它们的利益。
The Russians view normal relations between Turkey and Armenia as a way to minimize Georgia’s strategic role in the region. => 俄国认为，土耳其和亚美尼亚关系正常化可以把格鲁吉亚在该地区的战略作用降低到最小程度。
The US views an opening to Turkey as a way to decrease Armenia’s real and imagined reliance on Russia. => 美国认为，向土耳其开放可以减少亚美尼亚对俄国实际和想象中的依赖。

Beyond the emotional impact of President Gul’s visit to Yerevan, real improvement in Turkish-Armenian relations requires opening the two countries’ closed border – the last in Europe. => 居尔总统访问埃里温除了具有情感上的影响之外，土耳其和亚美尼亚两国关系得到实际改善要求开放两国封闭的边界。 这是欧洲范围内最后封闭的边界。
Or, for a start, the existing railroad link between the two countries could be made operational. => 或者作为开始，两国之间现有的铁路连接应当投入运行。
If this does not happen within the coming weeks and months, then Turkey will have demonstrated that all this was just a show. => 如果这一点在今后几周或几个月内无法实现，那么，土耳其就会表明这一切都不过是演戏罢了。
President Gul’s visit does mark a watershed – either as a failure to make history, or as the beginning of a new era. => 居尔总统的访问的确具有分水岭的意义，而这一分水岭要么是无法创造历史，要么是新时代的开始。
Truth and Consequences => 真相与后果
NEW YORK – The recent re-election of Colombia’s president, Juan Manuel Santos, brings hope to a country seeking to end a half-century of conflict. => 纽约 — — 不久前哥伦比亚总统胡安·曼努埃尔·桑托斯竞选连任为结束该国半个世纪的冲突带来了希望。

But, as with so many peace processes, finding a balance between creating a stable accord and acknowledging the terrible injustices that occurred during the conflict can be difficult to achieve. => 但是像其他众多和平进程一样，在签署稳定协议和承认冲突中发生的可怕的不公正之间找到平衡或许很难做到。

Many countries and communities, from Nepal to Northern Ireland, have grappled with legacies of ethnic, ideological, or religious division and violence, often with limited success. => 从尼泊尔到北爱尔兰的很多国家和团体一直在设法解决民族、意识形态、宗教分裂和暴力领域的遗留问题，但成功的先例却少之又少。
This is frequently the case because the mechanisms established to cope with post-conflict reconciliation, truth, and justice, have proved inadequate. => 归根结底是因为事实已经证明处理冲突后和解、真相和正义的机制远远不够。
In Bosnia and Herzegovina, the International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia (ICTY) has made important contributions to truth seeking. => 在波斯尼亚和黑塞哥维那，前南问题国际刑事法庭（ICTY）为揭露真相做出了重要贡献。
But victims complain that its procedures are slow and abstruse; and many Bosnian Serbs are convinced that the tribunal is selective and politically motivated. => 但受害者抱怨其程序迟缓晦涩；很多波黑塞族相信法庭是有选择性和政治动机的。

An agreement between Nepal’s government and Maoist guerrillas to establish a truth commission and investigate the “disappeared” was delayed for seven years. => 尼泊尔政府和毛派游击队之间成立真相委员会调查“失踪人员”的协议被推迟了七年之久。
Peace negotiators understandably fear that criminal accountability for past crimes will threaten their side’s leaders and supporters. => 和平谈判代表担心追究过去罪行的刑事责任会威胁本方领导人和支持者的安全是有道理的。
Many have wrongly assumed – based on a misinterpretation of the South African experience – that truth commissions provide a “soft” alternative to justice. => 很多人基于对南非经验的误解认为真相委员会比法律制裁更加“柔和 ” 。
Seeking the truth can be unsettling and painful for anyone, but it comes with serious consequences for those with reason to fear justice. => 了解真相对任何人来讲都伴随着不安和痛苦，但却会为那些有理由害怕制裁的人带来严重的后果。
But, in order to succeed, these commissions must be effective, independent, and legitimate. => 但真相委员会成功的前提是高效、独立、合法。
Half-measures will not do. => 仅靠权宜之计不可能实现目标。

Truth commissions therefore should never be established as “box-ticking” exercises to assuage local public opinion or the international community, as witnessed in Nepal. => 因此永远也不要像尼泊尔那样让真相委员会沦为缓和当地或国际社会公众舆论的象征性机构。

Even when broad mandates and functions are established with the best of intentions, truth commissions are often deprived of the necessary resources, leading to further frustration and disillusion. => 即使划定广泛的任务和职能范围完全出于好意，但真相委员会却往往得不到必要的资源，导致民众进一步信心受挫、理想幻灭。
Moreover, a commission should not be led or staffed by individuals of questionable integrity, thereby undermining the legitimacy of the process. => 此外，委员会不应默许品格有问题的人领导或参与，否则可能对程序的合法性构成威胁。
Above all, truth commissions must be adapted to a country’s particular circumstances. => 总之，真相委员会必须与国家的具体情况相适应。

As we have seen in Bosnia, Colombia, Nepal, Northern Ireland, and elsewhere, the nature of conflicts and how they are resolved differ widely; so should their respective commissions. => 我们已经在波斯尼亚、哥伦比亚、尼泊尔、北爱尔兰和其他国家看到冲突的性质和解决的方法有很大不同；因此各国委员会应当本着因地制宜的原则。
A “one-size-fits-all” solution ends up fitting no one. => “一刀切”的解决方案不适合任何国家。
It is vital that the details of each case of post-conflict transitional justice are understood and implemented. => 理解并落实每宗过渡期司法个案的细节非常重要。
It is all too easy for political leaders to ignore victims or suppress the truth in their quest for a peace deal. => 在试图签署和平协定时忽视受害者或隐瞒真相是政治领导人最容易犯的错误。
But recognizing victims’ rights is an indispensable condition for lasting peace. => 但实现持久和平不可缺少的条件是承认受害者的权利。
Human suffering and victims’ dignity are too powerful to be erased by others’ political pacts. => 任何人的政治协定都不能以罔顾人类苦难和受害者尊严为代价。
Eventually, the past demands its due: justice is not just an ideal; it is an investment in a better future. => 最后，我们必须总结过去的经验教训：正义不仅是种理想；也是投资于更好的未来。
Alan Greenspan on Trial => 审判格林斯潘

The release of Alan Greenspan’s ghostwritten memoirs The Age of Turbulence has elicited charges that he was not such a great central banker after all. => 阿兰•格林斯潘由他人捉刀的回忆录《动荡岁月》出版以来，引发了认为他不是一位出色的央行行长的指责。
But what is one to make of the criticisms of Greenspan’s tenure at the Federal Reserve? => 但对格林斯潘执掌美联储的生涯横加指责又有什么道理呢？
To the first two counts, Greenspan now pleads guilty. => 对于前两项罪名，格林斯潘供认不讳。
He says that he did not understand how the growth of non-standard mortgages had lured borrowers and investors into bearing dangerous risks. => 他说他不明白为什么非标准按揭贷款的增长会诱使借款人和投资人不顾风险趋之若鹜。
He was, he now says, focusing on how fixed-rate mortgages are relatively bad deals for borrowers in times of low inflation, which was a mistake. => 现在他说当时错误地关注了为什么固定利率按揭贷款在低通胀时期对借款人而言是不合理的。
Greenspan also pleads guilty to a mistake in early 2001. => 格林斯潘还对2001年初的错误认罪。
He thought that he was giving balanced testimony to Congress on government budget issues. => 他以为自己就政府预算问题在国会所作的证词是合适的。

He testified that it is important to run surpluses to pay down the debt, but that surpluses must not be so large that the government winds up owning American industry. => 他作证说利用盈余偿还债务是重要的。 但财政盈余的规模不能大到使政府最终掌控美国的工业。

Robert Rubin and Kent Conrad warned him that the press would not interpret his testimony as being balanced, and that Congress would interpret it as an excuse to abandon fiscal discipline. => 罗伯特•鲁宾 和 肯特•康拉德都警告他说新闻界不会认为他的证词是合适的，且国会也会将其理解为一种放弃财政纪律的借口。
They were right. => 事情果然被他们言中了。
Greenspan also pleads guilty to misunderstanding the character of the Bush administration. => 格林斯潘还承认误解了布什政府的特点。
He thought that his old reality-based friends from the Ford administration were back in power. => 他还以为是自己在福特政府的注重现实的老朋友又重新掌权了。
He was wrong. => 他错了。
But how serious are these policy-political crimes to which Greenspan now pleads guilty? => 但这些现在让格林斯潘供认不讳的政策—政治罪行究竟有多严重呢？
In my view, they are misdemeanors. => 在我看来，他们只是小过错。

Against them you have to set what former Treasury Secretary Larry Summers calls Greenspan’s “golden glove” performance at avoiding and minimizing recessions during his years at the Fed. => 你必须把它们放在被前财长拉里•萨默斯称为格林斯潘的“金手套”表现（即在其执掌美联储的岁月里规避及遏制经济衰退）的背景上来衡量。
Here, Greenspan holds his ground, and pleads not guilty. => 而在这两点上，格林斯潘坚定地为自己进行无罪申辩。

Interest rates high enough to curb stock market speculation would also have curbed construction and other forms of investment, raised unemployment, and sent the economy into recession. => 利率高到足够遏止股市的投机行为，也就会遏制建设和其他形式的投资、提高失业率并使经济陷入衰退。

To cause a significant current evil in order to avoid a possible future danger when our knowledge is limited and our judgments uncertain is, Greenspan believes, unwise. => 格林斯潘认为为了规避未来的危险而制造残酷现实的策略在我们所知有限且判断不明的情况下是不明智的。
In this, he is following a tradition of caution that extends from Edmund Burke to John Maynard Keynes. => 在这一点上他所遵循的是从伯克到凯恩斯的一贯审慎。
Greenspan mounts a similar defense concerning the housing bubble. => 格林斯潘对有关房地产泡沫的指控进行了类似的辩护。
High construction employment has been good for American workers in the past half-decade – a period that has not produced much good for them. => 建筑业的高就业率在过去五年以来对美国的工人而言是有利的—这一时期总体上并未给他们带来多收好处。
Higher interest rates to reduce the housing boom seem, even in retrospect, ill advised if the cost is mass unemployment. => 用高利率来给过热的房地产市场降温，如果其代价是大规模的失业，那么即便现在回头看来也是不可取的。

And Greenspan eschews paternalism: he would not assume the role of a regulator telling people that they cannot buy a house even though a lender is willing to finance it. => 并且格林斯潘还避免家长式的作风：他不想扮演一个告诉人们即便贷方愿意融资也不要买房的监管者角色。

But Greenspan would have served the country and the world better if he had been somewhat more paternalist in slowing the growth of non-standard adjustable-rate mortgages. => 但格林斯潘如果在减缓非标准可变利率按揭贷款的增长方面多一点家长式的作风，那么这对美国和世界本应该更好。
Of course, such a Greenspan would never have been re-appointed. => 当然，这样的格林斯潘是不会获得连任的。
A Lasting Poison => 幽灵不散
NEW YORK – Next year will mark the twentieth anniversary of the collapse of communism in Europe. => 纽约-明年将迎来共产主义在欧洲垮台20周年。

Liberated from the complexity of knowing too much about the cruel past, the young people of Eastern Europe’s post-communist generation seem uninterested in what their parents and grandparents endured. => 不再需要了解过多残酷过去的东欧后共产主义的年轻一代似乎对他们的父辈和祖辈所承受的一切毫无兴趣。

Yet the recent revelation of the Czech writer Milan Kundera’s presumed complicity in the face of Stalinism is but the latest of the long half-life of a toxic past. => 然而最近披露捷克作家昆德拉可能曾在斯大林主义时代参与共谋的消息只不过是漫长的痛苦过去最新暴露的一个事例。
Friedrich Nietzsche said that if you look in the eye of the Devil for too long, you risk becoming a devil yourself. => 尼采曾说过如果你盯着恶魔的眼睛时间太久，你自己也可能成为恶魔。
A Bolshevik anticommunism, similar in its dogmatism to communism itself, has from time to time run riot in parts of Eastern Europe. => 布尔什维克的反共产主义，与对共产主义本身的教条主义相似，在东欧的各个地区一再地肆虐。

In country after country, that Manichean mindset, with its oversimplifications and manipulations, was merely re-fashioned to serve the new people in power. => 在一个接一个的国家，这种要么过于简单化要么进行操纵的二元论心态只不过是重新粉饰来为掌权的新一代服务而已。
Opportunism has had its share in this, of course. => 当然在这其中也有机会主义的成分。
In 1945, when the Red Army occupied Romania, the Communist Party had no more than 1,000 members; in 1989, it had almost four million. => 当红军于1945年占领罗马尼亚时，共产党的党员还不满1000人；但是在1989年，这一数字达到了将近400万。

One day after Nicolae Ceausescu’s execution, most of these people suddenly became fierce anticommunists and victims of the system they had served for decades. => 在处决了齐奥塞斯库后，这些人中的大部分突然变成了激烈的反共产主义者以及他们曾服务了几十年的那个体制的受害者。
But the case of Kundera appears different – though no less disturbing. => 但是昆德拉的这件事似乎有所不同，尽管同样令人不安。

In 1950, Kundera, then a 20-year-old Communist, reportedly denounced to the criminal police as a Western spy a man he had never met – a friend of his friend’s girlfriend. => 在1950年，当时还只是一个20岁的共产党员的昆德拉被报道说向刑警告密，称一位他从未谋面的人是一个西方间谍，那个人是他朋友的女朋友的一位朋友。
The man was later brutally interrogated in a former Gestapo torture facility and spent 14 years in prison. => 那个人后来在前盖世太保的刑讯室里遭到了残忍的审问，后来被关押了14年。

Kundera’s name was contained in the investigating officer’s report, which was authenticated after a respected historian discovered it in a dusty Prague archive. => 昆德拉的名字出现在了调查官员的报告中，一位受人敬重的历史学家在翻阅了尘封在布拉格的档案后对此予以了证实。
The reclusive Kundera, who immigrated to Paris in 1975, has declared that “it never happened.” => 1975年移民到巴黎、现在过着隐居生活的昆德拉宣称“这件事从未发生过 ” 。

Moreover, Czechoslovakia’s fearsome secret police, who had every interest in silencing or compromising the famous dissident writer, never used the incident to blackmail or expose him. => 此外，捷克斯洛伐克可怕的秘密警察，他们曾采取各种手段是著名的持不同政见的作家闭嘴或者妥协，却从未利用这一事件来讹诈或揭露昆德拉。
Until more information is forthcoming, both from Kundera and from the authorities, the case will not be solved “beyond reasonable doubt.” => 在昆德拉本人和政府当局提供更多的信息之前，这件事不可能使人们不“产生合理的怀疑 ” 。
But if it happened, the case calls for a deeper reflection. => 但是如果它真发生过，这件事将呼唤我们进行更深层次的思索。

As far as we know, Kundera never was an informer before or after this incident, and we cannot ignore that he later freed himself from the compulsory totalitarian happiness that communism propagated. => 据我们所知，昆德拉在这起事件之前或之后从未做过告密者，并且我们不能忘记的是他后来从共产主义所散布的强制的极权主义幸福中逃离了出来。
Moreover, Kundera’s case is hardly unique. => 此外，昆德拉事件远远不是独此一例。

In 2006, the Nobel Prize-winning German author Günter Grass’s disclosed that, 60 years earlier, he was, as a teenager, a member of the Waffen-SS. => 2006年，诺贝尔奖获得者德国作家君特·格拉斯被揭露在60年前，当他还是一个十几岁的孩子的时候，曾是武装党卫队的成员。

Similarly, a few years ago, the world was shocked to learn that famous Italian writer Ignazio Silone had, in his youth, collaborated with the fascist police. => 同样地，在几年以前，世界震惊地发现著名的意大利作家纳齐奥·西隆尼在年青的时候曾与法西斯警察勾结。
Daily life under totalitarianism, be it communist or fascist, was routinely based on a deep duplicity whose effects are longstanding. => 每天生活在极权统治下，不管是共产主义还是法西斯统治，常常都会陷于深深的双重性中，而这种影响将会是非常深远的。
I don’t agree with those who say we should not be interested in the dark episodes in the life of a great writer. => 我不同意那些认为我们不应该对一位伟大作家在黑暗时期的生活感兴趣的说法。
Why not? => 为什么不呢？

But can we justifiably defend morally compromised artists and intellectuals on the basis of their work’s merit, yet condemn ordinary people for often less grave offenses? => 但是我们是否应该因为他们作品的伟大而无可非议地为那些在道义上妥协的艺术家和知识分子辩解，然而却因为没那么严重的错误而谴责普通的人呢？
Shouldn’t that cleaner’s drudgery to support her family, children, and her own survival be taken equally into account? => 那位清洁工为了她的家庭、孩子以及她自己的生存而去做苦工难道不应该同样考虑进去吗？
Life under totalitarianism was an extreme situation that requires us to apply special, nuanced rules to all the captives of that ordeal. => 极权主义统治下的生活是一种极端的状况，它要求我们对所有深受其折磨的受害者都适用特殊的、有细微差别的规则。
If nothing else, in order to forgive, we have to know what we are forgiving. => 不为别的，哪怕只是为了原谅，我们也必须知道我们原谅的什么。
In Eastern Europe today, old and young alike stand to benefit from that lesson. => 在今天的东欧，年长和年青的人都从那个教训中受益。
Moses wandered with his people in the desert for 40 years, until they had rid themselves of the poisonous slave mentality. => 摩西和他的百姓曾在沙漠里徘徊了40年，直到他们去除了他们自己有害的奴隶心态。
The Albanian Miracle => 阿尔巴尼亚奇迹
TIRANA – Five years ago, Albania faced a truly ominous situation. => 发自地拉那 — — 就在五年前，阿尔巴尼亚还在面临着极为危急的局面。
With Greece and Italy reeling from the euro crisis, remittances and capital inflows were falling and the economy suffered a severe slowdown. => 由于希腊和意大利遭遇欧元危机，导致该国侨汇和资本流入双双下降，经济严重放缓。

The fiscal deficit ballooned to over 7% of GDP, financed to a large extent by arrears, as access to external financial markets had collapsed and domestic interest rates were sky high. => 财政赤字激增至GDP的7％以上，同时进入外部金融市场的渠道崩溃且国内利率高涨，财政在很大程度上只能靠欠款维持。

In addition, the power distribution company was in both an operational and a financial crisis, unable to pay for the electricity that it was supposed to buy from power generation companies. => 此外该国的配电企业也处于运营和金融的双重危机之中，因为它无法支付本应从发电企业处购买的电力。
The arrears of both the government and the power company were fueling an increase in non-performing loans in the banking system. => 政府和电力公司的拖欠行为导致银行体系中不良贷款大幅增加。
All the ingredients of a catastrophic outcome were there. => 这简直是把一场灾难的所有成因都集齐了。

Fast-forward to the present: the economy is growing at a robust 4.2% rate, led by double-digit export growth in agriculture, mining, manufacturing, energy, tourism, and business services. => 现在让我们快进到当前：在农业，采矿业，制造业，能源，旅游业和商业服务业分别实现两位数出口增长的带领之下，阿尔巴尼亚经济正以4.2％的强劲势头增长。

It now has the lowest sovereign spread for any country in its rating class, indicating that markets think the rating agencies have been asleep at the wheel. => 该国现在的主权利差在其同一评级等级国家中最低的，表明市场认为评级机构显然太过粗心大意了。

Once the North Korea of Europe under Communist dictator Enver Hoxha, Albania’s per capita income level is now 25% that of Germany. => 作为曾经遭遇共产主义独裁者恩维尔·霍查（Enver Hoxha）统治的欧洲朝鲜，阿尔巴尼亚的人均收入水平现在相当于德国的25 ％ 。
If it can maintain its current growth rate, it will reach Germany’s current income in 32 years. => 如能够保持目前的增长率，它将在32年后达到德国的当前收入水平。
What was the secret of Albania’s turnaround? => 那么阿尔巴尼亚的转变秘诀是什么呢？

First, as opposed to many countries that delay action until it is too late, Prime Minister Edi Rama called in the IMF as soon as he got into power in September 2013. => 首先，在许多国家拖延推诿以致延误时机之时，总理埃迪·拉玛在2013年9月上台后立即致电国际货币基金组织。
His government then negotiated a program that allowed Albania to gain financial support while it was putting its fiscal house in order. => 他的政府随后通过谈判达成一项让阿尔巴尼亚可以在整顿本国财政秩序的同时获得财政支持的计划。
The three-year program ended successfully almost two years ago, and the debt-to-GDP ratio remains on a downward trend. => 这项为期三年的计划大约在两年前成功结束，债务与GDP的比率依然保持下降趋势。
This year, it is declining by 2.5% of GDP, while the country is significantly expanding its public investment budget. => 今年该数值又下降了2.5 ％ ， 即使该国正在大幅扩大其公共投资预算。
To be able to grow in the midst of fiscal consolidation, something else has to pull the economy forward, typically exports. => 为了能够在财政整顿过程中实现增长，就需要利用其他因素 — — 特别是出口 — — 去拉动经济。

In the process, Albania eschewed the temptation to focus on general Doing Business indicators, which assume that randomly following international best practices might do some good. => 在这一过程中，阿尔巴尼亚避开了集中关注某些通用性营商环境指标的诱惑，这些指标假设随机选定并遵循某些国际最佳实践就能收获某些成果。
Instead, the authorities followed a diagnostic approach to prioritize their policies. => 相反，当局采用了一种诊断式手段来确定其政策的优先顺序。
This led to many ideas that proved to be powerful. => 这种做法催生了许多被证明是极为有效的点子。

In agriculture, the development of aggregators helped small farmers connect to better technologies and more lucrative markets, creating a boom in vegetable exports. => 在农业方面，信心汇集企业的发展帮助农民获取先进技术并连接利润更为丰厚的市场，从而创造了蔬菜出口的繁荣。
Likewise, consultative groups in manufacturing and tourism identified areas for improvement. => 同样，制造业和旅游业的咨询小组也确定了需要改进的领域。

Albania has invested in the recovery of its historic cities and is now investing in 100 villages with strong agro-tourism potential that happen to be in areas that are both poor and pristine. => 阿尔巴尼亚正在投资修复本国那些历史悠久的城市，目前还针对100个具备强大农业旅游潜力但恰好位于贫穷原始地区的村庄投资。
No wonder that tourism is growing at double-digit rates. => 难怪旅游业实现了两位数的增长。
Moreover, the country’s ambassadors are now being used in a concerted strategy to promote foreign investment through direct engagement with firms. => 此外，该国的众多驻外大使现正采取协调一致的战略，通过直接接触企业来促进外国投资。

And policymakers are now engaging Albania’s diaspora – found to be an important source of talent, investment, market opportunities, and business ideas – to great effect. => 政策制定者们如今正在引导阿尔巴尼亚侨民去发挥重要作用 — — 因为他们是人才、投资，市场机会和商业创意的重要来源。
The innovations have not been only at the national level. => 这些创新不仅停留在国家层面。

Erion Veliaj, the mayor of Tirana, has tripled municipal revenues since he took over in 2015 and used the proceeds in ways that have made the city one of the most pleasant in the region. => 地拉那市市长埃里昂·维利亚（Erion Veliaj）自2015年上任以来已将市政收入增加了两倍，并将收益用于使该市成为该地区最令人愉悦的城市之一。

Albania’s capital has won European awards for its development of high-quality urban spaces and for solving mobility and environmental problems in innovative ways. => 阿尔巴尼亚的首都因其高质量的城市空间开发并以创新方式解决人员流动和环境问题而赢得了多个欧洲大奖。
The lessons for other countries are clear. => 对于其他国家来说阿尔巴尼亚的教益相当明确。
In this process, countries are not alone. => 在这个过程中每个国家都不是在孤军奋斗。
The system of international financial assistance led by the IMF and the development-finance institutions can be very helpful. => 由国际货币基金组织以及各个发展金融机构牵头的国际金融援助体系都可以伸出援手。
But countries must figure out when and how best to use them. => 但各国必须弄清楚何时以及如何最好地利用它们。
They can enhance government capacity but cannot substitute for government commitment. => 它们可以增强政府的能力，但不能取代政府的承诺。
For much of its history, Albania looked hopeless. => 在其历史的大部分时间里，阿尔巴尼亚看起来毫无希望。
But hopeless is as hopeless does. => 但绝望本身也是不可能永远存续下去的。
Now Albania’s turnaround is a source of hope for the rest of us. => 如今阿尔巴尼亚的转变已经成为了我们其他人的希望之源。
Toward a More Reflective Planet => 增加地球反射性

CAMBRIDGE – The last time the atmosphere held as much carbon dioxide as it does today was about three million years ago – a time when sea levels were 10-30 meters higher than they are now. => 坎布里奇—大气层上一次含二氧化碳量与今天一样多大约出现在三百万年前 — — 当时的海平面比今天高10—30米。
Climate models have long struggled to duplicate those large fluctuations in sea levels – until now. => 长期以来，气候模型一直努力复制着海平面的大幅波动 — — 直至目前。
Indeed, for the first time, a high-quality model of Antarctic ice and climate has been able to simulate these large swings. => 事实上，历史上第一次，一个高质量的南极冰和气候模型能够模拟这些大波动。
That is smart science, but it brings devastating news. => 这是智能科学，但它带来的是灾难性的消息。

The new model shows that melting in Antarctica alone could increase global sea levels by as much as one meter (3.2 feet) by the end of this century – well above prior estimates. => 新模型显示，光是南极融化就可以让全球海平面在本世纪末上升足足一米 — — 远高于先前的估计。

Worse, it suggests that even extraordinary success at cutting emissions would not save the West Antarctic Ice Sheet, locking in eventual sea-level increases of more than five meters. => 更糟糕的是，模型表明，即使减排工作取得卓越的成功，也无法拯救西南极洲冰原，最终的海平面上升幅度将超过五米。
As little as one meter could put at risk entire cities, from Miami to Mumbai, and cause enormous economic disruption. => 海平面升高区区一米就可以让从迈阿密到孟买面临全城被淹的危险，并导致巨大的经济破坏。
We need to turn down the heat – and fast. => 我们需要降低温度 — — 并且速度要快。

To this end, albedo modification – a kind of geoengineering intended to cool the planet by increasing the reflectivity of the earth’s atmosphere – holds tremendous promise. => 在这方面，改变反射率 — — 一种旨在通过增加地球大气层反射性的地理工程 — — 大有可为。
Injecting synthetic aerosols that reflect sunlight into the stratosphere, for example, could help counter the warming caused by greenhouse gases. => 比如，注入可将太阳光反射进入平流层的人工气溶胶有助于遏制温室气体带来的变暖。

The mechanism is similar to wearing a white shirt in the summer: white reflects sunlight and cools what is underneath, whereas darker colors absorb sunlight and heat. => 其中的机理类似于夏天穿白衬衫：白色反射太阳光，让下面的东西更凉爽；而深色吸收太阳光并升温。
To be sure, even in the best-case scenario, solar geoengineering alone could not stabilize the world’s climate. => 诚然，即使在最佳情景中，仅仅依靠太阳能地理工程也无法稳定世界气候。
For that, we must both stop pumping carbon pollution into the atmosphere and learn how to remove what is already there. => 对此，我们必须一面停止向大气层排放碳污染，一面学会如何去除已经存在于大气层中的碳。
That is why emissions cuts should receive the lion’s share of resources devoted to combating climate change. => 这便是应该将用于遏制气候变化的资源大部分用于减排的原因。
But, as the recent study shows, emissions cuts alone cannot save the West Antarctic Ice Sheet and prevent a drastic sea-level rise. => 但是，最新研究表明光是减排无法拯救西南极洲冰原和防止海平面灾难性上升。

(It should be noted that, given carbon-cycle feedbacks, such as the thawing of permafrost, there is a chance that the world would face a 1.5°C rise, even if emissions were eliminated today.) => （应该指出，考虑到碳循环反馈（如冻土解冻 ） ， 即使今天就消灭排放，世界温度上升幅度仍可能达到1.5℃。 ）

Most of the world’s state-of-the-art climate models have explored albedo modification, and each of them has found that the process does have the potential to mitigate climate change. => 如今，全世界大部分最新气候模型都探索了改变反射率的问题，并且都发现该过程确实有遏制气候变化的潜力。
Beyond limiting total warming, it can help to check the rise in peak temperatures, decreasing the risk of destructive heat waves. => 除了限制升温总幅度，它还有助于遏制峰值温度的上升，降低破坏性热浪的风险。
And it seems to be particularly effective at reducing extreme rainfall, which holds profound implications for minimizing flood damage. => 并且它在减少极端降雨方面似乎特别有效，这极有利于洪水危害最小化。
Albedo modification remains uncertain and risky, owing partly to a dearth of organized research into the subject. => 改变反射率仍充满不确定性和风险性，部分是因为这方面的有组织研究太少。
And, in fact, albedo modification would undoubtedly make some things worse. => 而事实上，改变反射率毫无疑问会让某些东西变得更糟。
But there is not a single climate model run that shows that a moderate intervention would make any region worse off overall. => 但没有一个气候模型表明，略作干预会让任何地区总体恶化。

Moreover, the large potential upside, measured in trillions of dollars, contrasts with low direct costs – in the single-digit billions for full-scale deployment. => 此外，巨大的潜在收益（高达亿万美元级别）与低廉的直接成本 — — 全部部署也只需要几十亿美元 — — 对比鲜明。
In fact, albedo modification is so cheap that direct costs will not be the deciding issue. => 事实上，改变反射率非常廉价，其直接成本根本不会成为决定性问题。
Instead, it is a risk-risk trade-off – one that will require more research to assess. => 相反，这是一个风险-风险权衡 — — 需要更多的研究来进行评估。
Given the lack of knowledge, no sensible person would push for deploying albedo modification today. => 考虑到这方面知识的不足，明智之士绝不会在今天部署改变反射率。
But it would make no sense to ignore its potential. => 但绝不应该忽略它的潜力。
After all, no one would argue that we should abandon research on a promising cancer drug because it is unproven. => 毕竟，没人会认为我们应该因为没有得到证实而放弃一种很有希望的癌症药物。

The US National Academy of Sciences first called attention to what it then described as “climate modification” in a 1983 report. => 美国科学院（US National Academy of Sciences）首次关注该问题是在一份1983的报告中，当时将该问题称为“气候改造 ” 。
It recommended careful research in 1992 and again in 2015. => 1992年和2015年，美国科学院建议进行仔细研究。

Major environmental groups such as the Environmental Defense Fund and the Natural Resources Defense Council support careful, small-scale research. => 主要环境组织，如环境保护基金（Environmental Defense Fund）和自然资源保护委员会（Natural Resources Defense Council ） ， 都支持仔细的小范围研究。
Yet no such program exists. => 但这些项目并不存在。
One reason for this is concern about the diversion of resources from other approaches. => 一个原因是担心其他方法的资源因此被分散。
And, of course, there are tradeoffs. => 当然，也有权衡问题。
But the US, for example, has an annual climate science budget of around $3 billion. => 但（比如）美国每年气候科学预算有30亿美元左右。
An exploratory solar geoengineering program, costing only a few tens of millions of dollars per year, is entirely feasible. => 一个太阳能地理工程实验项目每年只需要花费几千万美元，是完全可行的。
A larger obstacle to progress is fear that more attention to geoengineering solutions would sap motivation to cut emissions. => 阻碍进步的更大障碍是担心更多地关注地理工程解决方案不利于减排激励。
Maybe so, but it would be barking mad to take up smoking simply because an experimental cancer treatment showed some promise on a lab rat. => 也许如此，但如果你仅仅因为一项实验性癌症治疗方法在小白鼠身上出现了令人欣喜的效果就开始抽烟，那你一定是疯了。
China has initiated a limited research program on albedo modification. => 中国已经启动了一项有限的改变反射率研究项目。
The US has not. => 美国还没有。
The US government should take the lead now in researching albedo modification. => 目前，美国政府应该领衔改变反射率研究。

Even if the result was that albedo modification does not work, the dividends of such research would be enormous, owing to the added pressure to cut emissions. => 即使结果表明改变反射率没有用，这些研究所产生的红利也将是巨大的，因为这样能给减排带来更多压力。
And if it turned out to be successful, the social, environmental, and economic returns would be tremendous. => 而如果成功，其社会、环境和经济回报将不可限量。
India’s Prohibition Hypocrisy => 印度的禁令伪善

The victims were poisoned because this April, in a fit of moralism, Bihar adopted a draconian law prohibiting the sale, possession, and consumption of alcohol. => 受害者中毒的原因是今年4月比哈尔邦出于道德考虑实施了严苛的法律禁止酒精的销售、拥有和消费。
It is far from the first such ban that has ended badly. => 这绝非印度第一宗造成严重后果的禁令。

In a country where the national hero is the saintly Mahatma Gandhi, who considered alcohol an unmitigated evil, drinking has always carried a whiff of disrepute. => 在圣雄甘地被视为民族英雄的印度，饮酒一直被视为恶习。 甘地本人认为酒精是十足的恶魔。

India’s constitution, in its non-enforceable Directive Principles, urges Indians to work toward prohibition, and the government does not serve alcohol even at state banquets and official receptions. => 印度宪法以不具强制力的指导原则敦促印度人民厉行禁止，政府在国宴和公务接待中也不提供酒精饮料。

Four out of 29 Indian states (Bihar, Gujarat, Manipur, and Nagaland) and one union territory (Lakshadweep or the Laccadive Islands) are currently attempting to enforce total prohibition. => 印度29个邦中的四个（比哈尔、古吉拉特、曼尼普尔和那加兰）以及一个直辖区（拉克沙威或拉克代夫群岛）目前都在尝试强制性禁酒令。
But maintaining a sweeping prohibition policy has long proved difficult in India. => 但厉行禁止政策在印度向来困难重重。
In Manipur in 2002, the 1991 ban was lifted in five hill districts, where alcohol consumption is a centuries-old local tradition. => 2002年，曼普尔邦的1991年禁令在五个有着数百年饮酒风俗的山区被取消。
Lakshadweep makes an exception for an uninhabited island, where a tourist resort is allowed to operate a bar. => 拉克沙威的禁酒令也对其中一个岛屿豁免，一处度假区允许经营酒吧。
When I was a child, what was then Bombay excused anyone with a doctor’s note confirming alcoholism. => 在我小时候的孟买，如果你被医生判定为醉酒，就可以免于刑罚。
(Well-heeled executives tripped over themselves to be labeled alcoholics.) => （上层人士竞相给自己贴上酗酒者的标签。 ）
It has been backsliding ever since. => 此后该政策日益减弱。
A coastal state, Kerala has long been viewed as a tourist paradise – a reputation no doubt kept afloat on a sea of easily available libations. => 喀拉拉邦地处沿海地区，一直是旅游胜地 — — 这一盛名当然建立在想喝就喝的基础上。
Before the ban, Kerala held a somewhat dubious distinction: India’s highest per capita consumption of spirits. => 禁令实施前，喀拉拉邦保持着一项可疑的记录：印度最高人均酒精消费量。

But in India, where prohibition is popular among many segments of the electorate, politicians find it particularly difficult to resist the self-righteous urge to improve their fellow citizens. => 但在印度，禁令在许多选民细分群体中稀松平常，政客要抵制道貌岸然地敦促改善同胞境况的做法是十分困难的。
So Kerala’s government introduced the ban. => 因此，克拉拉邦政府实施了禁令。
And, at first, many approved. => 一开始，许多人都赞成。
The influential Christian churches applauded the move, as did the Christian-affiliated political parties. => 影响力巨大的基督教会赞赏该政策，受基督教会支持的政党亦然。

Kerala’s Muslim leadership, including the then-ruling coalition’s ally, the Indian Union Muslim League, was equally vocal in its support. => 喀拉拉邦的穆斯林领导层，包括时任执政联盟成员印度联合穆斯林同盟（Indian Union Muslim League）也是大力支持。
No public figure of any consequence in Kerala stood up to oppose the decision. => 在喀拉拉邦，每有一位有影响力的公众人物站出来反对这一决定。
But there were good reasons to oppose the ban – reasons that had nothing to do with religion, morality, or alcoholism. => 但有很好的理由应该反对该禁令 — — 这些理由与宗教、道德或酗酒无关。

Excise duties on liquor account for 22% of the state revenues that sustain generous welfare programs in Kerala, which boasts the best social development indicators in India. => 酒精税占喀拉拉邦收入的22 % ， 是维持其慷慨的福利政策的重要支柱，而喀拉拉邦的福利政策被夸赞为印度最佳社会发展指标。
Another 26% of state revenues come from tourism, which would surely also take a hit. => 另有26%的邦收入来自旅游业，而旅游业必然会因为禁酒令而遭受重创。
Furthermore, much of Kerala’s economic viability depends on dynamic knowledge and services sectors. => 此外，喀拉拉邦的大部分经济活力以来活跃的知识和服务界。
Attracting talent and investment from abroad would become much more difficult if prohibition hampered the state’s quality of life. => 如果禁酒令影响到喀拉拉邦的生活质量，吸引海外人才和投资将变得十分困难。
(IT professionals in Bangalore, in the neighboring state Karnataka, flock to that city’s bars and pubs after long hours at work.) => （毗邻的卡纳塔克邦的班加罗尔的IT人才都喜欢在结束了一天漫长的工作后去酒吧小酌一番。 ）
Kerala’s leaders should have known that their state could not afford to do without widely available, heavily taxed liquor. => 喀拉拉领导人应该知道，如果不让被课以重税的酒精畅通地流通，本邦收入将大受影响。
But they began to implement the policy anyway. => 但他们还是实施了禁酒令。
Almost immediately, 20,000 bar workers and distillery employees lost their jobs, in a state that already struggles with high unemployment. => 20,000酒吧和酿酒厂员工几乎在一夜之间失去了工作，而当时的喀拉拉邦已经因为高失业而步履维艰。

Tourism operators were stung by cancelations, as would-be visitors decided to visit Sri Lanka or Goa instead; 50% of existing convention bookings were canceled. => 旅游业经营者因为取消行程而遭遇重创，本打算来到喀拉拉邦的游客纷纷决定改去斯里兰卡或果阿；50%的会展预定被取消。
And IT companies contemplating moving to clean, green, tech-friendly Kerala expressed concern about the prohibition policy. => 打算迁往干净、绿色、技术友好的喀拉拉邦的IT公司纷纷表示对禁酒政策十分担心。

It was not long before Kerala’s government decided that prohibition would apply only to hard alcohol, and closed bars could reopen as wine and beer parlors. => 不久，喀拉拉邦政府决定禁酒令只对烈酒有效，已经关门的酒吧可以重新开张，销售葡萄酒和啤酒。
So Kerala is no longer hurtling toward disaster in the name of saving people from themselves. => 于是，喀拉拉邦不再打着从人民自己手中拯救人民的旗号走向灾难了。
Four states – Andhra Pradesh, Haryana, Mizoram, and Tamil Nadu – have repealed prohibition policies. => 有四个邦 — — 安德拉、哈里亚纳、米佐拉姆和泰米尔纳德 — — 都已经废除了禁令政策。
To be sure, not everyone loses out from a prohibition policy. => 诚然，并非所有人都因为禁令政策而受损。
In other words, excise duties from Kerala would now fill Tamil Nadu’s coffers. => 换句话说，喀拉拉邦的酒税现在落入了泰米尔拉德邦的金库中。
Banning alcohol in India has been economically devastating. => 在印度，禁酒一直是经济上的灾难。
Yet politicians continue to use the promise of prohibition to win votes. => 但政客仍然在用禁令承诺赢得选票。
When elections were called in Tamil Nadu early this year, its chief minister declared herself in favor of prohibition. => 今年年初，泰米尔拉德邦举行选举的时候，其首席部长宣布自己支持禁令。
After the election was won, however, all such talk discreetly subsided. => 但是，赢得选举后这些话被小心地回避了。
My late father liked to say: “India is not only the world’s largest democracy; we are also the world’s largest hypocrisy.” => 先父常言 ： “ 印度不但是世界上最大的民主国家；我们也是世界上最大的伪善者。
I suppose we can drink to that. => ”我觉得我们可以把这句话一饮而尽。
Leaders for a Leaderless World => 领导缺乏领袖的世界
PARIS – The newspaper commentaries that I write often have a dark perspective. => 巴黎 — — 我写的新闻评论往往从阴暗的角度出发。
Sadly, this one will be no different. => 可悲的是这一篇也不会例外。
But there are two pieces of good news that break through the gloom. => 但却有两则好消息能够冲破黑暗。
First, the global significance of US President Barack Obama’s reelection is clear: the world has escaped a disaster for international cooperation. => 首先，美国总统巴拉克·奥巴马再度当选发出了明确的信号：世界已经躲过了一场国际合作劫难。
The US was on the verge of sinking into isolationist nationalism, reinforced, perhaps, by xenophobic sentiment. => 美国已经处在孤立民族主义的边缘，仇外情绪或许进一步强化了这种现状。
The other piece of good news concerns France, and thus is more “local,” but is crucially important nonetheless. => 另一条好消息因为关乎法国而更有“地方性 ” ， 但其重要性却毫不逊色。
Manufacturing production has plummeted, the trade balance has deteriorated sharply, and corporate bankruptcies are increasingly frequent. => 制造业生产大幅下降、贸易收支急剧恶化，越来越多的企业濒临破产。
For six months, France has had new leadership – a new president, government, and parliament. => 六个月前，法国有了全新领导班子 — — 新总统、新政府和新议会。
Many began to wonder whether Hollande was aware of the scope of the crisis that the recent downturn might trigger. => 许多人开始怀疑奥朗德是否对不久前经济衰退可能引发的危机规模有着清醒的认识。
The VAT increase will hurt, but there was no other way. => 提高增值税会带来切肤之痛，但除此之外别无他法。
Awareness, boldness, and comprehensive policymaking have come as a relief to French investors, and have left them better positioned to face the crisis. => 清醒的头脑及大胆全面的决策令法国的投资者感到安心，让他们在面对危机时有更多办法。
The French government’s new push to confront the country’s economic plight matters not only to France, but to Europe and the world as well. => 法国政府应对国内经济困境的全新举措对法国、欧洲和世界都至关重要。
After all, France is the eurozone’s second-largest economy, and the fifth-largest economy in the world. => 毕竟法国是欧元区排名第二、世界排名第五的经济大国。

And yet, despite these bright spots, international cooperation on issues ranging from regional conflicts to the protection of global public goods remains weak. => 尽管有这些亮点，在从地区冲突到保护全球公众利益等领域的国际合作依然非常薄弱。
Antarctica, the only land in the world that is administered directly by the international community, is a recent case in point. => 南极洲这块世界范围内唯一由国际社会直接管理的大陆就是最新的例证。
The Antarctic Treaty, negotiated in 1959, prohibits any and all military activities in Antarctica and forbids the establishment of any borders. => 1959年谈判达成的南极条约禁止在南极洲从事一切军事活动或划定一切边界。

The Antarctic Treaty System includes three annual meetings: one deals with the supervision and management of the Treaty itself, and the other two concern the CCAMLR and the PEP. => 南极条约体系包含三次年会：其中一次涉及条约本身的监督和管理，另两次则与南极海洋生物资源养护委员会和《南极条约环境保护议定书》相关。

The principle that international cooperation is required to protect fishery resources, which are dwindling everywhere, was adopted at the 2011 CCAMLR meeting. => 2011年召开的南极海洋生物资源养护委员会会议确立了需要进行国际合作保护日益减少的渔业资源的原则。
They were compatible and would reinforce one another. => 上述提案不仅彼此之间没有冲突，而且还可以相互强化。
Yet the discussion foundered, and no decision was taken. => 可是讨论最终没能达成决议。
Russia and Ukraine – and, to a lesser extent, China – blocked efforts to reach an agreement. => 俄罗斯和乌克兰、其次还有中国妨碍了协议的达成。
That will not change until a new consciousness emerges worldwide to persuade states to support binding international law. => 除非说服各国政府支持有约束力的国际法的全新意识在世界各国扎根，否则这种状况很难发生变化。
The US has now reelected a president who understands this. => 美国目前连任的总统理解这一点的重要。
France has a president who understands the need for bold, far-reaching actions as well. => 法国也有一位理解必需采取大胆、意义深远行动的总统。
Their active leadership, and that of others, is needed now more than ever to turn the tide. => 我们现在比任何时候都需要他们及其他人的积极领导，才能帮助我们力挽狂澜、实现目标。
Assured Mutual Dependence => 确保相互依赖

Today, a very different race is taking place – a race for the earth’s vital resources, and it threatens to undermine stability in key regions of the world. => 如今，一场完全不同的竞赛正在展开 — — 地球关键资源竞赛，这场竞赛可能会动摇世界关键地区的稳定性。

The growing dependence of countries on one another’s food, water, and energy requires that the global response to sustainability is taken to the highest political level. => 各国日益依赖他国的粮食、水和能源，这要求我们把可持续性的全球响应列为最高政治等级。
Unlike the nuclear arms race of the twentieth century, the resource-security agenda is not linear. => 与二十世纪的核武竞赛不同，资源安全日程不是线性的。
Mutually assured destruction was explicitly acknowledged during the Cold War in statements from both sides. => 确保互相摧毁白纸黑字地写在冷战期间对立双方的声明中。

In the race for resources that defines the twenty-first century, no actor is directly or indirectly threatening other players to curtail food or energy exports, but all bear the systemic risks. => 在成为二十一世纪特征的资源竞赛中，没有哪个行动方直接或间接地威胁其他行动方减少粮食和能源出口，但所有人都承担着系统性风险。

Countries have become unavoidably interdependent, and climate change, water stress, and the loss of ecological resilience all increase the volatility of this mutual dependence. => 各国都不可避免地变得互相依赖，气候变化、水压力和生态恢复力的下降都增加了这一互相依赖的波动性。
In a world of limited and scarce resources, countries and companies will be forced to make decisions that affect one another’s security. => 世界的资源是有限而稀缺的，国家和公司将被迫做出互相影响安全的决定。
The ESI identifies four areas of mutual dependence that will likely shape global security in the coming decades: => ESI认为，四个互相依赖领域可能会影响未来数十年的全球安全：
·         Choke points. => ·         梗阻点。
Countries’ growing demand for energy, water, food, and land cannot be satisfied without incurring tradeoffs among limited available resources. => 各国的能源、水、粮食和土地需求无法在不进行有限可得资源之间的权衡的情况下得到满足。
Choke points are reached when the available resources are insufficient to satisfy demand. => 当可得资源不足以满足需求时，便达到了梗阻点。

In China and India, for example, this means that in certain regions there may not be enough water in the short term to run coal-fired thermal power stations and irrigate large fields to grow crops. => 比如，在中国和印度，这意味着一些地区无法在短期获得足够的水运行燃煤热电厂和灌溉大片土地种植庄稼。
In China, 60% of planned coal-fired power plants will be built in water-stressed regions. => 在中国，60%的规划燃煤电厂将建于水资源紧缺地区。
·         Food. => ·         粮食。

The growing dependence of many countries on food, water, and energy imports creates new opportunities for trade and investment, but it also exposes countries to critical vulnerabilities. => 许多国家对粮食、水和能源进口依赖日益增加为贸易和投资创造了新的机会，但也让国家暴露出关键弱点。
Australia, for example, is a large coal exporter but imports most of its refined fuels and holds just three days of fuel stockpiles. => 比如，澳大利亚是煤炭出口大国，但精炼燃料大部分依靠进口，燃料储备只够用三天。
The challenges of mutual dependence are particularly acute with respect to food. => 互相依赖的挑战在粮食方面尤其突出。

As the ESI shows, some countries – including Egypt, Peru, and the United Arab Emirates – are heavily dependent on cereal imports from a small number of suppliers. => ESI指出，一些国家 — — 包括埃及、秘鲁和阿联酋 — — 严重依赖少数供应国的谷物进口。

Moreover, grain suppliers’ exposure to extreme weather may compromise their ability to sustain supplies, with knock-on effects for import-dependent countries. => 此外，谷物供应国又容易受极端天气的冲击，这可能制约它们的持续供应能力，从而让进口依赖国连带遭殃。
In 2010, for example, Russia imposed an export ban on wheat, following a severe drought. => 比如，2010年，俄罗斯因为严重干旱实施了小麦出口禁令。
The resulting food-price increases are believed to have played a role in Egypt’s revolution. => 据信由此造成的粮食价格上涨在埃及革命中扮演了重要角色。
·         Teleconnections. => ·         遥相关。
Anticipating systemic ecological risks will be increasingly important for sectors such as reinsurance and infrastructure investments. => 预测系统性生态风险将对再保险和基础设施投资等部门越来越重要。
“Teleconnections” refer to weather events that are related to one another over large geographic distances. => “遥相关”是指地理距离很远的天气事件彼此之间互相联系。

They are well known to science but not properly discussed by the industries, investors, and governments whose security depends on environmental stability. => 科学界对此早已熟知，但在安全系于环境稳定性的产业界、投资者和政府中间还没有得到应有的讨论。

For example, tropical rainforests play a crucial function in maintaining stable weather and rainfall, acting as a “pump” that helps moisture travel between different regions. => 比如，热带雨林在保持稳定天气和降雨方面起着关键作用，起着帮助不同地区间的水传播的“泵”的作用。

Deforestation can thus have a destabilizing effect on weather patterns, amplifying the frequency and severity of extreme events such as floods and droughts. => 因此，毁林对天气路径具有破坏性影响，加剧了洪水和干旱等极端事件的频率和严重程度。
The resulting liabilities to key industries and the financial sector are clear. => 由此产生的关键产业和金融部门的责任是明确的。
In some regions of India, for example, these issues are playing out in tandem. => 比如，在印度的一些地区，这些问题都存在。
Countries and companies will increasingly need to invest in sustainable land in order to hedge their resource risks. => 国家和公司将越来越需要投资于可持续土地以规避这些资源风险。

In 2015, global frameworks are due to be agreed to address climate change, coordinate responses to natural disasters, and guide the world’s development agenda. => 2015年将形成一致的全球框架以纠正气候变化、协调自然灾害反应、指导全球发展日程。

Some of these multilateral processes – in particular, those seeking an ambitious global climate agreement – appear to be moving in slow motion and against the grain of geopolitical interests. => 一些多边过程 — — 特别是那些雄心勃勃的全球气候协议 — — 进展缓慢，不符合地缘政治利益。
