In the past, the case for high-level nuclear governance was urgent and clear, but required processes for creating a common understanding of risks and opportunities across national borders. => 在过去，高级别核治理的需求是紧迫而明确的，但需要创造对风险和机遇的超越国界的共同理解的过程。
Here, too, the world will need to create informal platforms that supplement traditional multilateralism. => 在这方面，世界还需要建立非正式平台以补充传统多边主义。
In particular, the outdated divisions between rich and poor countries and their responsibilities must be revised. => 特别是，富国和穷国过时两分法和他们的责任必须重新定义。

As new powers like China, Brazil, India, and other G-20 economies bid to reform global governance systems, their vulnerability to resource security must invigorate these processes. => 中国、巴西、印度和等新的大国和其他G-20经济体提出了全球治理体系改革，它们在资源安全方面的脆弱性应该对这些过程起到刺激作用。
Only then will the world be on track to improve the security of all. => 惟其如此，世界才会走向改善所有人的安全的道路。
After Aleppo => 阿勒颇之后
DENVER – The end of the fighting in Aleppo will not end the Syrian war, despite the countrywide ceasefire that has just been agreed. => 丹佛—阿拉破战事的结束不会结束叙利亚战争，尽管已经达成全国停火协议。
Nor will it ease the suffering of the city’s population, much of which has been displaced. => 阿勒颇市民的苦难也得不到缓解 — — 其中许多人已经流离失所。

What the Aleppo siege will do is clinch Syria’s place in history as, to borrow former US Secretary of State Warren Christopher’s phrase, another “problem from hell.” => 阿勒颇围城赢得了什么呢？ 赢得了叙利亚的历史地位 — — 用美国前国务卿沃伦·克里斯托弗（Warren Christopher）的话说，叙利亚是又一个“来自地狱的问题 ” 。
Good diplomacy begins with a keen analysis of interests, both of the country in question and of relevant external powers. => 好的外交必须从敏锐的利益分析开始，分析对象既包括问题所在国家，也包括相关外部力量。
It demands a careful assessment of how the pursuit of those interests will affect the regional and international order. => 必须仔细评估追求各种利益如何影响地区和国际秩序。
And it seeks ways to strengthen the capacity of regional or world powers to help solve problems. => 必须找出办法增强地区或世界力量帮助解决问题的能力。

The key is to ensure that values do not become weapons, deployed by one actor against another in a way that exacerbates tensions and undermines solutions. => 至关重要的是确保价值观不会变成某个行动方针对另一个行动方、加剧冲突、破坏解决方案的武器。

Consider the 1990s Bosnian War – the result of unfinished business from the breakup of the Austrian and Ottoman empires and the creation of nation-states earlier in the twentieth century. => 以20世纪90年代的波斯尼亚战争为例 — — 这场战争是20世纪初奥地利和奥斯曼帝国分裂、民族国家建立的历史遗留问题的演化结果。

The conflict erupted in the immediate aftermath of the Cold War, at a moment when one set of international organizing principles had collapsed and a new set had not yet been created. => 这场冲突爆发于冷战刚刚结束时，正逢一套国际组织原则崩溃、新一套组织原则尚未建立起来的空隙。
Partly as a result of this, the conflict was characterized by large-scale civilian carnage and human-rights violations. => 部分拜这一因素所赐，这场冲突引起了大规模杀戮平民和侵犯人权的局面。

But, as a test for the new world order, the Bosnian War ended up catalyzing change in the international community’s institutional structure (including the establishment of war crimes tribunals). => 但是，作为新世界秩序的一次考验，波斯尼亚战争最终促使国际社会制度结构发生了改变（包括建立了战争罪法庭 ） 。
Could the nascent post-Cold War system handle the inchoate problems of the former Soviet Union? => 方兴未艾的冷战后体系能否处理前苏联解体后所爆发的第一批问题？
Could NATO take on new roles and missions? => 北约能否担任新角色、完成新任务？
Could the West work with the new Russian Federation? => 西方能否与新建立的俄罗斯联邦合作？
Could the transatlantic relationship weather the storm? => 跨大西洋关系能否抵挡这场风暴？
The answer to all of these questions turned out to be yes. => 所有这些问题的答案最后都是肯定的。
As a result, though the region continues to be beset by serious problems, the gates of hell have remained closed – as they have in Rwanda. => 因此，尽管该地区一直受到严重问题的困扰，但地狱之门仍然没有打开 — — 卢旺达也是如此。
And yet, just 20 years later, it seems that the world’s collective memory of how to cooperate has failed. => 但是，仅仅过去了20年，世界关于合作的集体记忆就好像失效了。
To be sure, there was never a clear path to peace in Syria. => 平心而论，叙利亚从未出现明晰的和平路径。
The temptation to seek regime change – a goal embraced by the United States and some European countries – was understandable. => 叙利亚人民寻求颠覆政权 — — 美国和一些欧洲国家支持这一目标 — — 是可以理解的。
And make no mistake: there are a lot of (often conflicting) opinions and interests. => 不要弄错了：有许多（常常互相冲突的）观点和利益。

After all, Syria is strategically perched on the Mediterranean; shares borders with Israel, Jordan, Turkey, and Iraq; and, like Iraq, has its own restive Kurdish minority. => 毕竟，叙利亚是地中海的一个战略要点；与以色列、约旦、土耳其和伊拉克接壤；并且与伊拉克一样，也存在桀骜难驯的库尔德少数民族。
It is not the kind of country to which international and regional powers would be indifferent. => 这绝不是国际和地区力量能够忽视的国家。

In fact, when Western powers called for regime change, other actors – including Iran, Russia, and Shia interests in neighboring Lebanon – objected. => 事实上，当西方力量要求政权更迭时，其他行动方 — — 包括伊朗、俄罗斯和相邻的黎巴嫩的什叶派利益集团 — — 表示反对。

Nonetheless, the US soldiered on with its own poorly formulated agenda, supplying weapons to virtually unknown combatants on the ground before properly vetting them. => 尽管如此，美国一意孤行地推行自身相当拙劣的日程，在没有进行合理评估的情况下就为当地它几乎毫无所知的战斗力量提供武器。
That gave the Assad regime’s allies all the justification they needed to supply weapons of their own. => 这给了阿萨德政权的盟友所需要的口实提供它们自身的武器。
Some argue that, if the US had just provided more weapons sooner, Assad would not have had time to galvanize support and hold onto power. => 有人认为，如果美国更快地提供更多武器，阿萨德根本没有时间巩固支持、坚守权力。

But that neglects the strategic importance of Syria to so many external powers, as well as the fragmentation and unpredictability of the US-based combatants. => 但这忽视了叙利亚对如此众多的外部力量的战略重要性，以及依靠美国的战斗力量的分散性和不可预测性。
America’s real mistake was failing to engage with all sides, including Assad and the Sunni opposition, which it deemed sectarian. => 美国的真正错误是没有协调所有各方，包括阿萨德和它视为宗派力量的逊尼派反对派。
(During the Bosnian War, by contrast, the US talked to rump Yugoslavia’s ruler, Slobodan Milošević.) => （相反，在波斯尼亚战争期间，美国与南斯拉夫统治者米洛舍维奇谈判。

With that narrow-minded approach – reflected in the lack of any articulated vision for a post-war Syria – the US effectively handed the diplomatic reins over to Russia. => ）美国的思维狭隘的方针 — — 它没有描述任何战后叙利亚愿景就是明证 — — 将外交主动权拱手让给了俄罗斯。

Now, the US is essentially playing the role of agitator, offering little more than displays of moral outrage and stale references to a stillborn Geneva process. => 如今，美国实际上已经沦为“搅屎棍 ” ， 除了表示义愤和言必称早已流产的日内瓦进程的陈词滥调再也拿不出什么东西。

Reacting to the carnage in Aleppo, Samantha Power, the US ambassador to the United Nations, was reduced to demanding of Assad’s Russian ally, “Are you truly incapable of shame?” => 对于阿勒颇大屠杀，美国驻联合国大使萨蔓莎·��威尔（Samantha Power）竟然卑微到质问阿萨德的俄罗斯盟友“你们真的没有羞耻感吗？
Meanwhile, the conflict rages on, with severe spillover effects on US allies like the European Union. => ”与此同时，冲突仍在肆虐，并给欧盟的美国盟友造成严重的 溢出效应。
As for Russia, it, too, is pursuing a version of diplomacy that utterly lacks inclusiveness. => 至于俄罗斯，它也在追求严重缺乏包容性的外交。
Iran will be there. => 伊朗也将出席。
But where are the Sunni Arab states? => 但逊尼派阿拉伯国家呢？
More important, where is the US? => 更重要的是，美国呢？
It is often observed that, every four years, the US does without a foreign policy. => 人们常常观察到，每隔四年，美国就会迷失于外交政策。
This time, it seems to have gotten an early start. => 这一回，迷失来的早了一些。
Alexander Hamilton’s Eurozone Tour => 亚历山大·汉密尔顿的欧元区之旅
PRINCETON – Europe’s debt crisis has piqued Europeans’ interest in American precedents for federal finance. => 普林斯顿—欧洲债务危机激发了欧洲人关于美国联邦财政经验的兴趣。
For many, Alexander Hamilton has become a contemporary hero. => 对许多人来说，亚历山大·汉密尔顿称得上是一位当代英雄。
Perhaps one day his face should appear on the €10 banknote. => 或许有朝一日他的头像会出现在10欧元的钞票上。
Indeed, after Thomas Sargent won the Nobel Prize in Economics last year, he cited it as a precedent in his acceptance speech. => 事实上，托马斯·萨金特（Thomas Sargent）去年获得诺贝尔奖之后，在获奖演说中援引了汉密尔顿的举措作为先例。

Hamilton argued – against James Madison and Thomas Jefferson – that the debts accumulated by the states during the War of Independence should be assumed by the federation. => 汉密尔顿针对詹姆斯·麦迪逊和托马斯·杰斐逊的观点争锋相对地指出，各州在独立战争期间所积累的债务应该被认为是联邦债务。
There were two sides to his case, one practical, the other philosophical. => 他的观点包括两个方面，一是实践方面，而是理论方面。

“When the credit of a country is in any degree questionable,” he argued, “it never fails to give an extravagant premium upon all the loans it has occasion to make.” => 汉密尔顿强调，作为公共经济的先决条件，健康财政的承诺是很重要的。

While that logic certainly appeals to Europeans today, Hamilton insisted on a stronger reason for pursuing sound finance than merely the pursuit of expediency. => 汉密尔顿的逻辑对当今欧洲十分适用，但当初汉密尔顿之所以要追求健康财政，并不仅是为了便宜行事，而是有更深的理由。
There is, he maintained, “an intimate connection between public virtue and public happiness.” => 他说 ， “ 公德和公共福祉之间具有紧密联系。
That virtue consisted in honoring commitments, and it would build solidarity in the new political community of the United States. => ”公德在于信守承诺，能够为合众国营造团结的新政治氛围。
Indeed, public virtue made federal finance what he called “the powerful cement of our union.” => 事实上，公德让联邦财政成为汉密尔顿口中的“我们的联邦的强力粘合剂 ” 。

The condition for success in the American case was that the US raised its own revenue, with federally administered customs houses initially providing the bulk of its receipts. => 美国能够成功的条件在于它能获得收入 — — 美国拥有联邦管辖的海关，建国初期，财政收入的大头都来自关税。
In the American case, however, unity carried a price: a ceiling was imposed on Virginia’s exposure to the common debt. => 但是，美国的统一不是没有代价的：弗吉尼亚州就有一个对共同债务敞口的最高上限。
Only this inducement to the most powerful state in the union persuaded Madison to drop his opposition to the proposal. => 而正是以此为条件将最强大的州引入联邦才说服了麦迪逊不再反对汉密尔顿的方案。
The US experiment in federalized finance was not immediately successful. => 美国财政联邦化的实验并没有获得马上的成功。
Two important components of Hamilton’s financial architecture were not realized, or were realized imperfectly. => 汉密尔顿财政结构中，有两个重要部分无法实现（或无法完美实现 ） 。

He proposed a model of joint-stock banking on a national scale, which ran into immediate opposition (curiously, his proposal was much more influential in Canada). => 他提出了在全国范围内建立合资银行业的方案，但立刻招来了反对（有趣的是，这一提案在加拿大产生了重大影响力 ） 。
Second, opponents eventually blocked his proposal for a national central bank. => 其次，反对派最终否决了他建立国家中央银行的方案。
Nor did the Hamiltonian scheme of federal finance guarantee a peaceful commonwealth. => 汉密尔顿的联邦财政担保机制也没有保证联邦的和平。
In fact, the fiscal union proved to be explosive rather than adhesive. => 事实上，财政联盟与其说是内敛性的，还不如说是爆发性的。

As international capital markets developed in the early nineteenth century, state governments borrowed on a large scale, quickly turning them from creditors into debtors. => 19世纪早期，随着国际资本市场的发展，州政府借贷规模很大，很快就从债权人变成了债务人。
A wave of state defaults followed in the late 1830’s. => 接着，在19世纪30年代，爆发了一波州政府违约潮。
The federal assumption of states’ debts by itself could not guarantee political order. => 将各州债务算为联邦债务并不能保证政治秩序。
The Civil War revealed the centrality of a common foundation of morality to Hamilton’s approach to debt and public finance. => 美国内战表明，对于汉密尔顿的债务和公共财政方法，道德才是共同基础的核心。
As a result, his approach foundered on the differences between the different states’ conception of morality. => 因此，在各州道德观念不一的背景下，汉密尔顿的方法失败了。

The extended and politicized debate about debt restructuring has made a Hamiltonian solution more difficult, because the credit of the countries that would be party to it has become questionable. => 欧洲没完没了的关于债务重组的政治化争论使得实行汉密尔顿式的解决方案难上加难，因为其中所牵涉到的国家信用颇为可疑。
Debt exceeding that amount would be left to the responsibility of the member states. => 超过这一限度的债务将由成员国自己负责。

The lesson to be learned from Hamilton and the US is that the necessary institutions will not function without a greater degree of moral consensus as well. => 汉密尔顿和美国留给欧洲人的教训是，即使有了必要的制度，如果没有较大程度的一直道德观，这些制度也起不了作用。
Can Navalny Save Russia? => 纳瓦尔尼能拯救俄罗斯吗？

Fourteen years later, the Decembrist revolt – a movement of poets and army officers to topple Czar Nicholas I and establish a constitutional monarchy – seemed to refute de Maistre’s claim. => ”十四年后，十二月革命 — — 诗人和军官推翻沙皇尼古拉斯一世、实现君主立宪的运动 — — 似乎驳倒了迈斯特的结论。
Yet the revolt was suppressed, and the Decembrists were executed or exiled. => 但革命遭到了镇压，十二月革命党人被处死或流放。
One doomed officer famously declared, “You can’t hang us all.” => 一位被处决的官员说了一句名言 ： “ 你无法绞死我们所有人。 ”
Russia’s brutal twentieth century, with its totalitarianism and gulags, nearly proved that officer – and de Maistre – wrong. => 俄罗斯的野蛮二十世纪及其集权主义和古拉格几乎证明了这位官员 — — 以及迈斯特 — — 的错误。
No one “deserves” to be ruled so monstrously. => 没人“应得”被如此残暴统治的命运。
An estimated 20 million Russians perished under Stalin’s rule, and the rest were paralyzed with terror. => 据估计，2000万俄罗斯人丧生于斯大林的统治，其余人也在恐怖中惶惶不可终日。
The twenty-first century has been kinder to Russians, at least so far. => 二十一世纪对俄罗斯人来说要和善得多，至少到目前是如此。

But, while terror and famine have been absent, many of the oppressive tactics of the past have been revived under Vladimir Putin’s misrule, now in its 14th year. => 但是，尽管恐怖和饥馑已不复存在，但许多过去的镇压手段在普京的暴政下 — — 目前正处于第14年 — — 卷土重来。
None of them envisaged rotting in a labor camp like Khodorkovsky. => 没人敢设想像霍尔多科夫斯基那样被关进劳动营。
Under Putin, it seems, de Maistre’s maxim has received a new lease on life. => 在普京治下，迈斯特似乎又要一语成谶。

Then in 2011, massive protests against Putin and his party of “crooks and thieves” erupted, and Alexei Navalny, who coined that epithet, became the face of Russia’s opposition. => 接着，在2011年，俄罗斯爆发了针对普京及其“骗子和小偷”党的大规模示威 ， “ 骗子和小偷”这一称呼的始作俑者纳瓦尔尼（Alexei Navalny）成了俄罗斯反对派的代言人。
Navalny, a 37-year-old anti-corruption lawyer, has been a thorn in Putin’s side ever since. => 这位37岁的反腐律师自此被视为普京的眼中钉。

Recently, he announced that he has presidential ambitions; in the meantime, he is seeking to become the mayor of Moscow (arguably the second most important political post in Russia). => 最近，他声称有雄心竞选总统；与此同时，他还寻求成为莫斯科市长（被认为是俄罗斯第二重要的政治职位 ） 。

The incumbent mayor, Sergey Sobyanin, who has the full support of the Kremlin political-media machine, has been receiving personal-approval ratings above 90% in recent opinion polls. => 现任莫斯科市长索比亚宁（Sergey Sobyanin）拥有克里姆林政治宣传机器的全力支持，在当前的民调中获得了90%以上的个人支持率。
But Navalny’s approval ratings are not far behind, at 80%, and he has achieved them entirely on his own. => 但纳瓦尔尼的支持率也不遑多让，达到了80 % ， 且几乎完全是靠一己之力获得的。

Navalny’s candidacy received a recent boost when he became a convicted criminal, following a trial that resembled Khodorkovsky’s in terms of blatant political manipulation. => 最近纳瓦尔尼的竞选活动因为他被政治操纵之赤裸堪与霍尔多科夫斯基案相提并论的定罪而获得了提振。
Accused of fraud, Navalny received a five-year prison sentence for allegedly embezzling from Kirovles, a provincial timber company. => 纳瓦尔尼被控欺诈，因为挪用省级木材公司Kirovles公款而被判处五年有期徒刑。
But, in an unusual twist, Navalny was released from custody pending appeal of his conviction only a day after it was handed down. => 但是，经过一番不同寻常的周折，在判决下达仅仅一天后，纳瓦尔尼就从监禁中被释放。
That, some say, was because his supporters immediately took to the streets. => 有人说，这是因为他的支持者立刻涌上了街头。
The likelier motivation is that Putin decided to let the election play out, relying on Navalny to lose. => 更有可能的动机是普京决定让选举这出戏演完，他认定纳瓦尔尼会输。
But what if Navalny is elected? => 但如果纳瓦尔尼当选怎么办？
Would his sentence be commuted, postponed, or annulled? => 他的刑期会被缩短、中止还是取消？
Would he go to prison, Muscovites’ choice notwithstanding? => 还是会无视莫斯科人民的选择被关进监狱？

In a new challenge to de Maistre’s maxim, almost 200 young businessmen overcame the fear inspired by Khodorkovsky’s fate and donated funds to Navalny’s campaign. => 在这一迈斯特谶语的新挑战中，近200名年轻商人克服了来自霍多尔科夫斯基命运的恐惧，为纳瓦尔尼的选战慷慨解囊。
Thirty-seven of them signed what they called a new “social contract.” => 其中37人在他们所谓的新“社会契约”上签了字。

According to their manifesto, they “expect Navalny to defend the rule of law, support independent courts, and ensure that officials are really accountable before society.” => 根据他们的宣言，他们“期待纳瓦尔尼捍卫法治精神，支持司法独立，并确保社会真正可以问责官员。
Most of these young entrepreneurs have risen within the “knowledge economy.” => 这些年轻企业家大多崛起于“知识经济 ” 。
All of them have good educations, and many hold American business degrees. => 他们所有人都受过良好的教育，许多拥有美国商学学位。
And Putin himself has become an insufferably vulgar embarrassment. => 普金本身也变成了一桩令人难以忍受的恶俗闹剧。

To be sure, Navalny’s backers could emigrate comfortably; but, invigorated by their candidate’s campaign, they are willing to see whether he can make a difference. => 平心而论，纳瓦尔尼的支持者可以方便地移民国外；但是，受纳瓦尔尼选战的鼓舞，他们愿意看看他能否带来不同。
Indeed, Navalny has become the only hope for competitive politics in Russia. => 事实上，纳瓦尔尼已经成为俄罗斯竞争政治的唯一希望。
At the same time, Navalny’s unapologetic nationalism makes many people nervous. => 与此同时，纳瓦尔尼拒不让步的民族主义立场让许多人感到紧张。
And, while Russian leaders may start out as reformers, they do not often remain so. => 而尽管俄罗斯领导人不乏以改革者身份登场者，但能坚持下来的人很少。

Boris Yeltsin began the 1990’s as a courageous democrat, only to end up a corrupt, bibulous buffoon, while Putin initially vowed to bring law and order to the post-Yeltsin chaos. => 叶利钦以勇敢的民主派身份开启了1990年代，但在结束政治生涯时，他的形象是一个腐败的醉鬼，而普京在上任之初也宣誓要给叶利钦身后的混乱局面带来法律和秩序。

So Moscow’s mayoral election is a moment of truth for Navalny, the business leaders investing in his campaign, all Muscovites, and perhaps Russia as a whole. => 因此，莫斯科市长选举是纳瓦尔尼、投资于他的商业领袖、所有莫斯科市民甚至整个俄罗斯的真相时刻。
As in the time of the Decembrists, anyone in Russia can suffer from overweening government power, regardless of political belief. => 正如十二月革命时期，任何俄罗斯人遭遇恣睢的政府权力侵害，不管他的政见如何。
Fear and apathy have become riskier than taking a stand. => 恐惧和冷漠比现实立场更加危险。

But the question remains: Come September 8, can Navalny and his supporters change Russia’s political culture of fear, or was de Maistre right after all? => 但问题依然：9月8日来临时，纳瓦尔尼及其支持者能否改变俄罗斯恐惧的政治文化？ 还是迈斯特会笑到最后？
How We Lose Our Marbles => 我们是怎样丧失理智的

In the early nineteenth century, the friezes and sculptures were removed from the Parthenon by Lord Elgin, Britain’s ambassador to the Ottoman Empire from 1799 to 1803. => 十九世纪初，1799至1803年任英国驻奥斯曼帝国大使的埃尔金勋爵将雕像和饰物搬出了帕台农神庙。
Elgin sold them to the British government, which put them in the British Museum. => 埃尔金把雕像出售给英国政府，英国政府将这些文物放在大英博物馆展出。
Greece wants them back. => 现在希腊想要回这些文物。

The occasion for this latest round of historical jousting is the release of Clooney’s new film The Monuments Men, which details Allied efforts to rescue art works from the Nazis during World War II. => 克鲁尼新片《古迹卫士》的上映引发了本轮历史争议，这部影片描述的是二战时期从纳粹手中拯救艺术品的联合行动。
But the film is of less interest in this dispute than the identity of the characters involved. => 但影片的核心与其说是关注这场争议，还不如说是展现角色性格。
Perhaps the most important question is this: Whom is the public inclined to believe – Clooney or Johnson (or perhaps the Nazis)? => 或许最重要的问题是：公众更愿意相信谁 — — 克鲁尼还是约翰逊（或者纳粹 ） ？
Of course, one might ask why the people involved should matter at all; surely the facts of the case should speak for themselves. => 当然，有人可能会问这与当时的参与者有什么关系；本案的事实理应是不言自明的。

And yet, on questions such as this – as with so many important political, social, economic, and cultural issues – what we come to believe is not based on the facts alone, if at all. => 但这件事就像很多重要的政治、社会、经济和文化问题一样，人们的看法远不止立足于事实。

Social and cognitive psychologists have long understood these two basic processes in their study of “dual-process” models, which explain how we process information and eventually form an opinion. => 社会及认知心理学家早就在对人类处理信息及最终判断的“双进程”模型的研究中了解了这两种基本进程。

Psychological research has shown that any one of these three can be persuasive, depending on the speaker’s attractiveness or the audience’s predisposition. => 心理学研究表明这三点当中的任何一点都可以很有说服力，而说服力的大小取决于演讲者的魅力以及听众自身的倾向性。

But in most cases, when people are confronted with matters of great importance, they are more likely to use the so-called central route to information processing, and rightly so. => 但多数情况下当面对重要问题时，人们更有可能采取所谓信息处理的中枢路线，而且这也是理所当然的。
Issues of world cultural heritage, for example, deserve conscious, thoughtful deliberation of the facts. => 比方说世界文化遗产问题就需要自觉、全面的考虑现实情况。

At that point, only one conclusion is possible: The plundered Marbles must be reunited in their historical home and exhibited to the world as the ancient artists intended. => 因此，只有一个可能的结论：被夺走的大理石雕像必须回归其历史家园，按照古代艺术家的意愿向全世界展出。
Persuaded? => 被我说服了？
Perhaps not – I am Greek, after all. => 也许没有 — — 毕竟我是希腊人。
But do not take Clooney’s word for it, either (or Johnson’s). => 但不要听信克鲁尼，也不能盲从约翰逊。
Deciding the disposition of the world’s cultural patrimony is not like buying a toaster. => 决定世界文化遗产的归属不像买面包机那样简单。
Living Big Data => 活的大数据
CAMBRIDGE – Big data is made from the digital trail that we leave behind when we use credit cards, mobile phones, or the Web. => 美国剑桥—大数据来自我们使用信用卡、移动电话或网络后留下的数字痕迹。
Used carefully and accurately, these data give us unprecedented scope to understand our society, and improve the way we live and work. => 小心正确地使用这些数据能给我们带来前所未有的角度理解我们的社会，改善我们生活和工作的方式。

But what works in theory may not translate well in the real world, where complex human interactions cannot always be captured, even by the most sophisticated models. => 但理论上有效并不意味着在现实世界中管用，在现实世界中，复杂的人际互动未必总能把握，即便你使用最现金的模型。
Big data requires us to experiment on a big scale. => 大数据要求我们进行大规模实验。
This new capability allows viewers to see, for example, where government initiatives are working or failing. => 这一新功能能让访问者了解（比如）某地的政府计划是见效了还是失败了。

But, while such impressive visualization tools can dramatically enhance transparency and public knowledge, they are surprisingly limited when applied to solving society’s problems. => 但是，尽管这些令人瞩目的可视化工具能够极大地增加透明度和公共知识，但在被用于解决社会问题时，它们的作用仍然非常有限。
One reason is that such rich streams of data encourage spurious correlations. => 一个原因是如此丰富的数据流引起了不可靠的相关性。
Without knowing all possible alternatives, we cannot form a limited, testable set of clear hypotheses. => 在不了解所有可能的替代方法的情况下，我们无法形成一个有限的、可检验的明确假说集。
And if we can no longer rely on laboratory experiments to test causality, we must test it in the real world, using massive volumes of real-time data. => 而如果我们能够不再依赖实验室实验检验因果关系，就必须在真实世界中使用大量实时数据进行检验。

This involves moving beyond the closed, question-and-answer process typical of the lab, and applying our ideas in society, earlier and more frequently than ever before. => 这需要超越封闭的、以提问-回答为顺序的典型的实验室过程，提早并以比从前任何时候更频繁地在社会中应用我们的思想。

To see how things work in reality, we must construct living laboratories – that is, communities willing to try new ways of doing things (to be blunt, to act as guinea pigs). => 为了了解现实中的事物怎样运行，我们必须构建生活实验室 — — 即愿意尝试新方法做事的社区（能够直言，充当小白鼠 ） 。

Importantly, this living lab has the approval and informed consent of all involved; they understand that they are participating in a gigantic experiment whose goal is to create a better way of living. => 重要的是，这个生活实验室获得了所有参与者的知情同意和批准；他们都知道自己在参与一个巨型实验，目标是创造更好的生活方式。
One major challenge for a living lab is to protect individual privacy without diminishing the potential for better government. => 生活实验室的一大主要挑战是保护个人隐私而不影响形成更好的政府的潜力。

But the biggest difficulty in using big data to build a better society is being able to develop a human-scale, intuitive understanding of social physics. => 但使用大数据创造更好社会的最大困难是发展人体尺度的对社会物理学（social physics）的直观理解。

What is needed is some kind of dialogue between human intuition and the compelling reality of big data – a dialogue that is currently absent from management and government systems. => 我们需要的是某种形式的人类直觉和大数据的令人信服的现实之间的对话 — — 目前的管理和政府体系中缺少这种对话。
If big data is to be deployed effectively, people must be able to understand and interpret the relevant statistics. => 要想有效部署大数据，人们就必须能够理解和解读相关统计数字。
This calls for a new understanding of human behavior and social dynamics that goes beyond traditional economic and political models. => 这就需要对超越传统经济和政治模型的人类行为和社会动态做出新的理解。
Only by developing the science and language of social physics will we be able to make a world of big data a world in which we want to live. => 只有发展社会物理学的科学和语言，我们才能让大数据世界成为我们愿意生活其中的世界。
Peril and Promise in Algeria => 阿尔及利亚的危险和前途
MADRID – Five years after the start of the so-called Arab Spring, the hope that initially characterized those revolutions has largely been dashed. => 马德里—所谓的阿拉伯之春爆发已经过去了五年，这些革命最初被寄以厚望，如今，这些希望大多落空。
In many cases, the revolutions have evolved into brutal and protracted internal conflicts, with no solution in sight. => 在许多国家，革命演变为残酷的长期国内冲突，看不到解决办法。

Amid all of this strife, the international community has paid little attention to countries like Algeria, where the revolutionary spirit was stifled while still incipient. => 在所有这些冲突中，国际社会几乎没人关注阿尔及利亚等国家。 阿尔及利亚的革命精神尚未完全萌发便被扼杀。
But Algeria’s fate is back on the world’s radar – and not a moment too soon. => 但阿尔及利亚的命运已经进入了国际社会的视野 — — 差一点就来不及了。
These steps, in the making since 2011, aim to strengthen Algeria’s democratic standing; but they have been widely criticized as insufficient. => 这些从2011年开始酝酿的措施旨在增强阿尔及利亚的民主；但很多人批评阿尔及利亚做得还不够。
What is not in doubt is that the reforms come at a sensitive time, when Algeria is plagued by political and economic uncertainty. => 毫无疑问，改革出现在一个敏感的时刻，阿尔及利亚正面临政治和经济不确定性。
The “consensus” that supposedly shapes Algerian politics has, in fact, paralyzed decision-making for many years now. => 事实上，左右阿尔及利亚政治的“共识”多年来一直让决策处于瘫痪状态。

With the ailing Bouteflika not seen in public for more than a year, important questions have emerged about how the 2019 presidential election will play out. => 疾病缠身的本特弗利卡已经有一年多时间没有出现在公共视野中，对于2019年总统选举的结果问题重重。
Significant external challenges have exacerbated Algeria’s situation. => 重大外部挑战加剧了阿尔及利亚的状况。

Falling oil revenues mean that Algeria’s government cannot maintain the broad array of subsidies that traditionally served as a social balm, helping prevent protest. => 石油收入的下降意味着阿尔及利亚政府无法维持传统上作为社会稳定剂、有助于防止动乱的各种补贴。
The government has already had to increase some taxes, while raising prices for fuel, electricity, and gas. => 政府已经不得不提高一些税收，同时对燃料、电力和天然气涨价。
If the price of oil does not rise soon, and Algeria’s leaders are forced to take more drastic measures, social stability could be jeopardized. => 如果油价不迅速止跌回升，而阿尔及利亚领导人被迫采取更加猛烈的措施，社会稳定有可能崩溃。

To be sure, some factors may help to stave off social unrest – namely, the population’s memories of the brutal civil war of the 1990s, in which more than 150,000 people were killed. => 当然，一些因素有助于遏制社会动荡 — — 阿尔及利亚人民对于20世纪90年代的残酷内战仍然记忆犹新，150,000多人在这场战中被杀。
But, memories fade as time passes, and a new generation of young people lack the same fear of social strife that their parents and grandparents have. => 但是，记忆将随时间消退，新一代年轻人可没有父辈和祖父辈所具有的对社会冲突的恐惧。
In this social context, and if economic hardship persists, protests and even revolt may not be a distant prospect. => 在这一社会环境下，如果经济困难继续下去，示威乃至暴乱都不是遥远的事情。
To avoid such an outcome, Algeria’s government must work fast to diversify the economy. => 为了避免这一结果，阿尔及利亚政府必须尽快实现经济多元化。

But such concerted action will be difficult in the current political environment, especially in view of the government’s increased focus on security challenges in Algeria’s neighborhood. => 但这类协调行动在当前政治环境中十分困难，特别是考虑到政府的关注点日益集中在阿尔及利亚周边安全挑战上时。

For example, in Libya, Algeria has defended a process of inclusive national reconciliation of all forces, in support of efforts by the United Nations to stabilize the country. => 比如，在利比亚，阿尔及利亚支持协调各方力量的包容性进程，以支持联合国稳定利比亚的行动。
The United States and Europe have already recognized Algeria’s leadership and cooperation in anti-terror efforts in its neighborhood. => 美国和欧洲已经认识到阿尔及利亚对于周边反恐行动的领导作用和合作。
One key way Algeria can help improve security cooperation in its region would be to restore diplomatic relations with Morocco. => 阿尔及利亚帮助改善地区安全合作的一个关键方法是重建与摩洛哥的外交关系。
True, the countries have been at loggerheads for 40 years, owing to their sovereignty dispute over Western Sahara. => 诚然，40年来两国因为对西撒哈拉地区的主权争议而争执不断。

But the economic, commercial, and security-related dividends that renewed cooperation would provide should be enough to persuade them to reconsider this position. => 但重启合作所带来的经济、商业和安全相关红利应能足以说服它们重新考虑立场。
If the two North African giants were to recognize their mutual interests and reestablish ties, they would disentangle relations in the Maghreb. => 如果这两个北非大国愿意承认共同利益，重建关系，就能理顺马格里布地区的关系。
Algeria’s influence across Africa would also receive a boost. => 阿尔及利亚在整个非洲的���响力也会得到提高。
Already, Algeria’s Africa-wide influence may be set to grow. => 目前，阿尔及利亚的非洲影响力提高已成定局。
Some have suggested that an Algerian candidate could become Chair of the Commission of the African Union when the current term expires next July. => 一些人指出，阿尔及利亚候选人可能在明年7月现任主席任期结束后成为非洲联盟委员会主席。
If successful, Algeria would become the first North African country to lead the AU. => 如果成功，阿尔及利亚将成为首个领导非盟的北非国家。
The severe challenge posed by falling oil prices and a jittery regional context attest to the urgent need for change in Algeria. => 石油价格下跌和严峻的地区环境所带来的严重挑战表明阿尔及利亚急需做出变化。

But if the government acts to unblock the political system, diversify the economy, and ramp up diplomatic efforts, Algeria can emerge stronger and more influential than ever. => 但如果阿尔及利亚政府采取行动解放政治制度，实现经济多元化，并加强外交措施，阿尔及利亚能够成为比以往任何时候都更加强大、影响力更强的力量。
The Politics of Machine-Learning Algorithms => 机器学习算法的政治学

WASHINGTON, DC – Around 1200 BC, the Shang Dynasty in China developed a factory system to build thousands of huge bronze vessels for use in everyday life and ritual ceremonies. => 华盛顿—大约在公元前1200年，中国商朝就已经有工厂系统制造成千上万件青铜器用于日常和祭祀用途。
A similarly complex process went into fashioning the famous army of terracotta warriors that Qin Shi Huang, China’s first emperor, unveiled one thousand years later. => 一千年后，类似的复杂工艺也被用于制造著名的秦始皇兵马俑。

According to the Asian Art Museum in San Francisco, the statues “were created using an assembly production system that paved the way for advances in mass production and commerce.” => 据旧金山亚洲艺术博物馆，这些雕像“用奠定大生产和商业基础的流水线生产系统制造。 ”
Some scholars have speculated that these early forms of prescriptive-work technologies played a large role in shaping Chinese society. => 一些学者猜测，这些早期规范工作（prescriptive-work）技术的形式对中国社会的形成起到了非常重要的作用。

Among other things, they seem to have predisposed people to accept bureaucratic structures, a social philosophy emphasizing hierarchy, and a belief that there is a single right way of doing things. => 它们与其他因素一起，让人们接受了强调层级的官僚制度社会哲学，也让人们相信凡事都有简单的正确方法。
In the twentieth century, theorists such as Langdon Winner extended this line of thinking to other technologies. => 在二十世纪，兰登·维纳（Langdon Winner）等理论家将这一思路延伸到技术中。
Today, we can take that thinking even further. => 如今，我们可以将这一思路延伸到更远。
Consider machine-learning algorithms, the most important general-purpose technology in use today. => 考虑机器学习算法。 这是当今所运用的最重要的通用技术。
Using real-world examples to mimic human cognitive capacities, these algorithms are already becoming ubiquitous in the workplace. => 这些算法用真实世界的例子来模拟人类认知能力，如今已在职场无处不在。

But, to capitalize fully on these technologies, organizations must redefine human tasks as prediction tasks, which are more suited to these algorithms’ strengths. => 但要充分利用这些技术，组织必须重新定义人的任务为预测任务（prediction task ） ， 这更契合这些算法的优势。
A key feature of machine-learning algorithms is that their performance improves with more data. => 机器学习算法的一个关键特征是它们的表现会随着数据的增加而改进。
As a result, the use of these algorithms creates a technological momentum to treat information about people as recordable, accessible data. => 因此，使用这些算法就形成了一种技术动力，将关于人的信息处理为可记录、可调用的数据。

Like the system of mass production, they are “inherently political,” because their core functionality demands certain social practices and discourages others. => 就像大生产系统一样，它们具有“固有政治性 ” （ inherently political ） ， 因为它们的核心功能要求某些社会行为、阻碍其他社会行为。
In particular, machine-learning algorithms run directly counter to individuals’ desire for personal privacy. => 特别是，机器学习苏散发与个体的隐私渴望直接对立。
But, unlike communitarians, algorithms are indifferent to social norms. => 但和社会主义派不同，算法不关心社会规范。
Their only concern is to make better predictions, by transforming more and more areas of human life into data sets that can be mined. => 它们至关注更好地做出预测，而这可以通过将越来越多的人类生活领域转化为可挖掘的数据集来实现。

Whether it is at work, in school, or even on dating apps, we have already become accustomed to having our eligibility assessed by impersonal tools, which then assign us positions in a hierarchy. => 不管是在职场还是在校园，甚至是在约会应用中，我们都已经习惯于用非人工具评估我们的资格，然后分配给我们某个层级的位置。
To be sure, algorithmic assessment is not new. => 平心而论，算法评估并非新鲜事。

A generation ago, scholars such as Oscar H. Gandy warned that we were turning into a scored-and-ranked society, and demanded more accountability and redress for technology-driven mistakes. => 一代人以前，奥斯卡·甘迪（Oscar H. Gandy）等学者就警告说，我们正在转变为一个记录和排名的社会，并要求更多地问责和矫正技术导致的错误。
But, unlike modern machine-learning algorithms, older assessment tools were reasonably well understood. => 但和现代机器学习算法不同，旧的评估工具可以理解得相当透彻。
They made decisions on the basis of relevant normative and empirical factors. => 它们基于相关的规范性和实证性因子做出决定。
For example, it was no secret that accumulating a lot of credit card debit could hurt one’s creditworthiness. => 比如，背负许多信用卡债有损于一个人的信誉，这早已不是什么秘密。
By contrast, new machine-learning technologies plumb the depths of large data sets to find correlations that are predictive but poorly understood. => 相反，新机器学习技术深挖大型数据集寻找预测性但没有被很好地认识的相关性。

In the workplace, algorithms can track employees’ conversations, where they eat lunch, and how much time they spend on the computer, telephone, or in meetings. => 在职场中，算法能够跟踪员工的对话、他们在哪里吃午饭、在电脑、电话或会议上上花了多少时间等。
And with that data, the algorithm develops sophisticated models of productivity that far surpass our commonsense intuitions. => 有了这些数据，算法就能开发远远超过我们的常识直觉的复杂的生产率模型。
In an algorithmic meritocracy, whatever the models demand becomes the new standard of excellence. => 在一个算法精英体系中，模型要求什么，什么就成为出色的标准。
Still, technology is not destiny. => 尽管如此，技术并非宿命。
We shape it before it shapes us. => 我们在技术决定我们之前决定技术。
Business leaders and policymakers can develop and deploy the technologies they want, according to their institutional needs. => 商业领袖和决策者可以根据他们的机构需要开发和部署技术。
But if we follow the natural flow of algorithmic logic, a more meritocratic and communitarian culture will be inevitable. => 但在我们遵循自然算法逻辑流之前，更精英化和社会主义派的文化是不可避免的。
And this steady transformation will have far-reaching implications for our democratic institutions and political structures. => 而这一逐步的变化将深远影响到我们的民主制度和政治结构。

In China, collective decisions are not legitimated by citizens’ explicit consent, and people generally have fewer enforceable rights against the government, particularly when it comes to surveillance. => 在中国，集体决定不需要公民明确同意才合法化，一般而言，人们对政府的可执行权利（enforceable right）较少，特别是在监督方面。
An ordinary Chinese citizen’s role in political life is largely limited to participation in local elections. => 普通中国老百姓在政治生活中的角色大多只局限于参加地方选举。
The country’s leaders, meanwhile, are selected through a meritocratic process, and consider themselves custodians of the people’s welfare. => 与此同时，国家领导人通过英才过程遴选，并自视为人民福祉的监护人。
Liberal democracies are not likely to shift entirely to such a political system. => 自由民主不可能完全变为这种政治制度。
If we want to change course, we will have to put our own political imperatives before those of our technologies. => 如果我们想要改变趋势，就必须将我们自身的政治责任置于技术之前。
A Sunni-Shia Bridge Too Far => 弥合逊尼-什叶分歧任重道远
Can the new government restore order and address the many immense challenges that Iraq faces? => 新政府能够重建秩序、解决伊拉克所面临的诸多紧迫挑战吗？
The challenges are indeed daunting. => 挑战着实棘手。
But perhaps the most intractable challenge of all is bridging the sectarian rift between the country’s Shia and Sunni citizens. => 但或许最艰巨的挑战在于弥合伊拉克什叶派和逊尼派公民之间的宗派分歧。

These fissures are mirrored in other Arab countries (such as Syria, Lebanon, the Gulf countries, and Yemen) and, increasingly, in the wider Muslim world (including Pakistan, Malaysia, and Indonesia). => 这一分歧在其他阿拉伯国家也存在（如叙利亚、黎巴嫩、海湾国家和也门 ） ， 并大有席卷穆斯林世界（包括巴基斯坦、马来西亚和印度尼西亚）之势。
Is this a historical aberration, or are Islam’s two largest sects condemned to perpetual mutual hostility? => 这只是一个历史插曲，还是伊斯兰教最大的两个宗派已经陷入了持久的对立？
Certainly, there have been periods when the two communities have coexisted peacefully. => 毫无疑问，历史上曾有过两派和平共处的时期。

But what matters today is that Shia and Sunni relate to their past differently, and that this historical memory can be distorted – and even invented – to create mistrust and hate. => 但如今最重要的是什叶派和逊尼派都强调过去的不同，而历史记忆是可以扭曲 — — 甚至捏造 — — 从而炮制不信任和厌恶的。

The 500 years of Abbasid reign that followed provide many valuable illustrations of how these two communities subsequently related to each other. => 这带来了短暂的逊尼派-什叶派和解希望。 阿巴斯王朝统治的500年涌现出大量日后两派互相援引的极有价值的事件。

In particular, there is much to be learned from the different legacies of the caliph al-Nasir (1180-1225) and the last Abbasid caliph, al-Musta’sim (1242-1258). => 特别是，可以从内綏尔哈里发（al-Nasir，1180—1225）和阿巴斯王朝末代哈里发穆��台绥木（al-Musta’sim，1242—1258）的不同遗产中得到很多教训。

The rule of al-Nasir – who viewed the Shia as an intrinsic part of the Islamic community and sought to treat all of his subjects equally – was characterized by a marked decrease in sectarian tensions. => 内綏尔认为什叶派是伊斯兰教的固有组成部分，并试图平等对待他的所有子民，在他统治期间，宗派紧张大为缓和。
By contrast, Sunni-Shia clashes – including killings, arson, and other violence – were common during al-Musta’sim’s rule. => 相反，穆斯台绥木统治期间，逊尼派-什叶派冲突 — — 包括杀戮、焚烧和其他暴力 — — 十分普遍。

Iraq’s current political leaders need to learn from this past and ensure that none of the country’s communities face marginalization or discrimination – lessons that apply throughout the Muslim world. => 伊拉克的现任政治领导人需要从这些历史中吸取教训，并保证伊拉克的所有派别都不会被边缘化或受到歧视，这些教训是从穆斯林世界的全部历史中提炼出来的。
Politics and power struggles explain much of the violence and mistrust. => 政治和权力斗争能够解释这一暴力和不信任的大部分原因。
Fear of Iranian-led hegemony, for example, has focused Gulf leaders’ minds on their Shia population’s loyalty. => 比如，海湾国家领导人认定，担心以伊朗为首的霸权主义是其什叶派人口忠心的基础。
Malaysia’s political parties use anti-Shia animus to spread fear, helping to attract votes and consolidate power. => 马来西亚政党以反什叶派为目标散布恐惧，以此吸引选票、巩固权力。

Syria and its regional allies are determined to protect a new regional balance of power that shifted in their favor following the US-led invasion of Iraq. => 在美国领导的入侵伊拉克战争打响后，叙利亚及其地区盟友决心捍卫朝对其有利的方向发展的新的地区实力平衡。
But political calculation cannot explain everything. => 但政治算计不能解释一切现象。

The fall of Saddam Hussein in 2003 provides a good example of how a political event, viewed through a sectarian lens, can be interpreted differently. => 2003年萨达姆·侯赛因的倒台为我们提供了一个很好的例子，说明了同一件政治事件是如何被不同的宗派做出不同解读的。
The US destruction of the Iraqi state brought about a precarious new order that sought to redress years of Sunni dominance by favoring the Shia. => 美国对伊拉克国家的摧毁带来了不稳定的新秩序，该秩序试图通过向什叶派倾斜纠正多年来的逊尼派主导。
According to this thesis, the Shia simply reverted to their “historic” role as wreckers and fifth columnists. => 根据这一说法，什叶派只是恢复了其肇事者和第五纵队的“历史”角色。

Several medieval Muslim historians pointed to the role of the Shia vizier Ibn al-‘Alqami, arguing that he plotted with the Mongols to bring down the caliphate. => 一些中世纪穆斯林历史学家指出，什叶派宰相伊本·阿尔恰米（Ibn al - ‘ Alqami）与蒙古人合作灭掉了阿巴斯王朝。
Once the preserve of a handful of scholars, the Ibn al-‘Alqami story now plays a prominent part in today’s Sunni- Shia disputes. => 阿尔恰米的故事曾经是一些学者的禁脔，而如今，它成了逊尼派-什叶派纠纷的核心部分。
Indeed, “‘Alaqima,” the plural form of the Arabic name “‘Alqami,” is now applied to the Shia as short-hand for treachery. => 事实上 ， “ 阿尔恰米分子”即来源于阿拉伯名字“阿尔恰米 ” ， 现在被用来代称什叶派，意指他们是变节者。
Social media forums are replete with polemics about the Shia role in assisting both Mongol and US invaders. => 社交媒体论坛充斥着关于什叶派勾结蒙古和美国侵略者的辩论。
Many even claim that Iraq’s Shia are al-‘Alqami’s descendants, and that Nouri al-Maliki, Iraq’s Prime Minister, is his modern incarnation. => 许多人甚至将伊拉克什叶派称为阿尔恰米的后代，把伊拉克总理马利基说成是当代阿尔恰米。
These diatribes reflect Iraqi’s polarized historical memory. => 这些诽谤之词反映了伊拉克人历史记忆的两极分化。
Sadly, intolerance has now become a generalized condition. => 令人悲伤的是，偏隘已成为一般现象。

There is too little knowledge about other communities’ beliefs and history, and what little exists has been overwhelmed by sectarian anger and its poisonous rhetoric. => 对其他派别的信仰和历史了解太少，仅存的一些理解也被宗派愤怒和恶意中伤所压倒。
As long as Sunnis and Shia refuse to think about their past together, it is difficult to foresee a tranquil future together. => 只要逊尼派和什叶派拒绝共同思索他们的过去，就很难预见和平共处的未来。
Doing so will require knowledge, patience, and, above all, open minds and hearts. => 而这需要知识、耐心，以及最重要的，开放的思维和心态。
All in the Family => 全球性家族企业的多事之秋
MUNICH – Big economic crises often cause iconic companies to falter. => 慕尼黑 — — 经济大危机常令一些标志性公司走上下坡路。
Rupert Murdoch’s media empire is a model of the modern global enterprise. => 默多克的传媒帝国是现代全球企业的一个样板。
A particularly dynamic and innovative business model came from outside and took over central aspects of British and then American public life. => 秉持着一种特别富有活力和开创性的商业模式，这个外来势力先后闯入英国和美国的公共生活，占领了关键阵地。
That model is now threatened by the fallout from the scandal that started with phone hacking in Murdoch’s British press operations. => 如今，旗下英国报纸的手机窃听丑闻一石激起千层浪，令这座大厦风雨飘摇。
The Murdoch experience is a microcosm of how modern globalization works. => 默多克帝国的历史就是现代全球化的缩影。
Murdoch always looked like a foreign intrusion into British life. It was not just that he was Australian; he also brought new ideas. => 英国人总把默多克看作入侵者，不仅因为他是澳大利亚人，更因为他带来了新理念。

In particular, the application of digital technology, introduced after a ferocious struggle with the powerful print unions, brought substantial cost savings and allowed a new era of journalism. => 具体而言，在克服了印刷业工会的强力阻挠之后，数字技术全面引入，大大节约了成本，并把新闻行业带入了一个新纪元。

Even more importantly, Murdoch represented a concept of family business that is common in many parts of the world, but relatively rare in Britain and the United States. => 更重要的是，默多克所代表的家族企业模式，在英国和美国不太多见，在世界其他一些地方却相当普遍。
Family capitalism in the continental European model uses relatively little capital to achieve maximum control. => 欧洲大陆的家族资本主义模式可用较少的资本实现最大程度的控制。

It frequently depends on very complex corporate structures, with multiple layers of holding companies, as well as privileged shares that can guarantee the continuation of control. => 其治理结构通常很复杂，通过一级级的控股公司和优先股股份保证持续的控制。
This sort of firm is also very common in the most dynamic emerging-market economies in Asia and Latin America. => 在亚洲和拉美一些最富活力的新兴市场经济体，此类企业也很常见。

The Murdoch family holds only 12% of the shares of News Corporation, the top-level holding company, but it wields about two-fifths of the voting rights; other votes are held by a loyal Saudi prince. => 默多克家族仅持有顶级控股公司 — — 新闻集团12%的股份，却握有五分之二的投票权；剩下的投票权握在一位可靠的沙特亲王手中。
For decades, academic analysts have been fighting over whether such large-scale family businesses should be considered beneficial. => 这种家族企业巨无霸为什么还能维持可观的盈利？ 几十年来，学术界为此问题争论不休。
At least in the case of the Murdoch empire, it now appears that they pursue long and binding relationships with politicians and the police as well. => 现在看来 — — 至少就默多克的例子而言 — — 它也谋求同政界和警界建立长期、牢靠的关系。
Murdoch’s empire depended on its closeness to politicians. => 靠近政界是默多克帝国的一根支柱。

In retrospect, three successive British prime ministers – Tony Blair, Gordon Brown, and David Cameron – were on overly familiar terms with a manipulative business leader. => 今天回头来看，连续三任英国首相 — — 布莱尔、布朗和卡梅伦同这位长袖善舞的商业巨子过从甚密。
Cameron now talks about the need for “a healthier relationship between politicians and media owners.” => 卡梅伦如今口口声声说 ： “ 政治家和媒体大亨之间需要一种更健康的关系。
And Murdoch apparently is now saying that he wishes that all these prime ministers would “leave me alone.” => ”而默多克更是公开表态，希望首相们“离我远一点。 ”
The second notorious weakness of family businesses is the problem of succession. => 家族企业的第二大致命伤是继承问题。
When he appeared before the British parliament in July, Rupert Murdoch looked like an old man, remote and out of control. => 本月出席英国议会听证会时，默多克表现得像是远离公司管理的垂暮家翁。
In old-style family firms, there is a clear rule of succession that the oldest son takes over. => 老派家族企业的继承有一条明确的规矩 — — 长子继位。
But that rule is rightly recognized as being potentially dysfunctional. => 但应该承认这条规矩存在缺陷。
There is obviously no guarantee that the oldest son is the best businessman, and the result could be bitter and ferocious sibling rivalry. => 显然不能保证长子一定是最好的生意人，万一碰上个不肖之子，要么败家，要么内讧。
Such succession disputes become even more acute when there are multiple marriages and multiple sets of competing children. => 如果父辈结过多次婚，有几方子女参与争产，则继承纠纷会变得更险恶。

Until the eruption of the current scandal, the youngest of Murdoch’s three children from his second marriage, James, was generally believed to stand the greatest chance of succeeding his father. => 在这次丑闻爆发之前，默多克同第二任妻子所育三个子女中最小的儿子 — — 詹姆斯·默多克一般被视为最有可能继承家业的人物。
The complexities of modern marriage patterns make family life much more fraught, especially when phenomenal power and huge sums of money are involved. => 现代婚姻模式的复杂性令家族生活矛盾重重，同权、钱有关时尤其如此。

All three of Murdoch’s marriages have produced children, though those from his current relationship are too young to be considered potential corporate successors. => 默多克的三次婚姻都有子女，只是他同现任妻子所育子女年龄太小，当不了企业继承人。
In addition, succession planning can become complicated by the emergence of “substitute children” from the company’s management. => 此外，由公司管理层涌现的“代子女”令继承规划进一步复杂化。
The disintegration of the business empire is then accompanied and amplified by bitter disputes between the children and the substitute children. => 子女和代子女的混战，伴随着商业帝国的分崩离析，并且加剧了分崩离析的过程。
Indeed, the crisis of the Murdoch family’s business empire is neither unique nor unprecedented. => 说实话，默多克家族商业帝国的危机既非独一无二，也非前所未见。
As a result of globalization, large family firms could increase their size and their geographic range. => 全球化令大型家族企业得以扩大规模、扩展地理范���。
But globalization also increases the chances of backlashes that focus on the vulnerabilities, weaknesses, and mistakes of big family firms. => 但全球化也凸显了大型家族企业的弱点和失误，使它们更易受到冲击。

They are vulnerable to an Arab Spring (and a British summer) – and maybe to a US autumn that will focus not just on the Murdochs’ business, but also on its interplay with politics. => 阿拉伯之春和不列颠之夏已经让它们疲于应付，接下来很可能还会来一个美利坚之秋 — — 不仅针对默多克的生意，也针对它同政治的私通。
All Man’s Land => 清一色男人的土地
NEW DELHI – Ernest Hemingway’s collection of stories, Men without Women, examines tense gender relationships. => 新德里 — — 欧内斯特·海明威的系列小说《没有女人的男人》刻画了两性间的紧张关系。

In a particularly poignant story, a young man convinces his partner to have an abortion, viewing their unborn child as a hindrance to the status quo. Frustrated, the woman gives in. => 在一则特别凄美的小说中，一名年轻男子将尚未出世的婴儿视作障碍因而说服伴侣打胎，心灰意冷的女人被迫表示同意。
That story, published more than 80 years ago, remains relevant today in India, where female fetuses face severe risks. => 80年前的这则小说反应的现象在当今印度依然具有实际意义，这里的女性胎儿所面临的风险非常严峻。
According to the 2011 census, the sex ratio of the country’s children has dipped from 927 females per 1000 males to 914, a 60-year low. => 2011年的人口普查显示，印度的男女童比例已经从每千名男性927名女性下降到每千名男性914名女性，创下六十年来的新低。
Ratios in the northern states are particularly alarming: only Himachal Pradesh now has a ratio of girls to boys above 900. => 印度北部各邦的男女童比例尤其令人震惊：只有喜马偕尔邦目前的比例仍处于900以上。

Despite being illegal, ultrasound sex-determination tests are being used across India to identify for abortion extraordinary numbers of healthy female fetuses. => 尽管被视为非法，但印度各地普遍利用超声波鉴定婴儿性别，导致大量健康的女性胎儿招致人为堕胎。
But there are serious concerns about legal operations, too. => 而且合法手术也引发了严重的担忧。
Genitoplasty – a sex-change operation on newborn girls – is a mushrooming, and deeply disturbing, business in India. => 一种改变新生女婴性别的生殖器成形术正在印度境内蓬勃发展，这一现象引起了很多人的担忧。
There’s only one word for it: gendercide. => 只有性别屠杀这个词能够准确形容这种现象。
Left unchecked, it will leave India’s next generation of men with a severe shortage of women. => 如果不加以遏止，将导致下一代印度男人严重匮乏女性伴侣。

Indian couples have a strong cultural preference, bordering on obsession, for sons over daughters – despite the strides in education and employment that women have made over the last few decades. => 尽管过去几十年来女性在教育和就业领域已经取得了重大进步，但印度夫妻却有着建立在执迷基础上的强烈的重男轻女文化偏好。
Education and wealth have nothing to do with it – in fact, some of the worst-affected areas are in India’s wealthiest cities. => 这种偏好与教育和财富无关 — — 事实上，受影响最严重的恰恰是印度某些最富裕的城市。
However discomfiting a possibility, the real culprit might be Indian culture and tradition itself. => 无论这种可能性多么令人难以接受，但真正的罪魁祸首或许恰恰是印度文化和传统本身。

The expenses and pressure of the dowry system, and the fact that, in most joint families, only sons inherit property and wealth, contribute to this favoritism. => 嫁妆制度所造成的开销和压力，以及在多数联合家庭中只有儿子能继承产业和财富的现状是这种偏爱的始作俑者。

Perhaps just as important is that sons typically live with their parents even after they are married, and assume responsibility for parents in their old age. => 还有一点也许同样重要，那就是儿子即使婚后一般也与父母同住，并在父母年老时承担起赡养义务。
Daughters, who live with their in-laws after they marry, are viewed as amanat – someone else’s property. => 而女儿婚后只能与公婆同住，因此被视为别人的财富（amanat ） 。
In short, sons represent income and daughters an expense. => 简言之，儿子代表收入而女儿代表支出。
In the old days, when families typically had 5-10 children, this didn’t matter so much. => 从前，每个家庭都有5－10个孩子，因此这个问题显得并不突出。
The number of sons and daughters often evened out. => 因为儿女数量一般是平衡的。

But, for today’s smaller families, whether the children are two boys or two girls influences everything from financial planning to preparations for old age. => 但相对于今天的小家庭而言，究竟是两个儿子还是两个女儿则关乎从财务计划到养老准备的方方面面。
Many have argued that Indian women should stand up to their families and refuse to abort their daughters. => 很多人提出印度妇女应该顶住家庭压力，拒绝打掉女婴。
But Indian women want male children just as much. => 可印度妇女对男婴的渴望却丝毫不亚于其他人。
Unlike Hemingway’s character, they are often more than willing to abort a girl and try for a boy. => 与海明威小说中的主人公不同，她们往往会迫不及待地打掉女孩，以争取怀上男孩。

The novelist Salman Rushdie once put the question to supporters of abortion rights: “What should be done when a woman uses her power over her own body to discriminate against female fetuses?” => 小说家萨尔曼·拉什迪曾经向堕胎权的支持者提出这样一个问题 ： “ 如果女性利用对自己身体的权利来歧视女性胎儿，我们该怎么做？ ”
This raises other questions concerning the consequences of a large shortage of girls. => 至此又牵扯到女性短缺所带来的其他问题。
Will women be valued and treasured? => 女性是否会受到尊重和保护？
Or will the oversupply of men result in more bride trafficking, sexual violence, and female suicides? => 抑或因男性数量过多而导致更多的新娘贩卖、女性自杀和性暴力？

Niall Ferguson, the British historian, cites scholars who attribute Japan’s imperial expansion after 1914 to a male youth bulge, and who link the rise of Islamist extremism to an Islamic youth bulge. => 英国历史学家尼尔·弗格森援引某些学者的看法，将日本帝国主义扩张和伊斯兰极端主义盛行归结于1914年后日本男青年数量激增和伊斯兰青年男性人口膨胀。

“Maybe the coming generation of Asian men without women will find harmless outlets for their inevitable frustrations, like team sports or video games. => 弗格森写道 ， “ 或许新一代没有女人的亚洲男人能给自己无法避免的痛苦找到某种无害的宣泄方式，比方说集体运动或者视频游戏。
But I doubt it,” he writes. => 但我对此深表怀疑。
He warns us not to be surprised if, in the coming generation, “shrill nationalism is replaced by macho militarism or even imperialism.” => ”他警告我们如果下一代人“用大男子气的军国主义甚至是帝国主义取代尖锐的爱国主义 ” ， 我们不要对此感到惊奇。
Unfortunately, there is no instant solution. => 遗憾的是，这个问题没有立竿见影的解决方案。
Saving our girls will require radically altering some of Indian society’s family arrangements, traditions, and attitudes. => 拯救女孩的命运需要从根本上改变印度某些社会家庭安排、传统和态度。
And there is no easy way to accomplish this. => 实现这样的目标并不轻松。
Legislation alone won’t help, for tradition is a law unto itself. => 单靠立法并不能收到效果，因为传统本身就是一种法律。
Hindu religious law, for example, allows a woman to claim an equal share in her parents’ wealth, but few exercise this right. => 举例而言，印度宗教法允许女性对父母的财产主张同等权利，但却没有多少人真正这样做。
Culturally, she feels that she does not have an equal claim on her father’s property. => 从文化的角度，她感到自己对父亲的财产并不具备同等的权利。
Nonetheless, India does need new laws – direct and enforceable – that clamp down on the cultural practices that underpin destructive traditions. => 无论如何，印度的确需要直接可行的新法律取缔支撑破坏性传统的文化惯例。
For example, India could enforce a ceiling on wedding expenditure – typically a father’s biggest expense associated with his daughter. => 比方说，印度可以规定婚礼花销的上限 — — 婚礼花销往往是父亲在女儿身上最大的一笔开支。
Constrained from spending on the wedding, he would compensate her differently – perhaps with a larger inheritance. => 如果不用在婚礼上耗费大量财物，也许他会给她某种形式的补偿，也许会允许她继承更多财物。
Gradually, this would become the norm, and tradition would adjust accordingly. => 而这渐渐会成为新的标准，传统因此会进行相应的调整。

(Interestingly, the state of Kerala, whose people adhere to matrilineal inheritance, has among the most equal sex ratios and literacy rates in India.) => （有趣的是，在民众继续实行母系继承制度的喀拉拉邦，两性人口及识字人口比例都是印度最均衡的。 ）
A more radical measure, which some have advocated, would be direction intervene, with the state providing benefits for families with more girls. => 某些人鼓吹实行更激进的举措，即以国家之名为女性较多的家庭提供补助。
Perhaps the authorities could also penalize families with boys, at least temporarily. => 或许当局也可以惩罚以男孩为主的家庭，至少在一段时间内暂时如此。
India imagines herself as a woman – Bharat Mata, or Mother India. => 印度传统上将自己想象成一名女性 — — 巴特拉马塔，也就是印度妈妈。
The irony is that, unless far-reaching changes are made soon, Mother India could eventually be the only woman left in the country. => 颇具讽刺意味的是，除非展开影响深远的改革，否则印度妈妈可能最终成为这个国家剩下的唯一一名女性。
All Stimulus Roads Lead to China => 美国的赤字，中国的心病
BEIJING – Now that the “green shoots” of recovery have withered, the debate over fiscal stimulus is back with a vengeance. => 北京 — — 现如今，复苏的“绿芽”已经枯萎，该不该再搞财政刺激的辩论变本加厉。
But unemployment has risen even faster and further than expected. => 失业率激增，超出预期。
Combine this with the continued fall in housing prices, and it is understandable that consumer spending remains depressed. => 再算上持续走低的房价，不难理解消费为什么仍然低迷。
The banks, having been recapitalized only to the extent necessary to keep them afloat, still have weak balance sheets. => 虽然银行经过了资产重组，但那只够它们继续营业，其资产负债表依然脆弱。
Their consequent reluctance to lend constrains investment. => 惜贷之风继续制约着投资。
Meanwhile, state governments, seeing revenues fall as a result of lower taxable incomes last year, are cutting back like mad. => 与此同时，由于去年的居民应纳税收入减少，岁入下滑，一些州政府正发疯般地削减开支。
If there was a case for additional stimulus back in February, that case is even stronger now. => 如果说今年2月的时候有出台新刺激计划的需要，那眼下这种需要就更迫切了。
But the case against additional stimulus is also strong. => 然而，反对出台新刺激计划的理由也很有力。
The US federal deficit is an alarming 12% of GDP, and public debt as a share of national income is already projected to double, to 80% of GDP. => 美国联邦赤字已达到GDP的12 % ， 值得警惕；公债的GDP占比预计将翻倍，达到80 % 。

The idea that the US can grow out of its debt burden, as did Finland and Sweden following their financial crises in the 1990’s, seems unrealistic. => 认为美国能靠经济增长还清债务，就像上世纪90年代芬兰和瑞典在遭受金融危机之后所做的那样，这种看法似乎不太现实。
Given all this, more deficit spending will only stoke fears of higher future taxes and inflation. => 有鉴于此，更大规模的赤字支出只会激起对未来高税收和高通胀的恐慌。
It will encourage the reemergence of global imbalances. => 这将促使全球收支不平衡卷土重来。
And it will not reassure consumers or investors. => 而那种前景可不会让消费者和投资者放心。
It is possible to argue the economics both ways, but the politics all point in one direction. => 经济学可以两头争论，政治则全都指向一个方向。
The US Congress lacks the stomach for another stimulus package. => 美国国会对新刺激计划没胃口。
It has already faced intense criticism for its failure to get the country’s fiscal house in order. => 已经有人激烈批评国会没有看好国家的财政大门。

The slowness with which the first stimulus has been rolled out, and the fact that it will take even more time for its full effects to be felt, provides more fodder for the chattering classes. => 第一个刺激计划实施得很迟缓，而且其效果需要更长时间才能充分显现，这给议会里那批以讨好选民为业的政客提供了口实。

Disappointment over the effects of the TARP has already destroyed popular – and Congressional – support for more public money to recapitalize the banks. => 问题资产剥离计划（TARP）的效果令人失望，这已使民众和议会不再支持用更多的公共资金来搞银行资产重组。

So, even those who find the economic logic of arguments for fiscal activism compelling must acknowledge that the politics are not supportive. => 所以，即使一些人相信，根据经济学的逻辑，积极财政政策是当务之急，他们也不得不承认，这种政策得不到政治上的支持。
A second stimulus simply is not in the cards. => 出台第二个刺激计划远不是板上钉钉的事。
If there is going to be more aggregate demand, it can come from only one place. => 如果说，全球经济的总需求毕竟要有所扩大，那只能来自一个地方。
That place is not Europe or Japan, where debts are even higher than in the US – and the demographic preconditions for servicing them less favorable. => 不是欧洲，也不是日本，它们的负债比美国还高，人口前景比美国更糟。
Rather, it is emerging markets like China. => 那只能是来自新兴市场经济体 — — 比如中国。
The problem is that China has already done a lot to stimulate domestic demand, both through government spending and by directing its banks to lend. => 问题在于，中国已经做了很多事来刺激内需了，一方面是扩大政府支出，另一方面是指导银行放贷。
As a result, its stock market is frothy, and it is experiencing an alarming property boom. => 结果，中国的股市和房市又开始吹泡泡了。
Through May, property prices were up 18% year on year. => 5月份，房地产价格同比上涨了18 % 。
Understandably, Chinese officials worry about bubble trouble. => 中国官方开始担忧泡沫问题，这是可以理解的。
The obvious way to square this circle is to spend more on imports. => 最明显的应对之道就是扩大进口支出。
China can purchase more industrial machinery, transport equipment, and steelmaking material, which are among its leading imports from the US. => 中国可以购买更多的工业机械、运输设备、炼钢原料，这些都是中国从美国进口的大宗。
This strategy is not without risks. => 这个策略不是没有风险。
Allowing the renminbi to appreciate as a way of encouraging imports may also discourage exports, the traditional motor of Chinese growth. => 允许人民币升值以鼓励进口同时也会抑制出口，而出口是中国经济的传统引擎。
And lowering administrative barriers to imports might redirect more spending toward foreign goods than the authorities intend. => 降低进口的行政壁垒会把更多的支出引向外国货物的进口，也许有些政府部门并不乐见此情形。
But these are risks worth taking if China is serious about assuming a global leadership role. => 然而，如果中国当真想接过一个全球领导者的角色，这些风险值得冒一冒。
The question is what China will get in return. => 问题在于，中国能获得什么回报呢？
And the answer brings us back, full circle, to where we started, namely to US fiscal policy. => 这个问题把我们带回了本文的起点，也就是美国的财政政策。
China is worried that its more than $1 trillion investment in US Treasury securities will not hold its value. => 中国持有的美国国债超过1万亿美元，它很担心这笔资产的安全。

It wants reassurance that the US will stand behind its debts. It therefore wants to see a credible program for balancing the US budget once the recession ends. => 它想要美国保证不赖帐，所以希望美国拿出一个在衰退结束后平衡预算的可行方案来。
And, tough talk notwithstanding, the Obama administration has yet to offer a credible roadmap for fiscal consolidation. => 可是，不客气地讲，奥巴马政府至今未能拿出一个像样的巩固财政的路线图来。
Doing so would reassure American taxpayers worried about current deficits. Just as importantly, it would reassure Chinese policymakers. => 如果它能拿出来的话，就既能让美国纳税人安心，又能让中国决策者放心。
We live in a multipolar world where neither the US nor China is large enough to exercise global economic leadership on its own. => 我们生活在一个多极化的世界中，不论是美国还是中国，都没有足够的力量独自领导全球经济。
For China, leadership means assuming additional risks. => 对中国而言，肩负共同领导的责任意味着多冒一些风险。
But for this to be tolerable, the US needs to relieve China of existing risks. => 为了打消中国的顾虑，美国得想办法帮助中国规避一些既存的风险。
Only by working together can the two countries lead the world economy out of its current doldrums. => 只有携手合作，两国才能领导世界经济走出当前的萧条。
A Long March with China => 与中国之崛起长伴左右
BEIJING – US Vice President Joe Biden’s recent four-day visit to China ended on a high note. => 发自北京 — — 美国副总统乔·拜登最近的四日访华行程最终高调收尾。
But, behind all the smiles and banquet toasts, serious issues and perception gaps continue to divide the world’s two great powers. => 但在宾主笑脸相迎，推杯换盏的背后依然存在着一系列严重问题以及理念差距，不断撕裂着两个世界大国之间的关系。
For starters, there is always an attitude problem. => 首先呈现的往往是所谓态度问题。
Even a brawl between the Chinese and a visiting American basketball team is viewed as evidence of China’s aggressive behavior. => 甚至连某支中国篮球队与到访美国队之间的殴斗都被视为中国咄咄逼人的佐证。
Many Chinese, on the other hand, tend to think that the US is suffering from severe case of conceited superpower syndrome. => 另一方面，许多中国人则认为美国患上了目空一切的超级大国综合症，而且已经病入膏肓。

As these Chinese see it, the US has a rather dysfunctional government, but nevertheless insists that its political and economic system is the best in the world, and that everyone should emulate it. => 在这些中国人眼中，美国人自己的政府办事不力，却坚称自身政治和金融系统世界第一，以模范自居。
It is heavily in debt, but cannot stop spending and borrowing. => 这个国家早已负债累累，却无法停止消费和借钱。
It is no longer competitive in manufacturing, but blames others for its huge trade deficit. => 其制造业竞争力辉煌不再，却把造成巨额贸易逆差的原因归咎于他人。
And the world’s only military superpower is often seen within China as trigger-happy when intervening in other countries’ internal affairs. => 同时在中国人眼中这个全球唯一的军事强权极端好战，整天忙于干涉他国内政。
Then, there is the issue of trust. => 接着出现的则是信任问题。
China’s critics argue that its claims to a peaceful rise are not credible, given the country’s non-democratic, one-party system. => 那些批评中国的人认为所谓“和平崛起”的说法根本不可信，因为该国拥有一个不民主的一党制政治系统。
Any Chinese military move is portrayed as an expansionary and aggressive act that must be contained. => 任何中国军事行动都被描述成必须被遏制的侵略扩张行为。

Any attempts at engagement by Western politicians, such as Biden’s recent trip, are automatically met with doubt and criticism for cozying up to dictators. => 而西方政治家采取的任何举动（比如拜登访华）都会当即遭到质疑并被扣上巴结独裁者的帽子。
Likewise, for those Chinese who are suspicious of US intentions, conspiracy is always in play. => 同样，对于那些对美国意图疑心重重的中国人来说，阴谋论总是有市场的。
They see a declining superpower using economic, military, and diplomatic means in an unrelenting effort to prevent China’s rise. => 他们觉得美国这个日薄西山的超级大国正在想方设法用经济，军事和外交手段阻止中国崛起。
Talk of human rights and democracy is nothing but a smoke screen for demonizing China. => 所有对人权和民主的讨论都是妄图妖魔化中国的烟雾弹。

Arms sales to Taiwan, Tibetan activism, and “color revolutions” of various kinds are all sponsored by the US and other Western powers, and are aimed at weakening China. => 对台军售，藏独势力以及各类“颜色革命”都是美国以及其他西方势力背后资助的，而且唯一例外是为了削弱中国。
Increased interdependence has not led to better understandings on even some of the most basic issues. => 不断提升的相互依存度仍然无法令双方在某些最基本问题上达成更深的了解。
Are we going to be in a war? => 我们要走向战争吗？
Are we preparing for a war against each other?” => 我们在准备要和对方开战吗？

To meet these challenges successfully, there is no viable alternative to a positive, continuous, and frank engagement between China and the rest of the world. => 如果要成功应对着些挑战的话，唯一的方法就是在中国和其他国家之间实现积极，持续和坦诚的相互了解。

The Chinese economy will continue to grow; the Chinese military will continue to modernize; and the Chinese people will remain united in their Great Power aspirations. => 中国经济必将继续增长；中国军队也将继续迈向现代化；而中国人民也将继续团结在大国崛起的理想之下。

A Cold War-style confrontation and containment policy from the West will be met with strong resistance from the Chinese, whose global leverage, particularly in finance, cannot be ignored. => 西方的那套冷战对抗和遏制政策必将遭到中国人的强烈反抗, 而中国的全球杠杆作用（尤其在金融方面）也已强大到无法被忽视。
Only a patient, creative, and consistent engagement strategy will mitigate fears on both sides. => 只有一个耐心，富有创造力并始终如一的沟通战略能消除双方的恐惧。
China’s rise is a fact; the enduring peacefulness of that rise must be a priority for China, its neighbors, the West, and, most importantly, the US. => 中国的崛起已成事实；而在崛起期间的持久和平局面必然是中国，周边邻国，西方尤其是美国的第一要务。
Inequality on the Horizon of Need => 需要中的不平等
BERKELEY – By any economic measure, we are living in disappointing times. => 伯克利—不管用哪种经济衡量手段，我们都生活在令人失望的时代。

In the United States, 7.2% of the normal productive labor currently stands idle, while the employment gap in Europe is rising and due to exceed that of the US by the end of the year. => 在美国，7.2%的普通生产性劳动力目前处于显著状态，而欧洲的就业缺口也在上升，并将在今年年底超过美国。
So it is important to step back and remind ourselves that the “lost decade” that we are currently suffering is not our long-run economic destiny. => 因此后退一步提醒自己我们正在经历的“失去的十年”并不是长期经济宿命是很重要的。
As Paul Krugman recently reminded us, John Maynard Keynes perhaps put it best: => 克鲁格曼（Paul Krugman）最近提醒我们，凯恩斯说得好：
“This is a nightmare, which will pass away with the morning. => “这是场噩梦，终会过去迎来黎明。
For the resources of nature and men’s devices are just as fertile and productive as they were. => 因为自然资源和人类设施与昔日一样富饶高产。
The rate of our progress towards solving the material problems of life is not less rapid. => 我们迈向解决生活的物质问题的进程并没有减速。

We are as capable as before of affording for everyone a high standard of life – high, I mean, compared with, say, 20 years ago – and will soon learn to afford a standard higher still. => 我们和从前一样有能力让所有人过上高质量生活 — — 我的意思是，比20年前质量更高的生活 — — 并且很快就能学会创造更高质量的生活。
We were not previously deceived. => 此前我们并未遭遇背叛。

But today we have involved ourselves in a colossal muddle, having blundered in the control of a delicate machine, the working of which we do not understand. => 但如今我们把自己带进了巨大的迷宫，不知所措地控制着一座精美的机器，我们无法理解它的工作模式。
The result is that our possibilities of wealth may run to waste for a time.” => 结果是，我们的创富可能会遭到一时的浪费。 ”
But what is our long-run economic destiny? => 但我们的长期经济宿命如何？
Keynes looked forward to a time, perhaps 2050, when everyone (in England, at least) would be able to have the lifestyle of a Keynes. => 凯恩斯看到，在某个时间，也许是2050年，所有人（至少是所有英国人）将能够过上凯恩斯式的生活。

And, because he imagined that no sane person could want more of the necessities, conveniences, and luxuries of life than a Keynes had, the economic problem would be solved. => 他认为，只要你不是疯子，就不会渴望比凯恩斯得到的还要多的必需品、改善品和奢侈品，因此，经济问题是可以解决的。
We are wiser – and perhaps sadder – than Keynes. => 我们比凯恩斯更聪明，也许也更悲伤。

We know that we want hip replacements and heart transplants and fertility treatment and cheap air travel and central heating and broadband Internet and exclusive beachfront access. => 我们知道我们想要整形手术、心脏移植、不孕不育治疗、廉价航空、中央供暖、宽带网络、专属海滩。

Already nearly everybody in the North Atlantic region has enough food to avoid hunger, enough clothing to stay warm, enough shelter to remain dry. => 在北大西洋地区，几乎人人可以获得足够的食物避免饥饿，获得足够的衣物保证取暖，获得足够的住所保持干燥。
So the economic problem will certainly be with us for a long time yet. => 因此这个经济问题必然会在很长一段时间里伴随我们。

But at least we can count on being able to generate a relatively egalitarian middle-class society as we collectively slouch toward our consumerist utopia, right? => 但至少我们指望创造相对平等的中产阶级社会，让我们行尸走肉般地迈向消费至上主义乌托邦，不是吗？
It was Karl Smith of the University of North Carolina who explained to me that this was likely to be wrong. => 北卡罗来纳大学的卡尔·史密斯（Karl Smith）向我解释了这也许是错的。

To create wealth, you need ideas about how to shape matter and energy, additional energy itself to carry out the shaping, and instrumentalities to control the shaping as it is accomplished. => 为了创造财富，你需要的是如何改变事情和能量的思想、更多的能量本身从而带来改变，以及当改变完成时控制它的工具。
The Industrial Revolution brought ideas and energy to the table, but human brains remained the only effective instrumentalities of control. => 工业革命带来了思想和能量，但人的大脑依然是唯一的有效控制工具。
As ideas and energy became cheap, the human brains that were their complements became valuable. => 随着思想和能量变得廉价，人脑就成了珍贵的补充品。

The lesson is clear: the market is not guaranteed by nature to produce a long-run future characterized by a reasonable degree of wealth inequality and relative poverty. => 教训是显然的：市场并不天然保证能产生以合理财富不均和相对贫困为特征的长期未来。
Unless and until we recognize this fully, we will remain at the mercy of Keynes’s poorly understood “delicate machine.” => 除非我们有朝一日能充分认识到这一点，否则我们将继续陷于凯恩斯不为人所理解的“精美的机器”中。
Alpine Schadenfreude => 阿尔卑斯的幸灾乐祸
Not surprisingly, the atmosphere at this year’s World Economic Forum was grim. => 今年世界经济论坛的气氛毫不奇怪地显得非常糟糕。
Those who think that globalization, technology, and the market economy will solve the world’s problems seemed subdued. => 那些认为全球化、技术和市场经济可以解决世界的难题的人似乎都不出声了。
Most chastened of all were the bankers. => 受到指责最多的是那些银行家。
And it was not just the bankers who were in the Davos doghouse this year, but also their regulators – the central bankers. => 但是在今年的达沃斯被关进狗屋里的不仅仅是这些银行家，还有他们的监管者，也就是各国的中央银行。
Anyone who goes to international conferences is used to hearing Americans lecture everyone else about transparency. => 参加国际会议的人都习惯于听美国人教训其他国家要更加透明。
There was still some of that at Davos. => 在达沃斯还是有一些这样的人。
Had America really told others to bring in American banks to teach them about how to run their business? => 难道美国没有告诉其他国家让美国的银行进入它们的市场以便教它们如何经营它们的业务？
Had America really boasted about its superior risk management systems, going so far as to develop a new regulatory system (called Basle II)? => 难道美国没有吹嘘过它出色的危机管理体系，甚至制定了一个新的监管体系（称为第二代巴塞尔资本协定 ） ？
Basle II is dead – at least until memories of the current disaster fade. => 第二代巴塞尔资本协定已经死了，至少要等到对目前危机的记忆消退的时候才能复活。
Bankers – and the rating agencies – believed in financial alchemy. => 银行还有信用评级机构迷信金融炼金术。
They thought that financial innovations could somehow turn bad mortgages into good securities, meriting AAA ratings. => 它们认为金融创新可以在某种程度上把差的抵押贷款变为值得给予AAA评级的优质证券。
But one lesson of modern finance theory is that, in well functioning financial markets, repackaging risks should not make much difference. => 但是现代金融理论其中的一个课程是在功能完善的金融市场，重新打包的风险并没有太大的差别。
If we know the price of cream and the price of skim milk, we can figure out the price of milk with 1% cream, 2% cream, or 4% cream. => 如果我们知道乳酪和脱脂牛奶的价格，我们就能计算出含1 % 、 2%或4%乳酪的牛奶的价格。

There might be some money in repackaging, but not the billions that banks made by slicing and dicing sub-prime mortgages into packages whose value was much greater than their contents. => 通过重新打包也许可以产生一些钱，但是银行绝对无法通过把次级抵押贷款分割后包装成价值远远超出其实质价值的产品而获利几十亿美元。
It seemed too good to be true – and it was. => 这样的事情看上去太美妙而不可能是真的，但是它确实发生的。
I argued at Davos that central bankers also got it wrong by misjudging the threat of a downturn and failing to provide sufficient regulation. => 我在达沃斯会议上指出中央银行也犯下了错误，它们误判了经济下滑的威胁并且没有提高足够的监管。
They waited too long to take action. => 它们等了太长时间才采取行动。

Because it normally takes a year or more for the full effects of monetary policy to be felt, central banks need to act preemptively, not reactively. => 因为货币政策的全面效果至少要过一年或者更长时间才能感觉到，中央银行需要预先采取行动，而不是出现问题才做出反应。
Normally, a Davos audience would rally to the support of the central bankers. => 通常，达沃斯的与会者会一致支持中央银行。
This time, a vote at the end of the session supported my view by a margin of three to one. => 但是这一次，在会议结束时进行的一项投票有四分之三的人支持我的观点。

The only thing we got wrong was how bad banks’ lending practices were, how non-transparent banks really were, and how inadequate their risk management systems were. => 我们唯一没有预测到的就是银行的借贷行为 到底有多糟糕 ，这些银行 到底有多不透明 以及它们的风险管理体系到底有多不恰当。
It was interesting to see the different cultural attitudes to the crisis on display. => 有趣的是看到不同的文化对于正在上演的这场危机不同的态度。
He would have resigned. => 他可能会辞职。
In America, the only questions are whether a board will force a CEO to leave and, if so, how big his severance package will be. => 而在美国，唯一的问题是董事会是否会 迫使 一位首席执行官离开，以及如果让他离开的话，应该支付给他多少离职津贴。

When I asked one CEO whether there was any discussion of returning their bonuses, the response was not just no, but an aggressive defense of the bonus system. => 当我问一位首席执行官是否讨论过归还他们的奖金问题，回答不仅仅是简单的没有，而是大声地为奖金制度辩解。
This is the third US crisis in the past 20 years, after the Savings & Loan crisis of 1989 and the Enron/WorldCom crisis in 2002. => 这是过去20年来美国发生的第三场危机了，前两次危机是1989年的储蓄信贷机构危机和2002年的安然/世通公司危机。
Deregulation has not worked. => 解除管制并没有产生效果。
Unfettered markets may produce big bonuses for CEO’s, but they do not lead, as if by an invisible hand, to societal well-being. => 被解除束缚的市场也许给首席执行官们带来了更多的奖金，但是它们并没有就像是通过一只无形的手带来社会的幸福。
Until we achieve a better balance between markets and government, the world will continue to pay a high price. => 除非我们在市场和政府间获得更好的平衡，世界将依然付出高昂的代价。
Effective Altruism => 有效利他主义
PRINCETON – Can humans really be motivated by altruism? => 普林斯顿—人类真的可以受利他主义的驱动？

My new book, The Most Good You Can Do, discusses the emerging new movement called Effective Altruism, and, in doing interviews about the book, I am surprised by how often that question is asked. => 我的新书《你能做的最大善事 》 （ The Most Good You Can Do）讨论了被称为“有效利他主义 ” （ Effective Altruism）的新出现的运动，在关于这本书的访谈中，我惊奇地发现这个问题是如此频繁地提及。
Why should we doubt that some people act altruistically, at least some of the time? => 为何我们要怀疑有人至少会有时采取利他行为？
In evolutionary terms, we can easily understand altruism toward kin and others who can reciprocate our help. => 从进化论的角度，我们很容易就能理解对家人和可回馈帮助的人的利他主义。

The polling organization Gallup asked people in 135 countries whether they had, in the last month, donated money to a charity, volunteered their time to an organization, or helped a stranger. => 民调组织盖洛普公司（Gallup）询问了135个国家的人在过去一个月中是否为慈善组织捐过钱、为某个组织贡献义务劳动，或者帮助过某个陌生人。

Gallup’s results, which form the basis of the World Giving Index 2014, indicate that approximately 2.3 billion people, a third of the world’s population, perform at least one altruistic act per month. => 盖洛普调查的结果 — — 也是2014年世界奉献指数（World Giving Index 2014）的基础 — — 表明大约23亿人，即世界人口的三分之一，每个月至少会有一次利他行为。
More objective evidence of altruism buttresses these findings. => 更客观的利他主义证据也支持这一发现。
In many countries, the supply of blood for medical purposes relies on voluntary, anonymous donations. => 在许多国家，医用目的血液供应依靠志愿匿名献血。

Worldwide, more than 11 million people have put their names on donor registries for bone marrow, signifying their willingness to donate their marrow to a stranger. => 从全球看，超过1,100万人在骨髓捐献数据库中注册，表示愿意向陌生人捐献自己的骨髓。
A small but growing number of people have gone further still, donating a kidney to a stranger. => 少数人（但人数在不断增加）更进一步，愿意为陌生人捐献肾脏。
There were 177 altruistic donations by living donors in the United States in 2013 and 118 in the United Kingdom in the year to April 2014. => 2013年美国有177例在世捐献者的利他捐献，2013年5月—2014年4月英国有118例。
Then there are those who donate to charity. => 接下来我们看看慈善捐赠。
In the US alone, individuals gave $240 billion to charity in 2013. => 光是在美国，2013年就有2,400亿美元的个人慈善捐赠。
Foundations and corporations topped this up to a total of $335 billion, or about 2% of gross national income. => 加上基金会和企业的捐献，总数达到了3,350亿美元，或国民总收入的2 % 。
Myanmar also had the highest percentage of people volunteering time (51%). => 缅甸也是义务劳动时间比例最高的国家（51 % ） 。
The US did, however, have the highest ranking for “helping a stranger.” => 但是，美国在“帮助陌生人”方面的评分最高。
That, together with a high ranking for volunteering time, led it to tie with Myanmar as the most generous nation in the world. => 再加上在义务劳动时间上的高分，使美国与缅甸一起成为世界上最慷慨的国家。
Admittedly, not all of this giving is altruistic. => 诚然，这些奉献并不完全是利他的。
That gift seems motivated more by a desire for fame than a desire to do good. => 这份礼物似乎更多是受名誉而非行善驱动。
After all, as Geffen presumably knew, the family of Avery Fisher had to be compensated with a payment of $15 million in order to agree to the renaming. => 毕竟，格芬事先就已知道，让艾弗里·费雪家族同意改名需要给他们1,500万美元补偿。

By contrast, other donors give larger sums, usually to only a handful of charities chosen on the basis of some knowledge about what the charity is doing. => 相反，其他捐献者捐更多的钱，并且通常只根据关于慈善机构正在进行的活动的信息选择少数机构。
They want to have a positive impact on the world. => 他们希望给世界带来一些正能量。
Their gifts may also make their lives better, but this is not what motivates them. => 他们的捐献也让他们的生活变得更好，但这不是驱动他们的原因。
The Effective Altruism movement consists of people who give in the latter way, combining the head and the heart. => 有效利他主义运动由后一种捐献者构成，他们是知行合一之士。
Their aim is to do the most good they can with the resources that they are willing to set aside for that purpose. => ���们的目标是用他们所愿意拿来用于慈善目的的资源尽可能地做最大的善事。
Those resources may include a tenth, a quarter, or even half of their income. => 这些资源可能包括他们的收入的十分之一、四分之一乃至二分之一。
Their altruism may include their time and talents, and influence their choice of career. => 他们的利他主义也许包括他们的时间和才华，并影响他们的职业选择。
To achieve their aims, they use reason and evidence to ensure that whatever resources they devote to doing good will be as effective as possible. => 为了实现他们的目标，他们用理性和证据确保他们用于做善事的资源尽可能地有效使用。
Several studies show that people who are generous are typically happier and more satisfied with their lives than those who do not give. => 一些研究表明慷慨的人通常比不奉献的人更快乐、更满意于生活。

And other studies show that giving leads to activity in the reward centers of the brain (the areas of the brain that are also stimulated by tasty food and sex). => 也有一些研究表明奉献引起大脑回馈中心活动（回馈中心是大脑的区域，也受美食和性行为的刺激 ） 。
But this does not mean that these donors are not altruistic. => 但这并不意味着这些捐赠者不是利他的。
Their direct motive is to help others, and their giving makes them happier only as a consequence of the fact that it does help others. => 他们的直接动机是帮助他人，他们的奉献给让他们更快乐，这只是奉献确实帮助了他人的结果。
If we had more such people, we would have more giving, and that is what we want. => 如果这样的人更多一些，就会有更多的奉献，而这就是我们想要的。
Testing Times for Alzheimer’s => 阿尔茨海默症的考验时刻
LONDON – Alzheimer’s disease is by far the most common cause of dementia and one of the world’s most feared disorders. => 伦敦—阿尔茨海默症是目前最常见的痴呆诱发因素，也是世界上最令人恐慌的神经疾病。

By 2050, there will be 135 million Alzheimer’s sufferers worldwide, a threefold increase from today, with three-quarters of cases occurring in low- and middle-income countries. => 到2050年，全球将有1.35亿阿尔茨海默症患者，较目前增加三倍，其中四分之三发生在中低收入国家。
Predicting the onset of Alzheimer’s, let alone preventing or curing it, remains an immense challenge. => 预测阿尔茨海默的开始 — — 更不用说预防和治疗了 — — 仍是一个巨大的挑战。
Alzheimer’s disease was identified more than a century ago from autopsy results that showed characteristic brain lesions called “amyloid plaques.” => 阿尔茨海默症在一个世纪多前通过尸体解剖结果发现，其特征是被称为“淀粉样斑块”的脑损伤。
The disease is more difficult to diagnose in the living. => 该病在活着时更难诊断。

Doctors rely on observation of memory loss and other thinking deficits (such as reasoning or language comprehension) – signs that plaques are already present in the brain. => 医生依靠观察记忆丧失和其他思维缺陷（如推理和语言理解力）做出诊断 — — 这些迹象表明脑部已经出现损伤。
But any cure would have to be administered before the plaques form, and years before symptoms of dementia appear. => 但需要在这些斑块形成前进行治疗才行，这时距离出现痴呆症状还有几年时间。
Alzheimer’s might be more predictable if scientists had the time and resources to conduct far-reaching longitudinal studies over many years. => 如果科学家有时间和资源进行为期多年的深入的纵向研究，阿尔茨海默症的可预测性可能会有所提高。

Such studies ideally would involve blood, imaging, memory, and medical tests, as well as detailed lifestyle questionnaires filled out by thousands of young and middle-aged people. => 这些研究最好包括对数千青年和中年人进行血液、影像、记忆和医学测试以及详细的生活方式问卷调查。

Study participants would be followed over decades to see who developed the disease, and which tests proved positive before Alzheimer’s was diagnosed. => 研究参与者将受到为期数十年的跟踪，以观察谁发展出阿尔茨海默症，哪些测试在阿尔茨海默症获得诊断之前就能有所察觉。

In fact, two famous longitudinal studies – the Framingham Heart Study in Massachusetts and the Kungsholmen Project in Sweden – have led to important progress in predicting the disease. => 事实上，两项著名的纵向研究 — — 马萨诸塞州的弗莱明汉姆心脏研究（Framingham Heart Study）和瑞典的国王岛项目（Kungsholmen Project）在阿尔茨海默症的预测方面获得了重要进展。
These studies found that short-term memory may be impaired for up to ten years before an Alzheimer’s diagnosis. => 这些研究发现，在阿尔茨海默症被诊断出十年前，就有可能出现短期记忆损害。
Major advances have since been made in brain imaging, biochemical analysis, and, perhaps most important, genetic testing. => 此后，大脑造影、生化分析以及 — — 也许是最重要的 — — 基因测试取得了重大进展。
Indeed, the risk of Alzheimer’s doubles if a parent or sibling has it, probably due in large part to the presence of the ApoE gene. => 事实上，如果双亲或兄弟姐妹中有人罹患阿尔茨海默症，你的患病风险也将翻番，这很有可能是因为ApoE基因所赐。

The risk triples for Europeans who inherit a particular type of ApoE, called ε4; inheriting two copies of ε4 increases the risk roughly tenfold. => 遗传了某种ApoE基因（ε4）的欧洲人得阿尔茨海默症的概率会增加两倍；遗传双份ε4基因会让概率增加大约十倍。

But genetic testing alone is unlikely to be an accurate predictor, because around half of Alzheimer’s sufferers do not carry ε4, and probably half of those with ε4 do not develop the disease. => 但光靠基因测试无法作为准确的指标，因为大约一半的阿尔茨海默症患者不携带ε4，并且可能有一半的ε4携带者不会发生阿尔茨海默症。
Moreover, though international studies of more than 70,000 people have found over 20 other genes linked to Alzheimer’s, their impact is minimal. => 此外，尽管对70,000多人的国际研究表明有20多个基因与阿尔茨海默症有关，但它们的作用很小。
The study showed which tests were able to predict the outcome most accurately decades ahead of onset. => 研究表明了那些测试可以在症状出现前几十年最准确地预测结果。
Fifteen years prior to onset, a positron emission tomography (PET) scan showed amyloid-beta being deposited in plaques in the brain itself. => 痴呆症状出现前十五年，正电子发射成像术（PET）扫描显示乙型淀粉样蛋白正在大脑本身的斑块中堆积。
And detailed short-term memory tests were abnormal ten years before onset, as suggested in the Framingham and Kungsholmen studies. => 弗莱明汉姆和国王岛研究表明，痴呆症状出现前十年，详细短期记忆测试会有不正常表现。
These tests are now becoming part of clinical practice, and are available commercially. => 这些测试目前正在成为临床实践的一部分，并以投入商业应用。

Memory and other cognitive tests can reveal whether one has minor problems with some aspects of thinking – a condition known as “mild cognitive impairment” that precedes Alzheimer’s disease. => 记忆和其他认知测试可以揭示你是否在思维的某些方面存在小问题 — — 所谓的“温和认知损伤 ” ， 常常在阿尔茨海默症之前出现。

PET scans are slightly less accurate, while routine MRI brain scans can reveal with perhaps only 70% accuracy subtle abnormalities in people with mild cognitive impairment. => PET扫描准确率略低，而常规的MRI脑部扫描大概只能揭示70%的存在温和认知损伤人士的准确微小异常。

Scientists are therefore still searching for an accurate predictive test that is cheaper, quicker, and less invasive than PET scans or lumbar punctures. => 因此，科学家仍在寻找比PET扫描或腰椎穿刺更廉价、更快速、更加不痛苦的准确预测测试方法。

This year, two small studies of blood tests seemed to predict Alzheimer’s 1-3 years before it occurred, but the tests are complicated and require the measurement of ten or more substances. => 今年，两项小型血液测试研究似乎可以在阿尔茨海默症出现前1—3年作出预测，但测试很复杂，需要测量十种或以上物质。

The trickier question is whether we will be able to predict Alzheimer’s disease accurately in those with normal cognition and memory, or to predict it more than five years in advance. => 更困难的问题是我们是否能够准确预测认知和记忆能力正常人士的阿尔茨海默症，或在阿尔茨海默症出现五年前就做出预测。
