Even if accurate early prediction of Alzheimer’s eventually is achieved, there are currently no drugs available to prevent or cure it before the amyloid plaques start destroying the mind. => 即使最终实现了阿尔茨海默症的早期准确预测，目前也没有药物能够在淀粉样斑块破坏思维之前预防或治疗阿尔茨海默症。
That will be our next great challenge. => 这将是下一个大挑战。
Africa’s Necessary Data Revolution => 非洲需要数据革命
That makes sense. => 这是有意义的事情。
Assessing the international community’s next development agenda, regardless of its details, will be impossible without accurate data. => 要想评估国际社会的下一个发展日程（不管其细节如何 ） ， 没有准确地数据是万万不能的。

Yet, in Sub-Saharan Africa – the region with the most potential for progress under the forthcoming Sustainable Development Goals – accurate data are severely lacking. => 但是，在撒哈拉以南非洲 — — 在即将到来的可持续发展目标（Sustainable Development Goals）的指引下，该地区拥有最大的进步潜力 — — 极度缺乏准确数据。

From 1990 to 2009, only one Sub-Saharan country had data on all 12 indicators established in 2000 by the Millennium Development Goals. => 从1990年到2009年，只有一个撒哈拉以南国家拥有2000年千年发展目标（Millennium Development Goals）所制定的全部12项指标的数据。
Indeed, of the 60 countries with complete vital statistics, not one is in Africa. => 事实上，在关键统计数据完备的60个国家中，没有一个是非洲国家。
Inaccurate data can have serious consequences. => 失准的数据可能造成严重后果。
Consider Nigeria’s experience earlier this year, when GDP rebasing showed that the economy was nearly 90% larger than previously thought. => 以今年早些时候的尼日利亚为例，GDP重估表明该国经济比此前认为的要大近90 % 。

The distorted picture of Nigeria’s economy provided by the previous statistics likely led to misguided decisions regarding private investment, credit ratings, and taxation. => 此前的数据对尼日利亚经济的扭曲刻画可能导致私人投资、信用评级和税收等方面的决策不当。
Moreover, it meant that Nigeria was allocated more international aid than it merited – aid that could have gone to needier countries. => 此外，这意味着尼日利亚获得了比它所应该获得的更多的国际援助 — — 这些援助本可以用于更加需要的国家。

Contrary to popular belief, the constraints on the production and use of basic data stem not from a shortage of technical capacity and knowhow, but from underlying political and systemic challenges. => 与流行观点相反，基本数据生产和使用的约束并非来自技术能力和知识的欠缺，而是来自基本政治和制度挑战。
Poorly designed policies also undermine the accuracy of data. => 设计不当的政策也妨碍了数据的准确性。

For example, governments and donors sometimes tie funding to self-reported measures, which creates incentives for recipients to over-report key data like vaccination or school-enrollment rates. => 比如，政府和出资方有时让资金与自我报告措施挂钩，这就给受助者造成了夸大关键数据（如疫苗接种率和入学率）的激励。
Without effective oversight, these well-intentioned efforts to reward progress can go awry. => 没有有效监督，这些本意良好的奖励进步计划有可能适得其反。
Despite these failings, national governments and international donors continue to devote far too few resources to ensuring the collection of adequate data. => 尽管存在这些弊端，但国家政府和国际出资者用于确保收集足够数据的投入仍然太少。

Only 2% of official development aid is earmarked for improving the quality of statistics – an amount wholly insufficient to assess accurately the impact of the other 98% of aid. => 只有2%的官方发展援助被用于改善数据质量 — — 这一数字完全不足以准确评估其他98%的援助所产生的效果。
And governments’ dependency on donors to fund and gather their core statistics is unsustainable. => 而政府依赖出资者供资和收集核心统计数据的做法也是不可持续的。

These include statistics on births and deaths; growth and poverty; tax and trade; health, education, and safety; and land and the environment. => 这些统计数据包括出生和死亡数据、增长和贫困数据、税收和贸易数据、卫生、教育和安全数据，以及土地和环境数据等。
Developing such systems is an ambitious but achievable goal. => 发展这样的制度是远大但可实现的目标。
All that is needed is a willingness to experiment with new approaches to collecting, using, and sharing data. => 所需要的只是实验新方法以收集、使用和共享数据的意愿。
This is where the public comes in. => 公众可以在这方面起作用。

While it may be tempting to bypass government and hope for an easy technology-based solution, sustainable, credible progress will be difficult without public-sector involvement. => 绕过政府、寄希望于简单的基于技术的解决方案或许很有诱惑力，但若无公共部门参与，很难产生持续而可信的进展。

The recognition by governments and external donors of the need for more – and more efficient – funding, particularly to national statistical systems, will be integral to such a shift. => 政府和外部出资者认识到增加资金规模和效率的必要性（特别是国家统计制度问题）将有利于这一转变。
In fact, tying progress on those metrics to funding via pay-for-performance agreements could improve development outcomes considerably. => 事实上，用指标衡量进步，并采取按表现出资的协议可以大量改善开发成果。
One concrete strategy to achieve these goals would be to create a country-donor compact for better data. => 一个实现这些目标的具体战略是订立关于改善数据的国家-出资者契约。

Such a compact would enable governments and donors to express their shared intention to build a national statistics system over a period of several years, with clear and verifiable milestones. => 这一契约能让政府和出资者明确在几年的时间里建立国家统计制度的共同意愿，并定义明确可证的里程碑。
In short, a data compact would help to mobilize and focus domestic and donor funding to achieve national statistical priorities. => 简言之，数据契约有助于动员和集中国内和出资者资金实现国家统计数据的当务之急。

Data are the currency of performance, accountability, and credibility in the global economy, and improvements in data have been linked to better governance and higher levels of private investment. => 数据是全球经济绩效、问责和信誉的通货，改善数据与改善治理和增加私人投资息息相关。
That is just what Africa needs to support a new decade of growth and development. => 非洲想要支持增长和发展的新十年，需要的正是改善数据。
The Experts’ Advantage => 专家优势
LONDON – Nearly everyone who sits on Google’s board of directors has at least one computer science or engineering degree or doctorate. => 伦敦 — — 谷歌董事会每位董事几乎都握有至少一个计算机科学或工程学位，或者拥有博士学位。
For Google, it pays to have technical expertise at the top. => 对谷歌而言，技术专家坐镇高层自有其好处。
But Google is an unusual corporate giant in promoting those with scientific prowess to the top of the management ladder. => 但谷歌在提拔具有科技实力的高管方面却称得起是非同寻常的企业巨头。
Beyond Silicon Valley, few senior corporate executives boast technical expertise in the products that their companies produce. => 在硅谷以外，鲜有企业高管掌握本企业产品领域的技术专长。
Nowadays, it seems as anomalous to have knowledge workers serve as professional leaders as it once did to have scientists in the boardroom. => 今天像以往那样让知识型员工任专业领导、让科学家进入董事会似乎已不太寻常。
Hospitals used to be run by doctors; today, only 5% of US hospitals’ CEOs are medical doctors, and even fewer doctors run UK hospitals. => 医生曾经是医院的管理者，但今天只有5%的美国医院由医生出任首席执行官，而管理英国医院的医生则更是少之又少。
“Medicine should be left to the doctors,” according to a common refrain, “and organizational leadership should be left to professional managers.” => 现代人常说“医学问题就留给医生去操心，而职业经理人则应当在组织中担任领导角色。 ”
But this is a mistake. => 但这种理解是个误区。

Research shows that higher-performing US hospitals are likely to be led by doctors with outstanding research reputations, not by management professionals. => 研究表明高效的美国医院由科研声誉卓著的医生管理，而不���专门管理人员的可能性更高。

The evidence also suggests that hospitals perform better, and have lower death rates, when more of their managers up to board level are clinically trained. => 此外还有证据表明如果董事会管理者接受过临床培训，那么医院总体业绩更好、死亡率也更低。
We see similar findings in other fields. => 其他领域的发现也十分类似。

My research shows that the world’s best universities, for example, are likely to be led by exceptional scholars whose performance continues to improve over time. => 比方说，我所做的研究表明全世界最好的大学可能是由出色的学者领导，而他们的绩效往往随着时间的推移而不断提高。
Departmental-level analysis supports this. => 部门一级的分析数据也支持这种观点。
A university economics department, for example, tends to perform better the more widely its head’s own research is cited. => 打个比方，如果某大学经济系主任的研究成果被广泛引用，那么该系的绩效相应也会更为出色。
With experts in charge, it may not always look like there is an effective reporting structure in place. => 专家管理时并不总需要有效的报告体制。
But, as the academic saying goes: just because you cannot herd cats, does not mean there is not a feline hierarchy. => 但就像学术界一句俗语所说：虽然猫科动物很少成群活动，但并不等于不存在等级结构。
As with cats, academics operate a “relative hierarchy” in which the person in charge changes, depending on the setting. => 就像猫科动物一样，学者管理采取一种随着管理者和环境不断变化的“相对层次结构 ” 。

Even in the world of sports, where success is not an obvious preparation for management, we see interesting linkages between experience and organizational performance. => 即使在运动成绩并非明显管理必备要素的体育界，我们也能在经验和组织绩效间看到某种有趣的联系。
The very best NBA basketball players often make top coaches, while former Formula 1 champion drivers are associated with great team performance. => 最优秀的NBA篮球运动员往往能够成为顶级教练，而前一级方程式冠军车手执教的车队大都也表现出色。
Of the 92 soccer clubs in the English football league, club managers played an average of 16 years in senior clubs. => 92家英格兰足球联赛俱乐部经理在高级俱乐部的平均服役年限为16年。
Alex Ferguson, arguably Britain’s best manager, scored an average of one goal every two games in his professional career. => 弗格森也许是全英国最好的足球经理，他在职业生涯中每两场比赛打入一个球。
But where the pattern does occur, especially in the business world, we should take note. => 但我们对以商界为代表的模式适用领域应当多加关注。
The senior partner of any professional services firm is likely to have been a top performer during a long career with the firm. => 任何专业服务公司的高级合伙人很可能在其漫长的职业生涯中一直是该公司顶尖的执行者。
This might be because experts and professionals in knowledge-intensive organizations prefer a boss who has excelled in their field. => 这或许是因为专家和知识密集型组织的专业人士更愿意由在本领域取得过出类拔萃成绩的老板来领导自己的工作。
The leader’s credibility is vital: if she sets high standards, it seems only right that she should have matched or exceeded them herself. => 领导者的信誉至关重要：如果她制定高标准，那么这个标准她自己应该达到或者超过。
In short, she must lead by example. => 总之，她必须能够以身作则。
This sort of leadership arrangement creates a virtuous circle. => 这种领导机制的循环是良性的。
A leader with prior experience knows how her subordinates feel, how to motivate them, and how to create the right working environment. => 有过职业经历的领导了解下属的感受、懂得如何激励下属，以及如何创造良好的工作环境。
The problem, however, is not simply that today’s leaders lack technical knowledge; it is that experts are often reluctant to lead. => 但问题并不是今天的领导人缺乏技术知识那样简单；事实是专家往往不愿意承担领导工作。
But that can change. => 但这种情况可以改变。

By communicating the importance of management and leadership early in a specialist’s career, and by offering tailored, digestible, and jargon-free training, we could bridge the gap. => 如果在专家职业生涯的早期向其宣传管理和领导工作的重要性并提供专门定制、易于消化且没有专业术语的培训，我们可以弥补这条鸿沟。
Many medical schools are already considering including management education as part of the curriculum. => 很多医学院已经在考虑把管理教育纳入课程之中。
The trick is to get experts, who are trained to go ever deeper into their specialization, to step back and view the big picture. => 关键是让一向精于钻研专业领域的专家退后一步，建立大局观。
With the right preparation, there is no reason why a leader cannot specialize and manage. => 只要正确引导，领导人可以在专业和管理领域同样精通。
The results could be remarkable. => 结果可能会令人赞叹。
Think of how governments run by scientists with management skills might respond to climate change. => 想想由具有管理技能的科学家组成的政府可能会怎样应对气候变化。
Top minds should be put to top use. => 顶级人才本来就应当被委以重任。
A Mania for Diagnosing Bipolar Disorder => 双相障碍诊断乱象
Even patients who are diagnosed with bipolar disorder often wait more than 10 years after initially seeking treatment for the correct diagnosis to be made. => 即便是被诊断为双相障碍的病人，从最初的求诊到最后的确诊也往往会经历十多年的时间。

But, perhaps as a consequence of concerted efforts to improve the recognition of bipolar disorder, during the past few years we have observed the emergence of an opposite phenomenon – over-diagnosis. => 然而，同心协力提升对双相障碍的认识的努力很可能产生了反作用。 在过去几年里我们观察到了另一种极端的现象—过度诊断。

In my own practice, my colleagues and I have encountered patients who reported that they were previously diagnosed with bipolar disorder, despite lacking a history of manic or hypomanic episodes. => 在我自己的从医经历中，我和同事们碰到过一些病人反映说他们虽然没有过狂躁或轻度狂躁的情况，但也曾被诊断为双相障碍。
To be sure, we have also seen patients seeking treatment for depression who really did have bipolar disorder. => 当然，我们也的确看到有些因抑郁求诊的病人确实患有双相障碍。
However, there seemed to be more over-diagnosis than under-diagnosis. => 然而，过度诊断的情况似乎比诊断不足的情况多。
We therefore conducted a study to examine empirically how often bipolar disorder might be over- and under-diagnosed. => 于是我们便展开了一项研究，从经验的层面来考察双相障碍被过度诊断和诊断不足的程度。
Family history information was obtained from the patient regarding their immediate relatives. => 我们还从病人处获得了关于其近亲的家庭病史的信息。

Slightly more than 20% (145 patients) in our sample reported that they had been previously diagnosed as having bipolar disorder, significantly higher than the 12.9% rate based on the SCID. => 抽样病患中有20%多一点的人（145粒）报告之前曾被诊断为患有双相障碍，这比基于SCID的12.9%的诊断率要高得多。
Less than half of those who reported that they had been previously diagnosed with bipolar disorder were diagnosed with bipolar disorder based on the SCID. => 报告之前曾被诊断为患有双相障碍的人之中根据SCID被确诊为双相障碍的不到一半。
Our findings, validated by family history, thus suggest that bipolar disorder was over-diagnosed. => 我们的研究发现经过家族病史的确认，从而显示出双相障碍被过度诊断的情况。

Any study seeking to determine whether a psychiatric disorder is over-diagnosed will find that some patients with the condition do not have it upon re-interview. => 任何试图判断某种精神障碍是否被过度诊断的研究都会发现某种病情在病人再次问诊时却没了踪影。
Such is the nature of the imperfect reliability of psychiatric diagnosis. => 这就是精神病学诊断的可靠性具有缺陷的特点。
The question, then, is not whether some patients previously given a diagnosis do not seem to have it upon re-interview, but rather how many. => 因此，真正的问题就不在于是否有的曾被确诊病人再次求诊时似乎全然无恙，而是这样的病人有多少。
How high the percentage should be before claiming over-diagnosis is a significant problem and a value judgment. => 诊断的百分比应该达到多高才能说过度诊断是个严重的问题—这是个价值判断。
But we think that an over-diagnosis rate of more than 50% crosses the clinical significance threshold. => 但我们认为高于50%的过度诊断率超过了临床意义的极限。
Over-diagnosis of bipolar disorder has costs. => 双相障碍的过度诊断会造成不良后果。
Thus, over-diagnosing bipolar disorder can unnecessarily expose patients to serious side-effects of medication. => 因此，双相障碍的过度诊断可能让病人不必要地承受严重的药物副作用。

The impact of marketing efforts by pharmaceutical companies and publicity probably plays a role in the emerging tendency to over-diagnose bipolar disorder. => 制药公司的营销和宣传的影响很可能也对双相障碍的过度诊断的趋势起到了推波助澜的作用。

Direct-to-consumer advertisements that refer individuals to screening questionnaires can result in patients suggesting to their doctors that they have bipolar disorder. => 那些让个人使用筛查问卷的直接以消费者为对象的广告可能使病人在面对医生时暗示自己患了双相障碍。
We have seen evidence of this in our practice. => 我们在自身的经历中也见到过这样的例子。
This does not necessarily reflect a problem with the performance of a screening questionnaire, but rather how these scales are used. => 这并不一定反映了筛查问卷本身有效性的问题，而是反映了这些标准如何被使用的问题。

Screening questionnaires maximize sensitivity, at a cost of false positives, because it is presumed that they are followed by expert clinical evaluation. => 筛查问卷以假阳性为代价使敏感度最大化，因为其假设前提是这些结果随后会被专家进行临床评估。
But insufficient diagnostic rigor can result in over-diagnosis. => 但若诊断过程不够严格就可能造成过度诊断。
Clinicians are inclined to diagnose disorders that they feel more comfortable treating. => 临床医生们倾向于诊断那些他们治疗起来比较拿手的（精神）障碍。
The results of our study are consistent with prior studies suggesting possible problems with the diagnosis of bipolar disorder. => 我们的研究成果和此前针对双相障碍诊断中可能存在的问题的研究是一致的。
Both can have negative consequences. => 而两者都会造成不良的后果。
While there is still some uncertainty as to the best assessment approach, we recommend that clinicians use a standardized, validated method. => 鉴于在最佳评估方法上还有一些不确定性，我们推荐医生们采用标准化的、经过验证的方法。
When Tweets Trump Diplomacy => 当Tweet文压倒外交
NEW DELHI – Diplomacy often witnesses unusual spats. => 新德里—外交经常预见不同寻常的争吵。

There was the Pig and Potato War of 1859, the Affair of the Dancing Lamas in 1924, and the Bogotá Bracelet incident of 1970, to name just a few. => 1859年有猪和土豆战争（Pig and Potato War ） ， 1924年有跳舞的喇嘛事件（Affair of the Dancing Lamas ） ， 1970年有波哥大手镯（Bogotá Bracelet）事故，诸如此类。
But few were more surprising than the just-concluded Episode of the Offensive Doormats. => 但很少有比刚刚结束的冒犯性门垫事件（Episode of the Offensive Doormats）更加令人震惊的。

In just a few 140-character messages, Swaraj denounced the company and threatened to cancel its employees’ visas and refuse visas to its executives in the future. => 斯瓦拉伊谴责亚马逊公司，并威胁要吊销其员工的签证，拒绝日后为其高管签发签证。

What provoked Swaraj’s outburst was a Twitter user’s complaint to her that the Amazon Canada website offered for sale doormats depicting the Indian flag. => 让斯瓦拉伊突然爆发的是一位Twitter用户像她投诉亚马逊加拿大网站贩卖印度国旗图案的门垫。

The notion that dirty shoes would be wiped on a representation of the Indian flag had outraged the tweeter, Atul Bhobe, who contacted – and found an advocate in – Swaraj. => 印度国旗被肮脏的鞋子踩踏，这样的情景让这位名叫阿图尔·鲍比（Atul Bhobe）的Twitter用户怒不可遏，与撒瓦拉伊取得了联系，并得到后者的支持。
Amazon was swift to respond. => 亚马逊很快就做出了反应。
Less than 24 hours after the doormat crisis erupted, the matter was defused. => 门垫危机爆发不到24小时，事件便已经解决。
But the episode raises a number of broader issues that won’t disappear so quickly. => 但此事所引起的诸多更广泛的问题不会这么快消退。
The first issue is Swaraj’s use of Twitter. => 第一个问题是撒瓦拉伊对Twitter的使用。
I certainly do not oppose the use of Twitter by public officials. => 我当然不反对公职官员使用Twitter。
On the contrary, I view the growing comfort of government ministers with social media as a matter for celebration. => 相反，我认为越来越多的政府部长习惯于社交媒体可喜可贺。

That a foreign minister would respond to a Twitter complaint on such trivial matters, some would argue, seems to indicate that she lacks more important things to do. => 一些人认为，外交部长回应投诉琐事的tweet文表明她没有更重要的事情可做。
But the problem extends beyond Swaraj’s communication with ordinary citizens. => 但问题不仅在于撒瓦拉伊与普通公民的交流。
Such a move is unprecedented, and not particularly welcome. => 这样的做法可谓前无古人，也不是很受欢迎。
Social media is no substitute for a diplomatic cable. => 社交媒体不是外交专线的替代品。
Also less than diplomatic was the language Swaraj used in her warning to the company. => 同样不够“外交”的还有撒瓦拉伊警告亚马逊公司的用词。
“Amazon must tender unconditional apology,” she tweeted. => “亚马逊必须无条件道歉 ” ， 她发tweet文说。
“They must withdraw all products insulting our national flag immediately. => “他们必须立刻下架有辱我国国旗的产品。
If this is not done forthwith, we will not grant Indian Visa to any Amazon official. We will also rescind the Visas issued earlier.” => 如果不马上落实，我们将不会向任何亚马逊官员签发印度签证，并废除此前发出的签证。
A profession famed for summoning ambassadors for a discreet dressing-down has been reduced to upbraiding companies on Twitter. => ”外交部长的责任应该是传召大使进行谨慎的斥责，现在却堕落到在Twitter上抨击公司。
But Indians have a particularly low threshold for what qualifies as disrespect. => 但印度人对什么构成不尊重的门槛很低。
And it’s not just the flag. => 并且不仅仅是国旗。

Last year, Amazon enraged many Indians by offering doormats with pictures of Indian gods and goddesses, prompting the furious hashtag #BoycottAmazon. => 去年，亚马逊因为出售印有印度诸神的门垫而激怒了许多印度人，催生了愤怒的热门标签#BoycottAmazon（抵制亚马逊 ） 。
Two years earlier, the company’s website had caused similar outrage by selling women’s leggings with images of Hindu gods. => 两年前，亚马逊网站因为出售印有印度教神形象的女士紧身裤而引起类似的众怒。
So Amazon is no stranger to the anger of offended Indians. => 因此，亚马逊对于遭到冒犯的印度人的愤怒早已见怪不怪。

But the company’s swift capitulation in the latest incident – which will surely not be the last – shows that the value of a gigantic market like India far outweighs that of any single product. => 但该公司在最近的事件 — — 显然这不会是最后一次 — — 中迅速“认怂”表明大如印度的市场的重要性远远大于某种商品。
China has already proved that it can dictate terms to multinationals that covet its vast market. => 中国已经证明，它可以指定条件要求觊觎其巨大市场的跨国公司就范。
India, it seems, will follow suit. => 印度似乎要效而仿之。
But whoever has emerged as the winner of the doormat debacle – outraged Twitter users, perhaps – diplomacy has been the loser. => 但不论谁是门垫灾难的赢家 — — 也许是暴怒的Twitter用户 — — 外交都是输家。
Ambivalent Arabia => 矛盾的沙特阿拉伯
A democratic tide seems to be sweeping across the Arab world. => 一股民主浪潮正在席卷阿拉伯世界。
Even the traditional Arab monarchies and Emirates are changing in its wake. => 即使是那些传统的阿拉伯君主国和酋长国也正循着这股浪潮发生着某种改变。

Kuwait now allows women to vote, Qatar has embraced an ambitious reform program, Bahrain has shown great tolerance of mass demonstrations, and the U.A.E. is allowing something like a free press. => 科威特现在已经允许妇女参加投票，卡塔尔接受了一项艰巨的改革计划，巴林对群众示威游行表现出了极大的容忍，阿拉伯联合酋长国正允许通过某种新闻自由制度。

But Saudi Arabia continues to be deeply wary of any sort of change, and thus remains a huge and seemingly immovable obstacle to region-wide reform. => 但是沙特阿拉伯却依然对任何一种改变谨慎提防，也因此成为了阿拉伯地区改革进程中一块巨大无比、看起来岿然不动的绊脚石。

Although the Saudi ruling family, the al-Saud, is under enormous pressure to follow the example of its neighbors, internal resistance to doing so remains very strong. => 尽管沙特的统治家族 — — 邵德（al-Saud）家族，承受了要求他们学习邻国榜样的巨大压力，但是内部的反对力量依然很强。

So the al-Saud have become Janus-faced: looking in one direction, the royal family encourages democratic reformers to speak out; looking in the opposite direction, it jails them when they do. => 因此，邵德家族变成了双面派：一方面，皇室家族鼓励民主改革者大胆直言，另一方面，当民主改革者这么做的时候，皇室就把他们打入大牢。
Their crime was to call for a constitutional monarchy. => 他们的罪行是提倡鼓动宪法君主体制。

The official verdict states that they threatened national unity, challenged those in authority, and incited public opinion against the state while using “foreign,” that is, Western, terminology. => 官方判决称，他们使用“外国的 ” ， 也就是“西方的”的术语，威胁国家统一，挑战国家主权，煽动民众反对国家。
The petition called for the monarchy to work within constitutionally prescribed limits, and for an independent judiciary. => 这份请愿书要求君主政体在宪法规定的限度内工作，并且呼吁建立一个独立的司法体系。

The reformers believe that such reforms are the only way for Saudi Arabia to survive the threat of violence, instability, and national fragmentation that is looming on its horizon. => 改革者们相信这样的改革是唯一能使沙特阿拉伯在暴力威胁、不稳定性和国家分裂等这些已经初露端倪的危机中得以生存的办法。
Only a constitution, they argue, can restore much needed legitimacy to a political system that is widely perceived as deeply corrupt and inept. => 他们认为，只有宪法才能够恢复一个被普遍认为腐败无能的政治体系所需的合法性。

Crown Prince Abdullah, Saudi Arabia’s de facto ruler in place of his incapacitated half-brother King Fahd, is keen to be seen as a champion of reform. => 代替其碌碌无能的同父异母的兄长国王法德（King Fahd ） 、 沙特阿拉伯实际意义上的真正统治者皇储阿卜杜拉，非常希望被看作一个改革的赢家。
He received these proposals with a warm welcome in January 2003. => 2003年1月，他用一个热烈的欢迎仪式接受了这些提议。

But his half-brother and more powerful rival, Prince Naif, the Minister of Interior, ordered the arrests, trial, and imprisonment of 13 reformers in March 2004. => 但是他同父异母的兄长以及更为强大的竞争对手 — — 内政大臣纳伊夫亲王（Prince Naif）在2004年3月下令逮捕、审判并拘禁了13名改革者。
Crown Prince Abdullah offered not a peep of opposition, leaving the reform agenda that he initiated in a political netherworld. => 阿卜杜拉皇储没有提出一点儿反对意见，就把这场他发动的改革计划留在了政治地狱。

In order to maintain absolutist power and to minimize public anger, the Saudi princes, led by Prince Naif, asked the reformers to sign an agreement that they would never again ask for reform. => 为了维持绝对权力并最大限度地降低公众的愤慨之情，沙特的亲王们在纳伊夫亲王的带领下，要求改革者们签署一项协议保证他们再也不会要求改革。

Prince Naif bans the very word “reform” from public discourse, because it suggests that there is something wrong with the system; his preferred term is “development.” => 纳伊夫亲王在公共演讲中禁止使用“改革”一词，因为这个词暗示了体系中的问题；他更喜欢的词语是“发展 ” 。
Of the thirteen reformers who were arrested, ten submitted to this demand, but the other three refused and have paid the price. => 在13名被逮捕的改革者中，有十个人向这个要求低头屈服了，但是剩余三人明确拒绝并为此付出代价。
They remained in jail in Riyadh without legal representation until the final verdict. => 他们被关在Riyadh的监狱，在最后判决之前无法进行任何合法辩论。
Those who submitted had their passports withdrawn, lost their jobs, and were forbidden to speak to the press. => 那些屈服的人被扣押了护照，失去了工作并被剥夺了对新闻媒体说话的权利。

Under regional and international pressure, the Saudi ruling family has constructed a Potemkin village of reform while retaining absolute control over all political developments. => 在当地和国际压力下，沙特的统治家族建造了一个改革版的波特金村庄（Potemkin village ） ， 与此同时，将对所有政治发展的绝对控制权牢牢掌握在手中。

Earlier this year, they staged partial, and tightly regulated municipal elections, with no independent opinion permitted to influence when and how the ballots were held. => 今年年初，他们在局部范围内举行了一场严格控制的地方选举，不允许任何独立观点就应当何时以及如何举行选举发表评论。
These entire female population was excluded, and only one-quarter of the male population was eligible to vote. => 所有女性被排除在投票选举之外，并且只有四分之一的男性具有投票权。
Inevitably, Wahhabi Islamists did best. => 毫无疑问，只有瓦哈比伊斯兰分子（Wahhabi Islamists）才会做得最好。
The al-Saud face two threats: one from violent Islamists, and the other from liberal reformers. => 绍德家族现在面临两大威胁：一个来自崇尚暴力的伊斯兰分子，另一个来自自由改革者们。
There is every indication that they fear the reformers far more. => 很明显，他们更惧怕改革者。
Perhaps the princes believe that it is easier to kill “terrorist” criminals than to crush demands for social justice. => 也许亲王们认为，比起镇压要求社会正义的呼声，除去“恐怖主义”罪犯要容易得多。

Indeed, killing violent Islamists and al-Qaeda affiliates is applauded by the international community, especially the United States, as success in the “war on terrorism.” => 事实上，消灭暴力的伊斯兰分子和基地组织分子会被当作反恐战争的胜利受到国际社会的嘉奖，尤其是美国。
But as they hunt down and kill violent domestic extremists, they are quietly tightening the noose around all those who want moderate reform. => 但是当他们一路追寻并要除去国内的极端分子时，他们也悄悄地收紧了那些布在想要温和改革的人周围的套索。
This repression of liberal reformers passes unnoticed in the wider world, with America’s silence particularly noticeable. => 这种对自由改革的镇压就这样伴随着美国尤为明显的沉默，在世界范围内悄无声息地通过了。
This silence is vital to the princes, for what the al-Saud care about most is US support. => 这种沉默对亲王们至关重要，因为邵德家族最为在意的正是美国的支持。
As things stand in Saudi Arabia, the US administration has no credible ally for change outside of the existing regime. => 在沙特阿拉伯当前的情形下，除了当前的政权，美国政府没有其他可信任的同盟。
So, unlike in Ukraine, Georgia, Kyrgizstan, and Lebanon, it does nothing to encourage popular opposition. => 因此，与乌克兰、格鲁吉亚、吉尔吉斯和黎巴嫩不同，美国支持强烈反对派毫无意义。

As long as the Saudi regime meets America’s oil needs and fights Islamist radicals, it will continue to receive US support and silence – and hence its tacit consent. => 只要沙特���权能够满足美国的石油需求并对抗伊斯兰激进分子，它将会继续收到美国的支持和沉默 — — 以及它心照不宣的默许。
But turning a blind eye is shortsighted, for America and for the Saudis. => 但是，对美国和沙特阿拉伯来说，视而不见并非长久之计。
Those who make peaceful revolutions impossible make violent revolutions inevitable. => 那些抹杀和平革命可能性的人将会使暴力革命在所难免。
The liberal reformers who have been jailed could have paved the way for a peaceful transition to a reformed Saudi Arabia. => 那些被囚禁的自由改革者们可能已经为通向一个改革一新的沙特阿拉伯的和平演变铺平了道路。
By jailing them, the regime has made it clear that violence is the only avenue open to those seeking change. => 当局通过囚禁这些人已经明确表明，暴力是那些寻求改变者唯一可用的途径。
Algeria’s Dying Dictatorship => 行将就木的阿尔及利亚独裁

ALGIERS – Despite his failing health, Algerian President Abdelaziz Bouteflika won a fourth term last month, with 81% of the vote – or so the regime claimed. => 阿尔及尔—尽管健康每况愈下，阿尔及利亚总统阿卜杜拉齐兹·波特弗利卡（Abdelaziz Bouteflika）仍在本月第四次当选总统，支持率高达81 % — —至少他的政府是这么宣布的。

In fact, far from signaling growing political stability, the 77-year-old incumbent’s sham victory underscores just how few options Algerians have to effect change from within the system. => 事实上，这位77岁的现任总统的假胜利绝非政治日益稳定的信号，而是反映了阿尔及利亚人无法从体制内影响变局。
Under Bouteflika’s leadership, Algeria’s government has failed to address the country’s most pressing economic and social challenges. => 在波特弗利卡的领导下，阿尔及利亚政府无法解决该国最紧迫的经济和社会挑战。
And there is no reason to expect this to change. => 也看不到可以发生变化的信号。

Since suffering a stroke last year, Bouteflika has barely appeared in public, whether to campaign ahead of the vote or to acknowledge his victory after it. => 自去年中风以来，波特弗利卡就很少出现在公众面前，甚至在再次当选后都没有现身宣布自己的胜利。

As a result, the regime is finding it increasingly difficult to claim, as it has for the last 15 years, that Bouteflika’s leadership represents civilian control over the military. => 结果，他的政权越来越难以如过去15年那样宣布波特弗利卡的领导是文治而不是武治。

So it has devised a new strategy, aimed at creating a sense of transition: the constitution will be revised to designate a vice president as the president’s legitimate successor. => 因此，政权采取了新战略，旨在营造转型的氛围：宪法将作出修订，增加一名副总统作为总统的合法继任者。
Of course, the move’s true purpose will be to allow the army to rally around the next compliant “civilian leader.” => 当然，这一举措的真实目的是让军方团结在下一位顺从的“文官领导人”周围。
The regime will also propose a “national contract,” supposedly to initiate a dialogue with the opposition. => 政权还将提出“国民契约 ” ， 假装开启与反对派的对话。
But, in the wake of Bouteflika’s bogus victory, the opposition can no longer accept a sham role in the regime’s reform plans. => 但是，面对波特弗利卡的假胜利，反对派无法继续接受在政权的改革计划中扮演掩人耳目的角色。
When the election results were announced, they swiftly rejected the new government as illegitimate. => 在选举结果宣布后，他们马上拒绝承认新政府的合法性。
But, to gain credibility, the opposition parties will have to extend their criticism beyond Bouteflika to the system as a whole. => 但是，要获得信誉，反对党必须将批评从本特弗利卡一人扩大到整个体制。

This has become crucial to their survival, as younger opponents are seeking new ways to bring about political change outside state-controlled politics. => 这对于它们来说事关生死存亡，因为年轻一代反对派正在寻找新方式，在国家控制政治之外营造政治变革。
One important development is the growing influence of non-partisan voices of dissent. => 一个重要的发展趋势是无党派持异见者影响力日增。

Non-violent movements have formed to protest not only Bouteflika’s continued leadership, but also the pervasive role of the army and intelligence services in civil society. => 非暴力运动不但反对波特弗利卡的连选连任，也反对军方和情报机构在公民社会中的无孔不入。

Such movements, like the much-publicized “Barakat” (“Enough”), have encouraged a shift among Algerians from resentful abstention to active boycott. => 这些运动，如相当公开化的“足够 ” （ Barakat）运动，鼓励阿尔及利亚人从愤怒而消极的弃权转为积极的抵制。

Underground unions – which mount demonstrations and strikes to protect workers’ rights, while refusing to cooperate with the regime’s official unions – have also criticized the election. => 地下工会 — — 它们组织了保护工人权利的示威和罢工，并拒绝与政权的官方工会合作 — — 也批评选举。
Moreover, young people have assumed a prominent role in opposition efforts, such as by disrupting Bouteflika’s campaign rallies. => 此外，年轻人在反对运动 — — 包括干扰波特弗利卡的竞选阵营 — — 中起到了主导作用。

By organizing peaceful protests to demand accountability for public spending, these movements are raising issues that were not addressed during the election campaign. => 这些运动通过组织和平示威要求问责公共支出，引出了竞选期间未能解决的问题。

More immediately, they are also challenging the government’s ban on street demonstrations – a vestige of the state of emergency that lasted from 1992 until 2011. => 此后他们还挑战了政府的街头游行禁令 — — 从1992年一直持续到2011年的紧急状态后遗症。
With the civil war of the 1990’s long over, security officials cannot explain why Algerians are being arrested for demanding jobs. => 1990年内战已经过去很久，安全官员已无法解释为何要逮捕要求获得工作的阿尔及利亚人。
Of course, repression continues to intimidate many Algerians. => 当然，镇压将继续威胁许多阿尔及利亚人。
But it is becoming increasingly easy to rouse their sympathy for their fellow citizens through Twitter, YouTube, and Facebook. => 但通过Twitter、YouTube和Facebook激发他们对同胞人民的同情心已变得越来越容易。

By stimulating daily public debate about local human-rights violations, they spread the message of discontent more efficiently than traditional parties ever have. => 他们通过激发对本地侵犯人权行为的日常争论，更有效地传播不满情绪，这是此前的传统政党无法做到的。
Thus, even without explicitly talking about politics, ordinary Algerians are mobilizing in growing numbers against the government. => 因此，即使不明确谈论政治，仍有越来越多的普通阿尔及利亚人被动员起来反对政府。

The majority of street protests have occurred in the most deprived and neglected areas, and the primary demands have been economic: better jobs, housing, health-care services, and infrastructure. => 街头游行主要发生在权利受侵害最严重、最受忽视的地区，基本需求也都是经济方面的需求：更好的工作、住房、医疗服务和基础设施。
For some, the right to make a living through the informal market would be sufficient. => 对一些人来说，获得在非正式市场中讨生活的权利便已足够。

And demonstrators have gone to great – sometimes destructive – lengths to be heard, blocking roads, occupying factories and government buildings, and sabotaging water and electricity infrastructure. => 示威者的队伍十分庞大 — — 有时具有破坏性 — — 发出振聋发聩的声音，设置路障，占领工厂和政府大楼，捣毁供水和电力基础涉水。
More than 150 Algerians have even set themselves on fire since 2011, usually in front of public services buildings. => 自2011年以来，150多名阿尔及利亚人甚至不惜自焚 — — 地点多在政府大楼前。
In this context, the failure of the government’s half-baked attempts to buy off protesters is unsurprising. => 在这样��背景下，政府做出试图收买反对者的肤浅手段不足为奇。

But the plan backfired; protests intensified, with other workers demonstrating for similar benefits and railing against the inflation that the move engendered. => 但这一计划适得其反，示威更加严重了，其他部门的工人也要求获得同样的好处，并抗议政府的这一行为所导致的通货膨胀。

To be sure, street protests have already had a profound impact on Algeria’s authoritarian politics, with official fears of massive uprisings affecting public budgets and political appointments. => 平心而论，街头抗议已经对阿尔及利亚集权政治造成了深远影响，官员担心大规模动乱影响公共预算和政治任命。

But the decision to prolong Bouteflika’s presidency will not provide the kind of strong, transformational leadership that Algeria needs to materialize the regime’s stability promises. => 但延长波特弗利卡总统任期的决定并不能给阿尔及利亚带来实现政权的稳定承诺所需要的强大的转型性领导。
The Algerian authorities face a major challenge, because rejection of pluralist institutions makes it more difficult to find negotiating partners. => 阿尔及利亚当局面临着巨大的挑战，因为拒绝接受多元制度让它难以找到谈判伙伴。
The more the regime tries to buy off the protesters, the more overweening it appears – and the angrier citizens become. => 政权越是试图收买反对者，就会越显出它的自负 — — 人民也就变得越愤怒。
And the enraged younger generation, in particular, is not especially fearful of losing the limited benefits offered by the status quo. => 尤其是，愤怒的年轻一代并不特别害怕失去现状给他们带来的那点可怜的好处。
America After the Election => 大选后的美国
The contest has exposed deep fault lines within American society and damaged the country’s global reputation. => 这场选战暴露出美国社会内部深刻的断层线，也损害了美国的国际名誉。
No surprise, then, that one of the few things Americans seem to agree on is that the campaign has gone on for too long. => 因此，毫不奇怪，一件能让美国人统一意见的极少数事情之一便是这场选战实在是又臭又长。
But soon it will be over. => 但它马上就要结束了。
The question is: what comes next? => 问题是，接下来会怎样？
Polls suggest that Clinton, a former senator and secretary of state, will defeat the controversial Trump. => 民调显示，前参议员、国务卿克林顿将击败饱受争议的特朗普。
But polls are not to be confused with reality. => 但不要把民调与现实弄混了。
After all, going into June’s Brexit referendum, most observers believed that a victory for “Remain” was a sure thing. => 毕竟，6月份英国举行脱欧公投时，大部分观察家认为“留欧”阵营取得胜利是板上钉钉。
More recently, Colombian voters rejected a peace accord that was widely expected to receive popular approval. => 最近则有哥伦比亚人民拒绝和平协议的事件，人们原本广泛预期这一协议会受到热烈欢迎。
All of this is to say that, while a Clinton victory may be likely, it is no certainty. => 所有这些表明，尽管克林顿眼看就要取得胜利，但结果仍不确定。
The only poll that counts is the one on November 8. => 唯一有意义的民调是11月8日。
Until then, all we can do is speculate. => 在此之前，我们只能猜测。
Yet some predictions can be made with greater confidence. => 但已经有人做出了信心满满的预测。
Neither Democrats nor Republicans will be able to realize their objectives without at least some support from the other. => 不管是民主党还是共和党，都无法实现自己的目标，除非得到对方的一定的支持。
But no one should think that the only divide in American politics is between Republicans and Democrats. => 但决不能认为美国政治唯一的分歧点就在共和党和民主党。

In fact, splits within the two major parties are just as deep, with large and highly motivated factions pulling each to their respective extremes – Democrats to the left and Republicans to the right. => 事实上，两大党内部的分裂同样深刻，规模庞大、斗志昂扬的派系将两党推向各自的极端 — — 民主党左倾，共和党右倾。
This makes compromise on centrist positions all the more difficult to achieve. => 这导致在中间立场形成妥协的局面非常难以达成。
The rapid resumption of presidential politics will undermine compromise further. => 总统政治的迅速卷土重来将进一步破坏妥协。
If Clinton wins, many Republicans will assume that it was only because of Trump’s flaws, and they will judge her likely to be a one-term president. => 如果克林顿获胜，许多共和党人会将全部责任推给特朗普的缺陷，而认为克林顿只能担任一个任期。
A country favoring change, they will conclude, is unlikely to keep a Democrat in the Oval Office for a fourth term. => 他们会这样认为：一个喜欢变化的国家不可能让民主党主宰椭圆办公室四个任期。

Many Republicans (especially those who deny the legitimacy of a Clinton victory) will thus seek to frustrate her administration, lest she be able to run again in 2020 as a successful incumbent. => 许多共和党人（特别是那些否认克林顿胜利合法性的共和党）将因此寻求对克林顿政府从中作梗，唯恐她在2020年作为成功的在任总统再次竞选。
Given how much of Trump’s agenda his fellow policymakers would likely find objectionable, governing would be very difficult during his administration. => 特朗普��策团队所制定的日程必将遭遇重重阻力，在他的任期内，治理国家将非常困难。
In either scenario, it may still be possible to make progress in a few key areas. => 不管发生哪个情景，仍有可能在一些关键领域取得进展。

The next US government might manage to enact legislation to fund the modernization of America’s aging infrastructure, a policy that both candidates and many in Congress favor. => 下一届美国政府或可以实施立法筹资对美国陈旧的基础设施进行现代化，两位获选人和许多国会议员都支持这样做。

It might also be able to cobble together a majority to reform the US tax code – in particular, lowering the high rate for corporations and raising taxes on the wealthy. => 或许也有望凑成多数改革美国税法 — — 特别是降低高昂的公司税率并对富人增税。

There could even be some reform of health care, President Barack Obama’s signature achievement, owing to serious implementation problems with the current system. => 甚至还可能会有一些医疗改革，作为奥巴马总统招牌式的成就，当前医疗制度仍存在严重的实施问题。
But other issues requiring cooperation between Congress and the president are unlikely to be addressed any time soon. => 但其他要求国会与总统合作的问题绝无可能在短期得到解决。
One is immigration reform, which is as controversial in the US as it is in Europe. => 其一是移民改革，这个问题在美国与在欧洲一样存在争议。
Meanwhile, America’s deficit and debt are certain to rise, as there seems to be little or no will to reduce entitlement spending. => 与此同时，美国的赤字和债务也必将增加，因为根本看不出有削减福利支出的意愿。
The foreign-policy implications of the election are somewhat different, because, under the US Constitution, the president enjoys considerable latitude. => 大选的外交政策影响略有不同，因为，根据美国宪法，总统享有相当大的自由度。

While only Congress can officially declare war or ratify treaties, presidents may use (or refuse to use) military force without explicit congressional approval. => 只有国会可以正式宣战或批准条约，但总统可以在没有国会明确批准的情况下使用（或拒绝使用）武力。

They can also enter into international agreements other than treaties, appoint powerful White House staff, and change US foreign policy by executive action, as Obama recently did regarding Cuba. => 总统还可以签署国际协定而非条约，任命强力白宫官员，以及通过行政动作改变美国外交政策（如奥巴马最近对古巴的动作 ） 。
It is more difficult to guess what Trump would do. => 特朗普会怎么做更难猜测。
He is, after all, a political outsider, so no one knows how much of his campaign rhetoric would be translated into policy. => 毕竟，他是政治局外人，因此没人知道他的竞选纲领中有多少会转化为政策。

Still, one could anticipate a Trump administration distancing itself from some traditional allies in Europe and Asia and standing mostly aloof from the Middle East. => 但人们可能预测特朗普政府将与某些欧洲和亚洲的传统盟友保持距离，对中东更是敬而远之。
What exactly will happen to America after the presidential election remains an open question. => 美国总统大选后究竟会发生什么仍是一个开放性问题。
America and Europe => 美国和欧洲

Deeply frustrated by the Bush administration’s policies, many people and governments in Europe hope for a fundamental change in American foreign policy after the upcoming presidential election. => 在对布什政府的政策深感挫伤之后，欧洲的许多人和政府都希望在即将进行的总统大选之后，美国的外交政策能有根本性的变化。
But it would take a medium-sized political miracle for these hopes not to be disappointed, and such a miracle will not happen – whoever is elected. => 但要这些希望别成为失望，就需要有一场中等规模的政治奇迹，而这样的奇迹将不会发生—不管谁当选。
The Bush administration made numerous foreign-policy blunders with far-reaching consequences. => 布什政府在外交政策上屡犯大错，后果深远。
But Bush neither invented American unilateralism nor triggered the transatlantic rift between the United States and Europe. => 但布什既没有发明美国的单边主义，也没有造成大西洋两岸欧美之间的裂隙。

To be sure, Bush reinforced both trends, but their real causes lie in objective historical factors, namely America’s being the sole world power since 1989 and Europe’s self-inflicted weakness. => 确切地说，布什强化了这两种趋势，但究其原因还在于客观的历史因素，也就是自1989年以来美国在世界上的一家独大和欧洲自作自受的软弱。

As long as America remains the sole world power, the next US President will be neither able nor willing to change the basic framework of America’s foreign policy. => 只要美国仍然还是世界唯一的超级大国，下一任美国总统就既不能也不愿改变美国外交政策的基本框架。
It will, of course, be important who wins the presidency: a candidate expected to continue Bush’s foreign policy or someone ready for a new beginning. => 当然，谁赢得总统宝座也很重要：是一个会继续布什外交政策的候选人，还是一个准备重新开始的人。
In the former case, the transatlantic rift will deepen dramatically. => 如果是前一种情况，欧美之间的裂隙会进一步加深。

Four, or even eight, more years of US policy à la Bush would inflict such damage on the substance of the transatlantic alliance as to threaten its very existence. => 4年，甚至8年的“布什式”美国政策的继续会给跨大西洋联盟造成实质性的破坏，甚至危及其生存。
That is the good news. => 那将会是条好消息。

The bad news is that, even under such auspicious conditions, the US, as a world power, will not relinquish its “free-hand” policy or forget its strength and its claim to preeminence among nations. => 而坏消息则是，即便在如此祥和的环境下，美国作为世界唯一的超级大国，也不会放弃其“随心所欲”的政策或忘记自身的实力，令其他国家唯其马首是瞻。
To this common agenda, the Europeans should add Africa, climate change, and reform of the United Nations and the world trading system. => 欧洲人还应该把非洲、气候变化和联合国改革及世界贸易体系写入这一共同议程。
For a long time, Europe has underestimated its weight and importance. => 长期以来，欧洲都低估了自己的份量和重要性。
Europe’s geopolitical, economic, and social weight is quite obvious. => 它在地缘政治、经济和社会方面的影响力不言自明。
But Europe’s integration of sovereign states’ interests by means of common institutions could also be an example for much of the world. => 但欧洲通过共同制度整合主权国家利益的方式也同样为世界其他许多地方做出了榜样。

This modern, progressive, and peaceful model is unique and superior to all other currently available approaches to the fundamental questions of political order. => 这种现代、进步且和平的模式是独特的，并且优于其它所有现行的、针对政治秩序的根本性问题的众多模式。
But could doesn’t mean will. => 但“能够”并不意味着“将要 ” 。

Europe’s global influence is feeble because of its internal quarrels and lack of unity, which render the European Union weak and limit its ability to act. => 欧洲全球影响力的虚弱是由于内部纷争和缺乏统一。 这让欧盟也变得软弱，并限制了它的行动能力。
Objectively strong, subjectively infirm – that is how the EU’s present condition can be described. => 外强中干—这就是对欧盟现状的最佳描述。
In light of these developments, does it still make sense to speak of “the West”? => 在这样的形势下，再提“西方”还有意义么？
I believe it does, more than ever, because the rift between Europe and America leaves both sides substantially weaker in global terms. => 我认为比以往任何时候都有意义，因为欧美之间的裂隙使得双方的实力在全球层面上都大打折扣。
The unilateral overstretching of American power offers a chance for a new beginning in US-European relations. => 美国实力的单边过渡延伸给欧美关系的新起点提供了机会。
America, more than in the past, will depend on strong partners and will seek such partnerships. => 美国比以往更需要强大的伙伴，也会寻求这样的伙伴关系。
So what are the Europeans waiting for? => 既然如此，欧洲人还在等待什么？

Why not start now to overcome the traditional tension between NATO and the EU – especially as French policy toward NATO under President Nicolas Sarkozy has been moving in the right direction? => 为什么不从现在就开始改变北约与欧盟之间传统的紧张局面—特别是在萨科奇总统主持下的法国对北约的政策正向着正确方向发展的情况下？

A regular mutual presence of the Secretary General of NATO and of the head of EU foreign policy in the councils of both organizations doesn’t require much time and effort. => 让北约的秘书长和欧盟外交政策的领导人定期相互出席对方组织相关委员会的会议并不需要花多少时间和精力。
Why not have routine annual meetings between the European Council and the US President? => 为什么不建立欧盟委员会和美国总统之间每年定期会晤的机制呢？
The fate of the Kyoto Protocol should be a lesson to all parties involved. => 《京都议定书》的命运对相关各方都应该是个教训。
No such US-EU consultations would require any new agreements, so they could start without any further preliminaries. => 如此的美国—欧盟协商机制不需要任何新的协议，因此完全可以马上付诸实施。
And that is a good thing. => 这是件好事。
The new transatlantic formula must be greater say in decision-making in exchange for a greater share of responsibility. => 新的跨大西洋关系必须在决策方面拥有更大的发言权以换取更多的责任。
America at Stall Speed? => 失速的美国？
NEWPORT BEACH – Judging from the skittishness of both markets and “consensus expectations,” the United States’ economic prospects are confusing. => 纽波特海滩 — — 从市场和“一致预期”的变幻莫测判断，人们对美国经济前景仍是一片茫然。

In the process, markets take investors on a wild rollercoaster ride, with the European crisis (riddled with even more confusion and volatility) serving to aggravate their queasiness. => 在市场的左右摇摆之间，投资者仿佛坐上了过山车，而欧洲危机（更令人困惑、更大起大落）进一步加剧了乘客的头晕反应。
This situation is both understandable and increasingly unsettling for America’s well-being and that of the global economy. => 这一情形不难理解，却也加剧了美国和全球经济的不安。

It reflects the impact of fundamental (and historic) economic and financial re-alignments, insufficient policy responses, and system-wide rigidities that frustrate structural change. => 这反映了基础性（和历史性）经济和财政再联盟、政策应对不力、以及让结构变革陷入停顿的系统性僵化所产生的后果。

As a result, there are now legitimate questions about the underlying functioning of the US economy and, therefore, its evolution in the months and years ahead. => 结果，人们对美国经济的基础功能及其在未来数月和数年的发展动向提出了合理质疑。

Let us start with some simple aeronautic dynamics, using an analogy that my PIMCO colleague, Bill Gross, came up with to describe the economic risks facing the American economy. => 让我们从一些简单的航空动力学开始，用我的太平洋投资公司（PIMCO）同事格罗斯（Bill Gross）所做的比方来描述美国经济所面临的经济风险。
For the Dreamliner to take off, ascend, and maintain a steady altitude, it must do more than move forward. => 梦幻客机想要起飞、升空然后维持稳定高度，光是向前运动是不够的。

It has to move forward fast enough to exceed critical physical thresholds, which are significantly higher than those for most of Boeing’s other (smaller) planes. => 它必须向前运动得足够快，超过某个物理临界阈值 — — 远高于绝大部分波音其他型号（体型更小）的飞机。
Failure would mean succumbing to a mid-air stall, with tepid forward motion giving way to a sudden loss of altitude. => 失败意味着空中停车、降速因而导致高度突降。
America’s economy today risks stall speed. => 美国经济如今就面临着失速风险。
Stall speed is a terrifying risk for an economy like that of the US, which desperately needs to grow robustly. => 失速对于像美国这样的极度需要稳健增长的经济体来说具有很高风险。
The private sector alone cannot and will not counter the risk of stall speed. => 私人部门无法也不会单独抵挡失速风险。
What is desperately needed is better policymaking. => 当前急需的是更好的决策。

Specifically, policymakers must be open and willing to understand the unusual challenges facing the US economy, react accordingly, and possess sufficiently potent policy instruments. => 具体而言，决策者应该开诚布公，并愿意厘清美国经济所面临的非常规挑战，做出相应的反应，同时掌握充分的有效政策工具。
Unfortunately, this has been far from the case in America (and in Europe, where the situation is worse). => 不幸的是，美国（以及欧洲，那里的情况比美国还遭）的现状离这一步还差得很远。
This is where the insights of Steve Jobs, one of the world’s best innovators and entrepreneurs, come in. => 这正是史蒂夫·乔布斯 — — 全世界最好的创新者和企业家 — — 的洞见的闪光之处。
Jobs did more than navigate paradigm shifts; he essentially created them. => 乔布斯不但引导着范式的变化方向；事实上，他创造着范式。

He was a master at converting the complicated into the simple; and, rather than being paralyzed by complexity, he found new ways to deconstruct and overcome it. => 他是化繁为简的一代宗师；他不但没有陷入复杂性的漩涡中无法走出，反而发现了重建和克服复杂性之路。
Teamwork was an obligation, not a choice. => 团队合作是一种义务，而不是一种选择。
And he eschewed the search for the single “big bang” in favor of aiming for multiple breakthroughs. => 他并没有寻求单一的“大爆炸 ” ， 而是以各个击破为目标。
Underlying it all was a willingness to evolve – a drive for perfection through experimentation. => 归根到底，这来自于渐近 — — 用实验为推动力一步步迈向完美 — — 的意愿。
Moreover, he excelled at selling to audiences worldwide both his vision and his strategy for realizing it. => 此外，他还擅长向全世界信徒兜售自己的新愿景及其实现战略。
So far, America’s economic policymakers have fallen short on all of these fronts. => 到目前为止，美国经济决策者在这方面已经大大落后了。
No surprise that they have yet to find it. => 结果呢？ 当然是一无所获。
Teamwork has repeatedly fallen hostage to turf wars and political bickering. => 团队合作经常会沦为山头林立和政治扯皮。
This is an atmosphere in which unhealthy balance sheets come under even greater pressure, and healthy investors refuse to engage. => 着这样的环境下，不健康的资产负债表将进一步承受更大的压力，而健康的投资者则拒绝赶这趟浑水。

In the process, the risk of recession remains uncomfortably high, the unemployment crisis deepens, and inequities rise as already-stretched social safety nets prove even more porous. => 随之而来的是，衰退风险将继续阴魂不散，失业危机将继续深化，而不平等性将随着已然千疮百孔的社会安全网的进一步损坏而继续提高。
America, China, and the Productivity Paradox => 美国、中国和生产率悖论

That paradox is now back, posing a problem for both the United States and China – one that may well come up in their annual Strategic and Economic Dialogue. => 如今，这一悖论卷土重来，给美国和中国造成了一个问题，一个将在一年一度的中美战略和经济对话中出现的问题。

Back in 1987, Nobel laureate Robert Solow famously quipped, “You can see the computer age everywhere except in the productivity statistics.” => 让我们回到1987年。 这一年，诺贝尔经济学奖获得者罗伯特·索洛（Robert Solow）提出了他的著名讽刺 ： “ 计算机时代随处可见，就是无法在生产率数字中找到踪迹。
The productivity paradox seemed to be resolved in the 1990s, when America experienced a spectacular productivity renaissance. => ”生产率悖论似乎在20世纪90年代得到了解决，当时，美国出现了蔚为壮观的生产率复兴。

Average annual productivity growth in the country’s nonfarm business sector accelerated to 2.5% from 1991 to 2007, from the 1.5% trend in the preceding 15 years. => 1991—2007年美国非农商业部门生产率年增长率为2.5 % ， 而此前15年的趋势值为1.5 % 。
The benefits of the Internet Age had finally materialized. => 互联网时代的好处终于实现了。
Concern about the paradox all but vanished. => 关于生产率悖论的关注也烟消云散。
But the celebration appears to have been premature. => 但人们似乎高兴得太早了。
Despite another technological revolution, productivity growth is slumping again. => 尽管经历了又一次技术革命，但生产率增长再次下降。
And this time the downturn is global in scope, affecting the world’s two largest economies, the US and China, most of all. => 这一回，生产率下降是全球趋势，影响最大的正是世界最大的两个经济体 — — 美国和中国。
Over the past five years, from 2010 to 2014, annual US productivity growth has fallen to an average of 0.9%. => 在过去五年中（2010—2014年 ） ， 美国生产率平均年增长率下降到0.9 % 。
It actually fell at a 2.6% annual rate in the two most recent quarters (in late 2014 and early 2015). => 实际上，在最近两个季度中（2014年底和2015年初 ） ， 生产率以2.6%的年率降低。
Barring a major data revision, America’s productivity renaissance seems to have run into serious trouble. => 除非有重大数据修正，否则美国生产率复兴已经陷入了大麻烦。
China is witnessing a similar pattern. => 中国也经历了类似的过程。
Moreover, hiring seems to be holding at that brisk pace in early 2015. => 而在2015年初，雇用活动似乎继续维持着这一强势。
At the same time, output growth has slowed from the 10% trend of the 33 years ending in 2011 to around 7% today. => 与此同时，产出增长从33年（截至2011年底）来的趋势率10%下降到如今的7 % 。
That downshift, in the face of sustained rapid job creation, implies an unmistakable deceleration of productivity. => 这一降幅是在持续高速就业创造的背景下发生的，表明生产率必定在减速。
Therein lies the latest paradox. => 最新的悖论就在这里。
As a modern-day Solow might say, the ���Internet of Everything” is everywhere except in the productivity statistics. => 当代索洛也许会说 ， “ 万物联网”随处可见，就是无法在生产率数字中找到踪迹。
But is there really a paradox? => 但这真是一个悖论吗？

Indeed, as taken with today’s revolutionary technologies as we are – I say this staring at my sleek new Apple Watch – I am sympathetic to Gordon’s argument. => 事实上，今天的革命性技术令我沉迷 — — 写下这句话的时候，我一边看着我崭新的苹果手表 — — 但我对戈登的观点深有共鸣。

But this overlooks a much more important aspect of the productivity-measurement critique: the undercounting of work time associated with the widespread use of portable information appliances. => 但这忽视了生产率衡量手段批评的另一个重要得多的角度：便携式信息设备的普及所带来的工作时间的低估。

In the US, the Bureau of Labor Statistics estimates that the length of the average workweek has held steady at about 34 hours since the advent of the Internet two decades ago. => 在美国，据劳动统计局（Bureau of Labor Statistics）估算，平均工作周时长自二十年前互联网出现以来一直保持在34小时左右。
Productivity growth is not about working longer; it is about generating more output per unit of labor input. => 生产率并不是工作时间更长；而是关乎单位劳动投入产生更多产出。
Any undercounting of output pales in comparison with the IT-assisted undercounting of working hours. => 产出的低估与信息技术所导致的工作时长低估相比不值一提。
China’s productivity slowdown is probably more benign. => 中国生产率减速的情况也许不如美国严重。
It is an outgrowth of the Chinese economy’s nascent structural transformation from capital-intensive manufacturing to labor-intensive services. => 它是中国经济从资本密集型制造业向劳动密集型服务业的方兴未艾的结构转型的副产品。
Indeed, it was only in 2013 that services supplanted manufacturing and construction as the economy’s largest sector. => 事实上，直到2013年，服务业才超过之熬夜和建筑业，成为中国经济最大的部门。
Now the gap is widening, and that is likely to continue. => 如今，差距正在扩大，并且这一趋势可能会继续下去。
China has time before this becomes a problem. => 在这一转变成为问题之前，中国还有充足的时间。

As Gordon notes, there have been long-lasting productivity dividends associated with urbanization – a trend that could continue for at least another decade in China. => 戈登指出，城市化会带来长期持续的生产率红利 — — 在中国，这一红利至少还可以维持十年。
But there will come a time when this tailwind subsides and China begins to converge on the so-called frontier of the advanced economies. => 但这股顺风终有停止的一天，而中国也将开始想所谓的发达经济前沿靠拢。
At that point, China will face the same productivity challenges that confront America and others. => 到了那一步，中国将面临美国和其他国家所面临的相同的生产率挑战。
Chinese policymakers’ new focus on innovation-led growth seems to recognize this risk. => 中国决策者将创新驱动型增长作为新的重点，这表明他们认识到了这一风险。
Without powerful innovations, sustaining productivity growth will be an uphill battle. => 没有强大的创新，维持生产率增长将十分困难。
China’s recent shift to a slower-productivity trajectory is an early warning of what may well be one of its most daunting economic challenges. => 中国最近的生产率下降趋势是一个早期信号，它将成为中国最艰巨的经济挑战之一。
There is no escaping the key role that productivity growth plays in any country’s economic performance. => 生产率增长是一国经济表现的决定性因素，古今中外概莫能外。
Yet, for advanced economies, periods of sustained rapid productivity growth have been the exception, not the rule. => 但是，对发达经济体而言，持续高速生产率增长已经成为例外而非常规。
Recent signs of slowing productivity growth in both the US and China underscore this reality. => 最近出现的中美两国生产率增长齐降现象凸显出这一现实。
For a world flirting with secular stagnation, that is disturbing news, to say the least. => 对于陷入长期停滞的世界来说，这是个令人心烦的消息。
A New Blueprint for US-China Relations => 美中关系新蓝图

NEW YORK – In the coming decades, nothing will matter more for global peace, prosperity, and governance than how the United States and China handle the ongoing shift in their relative power. => 纽约—在未来几十年中，美国和中国如何应对两国相对实力的不断变化将是影响全球和平、繁荣和治理的最重要的因素。

In the long term, today’s other pressing challenges – including Russia’s relationship with the West and events in the tumultuous Middle East – will amount almost to sideshows by comparison. => 从长期看，目前的其他紧迫挑战 — — 包括俄罗斯与西方的关系以及动荡的中东的各种事件 — — 相比之下只能等而下之。
What makes the Sino-American relationship dangerous is that powerful forces in both countries seem intent on a collision course. => 让中美关系变得危险的是两国的强大力量似乎决定要来一个碰撞。
The prevailing Chinese mindset is that the US is intent on isolating, containing, and undermining it. => 中国人普遍认为，美国想要孤立、遏制和破坏中国。
Unhappily, there is plenty of evidence on the US side to feed that sentiment. => 令人不快的是，美国方面的诸多证据催生了这一情绪。
They say this is not a “containment” strategy, but it amounts to nothing less. => 他们说，这不是“遏制”战略，但其程度绝不下于遏制。
It’s a clunky label, but his analysis and policy prescriptions are compelling. => 这是一个笨重的主题，但他的分析和政策建议极具说服力。
They will defy easy solutions – and thus will require very careful management. => 这意味着不可能有容易的解决方案 — — 因此需要非常谨慎的管理。
Rudd argues that they are wrong, and that Xi will neither overplay his authoritarian hand nor under-deliver on growth. => 陆克文认为这些人是错误的，习近平不会过度使用极权措施，也不会让增长大幅降低。
China’s rise will continue, and the world – including the US – will have to find principled ways of peacefully accommodating it. => 中国将继续崛起，而世界 — — 包括美国 — — 必须找到和平适应这一变化的原则性方法。
Rudd’s recommendations are undoubtedly ambitious. => 陆克文的建议毫无疑问是宏大的。

(Not that this will much help his evident willingness to be drafted as the next UN Secretary-General: in that role the major powers have always preferred bland secretaries to creative generals.) => （这未必大大有助于他显而易见的争取成为下一任联合国秘书长的意愿：对于这个职位，主要大国永远更喜欢平庸温和的秘书，而不是有创造力的统帅。 ）
No American presidential candidate is likely to be comfortable talking about the US as anything other than Number One. => 美国总统候选人绝不可能踌躇满志地大谈美国不再是第一名。
But we must hope that in the years ahead we hear less talk of “primacy” and “dominance” and much more about cooperation and collaboration. => 但是，在未来几年中，但愿我们可以少听到一些“超然 ” 、 “主宰 ” ， 多听到一些合作和协作。

It is only with such US policies toward China that the world can begin to be confident that the twenty-first century will not, like the last, become a vale of tears. => 只有这样的美国对华政策可以让世界有信心二十一世纪不会重蹈二十世纪泪流成河的覆辙。
A Bilateral Foil for America’s Multilateral Dilemma => 美国多边困境的一块双边遮羞布
NEW HAVEN – The good news is that the United States and China appear to have backed away from the precipice of a trade war. => 发自纽黑文 — — 美中两国似乎已经从贸易战的悬崖边上撤了回来，这是个好消息。
While vague in detail, a May 19 agreement defuses tension and commits to further negotiation. => 虽然细节披露不多，但5月19日达成的协议消解了紧张局势并承诺展开进一步谈判。
There is a longstanding disconnect between bilateral and multilateral approaches to international economic problems. => 针对国际经济问题的双边和多边解决方案之间长期存在着脱节。

In May 1930, some 1,028 of America’s leading academic economists wrote a public letter to US President Herbert Hoover urging him to veto the pending Smoot-Hawley tariff bill. => 1930年5月，1028名美国知名学术经济学家向时任总统的赫伯特·胡佛（Herbert Hoover）写了一封公开信，敦促他否决尚未通过的斯穆特-霍利（Smoot-Hawley）关税法案。
Hoover ignored the advice, and the global trade war that followed made a garden-variety depression “great.” => 胡佛忽视了这一建议，结果随之而来的全球贸易战把一场原本小规模的萧条搞“大”了。
President Donald Trump has put a comparable spin on what it takes to “make America great again.” => 而如今特朗普总统对如何实现“让美国再度伟大起来”这句口号的解读方式也与前者异曲同工。
Politicians have long favored the bilateral perspective, because it simplifies blame: you “solve” problems by targeting a specific country. => 政客们一直都偏爱双边的观点，因为这可以将矛盾简单化：你通过针对特定国家来“解决”问题。

By contrast, the multilateral approach appeals to most economists, because it stresses the balance-of-payments distortions that arise from mismatches between saving and investment. => 相比之下多边手段得到了大多数经济学家的赞同，因为它强调了储蓄和投资之间错配所导致的国际收支扭曲。
This contrast between the simple and the complex is an obvious and important reason why economists often lose public debates. => 而这种简单和复杂之间的对比正是经济学家经常在公众辩论中落入下风的明显重要原因。
The dismal science has never been known for clarity. => 须知这门晦涩的学科从来都不是以清晰明了著称的。
Such is the case with the US-China debate. => 美中之辩正是如此。
China is an easy political target. => 中国很容易被锁定为一个政治目标。
After all, it accounted for 46% of America’s colossal $800 billion merchandise trade gap in 2017. => 毕竟它在2017年占据了美国8000亿美元巨额商品贸易逆差的46 ％ 。

A recent article in Foreign Affairs by two senior officials in the Obama administration says it all: “(T)he liberal international order has failed to lure or bind China as powerfully as expected.” => 原奥巴马政府的两位高级官员最近在《外交》杂志上发表的一篇文章一语中的 ： “ 自由的国际秩序没未如预期那样有力地诱惑或约束中国。

As is the case with North Korea, Syria, and Iran, strategic patience has given way to impatience, with the nationalistic Trump administration leading the charge against China. => ”正如与朝鲜，叙利亚和伊朗那样，战略上的隐忍已经被烦躁所取代，而秉承民族主义的特朗普政府领导正是冲在了攻击中国的最前线。
The counter-argument from multilateral-focused economists like me rings hollow in this climate. => 而在这种气氛中，来自像我这类多边主义经济学家的反对论点就显得空洞无聊。

Likewise, it doesn’t help when we emphasize that China is merely a large piece of a much bigger multilateral problem: the US had bilateral merchandise trade deficits with 102 countries in 2017. => 同样，当我们强调中国只是一个更庞大多边问题的其中一个大的板块时也无济于事：美国在2017年可是与102个国家之间存在双边商品贸易逆差。

Flawed as it may be, the bilateral political case resonates in a US where there is enormous pressure to ease the angst of the country’s beleaguered middle class. => 尽管可能存在着谬误，但双边政治话题的争论在美国引起了共鸣，因为该国陷入困境的中产阶级急于为自身的焦虑找到发泄口。
Trade deficits, goes the argument, lead to job losses and wage compression. => 争论中的说法是贸易赤字导致了失业以及工资缩减。
And, with the merchandise trade gap hitting 4.2% of GDP in 2017, these pressures have only intensified in the current economic recovery. => 同时由于2017年的商品贸易缺口已经相当于GDP的4.2 ％ ， 这类压力在当前的经济复苏中只会日益加剧。
As a result, targeting China has enormous political appeal. => 因此针对中国就具有巨大的政治吸引力。
So, what can be made of the May 19 deal? => 那么5月19日的交易又能敲定些什么呢？
Beyond a ceasefire in tit-for-tat tariffs, there are few real benefits. => 这除了叫停针锋相对的关税战之外几乎没有实际好处。
US negotiators are fixated on targeted reductions of around $200 billion in the bilateral trade imbalance over a two-year time frame. => 美国谈判代表的全部注意力都集中于在两年时间框架内将双边贸易不平衡削减约2000亿美元的目标上。
Indeed, with budget deficits likely to widen, America’s saving shortfall will only deepen in the years ahead. => 事实上，由于预算赤字可能继续扩大，美国的储蓄缺口只会在未来几年内进一步加深。

That points to rising balance-of-payments and multilateral trade deficits, which are impossible to resolve through targeted bilateral actions against a single country. => 这意味着国际收支和多边贸易的赤字都会增大，而这些赤字也无法通过面向某一国的针对性双边行动来解决。

Chinese negotiators are more circumspect, resisting numerical deficit targets but committing to the joint objective of “effective measures to substantially reduce” the bilateral imbalance with the US. => 中方则更加谨慎，一方面抵制任何量化的赤字目标，另一方面又承诺实现“通过有效措施大幅减少”对美双边失衡状况的共同目标。

China’s vague promise to purchase more American-made agricultural and energy products borrows a page from the “shopping list” approach of its earlier trade missions to the US. => 中国对于购买更多美国农产品和能源产品的模糊承诺沿袭了其前一段时间赴美贸易代表团的“购物清单”手段。
Unfortunately, the big-wallet mindset of a deal-hungry China reinforces the US narrative that China is guilty as charged. => 不幸的是，中国这种渴望大撒金钱来换取交易达成的思维反而让美方更加坐实了那种中国有罪的说法。

Even if the stars were in perfect alignment and the US was not facing a saving constraint, it stretches credibility to seek a formulaic bilateral solution to America’s multilateral problem. => 就算中方与美方步调一致且美国能摆脱储蓄的掣肘，但美方寻求用一种公式化的双边方案来解决自身多边问题的做法实际上也滥用了其信誉。

Since 2000, the largest annual reduction in the US-China merchandise trade imbalance amounted to $41 billion, and that occurred in 2009, during the depths of the Great Recession. => 自2000年以来美中商品贸易失衡的最大年度缩减量为410亿美元，但这一缩减是发生在2009年大衰退的最严重阶段。
The goal of achieving back-to-back annual reductions totaling more than double that magnitude is sheer fantasy. => 可见想要连续两年实现该缩减量两倍以上的目标纯属痴心妄想。
In the end, any effort to impose a bilateral solution on a multilateral problem will backfire, with ominous consequences for American consumers. => 最后，任何在多边问题上强加双边解决方案的努力都会适得其反，以致为美国消费者造成不利后果。
Without addressing the shortfall in domestic saving, the bilateral fix simply moves the deficit from one economy to others. => 如果不解决国内储蓄不足的问题，双边解决方案只不过是将赤字从一个经济体转移到另一个经济体而已。
Therein lies the cruelest twist of all. => 这是最棘手的问题。
China is America’s low-cost provider of imported consumer goods. => 中国是美国进口消费品的低成本供应商。

The Trump deal would shift the Chinese piece of America’s multilateral imbalance to higher-cost imports from elsewhere – the functional equivalent of a tax hike on American families. => 特朗普的这笔交易将把属于中国的这一部分美国多边失衡问题转移到其他地方的更高成本进口商品上 — — 这形同于给美国家庭的加税。
As Hoover’s ghost might ask, what’s so great about that? => 倘若胡佛泉下有知，也会问这种做法究竟有什么“伟大”可言呢？
America Confronts Old and New Europe => 美国面对的新旧欧洲
US Secretary of Defense Donald Rumsfeld's petulant remark of last year about "old and new Europe" was right for the wrong reasons. => 美国国防部长唐纳德·拉姆斯菲费尔德去年有关"新旧欧洲"的胡言乱语刚好歪打正着。
He meant it to refer to Europe's divisions, but in May, ten additional states joined the European Union. => 他本来是指欧洲的分裂，但今年5月，又有10个国家纳入了欧洲联盟。
The expanded Europe truly forms a new Europe. => 扩张后的欧洲真的成了新欧洲。
Should America be nervous? => 这是否令美国感到不安？
Eight of the new members are former Communist countries that were locked behind the Iron Curtain for nearly half a century. => 其中8个新成员为前共产党国家，近半个世纪来他们被铁幕重重封锁。
Their attraction to the Union is a sign of the appeal - the "soft power" - of the idea of European unification. => 它们加入欧盟表明了欧洲统一理念"软性力量"所具有的强大生命力。
Of course, this new Europe faces many problems. => 勿庸置疑，这个新欧洲面临着巨大的挑战。

The per capita income of the new countries is less than half of that of the fifteen members they are joining. Concerns have been raised about the influx of cheap labor. => 新成员的人均生产总值还不到原有15个国家的一半，廉价劳动力的大量涌入也引起了人们不小的担忧。

But average GDP growth rates in the new members are twice as high as in the original members, and this can provide a welcome stimulus to stagnant labor markets and sluggish economies. => 但新成员的平均国内产值增长率是原有成员国的两倍，这对停滞的劳动力市场和裹足不前的经济将产生良好的促进作用。
Political arrangements are somewhat more problematic. => 政治局势似乎更加问题重重。
Negotiations are underway to revise a draft EU constitution. => 各成员国正在谈判，修改欧盟宪法草案。

Some Europeans worry that the constitution will enable courts to carry the integration process further and faster than public opinion in member states will tolerate. => 欧洲某些人担心宪法将赋予法院权力，以超出成员国公众所能容忍的最快速度推进欧洲的统一进程。

Lack of grassroots support might lead to rejection of the constitution in countries like Britain, where referenda have been promised before the new arrangements come into force. => 缺少来自底层的支持可能导致英国等国否决这一宪法，因为上述当局许诺在新局势成形前举行全民公决。
Across the Atlantic, most Americans (to the extent they pay attention) regard these changes with general approval. => 大西洋的另一端，关注此事的美国人多数持赞成态度。
But some express concern that the new Europe will be defined in opposition to the US. => 但也有人表达了新欧洲也许会与美国作对的担忧。
The recent photographs of detainees being abused and sexually degraded in Baghdad's Abu Ghraib prison added fuel to the fire. => 不久前战俘在巴格达阿布格莱布监狱遭受虐待和性侮辱的照片曝光更为这一事件火上浇油。
Now some American neo-conservatives argue that the US should drop its longstanding support for European integration. => 如今，美国某些新保守主义者甚至主张撤销长久以来对欧洲统一进程的支持。
Such a policy change would be a serious mistake. => 这样的政策变化将犯下严重的错误。

Not only would it add to anti-American attitudes and fail to accomplish its objectives, but it over-estimates the extent to which the new Europe is being formed in opposition to the US. => 它不仅助长反美情绪，达不到既定目标，还过高估计了新欧洲形成给美国带来的威胁。

Whatever the rhetoric in France, for example, the policies and attitudes in countries such as Britain or Poland demonstrate that good trans-Atlantic relations can be maintained. => 无论法国怎样慷慨陈辞，英国或波兰等国的态度依然表明：良好的泛大西洋关系能够维持下去。
If anything, the risks of a US-Europe split will be reduced rather than increased by the EU's recent enlargement. => 如果一定要说影响，那么最近欧洲的东扩将削减而非助长美欧分裂的危险。
Moreover, there are several objective reasons why the current friction between Europe and the US is unlikely to lead to divorce. => 此外，若干客观原因使目前的欧美摩擦不会导致分离。
For one thing, the divisive war in Iraq may turn out to be the last act of the twentieth century rather than a harbinger of the twenty-first. => 首先，伊拉克的分裂战争也许标志着20世纪的终结，但绝非21世纪的起始。

Moreover, while the common security threat from the Soviet Union has disappeared, both the US and Europe face a new common threat from radical jihadist terrorism. => 还有一点。 尽管苏联带来的常规安全威胁已经不复存在，美国和欧洲又面临着激进的吉哈德恐怖运动的共同威胁。
Neither side of the Atlantic is immune to the threat, despite the efforts of Osama bin Laden to drive a wedge between Europe and America. => 这种威胁在大西洋两岸同样存在，尽管奥萨马·本·拉登试图在欧美之间挑起矛盾。
Europe and America also share a common structure of economic interests and values. => 欧洲和美国还拥有共同的经济利益和价值观结构。
While trade produces frictions in democracies, it also enhances wealth. => 尽管贸易造成民主国家间的摩擦，但同时也带来巨大的财富。
If one looks at foreign direct investment, it is clear that the two sides of the Atlantic are closely integrated. => 看看国外直接投资就知道，大西洋两岸是紧密联系在一起的。

In terms of values, while some differences exist between Europe and America, at the fundamental level of democracy and human rights, no other two parts of the globe share more. => 价值观方面，尽管欧洲和美国间存在分歧，但在民主和人权的根本问题上，没有哪两个地区观点如此一致。
In short, it is good for Americans - and for the world - that old and new Europe are becoming one. => 简而言之，新旧欧洲合而为一对美国和世界都是喜讯。
We can all benefit from the soft power of an enlarged Europe. => 我们都将受益于经过扩张的欧洲所拥有的软性力量。
America’s Baby Bust => 美国的生育低谷
LONDON – News that the United States’ fertility rate fell in 2017 to 1.75 has provoked surprise and concern. => 伦敦—2017 年美国生育率下降到1.75，这则新闻令人惊讶又担心。

A buoyant US economy in the 1990s and early 2000s was accompanied by fertility rates of 2.00-2.05 children per woman, up from 1.8-1.9 in the 1980s. => 1990年代末至21世纪初，美国经济繁荣，生育率为每个妇女生2.00—2.05个孩子，而1980年代为1.8—1.9。
But the increasingly strong economic recovery of the last five years has been accompanied by a declining birth rate. => 但在过去五年，经济复苏越来越强劲，生育率反而下降。
That seems to presage a long-term shortage of workers relative to retirees, and severe financial pressures on pension funds and health-care provision. => 这也许预示着工人将相对退休者出现长期短缺，退休基金和医疗供给将面临沉重财务压力。

But the assumption that stronger growth and economic confidence must generate higher fertility – with low birth rates reflecting pessimism about the future – is not justified by the evidence. => 但认为较强劲的增长和经济信息必然产生更高的生育率 — — 而出生率下降反映人们对未来感到悲观 — — 并无证据支持。
Moreover, fertility rates at around the current US level do not pose severe problems – and bring some benefits. => 此外，美国当前水平的生育率也不会造成严重问题 — — 还会带来一些好处。

In all major developed economies, fertility rates fell during the 1960s and 70s, reaching levels below the replacement rate of around 2.05 children per woman. => 在所有主要发达经济体中，1960和70年代都出现了生育率下降，下降到每位妇女声誉2.05个孩子的替代率以下。
The US rate reached 1.77 in the late 1970s, compared to 1.8 in Northern Europe and 1.65 in Western Europe. => 美国在1970年代末的生育率达到过1.77，而北欧为1.8，西欧为1.65。

Some viewed the US return to somewhat higher fertility rates in the 1990s as the consequence of greater economic dynamism and confidence, in contrast to “old Europe.” => 一些人认为，美国在1990年代恢复了较高的生育率是因为经济活力和信心提高，这与“老欧洲”形成了鲜明对比。

The same effect explains why Canada – with immigration skewed toward low-fertility Asian countries of origin – has had a significantly lower fertility rate of around 1.6. => 同样的效应解释了为何加拿大 — — 移民大多来自低生育率的亚洲国家 — — 生育率一直保持在1.6左右的显著更低的水平。

Absent temporary migration-induced effects, all major developed economies have shifted to fertility rates of 1.2-2.0, with most falling between 1.3 and 1.9. => 剔除暂时性移民导致的效应，所有主要发达经济体的生育率到演变为1.2—2.0，其中大部分下降到了1.3到1.9之间。
Canada, with its lower fertility rate, is quite as successful and confident as the US. => 加拿大生育率较低，但其经济与美国一样成功和自信。
Strong German growth over the last 20 years has been combined with a fertility rate of 1.4-1.5, well below the 1.98 rate in less successful France. => 过去20年来强劲的德国增长率带来了1.4—1.5的生育率，远低于不太成功的法国。
South Korea has maintained economic expansion with a fertility rate of just 1.2-1.3. => 韩国以仅有1.2—1.3的生育率保持了经济扩张。
Latin America’s most prosperous economy, Chile, has a fertility rate of 1.76, well below less successful Argentina’s rate of 2.27. => 拉丁美洲最繁荣的经济体智利的生育率也只有1.76，远低于不太成功的阿根廷的生育率2.27。
The recent decline in US fertility is therefore unsurprising; and, provided it does not fall to much lower levels, there is no cause for concern. => 因此，最近美国生育率的下降不足为奇；只要它不跌到显著更低的程度，就没有必要担心。

Of course, in the long run, a lower fertility rate, combined with rising life expectancy, will produce a higher ratio of those over 65 years old to those conventionally labeled as “working age.” => 当然，在长期，较低的生育率加上预期寿命的延长，将导致65岁以上人口与传统上的“工作年龄”人口的比率。
But as people live longer and healthier lives, retirement ages can and should be increased. => 但由于人们能够活得更长、更健康，退休年龄也能够并且应该提高。
Notably, fears that robots will take jobs are much less prevalent in Japan and China than in higher-fertility Western countries. => 引人注目的是，对机器人将抢走饭碗的担心在日本和中国远不及生育率更高的西方国家的普遍。

In rich developed societies with modern attitudes to the role of women, fertility rates somewhat below replacement levels may thus be both inevitable and broadly welcome. => 因此，在对妇女的作用持现代看法的富裕发达社会中，生育率总是会低于替代率也是是不可避免的，总体而言也是值得欢迎的。
But degree matters, and extremely low fertility, such as Japan’s rate of 1.4, will create major problems if permanently maintained. => 但程度很重要，极低的生育率，比如日本只有1.4，如果长久保持的话，会造成重大问题。
By contrast, Japan’s population is projected to fall from 125 million today to around 80 million. => 相反，日本人口预计会从今天的1.25亿下降到8,000万左右。
Demographic contraction on that scale will severely stress Japan’s ability to support an aging population. => 人口规模收缩将严重制约日本支持老龄化人口的能力。

The Scandinavian countries are exemplary in this respect, though fertility rates there have not returned to replacement levels, but only to about 1.75-1.9. => 斯堪的纳维亚国家是这方面的典范，尽管它们的生育率并没有恢复到替代率，而是只有1.75—1.9。
Similar policies in the US might marginally increase the fertility rate from today’s 1.75, with a mildly beneficial net effect. => 美国采取类似政策的话，也许可以将生育率在目前1.75的水平的基础上略微提高，形成比较有利的净结果。
But the predominant response to America’s recent fertility decline should be to accept it as inevitable and to stop worrying about it. => 但对于美国近期的生育率下降局面，最主要的应对应该是接受它的不可避免性，停止为它担忧。
The US Is Exporting Obesity => 输出肥胖的美国

Left unchecked, rapidly rising obesity rates could slow or even reverse the dramatic gains in health and life expectancy that much of the world has enjoyed over the past few decades. => 如果不加控制，肥胖率的迅速上升可能会减缓甚至扭转过去几十年来世界大部分地区医疗卫生水平以及预期寿命的巨大进步。
And by forcing its food culture on countries like Mexico and Canada, the United States is making the problem worse. => 而通过将其饮食文化强加给墨西哥和加拿大等国，美国正在令问题变得更加严重。

Of course, the two are not necessarily directly related. A considerable proportion of world hunger occurs in countries suffering from domestic strife or severe government dysfunction. => 当然这两者不一定直接相关，因为世界上有相当比例的饥饿发生在遭受内乱或政府严重失能的国家。
The obesity epidemic, however, has a much broader footprint, affecting advanced economies and most emerging markets. => 与此同时肥胖症的流行范围则更广，遍及发达经济体和大多数新兴市场。

According to the CDC, the average weight of an American woman today is greater than the average weight of an American man in 1960 (166 pounds, or 75 kilos). => 而据美国疾病控制与预防中心称，当今美国女性的平均体重大于1960年美国男性的平均体重（166磅/75公斤 ） 。
This same dynamic is playing out worldwide, with obesity rates soaring in Europe, Latin America, and even in China. => 同样的动态也存在于世界范围内，欧洲，拉丁美洲乃至中国的肥胖率都在上升。
The health costs are staggering, estimated to be close to $200 billion per year in the US alone. => 因此产生的医疗费用也极为惊人，估计每年接近2000亿美元。

And with rising childhood obesity rates worldwide portending significantly greater health problems in the future adult population, the costs are likely to rise considerably. => 随着儿童肥胖率在世界范围内不断上升，从而预示着未来成年人群的健康问题显着增加，医疗成本还有机会大幅走高。
The causes of obesity are manifold and complex. => 肥胖的成因是多方面且和复杂的。

Nevertheless, a growing body of evidence suggests that a culture emphasizing processed food and a generally sedentary lifestyle lies at the center of the problem. => 然而越来越多的证据表明，注重加工食品和普遍久坐生活方式的文化是问题的核心。
In emerging markets, rapid urbanization is another important factor, as well as a desire to emulate Western lifestyles. => 而在新兴市场国家快速城市化则是另一个重要因素，此外还有模仿西方生活方式的意愿。
Many governments have launched initiatives to improve nutrition education. => 许多政府已经启动了一些改善营养膳食教育的措施。

Unfortunately, industry advertising typically dwarfs these efforts, as do US trade lobbyists’ own efforts to push processed and fast food on the rest of the world. => 但不幸的是，与美国贸易游说者向世界其他地区推广加工和快餐食品的努力一样，行业广告通常也会让这些努力大打折扣。
It is hard to ignore the fact that Mexico’s adult obesity rate has soared since the adoption in 1993 of the North American Free Trade Agreement. => 自从1993年签署《北美自由贸易协定》以来墨西哥的成人肥胖率飙升，这是个难以忽略的事实。
While there are many causes, post-NAFTA direct foreign investment in the processed food industry and a surge in advertising are important contributors. => 而协定生效后该国加工食品行业引入的直接国外投资以及广告的激增是造成这种情况的重要因素。

Mexican consumption of sugary beverages nearly tripled between 1993 and 2014, and a new tax on sugary drinks has muted demand only slightly since then. => 墨西哥在含糖饮料方面的消费量在1993~2014年间几乎增长了两倍，而自那以后的一项针对含糖饮料的新税收仅仅令需求量略有下降。

The other NAFTA partner, Canada, has similarly experienced a rise in obesity, partly because US imports have led to a sharp decline in the price of fructose. => 另一个《北美自由贸易协定》合作伙伴 — — 加拿大 — — 同样也经历了肥胖率上升的状况，部分原因是来自美国的出口导致果糖价格急剧下跌。

It is unfortunate that government regulators have been so slow to try to reverse these trends by, for example, helping to educate the public on the science of nutrition. => 不幸的是，政府监管机构试图扭转这些趋势（例如向公众传播营养科学）的步伐太过缓慢。

Skeptics may point out that nutrition guidelines always seem to be morphing, with last year’s sin food becoming this year’s superfood, and vice versa. => 怀疑论者可能会指出，营养指南似乎总是在变化，去年的罪恶食品经常摇身一变成了今年的超级食品，反之亦然。
Though there is some truth to this, the fact is that nutrition research has made significant progress in recent decades. => 这有点道理，但事实是近几十年来营养学研究已经取得了重大进展。
The government has other tools at its disposal, besides education, for affecting people’s eating habits. => 除教育之外，政府还可以动用其他工具来影响人们的饮食习惯。

They can and should place greater restrictions on advertising to children, as the UK, France, and several other countries have done; obesity in early years can lead to lifelong problems. => 它们可以且应该像英国，法国和其他几个国家一样对儿童广告加大限制；因为早年的肥胖会引发终生的问题。

Beyond that, Ludwig, Tufts University’s Dariush Mozaffarian, and I have proposed instituting a tax on processed food, much the same way that tobacco is taxed. => 除此之外，大卫·路德维格，塔夫茨大学的达瑞许·莫扎法里安（Dariush Mozaffarian）和笔者也提议对加工食品征税，就跟烟草税一样。
Proceeds from the tax could be used to subsidize healthier alternatives. => 而收上来的钱可用于补贴更健康的替代食品。

It is perhaps fantasy to expect the current US administration to consider any kind of anti-obesity strategy while it is still busy dismantling Obama-era policies. => 期待正忙于废止奥巴马时代政策的现任政府考虑采取任何形式的反肥胖战略或许只是幻想。
“America First” Financial Regulation? => “美国第一”金融改革？

For the financial world, one of the most significant departures was that of Daniel Tarullo, the Federal Reserve governor who has led its work on financial regulation for the last seven years. => 对金融界来说，意义最重大的离职是在过去七年领导金融监管工作的美联储理事丹尼尔·塔鲁洛（Daniel Tarullo ） 。
It would be a stretch to say that Tarullo has been universally popular in the banking community. => 很难说塔鲁洛受到了银行界的一致欢迎。
He led the charge in arguing for much higher capital ratios, in the United States and elsewhere. => 他领衔要求大幅提高美国和其他国家的资本率。
He was a tough negotiator, with a well-tuned instinct for spotting special pleading by financial firms. => 他是个难产的谈判对手，拥有很强的识破金融企业诡辩术的本能。
But crocodile tears will be shed in Europe to mark his resignation. => 但随着他的离职，欧洲将流下鳄鱼的眼泪。
In his absence, these proposals’ fate is uncertain. => 他的去职让这一方案的前景蒙上了不确定性。
But Tarullo has also been an enthusiastic promoter of international regulatory cooperation, with the frequent flyer miles to prove it. => 但塔鲁洛也热衷于推动国际监管合作，频繁出访推销监管合作。

For some years, he has chaired the Financial Stability Board’s little-known but important Standing Committee on Supervisory and Regulatory Cooperation. => 多年来，他一直担任金融稳定委员会（FSB）中鲜为人知但十分重要的监督和监管合作常务委员会主席。
Already, some of those who criticized him most vocally in the past are anxious about his departure. => 目前，一些过去批评他最卖力的人对他的去职十分焦虑。
Who will succeed him? => 谁会接替他？

The 2010 Dodd-Frank Act created a vice-chair position on the Federal Reserve Board – which has never been filled – to lead the Fed’s work on regulation. => 2010年多德-弗兰克（Dodd-Frank）法案规定美联储需要设立一个副主席职位 — — 从未有人担任过此职 — — 来领导美联储的监管工作。
Will that appointee, whom Trump now needs to select, be as committed as Tarullo to an international approach? => 这一任命 — — 特朗普目前正在选人 — — 能像塔鲁洛那样致力于国际路线吗？
Or will his principal task be to build a regulatory wall, protecting US banks from global rules? => 或者，他的主要任务将是构建监管墙，让美国银行不受全球规则管辖？
This is unacceptable.” => 这是不可接受的。 ”
In her reply of February10, Yellen firmly rebutted McHenry’s arguments. => 在2月10日的复信中，耶伦坚决反驳了麦克亨利的指责。
But that will not be the end of the story. => 但这绝不是故事的结局。
The battle lines are now drawn, and McHenry’s letter shows the arguments that will be deployed in Congress by some Republicans close to the president. => 如今吗，战线已经划定，麦克亨利的信表明了一些接近总统个共和党将会在国会亮出怎样的观点。
There has always been a strand of thinking in Washington that dislikes foreign entanglements, in this and other areas. => 华盛顿总是存在一些在这个或那个领域不喜欢与国外串联的声音。

While Yellen’s arguments are correct, the Fed’s entitlement to participate in international negotiations does not oblige it to do so, and a new appointee might argue that it should not. => 尽管特伦的观点是正确的，但美联储参与国际谈判的权限并不意味着它必须这样做，而新的任命人选可能会认为美联储不应该这么做。
Such a reversal would generate tensions within the Fed, and where it would leave the FSB, or indeed the Basel Committee, is unclear. => 如此反覆将在美联储内部制造对立，而FSB，或者事实上还有巴塞尔委员会，将因此采取什么立场仍不得而知。
It is a little hard to see that arrangement working well today. => 时至今日，显然这一安排运转得十分出色。
These questions are of more than passing interest in Europe. => 这些问题对欧洲来说绝非稍纵即逝的利益。
European capital adequacy directives typically transpose Basel Accords into EU law. => 欧洲资本充足度指引通常将巴塞尔协议转化为欧盟法律。
If the Basel process stalls, transatlantic deals, which are the crucial underpinning of Western capital markets, will be far harder to reach. => 如果巴塞尔进程陷入停顿，作为西方资本市场基础的跨大西洋协议将极其难以达成。
There is a further complication arising from Brexit. => 英国退欧进一步增加了复杂性。

Absent any special deal between the EU27 and the United Kingdom, British and EU regulators will come together in Basel, not in the European Banking Authority. => 在欧盟27国与英国没有达成任何特殊协议的情况下，英国和欧盟监管者将在巴塞尔协议中进行合作，而不是在欧洲银行监管局（European Banking Authority）进行合作。

As central bankers bid farewell to the devil they know, financial regulation has entered a period of high uncertainty – and high anxiety for policymakers as they await an announcement from Mar-a-Lago. => 当央行行长们与他们所熟知的恶魔挥手道别时，金融监管却进入了一个高度不确定的时期 — — 而决策者们则将如坐针毡地在等待马拉拉歌庄园（Mar-a- Lago）的指示。
No likely Federal Reserve Board candidates have been spotted at poolside, or being interviewed on the golf course, but a decision cannot be far off. => 美联储理事不可能在游泳池边得到任命，或一边打高尔夫球一边面试，但决定已经不远了。
Nothing can be taken for granted. => 没有什么是理所当然的。
The financial world is holding its collective breath. => 金融界集体屏息以待。
Navigating America’s Economic-Policy Shocks => 应对美国经济政策冲击
