NEW YORK – With a series of tax and trade moves being considered in the United States this year, emerging-market economies are likely to face devaluation pressure and volatility. => 纽约—今年美国将考虑一系列税收和贸易动作，新兴市场经济体可能会面临贬值压力和波动。
Three sources of US-fueled economic uncertainty, in particular, will rattle emerging markets in 2017. => 特别是，三个美国引发的经济不确定性将在2017年影响到新兴市场。

The first is a border adjustment tax that would give tax breaks to US exporters, but impose a levy – or, equivalently, disallow deductions – on imports to the US. => 一是边境调节税。 边境调节税将让美国出口商获得税收优惠，但对美国进口商品征税 — — 或取消抵扣，效果相同。
Both President Donald Trump and the Republican-controlled US Congress have said they favor the scheme, which has a fair chance of being enacted. => 总统特朗普和共和党控制的国会都表示支持这一方案，它很有可能成为现实。
The second source of uncertainty is the possibility of more aggressive action on Chinese exports to the US. => 第二个不确定性是美国可能对中国对美出口采取更加激进的措施。
The Trump administration has said many times that it will confront China over what it considers unfair trade practices. => 特朗普政府已经多次表示，将在其所认定的不公平贸易行为上与中国针锋相对。
Trump has openly mused about imposing a 45% tariff on Chinese imports. => 特朗普公开呛声要对中国进口品征收45%的关税。
The introduction of anything close to that would generate downward pressure on the renminbi, given the resulting reduction in demand for Chinese exports. => 实施任何类似的措施都将导致中国出口需求下降，从而给人民币造成贬值压力。
But such a move would serve to weaken many other currencies as well. => 但这一动作也将导致其他许多货币贬值。

This slippage would likely offset any direct increase in these countries’ exports to the US, at least in the short and medium term, because re-organizing production chains is not a trivial matter. => 这一传导机制很可能抵消这些经济提对美出口的直接增量，至少在短期和中期是如此，因为重新组织生产链绝非易事。
A third US move that could unsettle emerging markets is faster-than-expected monetary tightening by the Federal Reserve. => 美国可能动摇新兴市场的第三个动作是美联储比预期更快地收紧货币政策。
A large interest-rate hike would translate into US dollar appreciation, and depreciation of developing-economy currencies. => 大幅升息将转化为美元升值和发展中经济体货币贬值。
One exception may be the currencies of commodity exporters. => 大宗商品出口国货币也许是例外。

Higher commodity prices, triggered in part by anticipation of increased demand as a result of a boost in US infrastructure spending, could cause these countries’ currencies to strengthen. => 美国提高基础设施支出可能引起大宗商品需求增加的预期，从而触发价格上涨，进而导致这些国家货币升值。

Even on that front, though, some commodity exporters – such as Brazil and Russia – may not see much improvement in their exchange rates, given the drag of other forces on their weak economies. => 但是，即使在这些国家中，某些大宗商品出口国 — — 比如巴西和俄罗斯 — — 也未必能够看到汇率改善，因为它们疲软的经济中还有其他力量在起拖累作用。
The challenges that US policy changes pose for emerging-market currencies include not only downward pressure, but also greater volatility. => 美国政策变化给新兴市场货币造成的挑战不仅包括贬值压力，还包括波动加剧。
What, then, should emerging-market countries do to enhance their resilience in anticipation of the shockwaves? => 那么，新兴市场国家应该如何加强对预期中的震波的抵抗力？
One option is to optimize the structure of capital inflows. => 一个选择是优化资本流入结构。
A second is to boost the flexibility of exchange rates. => 其次是提高汇率弹性。
As for the second option, allowing nominal exchange-rate flexibility would enable currency values to align with underlying economic fundamentals more quickly. => 对于后者，允许名义汇率弹性可以让货币价值更快地与经济基本面看齐。
Such adjustment is especially important for countries with rigid labor markets. => 这一调整对于劳动力市场僵化的国家尤其重要。
One danger of fixed exchange rates is the risk of an overvalued or undervalued currency, neither of which is good for economic stability. => 固定汇率的一大风险是货币出现高估或低估，两者都不利于经济稳定。
The chance of either scenario is elevated when the forces influencing the equilibrium exchange rate become more volatile. => 当影响均衡汇率的力量波动加剧时，发生高估或低估的可能性也会大大增加。

While the shape and timing of future US policies are uncertain, it seems clear that capital-flow management and nominal exchange-rate flexibility amount to good preparation. => 美国未来政策的面貌和时机仍不确定，但显然，资本流管理和名义汇率弹性都是非常好的准备工作。
To paraphrase Benjamin Franklin, if developing countries fail to prepare, they will have to prepare to fail. => 用本杰明·富兰克林的话说，如果发展中国家没有做好准备，它们就必须做准备失败。
Why Millennials Will Reject Trump => 为什么千禧一代会拒绝特朗普
NEW YORK – The key political divide in the United States is not between parties or states; it is between generations. => 纽约—美国的关键政治分歧不在于党派之间或州之间，而在于代际之间。
The millennial generation (those aged 18-35) voted heavily against Donald Trump and will form the backbone of resistance to his policies. => 千禧一代（18—35岁）大多反对特朗普，并将成为反对特朗普政策的骨干力量。
Older Americans are divided, but Trump’s base lies among those above the age of 45. => 年长美国人比较分裂，但特朗普的基本盘是45岁以上群体。
On issue after issue, younger voters will reject Trump, viewing him as a politician of the past, not the future. => 在问题不断曝出后，年轻选民将拒绝特朗普，将他视为过去而不是未来的政客。
Of course, these are averages, not absolutes. => 当然，这是平均而言，不是绝对的。
Yet the numbers confirm the generational divide. => 但数字确证了代际分歧。
According to exit polls, Trump received 53% of the votes of those 45 and older, 42% of those 30-44, and just 37% of voters 18-29. => 据出口民调，特朗普赢得53%的45岁及以上选民，42%的30—44岁选民，而18—29岁选民他只赢得了37 % 。

In a 2014 survey, 31% of millennials identified as liberals, compared with 21% of baby boomers (aged 50-68 in the survey) and only 18% of the silent generation (69 and above). => 在一份2014年的调查中，31%的千禧一代被认为是自由派，而婴儿潮一代（调查中的50—68岁群体）只有21 % ， 静默一代（69岁及以上）只有18 % 。
The point is not that today’s young liberals will become tomorrow’s older conservatives. => 个中含义不是今天的年轻自由派会变成明天的年长保守派。
The millennial generation is far more liberal than the baby boomers and silent generation were in their younger years. => 千禧一代远比婴儿潮一代和静默一代年轻时更加偏向自由派。
They are also decidedly less partisan, and will support politicians who address their values and needs, including third-party aspirants. => 他们的党派色彩也要少得多，他们将支持解决他们的价值观和需要的政客，包括来自第三党的有志者。
There are at least three big differences in the politics of the young and old. => 年轻人和年长者的政治学至少有三大不同。
First, the young are more socially liberal than the older generations. => 首先，年轻人比年长者更加偏向社会自由。
For them, America’s growing racial, religious, and sexual plurality is no big deal. => 对他们来说，美国日益严重的种族、宗教和性多样化不是大问题。

A diverse society of whites, African-Americans, Hispanics, and Asians, and of the native-born and immigrants, is the country they’ve always known, not some dramatic change from the past. => 由白人、非洲裔美国人、西班牙裔美国人、亚洲人组成的多元化社会，由土生土长的美国人和移民组成的多元化社会才是他们一直熟知的美国，而不是什么与过去的戏剧性变化。

They accept sexual and gender categories – lesbian, gay, trans, bi, inter, pan, and others – that were essentially taboo for – or unknown to – their grandparents’ (Trump’s) generation. => 他们接受性和性别分类 — — 女同性恋、男同性恋、变性人、双性人、异装癖、双性恋 — — 这些群体对他们的祖父辈（即特朗普这一代）来说本质上是一种禁忌（或一种未知 ） 。
Second, the young are facing the unprecedented economic challenges of the information revolution. => 其次，年轻人正面临前所未有的信息革命经济挑战。

They are entering the labor market at a time when market returns are rapidly shifting toward capital (robots, artificial intelligence, and smart machines generally) and away from labor. => 他们进入劳动力市场正逢市场回报迅速流向资本（普遍化的机器人、人工智能和智慧机器 ） ， 流出劳动力。
The elderly rich, by contrast, are enjoying a stock market boom caused by the same technological revolution. => 相反，年长的富人享受着由同一场技术革命带来的股市繁荣。
Third, compared to their parents and grandparents, the young are much more aware of climate change and its threats. => 第三，与父辈和祖父辈相比，年轻人更加清楚气候变化及其威胁。
While Trump is enticing the older generation with one last fling with fossil fuels, the young will have none of it. => 特朗普用化石燃料最后的狂欢麻痹年长一代，而年轻人只能获得一地鸡毛。
They want clean energy and will fight against the destruction of the Earth that they and their own children will inherit. => 他们想要清洁能源，也将为他们和他们的孩子们将要继承的被毁坏的地球战斗。

Part of the generational divide over global warming is due to the sheer ignorance of many older Americans, including Trump, about climate change and its causes. => 在全球变暖问题上的代际分裂在部分程度上要归因于许多年长美国人，包括特朗普在内，赤裸裸地忽视气候变化及其原因。
Older Americans didn’t learn about climate change in school. => 年长美国人在学校里没有学过气候变化。
They were never introduced to the basic science of greenhouse gases. => 他们从未获得过关于温室气体的基本科学知识。
That is why they are ready to put their own short-term financial interests ahead of the dire threats to their grandchildren’s generation. => 因此，他们欲把自己的短期财务利益置于孙辈致命威胁之上。

In a June 2015 survey, 60% of 18-29 year-olds said that human activity was causing global warming, compared with just 31% of those 65 and older. => 在一份2015年6月的调查中，60%的18—29岁群体说人类活动正在导致全球变暖，而65岁及以上群体只有31 % 。

A survey released in January found that 38% of American survey respondents 65 and older favored fossil-fuel expansion over renewable energy, compared with only 19% of those 18-29. => 一份1月份公布的调查发现，38%的65岁及以上美国调查受访者支持化石燃料而非可再生能源扩张，18—29岁群体只有19 % 。
Trump’s economic policies are geared to this older, whiter, native-born America. => 特朗普的经济政策偏向这一年龄更大、肤色更白、本土出生的美国人群体。
He favors tax cuts for the older rich, which would burden the young with higher debt. => 他支持为年长富人减税，而这将给年轻人带来更多的债务负担。
He is indifferent to the $1 trillion overhang of student debt. => 他对1万亿美元的累计学生债务漠然无视。

He is reprising the 1990s NAFTA debate over free trade, rather than facing the far more important twenty-first-century jobs challenge posed by robotics and artificial intelligence. => 他在三十年后重新翻出20世纪90年代北美自由贸易协定（NAFTA）争论的旧账，而不去面对机器人和人工智能所带来的更加重要的二十一世纪就业挑战。
And he is obsessed with squeezing a few more years of profit out of America’s coal, oil, and gas reserves at the cost of a future environmental catastrophe. => 他沉迷于让美国煤炭、石油和天然气储备多贡献几年利润，不惜让未来爆发环境灾难。
One might attribute Trump’s backward-looking mindset to his age. => 你也许会将特朗普的退步思维归因于他的年龄。
At 70, Trump is the oldest person ever to become president (Ronald Reagan was slightly younger when he took office in 1981). => 70岁的特朗普是美国历史上年纪最大的新总统（罗纳德·里根上台是比特朗普稍微年轻一些 ） 。
Yet age is hardly the sole or even the main factor here. => 但年龄绝不是唯一的原因，甚至不是主要原因。
Bernie Sanders, certainly the freshest mind of all the 2016 presidential candidates and the hero of millennial voters, is 75. => 伯尼·桑德斯（Bernie Sanders）毫无疑问是2016年总统候选人当中思想最为新潮的，也是千禧一代选民心中的英雄，他已经75岁了。
The main issue here is mindset and political orientation, not chronological age. => 这里的关键问题是思维和政治导向，而不是年龄。
Trump has the shortest time horizon (and attention span) of any president in historical memory. => 特朗普是历史上所有总统中目光最短浅的（也是注意力范围最狭隘的 ） 。

And he is utterly out of touch with the real challenges facing the young generation as they grapple with new technologies, shifting labor markets, and crushing student debt. => 他根本不清楚年轻一代在面临新技术、劳动力市场变迁和泰山压顶般的学生债务时所遇到的真正挑战。
A trade war with Mexico and China, or a tragically misconceived ban on Muslim migrants, will hardly meet their real needs. => 与墨西哥和中国的贸易战，以及计划不周的悲哀的“禁穆令”根本无法解决他们的真正需要。
Trump’s political success is a blip, not a turning point. => 特朗普在政治上的成功只是昙花一现，而不是转折点。
Today’s millennials, with their future-oriented perspective, will soon dominate American politics. => 今天的千禧一代，带着他们未来导向的视角，将很快主宰美国政坛。
America will be multiethnic, socially liberal, climate conscious, and much fairer in sharing the economic benefits of new technology. => 美国将是多种族的、社会自由的、充分认识气候变化的国家，其新技术的经济收益也将获得更加公平的分享。

Too many observers remain fixated on the traditional party divides in the US Congress, not on the deeper demographic changes that will soon be decisive. => 太多观察家仍沉迷于美国国会中的传统党派分歧，而没有关注更深层次的人口变化，而这一变化很快就将成为决定性因素。

Sanders nearly captured the Democratic nomination (and would likely have triumphed in the general election) with a platform appealing powerfully to the millennials. => 桑德斯几乎赢得民主党提名（如果赢得提名，他很有可能赢得大选 ） ， 他凭借的是充分吸引千禧一代的平台。
Their time is coming, most likely with a president they support in 2020. => 千禧一代的时代正在到来，并极有可能推动他们所支持的总统在2020年上台。
What Makes America Great => 是什么让美国伟大
CAMBRIDGE – Presidential inaugurations and commencement ceremonies are usually very emotional events. => 坎布里奇—总统就职典礼和毕业典礼通常都是非常情绪性的事件。
They are rites of passage that mark both an end and a new beginning in the life of a country or an individual. => 这类仪式既标志着一个国家或一个个体的一个段落的结束，也标志着新的开始。
As a professor at Harvard’s Kennedy School of Government, I attend our commencement ceremony every year. => 作为哈佛肯尼迪政府学院教授，我每年都要参加毕业典礼。
Despite this regularity, I still become emotional as I see my students complete a phase of their lives and contemplate their future. => 尽管毕业典礼对我来说如此平常，但当我看到学生完成了生命中的一个阶段、开始考虑他们的我来时，我都会感到十分激动。

One of the highlights of our ceremony is a video in which several professors and public personalities read, line by line, John F. Kennedy’s inaugural address. => 在我们的典礼上，一个高光时刻是多名教授和公共人物逐字逐句朗读约翰·肯尼迪的就职演说。

And yet, running at under 14 minutes, it never fails to move and inspire everyone in the audience, including that half of the graduates and their families who hail from other countries, near and far. => 但是，在不到14分钟的时间里，这份就职演说每一次都能打动和鼓励观众席上的每一个人，包括来自世界各地的那一半毕业生和他们的家庭。
To understand why, it is useful to recall a few of the most famous passages. => 要想知道为什么会这样，不妨回忆一下这篇名著。
If a free society cannot help the many who are poor, it cannot save the few who are rich.” => 如果自由社会不能帮助众多处于贫困的人，它也无法拯救那极少数富裕的人。 ”

Finally, there was Kennedy’s ethic of service on behalf of the commonwealth: “And so, my fellow Americans: ask not what your country can do for you – ask what you can do for your country. => 最后，公益服务伦理观 ： “ 还有，我的美国同胞：不要问国家能为你做些什么 — — 问问你能为你的国家做些什么。
My fellow citizens of the world: ask not what America will do for you, but what together we can do for the freedom of man.” => 我的世界公民同胞：不要问美国会为你做什么，问问我们携起手来能为人的自由做些什么。 ”

These words’ enduring emotional appeal is rooted in their embrace of a potentially difficult course of action, motivated by a pledge to uphold values shared by citizens of America and the world alike. => 这些话之所以能够造成经久不衰的情绪号召力，是因为它们提到了也许很困难的行动方针，其背后的推动力是誓死捍卫美国和世界公民的共同价值观。
Fast forward to today. => 快进到现在。
President-elect Donald Trump’s campaign narrative was based on the assumption that the US has fallen from its former greatness. => 当选总统唐纳德·特朗普的竞选纲领基于这样的认识：美国已经从昔日的伟大中衰落。
Jobs have moved to Mexico and China because weak leaders negotiated bad deals. => 就业流向了墨西哥和中国，因为软弱的领导人谈判了糟糕的协议。
Immigrants, mostly illegal, have taken the few jobs that remain, killing and raping in their free time. => 移民，主要是非法移民，则拿走了剩下的少数岗位，而在空余时间尽干些杀人强奸的勾当。

It follows that the US needs a president who will put America first and knows how to extract the best deals for it at every opportunity, using the country’s full might to advance its interests. => 因此，美国需要一位把美国放在第一位、知道如何在每一次机会中如何获得最佳协议、用美国的全部力量推进它的利益的总统。

I doubt that an inaugural address based on these ideas will awe and inspire many audiences at commencement ceremonies, especially where many of those in attendance are citizens of other countries. => 我怀疑基于这些思想的就职演说是否能够在毕业典礼上震撼和激发大量听众，特别是当许多听众是其他国家的公民的时候。
Such a speech will encourage no one to “bear any burden” for the sake of any universal principle or challenge, be it human rights or global warming. => 这样一份演讲无法鼓励任何人为任何普世原则或挑战“承担一切负担 ” ， 不管是人权还是全球变暖。
It will not exhort us to focus on something bigger than ourselves. => 它无法劝诫我们风物长宜放眼量。

Over the course of history, very few powerful states have developed a sense of themselves as being based not on ethnic heritage, but on a set of values that all citizens can live by. => 在历史进程中，很少有强大的国家能发展出这样一种感受：认为自己不是基于民族文化遗产，而是基于一系列所有公民生存之所系的价值观。
For the US, it was “life, liberty, and the pursuit of happiness.” => 对美国来说，这就是“生活、自由和追逐幸福 ” 。
For the Soviet Union, it was international proletarian solidarity – “workers of the world, unite.” => 对苏联来说，这是世界无产者大团结 — — “全世界工人联合起来 ” 。

The European Union is based on universal values and principles that are so attractive that 28 countries have opted to join it; and, Brexit notwithstanding, some half-dozen more are trying to get in. => 欧盟是基于能够吸引28个国家加入其中的普世价值观和原则；尽管发生了英国退欧，仍有六个国家正在努力加入其中。
Such an America will find its ability to lead the world compromised by a shortage of goodwill and an abundance of distrust. => 这样一个美国将发现，它领导世界的能力受到缺乏商誉和充满不信任的制约。
Other countries will huddle together to protect themselves from the US bully. => 其他国家将联合起来抵抗美国的仗势欺人。
If Trump really wants to make America great again, he should ponder how his inaugural address will sound to a global audience 56 years from now. => 如果特朗普真的想让美国重新伟大，他应该仔细思考他的就职演说如何面对56年前的全球听众。
Will it inspire the Class of 2073 the way Kennedy’s address still inspires graduates today? => 它能否激发2073届毕业生，就像肯尼迪的就职演说激发今天的毕业生那样?
America Goes from Teacher to Student => 美国从教师爷变成学生

Americans don’t seem to realize that their “sub-prime” mortgage meltdown has all too much in common with many previous post-1945 banking crises throughout the world. => 美国好像并不认识到，他们的“次级”房屋贷款破灭与许多1945年后席卷全球的银行危机有太多的共同之处。

The silver lining is that there are many highly distinguished current and former policymakers out there, particularly from emerging market countries, who have seen this movie before. => 令人欣慰的是，有许多特别是来自新兴市场国家的在任和前任杰出的决策者们已经看到了这一局面。

If US policymakers would only listen, they might get an idea or two about how to deal with financial crises from experts who have lived through them and come out safely on the other side. => 如果美国的决策者们听取意见的话，他们就会从安然度过金融危机的专家那里知道如何应付它们。
Unfortunately, the parallel between today’s US crisis and previous financial crises is not mere hyperbole. => 不幸的是，当今美国危机和以往金融危机的相同之处并不仅仅是夸张的。

The qualitative parallels are obvious: banks using off-balance loans to finance highly risky ventures, exotic new financial instruments, and excessive exuberance over the promise of new markets. => 本质上的相同之处是明显的。 银行使用帐外贷款来为极为具有风险的项目融资，别出心裁的金融工具以及对新的市场前景的过度兴奋。
But there are strong quantitative parallels as well. => 但是从数量上来说也有很强的共同之处。

These include epic crises in the Scandinavian countries, Spain, and Japan, along with lesser events such as the US savings and loan crises of the 1980’s. => 这些包括斯堪的那维亚国家、西班牙和日本发生的巨大的危机，以及二十世纪八十年代美国储蓄和贷款危机等较为轻微的事件。

Simply put, surging capital flows into the US artificially held down interest rates and inflated asset prices, leading to laxity in banking and regulatory standards and, ultimately, to a meltdown. => 简而言之，汹涌流向美国的资本人为地压低了利率并抬高了资产价格，导致银行和监管标准松懈并且最终造成瓦解。
The US should do the same. => 美国也应如此。
Admittedly, the IMF’s panel would have to look past America’s current hypocrisy. => 应当承认，国际货币基金组织的专家小组将会放过美国目前的伪善。
The US Treasury strongly encouraged Asia to tighten fiscal policy during its 1990’s crisis. => 在九十年代的危机中，美国财政部强烈鼓励亚洲紧缩财政政策。

Americans firmly told Japan that the only way to clean up its economy was to purge insolvent banks and regenerate the financial system through Schumpeterian “creative destruction.” => 美国人坚定地告诉日本说，收拾日本经济烂摊子的唯一途径就是清除负债的银行，并且通过熊彼特的“创造性破坏”来重造其金融体系。

Today, US authorities appear willing to contemplate any measure, no matter how inflationary, to insure that none of its major banks and investment houses fails. => 如今，美国当局似乎愿意考虑任何措施来确保其主要银行和投资公司没有一家倒闭，而无论其手段具有多大的通胀风险。
For years, foreign governments complained about American hedge funds, arguing that their non-transparent behavior posed unacceptable risks to stability. => 多年来，外国政府抱怨美国的对冲基金，说它们不透明的行为对稳定造成不可接受的风险。
In fact, having countries like Russia and China more vested in the well-being of the US economy would not be a bad thing. => 实际上，让像俄国和中国那样的国家在美国经济福祉上更多投资并非一件坏事。

Yes, the IMF ought to develop a voluntary code of conduct for SWF’s, but it should not be used as a weapon to enforce financial protectionism. => 是的，国际货币基金组织应该给主权财富基金制定一个自愿遵守的行为准则，但是这并不应当用来实行金融保护主义的武器。
For years, I, along with many others, have complained that emerging markets need greater representation in global financial governance. => 多年来，我和其他许多人抱怨说新兴市场国家需要在全球金融管理中占有更大的代表比例。
Today, the issue goes far beyond symbolism. => 今天，这一问题远远超过了象征主义。
The US economy is in trouble, and the problems it spins off are unlikely to stop at the US border. => 美国经济陷入麻烦，而它所带来的问题不大可能局限于美国境内。
Experts from emerging markets and elsewhere have much to say about dealing with financial crises. => 来自新兴市场国家和其他地方的专家们对于应付金融危机有很多话要说。
America should start to listen before it is too late. => 美国在为时已晚之前应该开始倾听。
Obamacare and Effective Government => 奥巴马医保和高效政府
Innovation is probably the least discussed aspect of health-care reform. => 创新也许是医疗改革中被讨论最少的话题。
Yet it is crucial to “bending” the sector’s cost curve, because it enables the delivery of quality health care in cost-effective ways. => 但它是“弯曲”医疗成本曲线的关键，因为它能够让高品质医疗以高性价比的方式提供。
Obamacare has provided powerful new incentives for such innovation. => 奥巴马医保为这类创新提供了有力的新激励。
From 1980 to 2010, US health-care spending grew almost twice as fast as the economy, rising from 9.2% to 17.4% of GDP. => 1980—2010年，美国医疗支出速度几乎是经济增长的两倍，占GDP之比从9.2%上升至17.4 % 。
Such patients are among the 10% who account for an estimated 64% of overall health care costs. => 这些病患占10 % ， 但付出了约64%的总医疗成本。
Around the US, providers, insurers, non-profits, and local governments are responding to the ACA’s incentives. => 放眼美国，提供商、保险商、非营利组织和地方政府都在响应ACA的激励。
Of course, it is still too early to declare victory, but Obamacare seems to be working. => 当然，现在就宣布胜利还为时尚早，但奥巴马医保似乎在起作用。
But the real surprise is that growth in health-care spending slowed dramatically from 2010 to 2013, to roughly the same pace as GDP growth. => 但真正的惊喜是医疗支出增长在2010—2013年出现大幅放缓，已与GDP增长速度相仿。

This represented a sharp break from the previous half-century; indeed, this period was characterized by the slowest growth in real per capita health-care spending on record. => 这与此前半个世纪形成了鲜明对比；事实上，这段时期创造了真实人均医疗支出增长最缓慢的记录。
To be sure, the ACA is only one factor in this promising trend; growth in health-care spending often slows in the wake of an economic downturn. => 诚然，ACA只是这一令人欣喜的趋势的一个因素；医疗支出增长常常随经济衰退而放缓。
But Medicare spending, which is not affected by recessions, has slowed along with private health-care spending. => 但联邦医疗保险支出 — — 该指支出不受衰退影响 — — 也随着私人健康支出一起放缓。
In a recent study, the CEA concluded that the ACA’s Medicare reforms account for a significant share of the slowdown. => 在最新研究中，CEA测算出ACA的联邦医疗保险改革贡献了医疗支出增长放缓的很大一部分。

The ACA is an example of how government can promote innovation to address major societal challenges by providing goals, directions, and incentives, rather than dictating solutions. => ACA是一个很好的范例，说明了政府如何能够通过提供目标、方向和激励而不是通过命令式方案促进解决重大社会挑战的创新。
The government plays a role akin to that of a venture capitalist providing seed money and financial support to foster innovation. => 政府的作用就像是风险资本家，提供种子资金和金融支持促进创新。
Brenner mapped “hot spots” around Camden, and sought to find out why people in some areas ran up such huge bills. => 布伦纳绘制了坎登周边的“热点 ” ， 并且试图找出为何某些地区的人医药费会如此巨大。

The problem was not fraud. It was an absence of coordinated medical care, especially basic primary care, and a lack of attention to people’s underlying risk factors. => 问题不在于欺诈，而在于缺乏协作医疗特别是基本初级治疗和缺乏对人们基本风险因素的关注。
The most expensive 1% of patients, those with a tangle of issues, accounted for 30% of Camden’s public health-care spending. => 最昂贵的1%病患往往一身是病，他们占据了坎登公共医疗支出的30 % 。

Brenner’s Camden Coalition of Healthcare Providers, founded in 2003, received its first funding from a philanthropy, the Robert Wood Johnson Foundation, and a private insurer, United Health Care. => 布伦纳的坎登医疗服务提供商联盟（Camden Coalition of Healthcare Providers）成立于2003年，首笔资金来自慈善机构罗伯特·伍德·约翰逊基金会（Robert Wood Johnson Foundation）和私人保险商联合医疗保险公司（United Health Care ） 。

The remarkable success in Camden has prompted the foundation to fund similar experiments in Boston, Cleveland, Cincinnati, western Michigan, and Humboldt County, California. => 坎登的巨大成功促使该基金会又资助了波士顿、克利夫兰、辛辛那提、西密歇根和加州洪堡县（Humboldt County）的类似实验。
Now the government is providing additional support, with grants to similar programs in Maryland, Colorado, Pennsylvania, and North Carolina. => 如今政府也开始提供更多的支持，马里兰州、科罗拉多州、宾夕法尼亚州和北卡罗来纳州的类似项目都获得了政府拨款。
Oregon has entered into a pay-for-success bargain with the federal government. => 俄勒冈州与联邦政府进行了“成功后支付 ” （ pay-for-success）谈判。
The state will receive $1.9 billion over five years to revamp its Medicaid services along the lines of Camden’s approach. => 该州将在五年时间中获得19亿美元按照坎登的方法改造联邦医疗补助服务。
Oregon will get the money only if its per-person Medicaid costs climb substantially more slowly than other states’. => 俄勒冈州只有在人均联邦医疗补助成本增速显著低于其他州的情况下才能获得这笔资金。
At the moment, Oregon is on track. => 现在，俄勒冈州正在路上。
The results so far are promising – not just by reining in costs, but also by better aligning service delivery with best practices. => 到目前为止，效果很好 — — 不但降低了成本，也更好地将服务提供和最佳实践结合起来。
The government can spur innovation by offering incentives that tap many different players’ strengths. => 政府可以通过提供集中多个行动方的优势的激励刺激创新。

And health-care reform is just one example in which government can deliver what the public wants by setting goals, encouraging creativity, and providing the resources to scale up what works. => 而医疗改革只是政府可以通过设置目标、鼓励创新、提供扩大有用方案的资源带来公众想要的东西的一个例子。
America’s Hidden Debt => 美国的隐藏负债

People like Summers worry about deficits because they doubt that the money the government is borrowing is being spent in ways that will push the long-term growth of GDP above that of the debt. => ”像萨默斯这样的人之所以为赤字忧心，是因为他们怀疑政府借来的钱是否最终被用到了可以推动GDP长期增长超过债务增长的手段上。
Unless the mix of spending changes, the debt-to-GDP ratio will continue to grow, foretelling disaster. => 除非支出组合发生变化，否则债务相对GDP的比率将继续增长，直到灾难降临。
Others do not share such concerns. => 其他人却对此不以为然。

On the political left, Nobel laureate Paul Krugman, for example, argues that for “a country that looks like the United States, a debt crisis is fundamentally not possible.” => 例如在左派诺贝尔经济学奖得主保罗·克鲁格曼（Paul Krugman）就认为对于一个“美国这样的国家来说，债务危机根本不可能发生。

On the right, John Tamny, Forbes’ political economy editor, says, “Ignore the endless talk of doom, budget deficits really don’t matter.” => ”而隶属于右派的《福布斯》杂志政治经济编辑约翰·塔姆尼（John Tamny）也觉得应该“把那些没完没了的危言耸听抛诸脑后，预算赤字委实无关紧要。 ”
But while judgments differ about the sustainability of US government debt, they both accept the standard measure of it as accurate. => 但尽管各方对美国政府债务可持续性的判断存在分歧，但他们都接受衡量这一指标的标准方法的准确性。
This is a mistake, and possibly a catastrophic one. => 这就是一个错误，甚至可能是灾难性的。

The Congressional Budget Office (CBO) recently reported that the federal budget deficit in the first ten months of this fiscal year was $116 billion higher than it was at the same time last year. => 美国国会预算办公室最近报告称，本财年前十个月的联邦预算赤字较去年同期高出1160亿美元。
The CBO is now projecting that the annual deficit will reach $1 trillion by 2020. => 国会预算办公室目前预计到2020年时年度赤字将达1万亿美元。
This is worrying, but it does not reflect the harsh truth. The annual deficit almost certainly surpassed $1 trillion last year. => 这虽然令人担忧，但却并未反映出严酷的事实：去年的年度赤字几乎已经肯定超过了1万亿美元。
To understand why, think of America as a home with a leaky roof. => 要理解这一点，可以把美国想象成一个天花漏水的屋子。

If you wanted to sell that home to a buyer who is financing the purchase with a mortgage, federal real-estate law would require you to get an appraisal, which would show that the roof needs repairs. => 如果你想将房屋出售给通过抵押贷款来筹措房款的买家，联邦房地产法会要求你先对房屋进行评估，而评估结果肯定会写明屋顶需要维修。
In this scenario, your maintenance delays cannot be ignored. => 在这种情况下你无法拖延维护。
The law requires that you disclose and pay for the hidden costs of repairing the roof. Otherwise, you are stealing from the buyer. => 法律会要求你披露并支付修复屋顶的隐性费用，否则的话你就是在盗取买家的利益。
True, unlike the mortgage on your balance sheet, you may not regard roof maintenance as a current liability. => 的确，与资产负债表上的抵押贷款不同，你可能不会将屋顶维护费用视为当期负债。
But putting it off doesn’t make it disappear. => 但是推迟这笔支出并不会让问题消失。
It is still a real debt – just one that has gone unaccounted for. => 它仍然是一笔实实在在的债务 — — 只是暂时未计入而已。
The federal government also has debt that has not been accounted for, and which one doesn’t often hear about. => 联邦政府也有一些人们往往都不会留意到的未计入债务。
And these are just two broad examples. => 但这些只是其中两个影响比较广泛的例子而已。
So, just how much hidden US debt is there? => 那么美国究竟有多少隐藏债务呢？
At this point, we must rely on rough estimates. => 在这方面我们只依靠粗略的估计。

For example, according to a 2016 report from the American Society of Civil Engineers (ASCE), upgrading the country’s crumbling infrastructure would cost $5.2 trillion. => 例如，根据美国土木工程师协会2016年发布的一份报告，升级该国摇摇欲坠的基础设施需要耗资5.2万亿美元。
All told, that is $11.8 trillion in unaccounted-for non-inflation-adjusted liabilities. => 加起来就是11.8万亿包含通胀因素的未入账负债。
To be sure, these debts are not solely federal liabilities. => 可以肯定的是，这些债务不仅仅是联邦债务。
In the past, state and local governments were responsible for most infrastructure and climate costs. => 过去大多数基础设施和气候成本都由州和地方政府负责。
They are America’s national “leaky roof.” => 它们就是美国这个国家的“漏水屋顶 ” 。

In fact, between 2012 and 2016, the ASCE increased its estimate of America’s annual infrastructure-investment gap by $221 billion – about $55 billion per year. => 事实上，在2012~2016年间，美国土木工程师协会将美国年度基础设施投资缺口预测数提高了2210亿美元 — — 每年增加约550亿美元。
And between 2012 and 2014, the IEA increased its estimated cost of moving to a clean-energy system by roughly $270 billion per year. => 而从2012年到2014年，国际能源署将向清洁能源系统转换的估计成本每年调高大约2700亿美元。

Together, the unaccounted-for inflation-adjusted deficit amounted to $345 billion – just from delaying needed infrastructure and climate abatement spending. => 加起来排除通胀因素后的赤字总额达3450亿美元 — — 仅仅是因为推迟了所需的基础设施和气候减排支出。
The 2017 US federal deficit was $665 billion, reflecting the amount by which debt that is actually accounted for increased. => 2017年美国联邦赤字为6650亿美元，这反映了实际得到核算的债务增加额。
If infrastructure and climate debt that is not accounted for were to be included, the all-in deficit in 2017 would have been over $1 trillion. => 但如果将未计入的基础设施和气候债务纳入其中，2017年的全部赤字将超过1万亿美元。
Yes, these are back-of-the-envelope calculations, but they point to an urgent question: Why isn’t the US counting its hidden debts? => 这虽然都是些粗略的计算，但它们指出了一个紧迫的问题：为什么美国去不计算其隐藏债务？
The short answer is that the law doesn’t require it. => 简略的回答是法律并不要求这样做。

The federal “debt limit” was never a firm construct, and under pressure it became a squishy “ceiling suspension” that allows the government to borrow as much as it wants. => 联邦“债务上限”从来都不是一个固定架构，并且在压力之下它已经变成了一种软性的“天花悬挂系统”好让政府可以尽可能多地借钱。
Until all debt is counted, we cannot even begin to know whether fiscal policies are having positive or negative effects on future growth. => 除非所有债务都被记录在案，否则我们甚至无法了解财政政策究竟会对未来增长产生正面还是负面影响。
America’s Second Chance with India => 美国和印度的第二次机会
NEW YORK – Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s visit to Washington, DC, in June garnered little public attention outside of India. => 纽约—印度总理莫迪6月份的访美之旅在印度之外基本没有引起什么关注。
Yet diplomats and military professionals in Asia and beyond were certainly watching closely. => 但亚洲外交官和军事专业人士显然在密切关注。
For good reason: the rapprochement between the world’s two most populous democracies could shape the world’s future. => 其来有自：世界上人口最多的两个民主国家之间的关系缓和可以决定世界的未来。
It is worth noting that in his address to the US Congress, Modi invoked the word “partner” or “partnership” no fewer than 15 times. => 值得注意的是，在美国国会演讲中，莫迪至少15次提到了“伙伴”一词。

The official joint statement released by the two governments described India as a “Major Defense Partner” of the United States, eligible for advanced technologies with military applications. => 两国政府发布的正式联合申明将印度描述为美国的“主要防务伙伴 ” ， 有资格获得军用先进技术。

The relationship between India and the US has evolved from one of cool distance to strategic proximity in a generation – lightning fast for geopolitics. => 在一代人的时间里，印美关系从冷眼保持距离演变为战略性靠近 — — 就地缘政治而言，发展不可不谓快。
The factors underlying this shift merit attention, for many of them are likely to bring the two countries even closer. => 这一转变背后的推动因素值得关注，因为其中许多因素有望让两国更加紧密。
A second factor is Pakistan. => 第二个因素是巴基斯坦。
For a long time, the US pursued an even-handed policy toward South Asia’s two most strategically important countries. => 长期以来，美国对这两个在战略上最重要的南亚国家采取的是一碗水端平的政策。
Nonetheless, during most of the Cold War, Pakistan was seen as a friendly country, whereas its great rival, India, was viewed as difficult. => 尽管如此，在冷战的大部分时间里，巴基斯坦被视为友邦，而它的劲敌印度被视为一个难点。
This view was reinforced when Pakistan became the essential conduit of weapons to Afghans fighting the Soviet occupation of their country. => 巴基斯坦成为向阿富汗输送武器助其抵抗苏联侵略的重要通道后，这一观点进一步得到了强化。
But the bond between the US and Pakistan weakened when Soviet forces withdrew from Afghanistan in 1989. => 但1989年苏军撤出阿富汗后，美巴关系有所削弱。
As a result, US ties to India were no longer constrained by fear of complications in Pakistan. => 结果，美国建设对印关系不再受到顾虑巴基斯坦不满的约束。
China is also animating the improvement in India-US ties. => 中国也在推动印美关系的改善。
The motivation is far more fundamental than the fact that India and China still have an unresolved border. => 其背后的动机远比中印边境问题仍有待解决这一事实更具根本性。
Domestic politics also loom large in the relationship’s development – on both sides. => 国内政治也严重影响着印美关系的发展 — — 对两国都是如此。
The decline of India’s Congress party reduced the influence of the political force most associated with maintaining distance from the US. => 印度国大党的衰落降低了最支持与美国保持距离的政治力量的影响力。

Meanwhile, there are now more than three million Indian-Americans, and, as with many other immigrant populations, they have become ever more prominent and powerful. => 与此同时，如今美国有三百万印度裔公民，与许多其他移民群体一样，他们变得更加重要和强大。
Economic ties are also growing, along with India’s economy. => 随着印度经济的增长，印美经济关系也在加强。
Bilateral trade has increased to more than $100 billion a year. => 双边贸易已增加到每年1,000亿美元以上。
High-level visits have become commonplace. => 高层访问已经稀松平常。
Closer economic ties and large-scale collaboration on clean energy are a high priority. => 更紧密的经济关系和清洁能源领域的大规模合作是重中之重。
One can also predict increased cooperation between the two countries’ military and intelligence establishments. => 可以预期，两国军事和情报机构之间的合作也将增加。
Indeed, joint efforts to keep the Indian Ocean open and safe are already a reality. => 事实上，保持印度洋开放和安全的联合行动已是既成事实。
The US and India need not be formal allies for their relationship to have the desired effect on Chinese strategic calculations. => 美国和印度正式结盟就可以对中国的战略意图形成想要的影响。
Challenges remain, of course. => 当然，挑战仍然存在。
Bureaucracy, corruption, and poor infrastructure continue to hold back India’s economy. => 官僚主义、腐败和拙劣的基础设施仍然制约着印度经济。
Indian leaders must also be careful not to do or say things that could alienate the country’s large Muslim minority. => 印度领导任还必须保持谨慎，不可做出或说出可能梳理该国为数巨大的穆斯林少数群体的内容。
And they must still ensure that close ties with the US are not simply the policy of one prime minister or party. => 他们还必须确保与美国的紧密关系不仅仅是一届总理或一党的政策。
This means getting the Congress party fully on board and overcoming the resistance of career officials to new ways of thinking and acting. => 这意味着要让国大党充分参与进来，并克服事务官对新思维和行为的抵触。
It is difficult to overlook the irony in much of this. => 不难看出，其中不乏讽刺之处。

More than a half-century ago, in the early years of the Cold War, many in Washington saw India as a potential model of non-Communist political and economic development. => 五十多年前，在冷战初期，华盛顿有许多人将印度视为非共产主义政治和经济发展的前在榜样。

For many reasons, things did not work out that way, as India became economically statist, for a time politically authoritarian, and geopolitically closer to the USSR than US officials liked. => 出于众多原因，事情并未朝这个方向发展，印度在经济上演变为国家主义，政治上一度成为极权主义，地缘政治上比美国官员所期待的更加接近于苏联。
Now, however, India is emerging as a successful example of a market-oriented democracy with close ties to the US. => 但是，如今，印度正在崛起成为与美国关系密切的市场经济民主的成功范例。
Second chances are rare in life, but both India and the US may be getting just that. => 生活中很少能获得第二次机会，而印度和美国可能恰恰获得了这一机会。
America Keeping Haiti Down => 美国在海地的伏都教人权政策

The IDB, the world's largest regional development bank, works in Latin America and the Caribbean purportedly to “contribute to the acceleration of economic and social development.” => 作为世界上最大的区域开发银行，泛美开发银行在拉丁美洲和加勒比海地区的工作据称是“为加快经济和社会发展作贡献 ” 。
Its actions in Haiti, however, have severely undermined those goals. => 但是，它在海地的行为已经严重损害了这些宗旨。

These actions violated the IDB’s own charter, which strictly prohibits the Bank and its members from interfering in the internal political affairs of member states. => 这些行为违反了泛美开发银行自己的章程，该章程严格禁止银行及其成员干涉成员国的内部政治事务。
Indeed, by requesting further review of the loans, Haiti would have to make scheduled payments before the funds were even disbursed. => 确实，通过要求对贷款进行进一步的审查，海地将不得不在贷款发放之前就进行定期还款。

“While this is not a ‘bullet-proof’ way to stop IDB disbursements,” the counsellor wrote, “it certainly will put a few more large rocks in the road.” => “虽然这不是阻止泛美开发银行贷款发放的‘完美无缺’的方法 ” ， 该律师写道 ， “ 但是，它肯定会给贷款的发放设置更多的障碍 ” 。

In 2001, then-US Ambassador to Haiti Dean Curran publicly and explicitly linked the withholding of IDB loans to the demand that Haiti’s political parties reach a compromise that America wanted. => 在2001年，时任美国驻海地大使的迪安·科兰（Dean Curran）曾公开明确地将泛美开发银行贷款的扣留和海地的政党达成美国希望的妥协的要求联系起来。
These tactics worked. => 这些策略奏效了。

Deprived of funds that had already been committed and expected, Haiti fell into arrears on money owed for loan repayment, triggering IDB policies that prevented the Bank from releasing loans. => 由于被剥夺了已经被承诺和期待的资金，海地没有支付偿还借款的资金，而这会使泛美开发银行启动阻止银行贷款发放的银行政策。

In subsequent years, the US employed additional delaying tactics, working with the IDB to move the goal posts whenever Haiti appeared to be meeting their demands. => 在后来的几年里，美国又使用了其他的延迟策略，这些策略就是在海地似乎快要满足其要求的时候，和泛美开发银行一起改变目标标杆。
The results have been devastating. => 这些策略的后果是毁灭性的。

The town of Port-de-Paix, slotted ten years ago by the IDB as the first project site due to its particularly deplorable water situation, has yet to see the implementation of any water projects. => 和平港市因为其悲惨的饮用水状况，在十年前就被泛美开发银行跟踪作为第一个项目实施地点，但是，到目前为止还没有看到任何饮用水项目的实施。

Researchers found three-quarters of water sources in the city contained high levels of coliform bacteria, a key indicator of contamination with fecal matter. => 研究人员发现，该市3/4的水源都含有很高水平的大肠杆细菌，这是水源被排泄物污染的一个重要指标。
A frightening 15% of households reported symptoms likely related to typhoid. => 而且，还有令人震惊的高达15%的家庭报告了可能和伤寒症有关的症状。
The Myth of Sound Fundamentals => 基本面可靠的神话
NEW HAVEN – The spin is all too predictable. => 纽黑文—起伏太容易预测了。
With the US stock market clawing its way back from the sharp correction of early February, the mindless mantra of the great bull market has returned. => 随着美国股市从2月初的大幅调整中逐步恢复，无脑大牛市的诅咒也开始回归。

The recent correction is now being characterized as a fleeting aberration – a volatility shock – in what is still deemed to be a very accommodating investment climate. => 如今，最近的回调被定义为短暂的偏离 — — 一次波动性冲击 — — 投资环境仍然十分适宜。
After all, the argument goes, economic fundamentals – not just in the United States, but worldwide – haven’t been this good in a long, long time. => 毕竟，这一观点说，经济基本面 — — 不仅仅是美国，也包括全世界 — — 很久没有那么好了。
But are the fundamentals really that sound? => 但基本面真的如此可靠吗？
For a US economy that has a razor-thin cushion of saving, nothing could be further from the truth. => 对储蓄缓冲薄得可怜的美国经济来说，没有比这离得更远的真相了。
Net saving represents today’s investment in the future, and the bottom line for America is that it is saving next to nothing. => 净储蓄代表了今天对未来的投资，而美国的计算结果是储蓄接近于零。
Alas, the story doesn’t end there. => 可惜，故事到这里还没有结束。
To finance consumption and growth, the US borrows surplus saving from abroad to compensate for the domestic shortfall. => 为了给消费和增长融资，美国向海外借入盈余储蓄来补足国内短缺。
All that borrowing implies a large balance-of-payments deficit with the rest of the world, which spawns an equally large trade deficit. => 所有这些借款带来了巨大的国际收支赤字，进而产生同样巨大的贸易赤字。
While President Donald Trump’s administration is hardly responsible for this sad state of affairs, its policies are about to make a tough situation far worse. => 特朗普总统的政府不需要为这个悲哀的状态负责，但其采取的政策会大大加剧困境。

Under the guise of tax reform, late last year Trump signed legislation that will increase the federal budget deficit by $1.5 trillion over the next decade. => 去年，特朗普打着税收改革的旗号签署了将让美国联邦预算赤字在未来十年增加1.5亿美元的立法。
And now the US Congress, in its infinite wisdom, has upped the ante by another $300 billion in the latest deal to avert a government shutdown. => 而如今，美国国用它的大智慧，在为了避免政府关门的人达成的最新协议中，将这个数字再度提高了3,000亿美元。

As domestic saving plunges, the US has two options – a reduction in investment and the economic growth it supports, or increased borrowing of surplus saving from abroad. => 随着国内储蓄的暴跌，美国有两个选择 — — 降低投资及其所支撑的经济增长，或增加从海外借入的盈余储蓄。
With these deficits, of course, come equally chronic trade deficits with a broad cross-section of America’s foreign partners. => 当然，与这些赤字一同到来的是同样根深蒂固的对美国各大贸易伙伴的贸易赤字。
Astonishingly, in 2017, the US ran trade deficits with 102 countries. => 2017年，美国对令人咋舌的102个国家存在贸易赤字。

Further compression of an already-weak domestic saving position spells growing current-account and trade deficits – a fundamental axiom of macroeconomics that the US never seems to appreciate. => 进一步压缩已然孱弱不堪的国内储蓄头寸意味着经常项目和贸易赤字继续增加 — — 这可不是美国一贯欣赏的宏观经济学的基本准则。

Attempting to solve a multilateral imbalance with bilateral tariffs directed mainly at China, such as those just imposed on solar panels and washing machines in January, doesn’t add up. => 1月份，特朗普政府对中国产太阳能面板和洗衣机征收关税，用诸如此类主要针对中国的双边措施来解决多边失衡问题无济于事。
Far from sound, the fundamentals of a saving-short US economy look shakier than ever. => 储蓄短缺的美国经济的基本面绝对算不上可靠，倒是比以往任何时候都要岌岌可危。

Lacking a cushion of solid support from income generation, the lack of saving also leaves the US far more beholden to fickle asset markets than might otherwise be the case. => 由于缺少来自收入创造的可靠支撑缓冲，储蓄不足还让美国更加容易受到变幻无常的资产价格的影响。
That’s especially true of American consumers who have relied on appreciation of equity holdings and home values to support over-extended lifestyles. => 对于依靠股票和房价上涨支持与收入不匹配的生活方式的美国消费者来说尤其如此。

It is also the case for the US Federal Reserve, which has turned to unconventional monetary policies to support the real economy via so-called wealth effects. => 对美联储来说也是如此，它依靠非常规货币政策，通过所谓的财富效应来支持实体经济。

And, of course, foreign investors are acutely sensitive to relative returns on assets – the US versus other markets – as well as the translation of those returns into their home currencies. => 当然，外国投资者对相对资产回报 — — 美国相对其他市场 — — 以及将这些回报换回本币的汇率非常敏感。
But momentum and fundamentals are two very different things. => 但动能和基本面是截然不同的两件事。
Momentum can be fleeting, especially for a saving-short US economy that is consuming the seed corn of future prosperity. => 动能随时会消失得无影无踪，对储蓄短缺、寅吃卯粮的美国经济来说尤其如此。

With dysfunctional policies pointing to a further compression of saving in the years ahead, the myth of sound US fundamentals has never rung more hollow. => 适得其反的政策准备在未来几年进一步压缩储蓄，照此看，美国基本面可靠的神话简直像是一个恐怖故事。
America’s Midterm Elections Turn Menacing => 美国的中期选举变得异常凶险
WASHINGTON, DC – With the approach of this year’s midterm elections in the United States, domestic terrorism is starting to dominate the political landscape. => 华盛顿 — — 随着年内美国中期选举的临近，国内恐怖主义开始主导政治格局。

First, barely two weeks before Election Day, an angry supporter of US President Donald Trump began sending 14 bombs to prominent Democrats and others whom Trump has frequently attacked. => 首先，就在选举日前不到两周，美国总统唐纳德·特朗普一位愤怒的支持者开始向著名的民主党人和其他特朗普经常攻击的人士邮寄14枚炸弹。
(None of the bombs exploded.) => （这些炸弹都没有爆炸。
Then things became much worse, with the murder, on a Saturday, of 11 Jews in a Pittsburgh synagogue. => ）而后局面更是进一步恶化，星期六，在匹兹堡的一座犹太教堂里，11名犹太人被谋杀。

Had the 14 crude bombs, which the FBI called “potentially destructive devices,” worked as intended, the bombmaker could have killed or gravely injured a who’s who of Trump adversaries. => 如果被联邦调查局称之为“潜在破坏性装置”的这14枚自制炸弹发挥了预期的效果，那么炸弹制造者可能已经杀害或重伤了作为特朗普对手的名人。

The mail bombs, they claimed, were a “false flag” operation by the left, with some of the Democrats even sending the bombs to themselves in order to blame Trump. => 他们声称邮件炸弹是左翼“打着特朗普旗号的假冒行动 ” ， 有些民主党人甚至给自己寄炸弹，并借此指责特朗普。
The most disheartening aspect of the entire episode was Trump’s utter incapacity as a national leader. => 整个事件从始至终最令人沮丧的就是，特朗普身为国家领袖却完全束手无策。
But that should surprise no one. => 但这应当早在所有人的预料之中。
It didn’t last. => 但这种情况并没有持续多久。
By that evening, at a rally in Wisconsin, he was making fun of his “trying to be nice” act and blamed the media for the violence. => 到那天傍晚，在威斯康辛州举行的一次集会上，特朗普就开始取笑自己“试图变得和善”的行为，并称媒体应对此次暴力行为负责。
And soon he was back to whipping up fear of a caravan of refugees from Honduras. => 很快他又重新开始煽动对洪都拉斯难民车队的恐惧。

Though still roughly 1,000 miles from the US border, Trump portrayed the refugees as an imminent national security threat, warning, without evidence, that “Middle Easterners” were among them. => 尽管距美国边境仍有1，000英里，但特朗普仍将那些难民描绘成迫在眉睫的国家安全威胁，并在毫无证据的情况下警告，难民队伍中混入了“中东人 ” 。
Trump’s rallies are now almost a daily event, and his lies are even more frequent than before. => 特朗普的集会现在几乎天天上演，而他的谎言也比以前频繁得多。

With the entire House of Representatives and one-third of the Senate to be chosen on November 6, the upcoming midterm election is widely regarded as the most consequential in memory, perhaps ever. => 因为11月6日将选举整个众议院和参议院1/3的席位，即将到来的中期选举被普遍视为人们记忆当中最重要的选举，其重要性甚至也许是史无前例的。

The Republicans’ two-year lock on the entire US government – the House, the Senate, the presidency, and, with the recent addition of Justice Brett Kavanaugh, the Supreme Court – could be broken. => 共和党对整个美国政府长达两年的完全控制 — — 包括众议院、参议院、总统职位，以及不久前刚刚就任最高法院法官的布雷特·卡瓦诺 — — 这次有可能会被打破。

The midterm election following the election of a new president is often considered a verdict on the incumbent, and his party usually loses strength, particularly in the House. => 紧随新总统当选后的中期选举往往会被视为对现任总统的宣判，而其所属政党往往会失势，尤其是在众议院。
But Trump has made the midterms about himself to an unprecedented degree. => 但特朗普已经把中期选举和自己的关系抬高的前所未有的程度。
He tells audiences that though he’s not on the ballot, they should vote as if he were (though his approval ratings are in the low forties). => 他告诉听众尽管他并未参加投票，他们在投票时应当假设他是其中的一员（尽管他的支持率现在已经降到40 % ） 。

It has long been believed that the Democrats are more likely to win the House than the Senate, because several of the Senate seats in play are held by Democrats in traditionally conservative states. => 很长时间以来，人们一直认为与参议院相比，民主党更有可能赢得众议院，因为即将参与选举的几个参议院席位都掌握在传统保守州的民主党人手中。
Trump’s determination, or anxiety, that Republicans maintain control of both chambers is understandable. => 特朗普对共和党人继续控制两院的决心和焦虑可以理解。
At least the House is likely to have the conclusions of Special Counsel Robert Mueller to consider. => 至少众议院可能会得出与特别顾问罗伯特·穆勒相同的结论。
In other words, no more lapdog Congress. => 换句话说，国会将不再是特朗普豢养的宠物。
But if the Republicans maintain control of the Senate, there will be limits on what the Democrats can achieve. => 但如果共和党保持对参议院的控制，就会限制民主党所能达到的目标。
Even if the House were to impeach Trump – no sure thing – convicting him in the Senate would be extremely difficult. => 即使众议院真的弹劾特朗普 — — 能不能弹劾现在还根本无法确定 — — 要想在参议院将他定罪也将是极其困难的。
Whether a Democratic House would even proceed in that direction has been the subject of intra-party debate. => 甚至民主党控制的众议院是否会朝那个方向努力一直都还是党内争论的目标。
The nightmare election possibility for the Democrats is continued Republican control of both chambers. => 对民主党而言，噩梦般的选举前景是两院继续由共和党控制。
In that case, Trump will feel vindicated and more liberated than ever. => 在那样的情况下，特朗普相比任何时候都将更强烈地感受到无辜和自由。
The conventional wisdom may prevail, with the Democrats winning the House but not the Senate. => 传统智慧可能会占据上风，民主党可能会在众议院而非参议院选举中获胜。
But the polls have been fluctuating. => 但民意调查显示的结果一直在波动。
And since Trump’s stunning election victory in 2016, most observers have become more cautious about predicting outcomes. => 自从特朗普2016年令人瞩目地获胜以来，多数观察家都对预测选举结果变得更加谨慎。
Alliances for Peace => 为了和平的联盟
WASHINGTON, DC – I grew up in the shadow of World War II, and at the dawn of the Cold War. => 华盛顿—我成长于二战的阴影和冷战的黎明中。
What strikes me now, all these years later, is that a generation of leaders won not only a war, but also the peace. => 多年以后，如今让我震惊的是一代领导人不但赢得了战争，还赢得了和平。
They did it together. => 他们齐心协力做到了这一点。
The United States and our partners worked to create alliances that brought prosperity and stability to Western Europe, Japan, and South Korea. => 美国和我们的伙伴努力建立了给西欧、日本和韩国带来繁荣与稳定的联盟。
Old enemies became new allies, and together pioneered a new global economic system that made the world more prosperous. => 旧敌人成了新盟友，并一起引领了让全世界更繁荣的新全球经济制度。
And even as the Cold War raged, leaders found ways to cooperate on arms control and prevent a nuclear Armageddon. => 哪怕是在冷战肆虐时，领导人们也找得到办法在武器控制和阻止核末日等方面进行合作。
That is the remarkable story of the twentieth century. => 这是20世纪令人瞩目的故事。
The question now is what story will emerge from the twenty-first century. => 现在的问题是21世纪的故事会怎样展开。
Today, the world order faces new challenges. => 今天，世界秩序面临新挑战。
Russian aggression is rattling allies. => 俄罗斯的入侵让盟国震惊。
Extremists who hijack religion threaten governments and people everywhere. => 从事宗教圣战的极端主义者威胁着政府和各处的人民。

Technology is accelerating a shift in the balance of power between governments and governed that offers both opportunities for democratic accountability and obstacles to inclusive politics. => 科技正在加速治国者和被治者之间的实力平衡，既提供了民主问责的机会，也形成了包容政治的障碍。
We have gone from a world where power resided in hierarchies to one where it inhabits networks. => 我们已经从权力呈现层级分布的世界来到了权力呈现网络分布的世界。
Statecraft has yet to adapt. => 但治国术还没有适应。
The international institutions and partnerships that emerged in the postwar years demand both maintenance and modernization. => 战后时期出现的国际机构和合作关系既需要维持，也需要现代化。
In the face of all of this turbulence, some suggest that America should turn inward. => 面临所有这些动荡，有人认为美国应该转向内向。
That is nothing new. => 这不过是陈词滥调。
Some argued the same after WWII. => 二战后就有人提出这样的观点。
They argued it again 25 years ago, after the fall of the Berlin Wall. => 25年前柏林墙倒塌后又有人这样说。 那时，他们错了。
They were wrong then – and they are wrong now. => 如今，他们也是错的。
The need for leadership has never been greater, and the US has never been more engaged with the world. => 对领导力的需要从未如此巨大，美国也从未如此深地参与世界。
The world has changed, and we are changing with it. => 世界已经发生了变化，我们也在随之改变。
Lines on the map no longer contain the gravest threats, and the players are no longer divided neatly into two camps. => 地图上的线不再包含最严重的威胁，各行动方也不再泾渭分明地分成两个阵营。
In the twenty-first century, next door is everywhere. => 在21世纪，后门无处不在。
That is why the world needs coalition diplomacy. => 因此，世界需要联盟外交（coalition diplomacy ） 。
No country can defeat terrorism on its own. => 没有哪个国家能够单枪匹马击败恐怖主义。
No country can solve the existential threat of climate change alone. => 没有哪个国家能够单枪匹马解决生存危机。
No country can eradicate extreme poverty, combat potential pandemics, or improve nuclear security by itself. => 没有哪个国家能够依靠自己消灭极端贫困、战胜潜在传染病或改善核安全。
None of us can live safer, richer lives by turning our back to the world. => 如果我���不直面世界，我们所有人都无法获得更安全、更富裕的生活。

We must build on our history of working with allies by forming new coalitions – with governments, with civil society, and, yes, with everyday people. => 我们必须与政府、与公民社会 — — 是的，还要与普罗大众 — — 结成新的联盟，与盟友们一起构建历史。
A good example is the international effort to confront the Islamic State’s malign brutality in Iraq and Syria. => 一个很好的例子是针对伊斯兰国在伊拉克和叙利亚残忍暴行的国际努力。
Political, humanitarian, and intelligence tools from more than 60 countries are being used to support unified military action. => 来自60多个国家政治、人道和情报工具被用于支持联合军事行动。

Success depends not on what one or even a handful of countries can do alone, but on what all of us are able to achieve by moving forward together against this common threat. => 成功不取决于一国甚至少数几国可以独力完成什么，而是取决于我们所有人可以通过携手面对这一共同威胁实现什么。
On an equally important front, the US is working with the United Nations to galvanize a global response to the danger posed by the Ebola virus. => 在另一个同样重要的阵线，美国正在与联合国一起努力激励全球应对埃博拉病毒的威胁。

I have personally talked with more than 50 foreign leaders, and we all agree that only by coordinating our actions can we stop the devastation in West Africa and halt Ebola’s spread. => 我个人与50多位外国领导人讨论了这一问题，我们都同意，只有通过协调行动才能阻止西非的灾难和埃博拉的传播。
We are making progress on both issues, but much work remains. => 我们在这两个问题上都在取得进展，但仍有许多工作要做。
Bringing together countries with competing interests and varying resources is hard work. => 让利益相互竞争、资源大相径庭的国家走到一起是一个艰难的工作。

It demands intense diplomatic engagement and calls upon relationships that have been built and maintained over decades, as well as alliances with new partners. => 这要求大量外交投入、动员几十年来所构建和维持的关系以及与新合作伙伴的联盟。

But by overcoming differences and coordinating efforts to defeat the Islamic State and conquer Ebola, we are reinforcing support for a world order grounded in collective solutions to common problems. => 但通过克服差异、共同努力击败伊斯兰国、征服埃博拉，我们正在强化对基于针对共同问题的集体解决方案的世界秩序的支持。
Cooperation is equally vital in reinforcing the bedrock economic principles on which America and other countries built their postwar prosperity. => 对于巩固作为美国和其他国家战后繁荣基础的经济原则，合作也同样重要。
Frustration cannot grow faster than opportunity in any country. => 不论哪个国家，沮丧都不会比机会发展得更快。
The benefits – for both the US and our partners – are enormous. => 不管是对美国还是对我们的合作伙伴，好处都是巨大的。
Estimates are that the TPP could provide $77 billion a year in real income and support 650,000 new jobs in the US alone. => 据估计，光是在美国，TPP每年可以增加77美元真实收入、支持650,000个新就业岗位。

The Transatlantic Trade and Investment Partnership being negotiated with the European Union offers another major step toward increasing trade. => 正在与欧盟谈判的跨大西洋贸易和投资合作伙伴关系（Transatlantic Trade and Investment Partnership）则提供了另一个促进贸易的一大步。
Whether for mutual security or shared prosperity, genuine partnerships are not built overnight. => 不管是为了共同安全还是共同繁荣，真正的伙伴关系都不是一夜建成的。
Closing the Investment Gap => 填补投资缺口

BERKELEY – The weakness of private investment in the United States and other advanced economies is a worrisome – and perplexing – feature of the recovery from the 2008 global financial crisis. => 伯克利—美国和其他发达经济体私人投资疲软，2008年全球金融危机后的复苏的这一特征令人担忧，也令人困惑。
Indeed, according to the International Monetary Fund, through 2014, private investment declined by an average of 25% compared to pre-crisis trends. => 事实上，据国际货币基金组织（IMF）的数据，2014年较危机前趋势，私人投资平均下降25 % 。
The shortfall in investment has been deep and broad-based, affecting not only residential investment but also investment in equipment and structures. => 投资不足的深度和广度都很大，不但影响住宅投资，也影响设备和结构投资。
Interestingly, the investment shortfall in the US coincides with a strong rebound in returns to capital. => 有趣的是，美国的投资短缺和资本回报率的强力反弹同时发生。
By one measure, returns to private capital are now at a higher point than any time in recent decades. => 从某种程度上讲，私人资本回报率目前比最近几十年中的任何时候都要高。

But extensive empirical research confirms that at the macro level, business investment depends primarily on expected future demand and output growth, not on current returns or retained earnings. => 但大量实证研究证实，在宏观层面，商业投资主要取决于预期未来需求和产出增长，而不是当前回报率或留存利润。

According to the IMF, this “accelerator” theory of investment explains most of the weakness of business investment in the developed economies since the 2008 crisis. => 据IMF，这一投资的“加速器”理论解释了2008年危机后发达经济体商业投资疲软的绝大部分。
In accordance with this explanation, investment growth in the US has been in line with its usual historical relationship with output growth. => 根据这一解释，美国投资增长与其与产出增长的正常历史关系相符。
In short, private investment growth has been weak primarily because the pace of recovery has been anemic. => 简言之，私人投资疲软主要是因为复苏疲软。

Businesses have marked down their pre-crisis investment plans to reflect a post-crisis “new normal” of slower and more uncertain growth in demand for their output. => 企业削减危机前的投资计划，以适应速度更低、不确定性性更大的危机后产出需求增长“新常态 ” 。
Under conditions of weak aggregate demand, stronger public investment encourages more private business investment. => 在总需求疲软的背景下，加强公共投资鼓励更多的私人商业投资。
But public investment, too, has fallen below pre-crisis expectations, aggravating rather than ameliorating the slump in private investment. => 但公共投资也不如危机前预期，加剧而不是缓解了私人投资的暴跌。

Indeed, telecom and cable companies accounted for the largest share of business capital expenditures during the last three years, with energy production and mining second on the list. => 事实上，通讯和电缆公司占据了过去三年商业资本支出的最大份额，紧随其后的是能源生产和矿产。
Differences in innovation opportunities across industries are also consistent with the changing composition of business investment. => 行业间创新机会的差异也与商业投资份额变化一致。
R&D investment usually expands faster than GDP during cyclical expansions, and the current period is in line with historical trends. => 在周期性扩张中，研发投资通常快于GDP，最近一段时期与历史趋势相符。
Indeed, as a share of the economy, R&D investment is now at its highest level on record, which bodes well for future productivity growth. => 事实上，以占经济比重论，研发支出目前处于历史最高水平，这十分有利于未来生产率增长。

As the accelerator theory of investment would predict, much R&D investment is occurring in technology-intensive sectors where current and future expected demand has been strong. => 投资的加速器理论认为，大量研发投资发生在当前和未来预期需求强势的技术密集型部门。
There is also evidence that the distribution of returns to capital is becoming increasingly skewed toward these sectors. => 也有证据表明，资本回报的分布越来越向这些部门倾斜。

Among US nonfinancial corporations, the proportion of investable funds used for dividends and share buybacks has been trending upward, albeit with cyclical ups and downs, since the 1980s. => 在美国非金融公司中，20世纪80年代以来用于股利和股票回购的可投资资金比例呈现增加之势（尽管存在起伏 ） 。

After a sharp downturn during the 2008-2009 recession, this proportion has now recovered to nearly 50%, a high point relative to historical averages. => 2008—2009年衰退期间这一比例大幅下井，但如今又恢复到50%左右，从历史平均值看相当高。

In a recent McKinsey survey of 1,000 top executives and corporate directors, 63% reported that shareholder pressure to realize short-term returns has increased over the last several years. => 最近，麦肯锡调查了1,000名高管和公司董事，其中63%表示过去几年中股东对实现短期回报的压力有所增加。
Indeed, some 79% reported pressure to demonstrate strong financial returns in two years or less. => 事实上，79%的受访者表示承受着在两年或以内实现大量财务回报的压力。

Shareholder pressure tends to be greater in older firms, and in the US over the last few decades, the proportion of older firms has been growing as the startup rate for new businesses has fallen. => 股东压力对于老牌企业往往更大，在过去几十年中，美国老牌企业占比因为企业创业率的下降而有所上升。

A sliding capital gains tax, with rates that decline as the holding period for investments increases, would reduce incentives for short-termism among investors. => 递减的资本利得税 — — 即税率随投资持有期的增加而降低 — — 能遏制投资者短期化的激励。
Among others, Larry Fink, the Center for American Progress, and Hillary Clinton propose this approach. => 拉里·芬克、美国进步中心（Center for American Progress）和希拉里·克林顿都建议采取这一方针。
These frameworks, Fink notes, should cover environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors that are core determinants of long-term value. => 芬克指出，这些框架应该覆盖环境、社会和治理（ESG）因素，它们是长期价值的核心决定因素。

Companies can use the new evidence-based standards developed by the Sustainability Accounting Standards Board to disclose material information about their ESG performance to their investors. => 公司可以使用可持续性会计准则委员会（Sustainability Accounting Standards Board）所开发的新的基于证据的标准向投资者披露关于ESG表现的实质信息。

Strategic frameworks, along with ESG disclosure, should encourage both companies and their shareholders to focus more on long-term value and less on short-term financial performance. => 战略框架配合ESG披露能够鼓励公司及其股东更加关注长期价值而不是短期财务表现。
But at the macro level, expected growth in demand and associated innovation opportunities will remain the primary drivers of business investment. => 但在宏观层面，需求及相应创新机会的预期增长将仍然是商业投资的主要推动力。
Inequality and the American Child => 不平等性与美国儿童
NEW YORK – Children, it has long been recognized, are a special group. => 纽约—我们早就知道，儿童是一个特殊群体。
They do not choose their parents, let alone the broader conditions into which they are born. => 他们无法选择父母，更不用说更广义的出生环境了。
They do not have the same abilities as adults to protect or care for themselves. => 他们没有如同成人那样的保护或照看自己的能力。

That is why the League of Nations approved the Geneva Declaration on the Rights of the Child in 1924, and why the international community adopted the Convention on the Rights of the Child in 1989. => 因此，国际联盟在1924年通过了日内瓦儿童权利宣言，国际社会也在1989年实施了儿童权利公约。
Sadly, the United States is not living up to its obligations. => 悲哀的是，美国没有在履行义务。
In fact, it has not even ratified the Convention on the Rights of the Child. => 事实上，它甚至没有批准儿童权利公约。
The US, with its cherished image as a land of opportunity, should be an inspiring example of just and enlightened treatment of children. => 美国向来以机会之地的形象自豪，它本应该成为公正、开明地对待儿童的榜样。
Instead, it is a beacon of failure – one that contributes to global sluggishness on children’s rights in the international arena. => 相反，它却成了失败的象征 — — 为儿童权利在国际经济场上的全球颓势做出了“贡献 ” 。

Though an average American childhood may not be the worst in the world, the disparity between the country’s wealth and the condition of its children is unparalleled. => 普通美国儿童也许不是全世界境况最糟糕的，但美国财富和儿童条件之间的反差大到无与伦比。
About 14.5% of the American population as a whole is poor, but 19.9% of children – some 15 million individuals – live in poverty. => 大约14.5%的美国总人口属于穷人，但19.9%的儿童 — — 大概相当于1,500万人 — — 生活在贫困中。
Among developed countries, only Romania has a higher rate of child poverty. => 在发达国家中，只有罗马尼亚的儿童贫困率更高。
The US rate is two-thirds higher than that in the United Kingdom, and up to four times the rate in the Nordic countries. => 美国的儿童贫困率比英国高三分之二，比北欧国家高三倍。
For some groups, the situation is much worse: more than 38% of black children, and 30% of Hispanic children, are poor. => 某些群体的状况更是恶劣得多：38%的黑人儿童和30%的西班牙裔儿童是穷人。
None of this is because Americans do not care about their children. => 所有这些都不是因为美国不在乎它的儿童。

It is because America has embraced a policy agenda in recent decades that has caused its economy to become wildly unequal, leaving the most vulnerable segments of society further and further behind. => 而是因为美国在近几十年中采取的政策日程导致其经济变得普遍不平等，让最脆弱的社会细分群体越来越落后。

The growing concentration of wealth – and a significant reduction in taxes on it – has meant less money to spend on investments for the public good, like education and the protection of children. => ��富的日益集中 — — 以及财富税收的大幅减少 — — 意味着花在教育和儿童保护等公共品投资上的支出越来越少了。
As a result, America’s children have become worse off. => 结果，美国儿童的境况每况愈下。

Income inequality is correlated with inequalities in health, access to education, and exposure to environmental hazards, all of which burden children more than other segments of the population. => 收入不平等与健康不平等、教育不平等和环境危险不平等都具有相关性，而所有这些对儿童的影响比其他人群更大。
Indeed, nearly one in five poor American children are diagnosed with asthma, a rate 60% higher than non-poor children. => 事实上，近五分之一的美国贫穷儿童被诊断出哮喘，比非贫穷儿童高出60 % 。

Learning disabilities occur almost twice as frequently among children in households earning less than $35,000 a year than they do in households earning more than $100,000. => 年收入低于35,000美元家庭的儿童学习无能比例比年收入高于100,000美元家庭的儿童高出近一倍。

And some in the US Congress want to cut food stamps – on which some 23 million American households depend, threatening the poorest children with hunger. => 一些美国国会议员还想削减食品券 — — 大约2,300万美国家庭需要仰仗食品券 — — 这将令去贫穷儿童面临挨饿的危险。
These inequalities in outcomes are closely tied to inequalities in opportunities. => 这些结果上的不平等与机会不平等息息相关。

At America’s most elite universities, for example, only around 9% of students come from the bottom half of the population, while 74% come from the top quarter. => 比如，在美国的精英大学，只有9%左右的学生来自底层二分之一人口，74%来自最高层四分之一人口。
Most societies recognize a moral obligation to help ensure that young people can live up to their potential. => 大部分社会都认为帮助确保年轻人能实现潜力所允许的生活水平是一种道德义务。
Some countries even impose a constitutional mandate for equality of educational opportunities. => 一些国家甚至从宪法上规定教育机会必须平等。
But in America, more is spent on the education of rich students than on the education of the poor. => 但在美国，富学生的教育支出要高于穷学生。
As a result, the US is wasting some of its most valuable assets, with some young people – bereft of skills – turning to dysfunctional activities. => 结果，美国正在浪费其最宝贵的资产之一。 一些年轻人无法获得技能，只能从事非正常活动。
American states like California spend about as much on prisons as on higher education – and sometimes more. => 加利福尼亚等州的监狱支出与高等教育支出相当，有时还要更高。
That should be a spur to policy action. => 这应该成为对政策行动的鞭策。
Indeed, while inequality’s harmful effects are wide-reaching, and impose huge costs on our economies and societies, they are largely avoidable. => 事实上，尽管不平等性的伤害效应很广，并且给我们的经济与社会造成了巨大成本，但它们大多是可以避免的。
The extremes of inequality observed in some countries are not the inexorable result of economic forces and laws. => 一些国家所观察到的极端不平等不是经济力量和定律的无情结果。

The right policies – stronger social safety nets, progressive taxation, and better regulation (especially of the financial sector), to name a few – can reverse these devastating trends. => 正确的政策 — — 强化社会安全网、累进税制和更好的监管（特别是对金融部门 ） ， 等等 — — 可以扭转这些消极趋势。

To generate the political will that such reforms require, we must confront policymakers’ inertia and inaction with the grim facts of inequality and its devastating effects on our children. => 要形成这些改革所需要的政治意愿，我们必须将决策者的惰性和不作为与不平等性的严峻现实及其对儿童造成的消极影响对立起来。

We can reduce childhood deprivation and increase equality of opportunity, thereby laying the groundwork for a more just and prosperous future – one that reflects our own avowed values. => 我们能够减轻儿童权利的剥夺、增加机会平等，从而为更公正、更繁荣的未来 — — 反映我们所公开追求的价值的未来 — — 打下基础。
So why don’t we? => 为什么我们还不行动呢？
Of the harm that inequality inflicts on our economies, politics, and societies, the damage done to children demands special concern. => 不平等性给我们的经济、政治与社会造成诸多伤害，其中对儿童的伤害需要特别关注。

Children, perhaps more than anyone, need the protection that rights afford – and the US should be providing the world with a shining example of what that means. => 也许儿童比其他任何人都更需要权利赋予的保护 — — 而美国应该为前世界树立此中含义的榜样。
American Conservatism’s Crisis of Ideas => 美国保守主义的思想危机

BERKELEY – On the back left corner of my desk right now are three recent books: Arthur Brooks’ The Battle, Charles Murray’s Coming Apart, and Nicholas Eberstadt’s A Nation of Takers. => 伯克利—现在，在我书桌的左后角摆着三部新书：布鲁克斯（Arthur Brooks）的《战争 》 （ The Battle ） 、 穆雷（Charles Murray）的《崩溃 》 （ Coming Apart）和埃伯斯塔特（Nicholas Eberstadt）的《匪之国 》 （ A Nation of Takers ） 。
But let’s back up historically, to the founding of what we might call modern conservatism in early nineteenth-century Britain and France. => 但让我们回顾历史，看看我们所谓的现代保守主义是如何在19世纪初的英国和法国起源的。

But they were balanced by those like Nassau Senior, who spoke out against even famine relief: Although a million people would die in the Irish Potato Famine, “that would scarcely be enough.” => 但他们的观点被西尼尔（Nassau Senior）反对，他认为就连食品救济都不应该有：尽管数百万人因爱尔兰土豆饥荒丧命，但“这远远不够。 ”

The main thrust of early conservatism was root-and-branch opposition to every form of social insurance: make the poor richer, and they would become more fertile. => 早期保守主义的主要卖点是彻底反对任何形式的社会保险：让穷人变富，他们就会生更多孩子。

As a result, farm sizes would drop (as land was divided among ever more children), labor productivity would fall, and the poor would become even poorer. => 结果，农场规模会下降（因为土地得分给越来越多的子女 ） ， 劳动生产率会下降，而穷人会变得更穷。
Social insurance was not just pointless; it was counterproductive. => 社会保险不但毫无意义；简直就是大逆不道。

Then, perhaps, with women chaste for half or more of their childbearing years, the surplus population would diminish and conditions for the poor would be as good as they could be. => 接着，只要女人在一半或以上的育龄时期严守贞洁，新增人口就会减少，穷人所处的环境就能尽可能地改善。

The government, Milton Friedman and others argued, told the poor: make more money and we will take away your free housing, food stamps, and income support. => 弗里德曼和其他人指出，政府告诉穷人：赚多点钱，我们将剥夺你的免费房子、食品券和收入支持。
People are rational, Friedman said, so they will not work for long if they get nothing or next to nothing for it. => 人是理性的，弗里德曼说，因此如果没有好处或好处不多，他们是不会长时间工作的。
So what is the problem that America’s new generation of conservative critics of social insurance sees? => 那么，美国新一代社会保险的保守主义批判家看到了什么问题？
For Eberstadt, the problem is that dependence on government is emasculating, and that too many people are dependent on government. => 在埃伯斯塔特看来，问题在于对政府的依赖在让人民变弱，太多的人仰仗政府过活。
For Brooks, it is that knowing that public programs make one’s life easier causes one to vote for non-Republican candidates. => 在布鲁克斯看来，问题在于知道公共项目让生活变得更加容易导致民众把选票投给非共和党候选人。

For Murray, it is that social insurance means that behaving badly does not lead to catastrophe – and we need bad behavior to lead to catastrophe in order to keep people from behaving badly. => 在穆雷看来，问题在于社会保险意味着做得不好不会导致崩溃 — — 我们需要导致崩溃的坏行为，这样才能让人们不再做出坏行为。
The crucial point is that America’s conservative elites believe Brooks, Eberstadt, and Murray. => 关键点在于，美国保守主义精英相信布鲁克斯、埃伯斯塔特和穆雷。
He could “never convince them that they should take personal responsibility and care for their lives.” => 他绝不会“让他们认为他们应该承担个人责任，看好自己的生活。 ”

The problem for American conservatives is not their choice of candidates or the tone of their rhetoric. It is that their ideas are not politically sustainable. => 美国保守主义者的问题不在于候选人的选择或是说辞的语调，而在于他们的想法不具有政治可持续性。
An Unhinged Democracy in America => 精神错乱的美国民主
But de Tocqueville had serious reservations, too. => 但托克维尔也有严重保留。

The biggest danger to US democracy, he believed, was the tyranny of the majority, the suffocating intellectual conformity of American life, the stifling of minority opinion and dissent. => 他认为，美国民主的最大危险是多数人的暴政，美国式生活中令人窒息的思想顺从，令人压抑的少数派观点和异见。
He was convinced that any exercise of unlimited power, be it by an individual despot or a political majority, is bound to end in disaster. => 他相信，任何无限权力，不管是个人暴君还是政治多数，都注定要在一地狼藉中结束。
Democracy, in the sense of majority rule, needs restraints, just like any other system of government. => 从多数规则的角度讲，民主需要约束，一如其他所有制度的政府。
That is why the British have mixed the authority of elected politicians with that of aristocratic privilege. => 因此，英国混合了当选政客的权力和君主特权。
And it is why Americans still cherish their Constitution’s separation of governmental powers. => 同样因此，美国人至今仍珍视宪法对政府权力的分割。
By contrast, in the French republican system, the state represents the so-called will of the people. => 相反，在法国共和制度中，国家代表所谓的人民的意志。
As a result, its authority is less constrained, which may explain the greater frequency in France of street demonstrations and even of mob violence. => 结果，它的权威约束较小，这也许解释了法国街头示威乃至群众暴力更为频繁。
Indeed, these upheavals may act as informal checks on official power. => 事实上，这些剧变是对正式权力的非正式制衡。
De Tocqueville identified another source of restraint in the US system: the power of religion. => 托克维尔还指出了美国制度的另一个约束来源：宗教的力量。
Human greed, as well as the temptation of going to extremes, was tempered by the moderating influence of a shared Christian faith. => 人类的贪婪，以及走极端的诱惑，被共同的基督教信仰的影响所中和。
Liberty, in the US, was inextricably entwined with religious belief. => 在美国，自由与宗教信仰密不可分。
The spectacle of American politics today would seem to cast doubt on de Tocqueville’s observation. => 今天的美国政坛景象似乎让人们质疑托克维尔的观察。
Or, rather, the rhetoric of many Republicans aspiring to be President sounds like a perversion of what he saw in 1831. => 或者说，许多志在总统之位的共和党人的言论与托克维尔在1831年的所见所闻南辕北辙。
Religion and liberty are still mentioned in one breath, but often to promote extreme views. => 宗教和自由仍然时时挂在嘴边，但常常是用来推动极端观点。
Religious minorities are denounced. => 宗教少数群体遭到压迫。
Apocalyptic fears are stoked. => 天启恐惧兴起。
Intolerance is promoted. => 党同伐异被煽动。
All in the name of God. => 所有这些打着上帝的名义。
Of course, the US is not the only country where fringe demagogues are now poisoning mainstream politics. => 当然，美国并不是唯一的边缘煽动着正在毒害主流政治的国家。
Religious language is less often heard in Western Europe, but all the more in parts of Eastern Europe, Turkey, and Israel. => 在西欧，宗教语言比以前更少听到了，但在东欧、土耳其和以色列的一些地方，情况正好相反。
Populism is causing considerable alarm, not least because mainstream politicians seem less and less capable of finding a convincing way to stop its rise. => 民粹主义正在敲响警钟，因为主流政客越来越难以找到令人信服的方式阻止它的崛起。
Those who are rightly worried about the politics of fear like to assume that populism is a threat to democracy itself. => 正确地担心恐惧政治的人喜欢假设民粹主义是民主本身的威胁。

Distrust of the elites fosters distrust of the system, and the longing for great leaders who will deliver us from the selfishness of professional politicians will lead to new forms of tyranny. => 不信任精英导致不信任制度，而期盼伟大领袖让我们摆脱职业政客的自私将导致新形式的暴政。
That may turn out to be true. => 这也许是真的。
But, in fact, it is not really democracy that is presently under siege. => 但是，事实上，陷入重围的其实并不是民主。
In some ways, many societies are more democratic than they were before. => 从某种角度讲，许多社会比从简更加民主了。
If nothing else, the Donald Trump phenomenon shows that old party establishments can be skirted by popular outsiders. => 唐纳德·特朗普现象所表现的正是旧政党格局可以被当红外部人士颠覆。

Social media also make it possible to bypass the traditional filters of authority, such as serious newspapers or broadcasters, and publish any point of view directly. => 社交媒体也让绕过传统权威滤网（如严肃的报刊或杂志）成为可能，直接发布任何观点。
The power of private fortunes to sway public opinion, especially in the US, also upsets the traditional order. => 私人财富左右公共观点的力量也在干扰传统秩序，特别是在美国。
Anti-elitism can be fanned by vast individual wealth, because elitism is defined less by financial clout than by education. => 反精英主义可以通过巨大的个人财富煽动，因为精英主义更大程度上由教育而非财力定义。

Angry people swayed by the populist message are angrier at liberal professors, clever bankers, or skeptical journalists than they are at multi-billionaires. => 被民粹主义信念激怒的人民对自由派教授、聪明的银行家或怀疑派记者的愤怒要大于他们对亿万富翁的愤怒。

(It is both President Barack Obama’s elite education and the color of his skin – or, rather, the combination of the two – that has attracted so much rage.) => （总统奥巴马的精英教育和他的肤色 — — 或者说，是两者的结合 — — 给她带来了如此多的愤怒。 ）
At the same time, people have more power to elect power-hungry crooks than they did before. => 与此同时，人民比以前有了更大的力量选举渴望权力的恶棍。

More and more, populist leaders regard their election by the majority of voters as a license to crush all political and cultural dissent. => 民粹主义领导人越来越把多数人选择了他们作为碾压一切政治和文化异见的通行证。
De Tocqueville’s nightmare is not yet the reality in the US, but it is close to what we see in Russia, Turkey, Hungary, and perhaps Poland. => 托克维尔的噩梦还没有在美国的现实中出现，但俄罗斯、土耳其、匈牙利（也许还有波兰）的情况已经与此不远。

Without editors, there can be no serious journalism. => 没有编辑，就不会有严肃的新闻。

Without limits placed on the appetites and prejudices of the majority, intolerance will rule. => 不对大多数人的偏好和偏见加以限制，就会让党同伐异成为规则。
This is not a question of nostalgia or snobbery. => 这不是怀旧或势利。

Anger at the elites is not always unjust. => 对精英的愤怒并非总是不公平的。

Globalization, immigration, and cosmopolitanism have served the interests of a highly educated minority, but sometimes at the expense of less privileged people. => 全球化、移民和世界主义符合受到良好教育的少数群体的利益，但有时会牺牲没有特权的人的利益。

Liberal democracy cannot be reduced to a popularity contest. => 自由民主决不能退化为民粹主义竞争。
Constraints on majority rule are necessary to protect the rights of minorities, be they ethnic, religious, or intellectual. => 对多数人统治的约束是保护少数群体的必要条件，不管是种族少数群体、宗教少数群体还是知识少数群体。
When that protection disappears, we will all end up losing the freedoms that democracy was supposed to defend. => 当这一保护消失时，我们最终将失去作为民主应有之义的自由。
The Indispensable American Partner => 不可或缺的美国伙伴
MADRID – The United States is gearing up for that most intoxicating (and exhausting) of political events: an open-seat race for the presidency. => 马德里—美国正在为最令人兴奋（也最令人疲惫）的政治事件做准备：总统席位的开放竞争。

But the payoff, for both the US and the liberal world order that it created, would be substantial. => 但不管对美国还是对其所创造的自由世界秩序来说，这样做的好处是无穷的。

In doing so, he planted the seed of the values-based approach that was adopted by the US as it spearheaded the development of the rules and structures that order today's world. => 就这样，他种下了基于价值的方针的种子，美国根据这一方针领导制定了决定当今世界秩序的规则与结构。

But, ironically, the notion of American exceptionalism often has led the US to undermine the international system that it nurtured. => 但是，讽刺的是，美国例外论常常导致美国破坏它所培养的国际体系。
Indeed, US history reveals a persistent isolationist streak, in which the “city upon a hill" is not a beacon, but a fortress. => 事实上，美国历史一直有一种孤立主义倾向 ， “ 山巅之城”好像不是一座灯塔，而是一座堡垒。
At times, including over the last six years, the belief that the US is better off going it alone has led to withdrawal from the world. => 一次又一次（包括在过去六年中 ） ， 美国最好还是只顾自己的观念导致其从世界舞台中退出。
This tendency was not a serious issue before World War II (though the people of Abyssinia and Manchuria may beg to differ). => 这一趋势在二战前并不是什么严重的问题（尽管阿比西尼亚和满洲人会提出异议 ） 。

But today, US withdrawal from the international system that it built has serious ramifications – namely, the kind of chaos and lawlessness exemplified by Russia's invasion of Ukraine. => 但如今，美国从其所构建的国际体系中退出将造成严重后果 — — 即各种混乱和无法，俄罗斯入侵乌克兰就是明证。
Yet isolationism is not America's most destructive impulse. => 但孤立主义不是美国危害最大的举动。

Worse is its “exemptionalism": its penchant for opting out of the rules that it promotes – and often actively enforces – elsewhere. => 更糟糕的是其“豁免论 ” （ exemptionalism ） ： 置身其在其他地区所推行 — — 并且常常积极执行 — — 的规则之外。
But, though such arrangements make for great headlines, they do not provide the stability and predictability necessary for long-term success. => 但是，尽管这样的安排吸引了大量目光，但并没有提供长期成功所需要的稳定性和可预测性。

If the US is to serve as the world's “indispensable partner," it must recommit to the rules-based order that has served it – and the world – so well for the last seven decades. => 如果美国要成为世界“不可或缺的伙伴 ” ， 它就必须重新致力于在过去七十年给它 — — 以及全世界 — — 带来无穷好处的基于规则的秩序。
It should begin by strengthening the flagging institutions that have served as the backbone of the liberal international order. => 首先，美国应该强化作为自由国际秩序基石的核心机构。
Indispensable partnership is about helping countries help themselves. => 不可或缺的伙伴意味着帮助各国帮助自己。
It requires vision, commitment, and, most important, leadership. => 这要求远见卓识、承诺以及（最重要的）领导力。

A frank discussion about America's foreign policy could prove vital to ensuring that this “city upon a hill" remains a beacon of hope – and a catalyst of progress. => 开诚布公地讨论美国外交政策将是确保这个“山巅之城”仍是希望灯塔 — — 以及进步催化剂的关键。
American Foreign Policy after Iraq => 伊拉克之后的美国对外政策
What comes after Iraq? => 伊拉克之后又会是什么？

If President George W. Bush’s current troop “surge” fails to produce an outcome that can be called “victory,” what lessons will the United States draw for its future foreign policy? => 如果布什总统的部队“急流”不能交出一份可以称作“胜利”的答卷，那么美国可以从中为其未来的对外政策吸取什么样的教训呢？
Will it turn inward, as it did after its defeat in Vietnam three decades ago? => 它会转为内向，正如30年前兵败越南之后那样么？
Will it turn from promoting democracy to a narrow realist view of its interests? => 它会从推动民主转向为一种对自身利益的狭隘现实主义观吗？
Even while discussion in Washington is fixated on Iraq, a number of thoughtful foreign observers are asking these longer-term questions. => 即便在华盛顿的讨论仍聚焦伊拉克的情况下，一些有思想的外交观察家已经开始提出这些长期性的问题了。
Analysts and pundits have often been mistaken about America’s position in the world. => 分析家和专家们对美国在世界上的地位往往有错误的认识。
For example, two decades ago, the conventional wisdom was that the US was in decline. => 例如，20年前，一般的公众观点认为美国正在衰落。
A decade later, with the Cold War’s end, the new conventional wisdom was that the world was a unipolar American hegemony. => 10年后，随着冷战结束，新的公众观点又认为世界上只有美国一个超级霸权。

Some neo-conservative pundits drew the conclusion that the US was so powerful that it could decide what it thought was right, and others would have to follow. => 一些新保守派专家认定美国是如此强大，以至于它可以按自己的意志决策，而其它国家不得不遵从。

Charles Krauthammer celebrated this view as “the new unilateralism,” and it heavily influenced the Bush administration even before the attacks on September 11, 2001. => Charles Krauthammer高调地将这种观点称为“新单边主义 ” 。 它甚至在2001年“9.11”袭击发生之前都一直对布什政府产生着重要的影响。
But the new unilateralism was based on a profound misunderstanding of the nature of power in world politics. => 但新单边主义是基于对世界政治实力特点的深刻误解。
Power is the ability to get the outcomes one wants. => 实力是取得需要的结果的能力。
Whether the possession of resources will produce such outcomes depends upon the context. => 通过所拥有的资源能否获得这样的结果还依赖于环境。

For example, a large, modern tank army is a powerful resource if a war is fought in a desert, but not if it is fought in a swamp – as America discovered in Vietnam. => 例如，如果战争在沙漠中进行，那么一支庞大的现代化坦克部队就是一种强大的资源。 但如果战事在沼泽地区进行则不然—正如美国在越南所发现的那样。
In the past, it was assumed that military power dominated most issues, but in today’s world, the contexts of power differ greatly. => 过去，人们一般认为军事实力主导着绝大多数问题，但在当今的世界，实力的大环境千差万别。
I have likened the distribution of power in politics today as analogous to a three-dimensional chess game. => 我把当今政治实力的分配比作一盘三维国际象棋。
On the top board – military relations among states – the world is, indeed, unipolar, and likely to remain that way for decades. => 在上盘—国家之间的军事关系中—世界确实是单极化的，而且这种情况很可能还要持续几十年。

But on the middle board of economic relations, the world is already multipolar, and the US cannot obtain the outcomes it wants without the cooperation of Europe, Japan, China, and others. => 但在中盘的经济关系方面，世界已经是多极化了，而美国也不可能不通过与欧洲、日本、中国和其它国家合作就获得自己需要的结果。
Yet it is on this bottom board that we find most of the greatest challenges we face today. => 然而正是在下盘让我们发现了当今面对的最大挑战。

The new unilateralists who dominated Bush’s first administration made the mistake of thinking that the unipolar distribution of power in the military context was sufficient to guide foreign policy. => 主导布什第一届政府的新单边主义者们错误地认为在军事环境中的实力单极化分配足以引导对外政策。
They were like a young boy with a hammer who thinks that every problem resembles a nail. => 他们就像一个手拿锤子的小孩，认为所有的问题都像钉子一样。
The danger of their approach is now obvious. => 他们这种思维方式的危险性在当下就显而易见了。
Whoever plays a three-dimensional game by focusing on only one board is bound to lose in the long run. => 任何人在玩三维国际象棋游戏时，只注重某一个盘，那么从长期来看他是注定要失败的。
Fortunately, the pendulum has begun to swing back toward cooperation. => 幸运的是，这个钟摆现在又开始滑向合作。
