Likewise, for all the complaints about the United Nations, the US and others turned to UN peacekeepers to sort out the mess after the Lebanon War last summer. => 同样，针对关于联合国的所有抱怨，美国和其它国家都通过联合国维和部队来收拾去年夏天黎巴嫩战争留下的烂摊子。
The Iraq War, in particular, increased public awareness of the mistakes in Bush’s first term, but other issues are changing as well. => 伊拉克战争尤其加深了公众对布什在第一任期所犯错误的认识，但其它情况也在变化中。
Americans now view cooperative action on global climate change more favorably. => 美国人现在开始以更赞许的态度来看待全球气候变化方面的合作行动。
The nature of these problems means that the US does not have the luxury of turning inward no matter what the outcome in Iraq. => 这些问题的特点意味着不论伊拉克问题的结果如何，美国都没有重新回归内向政策的奢侈了。
These are not problems you can leave overseas. => 这不是些你能留在海外的问题。
They follow you home. => 它们会如影随形般的跟你回到国内。
It also is unlikely that American foreign policy will return to a narrow realism and drop all emphasis on democracy and human rights. => 美国的对外政策也不大可能回到狭隘的现实主义，而不再强调民主和人权。

While the Iraq War discredited the idea of coercive democratization, both Republicans and Democrats have a strong strand of idealism in their foreign policy orientations. => 尽管伊拉克战争令强制民主化的理念声名狼藉，共和党和民主党人在他们的对外政策取向中仍保持着强烈的理想主义色彩。

The problem for whoever is elected president in 2008 will be to find appropriate realistic means to advance democratic values and adjust official rhetoric accordingly. => 在2008年获选总统的任何人所面临的问题都将是寻求推进民主价值观的适当的现实主义途径并对官方论调做出相应调整。
When rhetoric greatly outstrips reality, others view it as hypocrisy. => 当官方论调凌驾于现实之上时，别人就会认为这是种虚伪。
Americans will need to find ways to assert their narrative of democracy, freedom, and rights in a manner that respects diversity and the views of others. => 美国人需要找到一种尊重多样性和他人观点的方式来宣扬他们对民主、自由和权利的坚持。
What Iraq has taught is the importance of developing civil society and the rule of law before trying to hold broad-based elections. => 伊拉克给我们提供的教训是在试图举行广泛的选举之前先发展公民社会和健全法制的重要性。
Democracy is more than voting, for it requires large investments in education, institutions, and promotion of non-governmental organizations. => 民主不仅仅是选举，因为它还需要在教育、制度和推动非政府组织发展方面进行大量的投入。
It must be rooted in the indigenous society and bear its characteristics, not be imposed from abroad. => 它必须是植根于本地社会并承袭其特点，而不是被强加的舶来品。
It is highly unlikely that the US will react after Iraq as it did after Vietnam. => 美国在伊拉克战争之后做出类似越战后的反应的可能性微乎其微。
The paradox of American power is that the world’s only military superpower cannot protect its citizens by acting alone. => 美国实力的悖论在于：这个世界唯一的军事超级大国靠单打独斗无法保护其公民。
US Foreign Policy After the Midterm Election => 中期选举之后的美国外交政策
WASHINGTON, DC – One thing missing from the recent US midterm election campaigns was a focus on foreign policy. => 发自华盛顿特区 — — 最近各类美国中期选举拉票活动都遗漏了一点 — — 外交政策。
With the Democratic Party having regained control of the US House of Representatives, that will change. => 而随着民主党重新控制美国众议院，这一情况将发生改变。

A cornered President Donald Trump is likely to turn to a favorite tactic of autocrats everywhere: manufacturing foreign-policy crises to distract the public’s attention from problems at home. => 走投无路的美国总统特朗普可能会转而使用世界各地独裁者都最喜欢的策略：制造外交政策危机以分散公众对本土问题的注意力。

Trump may also decide to use Congress as a foreign-policy foil, tossing international challenges back into the lap of lawmakers, who will be hard-pressed to come up with good answers. => 特朗普也可能决定将国会用作外交政策挡箭牌，将国际挑战甩回到立法者手里从而把寻求良好应对措施的压力转移到他们肩上。

After all, in Trump’s zero-sum “I win, you lose” view of the world, congressional failures that he can blame on the Democrats are almost as good as White House successes. => 毕竟在特朗普“我赢你输”的零和式世界观中，可以赖到民主党身上的国会败局几乎和白宫的成功一样美好。
With the US House of Representatives under “new management,” including a record number of Democratic women, Trump has a tempting target. => 随着美国众议院被置于“新管理层”之下（包括创纪录的民主党女议员人数 ） ， 特朗普有了一个诱人的目标。
He has every incentive to show the newcomers up by passing the ball and watching them fail. => 他有足够的动力去让那些新来者难堪，只要把事情丢给他们并坐观其败就行了。
In this new contest to pass the blame, Syria is ripe for the picking. => 在这新一轮的推卸责任竞赛中，叙利亚问题正好可以拿来使用。

Eliot Engel, the incoming chairman of the House Foreign Affairs Committee, has already said that the Democrats may seek congressional authorization for the use of military force in Syria. => 即将就任众议院外交事务委员会主席的艾略特·恩格尔（Eliot Engel）已经表示民主党可能会寻求国会授权在叙利亚使用武力。

Any move the Democrats make will be unpopular with their own voters and will simply shift attention from Trump’s inability to solve the problem to their own lack of a plan. => 民主党做出的任何举动都不会受到选民的欢迎，只会将特朗普无法解决问题的注意力转移到他们自身计划的缺失之上。
Iran presents Trump with another opportunity to inflict political damage on the Democrats. => 而伊朗则为特朗普提供了另一个政治上打击民主党人的机会。
Specifically, he wanted the ability to reimpose sanctions on Iran, which he did earlier this month. => 具体而言，他希望重新获得伊制裁的能力，正如他本月早些时候所做的那样。
Sanctions, Trump has long maintained, would force Iran to negotiate. That has not happened and is unlikely to happen. => 特朗普一直以来都坚称制裁将迫使伊朗进行谈判，但这种情况从发生也不太可能发生。

To push Iran toward the negotiating table, and, more importantly, assert his authority and save face, Trump might be tempted to heighten tensions, if not provoke Iran into a confrontation. => 为了推动伊朗走向谈判桌，更重要的是维护自身权威并挽回面子，特朗普可能会试图加剧紧张局势，只要不会激发伊朗的对抗。
And here, Engel might be forced to play along. => 到那时候恩格尔可能会被迫入局。
Engel has said that Iran is the “most dangerous player” in the Middle East, and he was a vocal opponent of the JCPOA. => 恩格尔曾表示伊朗是中东地区“最危险的参与者 ” ， 他本人也是伊朗核协议的反对者。

But the payoff is likely to be a foreign-policy crisis that produces no meaningful progress toward a new nuclear deal and plenty of blame to go around. => 但这最终可能会导向一场外交政策危机，不但在新的核协议上没有取得任何有意义的进展，还会留下诸多口实供各方互相指责。
The Democrats also provide Trump an out on North Korea. => 民主党人也在朝鲜问题向特朗普露出了破绽。
Engel has already said he will call a hearing on the talks. => 恩格尔已经表示他将针对相关谈判召集一场听证会。

Whatever is said in that hearing could provide North Korean leader Kim Jong-un with a ready excuse to renege on his already-vague denuclearization agreement with Trump. => 但听证会上发表的任何言论都可以为朝鲜领导人金正恩提供一个借口去违反与特朗普那本就含糊不清的无核化协议。
The US president, Kim could argue, can no longer be trusted with a hostile Congress at his back. => 金正恩可以辩解说一个不能得到背后敌对国会支持的美国总统是不值得信任的。
Trump has already called for an increase in defense spending and the launch of a “space force”. => 特朗普已经呼吁要增加国防开支并启动“太空力量”的建立。
But Democrats should resist the urge to try correcting Trump’s perceived wrongs. => 但民主党人应该抵制试图纠正特朗普错误的冲动。
The House has just enough power to get into foreign-policy trouble and not enough to get out of it or to adopt and implement a coherent strategy. => 众议院只是刚好有力量去介入外交政策的乱局，但还没有足够力量去摆脱它或采取和实施一套连续性的战略。
The Democrats’ best bet is to let Trump take the lead on global affairs, however unsavory, and actively work to check and balance his actions. => 民主党最好的选择是让特朗普在全球事务中起带头作用，无论多么令人讨厌，并积极努力去制衡他的行为。
Oversight and the power of the purse will be their most powerful tools. => 监督和财权将是他们最强大的工具。
In the end, Trump will need House Democrats for money, sanctions, or approval of trade agreements. => 最终特朗普还是需要争取众议院民主党人以获取拨款，制裁或批准贸易协议。
If they play their cards right, he will have to deal them in. If they don’t, they will find that Trump still holds a much stronger hand. => 如果他们能行使正确的策略，他将不得不跟他们妥协；但如果他们没做到这一点，他们会发现特朗普仍然具备强大的实力。
American Foreign Policy After the Mid-Term Elections => 中期选举之后的美国外交政策
NEW YORK – Few Americans cast their ballot in the recent mid-term elections on the basis of foreign policy. => 发自纽约 — — 在本次中期选举中，只有为数不多的美国人是基于外交政策的原因而投票的。
While it may be difficult for people around the world to comprehend this, given the global reach of the United States, it is an undeniable fact. => 鉴于美国的全球影响力，世界其他地方的人们可能难以理解这一点，但这却是一个合理的事实。
Most Americans are, after all, preoccupied with the US economy’s sluggish growth and persistent high unemployment. => 毕竟绝大多数美国人都将精力放在了国内的增长停滞和长期高失业率之上。
The world’s challenges seem far removed from their day-to-day lives. => 而那些全球危机似乎离他们的日常生活太遥远了。
The Cold War ended a generation ago; the terror attacks of September 11, 2001, are nearly a decade in the past. => 冷战结束已经是上一代人的话题；9·11恐怖袭击也已经过去将近十年。
Most Americans do not feel the sacrifices associated with the large troop presence and ongoing conflicts in Afghanistan and Iraq. => 大多数美国人都对派驻阿富汗和伊拉克的庞大军队所付出的牺牲毫无知觉。
But the fact that foreign policy did not materially affect the November elections does not mean that the results will not affect US foreign policy. => 虽然外交政策并未对本次中期选举产生重大影响，但这却不意味着选举结果不会影响美国的外交政策。
They will, but in ways that are inconsistent and even surprising. => 影响是必然的，但会以一种反复无常甚至令人大吃一惊的方式。
One relationship sure to be influenced by Republican gains will be that between the US and Russia. => 共和党占优的形势必将影响到美俄关系。

Congress may also prove less willing to remove hurdles to Russia’s admission to the World Trade Organization, given what is widely judged to be its leaders’ anti-democratic behavior. => 众议院估计也不太会移除对俄罗斯加入世贸的诸多障碍，因为大家都对俄罗斯领导人的反民主行为感到反感。
China, too, will feel the results of the new balance in Congress. => 中国也会感觉到两党重新划分众议院势力的影响。

Pressure was already growing to introduce trade sanctions in response to China’s refusal to allow its currency to rise to a natural level against the dollar. => 事实上，已经有越来越多的压力要求对中国拒绝令其货币兑美元升值到一个合理水平的做法实施贸易制裁。
Such pressure will likely grow, given concerns over Chinese behavior both at home and abroad. => 这些压力将越来越大，因为大家对中国在其国内和国外的所做所为都有意见。
Moreover, Congress will resist rolling back any of the long-standing economic sanctions against Cuba. => 此外，中国将抵制美国取消对古巴的任何长期制裁。
There will be other consequences stemming from the election. => 选举还将带来其他一些后果。
What little chance there was of the US backing any global plan to limit or tax carbon emissions has disappeared. => 美国支持关于限制或者征收碳排放税的任何全球方案的微小可能性都已彻底破灭。
Improvement in US performance on climate change will have to come from innovation and increased energy efficiency. => 美国在这方面的改善只能依靠科技创新和提高能源利用效率了。

One can anticipate the Republicans, now in control of the House of Representatives, exploiting their ability to convene hearings to question and review foreign policy. => 人们可以预见到，目前控制了众议院���共和党人将利用手中的权力召开质疑或检讨当前外交政策的听证会。
In many other areas, continuity can be expected to trump change. => 而在其他许多领域，政策的持续性将不会有什么变化。
This comes as little surprise, as America’s Constitution and political system delegate most of the initiative on foreign policy and defense to the president. => 这毫不奇怪，因为美国的宪法和政治系统将大多数外交和国防事务交由总统承担。

One area of probable continuity is the Middle East, where Obama will continue to try to broker a deal between Israelis and Palestinians and press Iran not to develop nuclear weapons. => 其中一个能保留政策持续性的领域可能是中东，因为奥巴马将继续尝试促成以巴双方的和平条约，并迫使伊朗放弃发展核武器（共和党人一直都要求不要向以色列施加过多压力，而对伊朗采取更强硬手段 ） 。
Questions abound when it comes to foreign economic policy, however. => 但在经济外交政策方面则存在着许多问题。

Three completed trade agreements (with South Korea, Panama, and Colombia) have been languishing for years, mostly because of deep opposition to free trade from labor unions and the Democratic Party. => 三项全面贸易条约（与韩国，巴拿马和哥伦比亚）已经在工会和民主党的阻挠下拖延了几年时间。
Republicans have historically been more supportive of such bilateral free-trade agreements. => 而共和党一直以来对这类双边自由贸易条约都是表示支持的。
But will the new generation of Republicans continue this tradition? => 但新一代共和党人是否会坚持这一传统？
An even bigger question mark hovers over what might be the greatest national security concern of all: the federal budget deficit. => 而一个更重要的问题则是所谓最大的国家安全问题：联邦债务赤字。
Mounting debt also leaves the US vulnerable to the decisions of those who lend it money – or to the vagaries of the market. => 不断增加的债务将迫使美国向那些国际债主们俯首称臣，或是无法承受市场的突然波动。
A dollar crisis could weaken the foundations of American power. => 美元危机将影响到美国的全球权力基础。

But averting such a crisis requires that the White House and Congress, Democrats and Republicans, agree on a plan for moving the US budget toward balance. => 但克服这一危机则需要白宫和国会，以及民主党和共和党双方都能在促使美国实现财政平衡方面达成共识。
Alas, the election makes such agreement more distant than ever. => 无奈的是，中期选举却令这类共识离我们更加遥远了。
America’s Global Balancing Act => 美国的全球平衡行动
Is that true? => 真的如此吗？
In brief, the decisive axis of the new order increasingly involves the United States and the People’s Republic of China. => 简单说，决定新秩序的轴心已经日益明确 — — 美国和中华人民共和国。
America’s supposed “pivot to Asia” took a back seat in 2014 to the crises in Ukraine and the Middle East. => 2014年，美国的“重返亚洲”政策因为乌克兰和中东危机而变得不再显眼。
To what extent has uncertainty about the US commitment in Asia stoked tension between China and America’s Asian allies? => 美国的亚洲承诺的不确定性如何助长了中国和美国的亚洲盟国之间的紧张？
I disagree with the premises of the question. => 我不同意这个问题的前提。

I do think America has made it quite clear that it is in the interest both of America and China to avoid situations in which they will be pushed toward a collision. => 我确实认为美国非常清楚地表示，避免让中美双方陷入会把它们推向冲突的局面符合双方的利益。

The recent indications of some initial dialogue between China and India, and between China and Japan, suggest that China also realizes that escalating old grievances is not in its interest. => 最近的一些中印、中日之间初步对话的迹象表明，中国也认识到煽动旧仇恨不符合它的利益。
The more serious problem with the “pivot to Asia” was its actual wording, which implied a military posture designed to “contain” or “isolate” China. => “重返亚洲”所包含的更加严重的问题是它的实际用词，其中暗含要“遏制”或“孤立”中国的军事姿态。
Xi Jinping has used his war on corruption to concentrate more power in his hands than any Chinese leader since Deng Xiaoping, 30 years ago. => 习近平用其反腐斗争巩固更多的权力，这是30年前邓小平以来从未有过的。
How do you see Xi’s presidency evolving? => 你认为习近平的任期会如何发展？
Power in China is somewhat informally defined, and its limits are set more by political realities than by constitutional arrangements. => 从某种程度上讲，中国的权力界定不那么正式，其权力的边界更多地由政治现实而不是宪法安排决定。
That makes it difficult to say whether Xi’s power is greater than any Chinese leader’s since Deng. => 因此，很难说习近平的权力比邓小平以来的任何一位中国领导人更大。
He certainly has an authoritative personality and without doubt is more active on the international scene than some of his predecessors. => 他显然是一个拥有权威的人，并且毫无疑问比他的几位前任在国际舞台上更加活跃。

He has also been very decisive in attacking the growing corruption that has become a major source of internal malaise, reaching even the highest levels of government. => 在打击业已成为国内顽症、甚至已蔓延到政府最高成的日益猖獗的腐败方面，他也比几位前任更加果断。
The Party elite, quite understandably, does not find this reassuring. => 不难理解，中共精英对此感到十分不安。
Can Russian President Vladimir Putin’s regime withstand a prolonged period of low energy prices and Western sanctions? => 俄罗斯总统普京的政权能够抵挡长时期的低油价和西方制裁吗？
What risks do you see emerging should Russia’s economy continue to decline, with Putin increasingly unable to reward his political base? => 你认为如果俄罗斯经济继续衰退，普京在奖赏他的政治基础方面日益力不从心，会产生什么后果？

There is, of course, a danger that at some point Putin may choose to lash out and create a truly massive international crisis, and perhaps precipitate some new form of direct East-West warfare. => 当然，在某个点上普京也许会选择孤注一掷，制造真正的大规模国际危机，也许还会引爆新形式的东西方直接战争，这种危险是存在的。
The outcome of that would be inherently unpredictable, but probably in any case very destructive for Russian wellbeing. => 这一情况的结果具有内在不可预测性，但也许无论如何对俄罗斯人的福祉来说都是一场灾难。
But that depends in turn on the West’s firmness in supporting Ukraine’s efforts to stabilize itself. => 但这反过来取决于西方在支持乌克兰稳定自身方面有多坚定。

Following the withdrawal of US troops from Afghanistan and Iraq, much of the world now perceives the US as being in a period of “retreat,” similar to the post-Vietnam War era. => 美军撤出阿富汗和伊拉克后，世界上有许多人现在认为美国已经入“撤退”期，就像越战后时代那样。
Is the US embracing a form of neo-isolationism? => 美国正在采取某种形式的新孤立主义吗？
Or will America’s apparent inward turn be as brief as it was following Vietnam? => 还是说，美国显而易见的向内转和越战之后一样只是短暂现象？
I do not believe that the US is in a “period of retreat.” => 我不认为美国进入了“撤退期 ” 。
The fact of the matter is that the redistribution of global power has produced a situation in which the US is no longer the sole hegemon. => 重要的事实是全球实力的再分配产生了一个美国不再是唯一霸权的局面。
The US has to acknowledge the fact that the world is now much more complex. => 美国必须承认一个事实，即现在的世界比以前复杂得多。
The spread of conflict throughout the Middle East is currently precipitated more by the rise of religious sectarianism than by American interventionism. => 中东地区的冲突蔓延更多地是拜宗教门户之见崛起所赐，而不是因为美国的干涉。

In these volatile circumstances, greater attention must be given to the national interests of countries such as Turkey, Iran, Saudi Arabia, Egypt, and Israel. => 在这些暴力环境下，必须将更多注意力放在土耳其、伊朗、沙特阿拉伯、埃及和以色列等国家的国家利益上。
By the same token, the interests of any one of them must not be allowed to become the total interest of the US. => 同理，这些国家中的任何一国的利益决不能成为美国的总利益。
What may surprise the world most in 2015? => 2015年什么事情能给世界带来最大的意外？
Perhaps the gradual reappearance in Russia of a more politically assertive liberal middle class. => 也许是俄罗斯逐渐在再现政治上更积极的自由中产阶级。
That middle class was beginning to play a more significant role in shaping domestic and international Russian policy under Dmitri Medvedev. => 在梅德韦杰夫时期，这一中产阶级开始在俄罗斯国内和国际政策中扮演更加重要的角色。

With Putin’s return to power and his recent adventurism, it has been pushed aside by deliberately awakened and intensely stimulated national chauvinism. => 随着普京重回宝座并且采取了最近的冒险主义，自由中产阶级被刻意唤醒并且密集刺激的民族沙文主义所压制。
A Russia that gradually begins to gravitate toward the West will also be a Russia that ceases to disrupt the international system. => 逐渐开始被西方吸引的俄罗斯也将是一个停止干扰国际制度的俄罗斯。
America’s Enemy Within => 美国国内的敌人

NEW YORK – Barring any unexpected new revelations, there is not much to be learned from the Tsarnaev brothers, better known as “the Boston bombers.” => 纽约 — — 除出人意料的事实真相外，从察尔纳耶夫兄弟（也叫“波士顿兄弟 ” ） 身上再也得不到什么新的东西。
We can dig into their family histories in strife-torn Dagestan, or examine, once again, the lethal appeal of Islamist radicalism. => 我们可以挖掘俩兄弟在倍受纷争蹂躏的家乡达吉斯坦的家庭史，也可以再次审视伊斯兰激进主义的致命吸引力。
But I doubt that this would be enlightening. => 但我怀疑这样做有没有意义。

The elder brother, Tamerlan, who died in a gun battle with the police, appears to fit perfectly the profile of what the German writer Hans Magnus Enzensberger calls “the radical loser.” => 在与警方交火中丧生的哥哥塔梅兰似乎是德国作家汉斯·马格努斯·恩岑斯贝格口中“激进失败者”的典型。
The radical loser is the kind of young man who feels victimized by an unfeeling, uncaring world. => 激进失败者是指那些感觉被绝情、冷漠的世界抛弃的年轻人。
That sour sense of rejection, felt by many confused youths, turns for some into a fierce desire for vengeance. => 很多困惑的年轻人那种酸楚的被抛弃感，在某些人身上化成了强烈的复仇欲。
Like Samson in the temple of Gaza, he wishes to destroy himself in a public act of violence, taking as many people as possible with him. => 像加沙寺庙中的萨姆森一样，他追求公众暴力中的自我毁灭，让尽可能多的人给他陪葬。
Anything can trigger this final act: a lover’s rejection, a job application denied. => 情侣分手、工作申请被拒，任何小事均可触发这场最后的疯狂。
In the case of Tamerlan, a talented boxer, he was denied the chance to become a champion because he was not yet a United States citizen. => 具体到天才拳手塔梅兰，他因为不是美国公民而失去了登上冠军宝座的机会。
Radical Islamism offered him a ready-made cause to die for. => 激进伊斯兰主义为他提供了为事业献身的现成的机会。
More interesting, and in a way far more disturbing, has been the reaction in the US to the Boston bombings, which killed three people and injured 264. => 美国对致3人死亡、264人受伤的波士顿爆炸事件的反应非常有趣，在某种意义上也更耐人寻味。

Even after Tamerlan had died, and Dzhokhar, already wounded, was the only known fugitive, the Boston authorities decided to close down the entire city. => 即使在塔梅兰已死，受伤的焦哈尔被证明是唯一已知逃犯的情况下，波士顿当局依然决定封锁整座城市。
Public transport was halted, trains to and from the city were stopped, shops and business closed, and citizens were told to stay home. => 公共交通及城市列车停运、公司商店关闭、市民被告知要待在家里。
Until the surviving bomber was found, Boston was reduced to a ghost town. => 在幸存的爆炸案嫌犯被发现之前，波士顿已经沦为一座鬼城。
It shows how vulnerable a modern city can be when its leaders lose their nerve. => 此次事件显示领导人丧失勇气时现代城市将变得多么脆弱。
This may reflect what people are accustomed to. => 这也许是人们习惯成自然的反应。
Like the Spanish, they were used to it. => 英国人和西班牙人一样已经见怪不怪。
Americans, despite the attacks of September 11, 2001, are not. => 尽管经历过2001年9月11日的恐怖袭击，美国人却还没有对暴力司空见惯。
Exaggerated fear of outside enemies has always been part of the American political landscape. => 美国政界一直存在对外敌夸大其词的恐惧。
The “nation of immigrants” was traditionally regarded as a refuge from danger. => 美国作为“移民国家”传统上被视为避险之地。
The evil outside world should not be able to touch the Land of the Free. => 邪恶的外部世界不应触及这片自由的土地。
When it does – Pearl Harbor, September 2001 – all hell breaks loose. => 当珍珠港、911等外来袭击真实发生后，美国人好像掉进了活地狱。
Another factor may be the need for a common enemy in a country whose citizens come from so many different cultures and traditions. => 另一个因素或许是民众来自多元文化和传统的国家需要同仇敌忾。
Besieged by Communists or Islamists, people feel a sense of belonging. => 共产党或伊斯兰教徒的围攻给人带来归属感。
Defense of the nation against dangerous outsiders – and their domestic agents, whether real or imagined – provides a powerful bond. => 保护国家免遭想象或真实的危险外来者及其国内代理人的荼毒可以产生强大的凝聚力。
Such bonds can be useful, even necessary, in times of war. => 这样的凝聚力在战时不仅有效，而且必须。
But the politics of fear poses a danger to the US itself. => 但恐惧政治也威胁美国自身的安全。
The aim of political terrorist groups, such as Al Qaeda, is to provoke retaliation and maximize publicity for their cause. => 以“基地”为代表的政治恐怖组织的目的就是激起报复，最大限度地为他们的事业宣传。
As common criminals, such groups’ members would not achieve this goal. => 如果被当作普通罪犯，恐怖组织成员的上述目标将无法实现。

But by claiming to be soldiers at war with the world’s biggest military power, they gain sympathy, as well as recruits, among the radical losers and the disaffected. => 但自称与世界排名第一的军事强国作战能帮助他们博取同情，进而从激进失败者和不满群众当中征召人员。
Former President George W. Bush once explained terrorism as the expression of hatred for American freedom. => 前总统乔治·W·布什曾经说过恐怖主义是表达对美国自由的仇恨。
American Hegemony or American Primacy? => 美国霸权还是美国主导？
CAMBRIDGE – No country in modern history has possessed as much global military power as the United States. => 美国剑桥—在现代历史上，没有哪个国家拥有如同美国那样强大的全球军事实力。
Yet some analysts now argue that the US is following in the footsteps of the United Kingdom, the last global hegemon to decline. => 但如今一些分析家认为美国正在步上一个衰落的全球霸权 — — 英国的后尘。
This historical analogy, though increasingly popular, is misleading. => 这一历史比较尽管越来越热门，却有误导之嫌。
Britain was never as dominant as the US is today. => 英国从未获得可与今日美国相媲美的主宰力。

To be sure, it maintained a navy equal in size to the next two fleets combined, and its empire, on which the sun never set, ruled over a quarter of humankind. => 诚然，它拥有一支规模等于第二名和第三名之和的海军，并且“日不落帝国”统治范围覆盖了四分之一的人类。
But there were major differences in the relative power resources of imperial Britain and contemporary America. => 但大英帝国和当代美国的相对实力来源截然不同。

By the outbreak of World War I, Britain ranked only fourth among the great powers in terms of military personnel, fourth in terms of GDP, and third in military spending. => 一战爆发时，英国的军人数量只在列强中位居第四，GDP也位居第四，军事支出位居第三。
The British Empire was ruled in large part through reliance on local troops. => 大英帝国在很大程度上利用当地武装实现统治。
Of the 8.6 million British forces in WWI, nearly a third came from the overseas empire. => 在一战的860万英军中，近三分之一来自海外。
That made it increasingly difficult for the government in London to declare war on behalf of the empire when nationalist sentiments began to intensify. => 这使得当民族主义情绪开始高涨时，伦敦政府日益难以代表整个帝国宣战。
By World War II, protecting the empire had become more of a burden than an asset. => 到二战时，保护整个帝国成了一种负担而不是资产。
The fact that the UK was situated so close to powers like Germany and Russia made matters even more challenging. => 英国与德国和俄国的实力已非常接近，这一事实让挑战更加紧迫。

For all the loose talk of an “American empire,” the fact is that the US does not have colonies that it must administer, and thus has more freedom to maneuver than the UK did. => 在所有泛泛而谈的“美利坚帝国”论中，一个事实是美国并不拥有它必须管理的殖民地，因此拥有比英国更大的腾挪自由。
And, surrounded by unthreatening countries and two oceans, it finds it far easier to protect itself. => 此外，美国周边是没有威胁的邻国和两个大洋，保护自己要容易得多。
That brings us to another problem with the global hegemon analogy: the confusion over what “hegemony” actually means. => 这就引出了关于全球霸权比较的另一个问题：对“霸权”真实含义的混淆。
Some observers conflate the concept with imperialism; but the US is clear evidence that a hegemon does not have to have a formal empire. => 一些观察家将霸权列为帝国主义的同义词；但美国是一个明显的例子，说明了霸权并不一定要靠正式的帝国实现。

Others define hegemony as the ability to set the rules of the international system; but precisely how much influence over this process a hegemon must have, relative to other powers, remains unclear. => 另一些观察家将霸权定义为有能力制定国际制度规则；但霸权必须拥有相对其他列强多多少的影响力仍不明确。
Still others consider hegemony to be synonymous with control of the most power resources. => 还有一些观察家认为霸权意味着控制最多的实力资源。

Similarly, those who speak of American hegemony after 1945 fail to note that the Soviet Union balanced US military power for more than four decades. => 类似地，说美国在1945年后拥有霸权的人没有注意到苏联在四十多年的时间里都在制衡美国的军事实力。
Though the US had disproportionate economic clout, its room for political and military maneuver was constrained by Soviet power. => 尽管美国拥有无与伦比的经济实力，但其政治和军事腾挪空间因为苏联的力量而大受限制。
They point out that it may be rational for many countries to preserve this institutional framework, even if American power resources decline. => 他们指出，对许多国家来说，维护这一制度框架是理性的，即使美国实力源在衰落。

In this sense, the US-led international order could outlive America’s primacy in power resources, though many others argue that the emergence of new powers portends this order’s demise. => 从这个角度讲，美国领导的国际秩序能够比美国的实力源主导地位存在更长时间，尽管其他许多人指出新力量的崛起预示着这一秩序的崩溃。
But, when it comes to the era of supposed US hegemony, there has always been a lot of fiction mixed in with the facts. => 但是，在所谓的美国霸权时期，一直有许多混杂在一起的事实和矛盾。

It was less a global order than a group of like-minded countries, largely in the Americas and Western Europe, which comprised less than half of the world. => 它与其说是一套全球秩序，不如说是一群观念相近的国家（主要来自美洲和西欧，不到世界的一半 ） 。
And its effects on non-members – including significant powers like China, India, Indonesia, and the Soviet bloc – were not always benign. => 其对非成员国的影响 — — 包括中国、印度、印度尼西亚和苏联阵营等主要力量 — — 并不总是积极的。
Given this, the US position in the world could more accurately be called a “half-hegemony.” => 因此，美国在世界中的地位更应该称为“半霸权 ” （ half-hegemony ） 。
But, from a political or military standpoint, the world was bipolar, with the Soviet Union balancing America’s power. => 但是，从政治或军事角度看，世界是双极结构，苏联制衡着美国的实力。

Against this background, “primacy” seems like a more accurate description of a country’s disproportionate (and measurable) share of all three kinds of power resources: military, economic, and soft. => 在此背景下，或许“主导”才更准确地描述了一国在三大实力源上的（可测量的）超凡比重：军事、经济和软实力。
The question now is whether the era of US primacy is coming to an end. => 现在的问题是美国主导的时代是否正在走向结束。
Given the unpredictability of global developments, it is, of course, impossible to answer this question definitively. => 考虑到全球发展趋势的不可预测性，当然也就无法笃定地回答这个问题。

The rise of transnational forces and non-state actors, not to mention emerging powers like China, suggests that there are big changes on the horizon. => 跨国力量和非国家行动方的崛起 — — 更不用说中国等新兴力量了 — — 意味着全球局势的重大变化。
In short, while the era of US primacy is not over, it is set to change in important ways. => 简言之，尽管美国主导的时代还没结束，但必定会发生重要改变。
Whether or not these changes will bolster global security and prosperity remains to be seen. => 这些改变能否提升全球安全与繁荣还有待观察。
What I Tell My Non-American Friends => 我告诉我美国以外的朋友

CAMBRIDGE – I frequently travel overseas, and invariably my foreign friends ask, with varying degrees of bewilderment: What in the world is going on in your country? => 坎布里奇 — — 我时常前往海外，我外国的朋友每次都带着不同程度的困惑问：你们国家究竟发生了什么？
Here is what I say. => 下面是我的回答。
First, do not misinterpret the 2016 election. => 首先，不要误读2016年大选。
Contrary to some commentary, the American political system has not been swept away by a wave of populism. => 与某些评论所声称的恰恰相反，美国政治制度并未被民粹主义浪潮所消灭掉。
True, we have a long history of rebelling against elites. => 诚然，我们有着反抗精英的悠久历史。

Donald Trump tapped into a tradition associated with leaders like Andrew Jackson and William Jennings Bryan in the nineteenth century and Huey Long and George Wallace in the twentieth century. => 与十九世纪的安德鲁·杰克逊和威廉·詹宁斯·布莱恩和二十世纪的休伊·朗和乔治·华莱士等领袖相关的传统被唐纳德·特朗普所利用。
And yet Trump lost the popular vote by nearly three million. => 而且特朗普少近300万张民众选票。

He won the election by appealing to populist resentment in three Rust Belt states – Michigan, Pennsylvania, and Wisconsin – that had previously voted Democratic. => 他通过迎合密歇根、宾夕法尼亚和威斯康星这三个铁锈州所出现的民粹主义愤怒而赢得了大选 — — 这三个州此前曾是民主党的票仓。
If a hundred thousand votes had been cast differently in those states, Trump would have lost the Electoral College and the presidency. => 如果那些州有10万张选票当时改变了归属，那么特朗普将同时失去选举团和总统。
That said, Trump’s victory points to a real problem of growing social and regional inequality in the United States. => 也就是说，特朗普的胜利体现出的真正问题是美国愈演愈烈的社会和地区不平等。
J.D. Vance’s recent best-selling book Hillbilly Elegy compellingly describes the vast difference between California and Appalachia. => 万斯最新畅销书《乡村哀歌》令人信服地描绘了加利福尼亚和阿巴拉契亚之间的巨大差别。
In 1999, mortality rates among whites with no college were around 30% lower than those of African-Americans; by 2015, they were 30% higher. => 1999年，没有大学学历的白人死亡率比非洲裔美国人低30%左右；而到2015年，该数据却变成了高30 % 。

Moreover, manufacturing employment, once a prime source of high-paying jobs for working-class whites, has fallen sharply over the last generation, to just 12% of the workforce. => 不仅如此，曾一度成为工薪阶层白人高收入主要来源的制造业岗位在过去一代人间急剧下降，目前仅占劳动力总量的12 % 。
These previously Democratic voters were attracted by Trump’s promises to shake things up and bring back manufacturing jobs. => 这些之前的民主党选民被特朗普改变现状和重新创造制造业就业机会的承诺所吸引。
Ironically, Trump’s efforts to repeal President Barack Obama’s health-care legislation would make their lives worse. => 颇具讽刺意味的是，特朗普废除奥巴马总统医改法案的努力将进一步恶化他们的生活状况。
The second thing I tell my foreign friends is not to underestimate Trump’s communications skills. => 我告诉外国朋友们的第二点是不要低估特朗普的沟通技巧。
Many are offended by his tweet storms and outrageous disregard for facts. => 很多人非常厌恶他令人愤怒地无视事实以及他的推特风暴。
Twitter helps him to set the agenda and distract his critics. => 推特帮助他制定议程并分散批评。
What offends commentators in the media and academia does not bother his supporters. => 冒犯媒体和学者的内容对他的支持者而言无关紧要。
But as he turns from his permanent self-centered campaigning to trying to govern, Twitter becomes a two-edged sword that deters needed allies. => 但随着他从永远自我中心的竞选活动开始转向实际治理，推特也起到了阻止所需盟友的双刃剑的作用。
Third, I tell my friends not to expect normal behavior. => 第三，我告诉我的朋友不要指望特朗普表现正常。
Normally, a president who loses the popular vote moves to the political center to attract additional support. => 通常情况下，在民众投票中失利的总统会转向政治中心以吸引更多支持者。
This is what George W. Bush did successfully in 2001. => 2001年乔治·W·布什总统就曾成功地这样做。
Trump, by contrasts, proclaims that he won the popular vote and, acting as though he really did, appeals to his base voters. => 相比之下，特朗普宣称自己赢得了民众投票，而且就像真的赢了一样对他的基础选民发出号召。
His White House staff is divided between pragmatists and ideologues, and he caters to both. => 他安排的白宫工作人员既有实用主义者也不乏空想家，而他能自如地与两者打交道。
Fourth, no one should underestimate US institutions. => 第四，人们不应低估美国的机构。
Sometimes my friends talk as though the sky is falling and ask if Trump is as dangerous a narcissist as Mussolini. => 有时我的朋友说得就像天要塌了一样，问特朗普是不是像墨索里尼一样危险的自恋者。
I tell them not to panic. => 我告诉他们不要惊慌。
The US, for all its problems, is not Italy in 1922. => 尽管美国有各种各样的问题，但绝不是1922年的意大利。
Our national political elites are often polarized; but so were America’s founders. => 我们的国家政治精英往往两极分化；但美国的开国元勋当时也是一样。

In designing the US Constitution, the founders’ goal was not to ensure harmonious government, but to constrain political power with a system of checks and balances that made it difficult to exercise. => 在设计美国宪法的时候，开国元勋们的目标不是确保建设和谐的政府，而是利用完整的制衡体系约束政权，增加权力的行使难度。
The joke goes that the founders created a political system that made it impossible for King George to rule over us – or for anyone to ever do so. => 有人开玩笑说开国元勋们缔造了阻止乔治国王 — — 或任何独裁者 — — 执政的一整套政治制度。
Inefficiency was placed in the service of liberty. => 他们宁愿以低效为代价来实现自由的目标。
It is still early in the Trump presidency, and we cannot be sure what might happen after, say, a major terrorist attack. => 特朗普执政尚处于早期阶段，我们无法确定比如在一次重大恐怖袭击后可能发生些什么。
So far, however, the courts, the Congress, and the states have checked and balanced the administration, as Madison intended. => 但到目前为止，法院、国会及各州政府都在按麦迪逊的意图制约和平衡政府。
And the permanent civil servants in the executive departments add ballast. => 行政部门的常任公务员也发挥了稳定作用。
Finally, my friends ask what all of this means for American foreign policy and the liberal international order led by the US since 1945. => 最后，我的朋友问这对美国外交政策和1945年来由美国主导的自由国际秩序意味着什么。
Frankly, I don’t know, but I worry less about the rise of China than the rise of Trump. => 坦率地讲，我不知道，但与其说我担心中国的崛起还不如说我更担心特朗普。
Despite the US-led international order’s problems, the world has prospered and poverty has been reduced under it. => 尽管以美国为主导的国际秩序存在各种问题，但在这种制度下，世界实现了繁荣，贫穷也逐步减少。
But one cannot be sure it will continue. => 但我们无法肯定现行制度将继续下去。
The US will need to cooperate with China, Europe, Japan, and others to manage transnational problems. => 美国需要与中国、欧洲、日本和其他国家合作来管理跨国事务。
During the 2016 campaign, Trump was the first major party candidate in 70 years to call the American alliance system into question. => 2016年竞选期间，特朗普是七十年来首位质疑美国联盟制度的主要党派候选者。
Since taking office in January, statements by Trump and his appointees suggest that it is likely to persist. => 自1月上台以来，特朗普及其任命人员的言论表明这种质疑很可能不会消除。
American hard and soft power, after all, stems largely from the fact that the US has 60 allies (while China has only a few). => 归根结底，美国的硬实力和软实力大多来自美国的六十个盟友（而中国只有少数几个 ） 。
But the stability of the multilateral institutions that help manage the world economy and global commons is more uncertain. => 但协助管理世界经济和全球民众的多边机构能否保持稳定不确定性更高。
Trump’s budget director speaks of a hard-power budget, with funds cut from the State Department and the United Nations system. => 特朗普的预算总监谈到硬实力预算，拨给国务院和联合国系统的资金都有所减少。
Other officials advocate replacing multilateral trade deals with “fair and balanced” bilateral arrangements. => 其他官员则宣扬用“公平和平衡的”双边安排取代多边贸易协定。
And Trump is repudiating Obama’s efforts to address climate change. => 而且特朗普拒绝承认奥巴马应对气候变化的工作。
I tell my friends I wish I could reassure them on these issues. => 我告诉我的朋友我希望能在这些问题上给他们保证。
But I cannot. => 但我做不到。
Reclaiming American Internationalism => 重拾美国国际主义
But interventionism is not the same thing as internationalism. => 但干预主义与国际主义不同。
Conflating the two collapses the distinction between quick and decisive use of force and thoughtful engagement with the world and its problems. => 如果将两者混为一谈，就无法将快速断然使用武力与深思熟虑地参与世界及其问题区分开来。

In America’s “get ’er done” transactional Weltanschauung, international disputes tend to be viewed as military challenges that are merely masquerading as political issues. => 在美国那种“把事情摆平”的事务性世界观中，国际争端往往被视为伪装成政治事务的军事挑战。
In fact, they are usually the opposite, which is why the world’s most complex conflicts are rarely resolved by intervention. => 事实上情况通常是相反的，这就是为什么世界上最复杂的冲突很少能通过干预来解决的原因。
Geopolitical conflicts have long, sordid histories, and violence is more often a symptom of their intractability than an inherent trait. => 地缘政治冲突都有着悠久而丑恶的历史，而暴力往往并非其固有特征，而是证明其难以处理的症状。
They often have something to do with identity, and with claims of collective ownership of the land beneath the feet of a particular “nation.” => 它们往往与身份定义有关，并且声称对特定“国家/民族”脚下的土地拥有集体所有权。
The basis of political membership is more often ethnic than civil, which is contrary to Americans’ understanding of nationhood. => 构建政治成员资格的基础往往是种族而非公民身份，而这与美国人对国家的理解相悖。
Moreover, contemporary problems can be the products of flawed arrangements that were made decades or even centuries ago. => 与此同时，某些当代问题可能是几十年甚至几百年前那些缺陷性安排的产物。
In both cases, creating new states may have seemed like a straightforward solution, but doing so turned out to be a prescription for more war. => 在这两种情况下，建立一些新国家看似是个简单明了的解决方案，但真这样做只会引发更多战争。
For the United States, international conflicts are often an occasion to demonstrate “toughness” and “resolve.” => 对美国来说，国际冲突往往是其展现“硬派”和“决心”的机会。
The US airstrikes in Bosnia were meant to lend momentum to a political process that already had the support of the European Union and Russia. => 美国对波斯尼亚的空袭是为了推动一项已经得到欧盟和俄罗斯支持的政治进程。
The air campaign was a last resort, an effort to punish those who did not support the peace process. => 空袭是最后的手段，是为了惩罚那些不支持和平进程的人。
For many American pundits and politicians, then, the lesson of Bosnia was merely that the bad guys should have been bombed sooner. => 因此对许多美国权威人士和政治家来说，从波斯尼亚得到的经验就仅仅是应该早点轰炸坏人。
Few took the opportunity to study the region’s complex history so that judicious inter-entity boundaries could be drawn up. => 很少人借此机会研究该地区的复杂历史以便在各个实体间划分出审慎明智的界限。

If they had, the final arrangement might have done more to preserve external borders and nurture a constitutional structure that would allow the new state to be integrated into the European map. => 如果他们能做到这一点的话，最终安排可能会更加专注于保护外部边界并培育出一种宪政架构，使新国家得以融入欧洲地图。
Kosovo, too, supplied more historical complexity than many were willing to grapple with. => 科索沃也是如此，因为该地的历史要比许多人愿意探究的更为复杂。
On-the-ground diplomacy to achieve sovereign autonomy for Kosovo while respecting Serbs’ emotional connection to it was derided. => 力图在实现科索沃主权自治的同时尊重塞族与该地情感联系的接地气外交策略总是受到嘲笑。
The implication was that military means should be the first – rather than the last – option for securing Kosovo’s independence. => 这意味着军事手段成为了确保科索沃独立的首要 — — 而不是最后一个 — — 选择。

Never mind that many European countries objected to the creation of an independent state, and had called for multilateral diplomacy to be attempted before any discussion of air strikes. => 更别提许多欧洲国家反对建立一个独立国家，并呼吁在讨论实施任何空袭之前尝试进行多边外交。
Interventionism, with internationalism as an afterthought, continued after the turn of the century, but on a much bigger stage. => 在世纪之交之后，先干涉主义后国际主义的做法继续存在，而且站在更广大的舞台上。
After the attacks of September 11, 2001, the US led an invasion and subsequent occupation of Afghanistan to root out al-Qaeda. => 在2001年9月11日袭击事件发生后，美国领军了入侵并随后占领阿富汗以铲除基地组织。

But after 17 years with troops on the ground in that country, Americans have lost patience, with many embracing US President Donald Trump’s “America First” isolationism. => 但是在驻军17年后美国人失去了耐心，许多人接受了美国总统特朗普的“美国优先”孤立主义思维。

In Iraq, where the connection to terrorism was more dubious, the US mounted a major military effort with goals that were perplexing and shifting, insofar as they were ever clearly articulated at all. => 在与恐怖主义联系更为微弱的伊拉克，美国花费重大的军事努力去实现那些令人困惑且飘摇不定的目标，似乎它们根本就没有被明确表达过。

When things went wrong in Afghanistan and Iraq, the US blamed those countries’ political leaders, denouncing them as corrupt and deserving of regime change. => 当阿富汗和伊拉克出现问题时美国就会抨击这些国家的政治领导人，谴责他们腐败并活该下台。

The Europeans, too, were denounced, not just for fecklessness in the face of evil, but for living fat and happy lives without shouldering their proper burden. => 欧洲人也受到谴责，不仅仅是因为面对恶行时的无能，还因为光顾享受生活而不去承担适当的责任。
American internationalism will be back at some point. => 美国的国际主义将会在某个时刻回归。
But those who claim to support it could hasten its revival by acting in accordance with its original meaning. => 但那些声称支持它的人可以通过按照其原始含义行事来加速其复兴。
Traditional internationalists show respect for the opinions of others, and a willingness to accept – and even champion – multilateral structures. => 传统的国际主义者会表现出对他人意见的尊重，并表现出接受 — — 甚至支持 — — 多边架构的意愿。

What internationalism needs now is a renewed American commitment to cooperation, even when other governments require more time to secure a mandate for action from their respective constituencies. => 当前国际主义需要的是美国承诺重新参与合作，即使当其他政府需要更多时间来获取来自各自体制的行动授权。

At the end of the day, US international leadership must rest on American values, and on a broad perception of adherence to the unalienable principles underlying liberal democracy. => 毕竟美国的国际领导必须根植于美国的价值观并广泛遵守自由民主制度背后的一系列不可剥夺原则。
In other words, America must lead by example. => 换句话说，美国必须以身作则。
Its failure to do so in recent times – not least on the refugee issue – has undermined the influence on which its power ultimately rests. => 而其近期的失能 — — 尤其是在难民问题上 — — 已经破坏了其权力最终所赖以构筑的影响力。
Renewing American Leadership => 重建美国领导
MADRID – December always provides an opportunity to pause and reflect on what was and what will be. => 马德里—12月永远是停下来思考过去怎样、未来又会怎样的机会。
This year, one of the conclusions that such reflection yields is that the United States remains firmly at the center of the liberal world order. => 今年，这样的思考所产生的一个结论是美国仍然是自由世界秩序的核心，这一地位十分稳固。
Another is that the US needs to do more to lead in the way that its international standing demands. => 另一个结论是美国需要做更多的事才能满足其国际地位所要求的领导责任。
Doubts about America’s continued global leadership have been proliferating for years. => 多年来，关于美国是否能够保持全球领导力的质疑此起彼伏。
President Barack Obama’s restrained foreign-policy approach appears to be fueling, not reducing, global instability. => 总统奥巴马的克制外交方针助长而不是遏制了全球动荡。
The reasons for this lack of strong action are disputed. => 不再采取强势行动的原因饱受争议。
Some blame Obama’s own fears about repeating his predecessors’ mistakes; others blame a hostile Congress for tying his hands. => 一些人指责奥巴马害怕重蹈前任覆辙；也有人指责敌意国会的掣肘。
In fact, both factors may be at work. => 事实上，也许两个因素都在起作用。

It may well be true that Obama would rather exercise caution – even when bold action is called for – than act impulsively and potentially cause more damage. => 奥巴马宁愿谨慎行事 — — 哪怕是在人们呼吁采取果断行动时 — — 而不愿冲动以免造成更多伤害。
But the negative impact of an obstructionist, highly partisan US Congress should not be underestimated. => 但以制造障碍为己任的高度党派对立的美国国会所起到的消极作用也不能小觑。

And, by opposing the inclusion of legally binding climate commitments, it weakened the global climate agreement that was reached this month in Paris, leaving compliance and implementation uncertain. => 此外，美国国会还反对纳入有法律约束的气候承诺，从而削弱了本月在巴黎所达成的全球气候协定，留下了遵守和实施方面的不确定性。
Stalemate has become the name of the game in US politics in recent years. => 近几年来，僵局已成为美国政治博弈的代名词。
That is why next year’s presidential election is so crucial. => 正因如此，明年的总统选举至关重要。
It offers an opportunity for a fresh start, a new approach that produces the type of policy actions that the world needs. => 这次选举提供了一个采取新方针，带来世界所需要的政策行动的全新开始的机会。

The key is engagement – among branches of the US government, between the US government and the public, and between the US and the rest of the world. => 关键在于参与（engagement ） — —美国政府各部门的参与，美国政府和公众之间的参与，以及美国和世界其他国家之间的参与。

For starters, to avoid the kind of obstructionism that prevailed in the last eight years, the next president must engage Congress directly and actively. => 首先，为了避免过去八年中所出现的阻挠一切的情况，下一位美国总统必须直接、积极地参与国会。
Even in America’s highly divisive political atmosphere, it seems, where there is a will, there is a way. => 看起来，即使在高度分化的美国政治气候下，也是有志者事竟成。

America’s next president must also improve engagement with citizens, whose widespread disaffection constrains – or allows – US leaders to pursue a weak foreign policy. => 下一任美国总统还必须改善与公民之间的参与，美国公民的普遍不满制约 — — 或者让 — — 美国领导人采取了弱势外交。

Like many Europeans today, most Americans do not seem to understand – or care to understand – that the crumbling of the liberal world order would have dire consequences for all of them. => 和当今的许多欧洲人一样，大部分美国人似乎不理解 — — 也不屑理解 — — 自由世界秩序的崩溃会给他们所有人都带来可怕后果。
It was not always this way. => 并不总是如此。

Immediately after World War II, the memory of war, together with the enduring threat posed by the Soviet Union, made plain the importance of building and maintaining a liberal world order. => 第二次世界大战刚刚结束时，战争的记忆加上苏联所带来的持续威胁，使得人人都能理解构建和维持自由世界秩序的重要性。
Today, though the need for such an order is just as great, the argument is not nearly as comprehensible or emotionally powerful. => 如今，尽管对这一秩序的需求与当时同样巨大，但这一论点已不再那么完整或者具有那么强大的情感力量。
Discussion of rules and institutions comes across as bloodless. => 对规则和制度的讨论给人留下不会流血的引向。
It is up to political leaders – and especially the president – to figure out how to make a compelling case about what is at stake. => 政治领导人 — — 尤其是总统 — — 的责任就是找到如何将让最重要的事情显得刻不容缓。
Only this approach can secure the mandate from the public that the next US president will need to engage effectively with other world leaders. => 只有这一方针能够确保下一任美国总统能够获得与其他世界领导人有效参与的公众授权。
And make no mistake: Such engagement is indispensable. => 不要搞错了：这一参与是不可或缺的。

While the US must play an integral role in addressing global challenges, from ending the Syrian civil war to following through on the promises of the Paris climate agreement, it cannot do it alone. => 美国必须在解决全球挑战过程中起到核心作用，不管是结束叙利亚内战还是兑现巴黎气候协定承诺。
Real progress will demand real cooperation. => 只有真合作才能带来真进步。
In the second half of the twentieth century, the US showed that committed leadership could help to ensure widespread stability and prosperity. => 二十世纪下半叶，美国证明了全力以赴兑现领导力能有助于确保广泛的稳定与繁荣。
In the twenty-first century, it has showed how devastating a lack of such leadership can be. => 在二十一世纪，美国又证明了缺乏这一领导力所能造成的灾难性后果。
Finger pointing will not fix anything. => 指责游戏无助于解决问题。

Only by pursuing genuine, deep, and sustained engagement, both at home and abroad, can the next administration ensure that the coming years will be better than the last. => 下一届美国政府只有追求真正的深度可持续合作 — — 不管在国内还是国外 — — 才能确保未来几年会比过去几年更好。
American Pie in the Sky => 美国派在天上飞
NEW YORK – While the risk of a disorderly crisis in the eurozone is well recognized, a more sanguine view of the United States has prevailed. => 纽约—欧元区发生无序危机的风险已为人们所认识到，但对于美国，人们的普遍看法仍是乐观。

For the last three years, the consensus has been that the US economy was on the verge of a robust and self-sustaining recovery that would restore above-potential growth. => 在过去三年中，共识一直是美国经济快要实现稳健的自我维持复苏，将重回超过潜在增长率的增长阶段。
Even this year, the consensus got it wrong, expecting a recovery to above-trend  annual GDP growth – faster than 3%. => 即使在今年，共识也没有看准形势，期待超趋势的年GDP增长复苏 — — 3%以上。
But the first-half growth rate looks set to come in closer to 1.5% at best, even below 2011’s dismal 1.7%. => 但上半年的增长率能接近1.5%便已谢天谢地了，甚至连2011令人失望的1.7%都赶不上。

The reality is the opposite: for several reasons, growth will slow further in the second half of 2012 and be even lower in 2013 – close to stall speed. => 现实正好相反：多种理由表明增长会在2012年下半年有所放缓，在2013年进一步恶化，降至近乎停滞的程度。

First, growth in the second quarter has decelerated from a mediocre 1.8% in January-March, as job creation – averaging 70,000 a month – fell sharply. => 首先，二季度增长率较一季度的差强人意的1.8%有所减慢，这是因为就业创造 — — 平均每个月创造70 000个岗位 — — 迅速疲软所致。

Second, expectations of the “fiscal cliff” – automatic tax increases and spending cuts set for the end of this year – will keep spending and growth lower through the second half of 2012. => 其次 ， “ 财政悬崖”预期 — — 在今年年底自动实行增税减支 — — 将在2012年下半年拖累支出和增长。
In such conditions, most firms and consumers will be cautious about spending – an option value of waiting – thus further weakening the economy. => 在这样的环境下，大部分企业和消费者会对支出慎之又慎 — — 等待的选择价值 — — 从而进一步拖累经济。

Third, the fiscal cliff would amount to a 4.5%-of-GDP drag on growth in 2013 if all tax cuts and transfer payments were allowed to expire and draconian spending cuts were triggered. => 第三，财政悬崖将对2013年GDP形成4.5%的拖累作用，如果减税和转移支付到期停止且严厉的支出削减被触发的话。
Of course, the drag will be much smaller, as tax increases and spending cuts will be much milder. => 当然，如果增税减支较为温和的话，拖累作用也会大大降低。
Fourth, private consumption growth in the last few quarters does not reflect growth in real wages (which are actually falling). => 第四，过去几个季度的私人消费增长并未反映真实工资增长（实际上，真实工资在下降 ） 。

In 2013, as transfer payments are phased out, however gradually, and as some tax cuts are allowed to expire, disposable income growth and consumption growth will slow. => 2013年，随着转移支付的逐渐停止（不管多么缓慢）以及一些减税项目的到期，可支配收入和消费增长将会下降。
The US will then face not only the direct effects of a fiscal drag, but also its indirect effect on private spending. => 美国将不仅面临财政拖累的直接后果，还将面临其对私人支出的间接影响。

The US Federal Reserve will carry out more quantitative easing this year, but it will be ineffective: long-term interest rates are already very low, and lowering them further would not boost spending. => 美联储将在今年追加量化宽松，但这不会起效：长期利率已然很低，进一步压低它们不会提振支出。
Indeed, the credit channel is frozen and velocity has collapsed, with banks hoarding increases in base money in the form of excess reserves. => 事实上，信用渠道已经冻结，货币流速极慢，银行纷纷以超额储备的形式囤积基础货币。
Moreover, the dollar is unlikely to weaken as other countries also carry out quantitative easing. => 此外，在其他国家也推出量化宽松的情况下，美元也不可能贬值。

Indeed, growth in earnings and profits is now running out of steam, as the effect of weak demand on top-line revenues takes a toll on bottom-line margins and profitability. => 事实上，收益和利润的增长正在失去动力，因为需求疲软对运营收入的影响让利润率和盈利性遭受重创。
A significant equity-price correction could, in fact, be the force that in 2013 tips the US economy into outright contraction. => 事实上，股价的重大修正可能在2013年将美国经济拖入严重衰退。
An American Political Tragedy => 美国政治悲剧
BERLIN – US President Donald Trump’s nearly eight months in office have been characterized by a series of disturbing political developments. => 柏林—美国总统特朗普上台已经将近八个月了，这段时间伴随着一系列令人不安的政治发展趋势。
But Trump is not entirely to blame. => 但不能将错误全部归于特朗普。
His presidency is just the latest act in a long-running political tragedy. => 他的总统生涯只是漫长的政治悲剧的最新一幕。
From a foreign-policy perspective, the problem began in the 1990s, when the United States squandered the post-Cold War peace dividend. => 从外交政策角度，问题始于20世纪90年代，美国肆意挥霍冷战后的和平红利。

Of course, US politicians are rarely short on lofty rhetoric – from Ronald Reagan’s “Morning in America” campaign to Barack Obama’s “Yes, we can” slogan to Donald Trump’s “America First” refrain. => 当然，美国政客并不缺少高尚的言辞 — — 从里根的“美国早晨”运动到奥巴马的“是的，我们能”的口号，再到特朗普的“美国优先”信条，莫不如是。
And, beginning with John F. Kennedy, presidents have likened the US to a “city upon a hill” – an example to the rest of the world. => 而从肯尼迪开始，诸任美国总统都将美国称为“山巅之城 ” — —是世界其他国家的榜样。
Yet it is hard to remember the last time the US produced a policy that could serve as a model for others to emulate. => 但上一次美国拿出能够作为其他国家效仿榜样的政策是什么时候，已经很难让人记起了。
The country has not had a pro-active, forward-looking government since the 1960s. => 自20世纪60年代以来，这个国家就再也没有出现过积极主动、远见卓识的政府。
The list goes on. => 这个清单可以一直列下去。
And, as the US government has retreated from society, the US has retreated from the rest of the world. => 而随着美国政府从社会中撤出，美国也从世界其他地区撤出。
These trends have culminated in Trump, whose most popular policies focus on destruction, rather than creation. => 这些趋势在特朗普上任后达到了顶峰，他最受民众支持的政策集中在“毁”而不是“建”上。
Deregulation will supposedly slay the “deep state” chimera, while enabling the US to achieve energy independence. => 去监管化可能扼杀“深度国家 ” （ deep state）的空想，尽管它也可能让美国实现能源独立。
A US-centered foreign policy focused not on reshaping America’s role in the world, but on reducing it. => 以美国为中心的外交政策不注重美国在世界中的角色，而是以削弱这一角色为重点。

From the Affordable Care Act (Obamacare) to the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA) policy, Trump likes to reverse past policies, without devising anything to replace them. => 从平价医疗法（奥巴马医保）到暂缓遣返青少年（DACA）政策，特朗普想要扭转过去的政策，但没有拿出任何取而代之的政策。
American conservatives have so far failed to read Trump’s intentions accurately. => 到目前为止，美国保守派没能正确解读特朗普的意图。

In July, Robert W. Merry wrote that Trump had “yet to score anything approaching a serious legislative victory – or to demonstrate any serious political momentum.” => 7月，罗伯特·梅里（Robert W. Merry）写道，特朗普“在取得重大立法胜利方面还没有任何得分 — — 也没有表现出任何重大政治动能。
But the truth is that Trump’s agenda has plenty of momentum; it is just focused on demolishing Obama’s legacy. => ”但真相是特朗普的日程充满了动能；只不过它的重点是摧毁奥巴马的遗产。
The result of Trump’s approach is that America’s existing problems are worsening and huge opportunities are being missed. => 特朗普的方针的结果，是美国现有问题不断恶化，重大机遇被白白浪费。
But what can stop demons already unleashed? => 但什么才能阻止已经被释放出来的魔鬼？
And, even if they are stopped, can the damage they have already wrought be reversed? => 即使这些魔鬼被阻止，它们已经造成的伤害能够逆转吗？
Beyond lamenting the astonishing depths to which a great political culture and system can fall, what can be done? => 除了哀叹一套伟大的政治文化和制度能够堕落如斯，我们还能做些什么？
One obvious option, which Democrats largely seem to be taking, is to reject Trump and everything his administration stands for. => 一个显而易见的选择 — — 民主党也大多在这么做 — — 是拒绝特朗普和他的政府的一切立场。
But that risks ensuring the persistence of the dysfunctional dynamics that brought the US to this point. => 但这有可能导致把美国带到这一步的僵局持久化。
Another option, however unappealing at first glance, is to accept the Trump administration. => 另一个选项 — — 咋看上去，这个选项毫无吸引力可言 — — 是接受特朗普政府。
The result of such a choice may well be the worsening of domestic problems and the weakening of checks and balances. => 这一选择的结果很可能是国内问题恶化、制衡被削弱。

But it is also possible that checks and balances will hold until the next election, enabling America’s existing political parties to rebuild and new parties to emerge. => 但也有可能，制衡能够维持到下一次选举，让美国现有政党获得重建、新的政党得到涌现。
The result, one hopes, would be a much-needed political realignment – indeed, a political renaissance. => 我们希望，结果将是急需的政治整顿 — — 事实上，是政治文艺复兴。
To be sure, such a shift would take time – time that, depending on how long Trump remains in office, parties may not have. => 诚然，这样的改变需要时间，而政党可能并没有这么长的时间 — — 取决于特朗普将执政多久。

Republicans may be politically handicapped for years, as they are forced to reckon with the Faustian bargain they struck for the sake of political power. => 共和党可能会在多年的时间里在政治上一蹶不振，因为他们将被迫为了政治权力，而进行魔鬼交易。

Democrats, for their part, face a broad leadership vacuum and a lack of political vision, owing to their now-internalized fear of being labeled “big spenders.” => 至于民主党，他们面临着广泛的领导力真空，也缺少政治愿景，因为他们现在有一种源自内心的对“大手大脚花钱”标签的恐惧。
And, as it stands, no third parties or candidates provide reasonable alternatives. => 而从目前看，没有第三党或候选人能够拿出合理的替代方案。
Nonetheless, there are encouraging signs that some Republicans and Democrats are thinking outside the party box. => 尽管如此，有令人鼓舞的信号表明，一些共和党和民主党正在跳出党派的桎梏考虑问题。

To rewrite the plot before that scenario plays out requires reshuffling and revitalizing US politics, so that, in the words of the poet Seamus Heaney, “hope and history rhyme” once again in America. => 在这一情景成为现实之前重写剧本需要对美国政治彻底洗牌，让其获得重生，从而，用诗人西莫斯·希尼（Seamus Heaney）的话说 ， “ 希望和历史的韵脚”再次在美国回荡。
American Power in the Twenty-First Century => 二十一世纪的美国实力
Russian President Dmitri Medvedev has called the 2008 financial crisis a sign that America’s global leadership is coming to an end. => 俄罗斯总统德米特里·梅德韦杰夫称2008年金融危机标志着美国全球领导地位的结束。
The leader of Canada’s opposition Liberal Party, Michael Ignatieff, suggests that US power has passed its mid-day. => 加拿大反对派自由党领导人迈克尔·伊格纳季耶夫则认为美国权力的鼎盛期已经过去。
How can we know if these predictions are correct? => 我们怎样才能知道这些预测是否准确呢？
One should beware of misleading metaphors of organic decline. => 人们应当警惕全方位衰退的误导性比喻。
Countries are not like humans with predictable life spans. => 国家毕竟不同于寿命可以预测的人类个体。

For example, after Britain lost its American colonies at the end of the eighteenth century, Horace Walpole lamented Britain’s reduction to “as insignificant a country as Denmark or Sardinia.” => 例如，当英国在十八世纪末失去美洲殖民地后，霍勒斯·沃波尔曾哀叹英国已沦落到“像丹麦或撒丁岛一样微不足道 ” 。
He failed to foresee that the industrial revolution would give Britain a second century of even greater ascendency. => 但他没有能够预测到工业革命将使英国在接下来的世纪中统治地位更加稳固。
Rome remained dominant for more than three centuries after the apogee of Roman power. => 罗马帝国在登上权力顶峰后依然延续了三个多世纪的统治。
Even then, Rome did not succumb to another state, but suffered a death of a thousand cuts inflicted by various barbarian tribes. => 即使到最后，罗马也没有向另外一个国家屈服，而是在被野蛮部落蹂躏得千疮百孔后最终走上了灭亡的道路。
In an information-based world of cyber-insecurity, power diffusion may be a greater threat than power transition. => 在以信息为基础但缺乏网络安全的世界里，权力分散的威胁可能大于权力的转移。
So, what will it mean to wield power in the global information age of the twenty-first century? => 那么，在全球信息时代的二十一世纪行使权力将意味着什么？
What resources will produce power? => 哪些资源能够带来权力？

Conventional wisdom has always held that the state with the largest military prevails, but in an information age it may be the state (or non-state) with the best story that wins. => 传统智慧一直认为军队规模最大的国家将会胜出，但在信息时代获胜的也许是最会讲故事的国家（或非国家 ） 。
Today, it is far from clear how the balance of power is measured, much less how to develop successful survival strategies. => 今天，仍然没有明确的方法来衡量权力的平衡，更不必说如何制定成功的生存战略了。

Shortly thereafter, Secretary of State Hillary Clinton said, “America cannot solve the most pressing problems on our own, and the world cannot solve them without America. => ”其后不久，希拉里·克林顿国务卿也说 ， “ 美国仅凭一己之力无法解决最急迫的问题，而没有美国的参与世界也无法解决这些问题。
We must use what has been called ‘smart power,’ the full range of tools at our disposal.” => 我们必须充分利用所谓的‘明智的权力 ’ ， 利用能够为我们所用的一切工具。
Smart power means the combination of the hard power of command and the soft power of attraction. => ”明智的权力意味着将命令的硬实力和吸引的软实力结合在一起。
Power always depends on context. => 实力总与所处的环境脱不了干系。
The child who dominates on the playground may become a laggard when the context changes to a disciplined classroom. => 在操场上呼风唤雨的孩子在循规蹈矩的教室则可能成为一名落后份子。

In the middle of the twentieth century, Josef Stalin scornfully asked how many divisions the Pope had, but four decades later, the Papacy was still intact while Stalin’s empire had collapsed. => 二十世纪中期，约瑟夫·斯大林曾轻蔑地询问教皇管辖几个师，而四十年后，教皇制度依然完好无损，而斯大林的帝国却已经分崩离析。
In today’s world, the distribution of power varies with the context. => 当今世界，随着环境的不同权力的分配也在发生变化。
It is distributed in a pattern that resembles a three-dimensional chess game. => 权力分配的模式酷似一场三维棋局。
On the top chessboard, military power is largely unipolar, and the US is likely to remain the only superpower for some time. => 在棋局的最上层，军事实力基本将维持单极格局，而美国在一段时间内很可能仍会是唯一的超级大国。

But on the middle chessboard, economic power has already been multi-polar for more than a decade, with the US, Europe, Japan, and China as the major players, and others gaining in importance. => 但在棋局的中层，十多年来经济实力一直保持着多级化的态势，美、欧、日、中是四大强国，而其他国家的重要性也日趋增加。
The bottom chessboard is the realm of cross-border transactions that occur outside of government control. => 棋局的底层是政府无法控制的跨境交易领域。
It also includes new challenges like pandemics and climate change. => 其中还包括传染病和气候变化等全新挑战。
On this bottom board, power is widely dispersed, and it makes no sense to speak of unipolarity, multipolarity, hegemony, or any other cliché. => 在这底层棋局上，实力异常分散，谈论单极、多极、霸权或其他陈词滥调都毫无意义。

Even in the aftermath of the financial crisis, the giddy pace of technological change is likely to continue to drive globalization and transnational challenges. => 即便在金融危机发生后，令人目眩的技术发展仍然可能继续驱动全球化和跨国挑战。
The problem for American power in the twenty-first century is that there are more and more things outside the control of even the most powerful state. => 即便是最强的国家也有越来越多的问题无法控制是二十一世纪美国权力所面临的问题。
Although the US does well on military measures, there is much going on that those measures fail to capture. => 虽然美国在军事领域成绩斐然，但还有很多军事领域无法涵盖的问题。

Under the influence of the information revolution and globalization, world politics is changing in a way that prevents America from achieving all its international goals acting alone. => 在信息革命和全球化的影响下，世界政治变化的方式阻碍美国自行其是地实现所有国际目标。
For example, international financial stability is vital to Americans’ prosperity, but the US needs the cooperation of others to ensure it. => 例如，国际金融稳定对美国的繁荣至关重要，但美国需要其他国家的配合才能确保国际金融稳定。
Global climate change, too, will affect Americans’ quality of life, but the US cannot manage the problem alone. => 全球气候变化也将影响美国人的生活质量，但美国同样无法依靠自身力量管理全球气候。
In this sense, power becomes a positive sum game. => 从这个意义上讲，权力已经成为一场能产生积极效应的游戏。
It is not enough to think in terms of power over others. One must also think in terms of power to accomplish goals. => 仅从相对于他人的实力角度考虑还远远不够，我们必须考虑到实现目标的实力。
On many transnational issues, empowering others can help to accomplish one’s own goals. => 在许多跨境问题上，为他国授权能有助于实现本国的目标。
In this world, networks and connectedness become an important source of relevant power. => 在这个世界上，网络和联系成为相对实力的重要来源。

The problem of American power in the twenty-first century is not one of decline, but of recognizing that even the most powerful country cannot achieve its aims without the help of others. => 二十一世纪美国实力所面临的问题不是逐渐衰落，而是必须承认即便最强大的国家也无法单枪匹马实现目标的现实。
Abusing Churchill => 滥用丘吉尔

NEW YORK – A bronze bust of Winston Churchill, displayed in the White House since the 1960s, has been the object of a continuing right-wing canard in Washington. => 纽约—从20世纪60年代开始，白宫里摆着一尊丘吉尔的铜像，它是华盛顿一直在流传的一个右翼谣言的目标。
The story goes that when President Barack Obama moved in, he returned the bust to the British Embassy, supposedly signifying his hatred of Britain. => 这个谣言说，奥巴马总统入主白宫时把这尊铜像还给了英国大使馆，以示他对英国的讨厌。
In fact, Obama did no such thing. => 事实上，奥巴马根本没有这么做过。

The bust still stands in the White House Residence, where it always did, except for a short time under President George W. Bush when it was being repaired. => 丘吉尔铜像仍然矗立在在总统官邸，和往常一样，只不过在小布什期间因为修复需要而离开了一小段时间。
But Obama might have done well to remove the bust. => 但奥巴马移除这尊铜像或许属于“干得漂亮”范畴。
The cult of Churchill has not been an altogether beneficial one for the United States. => 丘吉尔崇拜对于美国来说有百害而无一利。
Too many US presidents fancy themselves Churchill’s true heirs. => 太多美国总统幻想自己是丘吉尔的真正传人。
Bush had a copy of Churchill’s bust, lent to him by Tony Blair, in the Oval Office. => 布什有一尊托尼·布莱尔送的丘吉尔铜像复制品，把它摆在椭圆办公室里。
He liked to portray himself as a “war president,” a “decider,” and a “great leader,” like Churchill. => 他喜欢自称“战时总统 ” 、 “决策者”和“伟大领袖 ” ， 就像丘吉尔那样。
He had a taste for battle dress. => 他也喜欢戎装。
And he got his country into a very foolish war. => 他也让他的国家陷入了一场极其愚蠢的战争。

Donald Trump’s British crony, Nigel Farage, the former leader of the UK Independence Party, suggested that Trump should put the bronze bust back in the Oval Office. => 唐纳德·特朗普的英国密友、前英国独立党领导人尼格尔·法拉奇（Nigel Farage）建议特朗普把这尊铜像迎回椭圆办公室。
Trump thought this was a splendid idea. => 特朗普想这绝对是个好主意。
Trump is the least appropriate figure to cast himself in Churchill’s mold. => 特朗普最没有资格自比丘吉尔。
Insofar as he has a coherent position on anything, he is hostile to most of the things that Churchill stood for. => 要说他对什么东西存在一以贯之的立场，那就是他对于丘吉尔所主张的东西大多怀有敌意。

The summer before the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor, 75 years ago this month, Churchill and Roosevelt met in Placentia Bay, Newfoundland, to set out their ideals for a postwar world. => 日本偷袭珍珠港（75年前的12月）的那年夏天，丘吉尔和罗斯福纽芬兰岛布雷莎湾（Placentia Bay）会晤，制定了战后理想世界。

The resulting Atlantic Charter included everything Trump seems to be against: lower trade barriers, economic cooperation, and the advancement of social welfare. => 脱胎于此的大西洋宪章囊括了一切特朗普所反对的东西：降低贸易壁垒、经济合作、推进社会福利。

Once Hitler was defeated, Churchill was also a proponent of European unification, even if he remained ambivalent about Britain’s role in the future union. => 打败希特勒后，丘吉尔又成为欧洲结盟的支持者，即使他对英国在未来的联盟中的角色态度矛盾。
The “special relationship” between the US and Britain, established during WWII, was never as substantial as Churchill and others liked to believe. => 二战期间建立的美国与英国之间的“特殊关系” 从未向丘吉尔和其他人愿意相信的那样重要。
The US, as the dominant postwar power, pursued its own interests, whether the British liked it or not. => 作为战后主宰力量的美国追求自己的利益，不管英国喜不喜欢。

American leaders sometimes pay lip service to the special relationship, to flatter visiting British prime ministers or get the UK onside in dubious military adventures. => 美国领导人有时在嘴上强调这一特殊关系，以奉承到访的英国首相或让英国在可疑的军事行动中站边。
There is talk of giving the relationship a new lease of life in the age of Trump and Brexit. => 有人说，要在特朗普和英国脱欧时代让这一关系获得新生。

A special US tenderness for Brexit Britain – Trump oddly referred to himself as “Mr. Brexit” – rather suggests the solidarity of two countries embarking on their own forms of economic nationalism. => 美国对脱欧的英国的特殊关照 — — 特朗普反常地自称为“英国脱欧先生 ” — —确实表明了这两个采取各自经济民族主义的国家之间的团结。

Again, this is precisely the route that Churchill and Roosevelt sought to avoid; after all, economic nationalism was one of the reasons why Europeans almost succeeded in destroying their continent. => 而这亦是丘吉尔和罗斯福肯定会避免的道路；毕竟，经济民族主义正是欧洲人几乎毁掉欧洲大陆的原因之一。
Of course, Trump’s love of Brexit may be just a question of words, like so much else about the great showman. => 当然，特朗普喜欢英���脱欧也许只是文字游戏，这位伟大“影帝”最擅长此道。
It is hard to imagine the US jeopardizing its economic interests by favoring Britain at the expense of far bigger stakes in the rest of Europe. => 很难想象美国牺牲欧洲其他部分的更大的代价支持英国，甚至不惜有损于自己的经济利益。
But words do matter, as Churchill knew well. => 但文字很重要，丘吉尔深知这一点。
Again, the rhetoric of Trump and his supporters, and of the Brexiteers, could not be further removed from the spirit of the Atlantic Charter. => 特朗普及其支持者，以及英国脱欧派的修辞与大西洋宪章的精神完全南辕北辙。
And Churchill’s response to the flirtations of Trump and the European far right with Vladimir Putin’s Russia can easily be imagined. => 丘吉尔对于特朗普和欧洲极右翼与普京的俄罗斯眉来眼去会做出如何反应很容易想象。
None of this means that Churchill was always right, let alone a figure to emulate. => 所有这些都不意味着丘吉尔永远是对的，更不是永远值得效仿的人物。
He was the right man in 1940 to raise British morale, when morale was about the only thing the British had going for them. => 他是1940年提升英国人士气的正确人选，当是时，士气几乎是英国人唯一的伙伴。
But he is not a good model for politicians in less perilous times. => 但在不那么危险的时代，他并不是一个很好的政治家榜样。
His views of colonial rule were already out of date before the war, and became a racist anachronism after it. => 他对殖民统治的观点在战前就已经不合时宜，战后他更是堪称种族主义老古董。

His romantic ideas about the moral superiority of the English-speaking peoples were old-fashioned during his lifetime, and are an arrogant absurdity now. => 他关于英语民族道德优越性的浪漫理想在他的时代就已属于迂腐，从今天看更是一种自大的荒谬。
But Churchill was neither petty nor provincial. => 但丘吉尔既非小人，也不是乡巴佬。
His vision, at least as far as the Western world is concerned, may have been romantic, but it had a certain nobility. => 他的愿景 — — 至少从西方世界的观念看 — — 也许是浪漫的，但也有一定的贵族气质。
The same cannot be said of the next occupant of the White House. => 下一任白宫主人绝非如此。
The idea of Trump, advised by Farage, using Churchill’s bronze head as a totem would have filled the old man with horror. => 特朗普根据法拉奇的建议用丘吉尔的铜头像当作图腾将让这位老人惊悚不已。
American Retreats => 美国的撤退
In all of these cases, regional stability of sorts emerged after an American military withdrawal, albeit at the cost of a significant loss of life. => 所有这些案例在美国撤军之后都出现了某种地区稳定，虽然是以损失大量生命为代价获得的。
America’s former adversaries either became preoccupied with consolidating or sharing power, suffered domestic defeat, or confronted neighboring states. => 美国原来的敌人不是全力关注巩固或瓜分权力，遭受国内失败，就是对阵邻国。
Ultimately, America’s vital interests prevailed. => 最后，美国的切身利益将会胜出。
The evidence today suggests that this pattern can be repeated when the United States departs Mesopotamia and leaves Iraqis to define their own fate. => 今日的证据表明，当美国离开美索不达米亚，让伊拉克人决定他们自己命运的时候，将会再现同样的模式。
Of the four withdrawals, arguably the 1982-1984 American intervention in Lebanon marks the closest parallel to Iraq today. => 在四次撤退中，1982年至1984年美国介入黎巴嫩被论证为和今天介入伊拉克最为相似。

A country torn by sectarian violence beginning in 1975, Lebanon pitted an even more complex array of contestants against each other than Iraq does today. => 1975年开始的派别之争撕裂了黎巴嫩，这个国家陷入比今日的伊拉克更复杂的派别敌对之中。 ，

The massacres in Palestinian refugee camps prompted a new commitment to “restore a strong and central government” to Lebanon, to quote President Ronald Reagan. => 发生在巴勒斯坦难民营里的屠杀又促成了一个新任务，用罗纳德·里根总统的话来说，就是“为黎巴嫩重建一个强大的中央政府 ” 。

But the result of intervention was that US forces became just one more target, culminating in the 1983 bombing of a US Marine barracks that killed 241 American soldiers. => 但介入的结果是美军也成了目标，以1983年一座海军营房被炸而告终，共有241名士兵在爆炸中丧生。
A similar suicide bombing two days later claimed the lives of 58 French soldiers. => 两天后，同样的自杀式爆炸致使58名法军士兵丧命。
In February 1984, facing a quagmire, Reagan acceded to Vice President George H.W. Bush’s recommendation to get out of Lebanon. => 1984年2月，面对困境的里根同意了副总统乔治·H·W·布什的建议从黎巴嫩撤军。
But the withdrawal of Western forces did not stop the fighting. => 但西方军队的退出并没有让战争结束。
In 1992, the sirens of Somalia’s political collapse lured the US into another civil war to save a country from itself. => 1992年，索马里政治崩盘的警报致使美国介入另一场内战来拯救一个国家。

The US humanitarian mission to that benighted country sought to salvage a failed United Nations enterprise to secure and feed Somalia’s ravaged population. => 美国在那个黑暗国家中的人道主义使命致力于完成联合国已经破产的任务，对索马里被劫掠的人民实施保护，提供食品。
The US committed 28,000 troops, which for a time imposed a modicum of security. => 美国调遣了28000名成员的部队，暂时还能勉强维持和平。
The ensuing bloodbath of US soldiers generated images that the American public could not stomach, prompting the exit of American and then UN forces. => 美军士兵之后的大屠杀树立起美国公众难以接受的形象，迫使美国军队和联合国部队先后撤军。
In 2006, the capture of Somalia’s capital, Mogadishu, by the Islamic Courts raised the specter of a jihadist state. => 2006年，索马里首都被伊斯兰法院联盟占领，人们担心会一个杰哈德圣战者国家会由此出现。
But Somalia soon demonstrated that quagmires can be a two-way street. => 但是索马里很快显示困境也有两条路。
Following Ethiopia’s intervention, the Islamists found themselves out of power. => 在埃塞俄比亚的干预下，伊斯兰分子发现他们被权力摒弃在外。
Today, Somalia remains a dysfunctional state, as rival clans, jihadists, and an interim government with Ethiopian support compete for power. => 今天，索马里依然是个混乱不堪运转不灵的国家，敌对的部族，杰哈德圣战者，和埃塞俄比亚支持的过渡政府彼此争权夺利。
The US, now out of the quagmire, exercises limited influence from afar. => 摆脱泥潭的美国现在只在远处施加有限的影响。
But the US saw things very differently in the 1960’s, when the ghosts of Munich hovered over Vietnam’s jungles. => 但在慕尼黑的幽灵盘旋在越南丛林中的1960年代，美国看到的东西可是大不一样。

As President George W. Bush argued about the war in Iraq, US President Lyndon Johnson predicted that defeat in Vietnam “would be renewed in one country and then another.” => 就像乔治·W·布什为伊拉克战争所做的辩护一样，美国总统林登·约翰逊预测说在越南的失败“将在一个国家，然后又一个国家里重现 ” 。
What Johnson failed to foresee were the domestic and regional constraints that would prevent the dominos from falling in the way he predicted. => 约翰逊没有预测到的是某些国内和区域内的限制因素，这些因素将会阻止多米诺骨牌按他预计的方式滑落。
Although the US bombed northeastern Cambodia intensely throughout the Vietnam War years, it had no stomach for a ground commitment there. => 虽然在整个越南战争期间，美国对柬埔寨的东北方狂轰乱炸，却没有胃口展开地面行动。
Still within congressional restraints, the Nixon administration attempted to bolster Cambodia’s military government. => 还是在国会的限制内，尼克松政府试图支持柬埔寨军政府。
But, despite modest material support, the US could not sustain a government that could not sustain itself. => 但是，虽然提供了一定的物质元祖，美国无力维系一个不能维系自身的政府。
Rather than the dominos falling following America’s retreat from Saigon in 1975, a Vietnam-Cambodian War ensued. => 1975年美国从西贡撤军后，多米诺骨牌没有滑落，反而爆发了越南和柬埔寨之间的战争。
This in turn stimulated China’s unsuccessful intervention in North Vietnam. => 随后这又促使中国对北越展开不成功的干涉。

The withdrawal by all of these invading armies to the recognized international boundaries demonstrated that nationalist forces were dominant in the region, not communist solidarity. => 所有这些侵略军队撤回到国际承认的边界线显示出这个地区占优势的是民族主义者的力量，而不是共产主义者的团结。
None of these American exits was without consequence. => 没有任何一次美国撤军是不产生后果的。
But, while the US suffered costs to its reputation around the world, the supposed advantages from this for America’s opponents proved illusory. => 但是，当美国承受在世界范围内声名扫地的代价时，认为美国的敌人会从中获益已经证明是虚幻的。

America’s departure from Mesopotamia will likewise put the burden of problem solving onto Iraqis and other regional players, leaving the US offshore to assist when and where it deems appropriate. => 美国撤离美索不达米亚也会同样把解决问题的负担交给伊拉克人和其他该地区的博弈者，美国的海外军队则会在合适的时间和地点介入其中。
History suggests that, in fits and starts, Iraq, like Vietnam and Lebanon, will find itself able to sort out its own affairs. => 历史表明，在起起伏伏之间，伊拉克将会如同越南和黎巴嫩一样，发现自己能够处理自身的事务。
Gun Nation => 枪之国

NEW YORK – Defending the right of United States citizens to buy semi-automatic rifles or carry concealed weapons is akin to denying any human responsibility for climate change. => 纽约—捍卫美国公民购买半自动步枪或携带隐蔽武器与否认人类需要为气候变化负任何责任异曲同工。
Rational arguments are not the point. => 重点不是理性辩论。

No matter how many schoolchildren are gunned down or what the scientific evidence may be for the effects of carbon dioxide emissions, people will not change beliefs that define their identity. => 有多少学生倒在枪口下或者有多少科学证据证明二氧化碳排放的影响并不重要，人类不会改变决定了他们的身份的信念。
They will often do so with the zeal of religious believers who feel that their God has been offended. => 他们常常以宗教信徒的狂热来进行反驳，就像感到自己的神祇被攻击了那样。
Collective identities have a history, of course. => 当然，集体身份有其历史。
Interpretation of this amendment has been contested terrain, but the original idea was that citizen militias should be armed. => 对这一修正案的解读一直是争议领域，但最初的思想是公民子弟兵应该得到武装。
For many Americans, especially in rural areas and in the southern states, this collective entitlement became akin to a God-given individual right. => 对很多美国人，特别是农村地区和南方州的美国人来说，这一集体权利好比是天赋个人权利。
Demagogues have had great success pitting such people against coastal and urban elites who supposedly want to strip them of this right. => 鼓动家在煽动这些人反对沿海和城市精英方面取得了巨大的成功，说沿海和城市精英想要剥夺他们的权利。
The fear that demagogues exploit is rooted in more than a shared taste for hunting, or a notion of self-defense. => 鼓动家所利用的恐惧不仅仅包括狩猎的共同爱好或自卫概念。
It is about who people think they are. => 这其中还牵涉到人们认为他们到底是谁。
Take away their gun rights, and they would feel culturally and socially annihilated. => 取消了他们的持枪权，他们就会感到在文化和社会上被“废掉 ” 。
But if this is the core of many Americans’ identity, it points to an odd contradiction in their national self-image. => 但如果这就是许多美国人的身份的核心的话，就引出了他们的国家自我形象的一个矛盾之处。
The Second Amendment is of course a legal concept. => 第二修正案当然是一个法律概念。
In a way, that is true of the US itself. => 从某种角度，美国本身也是一个法律概念。
As a country of immigrants, the US is not based on shared ancestry or culture. => 作为一个移民国家，美国不是基于共同的祖先或文化。
It is based on laws – the only way a people from so many different cultural backgrounds could be bound together in a common enterprise. => 它基于法律 — — 这也是一个由不同文化背景的人组成的民族能够凝聚成一个共同体的唯一办法。

No wonder, then, that there are so many lawyers in the US, and why Americans are more litigious than, say, the Japanese, who rely more on customs and traditions. => 因此，毫不奇怪美国有如此多的律师，也毫不奇怪为何美国人比更依赖习俗和传统的额日本人更喜欢诉讼。
If the US can be said to have a civic religion, the Constitution is its holy writ. => 如果说美国有什么民间信仰的话，那么宪法就是这一信仰的圣经。
And that is precisely how conservatives treat the foundational laws, including the Second Amendment. => 而保守派就是这么对待包括第二修正案在内的根本大法的。

At the same time, however, many Americans cherish national myths, no less foundational in their way, which are in direct opposition to the idea of a nation of laws. => 但与此同时，许多美国人也同时在根本上珍视国家神话，这些神话与法律之国的思想直接冲突。
John Wayne arrives to save the citizens from the bad guys in black suits whose nefarious deeds undermine the liberty of the American frontier. => 约翰·韦恩（John Wayne）拯救黎民于身穿黑衣、无恶不作、妨碍美国西部的自由的山贼之手。
But who are those villains dressed in black? => 但身穿黑衣的反派都有谁？
They are bankers, lawyers, businessmen, and railroad builders, often representing the interests of powerful figures in the big cities on the East Coast. => 他们中有银行家、律师、商人和铁路建造商，常常代表东海岸大城市权势人物的利益。
They employ fighting men of their own, to be sure, but the black-suited men come from a world of contracts, treaties, and big government. => 诚然，他们雇用打手充当家兵，但这些黑衣人都来自契约、条约和大政府的世界。

The story of most Westerns is of a wide-open rural idyll, where man has found perfect autonomy, threatened by a state ruled by man-made laws. => 大部分西部片的故事是一曲开放的田园牧歌，人在其中找到完美的自主权，而威胁这个田园牧歌的则是由人造法律治理的国家。
The only laws the Western hero respects are those laid down by God and his own conscience. And he badly needs his gun to defend them. => 西部英雄所尊重的唯一的法律由上帝和他自己的良心写就，而他急需要枪来捍卫它们。
The Second Amendment is a sop to the myth, disguised by the fact that it is also encoded as law. => 第二修正案便是对这一神话的讨好，而披着法律的外衣。

Ronald Reagan understood the mythical yearning of many Americans better than most presidents, perhaps because he had acted in a number of Westerns himself. => 里根比大部分总统都更能明白许多美国人对神话的向往，这也许是因为他本人演过很多西部角色。
In a far coarser and more belligerent way, Donald Trump has followed Reagan’s example. => 特朗普则以更粗俗和挑衅的方式效仿了里根的例子。
In fact, he really is a kind of outlaw, with no use for norms of civility in government. => 事实上，他是真正的法外之徒，在政府中完全不讲礼仪规范。
Trump is a New York hustler who can tap into the fears of Bible Belt gun-lovers. => 特朗普是一个纽约骗子，能够利用圣经地带（Bible Belt）枪支热爱者的恐惧。
To overcome the dangerous fissures that are tearing its society apart, the US must find a president who can bridge the cultural divide. => 要弥合正在撕裂社会的危险的裂纹，美国必须找到一位能够连接缺口的总统。
Alas, it could not have chosen a man less suited to the task. => 可惜，没有比特朗普更不适合这个任务的人了。
My Apology Tour => 我的道歉之旅
STOWE, VERMONT – American presidents are supposed to take America’s side when dealing with other countries. => 斯托，佛蒙特州—美国总统理应在于其他国家打交道时，站在美国的一边。

When Barack Obama was (falsely) accused of starting his term with a Middle East “apology tour,” it was understood that apologizing to foreigners would have been a bad thing, if true. => 奥巴马开始其中东“道歉之旅”时，被（错误）的指责，人们认为向外国人道歉是一件坏事（如果是真的话 ） 。
But while US presidents are not supposed to apologize for their country, nothing says that professors can’t. => 但即便美国总统不应该为他的国家道歉，教授则没有这些禁忌。
Here goes: => 我来倒一次歉：
Dear World: Not all Americans pay attention to foreign affairs. => 情爱的世界：不是所有美国人都关注外交事务。
But presuming to speak on behalf of many who do: we are abjectly remorseful for inflicting Trump on you. => 但斗胆代表许多关心国际事务的美国人说：我们万分懊悔让你碰到了特朗普。
Many of you deserve a dedicated apology. => 许多人都应该得到诚挚的道歉。
In alphabetical order: => 按字母排序：
Dear Africa: We apologize for Trump’s obscene remarks insulting your countries in January. => 亲爱的非洲：我们为特朗普1月份冒犯你们的国家的猥琐言论致歉。
Dear Britain: While visiting your country this month, Trump thoughtlessly undermined the political position of Prime Minister Theresa May. => 亲爱的英国：在这个月访问你们国家时，特朗普鲁莽地破坏了首相梅的政治立场。
Sorry for that, and for his mendacious attacks on London mayor Sadiq Khan. => 很抱歉，同样抱歉的还有他对伦敦市长沙迪克·汗（Sadiq Khan）的子虚乌有的攻击。

Dear Central America: You were invisible to us until a small number of desperate refugee families reached our border, whereupon we separated small children from their families and locked them all up. => 亲爱的中美洲：在一些绝望的难民家庭来到我们的国境线前以前，我们几乎没有注意你们过，你们来到我们的国境线前，是因为我们将幼儿与他们的家庭分离，并把他们都关了起来。
How can we erase this stain? => 我们如何洗去这个污点？
We could help your countries develop, if we tried, and at a far lower cost than the doomed wars in Afghanistan and Iraq. => 我们可以帮助你们发展，如果我们尝试的话，并且成本要比该死的阿富汗和伊拉克战争低得多。
Dear China: We apologize for giving you piles of paper (Treasury bills) in exchange for all the neat merchandise you have been sending us. => 亲爱的中国：我们为用纸（美国国债）换取了你们运给我们的精致商品致歉。
It’s not fair. => 这不公平。
On the other hand, your current-account surplus peaked at 10% of GDP in 2007, and now stands at a mere 1.3% of GDP. => 另一方面，你们的经常项目盈余在2007年达到了峰值，占GDP的10 % ， 而现在只占GDP的1.3 % 。
So now you are getting real goods and services in exchange for your exports. => 因此，现在你们的出口给你们换来了真正的商品和服务。
But we would. => 但我们不会。
Dear European Union: We are sorry that Trump called you a foe and that he cheers on the forces trying to fracture you. => 亲爱的欧盟：对不起，特朗普说你们是敌人，还说他要为拆散你们的力量鼓掌。
Sorry for those steel and aluminum tariffs, too. => 对不起，特朗普对你们征收了钢和铝关税。
Oh, and sorry for all those refugees we unleashed on you when we destabilized the Middle East. => 哦，同样对不起的是所有难民，他们是因为我们动摇了中东才逃到你们那里的。
Dear France: Your president, Emmanuel Macron, made an excellent effort to befriend Trump while sticking to principle. => 亲爱的法国：你们的总统马克龙做出了了不起的尝试，既对特朗普示好，又能坚持原则。

We are sorry that it did not get him anywhere and in particular that Trump, ignoring European pleas, subsequently reneged on the 2015 Iran nuclear deal. => 很抱歉这并没有打动他，特别需要致歉的是，特朗普无视欧洲的吁求，随后撕毁了2015年伊朗核协议。
Dear Germany: Sorry that Trump has repeatedly insulted Chancellor Angela Merkel. => 亲爱的德国：对不起，特朗普 多次攻击你们的总理默克尔。
Usually we keep our word. => 通常我们不会食言。
Dear Ireland: We are sorry that Trump apparently believes you are part of the United Kingdom and that you like him. => 亲爱的爱尔兰：很抱歉，特朗普显然认为你们是英国的一部分，并且你们很喜欢他。
We know you aren’t and don’t. => 我们知道你们不是，也不喜欢他。

Dear Japan: Prime Minister Shinzo Abe is one of many foreign leaders to learn that cozying up to Trump works only while he is standing next to you. => 亲爱的日本：首相安倍晋三和许多外国领导人一样，都领教到了只有在特朗普和你站在一起时，讨好他才有效果。
In fact, Japan was the only major US ally not granted even a temporary exemption from Trump’s 25% steel tariff. => 事实上，日本是唯一一个连25%的钢关税的临时豁免都没有获得 的美国主要盟友。
Also, we are sorry for Trump’s apparent indifference to North Korea’s ability to strike you (and South Korea) militarily. => 此外，很抱歉特朗普显然漠不关心朝鲜拥有军事打击你们（还有韩国）的能力。
Dear Mexico: What can I say? => 亲爱的墨西哥：我还能说什么呢？
We know that “criminals” and “rapists” are in fact far less common among immigrants from Mexico and elsewhere than among native-born Americans. => 我们知道 ， “ 犯罪分子”和“强进犯”在墨西哥和其他国际移民群体中间要比土上土长的美国人中间罕见得多。
We know that you will not pay to build a border wall. => 我们知道，你们不会为边境墙买单。

We know that renegotiating the North American Free Trade Agreement in a way that would satisfy Trump, particularly the demand for periodic renewal, is not an option. => 我们知道，以令特朗普满意的方式重新谈判北美自由贸易协定，特别是要求定期修订，绝不是一个选项。
Dear Philippines, Russia, Turkey, Egypt, and others: We understand the historic attraction of a strong leader who claims to get things done. => 亲爱的菲律宾、俄罗斯、土耳其、埃及和其他国家：我们明白，宣称会带领国家走上正轨的强力领导人有其历史吸引力。

But your “strongmen” do not help your countries in the long run, and we are sorry that Trump’s disdain for the rule of law aids their economic mismanagement and human-rights abuses. => 但你们的“强人”从长期看对你们的国家没有助益，很抱歉，特朗普对法治的蔑视助长了他们的经济管理不善和人权侵犯。
