Dear South Korea: We are sorry that Trump’s eagerness to match Kim Jong-un insult for insult last year stoked fears of a catastrophic war on the Korean Peninsula. => 亲爱的韩国：对不起，去年特朗普急于对金正恩以牙还牙，导致你们担心朝鲜半岛会爆发灾难性战争。
President Moon Jae-in deserves the Nobel Peace Prize for ratcheting down the risk of conflict. => 文在寅总统遏制了冲突风险，应该获得诺贝尔和平奖。

It’s too bad that, following Trump’s summit with Kim in June, he didn’t consult you before announcing the discontinuation of joint military exercises, while getting nothing in exchange. => 在今年6月与金正恩举行峰会后，特朗普在不与你们协商的情况下就宣布中止联合军演，并没有因此获得任何回报，这真是太糟糕了。
Dear Sweden: Sorry that Trump on February 19, 2017, fabricated a terrorist attack “last night in Sweden.” => 亲爱的瑞典：对不起，2017年2月19日特朗普捏造了“昨晚在瑞典”的恐怖袭击。
Dear Ukraine: Trump’s historical memory appears not to go back as far as 2014, when Russia invaded you. => 亲爱的乌克兰：特朗普的历史记忆似乎不会超过2014年俄罗斯入侵你们的那一刻。
Or if it does, he says it’s okay because so many Ukrainians speak Russian. => 或者他有这么长远的记忆，并表示这没什么，因为很多乌克兰人讲俄语。
Sorry for that – and that Trump’s campaign manager, Paul Manafort, now in jail, worked for the pro-Russian side in Ukraine. => 对不起。 同样对不起的是，特朗普的竞选经理保罗·马纳福特（Paul Manafort，现已锒铛入狱）在乌克兰站在亲俄派这一边。

Dear Venezuela: We regret that Trump is prolonging the life of your awful government by threatening invasion and giving the leaders a scapegoat for their humanitarian disaster. => 亲爱的委内瑞拉：很遗憾，特朗普用威胁入侵和为领导人寻找人道主义灾难的替罪羊来延长你们的十恶不赦的政府的性命。
I also apologize to every country I left out of this tour. => 我也为这场道歉之旅没有经过的国家道歉。
Trump’s demolition of the rules-based, truth-based, pro-trade world order hurts everyone. => 特朗普对基于规则和事实、支持贸易的世界秩序的背叛让所有人都蒙受了损失。
Please keep our seat warm at international meetings and organizations. => 请在国际会议和组织上为我们暖席。
The real US will return. => 真正的美国会回来的。
Trump’s Deplorables => 特朗普的可悲之徒

NEW YORK – Hillary Clinton, the Democratic US presidential nominee, recently described supporters of her opponent, Donald Trump, as a “basket of deplorables.” => 纽约—民主党美国总统提名人希拉里·克林顿最近把支持她的对手唐纳德·特朗普的人称为“一群可悲之徒 ” 。
It was neither a tactful nor an elegant phrase, and she later apologized for her remark. => 这个用词不得体，也不优雅，随后她因为此番评论而道歉。
But she was more right than wrong. => 但她是对的。
Trump has attracted many supporters whose views on race, for example, are indeed deplorable. => 特朗普吸引了许多支持者，他们的有些观点确实可悲，比如种族观点。
The problem is that many of these deplorable voters are also relatively uneducated, which makes Clinton’s remark look snobbish. => 问题在于许多这些可悲选民相对而言教育程度较低，这让克林顿的评价显得有些势利。
Alas, the United States has too many relatively uneducated people. => 唉，美国有太多教育程度相对较低的人。
Among developed countries, the US ranks low in terms of literacy, general knowledge, and science. => 在发达国家中，美国识字率、常识和科学排名很低。
Japanese, South Koreans, Dutch, Canadians, and Russians score consistently higher. => 日本、韩国、荷兰和俄罗斯的得分比美国高很多。

This is at least partly the result of leaving education too much to the market: those with money are highly educated, and those with insufficient means are not educated enough. => 这至少部分是因为教育过于依赖市场：有钱的人受到更好的教育，没有门路的受教育不足。
Does this mean that there is a link between education – or the lack of it – and the appeal of a dangerous demagogue? => 这是否意味着教育（或缺少教育）与危险的煽动家的吸引力之间存在关联？

One of the most remarkable things about Trump is the extent of his own ignorance, despite his high educational attainment, and the fact that he seems to benefit from flaunting it. => 特朗普身上一个最引人关注的特点是他自身的无知，尽管他受过高等教育，以及他从炫耀自己的无知中获益这一事实。
Perhaps it is easier for a loud-mouthed ignoramus to convince large numbers of people whose knowledge of the world is as slight as his own. => 也许大嗓门的无知者更容易让大量对世界的知识与他一样贫乏人们相信自己。
But this is to assume that factual truth matters in the rhetoric of a populist agitator. => 但这不啻认为事实真相在民粹主义搅局者的修辞中至关重要。
Many of his supporters don’t seem to care much about reasoned argument – that is for the liberal snobs. => 特朗普的许多支持者对理性观点没有什么兴趣 — — 这是自由主义小人关注的东西。
Emotions count more, and the prime emotions that demagogues manipulate, in the US and elsewhere, are fear, resentment, and distrust. => 情绪更重要，而在美国和其他国家，煽动家所操纵的主要情绪是恐惧、怨恨和不信任。
This was also true in Germany when Hitler came to power. => 希特勒掌权的德国也是如此。
But the Nazi Party in its early days did not find the bulk of its support among the least educated. => 但纳粹党初期的支持者主要不是来自教育程度最低的群体。

Urban factory workers and conservative Catholics were, on the whole, less susceptible to Hitler’s blandishments than many more highly educated Protestants. => 总体而言，相对许多教育程度更高的新教徒，城市工厂工人和保守的天主教徒对希特勒的花言巧语比较不敏感。
Low educational standards do not explain Hitler’s rise. => 低教育程度无法解释希特勒的崛起。
Fear, resentment, and distrust ran very high in Weimar Germany, after the humiliation of wartime defeat and amid a devastating economic depression. => 恐惧、怨恨和不信任程度在魏玛德国很高，当时一战的失败以及灾难性经济萧条让德国人充满了羞辱感。
But the racial prejudices whipped up by Nazi propagandists were not the same as the ones we see among many Trump supporters today. => 但纳粹宣传机器煽动的种族偏见与我们今天常见于特朗普支持者的种族偏见不同。
The Jews were seen as a sinister force that was dominating the elite professions: bankers, professors, lawyers, news media, or entertainment. => 犹太人被视为一股邪恶势力，他们主宰了精英职业：银行家、教授、律师、新闻媒体以及娱乐。
They were the so-called back-stabbers who prevented Germany from being great again. => 他们是所谓的背后搞鬼者，让德国无法再次走向伟大。

The Trump supporters are showing a similar animus against symbols of the elite, such as Wall Street bankers, “mainstream” media, and Washington insiders. => 特朗普的支持者也表现出类似的对精英象征的仇恨，如华尔街银行家 、 “ 主流”媒体以及华盛顿局内人。
It is a question of relatively underprivileged people in a globalizing, increasingly multi-cultural world, resenting those who are even less privileged. => 这是一个在全球化的、文化日益多元的世界中相对弱势群体仇恨比他们还要弱势的群体的问题。
By cleaning out the stables, it is hoped, greatness will return. => 他们希望，通过彻底的“打扫房子”可以恢复昔日荣光。
In Hitler’s Germany, this hope existed among all classes, whether elite or plebeian. => 在希特勒德国，这一希望存在于所有阶级中间，不管是精英还是草根。
In Trump’s America, it thrives mostly among the latter. => 在特朗普的美国，这一希望主要在草根中间兴盛。

Likewise, immigrants and ethnic minorities who seek to improve their lot have no interest in joining a populist rebellion directed mainly against them, which is why they will vote for Clinton. => 类似地，追求改善生活的移民和少数民族没有兴趣加入主要针对他们的反动，这也是他们投票支持克林顿的原因。
Trump must thus rely on disaffected white Americans who feel that they are being left behind. => 因此，特朗普必须依靠认为自己被抛弃的不满的美国白人。
The fact that enough people feel that way to sustain such an unsuitable presidential candidate is an indictment of US society. => 深有同感的人多到足够支持特朗普这样的根本不合格的总统候选人，这一事实表明美国社会已经病入膏肓。

This does have something to do with education – not because well-educated people are immune to demagogy, but because a broken education system leaves too many people at a disadvantage. => 这确实与教育有一定关系 — — 因为教育程度较高这能够对煽动免疫，也因为拙劣的教育体系让太多人成为弱势群体。
In the past, there were enough industrial jobs for less-educated voters to make a decent living. => 在过去，有足够的产业工作岗位留给教育程度较低的选民，让他们过上体面的生活。
Now that those jobs are vanishing in post-industrial societies, too many people feel that they have nothing more to lose. => 如今，这些工作岗位正在后工业社会中逐渐消失，太多人觉得自己已经输无可输。
The Double Standard of America’s China Trade Policy => 美国对华贸易政策的双重标准
CAMBRIDGE – A high-profile United States trade delegation appears to have returned empty-handed from its mission in China. => 坎布里奇—高规格美国贸易代表团双手空空地从中国回到了美国。
The result is hardly a surprise, given the scale and one-sided nature of the US demands. => 这个结果并不出乎意料，因为美国的要求完全是单边漫天要价。
This is not the first trade spat with China, and it will not be the last. => 这不是第一次与中国发生贸易争端，也不会是最后一次。
China, in particular, would become more “Western” in the way that it manages its economy. => 特别是中国的经济管理方法将变得更加“西方 ” 。
Instead, the continued divergence of economic systems has been a fertile source of trade friction. => 相反，经济制度的不断分化成为贸易摩擦的温床。
There are good reasons for China – and other economies – to resist the pressure to conform to a mold imposed on them by US export lobbies. => 中国和其他经济体有很好的理由拒绝美国贸易游说团体强加给它们的压力。

After all, China’s phenomenal globalization success is due as much to the regime’s unorthodox and creative industrial policies as it is to economic liberalization. => 毕竟，中国取得了巨大的全球化的成功，其体制的创造性非正统产业政策的功劳不亚于经济自由化。

China’s current strategy, the “Made in China 2025” initiative, aims to build on these achievements to catapult the country to advanced-economy status. => 中国当前的战略 — — “中国制造2025”计划旨在在这些成就的基础上更进一步，让中国跻身发达经济行列。
The fact that many of China’s policies violate WTO rules is plain enough. => 中国的许多政策违反了世贸组织规则，这一事实是显而易见的。

China plays the globalization game by what we might call Bretton Woods rules, after the much more permissive regime that governed the world economy in the early postwar period. => 中国用我们可称之为布雷顿森林规则的东西来玩全球化这场游戏，在此之前，战后早期治理世界经济的机制更加宽松。
As a Chinese official once explained to me, the strategy is to open the window but place a screen on it. => 一位中国官员曾经向我解释，中国的战略是打开窗户，再树一块屏风。

They get the fresh air (foreign investment and technology) while keeping out the harmful elements (volatile capital flows and disruptive imports). => 如此，他们获得了新鲜空气（外国投资核技术 ） ， 又屏蔽了有害元素（高波动的资本流和破坏性进口品 ） 。
In fact, China’s practices are not much different from what all advanced countries have done historically when they were catching up with others. => 事实上，中国的所作所为与所有发达国家在历史上互相赶超时的所作所为并无很大区别。
One of the main US complaints against China is that the Chinese systematically violate intellectual property rights in order to steal technological secrets. => 美国对中国的最大抱怨点之一是中国系统性地违反知识产权以窃取技术机密。

But in the nineteenth century, the US was in the same position in relation to the technological leader of the time, Britain, as China is today vis-à-vis the US. => 但在十九世纪，美国与当时的技术领导者英国的关系正如今天中国与美国的关系。
And the US had as much regard for British industrialists’ trade secrets as China has today for American intellectual property rights. => 美国对英国产业家的贸易秘密的关注也正如今天中国对美国知识产权的关注。

The fledgling textile mills of New England were desperate for technology and did their best to steal British designs and smuggle in skilled British craftsmen. => 新英格兰地区方兴未艾的纺织厂渴望获得技术，竭尽全力窃取英国的设计，挖掘熟练英国匠人。
The US did have patent laws, but they protected only US citizens. => 美国确实有专利法，但只保护美国公民。
As one historian of US business has put it, the Americans “were pirates, too.” => 一位美国商业史学家指出，美国“也是盗版之徒。 ”
Levels of development, values, and historical trajectories differ too much for countries to be shoehorned into a specific model of capitalism. => 各国的发展水平、价值观和历史轨迹大相径庭，无法硬塞进具体的资本主义模式。
Sometimes domestic policies will backfire and keep foreign investors out and the domestic economy impoverished. => 有时，国内政策会适得其反，让外国投资者逃离，国内经济陷入贫困。
Countries pursuing harmful policies that blunt their development prospects are doing the greatest damage to themselves. => 采取有害政策扼杀发展前景的国家，伤害最多的使它们自己。
Many liberal commentators in the US think Trump is right to go after China. => 许多美国的自由派评论家认为特朗普抓住中国不放是正确的。
Their objection is to his aggressive, unilateralist methods. => 他们反对的是他的激进的单边主义方法。
Yet the fact is that Trump’s trade agenda is driven by a narrow mercantilism that privileges the interests of US corporations over other stakeholders. => 但事实上，特朗普的贸易日程背后是狭隘的重商主义，美国公司利益严格高于其他相关利益。
It shows little interest in policies that would improve global trade for all. => 特朗普对于改善总体全球贸易的政策毫无兴趣。

Such policies should start from the trade regime’s Golden Rule: do not impose on other countries constraints that you would not accept if faced with their circumstances. => 这些政策应该从贸易机制的黄金规则开始：己所不欲，勿施于人。
America’s Ongoing Civil War => 美国正在进行的内战
NEW YORK –America continues be in a state of civil war. => 纽约 — — 美国继续处于内战状态。
Not just a civil war, but the civil war. => 这不仅是一场普通的内战，而是美国内战。
In the first round, back in the 1860s, the Confederacy lost. => 回溯到19世纪60年代的第一回合，邦联战败。
Yet now the Confederacy is temporarily on top. => 但现在邦联暂时处于领先地位。
The United States remains one country divided by two cultures. => 美国仍然被两种文化所割裂。
From the start, the US has been a battleground of two competing visions. => 从一开始，美国就一直有两种愿景在激烈交锋。
America’s founding credo was that “all men are created equal.” => 美国的创始信条是“人人生而平等 ” 。
Yet the founding reality was that white males were far more equal than everyone else. => 但建国时的现状却是白人男性所得到的平等远远超过其他人。
White men owned slaves, denied the vote to women, and took the lands and lives of native Americans. => 白人拥有奴隶，剥夺了女性的投票权，并剥夺了印第安原住民的土地和生存权。

During the 1861-1865 Civil War, the slaveholding Confederacy, formed by 13 secessionist states, was defeated by 19 northern states and then occupied by the federal government for a dozen years. => 1861-1865年内战期间，由13个分裂州组成的蓄奴邦联最终被19个北方州所击败，而后被联邦政府占领了十几年。
From that moment, Southern white voters deserted the Democratic Party en masse. => 从那时起，南方白人选民不约而同地抛弃了民主党。

The Republicans thereby became the party of the South, and the Democrats the party of the Northeast and Pacific West, with the Midwest and western mountain states the swing regions. => 共和党也由此成为南方政党，民主党代表东北地区和太平洋西部，而中西部和西部山区则成为摇摆区。
The industrial Great Lakes region tended toward the Democrats while the Midwestern farm states and mountain states leaned Republican. => 工业发达的五大湖区相对倾向于民主党，而共和党则更容易得到中西部各农业和山地州的支持。
The Midwestern and mountain states also carried the frontier culture of white settlers suppressing native Americans and Asian and Hispanic immigrants. => 各中西部和山地州还盛行白人定居者的边疆文化，他们鼓吹镇压美国土著、亚裔及西班牙裔移民。
Gun ownership marks another divide between Democrats and Republicans. => 枪支所有权标志着民主和共和党人之间的又一个分歧。
The Republican Party’s gun culture reflects the same cultural forces that shape its anti-minority views. => 共和党的枪支文化其实是决定其反少数族裔观点的同样一种文化力量的反映。

Both before and after the Civil War, poor Southern whites accepted their lowly status because they prized their superiority over even more desperate African-Americans. => 内战前后，贫穷的南方白人接受了自己的卑微地位，因为他们看重自己相对于更为绝望的非洲裔美国人所具备的身份上的优越。

Racial politics thus blocked the emergence of class politics, which would have brought poor whites and poor blacks together to demand more public services paid for by higher taxes on elite whites. => 种族政治因此阻碍了阶级政治的崛起，而阶级政治本来可能让贫穷的白人和黑人携起手来，共同要求为提供更多公共服务而向白人精英层增税。
Of the 26 senators representing the 13 former Confederate states today, 21 are Republicans and five are Democrats. => 在今天代表13个前邦联州的26名参议员中，21名来自共和党，来自民主党的仅有5名。

Of the 38 senators now representing the 19 northern states of 1861, 27 are Democrats and nine are Republicans (two Independents, Bernie Sanders and Angus King, caucus with the Democrats). => 而在今天代表1861年19个北方州的38位参议员中，27人来自民主党，而来自共和党的仅有9名（还有2名是独立无党派人士，伯尼桑·德斯和安格斯·金，他们往往与民主党人保持一致 ） 。
President Donald Trump is a geographical anomaly, a pro-southern racist from liberal New York. => 唐纳德·特朗普总统从地理角度看属于异数，是一名来自自由纽约的亲南方种族主义份子。
Trump, a champion of the white male southern culture, is shunned by his home state (59% disapproval as of September 2018). => 特朗普拥护崇尚白人男性的南方文化，导致他自己的家乡避之唯恐不及（截止2018年9月调查显示59%的不赞成率 ） 。
He is more Mississippi than Manhattan. => 他不像来自曼哈顿，更像来自密西西比。
The cultural divide was on full display in the Senate proceedings that recently confirmed Judge Brett Kavanaugh to the US Supreme Court. => 上述文化鸿沟在最近确定布雷特·卡瓦诺法官美国最高法院法官提名的过程中得到了充分的展示。
Mitch McConnell of Kentucky, a former slave state, successfully orchestrated Kavanaugh’s confirmation. => 来自前奴隶州肯塔基的米奇·麦康奈尔成功策划了卡瓦诺的提名确认。
John Kennedy of Louisiana, another former Confederate state, called the hearings “an intergalactic freak show.” => 约翰·肯尼迪出生于另一个前邦联州路易斯安那，他用“银河系级别的畸形秀”来形容这次听证会。
The Democrats and Republicans are parties not just of different cultures and regions, but also of different economies. => 民主和共和党不仅是来自不同文化和地区的政党，而且也代表着不同的经济。
The Northeast and Pacific states lead the US in high technology, innovation, higher education, well-paying jobs, and per capita income. => 东北和太平洋各州一直引领美国的高科技、创新、高等教育、高薪工作和人均收入。
The South lags far behind. => 南方则远远不能与之相比。
Working-class southern whites would have much to gain from abandoning the Republicans’ race-based politics in favor of class-based politics. => 来自工薪阶层的南方白人如果愿意放弃共和党所奉行的种族政治，转而信奉阶级政治会得到很多好处。
The declining predominance of non-Hispanic whites in the total population has probably widened America’s cultural divide during the past 20 years. => 非西班牙裔白人在总人口中所占主导地位不断下降可能在过去二十年里扩大了美国的文化差异。
And with non-Hispanic whites expected to become a minority of the total population by around 2045, America’s ongoing civil war could worsen. => 因为预计到2045年左右非西班牙裔白人将成为总人口中的少数，美国正在进行的内战有可能进一步加剧。

It will not end until working-class Americans of all regions, races, and ethnicities join forces to demand higher taxes and greater accountability of the rich corporate elite. => 除非所有地区、族裔和种族的工薪阶层美国人联合起来，要求富有的企业精英缴纳更多税收和承担更多责任，否则这场战争将不会结束。
America’s Exploding Deficit => 美国的赤字怒潮
CAMBRIDGE – Two recent pieces of budget news are a grim reminder of the perilous state of fiscal policy in the United States. => 发自剑桥 — — 最近两则与预算有关的新闻是对美国财政政策危机状况的严重警告。
That temporary progress reflected the economic recovery and congressional votes to limit spending on defense and nondefense discretionary programs. => 但这个短期成绩其实源自于经济复苏以及美国国会对国防和非国防可自由支配开支项目的限制决议。

The larger number of older Americans who are eligible for Social Security benefits will drive the program’s costs from 4.9% of GDP this year to 6.3% of GDP over the next 30 years. => 大量有资格领取社会保障福利的美国老年人将在未来30年使得社会保障计划支出相对GDP的比例从当前的4.9％上升至6.3 ％ 。

The Federal Reserve’s unconventional monetary policy has driven down the cost of the net interest on the federal debt to just 1.4% of GDP, despite the increase in the volume of the debt. => 尽管债务总额增加，但美联储的非常规货币政策依然拉低了联邦债务净利息的成本，使之仅相当于GDP的1.4 ％ 。

But as interest rates normalize and the volume of debt grows, the cost of servicing the interest on the national debt is projected to increase to 5.8% of GDP. => 但随着利率正常化和债务量的增长，维持国家债务利息的成本预计将增加至相当于GDP的5.8 ％ 。
That projected interest cost may be much less than it would actually be if the rest of the deficit and debt forecast turns out to be correct. => 如果赤字和债务预测的其余部分都被证明是正确的，预计利息成本可能远小于实际成本。
But investors in Treasury bonds might demand a much higher interest rate in exchange for loading up their portfolios with US debt. => 但美国国债投资者可能会要求高得多的利率来作为提高自身投资组合中国债比例的回报。
In that case, the interest cost and the debt would be much greater. => 在这种情况下，利息成本和债务会大得多。

The fact that more than half of the publicly held US government debt is now owned by foreign investors might make the interest rate even more sensitive to the debt’s relative size. => 超过一半的美国公开发行国债都由外国投资者持有的事实可能使利率对债务规模的变化更为敏感。
Foreign investors might fear that the government could adopt policies that reduced the real value of their holdings. => 外国投资者可能会担心政府会采取一些减少他们实际持有价值的政策。

Moreover, foreign investors might fear that very high debt levels could lead to inflationary monetary policy, which would depreciate the value of the dollar and lower the real value of their bonds. => 此外，外国投资者可能担心过高的债务水平可能会导致通胀性货币政策，这将导致美元贬值并降低债券的实际价值。
Here is an amazing and disturbing implication of the CBO’s forecast. => 以下是美国国会预算办公室的预测为何会令人惊讶不安的原因。
A small deficit (1.6% of GDP) would emerge even before spending on defense and other annually appropriated “discretionary” programs. => 就算把国防等每年拨付“自由裁量”项目支出都节省下来，也会出现一个小规模的赤字（相当于GDP的1.6 ％ ） 。
There is no way to offset the growth of the mandatory programs by slowing the growth of defense and other discretionary outlays. => 我们是无法借助减缓国防和其他自由裁量项目的增长来抵消强制性项目支出增长的。

Total defense spending is now just 3.2% of GDP and is expected to decline to 2.6% over the next ten years and to remain at that level for the next 20 years. => 总的国防开支仅相当于目前国内生产总值的3.2 ％ ， 并预计在未来十年内下降至2.6％并在之后20年内保持在相同水平。
That would be the lowest defense share of GDP since before World War II. => 这将是自二战前以来国防支出相对GDP比例最低的水平。
The same reduction is projected for all non-defense discretionary programs, also a record-low share of GDP. => 预计所有非国防自由裁量项目也会同步减少，也创下了相对GDP比率的最低记录。

The bright spot in this bleak picture is that it would not take much in terms of annual deficit reductions to prevent the rise in the debt ratio, or even to bring it back to where it was a decade ago. => 这种惨淡景象的亮点在于它不需要过多通过削减年度赤字以防止负债率的上升，甚至还能让后者倒退到十年前的水平。

Reducing the annual deficit by 1.7% of GDP by any combination of reduced spending and higher revenue would, if begun in 2017, prevent an increase from the current 75% debt-to-GDP ratio. => 如果能在2017年开始利用减少支出和提高收入的任意组合政策使得赤字占GDP的比例下降1.7 ％ ， 就可以避免在当前75％的债务相对GDP水平上有所增长。
And reducing the deficit by 3% a year would reverse the debt trajectory and bring it back to where it was in the decades before the recession. => 同时每年减少3%赤字将扭转债务发展的轨迹，并将其带回到��济衰退之前那几十年的状态。
Neither of the presidential candidates has indicated either a plan or an inclination to reverse the projected rise in the national debt. => 至今没有一个总统候选人发布过扭转国家债务上升预期的计划或意愿。
But it should be a top priority for whoever moves into the White House next year. => 但这应该是白宫主人明年施政的重中之重。
Given the need to act quickly to avoid the worst-case scenario, there is no excuse for waiting. => 我们没有任何借口去拖延等待，只能迅速采取行动，避免最坏情况的降临。
America’s Anti-Environmentalists => 美国的反环境保护主义者
As an American, I am appalled, ashamed, and embarrassed by my country’s lack of leadership in dealing with global warming. => 作为美国人，我对我们国家在处理全球气候变暖问题上缺乏领导作用感到惊讶、羞愧以及尴尬。
Scientific evidence on the risks mounts by the day, as most recently documented in England’s magisterial Stern Report. => 有关气候变暖风险的科学证据与日俱增。 最近，英国权威的斯特恩报告也作出了记载。

Yet, despite the fact that the United States accounts for roughly 25% of all man-made global carbon emissions, Americans show little will or inclination to temper their manic consumption. => 但是，尽管在所有的全球人造碳排放中美国占大约25 ％ ， 美国人对改变他们的消费没有表现出什么意愿或倾向。
The first George W. Bush administration was probably right to refuse to sign the so-called “Kyoto Protocol,” albeit for the wrong reasons. => 尽管出于错误的理由，布什当局在第一个任期拒绝签署所谓的“京都议定书”大概还是正确的。
Among other problems, the Kyoto Protocol does not go far enough towards redistributing carbon emission rights towards developing countries. => 京都议定书问题重重，其中之一是向发展中国家重新分配碳排放权利做得并不够。
But why can’t the US bring itself to raise taxes on gasoline and other sources of carbon emission like coal burning power plants? => 但是，为何美国就不能对汽油以及类似煤炭发电厂等其他碳排放源增税呢？
It is not like the US government, running a huge deficit despite an economic boom, does not need the money. => 尽管经济处于繁荣增长，但是美国政府还是赤字累累。 好像美国并非不需要这些钱。
Many people seem to think that the Bush administration is the problem. => 许多人认为布什是问题所在。
Put a Texas oilman and his buddies in charge and what do you expect, conservation? => 让一个德克萨斯州的石油商人和及其好友们执掌大权，你能指望什么呢？ 难道是环境保护妈？
Unfortunately, that is a facile excuse. => 不幸的是，那是一个浅显的借口。
American citizens’ resistance to moderating energy consumption for the sake of the global environment is much more deeply embedded. => 美国公民抵制为了全球环境而减少能源消费是更为根深蒂固的。
The evidence on global warming is considerably more muddled than Gore’s film suggests, but the basic problem is real. => 全球气候变暖的证据比戈尔的电影所描述的远远要模糊，但是基本问题确实真实的。
Unfortunately, however, Gore was not successful in carrying the torch on global warming when he was a politician. => 但是不幸的是，戈尔在从政期间却并未成功地高举气候变暖的火炬。
One cannot commend the 1990’s Clinton-Gore administration for taking any brave steps aimed at radically reducing carbon emissions. => 对于克林顿和戈尔当局在九十年代采取任何果敢的步骤大幅度减少碳的排放，人们并无法恭维。
Small wonder: the American public is fiercely resistant to anything that seriously forces them to compromise on their energy-burning, gas-guzzling lifestyle. => 怪不得美国公众强烈抵制任何确实迫使他们改变其大肆耗费石油的生活方式的东西。
It is not just politicians who have failed to provide leadership here. => 在这一点上，并非只有政客们没有予以提供领导。
The venerable New York Times editorial page was apparently opposed to an energy tax until only recently, when the newspaper finally endorsed the idea. => 受人尊重的纽约时报编辑版面直到最近还一直明显反对任何能源税，最后才支持这一提议。
Like many liberals, the Times’ editors worried that higher energy taxes would fall disproportionately on the poor. => 像许多自由派人士一样，该报的编辑担心更高的能源税将使穷人过多地更为不利。
The typical argument one hears is, “What about the poor guy with the gas-guzzling 1980 Chevy car, who has no other way to get to work?” => 人们听到的典型的争辩是这样的：一个开着耗油的1980年雪佛兰破车的穷人没有别的途径上班，你让他怎么办？

It is a legitimate point, but if ocean levels start rising, as the Stern Report predicts, a lot of our children will be swimming to work some day. => 这确实是有效的论点，但是，正如斯特恩报告所指出的那样，如果海平面开始上升，许多我们的孩子们就会在某一天游泳上班了。
The need for corrective measures to alleviate inequality is no excuse for inaction on global warming. => 需要采取纠正性的措施来减少贫困并不是对全球变暖无动于衷的借口。
The change of position by the Times, unfortunately, does not herald an about-face in the American electorate. => 不幸的是，纽约时报改变立场并不昭示美国选民立场的改变。
Mention the idea of an energy tax to any potential 2008 US Presidential candidate, and their faces will pale. => 如果对任何一个美国2008年总统大选可能的候选人提出能源税的问题，他们就会变色。

It is fine to say that you care about the environment or to claim, as Bush seems to do, that miracle technologies will solve the problem without too much pain. => 宣称你关心环境问题或者像布什那样说神奇的技术将会在没有很大痛苦的情况下解决问题是无关痛痒的。

But any 2008 Presidential candidate that dares to talk about making sacrifices now for a safer environment later will really be sticking his neck out. => 但是，任何敢于谈论为了将来更为安全的环境而现在作出牺牲的2008年总统候选人肯定冒很大的风险。

Until Americans suck it up and start fixing global environmental problems that they, more than anyone, have caused, it will be difficult to get the wholehearted support of the rest of the world. => 在美国人开始解决由他们比其他人所造成更多的全球环境问题之前，很难从世界其他地方得到全心全意的支持。
Developing countries ask why they should pay attention to global warming if rich countries are not prepared to curtail their own emissions sharply? => 发展中国家问道，如果富国不愿意大幅度限制它们自身的排放，为什么它们就应该关注全球气候变暖问题呢？
Why should poor countries worry about how deforestation contributes to global warming when rich countries remain so profligate? => 如果富国如此肆意挥霍，为何穷国就应该担心森林退化造成全球变暖的问题呢？
The scientific evidence suggests that carbon emissions from anywhere in the world have about the same impact on global warming. => 科学证据表明，世界任何地方的碳排放对于全球变暖具有大致相同的影响。
Such a tax is the most flexible and market-friendly approach, and would have the least impact on economic growth. => 这样的税收是最为灵活、也是亲市场的途径，而且对经济增长的影响最小。

Instead, the complex system of quotas favored by the Europeans and embodied in the Kyoto Protocol is likely to lead to much larger inefficiencies and costs. => 相反，由欧洲所倾向并且体现在京都议定书中的复杂的配额制度有可能导致更大规模的低效率和成本。

For this reason, England’s Stern Report is probably far too optimistic when it calculates that an eclectic approach to reducing carbon emissions will cost the world only 1% per year of income. => 出于这一理由，英国的斯特恩报告中有关减少碳排放的折中途径将每年只花费1％的收入的估计未免过于乐观。
But the Stern Report is still right to argue that the potential risks of continued inaction are far greater. => 但是斯特恩报告主张继续无动于衷潜在的风险远远更为巨大则是正确的。
America’s unwillingness to take the lead on environmental issues may some day be regarded as one of the country’s most profound political failures. => 某一天，美国不愿意在环境问题上发挥领导作用将会被认为是国家最为深重的政治失策。
One hopes that it changes course soon, before we all are forced to wear swimsuits to work. => 人们希望在我们所有人被迫穿游泳衣上班之前美国马上改弦更张。
A New Low for China Bashing => 诋毁中国行动的新低点
NEW HAVEN – As America’s election season nears its finish, the debate seems to have come unhinged. => 发自纽黑文 — — 随着美国的大选季节接近尾声，与选举有关的辩论似乎也变得精神错乱起来。
Get tough with China, both stressed in the presidential debates, and the pain will ease. => 两人都在大选辩论中强调：只要对中国强硬，美国人的痛苦自会有所减轻。
Nothing could be further from the truth. Consider the following charges: => 没有事情是能偏离真相的，请思考下面的这些指控：
Currency manipulation. => 货币操纵。

Since China reformed its exchange-rate regime in July 2005, the renminbi has risen 32% relative to the dollar and about 30% in inflation-adjusted terms against a broad basket of currencies. => 自从中国在2005年7月实施汇率调控机制改革以来，人民币兑美国升值了32 % ， 并在去除通胀因素后对一揽子货币升值了约30 % 。
These are hardly trivial amounts, and more renminbi appreciation can be expected in the years to come. => 这并不是一个微不足道的数目，而且预计未来数年人民币汇率还将继续上升。

Unlike Japan, which was pressured by the West into a large yen revaluation in 1985 (the “Plaza Accord”), the Chinese have opted to move gradually and deliberately. => 跟1985年在西方压力下被迫进行日元大幅升值 （ “ 广场协议 ” ） 的日本不同，中国人选择更为渐进而谨慎地行事。
American officials call this “manipulation,” arguing that market forces would have resulted in a sharper renminbi appreciation than has occurred. => 美国官员们把这个视为“操纵 ” ， 认为市场的力量本应使人民币实现比当前更大幅度的升值。

Fixated on stability – a concept alien to US politicians and policymakers – the Chinese prefer, instead, to play a more active role in managing the adjustment of their currency. => 而相反中国人则痴迷于维护稳定 — — 这是一个美国政客和政策制定者都不熟悉的概念 — — 也因此喜欢在管理调整自身货币方面承担更积极的角色。
I call that prudence – perhaps even wisdom. => 我把这称之为谨慎 — — 或者甚至是明智。
Two lost decades later, the guinea pig, Japan, might have a view on which approach works best. => 在经历了20年的迷失之后，日本这个实验品或许会知道哪种方法更加合适。
Outsourcing and intellectual property. => 业务外包和知识产权。
Notwithstanding some recent modest improvements in the US labor market, America’s job situation remains terrible. => 尽管美国的劳动力市行在最近稍有起色，美国的就业情况依然糟糕。
Private-sector employment is still down 4.1 million from its January 2008 peak. => 私人部门的就业人数依然比2008年1月的高峰期少了410万。
Yet there is not a shred of evidence to support bipartisan claims that this ongoing carnage is the result of outsourcing US manufacturing jobs to China. => 但这根本不足以支撑两党关于当前危机源于美国制造业职位外包给中国的论调。

Weak demand – especially the post-crisis collapse in consumer spending growth – is a far more likely culprit than China in explaining the recent hiring shortfall. => 相比于中国来说，需求疲软 — — 尤其是消费者支出增长在危机爆发后的暴跌 — — 更像是最近雇佣需求下滑的罪魁祸首。

About 50% of all exports leaving China have been processed previously by other economies, and close to 60% are shipped by Chinese subsidiaries of “foreign-invested enterprises.” => 约有50%的中国出口商品之前曾在其他经济体中进行加工，近60%的产品都是由所谓“外资企业”的中国子公司送出国外的。
The trade deficit. => 贸易逆差。

Yes, the US runs a massive trade deficit with China – around $295 billion in 2011, or fully 40% of America’s total merchandise trade gap of $738 billion. => 没错，美国对中国存在着巨大的贸易逆差 — — 2011年约为2950亿美元，相当于美国7380亿美元商品贸易总缺口的40 % 。
Republicans and Democrats alike argue that this is the crux of America’s jobs problem. => 共和民主两党都一直认定这是美国就业问题的关键。
After all, trade deficits mean job losses. => 毕竟贸易逆差意味着职位流失。

Because the biggest share of the US trade gap is with China, a country vilified as a currency-manipulating cheater, the bilateral trade deficit has become the lightening rod for China bashers. => 由于美国贸易缺口的最大一部分来自中国这个被诽谤为货币操纵作弊者的国家，双边贸易逆差因而成为了诋毁中国者的指路明灯。
But neither candidate acknowledges the much bigger elephant in the room. => 但两个候选人都没有意识到更大的症结所在。
In 2011, the US had trade deficits with 98 countries. => 美国在2011年与98个国家之间出现了贸易逆差。
The other 97 deficits did not magically appear. => 其他97项逆差也并未凭空消失。

Lacking in savings and wanting to grow, the US runs massive current-account and multilateral trade deficits in order to import other countries’ surplus savings. => 缺少储蓄却期望增长，美国唯有在巨额经常账户和多边贸易逆差下运作来进口其他国家的多余储蓄。
This goes to the heart of the folly of China bashing. => 这触及到了诋毁中国愚蠢行为的核心。
No leading country in world history has persistently maintained a negative saving rate. => 历史上没有一个领导国家会一直维持着负储蓄率的。
Trade deficits – with China or any other country – are part of the price that America pays for its unbridled profligacy. => 贸易逆差 — — 来自中国或者其他国家 — — 就是美国为其肆意挥霍所付出的代价之一。
Simple arithmetic and basic economics tell us that a multilateral problem cannot be addressed by a bilateral solution. => 简单的计算和基本的经济学原理告诉我们：你是无法通过一个双边解决方案来解决多边问题的。
Politicians have a penchant for simple and powerful messages. => 政客们都非常嗜好一些简明有力的信息。
Yet those messages are often more spin than substance. => 但那些信息往往都言过其实。
Indeed, one could argue that it is the American public that is being manipulated by the erroneous charges leveled at China. => 事实上，可以说正是美国公众被那些瞄准中国的错误指控所操纵了。
Fortunately, the campaign season is nearly over. => 但幸运的是，大选期正在接近尾声。
Left unanswered, however, is what comes next. => 但那些未能回答的问题则是下一次又将会出现什么情况。
China bashers typically change their tune after a presidential election. => 那些诋毁中国的人一般都会在总统选举之后调转话头。
But there is nothing typical about the pressures that are likely to continue squeezing American families long after November 6. => 但估计会在11月6号过后继续高悬在美国家庭头上的压力可不会消失。
Both Obama and Romney run the risk of painting themselves into a corner when it comes to China. => 无论是奥巴马还是罗姆尼都面临着在中国问题上自断后路的风险。
That could take all of us to the edge of a slippery slope. => 这可能把我们所有人都推向一个下滑的深渊。
America’s leaders need to come clean with the American people – before it is too late. => 在一切都已经无法挽回之前，美国领导人必须向自己的人民坦白。
America’s Coming Social Democracy? => 社会民主体制走近美国？
The United States is something different. Or is it? => 美利坚合众国也许略有不同，真的吗？
Whatever it has been in the past, the US in the future will have to choose whether, and how much, it will be a social democracy. => 不管它过去如何，美国在不久的将来必须决定是否成为一个社会民主政体，以及在多大程度上接受社会民主体制？
Once upon a time, according to mythology at least, America had little downward mobility. => 过去，至少从以往种种传说来看，美国几乎没有发生过“整体下流”的情形。
This was always half myth. => 但这些传说至少一半被神化了。
Setting out for the Western Territory was expensive. Covered wagons were not cheap. => 向西北地区进军得付出昂贵代价，隐蔽的篷车造价不菲。
But if this story was half myth, it was also half true, particularly in the years after WWII. => 但若这种说法一半是吹嘘，那么还有一半总是真的。

Largely independent of education or family, those Americans who did value stability and security could grasp it in the form of jobs with “a future.” => 尤其在二战后的几年内，多数未受教育或不依赖家庭生活的美国人，都能找到一份“有前途的”工作，过上经济稳定、安全有保障的生活。

Even for those not so lucky, economic risks were usually fairly low: the unemployment rate for married men during the 1960’s averaged 2.7%, and finding a new job was a relatively simple matter. => 即使是那些不太幸运的人，也通常无须承受什么经济风险：上世纪60年代已婚男性的平均失业率只有2.7 % ， 找份新工作是件再简单不过的事情。

It was during this era – roughly from 1948 to 1973 – that sociologists found that a majority of Americans had come to define themselves not as working class, but as middle class. => 大约就是在1948年到1973年这一阶段，社会学家们开始发现，大部分美国人开始将自己定位为中产阶级而不是工人阶级了。
The post-WWII period stands as a reference point in America’s collective memory, but it was in all likelihood an aberration. => 在美国人的集体记忆中，后二战时期是个参考点，尽管这多半是段非正常的时期。

In the early postwar decades, foreign competition exerted virtually no pressure on the economy, owing to the isolation of America’s continental market from the devastation of WWII. => 在二战刚结束的十年里，由于美国市场与战后萧条的欧洲大陆市场的完全隔离，海外竞争实质上对美国经济毫无影响。

At the same time, the war left enormous pent-up demand for the products of mass production: cars, washing machines, refrigerators, lawn mowers, television sets, and more. => 与此同时，这场战争反而刺激了人们对于汽车、洗衣机、冰箱、割草机、电视机等批量化生产的产品的大量需求，这种需求在战时已经被压抑过久。

Americans – at least white, male Americans – did not have to worry about tradeoffs between security and opportunity, because the US offered the advantages of both. => 美国人 — — 尤其是白人男性 — — 根本不用在机会和保障之间权衡两难，因为美国对这两种情况有给予优先照顾。
Corporate welfare capitalism substituted for what in Europe would have been government provided social democracy. => 公司福利资本主义代替了欧洲模式中政府调控的社会民主制度。
America was thus a special place. => 美国因此成为了一个特别的地方。
It had its cake and ate it, too: a combination of security with opportunity and entrepreneurship. => 他独享着自己的（市场）蛋糕，其同时也并合了一个机会与创业的保障体系。
It seemed that this was the natural order of things. => 看起来这正是事物发展的自然规律。
Hence there was little pressure for government-sponsored social democracy: Why bother? => 因此政府一手操办的社会民主体制几乎无甚压力。
What would it add? => 既然如此，何须费神再加一个新体制呢？
Now things are very different. => 只因如今形势不同往昔。
The typical American employer is no longer General Motors. => 通用汽车公司已不再代表典型的美国雇主。
It is Wal-Mart. => 沃尔马已经取而代之。

Private businesses are providing their workers with less and less in the form of defined-benefit pensions, health insurance, and other forms of insurance against life’s economic risks. => 私人企业正在通过不断减少其员工的固定福利，如养老金、健康保险及其他形式的保险，以减低经济风险。
Sharply rising income inequality has raised the stakes of the economic game. => 日益突出的收入不平衡矛盾提升了经济游戏的投资额度。
A government that cannot balance its own finances cannot be relied on to provide macroeconomic stability. => 一个不能平衡国内财政情况的国家不可能提供一个稳定的宏观经济环境。

Indeed, former Chairman of the US Federal Reserve Paul Volcker sees the US as so macroeconomically vulnerable as to be running a 75% chance of a full-fledged dollar crisis over the next several years. => 事实上，前美国联邦储备主席保罗·沃尔克已经预见到这一点，认为美国的宏观经济情形岌岌可危，将难以承受货币危机，其在未来几年中发生的可能性高达75 % 。
The coming generation will be one of massive downward mobility for many Americans. => 美国的下一代将会是替大部分美国人承受“整体下流”的一代。
Syria and September 11 => 叙利亚和911

The shadow of two previous events that took place on September 11 looms over the outcome – indeed, over the fact that the question is even being considered at all. => 此前两次发生在9月11日的事件的阴影影响着结果 — — 事实上，是影响着这个问题是否会被考虑。
In part, this reflected the new regime’s cruelty. => 从某些角度，这反映了新政权的残酷性。

More than three thousand people were murdered or “disappeared” during Pinochet’s rule, thousands more were tortured by his forces, and tens of thousands were forcibly exiled. => 皮诺切特统治期间，三千多人被杀或“被消失 ” ， 数千人遭遇军方虐待，数万人被迫流亡。
In the US, members of Congress turned the coup into a platform for efforts to promote human rights. => 在美国国内，国会议员将这次政变变成了推行人权运动的平台。
A slightly revised version of that legislation remains in force. => 如今，这一立法仍然有效，只是略微做了一些修订。

The events of September 11, 2001, are also playing a crucial role in deciding the question of a punitive strike against Syrian President Bashar al-Assad’s regime. => 2001年9月11日发生的事件也对向叙利亚总统巴沙尔·阿萨德政权采取惩罚性打击的问题起到了关键作用。

One consequence of the terrorist attacks 12 years ago is that Americans and others in the West became aware that developments in the Middle East could affect their own safety and security. => 12年前的恐怖袭击的一个后果是美国和其他西方国家认识到，中东的发展可能影响其自身安全和保障。
Initially, the attacks unleashed a strong desire to retaliate, which later gave way to caution about intervention, owing to unforeseen consequences. => 一开始，袭击造成了极强的复仇欲望，随后，由于后果不可预测，复仇欲望被谨慎干预取代。

In Britain, continuing intense resentment over the deceptions that led to the country’s engagement in the Iraq war seems to be the main reason for Parliament’s refusal to back a strike against Syria. => 在英国，人们对国家被骗参与伊拉克战争的骗局一直满怀憎恨，这成为国会拒绝支持打击叙利亚的主要原因。

Wariness of another Middle East war has also underpinned Obama’s unwillingness to go beyond a one-time punitive strike on Syria – with some in Congress opposed to even that. => 担心又一场中东战争也是奥巴马只愿意对叙利亚采取一次性惩罚性打击的原因，一些国会议员甚至连这一点都反对。
Maintaining the international prohibition on the use of chemical weapons is an urgent concern. => 维护使用化学武器的国际禁令是迫切的问题。
The Assad regime’s culpability for using these weapons is not in doubt. => 巴沙尔政权使用化学武器的罪行是毋庸置疑的。
A critical part of its role must be to consider with care the limits that should be placed on a punitive strike. => 这一角色的一个关键部分是谨慎考虑惩罚性打击的界线。

The war in Iraq was misconceived from the start, because it was an attempt to avenge the September 11, 2001, terrorist attacks by invading and occupying a country that had no part in them. => 伊拉克战争从一开始就被误解了，因为这是以侵略和占领与事无干的国家报复2001年9月11日的恐怖袭击。
It restores human rights to the central place in American foreign policy set forth after September 11, 1973. => 这让人权重新回到了1973年9月11日后设定的美国对外政策核心位置上。
America’s Constrained Choice => 约束重重的美国选择
NEWPORT BEACH – The conventional wisdom about the November presidential election in the United States is only partly correct. => 纽波特海滩—关于11月的美国总统大选，传统智慧只能说是部分正确。
Yes, economic issues will play a large role in determining the outcome. => 是的，经济问题将在结果决定中起到很大作用。

But the next step in the argument – that the winner of an increasingly ugly contest will have the luxury of pursuing significantly different policies from his opponent – is much more uncertain. => 但下一个阶段 — — 在日趋丑陋的竞赛中获胜的那一方是否拥有采取与其对手截然不同的政策的奢侈 — — 的不确定性要大得多。
Indeed, the potential differences for America are elsewhere, and have yet to be adequately understood by voters. => 事实上，美国的潜在分歧随处可见，选民们对此并没有充分的认识。

They center on the social policies that would accompany a broadly similar set of economic measures; and, here, the differences between the candidates are consequential. => 他们将注意力集中在伴随着范围甚广的类似经济政策的社会政策上；而在这方面，候选人之间的分歧将产生重大后果。
Whoever wins will face an economy growing at a sluggish 2% or less next year, with a nagging risk of stalling completely. => 不管谁当选，都将在明年面临经济增长只有2%的局面，并伴随着完全停滞的风险。
The financial side of the economy will also be a source of concern. => 经济的财政面也值得担忧。
The fiscal deficit will continue to flirt with the 10%-of-GDP level, adding to worries about the country’s medium-term debt dynamics. => 财政赤字将继续在10%GDP的水平上徘徊，令人对美国中期债务动态愈加担心了。

The banking sector will still be “de-risking,” limiting the flow of credit to small and medium-size companies and undermining hiring and investment in plant and equipment. => 银行部门仍在“去风险 ” ， 因此限制了流向中小企业、提振招聘和产房设备投资所必须的信贷流。
And the household sector will be only partly through its painful de-leveraging phase. => 而家庭部门痛苦的去杠杆化阶段也只进行了一半。
The policy front will be equally unsettling. => 政策面也同样令人不安。
Having dithered and bickered for too long, the US Congress will find it increasingly difficult to postpone action on these challenges. => 在犹豫和扯皮了太久之后，美国国会将发现，不能在拖延应对这些挑战的措施了。

Meanwhile, the Federal Reserve’s unusual activism, including an ever-expanding list of experimental measures, will yield fewer benefits and entail growing costs and risks. => 与此同时，美联储翻唱的激进主义 — — 包括不断延长的“摸石头过河”措施清单 — — 收效将越来越少，而成本与风险将越来越大。
The US economy will also be operating in a more difficult global environment. => 美国经济运行的全球环境也越来越困难。
In the next few months, Europe’s debt crisis will most likely worsen. => 在未来几个月中，欧洲债务危机极有可能会继续恶化。

So, whether President Barack Obama or Mitt Romney prevails in November, the next president will be constrained by the twin need for urgent economic stabilization and longer-term reforms. => 因此，不管现任总统奥巴马还是罗姆尼在11月胜出，新总统都将受到双重压力的约束 — — 一边是急需稳定经济，一边是长期改革。
Failure to do so would significantly increase the risk of an outright American recession. => 在这方面失败将大大增加美国陷入全面衰退的风险。
Serious medium-term budget reforms are needed to deal with the legacy of repeated congressional failures. => 深度中期预算改革是应对国会一再不作为所造成的问题之所必须。
It is certainly not an either/or proposition. => 这绝对不是一个要么/要么命题。
Fiscal reforms work best in a dynamic economy. => 财政改革在充满活力的经济中才能取得最佳效果。
To this end, Obama and Romney will need to lift the impediments to growth and job creation. => 在这方面，奥巴马和罗姆尼必须排除万难，实现增长和就业创造。

Here again – in areas like housing, the labor market, credit intermediation, and infrastructure – there is less room for maneuver than most politicians would like us to believe. => 与房地产、劳动力市场、信用中介和基础设施等领域一样，在这一领域，办法并不像政客们希望我们所认为的那样多。
But this does not mean that there is no scope for differences. => 但这并不意味着一点改变都无法做出。
There is, and they reflect the fact that general economic tendencies will be accompanied by multi-speed dynamics at many levels. => 改变的空间是有的，这反映出一个事实：总体经济趋势将伴随多重水平不同速度的动态。

Until now, Congress’s excessive political polarization has translated into an approach that has pushed more of the burden of adjustment onto those who are less able to bear it. => 到目前为止，国会的过度政治极端化已经产生了让承受能力较弱者经受更多调整负担的效果。
In an ideal world, America’s next president would rapidly embark on a two-step approach to restoring job dynamism and financial soundness. => 在理想世界中，美国新总统应快速实施两步走计划以重塑就业活力、重振金融稳定性。

First, he would devise a comprehensive set of economic-policy initiatives that are both feasible and desirable – and, again, the scope for major differences here is limited. => 首先，他应该设计可行而令人满意的全面经济政策计划组合 — — 在这方面，做出重大不同的空间是有限的。

Second, he would accompany this with an explicit set of social policies – and here the potential differences are profound – that addresses the need for equitable burden-sharing. => 其次，对于这些经济政策，应辅之以明确的社会政策组合 — — 在这方面，潜在改变空间极大 — — 以满足公平负担共担的需要。

It is much more about the accompanying concepts of social fairness, entitlement, equality and, yes, standards of behavior for a rich and civilized society. => 此次选举中兹事体大者在于它所伴随的社会公平、福利、平等呢个性以及富庶文明社会行为准则等概念。

This is an election about social responsibility – a society’s obligation to support those who are struggling, through no fault of their own, to find jobs and make ends meet. => 这是一场事关社会责任的选举。 所谓社会责任，即社会支持因并非由其自身造成的错误而承受寻找工作、实现收支平衡压力的群体的义务。
It is about protecting the most vulnerable segments of society, including by providing them access to proper health coverage. => 这场选举事关通过让他们获得健康保险保护社会最脆弱群体。
It is about reforming an education system that fails America’s young people (and about providing appropriate retraining to those who need it). => 这场选举事关改革让美国年轻人落于人后的教育制度（以及向需要者提供合适的再培训 ） 。
Among the numerous issues of fairness and equality, it is about the rich giving back to a system that has brought them unimaginable wealth. => 在诸多公平和公正问题中，让富人回馈给他们带来不可想象的财富的制度才是此次选举的重点。
It is here where the differences between Obama and Romney are important. => 奥巴马和罗姆尼的分歧之所以重要，原因就在这里。

The sooner the campaign debate pivots to this, the greater the probability that Americans will make a more informed choice and, thus, buy into the collective effort needed to escape national malaise. => 竞选活动越早以此为重心，美国人民就越有可能做出信息更充分的选择，从而采取必须的集体行动让美国免蹈倾覆之辙。
America’s Crony Capitalism => 美国的裙带资本主义
Buenos Aires – For 20 years, Americans have denounced the “crony capitalism” of Third World countries, especially in Asia. => 布宜诺斯艾利斯－20年来，美国一直在公开抨击第三世界国家，特别是亚洲国家的“裙带资本主义 ” 。
The recently completed “stress tests” of US banks are but the latest indication that crony capitalists have now captured Washington, DC. => 美国财政部最近完成的银行 “压力测试 ” ， 只是裙带资本主义占领华盛顿特区的一个最新标志而已。
Indeed, most professional investors trashed the tests as dishonest even as their holdings benefited from a rising market. => 事实上，许多专业投资者即使因为持有股票而从股市的上涨中获益，也仍然认为压力测试是不诚实的。

The tests were supposed to reveal the true conditions of banks saddled with unaudited toxic assets in housing loans and financial derivatives. The reasoning behind the tests seemed unimpeachable. => 压力测试是用来反映大量持有房屋贷款和金融衍生产品的银行未经审计的有害资产的真实情况的，因而，进行压力测试背后的理由似乎是无懈可击的。
But was it? => 但是，事实果真如此吗？
As any seasoned banker knows, a well-managed bank should undertake internal “stress tests” regularly as a matter of good housekeeping. => 任何经验丰富的银行家都知道，管理良好的银行应该将定期进行内部“压力测试”作为良好的企业管理的一部分。
The truth is that the tests were not designed to find answers. => 这背后的真相是，美国进行压力测试的目的不是为了找到问题的答案。
Both Wall Street’s chieftains and the Obama administration already knew the truth. => 华尔街的巨头们和奥巴马政府都已经知道了问题的真相。
Moreover, nationalizing banks would have required dismissing Wall Street captains and their boards for grossly mismanaging their firms. => 而且，如果美国进行银行国有化，就一定会有一些华尔街巨头及其同僚因为严重经营不善而遭到解雇。

Wall Street’s titans, however, had convinced Obama and his team that their continued stewardship was essential to getting the world out of its crisis. => 然而，华尔街的巨头们已经让奥巴马及其政府成员相信，他们持续工作对世界经济摆脱当前的危机至关重要。
They successfully portrayed themselves as victims of a firestorm, rather than as accessories to arson. => 而且，他们还成功地将自己描绘成经济危机的受害者，而不是引发经济危机的帮凶。
The stress tests were meant to signal to the public that there was no immediate threat of bank failures. => 压力测试本来是要告诉公众，银行没有迫在眉睫的破产威胁。

This message, it was hoped, would stabilize the market so that prices for “toxic” assets could rise to a level at which bankers might feel comfortable selling them. => 政府希望，这样的信息可以稳定市场，以便“有毒”资产的价格可以上涨到银行家在卖掉它们时可以感觉不太为难的水平。

After all, senior bankers had been claiming that these assets were “mispriced,” and that pricing them at market levels would penalize the banks unnecessarily. => 毕竟，高级银行家曾经声称这些银行资产的“价格定错了 ” ， 将它们按市场水平定价会使银行遭受了不必要地惩罚。
The feared implosion of Wall Street seems to have been avoided. => 以前人们所担忧的华尔街的破产，现��似乎已经避免了。
But no one ever seriously thought that the US would allow Citigroup and Bank of America, to name just two, to fail. => 但是，从来没有人真正地认为美国会让花旗集团和美国银行 — — 在此，我仅列举两家银行 — — 破产。
In fact, the stock market bottomed out last winter. => 事实上，股票市场在去年冬天就已经见底了。
Markets had factored into share prices the belief that the US government would not allow any more banks to collapse. => 市场已经将人们对美国政府不会让更多的银行破产的看法，反应到股票的价格中去了。

What the world wanted was an accurate picture of what the banks were worth and “mark-to-market” valuations to guide investors as to how much new capital they needed. => 世界想要的东西，是有关银行价值的准确数据和根据银行还需要多少注资所确定的引导投资者的“市价”估值。

The world also wanted to see the US retaking the high road in reinforcing business ethics and integrity – so lacking under the last administration. => 世界也希望看到，美国能够重新回到增强商业道德和诚实信用的道路上来 — — 上一届的美国政府非常缺乏这两样东西。

As taxpayers had already put huge sums into rescuing failing banks, with the prospect of more to come, a transparent process to reveal how the money was being used was imperative. => 因为纳税人已经为挽救濒临破产的银行投入了巨额资金，并且可能还要投入更多的资金，所以，有一个表明这些钱是怎样使用的透明的程序，势在必行。

Substantial public rescue funds have reportedly been siphoned off to foreign banks, Goldman Sachs, and staff bonuses for purposes unrelated to protecting public interests. => 据报道，美国有大量的公共援救资金，不是为了保护公共利益的目的而被转移到了外国银行、高盛手中或者被当作金融机构员工的奖金。
None of this was either revealed or debunked by Geithner’s tests. => 盖特纳的压力测试没有披露或拆穿这些情况。
Instead, public servants now appear to be in cahoots with Wall Street to engineer an artificial aura of profitability. => 相反，美国政府的工作人员现在却似乎在和华尔街沆瀣一气，营造出一个虚假的盈利氛围。
Moreover, the value of toxic assets remains as murky as ever. => 而且，美国对有毒资产的价值和以前一样讳莫如深。
Once sacrosanct accounting principles have been amended at Wall Street’s behest in order to allow banks to report essentially whatever they want. => 为了让银行基本上能够随心所欲的进行报告，在华尔街的要求下，美国政府将神圣的会计准则都进行了修改。
And now negotiated stress test results have been released to “prove” that the banks are a lot healthier. => 现在，美国公布了由美国政府和银行进行谈判形成的压力测试结果，想以此 “证明”美国的银行比人们想象的要健康得多。
Calling this a Ponzi scheme might be too harsh. => 虽然将这种行为称为旁氏骗局可能太尖刻了，但是它们却有相似的地方。
But few financial professionals have been fooled. => 这种骗局愚弄不了大多数的金融专业人士。

Like swine flu, crony capitalism has migrated from corrupt Third World countries to America, once the citadel of sound public and private governance. => 像猪流感那样，裙带资本主义已经从腐败的第三世界国家转移到了曾经是可靠的政府和公司治理根据地的美国。

Is it any wonder that China is perceived as an increasingly credible model for much of the developing world, while the US is now viewed as a symbol of hypocrisy and double standards? => 所以，对中国被认为是发展中国家越来越可靠的典范，而美国现在被认为是伪善和双重标志的象征，我们有什么好奇怪的呢?
America’s Dangerous Debt Ceiling Debate => 引火烧身的美国债务限额之辩
NEWPORT BEACH – It has been raised more than 70 times in the last 50 years, mostly without commotion. => 发自纽波特滩 — — 美国政府的债务限额在过去50年内已经上调了超过70次，一般都没有什么异议。
It must be raised again this summer if the United States government is to continue paying its bills on time. => 而当今美国政府如果还想继续按时还债的话，就必须在今年夏天再次上调这一限额。

As part of America’s system of checks and balances, Congress gets to do more than just approve the annual federal budget. It also sets a limit on how much debt the US Treasury is allowed to issue. => 作为美国制衡政治体制的组成部分，国会不仅扮演着审批联邦预算的角色，还负责制定美国财政部的债务限额。
Beyond this ceiling, the government can spend only from current revenues. => 一旦超出该限额，政府就只好从当年财政收入中掏钱支出了。
US Treasury Secretary Timothy Geithner recently informed members of Congress that the government will be in this situation on or around August 2. => 美国财政部长盖特纳最近就政府将在8月2日左右触及债务限额一事向国会作了汇报。
Having already officially hit the ceiling, the Treasury is moving money around and tapping various pots of unused funds to pay its bills. => 在借债总额已经到达上限的情况下，财政部当前正在东挪西凑地动用各种闲置资金还债。
In a few weeks, this “flexibility” will be used up. => 而再过几个星期，这些“流动性”也将告罄。

With the US government now borrowing around 40% of every dollar it spends, a truly binding debt ceiling would immediately force the government to reduce spending radically and in a disorderly fashion. => 考虑到美国政府当前每1美元的支出中就有40美分债务的处境，一个真正具有约束力的债务限额将迫使其不顾一切地大幅削减支出。

Yet, in today’s polarized environment in Washington, Republicans and Democrats are unwilling to compromise – or at least to compromise “too early.” => 但在华盛顿当前极端对立的政治环境下，共和党和民主党彼此都不愿妥协 — — 或者认为现在妥协还为时尚早。
By holding out, Republicans wish to force President Barack Obama’s administration into massive spending cuts. => 共和党人想利用僵持来迫使奥巴马当局大规模消减开支。
Democrats respond that such a one-sided approach would be economically harmful and socially unjust. => 民主党则辩称这个不考虑其他因素的单一手段不但会损害经济，还会造成社会不公。

In the meantime, both sides risk disrupting transfer payments (including to the elderly) and the provision of public services, as well as eroding further America’s global credit standing. => 与此同时，双方都冒着扰乱转移支付（包括老人补助）和公共服务供给的风险，甚至进一步威胁到美国的全球信用。

The overwhelming – and sensible – expectation is that the two parties will compromise and raise the debt ceiling before inflicting serious economic and financial dislocations. => 目前主流（也合理）的期望是，两党能在国内经济和金融严重扭曲前不计前嫌，调高债务限额。

A compromise would allow both parties to declare partial victory, for it would likely entail commitments to cut spending and some steps to make taxation more socially just. => 彼此妥协则双方都能各得其所，既能让政府承诺减少支出，又能采取一系列步骤来使税收具有更多的社会正义性。
But, like many last-minute agreements, it would have little durable impact. => 但正如众多最后一刻达成的协议一样，这个协议也缺乏长期效力。

In effect, the political system would again be kicking the can down the road, with real progress on necessary fiscal reforms expected only after the November 2012 presidential election. => 事实上，美国的政治系统很快又会故伎重演，对协议敷衍塞责，而人们所期望的财政改革只有在2012年总统大选之后才能取得实质性进展。
But politicians may need two steps: an initial failure to agree, and then a quick deal in response to the resulting financial-market convulsions. => 此外就是政治家们需要分两步走：首先是协议失败，��后在引发金融市场动荡后迅速妥协。
In the meantime, the Treasury would temporarily re-prioritize and slow outgoing payments. => 同时财政部会暂时重新安排还款优先次序并延缓付款。

Congress initially rejected the measure, but a dramatic 770-point drop in the stock market focused politicians’ minds, bringing them back to the table – and to agreement. => 国会一开始拒绝了这一要求，但股市急挫770点使得政治家无暇旁顾，随后将这一提案重新提上议程并最终通过。
The next few weeks will provide plenty of political drama. => 未来5个星期的政治舞台必有众多好戏上演。

Such political paralysis on key economic issues is increasingly unsettling for the US private sector, and for other countries that rely on a strong US at the core of the global economy. => 对美国的私人企业以及依赖美国在全球经济中扮演核心角色的国家来说，美国政治体制在面临如此关键的经济问题时所发生的瘫痪更加令他们感到不安。
The world economy is hard-wired to the assumption of a strong America, and Americans benefit from this. => 全球经济与一个强势美国的假设紧密相连，而美国人也从中大获其利。
But the more their politicians argue over the debt ceiling, the greater the risk that the wiring will become irreparably frayed. => 但美国政治家在债务限额问题上的争论越激烈，这一关联就越有可能发生无法挽回的断裂。
America’s Deepening Moral Crisis => 不断恶化的美国道德危机
NEW YORK – America’s political and economic crisis is set to worsen following the upcoming November elections. => 发自纽约 — — 美国的政治和经济危机必将在11月国会中期选举之后进一步恶化。
President Barack Obama will lose any hope for passing progressive legislation aimed at helping the poor or the environment. => 而一直致力于推动扶助贫困阶层和环保立法的奥巴马也将失去最后一丝希望。
Indeed, all major legislation and reforms are likely to be stalemated until 2013, following a new presidential election. => 事实上，所有重要的立法和改革都将停滞不前，直到2013年的新一轮总统大选之后才有转机。

An already bad situation marked by deadlock and vitriol is likely to worsen, and the world should not expect much leadership from a bitterly divided United States. => 而这个充斥着僵局和刻薄攻击的可悲状况很可能会愈演愈烈，因此世界也不必指望这个内部急剧分化的美国能表现出多少全球领导力。
Much of America is in a nasty mood, and the language of compassion has more or less been abandoned. => 大部分美国人如今都怀着一种丑陋的心态，而同情和怜悯之心则被抛到了九霄云外。
Both political parties serve their rich campaign contributors, while proclaiming that they defend the middle class. => 两大党虽然都自称捍卫中产阶级利益，但其实只为那些富有的选举捐款人服务。
The Republican Party recently issued a “Pledge to America” to explain its beliefs and campaign promises. => 共和党最近发布了一份名为《向美国宣誓：新共和党议程》的宣言来阐述自己的信念和选举承诺。
The document is filled with nonsense, such as the fatuous claim that high taxes and over-regulation explain America’s high unemployment. => 但宣言中却充斥着类似“高税率和过度监管导致了美国高失业率”这样的荒唐言论，堪称一派胡言。
Most of all, the Republican platform is devoid of compassion. => 最糟糕的是，共和党阵营根本就毫无同情心可言。
America today presents the paradox of a rich country falling apart because of the collapse of its core values. => 而美国之所以发生这种富裕国家内部解体现象，就是因为其核心价值已经崩溃。
American productivity is among the highest in the world. => 美国的生产力居世界前列。
Average national income per person is about $46,000 – enough not only to live on, but to prosper. => 人均国民收入高达4.6万美元 — — 不仅能保证温饱，还足以令民众过上富足的生活。
Yet the country is in the throes of an ugly moral crisis. => 但整个国家却被一场严重的道德危机所荼毒。
Income inequality is at historic highs, but the rich claim that they have no responsibility to the rest of society. => 收入不均程度已经达到了历史最高点，但富人们却宣称自己不需要对其他国民负责。
They refuse to come to the aid of the destitute, and defend tax cuts at every opportunity. => 他们不愿扶助贫困阶层，而且尽可能地为减税政策辩护。
Americans seem to believe that they have a natural right to government services without paying taxes. => 美国人似乎相信他们本来就该免费享用政府服务而无需缴税。
In the American political lexicon, taxes are defined as a denial of liberty. => 在美国的政治词汇中 ， “ 税”就意味着“限制自由 ” 。
There was a time, not long ago, when Americans talked of ending poverty at home and abroad. => 但就在不久之前的一个时期，美国人其实非常热衷于在国内外谈论消除贫困问题。

Then the deep divisions over Vietnam and civil rights, combined with a surge of consumerism and advertising, seemed to end an era of shared sacrifice for the common good. => 但随后全社会在越战和民权议题上爆发分歧，加上消费主义和广告的入侵，似乎最终令这个为公共福利共同付出的时代走向了终结。
For 40 years, compassion in politics receded. => 其后40年间，我们的政治同情心不断消退。
Ronald Reagan gained popularity by cutting social benefits for the poor (claiming that the poor cheated to receive extra payments). => 罗纳德·里根通过减少贫困阶层的社会福利（他宣称穷人经常用欺骗的手段获取额外福利）并赢得了支持。
Bill Clinton continued those cuts in the 1990’s. => 而比尔·克林顿则在1990年代故伎重施。
Today, no politician even dares to mention help for poor people. => 时至今日，甚至没有政治家敢于提起任何扶贫政策了。
The big campaign contributors to both parties pay to ensure that their vested interests dominate political debates. => 那些财大气粗的选举捐款人花钱的目的就是为了确保他们的既得利益能主导整个政治辩论的方向。
That means that both parties increasingly defend the interests of the rich, though Republicans do so slightly more than Democrats. => 这意味着两大党都不断为富人的利益辩护，只不过共和党的作为比民主党稍稍多一点而已。
Even a modest tax increase on the rich is unlikely to find support in American politics. => 即便是某个针对富人的温和加税政策在美国也是无人问津的。

The result of all of this is likely to be a long-term decline of US power and prosperity, because Americans no longer invest collectively in their common future. => 所有这一切的最终结果就是美国实力和繁荣的长期衰退，因为美国人再也不集体投资于他们的共同未来了。
America will remain a rich society for a long time to come, but one that is increasingly divided and unstable. => 美国在一段长时期内依然会是一个富裕的国家，但同时也会逐渐走向分化和动荡。
Fear and propaganda may lead to more US-led international wars, as in the past decade. => 恐惧和误导性宣传将导致美国发起更多国际战争，正如过去十年那样。
And what is happening in America is likely to be repeated elsewhere. => 而发生在美国的一切也会在世界其他地方重演。
America is vulnerable to social breakdown because it is a highly diverse society. => 社会的高度分化导致美国极其容易发生社会崩溃。

Racism and anti-immigrant sentiments are an important part of the attack on the poor, or at least the reason why so many are willing to heed the propaganda against helping the poor. => 而种族主义和反移民思潮其实就是对贫困人口的攻击的重要部分，或者至少是人们愿意听信那些反对扶助贫困阶层的政治宣传的原因。
As other societies grapple with their own increasing diversity, they may follow the US into crisis. => 随着其他各国社会内部分化的恶化，他们最终也会步美国后尘。

In France, Nicolas Sarkozy’s government has tried to regain popularity with the working class by deporting Roma migrants, a target of widespread hatred and ethnic attacks. => 在法国，萨科齐政府尝试通过将吉普赛移民驱逐出境的方式来赢得工薪阶层支持，而这些人在法国早已成为种族仇恨和攻击的众矢之的。
Both examples show that Europe, like the US, is vulnerable to the politics of division, as our societies become more ethnically diverse. => 这两个例子都显示出随着我们的社会在种族上越来越多元化，欧洲也无法克服随之诱发的政治分裂现象，正如美国一样。
The lesson from America is that economic growth is no guarantee of wellbeing or political stability. => 美国的教训就是经济发展并不能确保人民幸福和政治稳定。
American society has become increasingly harsh, where the richest Americans buy their way to political power, and the poor are abandoned to their fate. => 美国的社会形势正不断恶化，富人们用钱来换取政治权力，而穷人则自生自灭。

In their private lives, Americans have become addicted to consumerism, which drains their time, savings, attention, and inclination to engage in acts of collective compassion. => 在私人生活中，美国人已经深陷于消费主义无法自拔，而消费主义则反过来吞噬了美国人的时间、金钱、精力，以及致力于集体福祉的倾向。
The world should beware. => 全世界都必须引以为戒。

Unless we break the ugly trends of big money in politics and rampant consumerism, we risk winning economic productivity at the price of our humanity. => 除非我们能摆脱这种权钱交易和病态消费主义的怪圈，否则的话，每增加一点生产力，我们就会多丢失一点人性。
America’s Economic Stalemate => 美国的经济僵局

Indeed, the Congressional Budget Office projects that the national debt could increase to 82% of GDP over the next ten years – more than double the debt ratio as recently as 2008. => 事实上，国会预算办公室估计，国民债务将在未来十年内上升至GDP的82 % ， 即2008年水平的两倍。
That forecast, moreover, is based on quite optimistic assumptions of strong economic growth and low interest rates. => 此外，这一估计是建立在十分乐观的经济增长和低利率假设上的。
With slower growth and more normal interest rates, the debt ratio could easily rise to more than 100% in 2021, and exceed 150% by 2030. => 如果增长率没有那么高，名义利率没有那么低，则债务比率将在2021年突破100 % ， 在2030年超过150 % 。

Most experts believe that limiting the rise in debt will require slowing the growth of these “entitlement” programs and increasing taxes as a share of GDP. => 大多数专家认为，欲限制债务增长，就必须降低这些“福利”项目占GDP的比重，同时提高税收占GDP的比重。
The result is the current stalemate in reducing the fiscal deficit and reversing the growth of the national debt. => 结果就是当前的僵局 — — 无法削减财政赤字，也无法扭转国民债务的上升趋势。
Republicans argue that the national debt’s growth should be limited only by cutting government spending. => 共和党指出，国民债务增长只能通过削减政府支出来限制。

Limiting tax expenditures could reduce the annual deficit by as much as 2% of GDP, thereby reducing the debt-to-GDP ratio in 2021 by more than 25 percentage points. => 限制税收支出可以削减相当于2%GDP的年度赤字，从而在2021年将债务-GDP比率拉低25个百分点以上。
Republicans generally reject this form of spending reduction, because it results in additional tax revenue. => 共和党普遍拒绝这种形式的支出削减，因为这会导致税收增加。

While this method does indeed increase total revenue, the economic effect of limiting tax expenditures is the same as it is under any other method of cutting spending on those programs. => 该方法确实会让总税收收入增加，但限制税收支出的经济效应与通过其他方法减少这些项目的支出是完全一样的。
But the Republicans’ opposition to anything that raises revenue means that this key to breaking the budget stalemate won’t be implemented. => 但共和党反对任何令税收收入增加的办法，这意味着这一打破预算僵局的关键永远不会得到实施。
But even though such a reform could maintain income levels for retirees, Democrats oppose it, because it lowers traditional government benefits. => 但即使这样的改革可以维持退休者的收入水平，民主党也会反对，因为这会让传统政府福利减少。
This reinforces the stalemate. => 于是，僵局会因此加深。
The two parties’ hardline stances anticipate the upcoming congressional and presidential elections in November 2012. => 两党立场均十分强硬，这将影响到2012年的国会和总统选举。
The Republicans, in effect, face the voters with a sign that says, “We won’t raise your taxes, but the Democrats will.” => 事实上，共和党向选民打出的口号将是“我们不会对你们增税，但民主党会。
The Democrats’ sign, by contrast, says, “We won’t reduce your pension or health benefits, but the Republicans will.” => ”而民主党将针锋相对，树立“我们不会削减退休金和医保福利，但共和党会”的大旗。

Neither side wants any ambiguity in their message before the election, thus ruling out the possibility of any immediate changes in tax expenditures or future Social Security pensions. => 双方在大选前都将保持鲜明的立场，因此，马上实现税收支出和未来社保退休金变化是不可能的。
But, for the same reason, I am optimistic that the stalemate will end after the election. => 但是，出于同样的理由，我对僵局将在大选后不复存在十分乐观。
At that point, both Republicans and Democrats will be able to accept reforms that they must reject now. => 那时候，不论是共和党还是民主党，都可以接受当前必须拒绝的改革。
Another post-election route to deficit reduction would be to lower marginal tax rates and balance that revenue loss with cuts in tax expenditures. => 另一条在选举后赤字削减的办法是降低边际税率，同时用削减税收支出来弥补收入的减少。
Reducing tax expenditures while lowering marginal tax rates can produce substantial revenue by increasing the level of taxable income. => 削减税收支出和降低边际税率双管齐下可以通过增加可纳税收入水平大大增加税收收入。

The current economic stalemate is troubling, because financial markets could react adversely, and because delays in addressing the fiscal deficit means a higher national debt. => 当前的经济僵局十分危险，因为金融市场可能对此产生负面反应，且推迟解决财政赤字问题意味着国民债务会继续攀升。
America’s Election and the Global Economy => 美国大选和全球经济
The most important differences between the two candidates can be summarized as follows: => 两大总统候选人的主要差别可以总结如下：
Spending. => 指出。
Obama has dramatically increased spending. => 奥巴马大举增加了支出。
Romney, by contrast, favors limiting overall federal spending, currently 24% of GDP, to 20%, and keeping defense at 4%. => 相反，罗姆尼支持限制联邦总支出，将其规模从目前占GDP的24%缩减至20 % ， 并将赤字维持在GDP的4%的水平。
He wants private markets, not government, to choose winning firms and technologies. => 他希望让私人市场而不是政府来选择企业和技术赢家。
Democrats oppose most nondefense spending cuts, arguing that reductions would cause the economy to contract. => 民主党反对大多数非防务支出削减，他们指出，削减支出将导致经济衰退。
That case is strongest if the spending reductions are large and abrupt in a weak economy. => 当支出削减突然性地发生在疲软经济时，这种效应最为强烈。
If phased in over a multi-year period as the economy recovers, as Romney proposes, thrift would likely be expansionary. => 如果在多年的经济复苏过程中实现（如罗姆尼所规划的 ） ， 那么节流可能会收到扩张性的效果。
Taxes. => 税收。

Obama would raise the top marginal tax rates on wages, capital gains, dividends, interest, and estates, especially on higher-income individuals and small businesses. => 奥巴马将提高工资、资本利得、分红、利息和房地产的最高边际税率，特别是对高收入个人和小企业。
Yet he has never proposed comprehensive reform of either the personal or corporate income tax. => 但不论是在个人还是在公司所得税方面，他都没有提出全面的改革计划。

Romney’s fiscal plan thus reduces deficits sufficiently to decrease the debt-to-GDP ratio. He favors a balanced-budget amendment to the Constitution, and hopes to balance the budget over eight years. => 他还将把个人税率降低20 % ， 并通过限制税收减免（特别是高端人群的税收减免，该措施可以筹集相当于充分就业水平GDP的18.5%的税收，略高于历史平均水平）冲抵收入的下降。

Obama, by contrast, would run larger deficits – his spending increase is much larger than his tax increase – which imply large tax hikes in the future. => 相反，奥巴马将扩大赤字 — — 他的增支计划远比增税计划庞大 — — 这意味着未来会发生大规模增税。
Moreover, he would run far larger debt ratios than Romney, because the main driver of the debt is entitlement spending. => 此外，奥巴马的税收比率将远高于罗姆尼，因为债务的最大原因的福利支出。
Entitlements. => 福利。
Obama has remained silent about reform of Medicare and Social Security, whose long-run deficits are several times the national debt. => 奥巴马在医疗保险和社会保障方面的改革一直缄口不言，这些计划的长期赤字是国民债务的数倍。
Vice President Joe Biden has even said that “no changes” to Social Security are to be made. => 副总统拜登甚至说社会保障计划“不会有变化 ” 。

Romney supports gradually increasing retirement ages, a premium-support model for Medicare, and shifting Medicaid (health insurance for the poor) to the states via block grants. => 罗姆尼支持逐渐提高退休年林、以保险金支持的医疗保险模式、以及将医疗补助（面向穷人的医保）通过取消补助移交给各州。

The Obama campaign is pummeling Romney on Medicare, and the Romney campaign is hammering Obama for his refusal to negotiate or even propose a solution. => 奥巴马的竞选方针是攻击罗姆尼的医疗保险计划，而罗姆尼的策略是攻击奥巴马拒绝讨论该问题甚至拿不出解决方案草案。
Some observers suggest that Obama’s unspoken plan is ever-growing entitlements eventually paid for by a European-style value-added tax. => 一些观察者认为奥巴马未明言的计划是用欧洲式的增值税来为不断增加的福利支出买单。
Trade. => 贸易。
Obama is the first US president in a long time who has not played a leading role on global trade liberalization. => 奥巴马是相当长的一段时间以来第一位没有在全球贸易自由化方面起到领导作用的美国总统。

The Doha Round of global trade talks remains stalled, and Obama delayed the three bilateral free-trade agreements that awaited approval when he came into office. => 世贸谈判多哈回合依然停滞不前，并推迟了三项自他入主白宫以来一直等在签署的双边自由贸易协定。
Romney is a proponent of free trade, but has said that he would be tougher on China’s trade practices and currency policies. => 罗姆尼是自由贸易的支持者，但也表示将对中国贸易行为和货币政策采取更强硬的立场。
Regulation. => 监管。

Obama wants to expand federal command-and-control regulation further (though the courts have stopped his extension of some regulatory powers). => 奥巴马希望进一步扩大联邦指令-控制（command-and-control）监管（尽管法院已经叫停了他的某些监管权力的扩张 ） 。
Romney vows an economically balanced approach that would reform Obama’s major health-care, environmental, and financial-services regulations. => 罗姆尼的方案采取经济平衡的立场，将改革奥巴马的主要卫生、环境和金融服务监管。
Appointments. => 任命。
Every US president appoints thousands of officials, many with considerable power. => 每位美国总统都会任命几千官员，其中许多人将掌握重权。

Romney has said that he would not reappoint Ben Bernanke as Fed Chairman (likely candidates: economists Glenn Hubbard, Greg Mankiw, John Taylor, and Martin Feldstein). => 罗姆尼声称他将不会任命伯南克为美联储主席（可能的候选人选包括胡巴德（Glenn Hubbard ） 、 曼昆（Greg Mankiw ） 、 泰勒（John Taylor ） 、 费尔德斯坦（Martin Feldstein）等经济学家 ） 。
Other presidential appointees exert considerable influence on firms, industries, or the entire economy. => 其他总统任命职位将对企业、产业甚至整个经济产生重大影响。

For example, Obama’s appointees to the obscure National Labor Relations Board tried to prevent Boeing from expanding in South Carolina, despite the state’s anti-union “right to work” legislation. => 比如，奥巴马授命成立的神秘的美国劳工关系委员会（National Labor Relations Board）试图阻止波音公司在南卡罗来纳州的扩张，尽管该州通过了反工会的“工作权利”立法。
These policies would affect US economic growth, the budget deficit, national saving, and hence global trade and capital flows. => 这些政策将影响到美国的经济增长、预算赤字、国民储蓄，从而影响全球贸易和资本流。
Obama would steer America in the direction of European social-welfare states; Romney’s agenda is designed to prevent that. => 奥巴马将把美国驶上欧洲式社会福利国家的道路；而罗姆尼的方案是阻止这一幕的发生。
Whoever wins, a fiscal cliff looms at the end of 2012. => 不论谁获胜，财政悬崖都将是2012年底的一打阴影。

Previous legislation, if not reversed, will lead to large abrupt tax hikes and spending cuts, which the Congressional Budget Office forecasts would likely cause a recession in 2013. => 此前的立法如果不能扭转，将导致突发性的大规模增税和减支，据联邦预算委员会的预计，这极有可能在2013年导致衰退。

While a post-election, lame-duck session of Congress will address the fiscal cliff, the deep differences between Republicans and Democrats on taxes and spending remain wide and difficult to bridge. => 选举之后的国会免不了像只跛脚鸭，尽管它会解决财政悬崖，但共和党和民主党之间在税收和支出问题上的重大差异依然难以弥合。
With uncertainty plaguing Europe’s finances and China slowing, the last thing the global economy needs is a stagnant or shrinking US economy. => 不确定性正在折磨欧洲财政，中国正在经历减速，如果美国经济再停滞不前甚至衰退，那世界经济就完了。
But it will take strong leadership by the president-elect to avoid it. => 但要阻止这一幕，就需要总统大选选出强大的领袖。
America’s Exceptional Fiscal Conservatism => 美国的另类财政保守主义

WASHINGTON, DC – In most countries, to be “fiscally conservative” means to worry a great deal about the budget deficit and debt levels – and to push these issues to the top of the policy agenda. => 华盛顿—在大多数国家，身为“财政保守派”意味着你非常担心预算赤字和债务水平，并将这类问题置于政策日程的最优先位置。

In many eurozone countries today, “fiscal conservatives” are a powerful group, insisting on the need to boost government revenue while bringing spending under control. => 如今，在许多欧元区国家 ， “ 财政保守派”是一个很有力量的集团，他们坚持政府需要增加收入，同时控制支出。
In Great Britain, too, leading Conservatives have recently proved willing to raise taxes and attempted to limit future spending. => 在英国，执政的保守党最近也显示出征税和限制未来支出的意愿。
The United States is very different in this respect. => 在这方面，美国显得极为不同。
Why do US fiscal conservatives care so little about government debt, relative to their counterparts in other countries? => 为什么与其他国家的同道相比，美国的财政保守派基本不关注政府债务呢？
It has not always been this way. => 并非总是如此。

For example, in 1960, President Dwight D. Eisenhower’s advisers suggested that he should cut taxes in order to pave the way for his vice president, Richard Nixon, to be elected to the presidency. => 比如，1960年，艾森豪威尔总统的顾问就建议他减税从而为其副总统尼克松问鼎总统宝座创造条件。

Eisenhower declined, partly because he did not particularly like or trust Nixon, but mostly because he thought it was important to hand over a more nearly balanced budget to his successor. => 艾森豪威尔拒绝了这一建议，部分是因为他并不是很喜欢和信任尼克松，但主要原因是他认为给继任者留下更接近收支平衡的预算非常重要。
The framework for US macroeconomic policy changed dramatically when the international monetary system broke down in 1971. => 1971年国际货币体系崩溃后，美国宏观政策框架有了极大的改变。
The US could no longer maintain a fixed exchange rate between the dollar and gold – the cornerstone of the postwar Bretton Woods system. => 美国不再能够维持美元和黄金之间的固定兑换率，而这正是战后布雷顿森林体系的基石。

Ironically, however, rather than undermining the predominant international role of the US dollar, the end of Bretton Woods actually boosted its use around the world. => 不过，讽刺的是，布雷顿森林体系的终结并没有动摇美元在国际上的主导地位，实际上反而增加了美元在世界范围的使用。
This turns out to be a mixed blessing, because it has allowed the US to become less careful about its fiscal accounts. => 这是一柄双刃剑，因为这导致美国不再关注财政账户。

Foreigners now hold roughly half of all US federal government debt, and they are willing to hold it when it yields a very low return in dollars (and even when the dollar depreciates). => 如今，外国人大约持有了美国联邦政府债务的一半，而即使在这笔债务的美元回报率极低（以及美元出现贬值）的情况下，他们也愿意持有
In fact, whenever the world looks unstable, investors want to hold more dollar assets – even when the US is the cause of the instability. => 事实上，每当世界不太稳定的时候，投资者就会愿意持有更多的美元 — — 即使不稳定的根源正是来自美国。

When big US banks are in trouble or Americans are having another debilitating political fight over their public finances, global investors scramble into US Treasuries. => 当美国大银行陷入麻烦或美国陷入危害甚深的公共财政政治斗争时，全球投资者忙不迭地买入美国国债。
What has America done with this opportunity – arguably the lowest-cost funding in the history of humankind? => 美国利用这一机会做了些什么呢 — — 这也许是人类历史上最低廉的融资成本了？
Not much, in terms of productive investment, strengthening education, or maintaining essential infrastructure. => 没做什么，如果你从生产性投资、加强教育或维持基本基础设施角度来看的话。

But the US has done a great deal in terms of adopting tax cuts that boost consumption relative to income and lower government revenue relative to expenditure. => 但若从采取减税措施以增加消费相对收入的比例以及降低政府收入相对支出的比例来说，美国又做了很多。
This is the lasting legacy of the “temporary” tax cuts adopted by George W. Bush’s administration in the early 2000’s. => 这是小布什政府在21世纪初所采取的“临时”减税措施的最后遗留效应。

Ryan and members of the Tea Party wing of the Republican Party undoubtedly want to cut the size of the federal government, and they have articulated plans to do this over several decades. => 莱恩和共和党中的茶党成员毫无疑问希望削减联邦政府的规模，他们交流这方面的计划已经几十年了。
But, in the near term, what they promise is primarily tax cuts: their entire practical program is front-loaded in that direction. => 但是，在短期，他们的承诺主要是减税：他们的整个实用性规划是一个朝着这个方向前进的前瞻性计划。

The calculation is that this will prove politically popular (probably true) while making it easier to implement spending cuts down the road (less obvious). => 他们的算盘是，政治上，这会得到民众支持（也许是对的 ） ， 与此同时，这会让后续的减支计划更容易实施（正确性不那么明显 ） 。
The vulnerability caused by higher public debt over the next few decades is simply ignored. => 而未来数十年公债增加所引起的脆弱性完全不在他们的考虑范围内。
For example, Ryan supported George W. Bush’s spending spree. => 比如，莱恩支持小布什的无节制支出。

He also supports maintaining defense spending at or near its current level – resisting the cuts that were put in place under the Budget Control Act of 2011. => 他还支持将防务开支维持在（接近）现有水平，拒绝接受根据2011年预算控制法实施的防务开支缩减。

The assumption here – unstated and highly questionable – is that the US will be able to sell an unlimited amount of government debt at low interest rates for the foreseeable future. => 他们的假设 — — 并没有明说，也很可疑 — — 是在可预见的未来，美国仍能以极低的利率出售任意数量的国债。
There is no other country in the world where fiscal conservatives would want to be associated with such a high-stakes gamble. => 在其他国家，没有哪个财政保守派愿意进行如此高赌注的豪赌。
America’s Failed Militarized Foreign Policy => 美国失败的军事化外交政策

Many of today’s war zones – including Afghanistan, Ethiopia, Iran, Iraq, Pakistan, Somalia, and Sudan – share basic problems that lie at the root of their conflicts. => 当今许多战火不断的地区—包括阿富汗、埃塞俄比亚、伊朗、伊拉克、巴基斯坦、索马里和苏丹—都有着植根于它们冲突之中的基本问题。

They are all poor, buffeted by natural disasters – especially floods, droughts, and earthquakes – and have rapidly growing populations that are pressing on the capacity of the land to feed them. => 它们都很贫穷，饱受自然灾害之苦—特别是洪水、干旱和地震—并且都有着急速增长的人口，给土地的承载力带来巨大的压力。
And the proportion of youth is very high, with a bulging population of young men of military age (15-24 years). => 年轻人口的比例很高，达到入伍年龄(15-24 岁)的年轻人数量也在不断增加。
All of these problems can be solved only through long-term sustainable economic development. => 所有的这些问题通过长期可持续的经济发展都可以解决。
Yet the United States persists in responding to symptoms rather than to underlying conditions by trying to address every conflict by military means. => 然而，美国的反应却是治标不治本，试图通过军事手段应对每一场冲突。
It backs the Ethiopian army in Somalia. => 它在索马里支持埃塞俄比亚军队。
It occupies Iraq and Afghanistan. => 它占领了伊拉克和阿富汗。
It threatens to bomb Iran. => 它威胁轰炸伊朗。
It supports the military dictatorship in Pakistan. => 它支持巴基斯坦的军事独裁政权。
None of these military actions addresses the problems that led to conflict in the first place. => 没有一项这样的军事行动是旨在解决引发冲突的问题。
On the contrary, American policies typically inflame the situation rather than solve it. => 相反，美国的政策通常是给当前的局势火上浇油。
Time and again, this military approach comes back to haunt the US. => 这种军事手段使得美国屡屡自酿苦酒。
The US embraced the Shah of Iran by sending massive armaments, which fell into the hands of Iran’s Revolutionary Government after 1979. => 它曾以提供大量武器装备的形式支持伊朗国王，但这些装备在1979年以后却落入了伊朗“革命政府”手中。
The US then backed Saddam Hussein in his attack on Iran, until the US ended up attacking Saddam himself. => 美国在那时支持萨达姆攻打伊朗，直到调转枪头对准萨达姆本人。
The US backed Osama bin Laden in Afghanistan against the Soviets, until the US ended up fighting bin Laden. => 美国曾在阿富汗支持本•拉登抵抗苏联，直到他最终成为美国的头号敌人。

Since 2001 the US has supported Pervez Musharraf in Pakistan with more than $10 billion in aid, and now faces an unstable regime that just barely survives. => 自2001年起，美国给巴基斯坦的穆沙拉夫提供了超过100亿美金的援助支持，而现在所面对的却是一个摇摇欲坠的政权。
US foreign policy is so ineffective because it has been taken over by the military. => 美国的外交政策如此低效的原因是它被军方控制了。
Even postwar reconstruction in Iraq under the US-led occupation was run by the Pentagon rather than by civilian agencies. => 就连美国占领下的伊拉克战后重建也是由五角大楼而不是民间机构主导的。
The US military budget dominates everything about foreign policy. => 美国的军事预算主导着外交政策的方方面面。
Another 16% went straight to the Pakistani budget, no questions asked. => 另有16%直接流入巴基斯坦的预算，具体去向不明。
That left less than 10% for development and humanitarian assistance. => 所剩给发展与人道主义援助的部分不足10 % 。
Annual US aid for education in Pakistan has amounted to just $64 million, or $1.16 per school-aged child. => 用于巴基斯坦教育方面的年度美国援助总额仅有6400万美元，平均到每个学龄儿童身上只有1.16美元。

They also emphasize that “US engagement with Pakistan is highly militarized and centralized, with very little reaching the vast majority of Pakistanis.” => ”他们还强调“美国与巴基斯坦的接触是高度军事化和集中化的，与广大巴基斯坦民众几乎不相干。

They quote George Bush as saying, “When [Musharraf] looks me in the eye and says…there won’t be a Taliban and won’t be al-Qaeda, I believe him, you know?” => ”他们援引布什的话 ： “ 当（穆沙拉夫）直视着我的眼睛说 … … 将不会有塔利班也不会有基地组织时，我相信他，你���白么？ ”
This militarized approach is leading the world into a downward spiral of violence and conflict. => 这种军事化的手段正将世界引入无止境的暴力与冲突之中。

Each new US weapons system “sold” or given to the region increases the chances of expanded war and further military coups, and to the chance that the arms will be turned on the US itself. => “出售”或给予该地区的每一件新的美国武器系统都会增加战争扩大和进一步军事政变的几率，也会增加将这些武器用来对付美国自身的几率。
These places are bulging with people facing a tightening squeeze of insufficient rainfall and degraded pasturelands. => 这些地区的众多人口都面临着降雨不足和草场退化的严重威胁。
Naturally, many join radical causes. => 很自然，在这样的情况下很多人加入了激进组织。
Instead of seeing real people in crisis, they see caricatures, a terrorist around every corner. => 他们看不到危机中的真实民众，而只看得到漫画般的，藏匿在每个角落的恐怖分子。
America’s Financial Leviathan => 美国的金融利维坦
BERKELEY – In 1950, finance and insurance in the United States accounted for 2.8% of GDP, according to US Department of Commerce estimates. => 伯克利 — — 根据美国商业部的统计数字，1950年，美国金融和保险业占GDP的比重为2.8 % 。
By 1960, that share had grown to 3.8% of GDP, and reached 6% of GDP in 1990. => 1960年，这一比重已上升为3.8 % ， 1990年则达到了6 % 。
Today, it is 8.4% of GDP, and it is not shrinking. => 今天，这一数字是8.4 % ， 而且并没有出现下滑。
The Wall Street Journal’s Justin Lahart reports that the 2010 share was higher than the previous peak share in 2006. => 《华尔街日报》的贾斯丁·莱哈特（Justin Lahart）报道说，2010年，该比重超过了2006年前一次高峰值。
There have been many shocks to the US economy over the past couple of generations, and many factors have added to or subtracted from economic growth. => 过去几代人经历了多次对美国经济的冲击，诸多因素都领经济增长雪上加霜。

But it is not obvious that the US economy today would be 6% less productive if it had had the finance-insurance system of 1950 rather than the one that prevailed during the past 20 years. => 但没有明显的证据表明，如果金融-保险系统维持1950年的水平，而没有像过去20年那样出现爆发式增长，那么今天美国经济的生产率会比现在低6 % 。
There are five ways that an economy gains from a well-functioning finance-insurance system. => 经济从运转良好的金融-保险系统中获益，存在五种途径。

Second, well-functioning financial systems match large, illiquid investment projects with the relatively small pools of money contributed by individual savers who value liquidity highly. => 其二，运转良好的金融-保险系统将大规模、低流动性的投资项目与相对较小、由看重流动性的个人储蓄者提供的资金组成的资金池匹配了起来。
