There has been one important innovation over the past two generations: businesses can now issue high-yield bonds. => 在过去两代人的时间里，有一项重要创新：现在，企业可以发行高收益债券。
Third, improved opportunities to borrow allow one to spend more now, when one is poor, and save more later, when one is rich. => 其三，借贷机会的改善使得人们可以在今天（较穷时）支出得更多，在未来（较富时）储蓄得更多。
Households are certainly much more able to borrow, thanks to home-equity loans, credit-card balances, and payday loans. => 家庭的借贷机会有了明显的提高，这得归功于住房所有权贷款、信用卡账户和发薪日贷款。
But what are they really buying? => 但实际上他们买了些什么呢？
And that is not something you want to buy. => 而这正是你所想买到的。
Fourth, we have seen major improvements in the ease of transactions. => 其四，我们看到，交易的便利性有了极大的改善。
Finally, better finance should mean better corporate governance. => 最后，更棒的金融意味着更棒的公司治理。

And a substantial change has indeed occurred over the past two generations: CEOs focus much more attention than they used to on pleasing the stock market, and this is likely to be a good thing. => 而在过去两代人的时间里，的确发生了深远的变化：CEO们比以前更关注股市表现了，这或许是件好事。

Lahart cites the conclusion of New York University’s Thomas Philippon that today’s US financial sector is outsized by two percentage points of GDP. => 莱哈特引用了纽约大学的托马斯·菲力彭（Thomas Philippon）的结论：今日美国的金融部门显得太大了，占GDP的比重至少比合理水平高2个百分点。
And it is very possible that Philippon’s estimate of the size of the US financial sector’s hypertrophy is too small. => 而且菲力彭对美国金融部门规模的估计很有可能是低估的。
Why has the devotion of a great deal of skill and enterprise to finance and insurance sector not paid obvious economic dividends? => 为什么投入金融和保险部门的技能和创业精神没有产生显而易见的经济红利？
Are we sure that most of the growth in finance stems from a rising share of financial professionals who undertake the former rather than the latter? => 金融业的增长主要来自从事前一种业务还是后一种业务的专业人士，这个问题的答案有谁能确切知道吗？
America’s Fiscal Isolationism => 美国的财政孤立主义
DENVER – Patience might be a virtue, but not necessarily when it comes to American foreign policy. => 丹佛 — — 耐心是一种美德，但在美国外交政策上绝非如此。

It was also a realpolitik acknowledgement of the setbacks to be expected along the way (the “slog,” as then Defense Secretary Donald Rumsfeld put it). => 这一概念也是对预期中的挫折的强权政治式的承认（用当时国防部长拉姆斯菲尔德的话说，就是“决胜 ” ） 。
Daunting as the effort would be, its advocates assumed a sustainable political consensus to support it. => 这样的付出令人生畏，因此其鼓吹者需要可持续的政治一致来支持它。
After all, the United States had been attacked. => 毕竟，美国也曾被攻击过。

Today, that consensus is unraveling as America’s politicians wrestle with a federal budget that is itself turning into a long war – one with its own casualties. => 如今，随着美国政客在旷日持久的联邦预算论战中斗得不可开交，这个一致条件已不再成立。

The battle lines in this struggle suggest that there is little accord among political elites for any spending, let alone for a long war with far-flung commitments. => 这场论战表明，政治精英在所有支出方案上都存在分歧，更不用说劳师远征事宜了。
As a result, basic assumptions are being questioned at every turn. => 结果，每走一步，基本条件就会受到质疑。
Indeed, the current budget war seems to be reopening old divisions about America’s view of itself and the world. => 事实上，当前预算论战似乎重新撕开了美国对其自身以及世界看法的旧有分歧。
The outcome is far from certain, but even isolationism, a perennial American malady, seems to be making a comeback. => 论战结果远未明了，甚至有孤立主义（在美国由来已久的弊端）卷土重来的可能。
But this time, as perhaps never before, a bipartisan isolationist impulse is being driven by the budget. => 但这一回可能与前几次都不一样，预算问题正在催生跨党派孤立主义。
America’s fiscal crisis is profound, and it is not just about numbers. => 美国的财政危机影响深远，绝对不是几个数字那么简单。

As the emotions in Washington today suggest, the aversion to tax increases runs far deeper than concern about their effect on current economic performance and job growth. => 华盛顿的情绪表明，对加税的厌恶要远胜于当前经济和就业表现。

In part, it represents a fundamental – some would say fundamentalist – view that taxes are to government what a bottle of whisky is to an alcoholic. => 从某种程度上说，这代表着一种正统 — — 一些人称之为正统派 — — 观点，即税收之于政府，就像威士忌之于酒鬼。
Government, as Ronald Reagan told us, is the problem, not the solution. => 罗纳德·里根告诉我们，政府不是解决方案，政府本身就是问题。
That message is bad news for American diplomacy. => 这对美国外交来说可是个坏消息。

In places like rural El Paso County, on the eastern plains of Colorado, far from the federal budget debate’s epicenter, spending cuts are the order of the day. => 在艾尔帕索县（El Paso County）农村等地区，在科罗拉多州东部平原，在那些远离联邦预算论战中心的地区，支出削减已经提上了议程。
School districts are increasing class sizes as they shed teachers, as well as deferring maintenance projects and curtailing the school-bus service. => 随着教师裁员，各学区纷纷提高了班级规模，校舍修缮计划被推迟，校车服务也收到了影响。
These cuts are having a very real and immediate impact on El Paso County’s residents. => 支出削减正在对艾尔帕索县居民造成直接影响。

Can they, and other Americans who are losing vital services, really be expected to rise above it all and support funding to build new schools in Afghanistan? => 他们（以及其他正在失去生活必须服务的美国人）真的会期待付出更多的税收来为阿富汗建设新学校提供资金？
Not only are America’s public schools starting to look second-rate, but so is its infrastructure, which had long been a source of national pride. => 不但美国公立学校正在沦为二等，美国基础设施亦然，而这长期以来一直是美国人民的骄傲。

How many travelers nowadays can fail to note the difference between Asia’s new, efficient airports and the aging, clogged antiques in some major US cities? => 现在，有多少旅行者会分不清亚洲的新建高效机场和美国各主要城市那老迈低效的古董机场？

The budget war is not producing any consensus on fixing America’s infrastructure, but it is beginning to produce a view that Afghanistan and Pakistan are far from being core US national interests. => 预算论战并没有就修补美国基础设施���成任何一致，倒是在造成这样的印象：阿富汗和巴基斯坦才是美国的核心国家利益。
Why, people ask, are schools and roads in Afghanistan and Iraq more important than those in Colorado or California? => 人们不禁要问，为什么阿富汗和伊拉克的学校和道路比科罗拉多和加利福尼亚更重要？
At one point in 2008, the US military picked up the cost of transporting a tiger for the Baghdad zoo. => 在2008年，美国军队承担了向巴格达动物园运送一只老虎的费用。
When was the last time the US government did that for a US zoo (outside of Washington, of course)? => 美国政府上一次为美国动物园做同样的事情要追溯到何年何月了（当然，华盛顿除外 ） ？
How this debate sorts itself out will have profound consequences for how America conducts itself in the world. => 这场论战如何收场将对美国如何在世界上给自己定位造成深远影响。
But it might also take a toll on how the world reacts to America’s fastest-growing export: unsolicited advice. => 但这也将有损于世界对美国增长最快的出口项目 — — 主动提供意见 — — 的反应。
Countries take others’ advice for many reasons. => 一国接受他人意见的原因很多。
Sometimes they respect the adviser’s wisdom and insights (fairly rare in diplomacy). => 有时他们尊重意见提供者的智慧和洞见（这在外交中非常罕见 ） 。
Or they might fear the consequences of not taking the advice (an offer one cannot refuse, so to speak). => 有时他们害怕拒绝建议的后果（及不得不接受的意见 ） 。
Or, as is true of many of America’s diplomatic transactions, accepting advice could open the way to a better relationship and to additional assistance. => 有时（正如大量美国外交交易所显示的）接受建议开启改善关系之门，从而带来进一步的援助。
In short, diplomacy – and US diplomacy, in particular – often involves money. => 简言之，外交 — — 特别是美国外交 — — 通常与金钱有关。
But what if there is no money to offer? => 但没钱进行外交会怎么样呢？
What if Americans, tired of the budget cuts in their neighborhoods, refuse to support funds even for “the long war”? => 如果美国人厌恶了对自己所住社区预算的削减，从而拒绝为“漫长的战争”掏腰包，情况又会如何？
At that point, senior US officials might well arrive in a country, offer advice, and find that nobody is bothering to listen. => 真到了这一步，可能会是这样：美国高官抵达某个国家，给出一些建议，结果发现根本没人理他。
Learning from America’s Forgotten Default => 汲取被遗忘的美国违约的教训
LOS ANGELES – One of the most pervasive myths about the United States is that the federal government has never defaulted on its debts. => 洛杉矶—关于美国的一则流传甚广的传说是联邦政府从未对其债务违过约。
Every time the debt ceiling is debated in Congress, politicians and journalists dust off a common trope: the US doesn’t stiff its creditors. => 每一次国会争论债务上限，政客和记者都会站出来说，美国不会失信于债权人。
There’s just one problem: it’s not true. => 只有一个问题：这不是真的。

There was a time, decades ago, when the US behaved more like a “banana republic” than an advanced economy, restructuring debts unilaterally and retroactively. => 几十年前，美国曾经一度更像是一个“香蕉共和国”而不是发达经济体，单方面和追溯性地重组债务。
And, while few people remember this critical period in economic history, it holds valuable lessons for leaders today. => 尽管很少有人记得这段经济史上的重要时期，但它对于今天的领导人来说是非常宝贵的教训。

In April 1933, in an effort to help the US escape the Great Depression, President Franklin Roosevelt announced plans to take the US off the gold standard and devalue the dollar. => 1933年4月，为了帮助美国摆脱大萧条，罗斯福总统宣布准备让美国脱离金本位并让美元贬值。
But this would not be as easy as FDR calculated. => 但这不像罗斯福想象的那么简单。
Most debt contracts at the time included a “gold clause,” which stated that the debtor must pay in “gold coin” or “gold equivalent.” => 当时的大部分债务合同都含有“黄金条款 ” ， 规定债务人必须用“金币”或“黄金等价物”偿付。
These clauses were introduced during the Civil War as a way to protect investors against a possible inflationary surge. => 这些条款产生于内战时期，初衷是为了保护投资者免收可能的通货膨胀飙升的影响。
For FDR, however, the gold clause was an obstacle to devaluation. => 但对罗斯福来说，黄金条款成为美元贬值的障碍。
To solve this problem, Congress passed a joint resolution on June 5, 1933, annulling all gold clauses in past and future contracts. => 为了解决这个问题，国会在1933年6月5日通过了联合决议，废除过去和未来的一切黄金条款。
The door was opened for devaluation – and for a political fight. => 贬值的大门打开了 — — 政治斗争的大门也随之打开。

Republicans were dismayed that the country’s reputation was being put at risk, while the Roosevelt administration argued that the resolution didn’t amount to “a repudiation of contracts.” => 共和党感到沮丧，因为美国的声誉岌岌可危，而罗斯福政府认为决议并不构成“否认合同 ” 。
On January 30, 1934, the dollar was officially devalued. => 1934年1月30日，美元正式贬值。
The price of gold went from $20.67 an ounce – a price in effect since 1834 – to $35 an ounce. => 黄金价格从每盎司20.67美元 — — 自1834年生效的价格 — — 上涨到每盎司35美元。
Not surprisingly, those holding securities protected by the gold clause claimed that the abrogation was unconstitutional. => 毫不奇怪，受黄金条款保护的证券持有者宣称此举违宪。

Lawsuits were filed, and four of them eventually reached the Supreme Court; in January 1935, justices heard two cases that referred to private debts, and two concerning government obligations. => 这引起了很多官司，其中四宗最终抵达了最高法院；1935年1月，法官听取了两宗与私人债务有关的案件，两宗与政府债务有关的案件。
The underlying question in each case was essentially the same: did Congress have the authority to alter contracts retroactively? => 每宗案件的基本问题其实是一样的：国会是否有权力追溯性地更改合同？
On February 18, 1935, the Supreme Court announced its decisions. => 1935年2月18日，最高法院宣布了裁决。
In each case, justices ruled 5-4 in favor of the government – and against investors seeking compensation. => 每宗案件，法官都以5-4的投票做出有利于政府，不利于索赔投资者的裁决。

According to the majority opinion, the Roosevelt administration could invoke “necessity” as a justification for annulling contracts if it would help free the economy from the Great Depression. => 根据多数意见，罗斯福政府可以以“必要性”为由撤销合同，如果这有助于让经济摆脱大萧条的话。
He ended his presentation with strong words: “Shame and humiliation are upon us now. Moral and financial chaos may be confidently expected.” => 在一次简要演讲中，他谈到了合同的不可侵犯性、政府的义务，以及打着法律幌子的赖账。

Most Americans have forgotten this episode, as collective amnesia has papered over an event that contradicts the image of a country where the rule of law prevails and contracts are sacred. => 大部分美国人都忘了这段历史，对于这个与国家形象 — — 法治和合同神圣不可侵犯 — — 相悖的事件，美国人犯了集体健忘症。
But good lawyers still remember it; today, the 1935 ruling is invoked when attorneys are defending countries in default (like Venezuela). => 但好律师仍然记得；如今，为违约国家（如委内瑞拉）辩护的律师，都会援引1935年裁决。

And, as more governments face down new debt-related dangers – such as unfunded liabilities associated with pension and health-care obligations – we may see the argument surface even more frequently. => 随着更多政府面临新的债务相关危机 — — 如与退休金和医疗义务有关的无力支付的负债 — — 我们可能会更加频繁地看到这个论据出现。

Nor is this a problem only for America; in many countries, pension and health-related liabilities are increasing, while the ability to cover them is diminishing. => 这一问题也不仅局限于美国；许多国家的退休金和医疗相关负债都在不断增加，而覆盖这些债务的能力不断削弱。
A key question, then, is whether governments seeking to adjust contracts retroactively may once again invoke the legal argument of “necessity.” => 因此，一个关键问题是试图追溯性调整合同的政府是否会再次援引“必要性”为合法借口。
The 1933 abrogation of the gold clause provides abundant legal and economic reasons to consider this possibility. => 1933年的撤销黄金条款提供了充足的法律和经济理由考虑这一可能性。
The US Supreme Court agreed with the “necessity” argument once before. => 美国最高法院曾经首肯了“必要性”观点。
It is not far-fetched to think that it may happen again. => 认为它会再次这么做绝非牵强附会。
The Maddening of America => 变疯的美国
BOSTON – The relative global decline of the United States has become a frequent topic of debate in recent years. => 波士顿—近几年来，美国的相对全球衰落成了常见的争论主题。
Proponents of the post-American view point to the 2008 financial crisis, the prolonged recession that followed, and China’s steady rise. => 后美国论的支持者的论据包括2008年金融危机及其后的长期衰退和中国的稳步崛起。

The claim that the spread of severe mental illness has reached “epidemic” proportions has been heard so often that, like any commonplace, it has lost its ability to shock. => 严重精神病的普遍程度已经达到了“传染病”级别，我们经常能够听到这种论调，以至于已经对此见怪不怪了。

But the repercussions for international politics of the disabling conditions diagnosed as manic-depressive illnesses (including major unipolar depression) and schizophrenia could not be more serious. => 但被诊断为狂躁抑郁症（包括严重单相抑郁）和精神分裂症的残疾症状的国际政治影响是极其严重的。

Indeed, the most common of these illnesses, unipolar depression, is the least complex in terms of its symptoms, but also the most lethal: 20% of depressed patients are estimated to commit suicide. => 事实上，这些疾病中的最常见者 — — 单向抑郁症从症状来说是最不复杂的，但也是最致命的：据统计，20%的抑郁症患者会走上自杀之路。
Obsessive suicidal thinking and paralyzing lack of motivation allow depressed patients to be classified as psychotic as well. => 沉溺于自杀的想法和缺少动机使抑郁症患者也可以归为精神病。

These conditions are often accompanied by elaborate delusions – images of reality that confuse information generated in the mind with that provided from outside. => 这些病症常常伴有精心构造的妄想 — — 即混淆了来自意识的信息和来自外部提供的信息的现实影像。
Often the distinction between symbols and their referents is lost, and patients begin seeing people solely as representations of some imagined force. => 通常，符号及其意象之间的区别会消失，患者开始将人仅仅视为某种想象力量的代表。
The judgment of such people cannot be trusted, to put it mildly. => 保守地说，这类人的判断是不可信任的。
Lifetime prevalence for schizophrenia was estimated at 1.7%. => 终身精神分裂症患病率约为1.7 % 。

There is no known cure for these chronic diseases; after onset (often before the age of 18), they are likely to last until the end of the patient’s life. => 这些慢性疾病没有已知的治疗方法；首次发作（通常在18岁之前）后，就可能一直持续到患者生命终结。

Surveys among US college students estimated that 20% fit criteria for depression and anxiety in 2010, and that nearly 25% fit these criteria in 2012. => 对美国大学生进行的调查表明，2010年有20%的受访者符合抑郁症和焦虑症标准，2012年则有25 % 。
All of this suggests that as many as 20% of American adults may be severely mentally ill. => 所有这些表明，多达20%的美国成年人可能有严重的精神疾病。
In view of disputes over the significance of available data, let’s assume that only 10% of American adults are severely mentally ill. => 从可获得数据的重要性的争论角度，我们假设只有10%的美国成年人有严重的精神疾病。

Southeast Asian countries appear to be especially immune to the bane of severe mental illness; in other regions, poverty, or lack of development, seems to offer a protective barrier. => 南亚国家队严重精神疾病尤其免疫；在其他地区，贫困或欠发展似乎可以成为保护性壁垒。

As I argue in my recent book Mind, Modernity, Madness, the reason for high concentrations of severe mental illness in the developed West lies in the very nature of Western societies. => 我在近著《思维、现代性和疯病 》 （ Mind, Modernity, Madness）中说明了严重精神疾病如此集中高发于发达西方的原因在于西方社会的性质。
The US offers the widest scope for personal self-definition; it also leads the world in judgment-impairing disease. => 美国提供了范围最广的个人自我定义；也存在世界上最大的选择无能症候群。

Unless the growing prevalence of serious psychopathology is taken seriously and addressed effectively, it is likely to become the only indicator of American leadership. => 除非严重精神病的日渐普遍被严肃对待、有效纠正，否则它将成为美国领导力的唯一指标。
The rise of China is unrelated to this. => 中国的崛起与这一点可没有关系。
Obama’s Underachieving Foreign Policy => 奥巴马外交政策差强人意

Nevertheless, in advance of November’s presidential election, it is important to distinguish the forces that have shaped Barack Obama’s foreign policy, and to assess his handling of them. => 尽管如此，在11月总统大选即将到来之际，认识一下什么驱动力决定了奥巴马的外交政策并评估他在处理外交问题上的表现仍然是非常重要的。
Obama kept his promise to withdraw American forces from Iraq during his first term. => 在其第一个任期中，奥巴马履行了从伊拉克撤军的承诺。
But the move proved to be a strategic defeat, given that it significantly diminished the United States’ political influence in Iraq. => 但这一行动是一场战略失败，因为这极大地削弱了美国在伊拉克的政治影响力。
Indeed, Prime Minister Nouri al-Maliki’s government is becoming increasingly allied with Iran. => 事实上，总理马利基政府正在倒向与伊朗结盟。
Obama, who opposed the Iraq war, should not be blamed for current circumstances there. => 反对伊拉克战争的奥巴马不应该成为伊拉克如此现状的替罪羊。
But he was unable to improve the situation or help Iraq’s Shias and Sunnis reach a political compromise. => 但他也没能改善这一状况或帮助伊拉克的什叶派和逊尼派达成政治妥协。
In contrast, Obama expanded the war in Afghanistan – which he considered to be a war of necessity – and put the Taliban on the defensive. => 与之相对的是，奥巴马扩大了阿富汗战争（他认为这是一场必要之仗 ） ， 并迫使塔利班采取了守势。
But the US will begin to withdraw troops after 2014, without having defined a political solution in line with its interests. => 但美国将在2014年后开始撤军，与此同时，与其利益一致的政治解决方案并没有产生。

Meanwhile, America’s strategic partnership with Pakistan, where Obama won a significant symbolic victory by eliminating Osama bin Laden, is in tatters. => 与此同时，美国与巴基斯坦的战略合作关系（在这方面，奥巴马除掉了本·拉登，赢得了重要的象征性胜利）也是千疮百孔。
US-Pakistan relations have regressed to their level before September 11, 2001, with mutual distrust minimizing cooperation. => 美巴关系已经退回了2001年9月11日之前的水平，相互不信任使得两国无法精诚合作。

Notwithstanding Obama’s skillful response to the Arab Spring – the only strategic surprise that he has faced as president – his credibility in the Muslim world has steadily declined. => 尽管奥巴马对于阿拉伯之春的反应可谓灵巧 — — 这也是他作为总统所面临的唯一一次战略惊奇 — — 但其在穆斯林世界中的信誉在稳步下降。

He has failed to deliver on the key promise of his Cairo speech in 2009: “to seek a new beginning between the United States and Muslims around the world.” => 他没能兑现2009年开罗演讲所作出的重要承诺 ： “ 寻求美国和全世界穆斯林的新关系 ” 。

And the US-China relationship has deteriorated, with America seeking to manage China’s rise strategically – for example, through regional trade agreements and an enhanced military presence in Asia. => 美中关系也出现了倒退，美国寻求遏制中国的战略崛起，比如通过地区贸易协定以及增加在亚洲的军事部署。
On multilateral issues, Obama’s performance is equally unimpressive. => 在多边问题方面，奥巴马的表现也同样不尽如人意。
Likewise, domestic pressure has caused Obama to neglect trade issues. => 类似地，国内压力还迫使奥巴马忽视贸易问题。
The US is largely responsible for the failure of the Doha Round of global trade talks. => 美国要为全球贸易谈判多哈回合的失败负主要责任。
Obama’s one significant foreign-policy breakthrough has been to release the US from the grip of the “global war on terror.” => 奥巴马的重大外交政策突破之一是把美国从“全球恐怖战争”的束缚中解放了出来。

Jettisoning the Manichean rhetoric of that “war” allowed the US to regain the political legitimacy that former President George W. Bush had lost, without diminishing its strategic credibility. => 放弃这场对“战争”的摩尼教式的口吻，美国重新赢得了前总统小布什所丢掉的政治合法性，同时又没有降低其战略信誉。
After the Vietnam War, Jimmy Carter hoped to make a break with established US policy. => 越南战争后，卡特希望在既成美国政策中取得突破。
But his administration’s actions – including serious blunders in Iran and Afghanistan – made the US appear weak and indecisive. => 但他的政府的行为 — — 包括在伊朗和阿富汗所犯下的重大错误 — — 让美国显得孱弱而犹豫。
To be sure, Obama faces a more complex diplomatic and strategic environment than Nixon faced in the 1970’s. => 平心而论，奥巴马所面临的外交和战略环境比20世纪70年代尼克松更复杂。

Unstable coalitions in Iran prevent any substantive negotiations between the two countries, while political fragmentation in Pakistan significantly hinders US policy there. => 伊朗内部联盟的不稳定性决定了美伊之间不可能开展任何有意义的谈判，而巴基斯坦的政治分裂局面也极大地拖累了美国的巴基斯坦政策。
But Obama has also struggled to define the terms of a possible grand bargain. => 但奥巴马仍然勉强地给出了可能的大谈判的条件。
Any agreement with Iran would require consent from Israel and the Gulf countries, which do not share the same objectives. => 任何与伊朗达成的协议都必须经过以色列和海湾国家同意，而后两者的目标并不相同。

With Israel, the terms are ostensibly simpler: in exchange for a stronger US security guarantee, Israel would accept the establishment of a Palestinian state based on the 1967 borders. => 至于以色列，条件看上去更简单：作为对美国加强其安全保证的交换，以色列将接受巴勒斯坦沿1967年边境建国。
But Israel is also a crucial domestic political topic in the US; indeed, any distancing from Israel is unacceptable to most Americans. => 但以色列也是美国的主要国内政治话题之一；事实上，任何远离以色列的做法对于大部分美国人来说都是不可接受的。
While Obama’s first term could not be called a foreign-policy disappointment, his achievements – although not trivial – have been limited. => 尽管奥巴马的第一个任期的外交政策算不上令人失望，但他的成就 — — 虽说不小 — — 极其有限。
If he wins a second term, he is likely to find it increasingly difficult to win by playing not to lose. => 如果他能够赢得第二个任期，那么他可能会更加难以通过立足不败之地获得胜利。
America’s Groucho Marxists => 美国的“格鲁乔”马克思主义者
LONDON – Groucho Marx has always been my favorite Marxist. => 发自伦敦 — — 美国喜剧明星格鲁乔·马克思一直是我最钟爱的“马克思主义者 ” 。

One of his jokes goes to the heart of the failure of the ideology – the dogmatic religion – inflicted on our poor world by his namesake, Karl. => 他的其中一条笑料道破了马克思主义意识形态 — — 既所谓教条化的信仰 — — 为何失败的核心原因，而这个信仰曾被他的同族人卡尔·马克思所利用，令我们这个悲惨的世界饱受折磨。
“Who are you going to believe,” Groucho once asked, “me, or your own eyes?” => “你到底要信谁 ， “ 格鲁乔曾经这样问道 ， “ 是我，还是你自己的眼睛？

For hundreds of millions of citizens in Communist-run countries in the twentieth century, the “me” in the question was a dictator or oligarchy ruling with totalitarian or authoritarian powers. => ”对于成千上万名生活在20世纪社会主义国家的公民来说，问题中的“我”是一个用极权主义或者强权主义来进行统治的独裁者或者政治寡头集团。
It didn’t matter what you could see with your own eyes. You had to accept what you were told the world was like. => 你自己的眼睛看到的一切并不重要，你必须接受世界就是他们所说的样子。
Reality was whatever the ruling party said it was. => 执政党说它是什么它就是什么，这就是现实。
The designated successor to Mao Zedong in China, Hua Guofeng, raised this attitude to an art form. He was known as a “whateverist.” => 在中国，毛泽东指定的继承人华国锋把这个观点发挥到了极致：众所周知，他是个“凡是主义者 ” 。
The Party and people should faithfully follow whatever Mao instructed them to do. => 中国共产党和人民就该一心一意遵照毛主席曾经指示的去办。
Communism, like the horizon, was always just beyond reach. => 共产主义更像天边的地平线，永远可望而不可及。

It would be interesting to know how many of those at Beijing’s Central Party School – the party’s main educational institute – believe that the Chinese state is about to wither away, or ever will. => 而如果能让我们了解一下在北京中央党校 — — 这个中国共产党最主要的教育机构 — — 进修的人之中究竟有多少会相信作为一个国家形式的中国即将消亡，或者总有一天会消亡，这都会是一件挺有趣的事。

The more that Russians, Poles, Czechs, and others saw of the life-style in the Western democracies, the more they questioned their own system. => 生活在俄罗斯、波兰、捷克和其他社会主义国家的人们越多看到西方民主国家的生活方式，他们就越质疑自己的社会体系。

In his magisterial book The Rise and Fall of Communism, Archie Brown notes how travel abroad opened Mikhail Gorbachev’s eyes to the failure of the system that he had lived under all his life. => 在阿奇·布朗的权威性著作《共产主义兴衰论》中就记述了出国访问是怎样打开了米哈伊尔·戈尔巴乔夫的眼界，令其发现了一生寄身其中的社会体系的失败之处。
So, in the political sphere, reason has trumped both faith in an unattainable goal and self-delusion about the consequences of its pursuit. => 因此在政治范畴内，理性既战胜了那种追求遥不可及目标的信念，也击败了那种为这一追求而放弃某些权利的自欺欺人之举。
Democracies, of course, allow people to use their reason to make choices based on the evidence of their own eyes. => 而民主国家这一边，人民能够运用自身的理智，根据他们亲眼所见来作出选择。
When you don’t like a government, you can turn the rascals out without overthrowing the whole system. => 当你不喜欢某届政府，你可以将这些混蛋赶下台，而不必去推翻整个政体。
Change can be made in an evolutionary, rather than a revolutionary, way. => 改变是渐进式的，而不是一场彻底革命。
But no one should think that debate in democracies is always based on reason, or that democracy necessarily makes people more rational. => 但人们也不应认为民主国家里的政治争论就总是建筑在理性之上的，或者想当然地认为民主制度必然会令人民变得更加理性。
But reason does not seem to be getting much of a hearing during the current health-care debate in the US. => 然而，在目前关于美国医疗保健改革的争论当中，理性似乎没占到什么便宜。

Outsiders, even admirers, have often wondered how the most globalized country in the world – a continent inhabited by people from every land – can be so irrationally insular on some issues. => 局外人，甚至是仰慕者们都经常感到诧异 — — 美国这个世界上全球化程度最高的国度、一块由各大洲移民居住的大陆怎么会在某些问题上显得如此狭隘而不理智。
The opposition to health-care reform is a similar cause of bemusement. => 而对医疗改革的反对，也引起了我们同样的困惑。

We know that despite its great wealth – and its groundbreaking medical research – America’s health-care system is awful. It is hugely expensive. => 众所周知，除了巨大的财富与其不断创新突破的医药研究之外，美国的医疗体系其实非常糟糕：它异常昂贵，并且花费高得令工作场所健康保险体系都负担不住。
Its costs overwhelm workplace health-insurance schemes. The poor go unprotected. => 穷人缺乏保护，很多疾病也不在保障范围之内。
Too many of the sick are untreated. Overall health statistics are worse than those in comparable countries. => 总的来说，美国的健康统计数据比其他类似国家都要差得多。
Yet Obama’s attempts to reform health care have run into hysterical opposition. => 但即便如此，奥巴马试图改革医疗体系的举措还是遭到了近乎疯狂的反对。
His proposals would lead, it is said, to the state murdering the elderly. => 有人说他的提案意味着国家在谋杀那些年老的公民。

They would introduce Soviet communism into the US – just like what apparently exists in Canada and Britain, with their state-sponsored health systems. => 并认为政府这种由各州提供财政支持的医疗体系将等同于把苏联社会主义引入美国 — — 就像已经明确存在于加拿大和英国的那样。
Communism in Toronto and London? => 那么此举究竟有没有让多伦多和伦敦笼罩在共产主义的阴影之下？
Or just better, cheaper, more reliable health care for all? => 还是创造了一个面向所有人，更好、更经济实惠并且值得信赖的医疗体系呢？
Reason seems to be having a hard time of it in the US just now. => 如今在美国国内，理性似乎正举步维艰。
Maybe it’s no coincidence that Groucho Marx was an American citizen. => 也许只有这样一个国度才能孕育出格鲁乔这种能深入思考教条主义的奇人。
Gun Control After Newtown => 纽顿之后话枪管

NEW YORK – The brutal murder of 20 children and seven adults in Newtown, Connecticut, shakes us to the core as individuals and requires a response as citizens. => 纽约—康涅狄格州纽顿市20名儿童、7名成人遇害惨案骇人心魄，作为公民，我们必须对此有所反应。
The United States seems to reel from one mass gun killing to another – roughly one a month this year alone. => 美国似乎陷入了大规模枪击杀人的怪圈，光是今年，几乎每个月都要发生一起。
Easy access to guns in the US leads to horrific murder rates relative to other highly educated and wealthy societies. => 在美国，得到枪支易如反掌，这导致与其他教育程度较高的富裕社会相比，美国的谋杀大案率较高。
America needs to find a better way. => 美国必须找到一条更好的道路。
Other countries have done so. => 其他国家已经找到了这样的道路。
Between the mid-1970’s and the mid-1990’s, Australia had several mass shootings. => 20世纪70年代中期至90年代中期，澳大利亚发生过数起大规模枪击案。
After a particularly horrible massacre in 1996, a new prime minister, John Howard, declared that enough was enough. => 1996年的特别重大杀戮事件后，新任总理霍华德（John Howard）宣布，够了已经够了（enough was enough ） 。

He instituted a severe crackdown on gun ownership, and forced would-be gun owners to submit to a rigorous application process, and to document why they would need a gun. => 他严厉打击枪支保有，强迫潜在持枪者走严格的申请程序，且必须说明需要持枪的原因。
Conditions for gun ownership in Australia are now very strict, and the registration and approval process can take a year or more. => 如今，澳大利亚的持枪条件十分严格，注册和批准程序长达一年或以上。
Howard’s government also implemented a rigorous “buyback” policy, to enable the government to purchase guns already owned by the public. => 霍华德政府还实施了严格的“回购”政策，允许政府收购已被公众所拥有的枪支。
The policy worked. => 这一政策起到了效果。
Before the crackdown, there had been 13 such massacres in 18 years. => 而在打击枪击保有之前，18年中澳大利亚发生了13起大规模杀戮事件。
The gun lobby in the US remains powerful, and politicians are afraid to counter it. => 枪支游说集团在美国仍然势力强大，政客不敢得罪他们。
Given the shooting of then-Congresswoman Gabrielle Giffords in 2011, perhaps they even fear that they, too, might be targeted. => 2011年，国会议员吉福斯（Gabrielle Giffords）遭遇枪击，这使得政客们甚至害怕自己也成为目标。

There can be little doubt that some societies are more steeped in violence than others, even controlling for obvious factors like income levels and education. => 毫无疑问，即使控制了收入水平和教育等显而易见的因素，某些社仍比其他社会更具暴力倾向。
What accounts for staggeringly high rates in the US and Latin America? => 美国和拉美杀人率如此之高的原因是什么？
American violence is rooted in history. => 美国的暴力有其历史根源。
The US and Latin American countries are all “conquest” societies, in which Europeans ruled over multi-racial societies. => 美国和拉美国家都是“��征服”社会，是由欧洲人统治的多种族社会。
In the US and many Latin American countries, slaveholding fueled mass violence as well. => 在美国和许多拉美国家，蓄奴也是大规模暴力的助长原因。
The slaves – and generations of their descendants – were routinely murdered. => 奴隶 — — 以及他们的后代 — — 经常被杀致死。
The US also developed a particular populist belief that gun ownership constitutes a vital protection against government tyranny. => 美国还形成了一种带浓厚民粹主义色彩的信念：拥有枪支是抵抗暴政的关键手段。
The US was born in a citizens’ revolt against British imperial power. => 美国诞生在公民反抗英国帝国主义霸权的过程中。

Since citizens’ militias are anachronistic, gun owners now use the second amendment merely to defend individual gun ownership, as if that somehow offers protection against tyranny. => 公民建军权已经过时，因此如今搬出第二修正案的持枪者捍卫的只是个人枪支拥有权，看起来好像这样能够提供抵御暴政的保护。
A reckless, right-wing Supreme Court has agreed with them. => 鲁莽的右倾最高法院也站在持枪者一边。
As a result, gun ownership has become perversely linked to freedom in the vast gun-owning American sub-culture. => 于是持枪权与大规模持枪自由的美国亚文化紧密地联系在了一起。
But, instead of protection of freedom, Americans nowadays are getting massive bloodshed and fear. => 但是，如今，美国人并没有得到自由的保护，反而经受着大规模的流血事件和恐慌。

The claim that gun ownership ensures freedom is especially absurd, given that most of the world’s vibrant democracies have long since cracked down on private gun ownership. => 持枪保证自由的说法尤其荒谬 — — 世界上生机勃勃的民主国家早就撤消了私人枪支拥有权。
No tyrant has risen in Australia since Howard’s gun-control reforms. => 在霍华德枪支管制改革后，澳大利亚也没有出现暴君。
Simply put, freedom in the twenty-first century does not depend on unregulated gun ownership. => 简言之，21世纪的自由并不取决于受管制的持枪权。
Yet US gun culture remains as pervasive as it is unrecorded. => 但美国枪文化仍然无处不在，且鲜有报道。

America reels from one shooting disaster to the next, and on nearly every occasion, politicians dutifully declare their continued devotion to unregulated gun ownership. => 美国接二连三遭遇枪击灾难，而在几乎每一次枪击案中，政客都会誓言旦旦地表示将继续打击不受管制的枪支持有。
Indeed, no one even knows how many guns Americans hold. => 事实上，没有人知道美国人到底拥有多少枪。
The number is estimated to be around 270 million, or almost one per person on average. => 据估计，枪支数量在2.7亿枝，平均人手一把。
According to one recent poll, 47% of households have a gun at home. => 一份最新的民调显示，47%的家庭在家里藏着枪。
Loners, often with paranoid tendencies, commit these heinous acts as part of their own suicide. => 孤独者 — — 往往有偏执倾向 — — 将这种可怕的行为作为自杀过程的一部分。
They use carefully planned and staged mass murders of innocents in order to take revenge on society and to glorify themselves as they take their own lives. => 他们精心计划和实施针对无辜群众的大规模屠杀，目的是报复社会，然后光荣地自我了断。
The perpetrators are not hardened criminals; many have no previous criminal record. => 凶犯并不是顽固不化的罪犯；许多人都没有犯罪记录。
They are pathetic, deranged, and often have struggled with mental instability for much of their lives. => 他们是可怜的精神错乱者，常常在精神异常中苦苦挣扎。
They need help – and society needs to keep guns out of their reach. => 他们需要帮助 — — 而社会需要让枪支远离他们。

America has now suffered around 30 shooting massacres over the past 30 years, including this year’s deadly dozen; each is a gut-wrenching tragedy for many families. => 过去30年来，美国已经经历了30次大规模枪击，包括今年所发生的12次；每一次惨案都会让许多家庭陷入悲剧。
And yet, each time, gun owners scream that freedom will be eliminated if they are unable to buy assault weapons and 100-round clips. => 而每一次，枪支拥有着都在叫嚣，如果他们无法买到攻击性武器百发装子弹，自由就会被剥夺。
The bloodbath in Newtown is the time to stop feeding this gun frenzy. => 纽顿血案是叫停这一枪支狂热的良机。
Australia and other countries provide models of how to do it: regulate and limit gun ownership to approved uses. => 澳大利亚和其他国家给美国树立了榜样：管制和限制持枪和用枪的批准。
America’s real freedoms depend on sane public policy. => 美国的真正自由取决于明智的公共政策。
America’s G-Zero Moment => 美国的G0时刻
NEW YORK – The 2008 financial crisis marked the end of the global order as we knew it. => 纽约—2008年的金融危机宣告了我们所熟悉的全球秩序寿终正寝。

Indeed, the US has trimmed its presence abroad by refusing to contribute to a eurozone bailout, intervene in Syria, or use force to contain Iran’s nuclear breakout (despite strong Israeli support). => 事实上，美国拒绝在拯救欧元区、干预叙利亚以及动用武力解决伊朗核问题（尽管以色列强烈支持这样做）已经表明它的海外形象有所调整。

President Barack Obama officially ended the war in Iraq, and is withdrawing US troops from Afghanistan at a pace constrained only by the need to save face. => 总统奥巴马正式结束了伊拉克战争，并正在从阿富汗撤军 — — 只能用控制撤军节奏来挽回最后的颜面。
America is handing off the leadership baton – even if no other country or group of countries is willing or able to grasp it. => 美国正在交出领导权杖 — — 尽管还没有哪个国家或国家组织愿意或能够接过它。
In short, US foreign policy may be as active as ever, but it is downsizing and becoming more exacting about its priorities. => 简而言之，美国的外交政策或许亦然像从前那样积极，但免不了正在走下坡路，越来越难以维持其超然的地位。

As a result, many global challenges – climate change, trade, resource scarcity, international security, cyber-warfare, and nuclear proliferation, to name a few – are bound to loom larger. => 结果，诸多全球性挑战 — — 气候变化、贸易、资源稀缺性、国际安全、网络战、核扩散等等 — — 将注定愈演愈烈。
Welcome to the G-Zero world, a more turbulent, uncertain environment in which coordination on global policy issues falls by the wayside. => 欢迎来到G0世界，这是一个更动荡、更不确定的环境，全球政策问题的协调早已被抛诸脑后。

Paradoxically, this new environment, though daunting, is less troublesome for the US; in fact, it provides fresh opportunities for the US to capitalize on its unique position. => 讽刺的是，这一令人沮丧的新环境倒让美国落得了清净；事实上，这给了美国一个全新的利用其独一无二地位的机会。
The G-Zero world is not all bad for the US – if it plays its cards right. => G0世界对美国来说并不是件坏事 — — 只要美国能打好手里的牌。

Many residual strengths take on greater importance in such a world, and America remains the world’s only true superpower and its largest economy – still more than twice the size of China’s. => 在这样一个世界中，诸多剩余力量将扮演更加重要的角色，而美国仍然是唯一的真正超级大国和第一大经济体，比中国大出一倍有余。
Its defense expenditures represent nearly half the world total, and exceed those of the next 17 countries combined. => 美国的国防支出几乎占据了全球总数的半壁江山，比随后的17国的总和还要多。
Likewise, the US continues to lead in entrepreneurship, research and development, higher education, and technological innovation. => 类似地，美国在企业家精神、研发、高等教育和技术创新领域依然无人能出其右。

Moreover, it is now the world’s largest natural-gas producer and calorie exporter, which has reduced its vulnerability to price shocks or food shortages. => 此外，如今美国还是世界最大的天然气产国和热量出口国，这降低了价格冲击或食品短缺对美国的冲击力。
No country rivals America’s promotion of the rule of law, liberal democracy, transparency, and free enterprise. => 没有哪个国家可以在推进法治精神、自由民主、透明和自由企业方面能与美国相媲美。
While other countries certainly support these values, only the US has been willing, healthy, and big enough to ensure that they prevail. => 尽管其他国家显然也支持这些价值，但只有美国一直愿意、也足够坚挺和强大以保证这些价值的推行。
So, as America curtails its global leadership, it will find itself in more demand. => 因此，随着美国全球领导力的收缩，它会发现自己变得更受欢迎。
Consider Asia, for example. As China’s economic importance and regional influence grows, its neighbors are seeking to deepen ties with the US. => 以亚洲为例。 随着中国的经济实力以及地区影响力的提升，其邻国纷纷开始寻求与美国的深度合作。
Japan, Australia, Indonesia, and Taiwan have all recently closed trade and security-related deals with the US. => 日本、澳大利亚、印尼和台湾地区最近都与美国展开了密切的贸易和安全相关问题的交流。
Even Burma has gotten on board, resuming diplomatic engagement with the US while trying to work its way out of China’s shadow. => 甚至缅甸也开始倒向美国，重启了与美国的外交关系，并竭力摆脱中国的阴影。
The extent to which the US will capitalize on these opportunities remains to be seen. => 美国可以多大程度上利用这些机会还有待观察。
In fact, America’s short-term advantages pose the biggest obstacle to its long-term outlook. => 事实上，美国的短期优势正是其长期前景的障碍所在。

Call this the “safe-haven curse”: as long as the US remains the safest port in any storm, it faces no immediate pressure to address its weaknesses. => 不妨将这称为“安全港诅咒 ” ： 只要美国仍然是任何风暴最安全的避风港，那么它就没有动力马上修复自己的弱点。
For example, for all of the hand-wringing about America’s national debt, investors will continue to loan the US money. => 比如，所有关于美国国民债务的文章都说，投资者会继续借钱给美国。
America’s advantages in the G-Zero world afford it the chance to invest in the future. => 美国在G0世界中的超然地位给予了它为未来投资的机会。
But, by cushioning against sufficiently calamitous risks, the same advantages allow the US to procrastinate. => 但是，正是这种超然地位消除了形成灾难性后果的风险，从而让美国安于现状，不思进取。

America’s political system usually works well in crises. But, thanks to its residual advantages in a leaderless world, the US need not rely on a crisis to precipitate action. => 美国的政治制度通常能在危机中运转良好。 但是，由于美国在缺少领袖的世界中还拥有一些残存优势，因此它并不需要一场危机来刺激行动。
It need only seize the G-Zero moment. => 它所需要的，只是抓住G0时刻的机会。
America’s Houses of Cards => 美国的房产危机
There are times when being proven right brings no pleasure. => 有些时候即便证明自己正确也毫无快感可言。
For several years, I argued that America’s economy was being supported by a housing bubble that had replaced the stock market bubble of the 1990’s. => 过去几年来，我一直认为美国的经济是由房地产泡沫支撑着。 这种泡沫取代了1990年代的股市泡沫。
But no bubble can expand forever. => 但没有泡沫可以无限膨胀。
With middle-class incomes in the United States stagnating, Americans could not afford ever more expensive homes. => 随着美国中产阶级的收入滞胀，美国人买不起越来越贵的房产了。

As one of my predecessors as Chairman of the US President’s Council of Economic Advisers famously put it, “that which is not sustainable will not be sustained.” => 作为美国总统经济顾问委员会主席，我的一位前任曾有一句名言 ： “ 不可持续的东西是不会受到支撑的。
But the patterns are systematic, with consequences that unfold gradually, and painfully, over time. => 但有些征兆是系统的，其后果也随着时间的推移逐渐而痛苦地显露出来。
There is a macro-story and a micro-story here. => 这里有宏观和微观层面的原因。
The macro-story is simple, but dramatic. => 宏观原因简单但又富有戏剧性。
Some, observing the crash of the sub-prime mortgage market, say, “Don’t worry, it is only a problem in the real estate sector.” => 有些观察到次级贷市场崩溃的人说 ： “ 别担心，这只是不动产行业的问题。
Booming home prices gave Americans the confidence, and the financial wherewithal, to spend more than their income. => 房产价格的一路飙升给了美国人信心和资金让他们可以超前消费。
America’s household savings rate was at levels not seen since the Great Depression, either negative or zero. => 美国的家庭储蓄率降到大萧条以来的最低点，不是为负就是为零。
With higher interest rates depressing housing prices, the game is over. => 随着高利率对房价的压制，游戏结束了。
As America moves to, say, a 4% savings rate (still small by normal standards), aggregate demand will weaken, and with it, the economy. => 当美国的储蓄率达到4 % （ 就一般标准来看仍然很低 ） ， 累计总需求就会减弱，随之而来的就是经济走弱。
The micro-story is more dramatic. => 微观的分析则更具戏剧性。
Record-low interest rates in 2001, 2002 and 2003 did not lead Americans to invest more – there was already excess capacity. => 2001、2002、2003年创纪录的低利率并未引发美国人更大的投资热情—超额产能（excess capacity）已经出现。
Instead, easy money stimulated the economy by inducing households to refinance their mortgages, and to spend some of their capital. => 相反，赚快钱的心态诱使美国家庭将他们的按揭重新融资并支出部分资本从而刺激美国经济。

It is one thing to borrow to make an investment, which strengthens balance sheets; it is another thing to borrow to finance a vacation or a consumption binge. => 借钱投资是一回事，这能强化我们的资产负债表；但把借来的钱用于度假和疯狂消费那就是另一码事了。
But this is what Alan Greenspan encouraged Americans to do. => 而这正是格林斯潘鼓励美国人做的。

When normal mortgages did not prime the pump enough, he encouraged them to take out variable-rate mortgages – at a time when interest rates had nowhere to go but up. => 当普通贷款不能满足需求时，他鼓励美国人进行可变汇率按揭—而且在利率只升不降的时期。
Predatory lenders went further, offering negative amortization loans, so the amount owed went up year after year. => 贪婪的贷方进而推出了负摊销贷款（negative amortization loans ） ， 从而使借款人的负债连年攀升。

Sometime in the future, payments would rise, but borrowers were told, again, not to worry: house prices would rise faster, making it easy to refinance with another negative amortization loan. => 在未来的某个时候，还款额会提高，但借款人会又一次被告知，别担心：房价上涨会更快，因此再借一笔负摊销贷款会很容易。
The only way (in this view) not to win was to sit on the sidelines. => （在这种观点下）不能受益的只有那些静观其变的人。
All of this amounted to a human and economic disaster in the making. => 这样的推波助澜最终导致了人类和经济的灾难。
Now reality has hit: newspapers report cases of borrowers whose mortgage payments exceed their entire income. => 现实显露出残酷的一面：报纸上报导着借款人的总收入不够偿还按揭的案例。
Globalization implies that America’s mortgage problem has worldwide repercussions. => 全球化意味着美国的贷款问题已经造成了世界范围内的影响。
The first run on a bank occurred against the British mortgage lender Northern Rock. => 第一波受到冲击的是英国按揭贷款银行Northern Rock。
America managed to pass off bad mortgages worth hundreds of billions of dollars to investors (including banks) around the world. => 美国成功地将数以千亿计的不良贷款转卖给全世界的投资者（包括银行 ） 。

They buried the bad mortgages in complicated instruments, buried them so deep that no one knew exactly how badly they were impaired, and no one could calculate how to re-price them quickly. => 他们通过复杂的金融工具埋葬这些坏账，埋葬得如此之深以至于没人知道这些坏账究竟有多坏，也没人能够很快地为它们重新定价。
In the face of such uncertainty, markets froze. => 面对这样的不确定性，市场就冻结了。
Those in financial markets who believe in free markets have temporarily abandoned their faith. => 那些笃信自由市场原则的金融从业人士也暂时将他们的信念抛诸脑后。
For the greater good of all (of course, it is never for their own selfish interests), they argued a bailout was necessary. => 他们说为了所有人的更大福祉（当然，他们从来就是为他人利益着想 ） ， 政府救市是必要的。

But lower short-term interest rates have led to higher medium-term interest rates, which are more relevant for the mortgage market, perhaps because of increasing worries about inflationary pressures. => 但更低的短期利率导致了更高的中期利率，而后者与按揭贷款市场更有关联或许是因为对通胀压力的担心日益增加。

It may make sense for central banks (or Fannie Mae, America’s major government-sponsored mortgage company) to buy mortgage-backed securities in order to help provide market liquidity. => 各中央银行（或美国主要的政府主办贷款银行—美国联邦国民抵押贷款协会Fannie Mae）购入抵押贷款支持证券以增加市场的流动性可能会起到一些作用。
But those from whom they buy them should provide a guarantee, so the public does not have to pay the price for their bad investment decisions. => 但证券的出售方应该提供某种担保，这样公众就不必为他们糟糕的投资决策埋单。
Equity owners in banks should not get a free ride. => 银行的股权拥有者也不应该搭顺风车。
Securitization, with all of its advantages in sharing risk, has three problems that were not adequately anticipated. => 证券化在分担风险方面虽然有其优势，但也存在三个让人没有充分认识到的问题。
While it meant that American banks were not hit as hard as they would otherwise, America’s bad lending practices have had global effects. => 尽管这意味着美国的银行所遭受的打击还不算最坏，但美国的不良贷款方式却已经产生了全球性的影响。
(As economists would say, problems of asymmetric information have increased.) => （就像经济学家们会讲，信息不对称的问题更严重了。 ）

In the old days, when borrowers found it impossible to make their payments, mortgages would be restructured; foreclosures were bad for both the borrower and the lender. => 在过去，当借款人发现无法负担他们的还款时，按揭贷款就会从新组合；抵押赎回对借贷双方都不是好事。
Securitization made debt restructuring difficult, if not impossible. => 证券化使债务重组变得困难（如果不是不可能的话 ） 。
It is the victims of predatory lenders who need government help. => 掠夺性贷方的受害者们才是需要政府帮助的人。
With mortgages amounting to 95% or more of the value of the house, debt restructuring will not be easy. => 当按揭总额达到房产价值的95%或以上时，债务重组就不那么容易了。
America’s Interest-Rate Puzzle => 美国利率之谜
A great puzzle in today’s world economy is the continued low level of long-term real interest rates in the United States. => 美国的长期实际利率一直维持着较低水平，这可以算是当今世界经济的一大难解之谜。

Conventional macroeconomists like me look at America’s current-account deficit, now running at 7% of GDP, and know that such vast deficits are inevitably followed by large currency depreciations. => 现在，美国的经常项目赤字已达到国内生产总值的7 % 。 看到这种情况，像我这样的传统宏观经济学家都清楚，在巨额赤字后，会不可避免地出现大幅度货币贬值。
So we expect a substantial depreciation premium on US interest rates. => 所以，我们预测美国利率溢价会出现大幅度的下降。

If the dollar falls 20% more against the euro sometime in the next ten years, US long-term interest rates should be two percentage points higher than euro rates. => 如果在未来十年的某一天，美元与欧元的汇率再下跌20 % ， 美国的长期利率就会比欧元高出2个百分点。

If it falls 40% against the yen sometime in the next ten years, US long-term interest rates should be four percentage points higher than Japanese rates. => 如果在未来十年的某一天，美元与日元之比下跌40 % ， 美国的长期利率就会比日本高出4个百分点。

If it falls 60% against China’s currency, the yuan, sometime in the next ten years, US long-term interest rates should be six percentage points higher than Chinese rates. => 如果在未来十年的某一天，美元与人民币之比下跌60 % ， 美国的长期利率就会比中国高出6个百分点。
But we are not seeing signs of anything like this. => 但是，现在我们却看不到一点这样的迹象。

The puzzle is not only that long-term rates are too low when viewed in the international context, but also that they are too low when viewed in America’s domestic context. => 让人不解的是，不仅从国际上看长期利率太低，而且就是从美国国内来看，这一利率也非常低。
In this case, the price of loanable funds is the real interest rate. => 在这种情况下，信贷资金价格就等于实际利率。
An expectation that interest rates will be high sometime in the next decade should mean high interest rates on long-term bonds today. => 如果期望在未来十年的某一天利率走高，就意味着要提高目前长期债券的利率。
Yet financial markets are not pricing dollar depreciation and a rise in long-term US interest rates accordingly. => 但金融市场并没有美元贬值、美国长期利率上涨的相应计划。
When we macroeconomists talk to our friends on Wall Street, we find that they don’t view this as a puzzle at all. => 当我们这些宏观经济学家和华尔街的朋友们谈起这个问题时，发现他们根本不觉得这有什么难理解的。
On the contrary, they are puzzled about why we view the current low level of US long-term interest rates as worrisome. => 正相反，他们不明白的是为什么在我们眼里，目前美国长期利率低是件令人担心的事情。
By doing so, they will push prices close to fundamentals today. => 如此一来，他们就能驱使价格接近今天的基点。
And trades do go wrong: remember the collapse of Long-Term Capital Management. => 而交易确实出了问题：别忘了美国长期资本管理公司的倒闭。
The existence of large financial-market actors that do not care about maximizing their profits magnifies the riskiness of the bets. => 金融市场上还有一些大户，他们对最大化自己的利润并不关心。 他们的存在更加大了投资的风险。

Similarly, any financial institution that bets on a sharp rise in long-term interest rates over the next five years in a serious, leveraged way also puts its survival at risk. => 与此相似，如果任何金融机构很认真地，举债来赌未来5年内长期利率会大幅度上涨，那它也是在拿自己的生存冒险。
For where should they park their money? => 他们该把钱投在什么地方？

Real estate rental yields and stock-market payouts are low, and real estate and stock prices may well fall as much as or more than bond prices if interest rates spike. => 房地产租金收益和股市盈利率都太低。 此外，如果利率激增，房地产和股票价格会下跌，跌幅可能等于或大于债券价格的涨幅。

Only businesses that can borrow long-term now, lock in a low real interest rate, and invest in expanding their capacity can make the domestic bet that interest rates will rise. => 只有那些现在能借进长期贷款，锁定目前较低的实际利率，并投资扩大规模的企业可以在国内下注，赌利率上涨。
But America’s businesses see enough risk in the future to be wary of getting stuck with unutilized capacity. => 但是美国的企业都看到了未来的风险，并时刻保持警惕，不让自己被无用规模所套住。
Economists believe that market forces drive prices to fundamentals. => 经济学家们相信市场力量会驱使价格回到基点。
But we are not careful enough to distinguish situations in which equilibrium-restoring forces are strong from those in which such forces are weak. => 但我们总是不够仔细，不能把平衡恢复力强与弱的情况区分开来。

The dollar will fall and US long-term interest rates will rise, but only when traders on Wall Street and elsewhere decide that holding dollars and long-term US bonds is more risky in the short run. => 只有华尔街和别的地方的交易者都认定从短期看，持有美元和长期美国债券风险更大时，美元才会下跌，美国长期利率才会上升。
When that happens, the long-run future will be now. => 等到这种情况发生时，长远的未来形势还是会和现在一样。
America’s Islamist Allies of Convenience => 便利思维下的美国伊斯兰盟友
NEW DELHI – In just one decade, the United States has intervened militarily in three Muslim-majority countries and overthrown their governments. => 新德里—短短十年间，美国军事干预了三个穆斯林占多数国家并颠覆了它们的政府。
Indeed, the last “humanitarian intervention” has clearly backfired, turning Libya into a breeding ground for transnational militants. => 事实上，上一次“人道主义干预”显然适得其反，把叙利亚变成了跨国部队的流血场。

As the intense US debate about President Barack Obama’s proposed use of military force highlights, the attack-Syria push is not about upholding America’s national interest. => 关于总统奥巴马的动武计划的激烈争论凸显出，打击叙利亚的举动并不符合美国的国家利益。
Rather, the desire to protect US “credibility” has become the last refuge of those seeking yet another war in the wider Middle East. => 相反，保护美国“信誉”的渴望成了那些寻求在大中东地区发动又一场战争的人的最后庇护所。

Indeed, an attack would most likely increase America’s reliance on unsavory Islamist rulers in countries ranging from Saudi Arabia and Qatar to Turkey and the United Arab Emirates. => 事实上，打击叙利亚很可能让美国更加依赖于从沙特到卡塔尔和从土耳其到阿联酋的不受欢迎的伊斯兰统治者。

Some Arab monarchs have pledged to bankroll the US attack – an investment that they would easily recover, given that the war talk has already increased oil prices. => 一些阿拉伯君主承诺为美国的打击提供资金 — — 这笔投资很容易就能回本，因为战争言论已经使石油价格上涨。

The US invasion and occupation of Iraq, for example, created a major opening for Al Qaeda, whose affiliates now represent the Sunni struggle against the Shia-dominated government. => 比如，美国对伊拉克的入侵和占领给基地组织敞开了大门，其附属组织目前代表着逊尼派与什叶派控制的政府作对。
Likewise, regime change in Libya aided the rise of Al Qaeda-linked militants, leading to the killing in Benghazi of the US ambassador. => 类似地，利比亚的政权变化也助长了与基地组织有涉的军事势力，导致班加西美国大使遇刺。

A system based on sharia (Islamic law) has been imposed, human-rights abuses are legion, and cross-border movement of weapons and militants has undermined the security of Libya’s neighbors. => 基于伊斯兰法律的制度已经建立，侵害人权的状况比比皆是，武器和军队的跨境流动破坏着利比亚邻国的安全。
Meanwhile, America’s support for the regimes in Yemen and Saudi Arabia has contributed to the rise of Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula. => 与此同时，美国对也门和沙特政权的支持也有利于基地组织在阿拉伯半岛的兴盛。
In parts of southern Yemen, an Al Qaeda affiliate, Ansar al-Sharia, functions as a de facto government. => 在也门南部的一些地区，基地组织附属机构Ansar al-Sharia才是事实上的政府。
Airstrikes now would merely make matters worse by undercutting the FSA’s grassroots legitimacy and aiding Islamist forces. => 目前，空袭将破坏让FSA的草根合法性，倒过来帮助伊斯兰势力，让情况更加恶化。

Farther east, the US wants an “honorable” exit from Afghanistan – the longest war in its history – through a peace deal with the Taliban, its main battlefield opponent. => 在更向东的地方，美国希望与其在阿富汗的主要战斗对手塔利班达成和平协议，从而“光荣”地退出这场美国历史上历时最长的战争。
That simply will not work, even in the short term. => 这一套根本不管用，即使在短期也是如此。

On the contrary, until the Egyptian army removed him from the presidency, the Muslim Brotherhood’s Mohamed Morsi was coming to be seen by many as America’s man in Cairo. => 相反，在埃及军队将穆斯林兄弟会的穆尔西赶下总统宝座前，许多埃及人一直把他当成美国在开罗的代言人。

By supporting Islamist rulers, the US is contributing to a trend evident from the Maghreb to the badlands of Afghanistan and Pakistan – Muslims killing Muslims. => 支持伊斯兰统治者的美国在助长从马格利布到阿富汗和巴基斯坦山沟的穆斯林杀戮穆斯林的趋势。
American policy has also contributed to a growing conflict between Islamist and secular forces in Muslim countries. => 美国的政策还在助长伊斯兰教徒和穆斯林国家的世俗势力之间的冲突。

This is best illustrated by Turkey, where Obama has ignored Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdoğan’s heavy-handed efforts to annul free speech and turn himself into a twenty-first-century Sultan. => 最佳的写照就是土耳其，奥巴马对总理埃尔多安辣手摧毁言论自由、使自己称为21世纪苏丹的行为视而不见。
Moreover, the clash within Islam is likely to be destabilizing regionally and counterproductive to the interests of the free world. => 此外，伊斯兰教内部的冲突也可能成为地区动荡因素，破坏自由世界的利益。
Against this background, Obama should heed the doctrine proposed in 1991 by General Colin Powell. => 在这一背景下，奥巴马应该遵循鲍威尔将军在1991年提出的思想。

Given the US record since the doctrine was formulated, another criterion should be added: the main beneficiaries of military intervention are not America’s mortal enemies. => 美国在这一思想提出后的记录表明，应该在这些标准之上再增加一条：军事干预的主要受益者不是美国的道德对手。
Drone Wars => 无人机战争
BRUSSELS – “Sometime they’ll give a war and nobody will come,” the American poet Carl Sandburg wrote hopefully in 1936. => 布鲁塞尔 — — 1936年美国诗人卡尔·桑德伯格曾满怀希望地写道 ， “ 总有一天他们会发动战争但是没有人来响应。
His sentiment seems more apt than ever nowadays, but not because humanity has turned pacifistic. => ” 他的这种感觉比以往任何时候都更正确，但却不是因为人类比以往更加向往和平。
Rather, wars are increasingly fought remotely, with drones – or unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) – doing the killing. => 相反，人类越来越多地依靠无人机 — — 或无人驾驶飞行器（UAV ） — —进行远程杀戮。

Under President Barack Obama, the number of drone strikes carried out by the United States has soared, with more than 300 UAV attacks reported in Pakistan alone. => 在巴拉克·奥巴马总统治下，美国由无人机发起的攻击数量猛增，仅巴基斯坦一地报告的无人机攻击就超过300次之多。
In March 2011, the US Air Force for the first time trained more pilots for drones than for any other purpose. => 2011年3月，美国空军培训的无人机驾驶员首次超过其他机种。
This raises serious ethical questions. => 这种情况引发了严重的道德问题。
With no military personnel risking their lives, UAVs make it easier to kill, and to justify war operations to the public at home. => 因为没有军事人员需要冒生命危险，无人机降低了杀戮和向国内公众证明战争合法性的难度。
Moreover, a human being’s reticence to kill is inversely related to the distance between attacker and target. => 此外，袭击者和目标之间的距离越远人类进行杀戮的顾虑就越小。
In the case of a pilot flying drones over Yemen by operating a joystick in Nevada, the threshold to pulling the trigger is dangerously low. => 如果无人机飞行员在内华达用操纵杆在也门上空驾驶无人机，那么扣动扳机的临界点会低到十分危险的程度。
Killing is just a part of the job, to be followed by bowling, perhaps, or a quiet evening at home. => 杀戮仅仅是工作的一部分，之后或许会去打保龄球，也可能静静地在家中渡过整个晚上。
From a legal and human-rights point of view, the US drone program is even more alarming. => 从法律和人权角度看，美国的无人机发展计划更为惊人。
After all, countries such as Pakistan, Yemen, and Somalia do not belong to declared war zones. => 毕竟，巴基斯坦、也门和索马里等国不属于公认战区的范畴。
Outside the context of war, in turn, state killings are legal only if they prove absolutely necessary to save lives. => 在战争以外的情况下，只有证明对挽救生命绝对必要才能允许国家采取杀戮行动。

They must be conducted either in self-defense after an attack, or in anticipatory self-defense against an immediate threat, when taking time to discuss non-lethal alternatives is not feasible. => 反击必须在受到攻击后以自卫为目的，或者为了应对可能发生的直接威胁而采取自卫行动，无论是上述哪种情况，都不可能有时间去讨论非致命的替代行动。
More than a decade after September 11, America’s drone program does not fall into the first category of reactive self-defense. => 9.11事件过去10年后，美国无人机计划已无法再划入第一类反应性自卫的范畴。

Unless US leaders prove otherwise in every case, American UAV attacks in countries like Pakistan or Yemen should be called what they are: extrajudicial killings. => 除非美国领导人能够一一证明，否则美国无人机在巴基斯坦和也门等国发动的攻击应该还原其法外处决的本来面目。

US State Department legal adviser Harold Koh disagrees, arguing that America is involved in a worldwide “armed conflict with Al Qaeda, as well as the Taliban and associated forces.” => 美国国务院法律顾问高洪柱不同意这种说法，并提出美国正在打一场世界范围内“与基地组织和塔利班及相关势力的武装战争。
So, Koh claims, drone attacks are part of a global war, fought both in declared war zones and non-war countries; therefore, they are legal. => ”因此高洪柱声称无人机攻击是战区及非战区国家全球战争的组成部分，因此其具有合法性。
But, even under this adventurous assumption, human-rights issues arise. => 但即使我们接受这一冒险的假设，仍然无法对人权问题做出合理的解释。
The laws of war condone targeted killings only of “combatants” who “directly participate in hostilities.” => 战争法只容许定点清除“直接参与敌对行动”的“战斗分子 ” 。
The killings must be proportionate, strategically necessary, and publicly justified. => 而且杀戮行为必须有所控制、具有战略必要性、且能为公众所接受。
Avoiding harm to civilians should be the top priority. => 避免伤害平民应当成为重中之重。
At the slightest sign of illegality, an investigation must be conducted, offenders prosecuted, and victims compensated. => 必须对一丝一毫的非法行为展开调查，对行凶者提起诉讼，并对受害者进行赔偿。
The US drone program’s legal basis is entirely unclear, however. => 但美军无人机计划的法律基础完全不明确。
Given that most information about UAV activity is classified, it is impossible to know whether all drone targets directly participated in hostilities. => 鉴于多数无人机活动信息属保密级别，几乎不可能了解是否所有无人机目标都直接参与了敌对行动。
Others estimate a lower, but still alarming, rate of 30%. => 其他报告虽然估值略低，但仍然达到了30%的惊人比率。
The legal obligation of proportionality is clearly being violated. => 这显然违反了适度采取行动的法律义务。
Accountability is also being flouted. => 问责制同样遭到了蔑视。
Drone operations are carried out by the Central Intelligence Agency, an organization whose activities are shrouded in secrecy. => 无人机行动的执行者是中央情报局，该组织的所有活动无不是秘密进行的。
And, unlike military personnel, CIA agents enjoy extensive immunity, undermining international legal standards. => 而且与军事人员不同，中央情报局特工享有全方位的豁免权，这已经破坏了国际法律的基础。
Without increased transparency, to declare America’s UAV campaign legal is impossible, both in the context of war and outside of armed conflict. => 无论在战争还是武装冲突以外的情况下，要想宣布美国无人机行动合法就必须增加透明度。
As long as the US keeps the rest of the world in the dark, illegal acts – including possible war crimes – may be committed with impunity. => 只要美国仍然不让世界其他国家了解真相，那么违法行为 — — 包括可能发生的战争罪行 — — 就有可能继续逍遥法外。

Victims of UAV attacks, their families, and civil-society groups have begun to speak out against America’s questionable drone campaign, and to pursue legal action. => 无人机攻击的受害者及其家属和民间社会团体已经开始站出来反对美国可疑的无人机行动，并且提起法律诉讼。
Others should feel encouraged to follow suit. => 应该鼓励其他人也这么做。
America’s Locust Years => 美国的灾年
BERKELEY – It is hard right now to write about American political economy. => 伯克利 — — 现在写点关于美国政治经济学的文章可不容易。
Nobody knows whether the debt-ceiling tripwire will be evaded; if so, how; or what will happen if it is not. => 没人不知道债务上限这根紧绷的弦会不会松下来；如何松下来；如果不松下来又会发生什么。
Or the US Federal Reserve, the Peoples Bank of China (PBC), or both – or even some other body – could support the market. => 美联储和中国人民银行（以及其他机构）也可能会出手支撑市场。

Or interest rates could rise if people expect a much weaker global economy – and, in a weaker global economy with no inflation, investors should be holding more US Treasuries, not fewer. => 如果人们预期全球经济会进一步疲软，那么利率也可能会上升，而如果此时没有通胀之忧，那么投资者会更多（而不是更少）地持有美国国债。
Frankly, no one knows what legislative deal will be struck to raise the debt ceiling. => 坦白讲，没人知道到底会达成什么样的方案来提高债务上限。

All we know as of this writing is that a deal would probably involve cuts in near-term spending, meaning weaker growth and higher unemployment over the next 18 months. => 我们所能知道的是，该方案可能会包括削减近期支出的措施，这意味着在未来18个月里，增长会进一步放慢，失业率会进一步增加。

And we can assume that it would be repealed and replaced by something else come January 2013, either by a re-elected President Barack Obama, or by a new, Republican president. => 我们还可以认为这些措施会在2013年1月结束，届时将会有新动作，抛出新措施的既可能是连任的奥巴马，也可能是新的共和党总统。
The risks imposed by global warming, for example, have not gone away. => 比如，全球变暖的威胁并未消除。
The sooner the world starts preparing to deal with those threats, the better. => 对于这一威胁，越早准备越好。
Another six months should not be lost. => 我们不应该再浪费另一个半年。
The employment-to-population ratio in the US remains flat – mired at the very low levels to which it fell during the recession. => 美国就业-人口比率仍然停滞不前，维持在衰退期间的极低水平。
But opportunities to pursue the necessary policies have not been grasped. => 但我们并没有抓住实施必要措施的机会。
Here, too, another six months should not be lost. => 在这一方面，我们也不应该再浪费另一个半年了。
The mandarins of northern Europe continue to measure out a drip-feed of support with coffee spoons. => 北欧的政要们惜钱如金，支持政策大大地不给力。
Another six months have been lost. => 于是，又一个半年浪费了。
But so far in the third millennium, this skill – or simply run of luck – has deserted the US. => 但在第三个千禧年中，这项技能（也许只是运气）离美国而去了。

My view is that the problem would fix itself easily if only the Republican Party of Dwight D. Eisenhower could stage a comeback (though without Richard Nixon and Joseph McCarthy). => 在我看来，要是艾森豪威尔治下的共和党能起死回生就好了（可别是尼克松和约瑟夫·麦卡锡的共和党 ） ， 这样的话，这个问题就能自动修正了。
It is becoming increasingly clear, however, that the problem is one not only for the US, but for the rest of the world as well. => 不过，形势已经越来越明朗，问题不仅出在美国，也出在世界其他地方。
Since December 7, 1941, the world has in large part been able to rely on global governance by a somewhat-competent hyperpower. => 自从1941年12月7日以来，在大部分时间里，世界一直依赖某个还算胜任的超级大国的治理。
That America may be gone for good. => 这样的一个美国也许已是前尘往事了。
If it is, the world needs to develop other institutions for global management – and quickly. => 果真如此的话，世界就需要另外的制度来管理全球事务，越快越好。
America’s Misguided Immigration Debate => 美国有关移民的辩论被引入歧途
A debate on immigration is beginning in the United States Senate, which will take up several proposals. => 美国参议院正在展开一场有关移民问题的辩论，这场辩论将讨论数个建议。
Another idea is to require anyone in the US wanting to regularize their immigration status to go home and wait in line there. => 另一个主张是要求任何在美国境内想要获得正常移民资格的人返回祖国并在那里等候。

This last component is largely rhetoric; it is hard to imagine any Mexican already in the US voluntarily returning to, say, Zacatecas to wait patiently in line for a new visa. => 最后一项建议基本上是夸夸其谈。 很难想象任何一个已经在美国的墨西哥人主动返回到比如卡萨特卡斯的地方耐心排队等候新的签证。
Finally, and perhaps most importantly, there is Senate Judiciary Committee Chairman Arlen Specter’s compromise proposal. => 最后，也许是最为重要的是参议院司法委员会主席斯佩克特的妥协性建议。
What’s missing in the debate is the Latin American context. => 这一辩论缺乏的是考虑到拉美大环境。
There was a time when north-south migratory flows in the western hemisphere were limited to Mexico and the Caribbean. => 先前有段时期，西半球的南北向移民流动局限于墨西哥以及加勒比。
Today, even Brazil, traditionally a country of immigration, has become one of emigration. => 巴西传统上是一个吸纳移民的国家。 如今，它也成为了输出移民的国家。

Moreover, these migrants are no longer exclusively of rural origin, nor do they travel only to traditional areas in the US; they are, literally, everywhere. => 更为重要的是，这些移民不再局限于农村人口，而且他们不再只是前往移民在美国的传统落脚点。 事实上，他们无处不在。
Their remittances contribute immensely to the economic welfare of their families, communities, and home countries’ economies. => 他们的汇款为他们的家庭和社区的经济状况以及祖国的经济做出了巨大贡献。
Thus, whatever immigration policy emerges in the US will have an enormous impact south of the Rio Grande well beyond Mexico. => 如此，美国无论出现何种移民政策都将会对里奥格兰德以南墨西哥以外的地区产生重大影响。
If the perception of further US hostility toward Latin America persists, the tilt toward an irresponsible, demagogic left will harden. => 如果人们依旧感觉美国敌视拉美的话，将会硬化不负责任以及蛊惑人心的左派倾向。
The responsible left in Chile, Brazil, and Uruguay are an exception to the emerging rule set by Venezuela’s President Hugo Chávez. => 对于委内瑞拉总统查韦斯所确立的新兴规则而言，智利、巴西以及乌拉圭负责任的左派人士是例外。
The best way to accentuate the region’s growing anti-American sentiment is to try to close the US-Mexican border (which will be futile). => 恶化该地区不断增长的反美情绪的最佳办法就是试图关闭美墨边境（这将会是徒劳的 ） 。
Bush must begin to use what political capital he has left to support enlightened immigration reform, along the lines of the Kennedy-McCain bill. => 布什必须开始利用他所剩下的政治资本，沿着肯尼迪和麦肯恩法案的路线来支持开明的移民改革。
Mexico and the US must be sensitive to domestic political concerns in both countries. => 墨西哥和美国必须对各自国家的国内政治关切保持敏感。
Mexico must act on what Fox has called “shared responsibility.” => 墨西哥必须在福克斯总统所说的“共同责任”上采取行动。

The best imaginable deal between the US and Mexico, or the best imaginable US immigration reform, will not eliminate the flow of undocumented migrants from Mexico and South America overnight. => 美墨之间最为可行的协议、或者说可以想象得到的最佳的美国移民改革，并非是一夜之间就消除来自墨西哥以及南美的无合法证件的移民。
Mexico has to assume responsibility for regulating this traffic, which means more than sealing off its southern border. => 墨西哥必须承担责任对这一人流设施管理，这就意味着做比关闭南部边境更多的事情。
Fox has said that he is willing to break with old Mexican taboos, but the Bush administration has never taken him up on it. => 福克斯总统已经说过，他愿意与旧的墨西哥禁忌决裂，但是布什行政当局从来没有认真对待过。
That is unfortunate, because Fox will not be around forever. => 这是不幸的，因为福克斯总统不会永远当政。
Immigration has always been an immensely complex and delicate issue inside the US, and now for Latin America as well. => 移民问题总是美国国内的一个极为复杂和微妙的问题，现在对于拉美国家也是一样。
A window of opportunity opened at the beginning of Bush’s first term, and closed shut after the terrorist attacks of September 2001. => 布什第一个任期内开启的机会之窗在2001年9月份的恐怖主义攻击后关闭了。
It is opening again and should be taken advantage of before it is too late. => 现在这个窗户在一次开启，就应当在过于后迟之前加以利用。
Why Iran Won’t Budge => 伊朗为什么不会让步
TEL AVIV – No one really believed that the latest round of international negotiations with Iran over its nuclear program would produce a breakthrough. => 特拉维夫 — — 没有人真的相信与伊朗的新一轮核计划国际谈判能够取得突破。

So it was no surprise that itdid not, despite the concessions that were made at the meeting in Kazakhstan by the P5+1 (China, France, Russia, the United Kingdom, and the United States, plus Germany). => 因此尽管P5+1集团（中国、法国、俄罗斯、英国、美国，再加上德国）在哈萨克斯坦会议上已做出让步，谈判没有进展也并不出人意料。
America’s belief that a harsh sanctions regime could coax Iran into a deal has proved – at least so far – to be unrealistic. => 美国认为严厉的制裁制度​​可以劝诱伊朗达成协议的想法至少目前看来是不切实际的。

More important, even though the severe sanctions regime led by the United States is bound to be imperfect – it only hardens further Iran’s resistance to “America’s designs.” => 更重要的是，即使美国领导的严厉制裁制度​​注定并不完美 — — 它只能进一步增强伊朗对“美国阴谋”的抵触情绪。
To be sure, Iran’s alliances are vulnerable to erosion and, in the case of two staunch allies, Syria and Venezuela, to outright collapse. => 可以肯定伊朗的战略联盟并不稳固，叙利亚和委内瑞拉这两大坚定盟友甚至有可能彻底崩溃。
While the Western powers have embraced ever-harsher sanctions, Russia and China view Iran as a tool in their global competition with the US. => 尽管西方列强采取的制裁措施比以往任何时候都更严厉，但俄罗斯和中国却把伊朗作为工具与美国展开全球竞争。
China’s Iranian interests boil down to economics. => 中国在伊朗的利益归根结底是经济利益。
True, China cannot entirely overlook US pressure and the staunch opposition of its top oil supplier, Saudi Arabia, to Iran’s nuclear program. => 诚然，中国无法完全忽视来自美国的压力及其头号原油供应国沙特阿拉伯对伊朗核计划的坚决反对。
But, while China has supported the mandatory sanctions set by the United Nations Security Council, it has rejected the West’s unilateral measures. => 但在支持联合国安理会强制制裁措施的同时，中国拒绝承认西方国家的单边制裁措施。
With bilateral trade worth only about $5 billion annually, Russia’s economic interests in Iran are fairly modest. => 俄伊的双边年度贸易总值仅50亿美元，因此俄国在伊朗的经济利益微乎其微。
But it fears Iran’s ability to cause trouble, particularly by stirring up unrest among Russia’s Muslim citizens. => 但俄国担心伊朗制造麻烦，特别是挑动俄国内的穆斯林民众闹事。

The problem with the US drive to have key stakeholders join its anti-Iran crusade is that some of them live in neighborhoods where Iran is an important factor. => 美国要求关键利益方参与对伊讨伐运动的问题在于伊朗在某些国家所处的区域发挥着重要作用。
India is a case in point. => 印度就是一个很好的例子。

India is certainly alarmed at the possibility of Iran developing nuclear weapons, not to mention its concern at the possible effects of Iran’s Islamist fundamentalism on Kashmiri Muslims. => 印度肯定警惕伊朗发展核武器的可能性，更不用说它对伊朗伊斯兰原教旨主义可能对克什米尔穆斯林造成的影响表示关注。

But its $14 billion in annual bilateral trade, and dependence on Iranian oil – many of India’s refineries have been built to run solely on Iranian crude – are key strategic considerations. => 但140亿美元的年度双边贸易和对伊朗石油的依赖（印度许多炼油厂完全依赖伊朗原油进口）却是印度必需思考的关键战略问题。

As a result, India’s policy mirrors China’s: it has aligned itself with mandatory international sanctions, but has abjured voluntary Western financial restrictions. => 因此印度的政策和中国如出一辙：那就是赞同强制性的国际制裁，但拒绝执行西方的自愿金融限制政策。
The equivocal nature of Iran’s alliances, however, can be a mixed blessing. => 伊朗联盟的暧昧态度其实好坏参半。

Yes, a harsh sanctions regime might still gain additional supporters, but an Iran with its back against the wall would probably be even more obstinate in its nuclear drive. => 多一些国家支持严厉制裁当然是好事，但被逼入绝境的伊朗可能会更顽强地研制核武器。

After all, Iraq was an easy target in the first Gulf War precisely because it had abandoned its nuclear program, and possessed no weapons of mass destruction. => 毕竟，伊拉克正是因为放弃核计划且不拥有大规模杀伤性武器而成为第一次海湾战争的靶子。
Similarly, Libya’s Muammar el-Qaddafi exposed himself to a NATO onslaught by relinquishing his WMDs. => 同样，利比亚的卡扎菲也因为放弃了大规模杀伤性武器才成为北约的攻击对象。
By contrast, North Korea shows that defiance, rather than accommodation, is a strategy that works. => 相反，朝鲜的例子表明真正奏效的对策不是妥协而是挑战。

Albert Einstein’s definition of insanity as “doing the same thing over and over again and expecting different results” could be applied to America’s Iran policy. => 爱因斯坦用“反复做同样的事，却期待不同结果”来定义精神错乱，这恰好适用于描述美国的伊朗政策。
The diplomacy of sanctions, ostracism, and brinkmanship has failed resoundingly. => 外交制裁、排斥和边缘化政策已经彻底失败。
As Iran’s uranium-enrichment and other weapons-development activities continue unabated, the US needs to make a break with the old rules of engagement. => 由于伊朗铀浓缩和其他武器研发活动有增无减，美国需要彻底改变原有的交往规则。
America’s Misplaced Deficit Complacency => 错误的赤字满意

CAMBRIDGE – The United States still faces a dangerous fiscal deficit, but one might not know it from the complacency that dominates budget discussions in Washington. => 美国剑桥—美国依然面临着危险的预算赤字，但这个赤字可能无法从华盛顿预算讨论中所弥漫的自鸣得意之情中获知。
Regarded as an urgent problem until recently, the federal deficit is now being placed on the back burner of American politics. => 此前联邦赤字被视为一个紧迫问题，但现在已经沦为美国政坛的次等问题。
According to the CBO’s report, the US fiscal deficit will decline from 7% of GDP in 2012 to 4% in 2013. => 根据CBO的报告，美国财政赤字将从2012年的占GDP的7%降至2013年的占GDP的4 % 。
That path of deficits implies that the government debt/GDP ratio will remain at about the current level of 75% for the next ten years. => 预算变化路径意味着未来十年的政府债务/GDP比率将维持在75%左右。

Unfortunately, these headline-grabbing numbers are not likely to be borne out in reality; indeed, even the CBO does not believe that they represent what will occur. => 不幸的是，这些吸引眼球的数字不可能成为现实；事实上，即便是CBO也不相信它们代表将来发生的事情。
Instead, these official forecasts represent a “baseline” scenario that the CBO is required to present. => 相反，这些官方预测代表一种CBO被要求给出的“基线”情形。
The CBO’s “baseline budget” assumes that all of the deficit-reducing features in current law will remain unchanged. => CBO的“基线预算”假设当前法律的所有赤字削减内容都保持不变。

In order to provide better guidance, the CBO presents an “alternative fiscal scenario,” in which such very unlikely features are removed from the forecast. => 为了提供更好的指导，CBO给出了“替代财政情景 ” ， 在这一情景中，可能性极低的内容被剔除出预测。

The alternative forecast implies that the annual budget deficit at the end of ten years will be back up to 4.7% of GDP, with the debt/GDP ratio at 83% and rising. => 替代预测表明，十年后的年度预算赤字将回升至GDP的4.7 % ， 债务/GDP比率为83%并呈上升趋势。

And those estimates are based on the optimistic assumption that the economy will have returned gradually to full employment with low inflation and moderate interest rates. => 且这些估算基于乐观的假设 — — 经济将逐渐恢复充分就业，通胀较低，利率也很温和。
Officials and others who favor stimulating growth through increased government spending ignore the CBO’s more realistic alternative scenario. => 官员和其他支持通过增加政府支出刺激增长的人士忽略了CBO更为现实的替代情景。

According to the CBO, without legislative changes, the fiscal deficit in 2037 will be 17% of GDP, while the national debt will increase to more than 195% of GDP. => 据CBO的数字，若无立法变化，2037年财政赤字将为GDP的1.7 % ， 而国民债务将升至GDP的195%以上。
A large and rising national debt is a serious danger to an economy’s health. => 庞大且增长的国民债务对经济健康而言是一个严重威胁。
Higher debt-service costs require higher tax rates, which in turn weaken incentives and reduce economic growth. => 债务维持成本的上升要求提高税率，而这反过来又削弱了激励、抑制了经济增长。

By the end of the decade, the US will have to pay an amount equivalent to more than one-third of the revenue from personal-income taxes just to pay the interest on the national debt. => 十年后，美国需要付出相当于个人所得税收入三分之一多的资金用来偿付国民债务利息。
Foreign investors now hold more than half of that debt. => 目前，外国投资者持有了一大半债务。
Paying interest to them requires sending more goods and services to the rest of the world than the US receives from the rest of the world. => 向他们支付利息需要向世界其他地区输送商品和服务，其数量超过了美国得自世界其他地区的数量。
That requires a weaker dollar to make US goods more attractive to foreign buyers and to make foreign goods more expensive to American consumers. => 这要求美元贬值以使美国商品对外国买家更有吸引力，而使外国商品对美国消费者来说更贵。
The weaker dollar reduces the US standard of living. => 美元贬值会降低美国的生活水平。
A large national debt also limits the government’s ability to respond to emergencies, including both military threats and economic downturns. => 庞大的国民债务还限制了政府响应紧急情况的能力，包括军事威胁和经济衰退。
And it makes the US vulnerable to changes in financial-market sentiment, as the European experience has shown. => 这还让美国易受金融市场情绪变化的影响，如欧洲经验所显示的那样。

Reducing future deficits and reversing the rise in the national debt require raising tax revenue and slowing the growth of government pension and health-care programs. => 降低未来赤字、扭转国民债务的上升之势要求提高税收收入和降低政府退休和医疗计划的增长率。
Tax revenue can be raised without increasing marginal tax rates by limiting the tax subsidies that are built into the current tax code. => 税收收入可以通过限制现行税法中的税收补贴在不增加边际税率的情况下实现。

Those subsidies are a hidden form of government spending on everything from home mortgages and health insurance to the purchase of hybrid cars and residential solar panels. => 这些补贴是隐性政府支出，其范围从家庭按揭和医疗保险到混合动力汽车和家用太阳能板无所不包。
Slowing the growth of the pension and health-care programs for middle-class retirees cannot be done abruptly. => 降低中产阶级退休和医疗项目支出增长不是一夜之间就能完成的任务。
It must begin by giving notice to those who are now a decade away from retirement – which is why it is important to launch such reforms now. => 它必须以警示离退休尚有十年的人群为起点 — — 这也是为何需要从现在就开始改革的原因。

Unfortunately, the new complacency about future deficits makes it difficult, if not impossible, to enact the legislation needed to begin the process of trimming America’s long-term fiscal deficit. => 不幸的是，对未来赤字的新出现的自鸣得意之情让实施开启美国长期预算赤字整合过程所需要的立法变得十分困难（如果不是不可能的话 ） 。

It is important for policymakers and the public alike to understand the real fiscal outlook and the damage that high deficits will cause if prompt action is not taken. => 对决策者和公众来说，很重要的一点事要理解真实的财政前景和在不立刻采取行动的情况下高赤字所带来的后果。
Merely moving the problem to the back burner will not prevent it from boiling over. => 仅仅把问题移至次要地位是无法防止它爆发的。
Meeting America’s Growth Challenge => 面对美国的增长挑战

BERKELEY – The United States continues to recover from its deepest economic slump since the Great Depression, but the pace of recovery remains frustratingly slow. => 伯克利—美国一直处在大萧条以来最深经济衰退之后的复苏中，但复苏的速度仍然低得令人沮丧。
There are several reasons to anticipate modest improvement in 2013, although, as usual, there are downside risks. => 有理由表明2013年会出现一些好转，尽管与往常一样，下行风险依然存在。
Prolonged recession or a financial crisis in Europe and slower growth in emerging markets are the main external sources of potential danger. => 欧洲衰退延续或爆发金融危机以及新兴市场增长放缓是主要的外部忧虑来源。

At home, political infighting underlies the two greatest risks: failure to reach a deal to raise the debt ceiling and an additional round of fiscal contraction that stymies economic growth. => 在国内，政治斗争体现了两个最大的风险：无法达成提高债务上限的协议以及妨碍经济增长的新一轮财政紧缩。
Since 2010, tepid average annual GDP growth of 2.1% has meant weak job creation. => 自2010年以来，平均年GDP增长率只有2.1 % ， 这意味着就业岗位创造不振。
In both this recovery and the previous two, the rebound in employment growth has been weaker and later than the rebound in GDP growth. => 在此次和前两次复苏中，就业增长的反弹都比GDP弱，而且滞后于GDP。

But the loss of jobs in the most recent recession was more than twice as large as in previous recessions, so a slow recovery has meant a much higher unemployment rate for a much longer period. => 但最新衰退中的就业岗位减少量比前两次多两倍，因此缓慢的复苏意味着在长得多的时间里存在高得多的失业率。
Weak aggregate demand is the primary culprit for subdued GDP and employment growth. => 总需求疲软被指为GDP和就业增长不振的罪魁。
The 2008 recession was triggered by a financial crisis that erupted after the collapse of a credit-fueled asset bubble decimated the housing market. => 2008年衰退由金融危机引发，而金融危机由信用催生的资产泡沫破裂摧毁了房地产市场引发。
Private-sector demand contracts sharply and recovers only slowly after such crises. => 在这类危机后，私人部门需求会急剧下降，复苏会极为缓慢。

The private-sector financial balance swung from a deficit of 3.7% of GDP in 2006, at the height of the boom, to a surplus of about 6.8% of GDP in 2010 and about 5% today. => 私人部门财务收支的波动情况是：2006年存在相当于GDP的3.7%的赤字（繁荣期最高值 ） ， 2010出现了相当于GDP的6.8%左右的盈余，目前盈余约为GDP的5 % 。
This represents the sharpest contraction and weakest recovery in private-sector demand since the end of World War II. => 这意味着这是二战结束以来私人部门需求最剧烈的衰退和最疲软的复苏。

Growth in two components of private demand, residential investment and consumption, which account for more than 75% of total spending in the US economy, has been especially slow. => 私人需求的两大组成部分 — — 占美国经济总支出额75%以上的住宅投资和消费增长特别缓慢。
Both sources of demand are likely to strengthen in 2013. => 两大需求源都有望在2013年有所增强。

Residential investment is still at an historic low as a share of GDP as a result of overbuilding during the 2003-2008 housing boom and the tsunami of foreclosures that followed. => 用占GDP比重衡量，住房投资仍处在历史低点，这是2003—2008年房地产泡沫期的过度建房以及随后按揭止赎风暴带来的后果。
But the headwinds in the housing market are dissipating. => 但房地产市场的阻力正在消散。
Home sales, prices, and construction all rose last year, while foreclosures declined. => 去年，住房销量、价格和建筑量均有所上升，而按揭止赎有所下降。
Residential investment should be a source of output and job growth this year. => 住房投资应能成为今年产出和就业增长的一大源泉。
To be sure, the balance-sheet headwinds holding back consumption have eased. => 实事求是地说，消费的资产负债表阻力已有所减缓。
But consumption will be hit by the expiration of the payroll tax cut, which will reduce household income by about $125 billion this year. => 但消费将因工资税减免计划到期而受到影响，今年的家庭收入将因此减少1 250亿美元。

Another factor holding back recovery has been weak growth in spending on goods and services by both state and local governments, and more recently by the federal government. => 妨碍复苏的另一大因素是州和地方政府商品和服务支出增长疲软，最近，联邦政府也加入了这一行列。

Indeed, since the recession’s onset, state and local governments have cut nearly 600,000 jobs and reduced spending for infrastructure projects by 20%. => 事实上，自衰退发生以来，州和地方政府裁掉了600 000个工作岗位和20%的基础设施项目支出。
The fiscal trends for 2013 are mixed, but negative overall. => 2013年的财政趋势仍不明朗，但总的来说是消极的。

While state and local government cutbacks in spending and employment are ending as the recovery boosts their tax revenues, the fiscal drag at the federal level is strengthening. => 州和地方政府的减支和裁员过程正在随复苏提振税收收入而结束，联邦层面的财政后腿则日趋严重。
In addition, although less widely appreciated, significant reductions in federal spending are already under way, with more likely to come. => 此外，尽管大幅削减联邦支出的方案支持者要少一些，但该方案已经步入了实施阶段，未来可能还会加码。
Based on current economic assumptions, the US needs about $4 trillion in savings to stabilize the debt/GDP ratio over the next decade. => 根据当前的经济假设，美国需要约4万亿美元储蓄才能在未来十年中保持债务/GDP比率稳定。
It is already three-fifths of the way there. => 其中五分之三已有了着落。

The so-called sequester (the across-the-board spending cuts scheduled to begin in March), would slash another $100 billion this year and $1.2 trillion over the next decade. => 所谓的扣押（将于3月开始的全面减支）将在今年减少1 000亿美元、未来十年减少1.2万亿美元赤字。
Moreover, despite the warnings of deficit alarmists, the US does not face an imminent debt crisis. => 此外，尽管赤字悲观派频发警告，但美国仍没有迫在眉睫的债务危机。
Currently, the federal debt held by the public is just over 70% of GDP, a level not seen since the early 1950’s. => 最近，公共部门持有的联邦债务略高于GDP的70 % ， 这是20世纪50年代初以来不曾有过的情况。

However, government debt soars by an average of 86% after severe financial crises, so the increase in the federal debt by 70% between 2008 and 2012 is not surprising. => 尽管如此，平均而言政府债务会在严重金融危机后增加86 % ， 因此2008—2012年联邦债务增加70%并不令人奇怪。
Nor is it alarming. => 这也没什么值得担忧的。
The considerable progress that has been made on deficit reduction over the next ten years has been overlooked. => 未来十年赤字削减取得重大进步被忽视了。
Also overlooked have been the immediate challenges of low growth, weak investment, and high unemployment. => 同样被忽视的还有低增长、投资不振以及失业高企所带来的即期挑战。
It is time to refocus. => 是时候转变专注点了。
The US needs a plan for faster growth, not more deficit reduction. => 美国需要提振增长速度的计划，而不是更多的赤字削减。

Evsey Domar, a legendary growth economist (and one of my MIT professors) counseled that the problem of alleviating the debt burden is essentially a problem of achieving growth in national income. => 杰出的增长经济学家多马尔（Evsey Domar，我在MIT的教授之一）建议，缓解债务负担的问题本质上是取得国民收入增长的问题。
We should heed his wisdom. => 我们应该遵循他的智慧。
America’s New Progressive Era? => 美国的新进步时代？
NEW YORK – In 1981, US President Ronald Reagan came to office famously declaring that, “Government is not the solution to our problem. => 纽约—1981年，美国总统里根以一句名言入主白宫 ： “ 政府不是问题的解决方案。
Government is the problem.” => 政府是问题。
Reagan’s statement in 1981 was extraordinary. => 里根1981年的名言是不同寻常的。

It signaled that America’s new president was less interested in using government to solve society’s problems than he was in cutting taxes, mainly for the benefit of the wealthy. => 它表明这位美国新总统对用政府来解决社会问题不像他对减税（主要受益者是富人）那样热衷。
These special interests included Wall Street, Big Oil, the big health insurers, and arms manufacturers. => 这些特殊利益包括华尔街、大石油公司、大人寿保险商以及军火商。
For more than three decades, no one really challenged the consequences of turning political power over to the highest bidders. => 三十多年来，没有人真正挑战过将政治权力交给出价最高者的后果。
In the meantime, America went from being a middle-class society to one increasingly divided between rich and poor. => 与此同时，美国从中产阶级社会变得日益贫富分化。
CEOs who were once paid around 30 times what their average workers earned now make around 230 times that amount. => 从前，CEO的薪水是普通员工的30倍，如今是230倍。
Once a world leader in the fight against environmental degradation, America was the last major economy to acknowledge the reality of climate change. => 从前，美国是对抗环境恶化的世界领袖，后来却成为最后一个承认气候变化现实的大国。

Financial deregulation enriched Wall Street, but ended up creating a global economic crisis through fraud, excessive risk-taking, incompetence, and insider dealing. => 金融去监管化肥了华尔街，但最终因为欺诈、过度冒险、不胜任和内幕交易造成了全球经济危机。
Maybe, just maybe, Obama’s recent address marks not only the end of this destructive agenda, but also the start of a new era. => 也许，仅仅是也许，奥巴马最新的就职演说不但标志着这一毁灭性过程的结束，也标志着新时代的开端。
It was the first inaugural address of its kind since Reagan turned America away from government in 1981. => 这是自1981年里根让美国原理政府以来第一个这样说的总统就职演说。

In the late 1800’s, America had its Gilded Age, with the creation of large new industries by the era’s “robber barons” accompanied by massive inequality and corruption. => 十九世纪末，美国来到了镀金时代，这一时代的“强盗资本家”建立了大规模的新产业，社会也滋生了大量的不平等和腐败。
The subsequent Progressive Era was followed by a temporary return to plutocracy in the 1920’s. => 随后的进步时代引来的是20世纪20年代富豪统治的暂时复辟。
