Then came the Great Depression, Franklin Roosevelt’s New Deal, and another 30 years of progressive politics, from the 1930’s to the 1960’s. => 接着发生了大萧条、罗斯福新政和新的30年进步政治 — — 20世纪30—60年代。
The 1970’s were a transition period to the Age of Reagan – 30 years of conservative politics led by powerful corporate interests. => 70年代是向里根时代的过渡期 — — 权势公司利益把持的30年保守政治。
It is certainly too early to declare a new Progressive Era in America. => 现在就宣布美国进入了新进步时代显然还为时过早。
Vested interests remain powerful, certainly in Congress – and even within the White House. => 既得利益仍然十分强大，特别是在国会 — — 甚至是在白宫中。

These wealthy groups and individuals gave billions of dollars to the candidates in the recent election campaign, and they expect their contributions to yield benefits. => 这些权贵集团和个人在最近的竞选过程中向候选人提供了数十亿美元，并期待他们的付出能产生回报。

Moreover, 30 years of tax cutting has left the US government without the financial resources needed to carry out effective programs in key areas such as the transition to low-carbon energy. => 此外，30年的减税也让美国政府失去了实施关键领域（如面向低碳能源的转型）的财源。
Still, Obama has wisely thrown down the gauntlet, calling for a new era of government activism. => 尽管如此，奥巴马仍然明智地下达了战书，发出了新政府积极主义时代的呼声。
Implementation of public policy is just as important to good governance as the vision that underlies it. => 对良好的治理来说，公共政策实施与实施它们的愿景一样重要。
So the next task is to design wise, innovative, and cost-effective programs to address these challenges. => 因此下一个任务是设计明智、新颖、低成本的方案解决这些挑战。
Unfortunately, when it comes to bold and innovative programs to meet critical human needs, America is out of practice. => 不幸的是，当需要采取大胆的创新方案满足关键人类需求时，美国总是行动的矮子。
It is time to begin anew, and Obama’s full-throated defense of a progressive vision points the US in the right direction. => 美国是时候脱胎换骨了，而奥巴马全力为进步主义愿景辩护的举动为美国指明了正确的方向。
America’s New Trade Hypocrisy => 美国新的贸易伪善

Nowhere is this clearer than in a provision that is supposed to give the least developed countries almost duty-free access to developed countries’ markets. => 有一项条款让这一现象再清楚不过了，那就是看似给予最不发达国家几乎免税的发达国家的市场准入。
A year ago, the leaders of the world’s richest countries committed themselves to alleviating the plight of the poorest. => 一年前，世界最富有国家的领导人承诺缓解最穷国家的困境。

At Doha in November 2001, they pledged to give something more valuable than money: the opportunity for poor countries to sell their goods and earn their way out of poverty. => 2001年11月在多哈，它们保证给予比钱更为有价值的东西，也就是给穷国出售其产品并且获得收入摆脱贫困的机会。
The opening was less than it seemed. => 这一开放比看起来的要小。
But the coup de grace was delivered by the world’s richest country, the United States, which once again decided to demonstrate its hypocrisy. => 但是，美国这一世界上最富有的国家再次决定展现其伪善，从而给了致命的一击。
The US ostensibly agreed to a 97% opening of its markets to the poorest countries. => 美国表面上同意向最贫困国家开放其市场的97 ％ 。

America’s intention was, to the contrary, to seem to be opening up its markets, while doing nothing of the sort, for it appears to allow the US to select a different 3% for each country. => 相反，美国的意图却是看似开放其市场实则无所作为，因为，美国针对每个国家挑选不同的3 ％ 。

The result is what is mockingly coming to be called the EBP initiative: developing countries will be allowed freely to export everything but what they produce. => 其结果就是被嘲弄为EBP的项目，也就是，发展中国家被允许自由出口所有它们所不生产的产品。

They can export jet engines, supercomputers, airplanes, computer chips of all kinds—just not textiles, agricultural products, or processed foods, the goods they can and do produce. => 它们可以出口喷气机发动机，超级计算机，飞机以及所有种类的计算机芯片，唯独没有它们做得来而且实际生产产品，如纺织品、农产品或者加工食品。
Consider Bangladesh. => 以孟加拉为例。

If we go by the most widely used six-digit tariff lines, Bangladesh exported 409 tariff lines to the US in 2004, from which it earned about $2.3 billion. => 如果我们采用最为常用的六位数稅则编码，孟加拉国在2004年向美国出口了409个税则编码产品，收入为23亿美元。
But its top 12 tariff lines – 3% of all tariff lines – accounted for 59.7% of the total value of its exports to the US. => 但是，其价值最大的12项税则产品，也就是所有税则编码的3％占向美国出口的总价值的59.7 ％ 。
This means that the US could erect barriers to almost three-fifths of Bangladeshi exports. => 这就意味着美国可以给孟加拉出口产品的几乎五分之三设立贸易壁垒。
For Cambodia, the figure would be about 62%. => 对于柬埔寨而言，这一数字将近62 ％ 。

For Bangladesh, this implies that 75% of the tariff lines, accounting for more than 90% of the value of its exports to the US, could be excluded from duty-free treatment. => 对于孟加拉而言，这就意味着占向美国出口商品价值90％的税则编码的75％将可能被从免税待遇中排除。
Exclusion from duty-free treatment could reach 100% for Cambodia, which exported only 277 tariff lines to the US in 2004. => 排除在免税待遇之外可能波及柬埔寨出口产品的100 ％ ， 而该国2004年仅仅向美国出口了277项税则编码产品。
The official argument for the 3% exclusion is that it affects “sensitive products.” => 对于3％排除的正式理由是，这影响到“敏感产品 ” 。

In other words, while the US lectures developing countries on the need to face the pain of rapid adjustment to liberalization, it refuses to do the same. => 换句话说，美国向发展中国家宣扬面对快速调节适应贸易自由化的痛苦的需��，它自己却拒绝这样做。
(Indeed, it has already had more than 11 years to adjust to liberalization of textiles.) => （实际上，美国已经有11年的时间来适应纺织品贸易自由化。
The whole exclusion simply undermines the multilateral trading system. => 整个排除规则恰恰破坏了多边贸易体系。
Indeed, there may be a further hidden agenda behind the 97% proposal. => 确实，97％建议后面可能还有更大的不可告人的目的。
It was imperative that such unity be destroyed. => 摧毁这样的联合是非常必要的。

America’s strategy of bilateral trade agreements was aimed at precisely that, but it enlisted only a few countries, representing a fraction of global trade. => 美国的双边贸易协议的战略恰恰以此为目标，但是它只是得到了代表全球贸易一丁点儿的几个国家的支持。
The 97% formula holds open the possibility of extending that fragmentation into the WTO itself. => 97％规则可能会把这一分裂延伸到世界贸易组织本身。
The US has already had some success in pitting the poor against each other. => 美国在让穷国内斗方面成功过。
For example, Bangladesh’s share in US clothing markets declined from 4.6% in 2001 to 3.9% in 2004. => 例如，孟加拉国在美国的服装市场份额从2001年的4.6％下降到2004年的3.9 ％ 。
The WTO is supposed to prevent these trade-diversionary agreements, but so far no case has been successfully brought. => 世界贸易组织理应防止这些分离贸易的协议，但是目前为止还没有成功地做到这一点。
Even if America succeeds in dividing the developing countries, however, it may inspire a degree of unity elsewhere. => 即使美国成功地分离了发展中国家，也会在其他地方激发团结。

Both those committed to trade liberalization within a multilateral system and those committed to helping developing countries will look at America’s new strategy with abhorrence. => 那些致力于多边体系下的贸易自由化和帮助发展中国家的人们将以憎恶的目光看待美国的新战略。
Game Changers for Growth => 增长的局面改变因素

BERKELEY – The recent G-20 meeting of finance ministers in Saint Petersburg confirmed that the debate between growth and austerity is over – at least for now. => 伯克利—最近在圣彼得堡举行的G20财政会议确认了增长和紧缩之争已经结束 — — 至少在当下是如此。
With protracted recession in Europe and slowdowns in emerging markets, concern about budget deficits has given way to apprehension about growth. => 随着欧洲的长期衰退和新兴市场的减速，对预算赤字的担忧已经让位给对增长的担忧。
In July, the International Monetary Fund revised its global growth forecast downward for the second time this year. => 7月，IMF今年第二次下调全球增长预测。
Both Japan and the United States stand out as bright spots in the subdued global outlook, but for different reasons. => 日本和美国成为暗淡全球前景的亮点，但各有各的原因。
Now Abe has signaled his intention to move forward with tough structural reforms. => 如今，安倍放出信号将跟进一步采取严厉的结构性改革。
If he delivers, his policies will be game changers for Japan. => 若得偿所愿，那么他的政策将让日本焕然一新。
In the US, the story is one of continued recovery as the headwinds slowing growth dissipate. => 美国的情况则是随着增长逆风的逐渐减弱，复苏在持续发生。
State- and local-government budgets are improving, the housing market is strengthening, and households are deleveraging and repairing their balance sheets. => 州和地方政府赤字在改善，房地产市场在走强，家庭在去杠杆并修复资产负债表。

Counterproductive and excessive fiscal austerity at the federal level has dampened growth this year, but the private sector has proved more resilient than expected. => 联邦层面的适得其反的过度财政紧缩拖累了今年的增长，但私人部门比预期中恢复力更强。

Under current law, fiscal contraction is slated to ease next year and monetary policy is likely to remain supportive, so most forecasters predict an acceleration of growth. => 在现行法律下，财政收缩将在明年放松，货币政策仍将保持支持性，因此大部分预测家预计增长会加速。
But growth prospects could be undermined by another bruising political battle over the federal budget, resulting in deep spending cuts. => 但增长前景可能因深度减支引发的新一场围绕联邦预算的政治斗争而受挫。
The current Republican rhetoric in the House of Representatives portends additional fiscal austerity. => 从众议院共和党的语气看，会有新一轮财政紧缩。

Every year of below-capacity growth means lower growth capacity in the future, owing to lost investment, erosion of worker skills and experience, and diminished risk-taking. => 每一个低于产能的增长年份都意味着未来增长能力的下降，这是因为投资有所下降，工人技能和经验有所损失，风险承担行为有所减少。
Still, there are often-overlooked reasons for optimism about America’s future potential growth. => 但是，一些常被忽视的理由表明，美国未来潜在增长前景乐观。
US production of shale gas and oil has been growing by more than 50% annually over the last five years. => 在过去五年中，美国页岩油气产量年增长率超过50 % 。
This price advantage will enhance America’s competitiveness as a manufacturing location, particularly for energy-intensive activities. => 这一价格优势能增强美国作为制造业落脚点的竞争力，特别是能源密集型活动。
The US has the largest recoverable shale-gas reserves and the second-largest recoverable shale-oil reserves in the world. => 美国拥有世界第一大可恢复页岩气储量和第二大可恢复页岩油储量。
Growth in shale energy will mean more investment, production, and jobs in the energy sector itself. => 页岩能源的增长意味着能源部门本身的更多的投资、产量和就业岗位。

Lower gas prices will boost manufacturing production, particularly in downstream industries like petrochemicals and primary metals that use natural gas as fuel and feedstock. => 气价下降将提振制造业产量，特别是石化产品和以天然气为燃料和投入品的初级金属等下游行业。
Overall, McKinsey estimates that growth in shale energy could add 2-4% to annual GDP and create up to 1.7 million jobs by 2020. => 总体而言，麦肯锡估算页岩能源增长将在2020年将美国年GDP提高2—4 % ， 并创造最多170万个工作岗位。

But extracting shale energy involves environmental risks and uncertainties, among them groundwater contamination, higher methane emissions, and potential seismic effects. => 但提炼页岩能源会产生环境风险和不确定性，包括地下水污染、甲烷排量和潜在的地震效应。

And shale gas emits CO2 when burned, even though it has half the carbon content of coal and has played a significant role in cutting US carbon emissions to mid-1990’s levels. => 页岩气燃烧时还会释放二氧化碳，尽管页岩气比煤炭的含碳量低一半，并且对美国将碳排放量减至20世纪90年代中期水平居功至伟。

Not surprisingly, the President of the Natural Resources Defense Council, an admired environmental group, recently remarked that “fracking is about the most complicated thing I have encountered.” => 毫不奇怪，广受尊敬的环境团体 — — 自然资源保护委员会（Natural Resources Defense Council）主席最近评论说 ， “ 致裂法是我所见过的最复杂的东西。

More research on the environmental risks and benefits of shale energy, and the development of new standards and regulations to control these risks are required. => ”我们需要更进一步地研究页岩能源的环境风险和收益，并开发新标准和监管以控制这些风险。
Big data and advanced analytics are another technology-driven game changer for US growth. => 大数据和先进分析法是美国增长的有一个技术推动型局面改变因素。

As more data are generated, stored, and transmitted in digital form, new data sets relevant to personal and business decisions are growing exponentially. => 随着更多数据的产生、存储和以数字形式传输，与个人和企业决策有关的新数据集正在呈现指数增长之势。
The potential savings in health-care costs would ease pressures on government budgets and release resources to boost growth in the rest of the economy. => 医疗成本的潜在节省将减轻政府预算压力，释放资源用於提振经济的其他部分的增长。
New information and communications technologies were game changers that boosted the potential growth rate of the US economy in the 1990’s. => 20世纪90年代改变美国经济潜在增长率局面的因素是新信息和通信技术。

McKinsey’s research suggests that shale energy and big-data technologies will be game changers with similar benefits for the economy’s potential growth over the next several years. => 麦肯锡的研究表明，页岩能源和大数据技术将在未来数年内给美国经济的潜在增长带来等量齐观的好处，它们是新的局面改变因素。
America’s Opposing Futures => 美国针锋相对的未来
International finance economists see a financial crisis as likely, followed by a painful and perhaps prolonged recession in the United States. => 国际金融经济学者认为巨额赤字可能带来金融危机，紧随其后的也许就是漫长而痛苦的国内衰退。

Domestically oriented macroeconomists, by contrast, see a forthcoming fall in the value of the dollar not as a crisis, but as an opportunity to accelerate growth. => 而国内宏观经济学家的看法却恰恰相反，他们认为美元即将贬值非但不是一次危机，还是一次加速成长的难得机会。
When they cease their large-scale dollar-purchase programs, the value of the dollar will fall – and it will fall hard. => 如果他们停止大规模的美元购买计划，美元的价值就会下跌¾而且是狂跌不止。
International finance economists see a far bleaker future. => 国际金融经济学家对前景的预测却远没有那么乐观。

Eight to ten million people will have to shift employment from services and construction into exports and import-competing goods, implying that structural unemployment will rise. => 800到1000万人将不得不从服务和建筑行业转向出口和进口竞争性商品，也就是说结构性的失业不可避免地将会发生。

When international finance economists sketch this scenario, domestically oriented macroeconomists respond that it sounds like a case of incompetent monetary policy. => 国际金融经济学家描述的这幅图景，国内宏观经济学家却认为更像是货币政策的失误。
Why should the Federal Reserve allow long-term interest rates to spike just because other central banks have ceased their dollar-purchase programs? => 美联储为什么仅仅由于外国央行停止了美元购买计划就允许长期利率大幅增长？

Should not the Fed step in and replace them with its own purchases of long-term US Treasury bonds, thereby keeping long-term interest rates at a level conducive to full employment? => 美联储就不能介入其中，自己购买美国发行的长期债券，从而把长期利率控制在有利于扩大就业的水平？
To this, international finance economists respond that the Fed does not have the power to do so. => 对于这种说法，国际金融经济学家认为美联储根本不具备这样的能力。
Serious economists whom I respect enormously find themselves taking strong positions on opposite sides of this debate. => 我非常尊敬的严肃的经济学家在这场辩论中的观点尖锐对立、南辕北辙。
I’m not wise enough to say which side is right, but I certainly know which side I hope is wrong. => 我没有能力指出谁对谁错，但我肯定知道我希望其中一方的观点是错误的。
America’s Other 30% => 美国的其余30%
NEW HAVEN – The American consumer is but a shadow of its former almighty self. => 纽黑文 — — 美国消费者现在只剩下以前无所不能的影子。

Personal consumption in the United States expanded at only a 1.5% annual rate in real (inflation-adjusted) terms in the second quarter of 2012 – and that was no aberration. => 2012年第二季度美国个人消费经通胀调整后的实际年增长率仅为1.5 % — —而且这还算不上什么失常表现。
Unfortunately, it continues a pattern of weakness that has been evident since early 2008. => 不幸的是，这不过是2008年初以来日趋明显的疲软格局的延续。

Over the last 18 quarters, annualized growth in real consumer demand has averaged a mere 0.7%, compared to a 3.6% growth trend in the decade before the crisis erupted. => 与危机爆发前10年3.6%的增长趋势相比，过去18个季度实际消费需求的年均增长率仅有可怜的0.7 % 。
Never before has the American consumer been this weak for this long. => 美国消费者还从未有过如此长时间的弱势记录。
The cause is no secret. => 其中的原因并不是什么秘密。
Consumers made huge bets on two bubbles – housing and credit. => 消费者在住房和信贷这两个泡沫上下了大注。

Reckless monetary and regulatory policies turned the humble abode into an ATM, allowing families to extract dollars from bubbles and live beyond their means. => 不计后果的货币和监管政策把原本简陋的居所变成了自动提款机，让有房一族从泡沫当中提取美元，享受着超出自身经济能力的生活。

Both bubbles have long since burst, and US households are now dealing with post-bubble financial devastation – namely, underwater assets, record-high debt, and profound shortages of savings. => 这两大泡沫其实早已破裂，美国家庭正被迫面对泡沫破灭所带来的金融后果。 相关问题包括水下资产、创记录的负债和深度储蓄短缺。
At the same time, sharply elevated unemployment and subpar income growth have combined to tighten the noose on over-extended consumers. => 与此同时，失业率飙升和收入增长欠佳也收紧了本已过度举债的消费者脖子上的绞索。
As a result, American households have hunkered down as never before. => 于是乎，美国家庭前所未有地放低了姿态。
Consumers are diverting what little income they earn away from spending toward paying down debt and rebuilding savings. => 消费者把赚取的微薄收入用来还债和重建储蓄，而不是用来支出。
That is both logical and rational – and thus not something that the US Federal Reserve can offset with unconventional monetary easing. => 此举确为逻辑理性之举 — — 因此绝非美联储靠超乎常规的宽松货币政策可以抵消的。
American consumers’ unprecedented retrenchment has turned the US economy’s growth calculus inside out. => 美国消费者前所未有的紧缩态度已经将美国经济增长预测翻了个底朝天。
Consumption typically accounts for 70% of GDP (71% in the second quarter, to be precise). => 消费通常占国内生产总值的70 % （ 准确的讲二季度为71 % ） 。
But the 70% is barely growing, and is unlikely to expand strongly at any point in the foreseeable future. => 但这70%几乎没有任何增长，而且在可以预见的未来强劲增长的可能性也微乎其微。
That puts an enormous burden on the other 30% of the US economy to generate any sort of recovery. => 这就导致推动经济复苏的巨大压力落到其余30%的美国经济身上。
In fact, the other 30% has not done a bad job, especially considering the severe headwinds coming from consumers’ 70%. => 其实，这其余30%的表现可圈可点，尤其考虑到70%消费所产生的严重阻力。

The 30% mainly consists of four components – capital spending by firms, net exports (exports less imports), residential construction, and government purchases. => 其余这30%主要包括四个部分：即公司资本支出、净出口（出口减去进口 ） 、 住宅建设和政府采购。

(Technically, the pace of inventory investment should be included, but this is a cyclical buffer between production and sales rather than a source of final demand.) => （技术上还应该包括库存投资的速度，但该指标仅为生产和销售之间的周期性缓冲，而并非最终需求的来源。 ）

Given the 0.7% trend in real consumption growth over the past four and a half years, the US economy’s anemic 2.2% annualized recovery in the aftermath of the Great Recession is almost miraculous. => 鉴于过去四年半中实际消费区区0.7%的增长率，大萧条后美国经济能以2.2%的速度缓慢复苏不失为一个奇迹。
Credit that mainly to the other 30%, especially to strong exports and a rebound in business capital spending. => 这主要归功于除消费以外的其余30 % ， 特别需要感谢强劲的出口和企业资本支出的反弹。

By contrast, the government sector has been moving in the opposite direction, as state and local governments retrench and federal purchases top out after post-crisis deficit explosions. => 反之，政府部门却朝着相反的方向发展，因为国家和地方政府执行紧缩，联邦采购也随着后危机时代的赤字爆炸达到了极限。

The housing sector has started to recover over the past five quarters, but from such a severely depressed level that its growth has had little impact on the overall economy. => 房地产部门过去五个季度已经开始复苏，但因为之前的状况过于严重，其目前增长对整体经济的影响微乎其微。

Given the strong likelihood that consumers will remain weak for years to come, America’s growth agenda needs to focus on getting more out of the other 30%. => 鉴于消费今后几年持续疲软的可能性极大，美国经济增长议程需要重点挖掘其余30%的潜力。
Of the four growth components that fall into this category, two have the greatest potential to make a difference – capital spending and exports. => 在构成这其余30%的四大门类中，资本支出和出口这两类最有可能有所作为。

Prospects for these two sources of growth will not only influence the vigor, or lack thereof, of any recovery; they could well be decisive in bringing about an important shift in the US growth model. => 这两大增长源头的前景不仅会影响到复苏的前景，还很可能成为美国经济增长模式重大转变的决定因素。
Capital spending and exports, which together account for about 24% of GDP, hold the key to this shift. => 共同占国内生产总值约24%的资本支出和出口构成了此次转型的关键因素。
At just over 10% of GDP, the share of capital spending is well below the peak of nearly 13% in 2000. => 资本支出的比例将将超过GDP的10 % ， 远低于2000年近13%的峰值。
Only then could export growth, impressive since mid-2009, sustain further increases. => 只有这样从2009年中以来令人印象深刻的出口增长才能更进一步。
And only then could the US stem the rising tide of import penetration by foreign producers. => 也只有这样美国才能遏制外国生产企业进口渗透的增长势头。
The other 30% is also emblematic of a deeper strategic issue that America faces – a profound competitive challenge. => 其余这30%也象征美国所面临的更深层次的战略问题 — — 同时也是深刻的竞争挑战。
A shift to external demand is not there for the asking. It must be earned by hard work, sheer determination, and a long overdue competitive revival. => 向外部需求转型也并非招之即来，必须依靠勤奋、毅力和迟到的竞争力复苏来努力争取。
On that front, too, America has been falling behind. => 美国在这方面也已经落后。
The erosion is traceable to several factors, including deficiencies in primary and secondary education as well as poor macroeconomic management. => 持续下滑可以归结为若干因素，其中包括中小学教育缺陷和宏观经济管理的低效。
Improvement on all counts is vital for America’s competitive revival. => 全方位的改善对美国竞争力的复苏至关重要。
But meeting the challenge will require vigorous growth from America’s other 30% – especially private capital spending. => 但迎接上述挑战需要美国其余的30 % — —尤其是私人资本开支保持强劲的增长势头。
With the American consumer likely to remain on ice, the same 30% must also continue to shoulder the burden of a sluggish economic recovery. => 由于美国消费可能会持续低迷，同样这30%还必须继续担负起疲弱的经济复苏重担。
None of this can occur in a vacuum. => 所有这些都不可能在真空当中实现。
The investment required for competitive revival and sustained recovery cannot be funded without a long-overdue improvement in US saving. => 没有美国储蓄迟到已久的复苏，恢复竞争力和持续复苏所需的资金根本不可能实现。
In an era of outsize government deficits and subpar household saving, that may be America’s toughest challenge of all. => 在政府赤字超大和家庭储蓄欠佳的年代，这或许是美国所面临的最严峻的挑战。
America's Other 87 Deficits => 美国的其他87处赤字
NEW HAVEN – The United States has a classic multilateral trade imbalance. => 纽黑文 — — 美国存在经典的多边贸易失衡。
While it runs a large trade deficit with China, it also runs deficits with 87 other countries. => 除了对中国的巨大贸易赤字意外，对其他87个国家，美国也存在赤字。
A multilateral deficit cannot be fixed by putting pressure on one of its bilateral components. => 多边赤字是无法通过向双边伙伴中的一边施加压力解决的。
But try telling that to America’s growing chorus of China bashers. => 但美国日渐壮大的对华强硬派可不这么想。
America’s massive trade deficit is a direct consequence of an unprecedented shortfall of domestic saving. => 美国的大规模贸易赤字是前所未有的国内储蓄短缺的直接结果。

The broadest and most meaningful measure of a country’s saving capacity is what economists call the “net national saving rate” – the combined saving of individuals, businesses, and the government. => 对一国储蓄能力的最广泛也最有意义的测量指标是经济学家所谓的“净国民储蓄率 ” — —个人、企业和政府储蓄之和。
It is measured in “net” terms to strip out the depreciation associated with aging or obsolescent capacity. => 该指标测量“净”值，以剔除与老龄化或报废产能有关的折旧。
It provides a measure of the saving that is available to fund expansion of a country’s capital stock, and thus to sustain its economic growth. => 该指标可用来测量可为一国资本存量增长融资从而保持经济增长的储蓄量。
In the US, there simply is no net saving any more. => 在美国，净储蓄早已不复存在。

Since the fourth quarter of 2008, America’s net national saving rate has been negative – in sharp contrast to the 6.4%-of-GDP averaged over the last three decades of the twentieth century. => 自2008年第四季度以来，美国净国民储蓄率一直是负数，与20世纪最后30年的平均水平 — — 占GDP的6.4%相去甚远。
Never before in modern history has the world’s leading economic power experienced a saving shortfall of such epic proportions. => 在现代历史中，还从未有哪个世界经济大国经历过如此规模的储蓄短缺。
Yet the US found a way to finesse this problem. => 但美国找到了一条解决这一问题的妙招。
The US current account, which was last in balance in 1991, hit a record deficit of $801 billion (6% of GDP) in 2006. => 美国经常项目上一次出现余额是在1991年，2006年，经常项目创出了8010亿美元（相当于GDP的6 % ） 赤字的历史记录。

This gap has narrowed in the past couple of years, but much of the improvement probably reflects little more than the temporary impact of an unusually tough business cycle. => 过去几年来，赤字有所减少，但大部分改善可能只是受异常艰难的商业周期的暂时影响所致。
This is where America’s multilateral trade deficit enters the equation, for it has long accounted for the bulk of America’s balance-of-payments gap. => 美国多边贸易赤字长期以来都要占美国国际收支缺口的大头。
Since 2000, it has made up fully 96% of the cumulative current-account shortfall. => 自2000年以来更是占到了累计经常项目赤字的96 % 。
And that is what ultimately makes the China-centric blame game so absurd. => 这也是中国罪魁论的可笑之处。

Without addressing the root of the problem – America’s chronic saving shortfall – it is ludicrous to believe that there can be a bilateral solution for a multilateral problem. => 除非能从根源上解决问题 — — 即慢性储蓄短缺 — — 否则，认为能用双边办法解决多边问题就是荒唐可笑的。
Yet that is exactly what US officials, together with many prominent economists, believe America needs. => 但这正是美国官员以及众多出名经济学家认为美国所需要做的。

Since the trade deficit is widely thought to put pressure on US jobs and real wages, the US-China trade imbalance has come under special scrutiny in these days of great angst. => 贸易赤字被广泛认为给美国就业和真实工资造成了严重压力，因此，近期以来，人们心急火燎地对美中贸易失衡给予了特别关注。
Yes, China does account for the largest component of America’s multilateral trade deficit – making up 42% of the total trade gap in 2010. => 是的，中国是美国多边贸易赤字最主要的组成部分，占2010年贸易总缺口的42 % 。
Conscious outsourcing and supply-chain management decisions by US multinationals play an important role in exaggerating China’s share. => 美国跨国公司的主动外包和供应链管理决策是中国份额大增的重要原因之一。
But that does little to let China off the hook in the eyes of Washington. => 但这并没有让华盛顿的官员们停止对中国指手画脚。
That was precisely the argument behind the US Senate’s recent overwhelming approval of a “currency bill” that took dead aim on China. => 这就是美国参议院最近以压倒性多数通过的矛头直指中国的“货币法案”背后的观点。
While it may be convenient to hold others accountable for America’s problems, this is bad economics driving bad politics. => 给美国的问题找个替罪羊也许只是权宜之计，但仍不可不谓是坏算盘驱使的坏政策。
In that vein, closing down trade with China, while failing to address the saving shortfall, is like putting pressure on one end of a water balloon. => 切断与中国的贸易不但不能解决储蓄短缺问题，还可能弄巧成拙。
The Chinese component of America’s multilateral trade deficit will simply migrate somewhere else – most likely to a higher-cost producer. => 美国多边贸易赤字中的中国成分只可能转移给另一个国家，该国的生产成本十有八九会远高于中国。
That would be the functional equivalent of a tax hike on beleaguered American families – hardly the solution that US politicians are promising. => 此举无异于向困境重重的美国家庭加税，绝不是美国政客所承诺的解决方案。
This is not to ignore important US-China trade issues that need to be addressed. => 这并不是要忽视必须修正的美中贸易问题。
Market access should be high on the agenda – especially for a sluggish US economy that needs new sources of growth, like exports. => 市场准入应该成为最优先项 — — 特别是对疲软的、急需出口等新增长源的美国经济来说。
China should be viewed as an opportunity, not a threat. => 中国应该被视为机会，而不是威胁。
At the same time, the US government should come clean with the American public about charges of Chinese currency manipulation and unfair trade practices. => 与此同时，美国政府应该向美国公众澄清，指责中国操纵汇率是不公平的贸易伎俩。
The renminbi has, in fact, appreciated by 30% relative to the US dollar since mid-2005. => 事实上，自2005年以来，人民币已对美元升值了30 % 。
Yes, China continues to accumulate a vast fund of foreign-exchange reserves. => 是的，中国仍在继续囤积巨量外汇储备。
China-bashing in the US speaks to a corrosive shift in the American psyche. => 指责中国体现出美国人心态的恶化。
It deflects attention away from those truly responsible for perpetuating the greatest saving shortfall in history. => 这使得美国人的注意力从真正应该对导致史上最大储蓄短缺问题永久化的人身上移开。
Washington has been seduced by the political economy of false prosperity. => 美国已经被虚假繁荣的政治经济学惯坏了。
That seduction has encouraged America to squander its savings and live beyond its means for nearly two decades. => 它使美国人在近20年的时间里一直过着过度奢侈的生活。
Now the game is up. => 现在，游戏结束了。
The ultimate test of any nation’s character is to look inside itself at moments of great challenge. Swept up in the blame game, the US is doing the opposite. => 不管是什么国家，其国民性格的终极考验都是能否在面临重大挑战是躬身自省。
And that could well be the greatest tragedy of all. => 美国正在倒行逆施，大玩抹黑他人的游戏。
After all, America’s 88 deficits did not arise of thin air. => 说到底，美国的88个赤字不是一日炼成的。
The American Consumer is Not Okay => 美国消费者有恙
NEW HAVEN – The spin-doctors are hard at work talking up America’s subpar economic recovery. => 纽黑文—诡辩老手努力地为美国欠佳的经济复苏开脱。
All eyes are on households. => 所有目光都集中在家庭身上。
Don’t believe it. => 别信他们。

First, consider the facts: Over the 21 quarters since the beginning of 2008, real (inflation-adjusted) personal consumption has risen at an average annual rate of just 0.9%. => 首先来看事实：自2008年初以来的21个季度中，真实（经通胀调整的）个人消费平均增长年率只有0.9 % 。
Look no further for the cause of unacceptably high US unemployment. => 无怪乎美国失业率会高到不可忍受的程度了。

To appreciate fully the unique character of this consumer-demand shortfall, trends over the past 21 quarters need to be broken down into two distinct sub-periods. => 为了充分理解这一消费需求短缺的独特特征，过去21个季度的趋势可以被分为两个不同的次级阶段。
First, there was a 2.2% annualized decline from the first quarter of 2008 through the second quarter of 2009. => 首先是2008年一季度到2009年二季度，此阶段出现了2.2%的年化下降。
This was crisis-driven carnage, highlighted by a 4.5% annualized collapse in the final two quarters of 2008. => 这是拜危机所赐，高峰是2008年后两个季度，年化下降达4.5 % 。
That key point appears all but lost on the consumer-recovery crowd. => 这个关键点人人都看得到，唯有消费复苏派对此视而不见。
At least it’s a recovery, they claim, and a sign of healing that can be attributed mainly to the heroic, unconventional efforts of the US Federal Reserve. => 他们指出，这至少是复苏，也是走向健康的信号，其功劳主要来自美联储果断的非常规手段。
This brings us to the second part of the argument against optimism: analytics. => 这就把我们带到了反对乐观的第二个理由：分析。
One of the first concepts to which an economics student is exposed in a basic macro course is “pent-up” consumer demand. => 经济学学生在基础宏观课程中接触的第一批概念之一是“被抑制的”消费者需求。
Discretionary consumption is typically deferred during recessions, especially for long-lasting durable goods such as motor vehicles, furniture, and appliances. => 自由裁量消费通常会在衰退中被推迟，特别是汽车、家居和电器等长期耐久品。

Once the recession ends and recovery begins, a “stock-adjustment” response takes hold, as households compensate for foregone replacement and update their aging durable goods. => 当衰退结束、复苏开始时 ， “ 存货调整”反应就会出现，家庭开始补偿此前的替代，升级老旧的耐久品。
Over most of the postwar period, this post-recession release of pent-up consumer demand has been a powerful source of support for economic recovery. => 在战后的大部分时间里，这一危机后释放的被抑制的消费者需求是经济复苏的强大支撑力。

By contrast, the release of pent-up demand in the current cycle amounted to just 3% annualized growth in the five quarters from early 2010 to early 2011. => 相反，当前周期的释放的被抑制需求只带来了3%的年化增长（在2010年初至2011年初的五个季度中 ） 。
Moreover, the strongest quarterly gain was a 4.1% increase in the fourth quarter of 2010. => 此外，最强季度增长出现在2010年四季度，增长率为4.1 % 。
This is a stunning result. => 这是个令人沮丧的结果。

The worst consumer recession in modern history, featuring a record collapse in durable-goods expenditures in 2008-2009, should have triggered an outsize surge of pent-up demand. => 现代史以来最严重的消费衰退 — — 2008—2009年耐久品支出下降创出历史记录 — — 应该触发被抑制需求的全面爆发。
Yet it did anything but that. => 但什么都发生了，唯独这一幕没有发生。
Instead, the release of pent-up consumer demand was literally half that of previous business cycles. => 相反，被抑制消费者需求的释放大概只有此前商业周期水平的一半。

The third point is more diagnostic: The shockingly anemic pattern of post-crisis US consumer demand has resulted from a deep Japan-like balance-sheet recession. => 第三点是关于诊断的：美国消费者需求在危机后增长如此无力是因为类似于日本的深度资产负债表衰退导致的。

With the benefit of hindsight, we now know that the 12-year pre-crisis US consumer-spending binge was built on a precarious foundation of asset and credit bubbles. => 从后见之明中我们知道，危机之前美国所经历的12年的消费者支出繁荣建立在脆弱的资产和信用泡沫的基础之上。
When those bubbles burst, consumers were left with a massive overhang of excess debt and subpar saving. => 当这些泡沫破裂时，留给消费者的是大量积压的过多债务和过少储蓄。

The post-bubble aversion to spending, and the related focus on balance-sheet repair, reflects what Nomura Research Institute economist Richard Koo has called a powerful “debt rejection” syndrome. => 泡沫期后的支出厌恶，以及与此相关的对修复资产负债表的关注，反映了野村研究所经济学家辜朝明所谓的强大的“债务拒绝”综合症。
Through its unconventional monetary easing, the Fed is attempting to create a shortcut around the imperative of household sector balance-sheet repair. => 美联储实施了非常规的货币宽松，试图创造一条修复家庭部门资产负债表的捷径。
This is where the wealth effects of now-rebounding housing prices and a surging stock market come into play. => 在这里，目前已步入反弹的房价和暴涨的股市的财富效应体现出来了。
But are these newfound wealth effects really all that they are made out to be? => 但这些新出现的财富效应真的就是我们想要的吗？
Yes, the stock market is now at an all-time high – but only in current dollars. => 是的，股市目前已经创出历史新高 — — 但这是以当前美元衡量的。
In real terms, the S&P 500 is still 20% below its January 2000 peak. => 若以真实值衡量，标准普尔500指数仍比2000年1月峰值低了20 % 。

Similarly, while the Case-Shiller index of US home prices is now up 10.2% over the year ending March 2013, it remains 28% below its 2006 peak. => 类似地，尽管Case-Shiller美国房价指数在2013年3月累计同比增长10.2 % ， 但仍比2006年峰值低了28 % 。
Wealth creation matters, but not until it recoups the wealth destruction that preceded it. => 财富创造能起到效果，但得等到它消弭了此前的财富毁灭之后。
Sadly, most American households are still far from recovery on the asset side of their balance sheets. => 不幸的是，大部分美国家庭的资产负债表的资产端还远远没有复苏。
At the same time, while consumer confidence is on the mend, it remains well below pre-crisis readings. => 与此同时，尽管消费者信心在反弹，但仍比危机前水平低得多。
In short, the American consumer’s nightmare is far from over. => 简言之，美国消费者的噩梦远远没有醒来。
Spin and frothy markets aside, the healing has only just begun. => 抛开市场欢腾，康复才刚刚开始。
America’s Political Recession => 美国的政治衰退
BERKELEY – The odds are now about 36% that the United States will be in a recession next year. => 伯克利—目前，美国在明年陷入衰退的可能性大约在36 % 。
More than a century ago, during the first Gilded Age, American politics was sharply polarized as well. => 一百年前，在第一次镀金时代期间，美国政坛也出现了迅速两极分化。
In 1896, future President Theodore Roosevelt was a Republican attack dog. => 1896年，日后成为美国总统的西奥多·罗斯福是一位共和党打手。

He denounced Democratic presidential candidate William Jennings Bryan as a mere puppet of the sinister governor of Illinois, John Peter Altgeld. => 他抨击民主党总统候选人布莱恩（William Jennings Bryan）只不过是伊利诺伊州黑老大奥特戈尔德（John Peter Altgeld）的傀儡。

Bryan, Roosevelt said, “would be as clay in the hands of the potter under the astute control of the ambitious and unscrupulous Illinois communist.” => 罗斯福说，布莱恩“就像是制陶家手上的粘土，被野心勃勃、肆无忌惮的伊利诺伊州共产主义者玩弄在股掌之间。
The “free coinage of silver” would be “but a step towards the general socialism which is the fundamental doctrine of his political belief.” => ” “ 自由铸币制”将“是迈向完全社会主义的一个步骤，社会主义就是他的基本政治理念。
He and Altgeld “seek to overturn the...essential policies which have controlled the government since its foundation.” => ”他和奥特戈尔德“想颠覆 … … 自建国以来便控制着政府的基本政策。 ”

Such language is as extreme as any we hear today – and from a man who was shortly to become Vice President (and later President, following the assassination of William McKinley). => 这番话与如今我们所听到的那些一样极端，而说这番话的是即将成为副总统（并在麦金利遇刺后成为总统）之人。

We have heard Texas Governor Rick Perry call obliquely for the lynching of his fellow Republican, Federal Reserve Chairman Ben Bernanke, should he come to the Lone Star State. => 我们听到得克萨斯州州长佩里（Rick Perry）拐弯抹角地表示，要是其共和党同僚、美联储主席伯南克胆敢到得州来的话，就会处死他。
But neither Perry nor Kobach is likely ever to be a US president, whereas Theodore Roosevelt was more than a partisan. => 但不论是佩里还是科巴赫，都不可能成为美国总统，而西奥多·罗斯福已经超越了党派色彩。
And yet he has gotten next to no Republicans to support their own policies. => 但他并不向共和党靠拢，支持共和党的政策。
Likewise, he has been unable to get Republican Vice-Presidential candidate Paul Ryan to endorse his own Medicare cost-control proposals. => 类似地，他也无法让共和党副总统候选人莱恩支持其本人的联邦医保计划成本控制方案。
There are obvious reasons for this. => 之所以如此，有诸多显而易见的原因。
And the Republican cadres believe this of Obama even more than they believed it of Clinton. => 共和党干部还认为奥巴马比克林顿更符合这一观点。
This view clearly influences Republican office-holders, who fear the partisan beast that mans their campaigns’ phone banks and holds the purse strings. => 这一观点显然影响了共和党领导人，他们担心党派之争扼住了其竞选阵营的电话银行和钱袋子。
That was the Republicans’ calculation in 2011-2012. => 这就是2011—2012年期间共和党的算盘。

It is possible that Republican leaders like Representatives John Boehner and Eric Cantor and Senator Mitch McConnell will conclude that their policy of obstruction has been a failure. => 博纳尔（John Boehner）众议员、康托（Eric Cantor）众议员、麦考奈尔（Mitch McConnell）参议员等共和党领导人可能会认为他们的阻挠政策已经失败了。
But don’t count on it. => 但别当真了。

Right now, every senior politician in America is telling their favorites in the press that they are confident that compromise on the “fiscal cliff” will be reached before the end of December. => 目前，所有美国高级政客都在媒体面前向支持者表示，自己对在12月底之前就“财政悬崖”问题达成一致有信心。
But they are telling their favorites this because they think that pessimism now will lead to their being blamed for gridlock later. => 但他们之所以向支持者如此表示，是因为当前的悲观气氛会导致人们把随后的僵局的责任推到他们头上。
It seems to me that the odds are around 60% that real negotiation will not begin until tax rates go up on January 1. => 对我来说，有60%的可能，真正的谈判在明年1月1日税率提高之前是不会发生的。
And it seems to me that, if gridlock continues into 2013, the odds are 60% that it will tip the US back into recession. => 对我来说，如果政治僵局持续到2013年，美国有60%的可能因此重陷衰退。
Let us hope that it will be short and shallow. => 但愿是我目光短浅。
Bye-Bye, Middle East? => 拜拜，中东？
This view seems intuitively correct, but is it? => 但真的如此吗？
Energy-hungry America has long depended on the global market to meet domestic demand. => 渴望能源的美国长期以来一直依靠全球市场满足国内需求。
In 2005, the US imported 60% of the energy that it consumed. => 2005年，美国所消费的能源中60%来自进口。
Since then, however, the share of imports has decreased, and it should continue to do so. => 不过，至此以后，进口比重便有所降低，未来仍将维持这一趋势。
The US is expected to become energy self-sufficient in 2020, and to become an oil exporter by 2030. => 据估计，到2020年，美国将实现能源自给，并在2030年成为石油出口国。
This scenario would grant the US three enormous advantages. => 这一形势将给美国带来三大优势。
It would enhance US economic competitiveness, especially relative to Europe, given the lower costs involved in the extraction of shale gas. => 这将赋予美国经济竞争力，特别是相对欧洲的竞争力，因为美国提取页岩气的成本更低。
It would also reduce America’s exposure to growing unrest in the Arab world. => 这还将减少美国对日益动荡的阿拉伯世界的风险暴露。

Finally, it would increase the relative vulnerability of America’s main strategic rival, China, which is becoming increasingly dependent on Middle East energy supplies. => 最后，这还将增加美国主要战略竞争对手中国的相对弱势，后者正日益依赖中东的能源供给。
These facts obviously need to be taken seriously, but their implications for US foreign policy in the Middle East should not be too hastily drawn. => 这些因素显然都值得严肃考虑，但它们对美国的中东外交政策的影响不应该过早下结论。
Above all, though energy dependence is a key element of US policy in the region, it is far from being the only factor. => 无论如何，尽管能源依赖是美国在该地区政策的主要决定要素，但绝不是唯一要素。
Israel’s security and the desire to contain Iran are equally important. => 以色列的安全和对遏制伊朗的渴望也同样重要。

Moreover, the Middle East’s role in the global geopolitics of energy will grow in the coming decades, making it difficult to see how a superpower like the US could simply walk away from the region. => 此外，中东在全球能源地缘政治中的作用将在未来几十年中与日俱增，因此，对于美国这样的超级大国，很难想象它会对该地区一弃了之。
Within the next 15 years, OPEC countries will account for 50% of global oil production, compared to only 42% today. => 在未来15年中，欧佩克国家将占据全球石油产量的一半，而今天为42 % 。
Furthermore, the country on which this increase will most likely hinge is Iraq. => 此外，份额的增长之源极有可能来自伊拉克。
Would it withdraw in the face of the consequent strategic threat to its three allies – Saudi Arabia, Turkey, and Israel – in the region? => 美国会放任其三大地区盟友 — — 沙特、土耳其和以色列面临战略威胁从该地区撤退吗？
Even when its energy dependence on the Middle East was at its peak, the US rarely altered its policy of support for Israel. => 即使其对中东能源的依赖已经过了顶峰期，美国也不会改变支持以色列的政策。
In the end, America’s position in the region strengthened after Egypt became a US ally and made peace with Israel. => 最终，在埃及成为美国盟友并与以色列和解后，美国在该地区的地位提高了。
China’s growing interest in the Middle East also decreases the likelihood of an American withdrawal. => 中国在中东利益的提升也降低了美国撤退的可能性。

The US will remain concerned about ensuring the security of energy supplies for its Asian allies, which, like China, are increasingly dependent on the region’s oil exporters. => 美国仍将考虑确保亚洲盟国能源供应的安全问题，它们与中国一样，越来越依赖中东的石油出口。
Its involvement in the Israeli-Palestinian conflict will likely be limited to maintaining the status quo rather than seeking a comprehensive settlement. => 其对以色列-巴勒斯坦冲突的干涉可能将局限于维持现状，而不再寻求全面解决。
That would certainly satisfy Israeli Prime Minister Binyamin Netanyahu and the Palestinian fringe seeking to weaken the Palestinian Authority. => 这显然满足了以色列总理内塔尼亚胡以及寻求削弱巴勒斯坦权力机构的巴边缘组织。
But it would fully vindicate those who believe that Obama is more a man of good will than a visionary. => 但也充分证明认为奥巴马是善人多过空想家是正确的。
America’s Perpetual Christmas => 美国永不结束的圣诞
Has the United States transcended the laws of economics? => 美国能否超越经济规律？
As the New Year begins, the US continues to race ahead of its rich-country counterparts. => 新年伊始，美国经济仍然领先于其它富裕国家。
The gargantuan US trade deficit? => 庞大的贸易赤字？
No problem. => 没问题。
In 2005, it widened further, and the dollar only strengthened. => 2005年赤字额继续增加，而美元却依然坚挺。
Low investment and a deteriorating primary education system? => 投资规模小、初等教育体系恶化吗？
Not to worry. => 别担心。
The super-flexible US economy keeps managing to produce more with less. => 超级灵活的美国经济只用很少的投入就能获得更多的效益。
Nor are there any signs of America’s economic hegemony starting to fold under the weight of maintaining its unilateral military dominance. => 此外美国经济霸权也没有在保持单边军事统治的重压下显露出彻底失败的迹象。

Instead of feeling the pinch of wartime privations, like in any ordinary country, American consumers are binging as if it were Christmas all year round. => 美国消费者没有象普通国家的消费者那样感到战争时期物质匮乏的压力，他们继续狂欢，好像1年365天天天都是圣诞节。
There are those who truly believe in the idea that America is exceptional. => 有人虔诚地相信美国经济与众不同。
Those true believers argue that America’s consumers can long pursue their spendthrift ways because their country’s economy is better than everyone else’s. => 这些人认为由于美国经济比其它国家都好，美国消费者就能够继续他们挥金如土的生活。
The US labor market is more flexible than Europe’s, enabling it to react more nimbly to the ever shifting sands of globalization. => 美国的劳务市场比欧洲灵活，能够迅速调整适应全球化不断变化的需要。
And, unlike most countries, especially in Latin America and Asia, the US system ruthlessly prunes weak corporate leadership. => 此外，与拉丁美洲和亚洲的多数国家不同，美国的经济体系无情地剪除一切软弱的企业领导。

Moreover, the true believers cite America’s better-funded and hyper-competitive university system, which sucks in a disproportionate share of the world’s top students and researchers. => 不仅如此，这些虔诚的崇拜者还用美国资金充足、竞争激烈的大学体系来证明自己的正确，这些大学吸纳世界顶尖学生和研究人员的数量之多令人惊讶。
On top of all this, the US military, rather than being a burden, feeds the country’s technological superiority by subsidizing basic research. => 除此之外，美国军队不但不是社会的负担，还通过资助基础研究为美国保持技术领先做出了贡献。
By contrast, skeptics hold that the US economy already contains the seeds of its own socio-economic decline. => 与此形成鲜明对照的是，怀疑论者认为社会经济衰退的种子早已蕴藏在了美国的经济之中。
They point to worsening income inequality, as images beamed worldwide from post-hurricane New Orleans illustrated all too clearly. => 他们指的是日益拉大的收入差距，这一点在新奥尔良遭受飓风袭击后传送到世界各地的电视画面中已经有了清楚地证明。
Poor children do not have reasonable access to health care. => 贫困儿童得不到合理的医疗救治。

Nor are the non-poor faring particularly well, as wage growth has remained virtually flat for a very long time, even as corporate profits are booming. => 非贫困人口的生活状况也并不理想，因为很久以来虽然企业利润大幅度飙升，但员工薪水却一直没有太大增长。
All of these factors place deep stresses on the social fabric which, so the skeptics argue, will ultimately play out in the political arena. => 怀疑论者认为所有这些因素都转化成了社会压力，而社会压力最终会对政治局势造成影响。

Interestingly, both sides cite America’s gaping trade deficit – believe it or not, the US is soaking up two-thirds of global excess saving – to support their arguments. => 有趣的是，正反两方都把美国的贸易赤字做为支持本方观点的依据，无论你是否相信，美国都吸纳了全球多余存款的三分之二以上。

The true believers view the deficits as evidence that the world recognizes how special the US is and wants to buy in. Skeptics see an empire living on borrowed money and borrowed time. => 狂热的崇拜者把赤字作为全世界认可美国特殊性，愿意大宗买进的证据，而怀疑论者看到的却是一个依靠借钱、借时间度日的没落帝国。
So which is it? => 到底哪种看法是对的？
In my view, those who think that America is about to collapse are likely to be disappointed. => 在我看来，认为美国行将崩溃的一方可能会感到失望，但与此同时，我怀疑美国例外论也即将终结。

Nevertheless, I suspect that the age of American exceptionalism is near an end, and soon per capita income in Europe and Japan will approach that of the US, rather than falling farther behind. => 欧洲和日本的人均收入与美国之间的差距不会进一步拉大，相反会迅速地接近美国的水平。

We would do well to recall how, at the beginning of the 1990’s, book after book was still being written urging US and European corporations to imitate Japan or face certain doom. => 我们还能够清晰地记起20世纪90年代初期如何出现了一本接一本的著作，敦促美国和欧洲公司模仿日本的做法，预言惟其如此才能逃脱失败的命运。
The last 15 years have of course revealed deep flaws in Japan’s financial system. => 当然过去15年中日本金融体系暴露了很多深层次问题。
But another major factor contributing to Japan’s decline was that firms elsewhere began adopting Japanese methods, such as just-in-time supply chains. => 但导致日本衰退的另一个重要因素是其它地方的公司也开始采用日本的管理方法，比如及时生产管理。
Surely, imitation will someday impinge on superior US growth performance as well. => 当然，有一天这种模仿也会威胁到美国经济的发展前景。
Perhaps the biggest weakness in the true believers’ argument is the trade deficit. => 狂热崇拜者所举论据中最经不起推敲的也许就是贸易赤字问题。
At some point, the party is going to end. => 但美国的经���狂欢终有一天将会曲终人散。
Individually, these are each highly plausible scenarios, and collectively they would hit the US trade deficit like a perfect storm. => 单独去看，每种状况的可能性都无法排除，而这些合在一起，就构成了冲击美国贸易赤字的完美风暴。
Perhaps the end will come in a different way, but it is difficult to imagine the age of US exceptionalism lasting indefinitely. => 也许终结的到来会采取另外一种方式，但很难想象美国例外论时代将会无限期地延长。
Can the end come abruptly in 2006? => 美国经济盛宴是否会在2006年突然结束？
This is not the most likely scenario, but it is not unthinkable. => 这种情况的可能性虽然不大，但也不是完全不可想象。
America’s Strategy Vacuum => 美国的战略真空
NEW HAVEN – Apparently, policymakers at the Federal Reserve are having second thoughts about the wisdom of open-ended quantitative easing (QE). => 纽黑文 — — 显然，美联储决策者对开放式量化宽松政策（QE）明智与否开始有些犹豫。
They should. => 这种犹豫合情合理。
Not only has this untested policy experiment failed to deliver an acceptable economic recovery; it has also heightened the risk of another crisis. => 这项效果不明的政策试验不仅未能实现合格的经济复苏，甚至可能引发另外一场危机。

As serious as these concerns may be, they overlook what could well be the greatest flaw in the Fed’s unprecedented gambit: an emphasis on short-term tactics over longer-term strategy. => 无论担忧情绪多么严重，它们都忽略了美联储这项史无前例策略中最大的弱点：那就是强调短期战术甚于长期战略。
That approach might have worked had the US economy been afflicted by a cyclical disease – a temporary shortfall of aggregate demand. => 假如是总需求暂时不足的周期性顽疾困扰美国经济这种办法有可能奏效。

In that case, countercyclical policies – both fiscal and monetary – could eventually be expected to plug the demand hole and get the economy going again, just as Keynesians argue. => 在上述情况下，按照凯恩斯理论，财政及货币等反周期政策最终可以弥补需求不足，从而让经济再度启动。
Two bubbles – property and credit – against which American families borrowed freely, have long since burst. => 美国家庭曾信手拈来的房地产和信贷两大泡沫早已破灭。
Understandably fixated on balance-sheet repair, US consumers have not taken the bait from their monetary and fiscal authorities. => 不难想见专注于资产负债表修复的美国消费者并未吞下货币财政当局抛出的香饵。
Instead, they have cut back on spending. => 相反，他们已经削减开支。
The brute force of massive monetary and fiscal stimulus rings hollow as a cyclical remedy to this problem. => 在大规模货币财政刺激领域使用蛮力无助于对上述问题��周期性补救。
Another approach is needed. => 采用其他方法非常必要。

The focus, instead, should be on accelerating the process of balance-sheet repair, while at the same time returning monetary and fiscal policy levers to more normal settings. => 相反，在复原货币财政政策杠杆的同时加速修复资产负债表应当引起足够的重视。
How else can the crisis-battered housing market finally clear for the remainder of US homeowners? => 还有什么其他办法能让剩余的美国房主摆脱房地产市场的影响？
Yes, these are controversial policies. => 诚然，上述政策充满争议。
Debt forgiveness raises thorny ethical concerns about condoning reckless and irresponsible behavior. => 债务减免将纵容鲁莽和不负责行为的棘手伦理问题摆在了我们面前。
Timing is also an issue, especially with respect to saving incentives. => 在鼓励储蓄的问题上，时机的把握也同样重要。
To avoid the shortfall in aggregate demand that might arise from an abrupt surge in saving, these measures should be phased in over a period of 3-5 years. => 为避免存款激增可能导致总需求不足，应当在3－5年内分阶段实施上述举措。

The main benefit of these proposals is that they are more strategic than tactical – better aligned with the balance-sheet problems that are actually afflicting the economy. => 相关提案的主要优势是关注战略胜过战术层面，因此在解决实际困扰当前经济的资产负债表问题时更能对症下药。
As the quintessential laissez-faire system, the US has outsourced strategy to the invisible hand of the market for far too long. => 由于崇尚典型的自由放任主义，美国一直将战略问题交给市场这只看不见的手。
That has left the government locked into a reactive and often misguided approach to unexpected problems. => 长此以往导致政府在处理突发问题时被动且时常受到误导。
Thus, the Fed is focused on cleaning up after a crisis rather than on how to avoid another one. => 因此，美联储似乎更关注危机善后，而不是避免新一轮危机爆发。
A compliant bond market, which may well be the next bubble, is mistakenly viewed as the ultimate validation of this myopic approach. => 被误当成这种短视做法终极检验的顺从的债券市场很可能酝酿着下一轮泡沫。
The dangers of America’s strategy vacuum and the related penchant for short-termism have been mounting for some time. => 美国战略真空和短期主义危险已经存在了很长时间。
Harvard Business School professor Michael Porter famously raised this concern in a 1996 article in the Harvard Business Review. => 1996年哈佛商学院教授迈克尔·波特在《哈佛商业评论》刊载的一篇文章中尽人皆知地提出了这个问题。
While Porter’s critique was directed at business managers, it bears critically on the current US policy debate. => 尽管针对的是企业管理者，但波特的评论会对当前美国政策争论造成关键的影响。
A successful long-term strategy cannot be seen as a succession of short-term fixes. => 一系列短期的修修补补绝不能同成功的长期战略划等号。
A comparable debate is raging over fiscal policy. => 财政政策领域同样存在类似的争议。
Can America finally face up to the perils of its strategy vacuum? => 美国最终能否正视自己的战略真空？
America’s Political Class Struggle => 美国的政治阶级对立
NEW YORK – America is on a collision course with itself. => 发自纽约 — — 美国当前正在陷入一场自身与自身的斗争之中。

As in many countries, conflicts over public morality and national strategy come down to questions of money. In the United States, this is truer than ever. => 在许多国家内部，所有关于公共道德和国家战略的冲突最终都会归结到钱的问题上，而这一点在美国尤其正确。
The US is running an annual budget deficit of around $1 trillion, which may widen further as a result of the new tax agreement. => 美国的年度预算赤字高达1万亿美元，而这一状况将随着新税务协议的实施而进一步恶化。
This level of annual borrowing is far too high for comfort. It must be cut, but how? => 毫无疑问，这种年度借贷居高不下的状况必须被遏制，但我们又该如何去遏制呢？
The problem is America’s corrupted politics and loss of civic morality. => 但问题则在于美国的腐败政治和公民道德的缺失。
One political party, the Republicans, stands for little except tax cuts, which they place above any other goal. => 其一个政党 — — 共和党 — — 将减税凌驾于其他一切目标之上。
The Democrats have a bit wider set of interests, including support for health care, education, training, and infrastructure. => 民主党人的政治目的则相对较多，包括医疗保障，教育，职业培训和基础设施建设。
But, like the Republicans, the Democrats, too, are keen to shower tax cuts on their major campaign contributors, predominantly rich Americans. => 但跟共和党人一样，民主党人也热衷于给自己的竞选赞助者 — — 那些富裕的美国人 — — 提供减税优惠
The result is a dangerous paradox. => 而此举引发的结果则是一个极度危险的矛盾综合体。
The US budget deficit is enormous and unsustainable. => 美国的预算赤字极为巨大而且无法持续。
The poor are squeezed by cuts in social programs and a weak job market. => 穷人们则被社会福利项目的削减和低迷的就业市场折磨得奄奄一息。
One in eight Americans depends on Food Stamps to eat. => 每8个美国人就有1个要靠政府发放的食品券维生。
This tax-cutting frenzy comes, incredibly, after three decades of elite fiscal rule in the US that has favored the rich and powerful. => 更令人难以置信的是，这场减税狂热竟然在持续30年的偏袒有权有势者的精英财政管理后出现了。

Since Ronald Reagan became President in 1981, America’s budget system has been geared to supporting the accumulation of vast wealth at the top of the income distribution. => 自从罗纳德·里根于1981年当选总统以来，美国的预算系统就被用作帮助那些位于利益分配链条高端的人聚集巨额财富服务。
Amazingly, the richest 1% of American households now has a higher net worth than the bottom 90%. => 令人吃惊地是，最富有的那1%美国家庭所拥有的资本比位于底层的90%家庭还要多。
The annual income of the richest 12,000 households is greater than that of the poorest 24 million households. => 最富有的那1.2万个家庭的年收入比最贫穷的2400万家庭还要高。
The Republican Party’s real game is to try to lock that income and wealth advantage into place. => 民主党的真正意图就是确保上述收入和财富优势能长期维持下去。
They fear, rightly, that sooner or later everyone else will begin demanding that the budget deficit be closed in part by raising taxes on the rich. => 因此他们当然也害怕某一时刻其他所有人都会要求通过提高富人缴税额的方式来结束这种预算赤字状况。
After all, the rich are living better than ever, while the rest of American society is suffering. => 毕竟当美国其他阶层正在受苦受难之时，富人们的生活却日益奢靡。
It makes sense to tax them more. => 因此向他们征收更多的税是公平合理的。
The Republicans are out to prevent that by any means. => 共和党人自然会想尽一切办法阻止这一切发生。
This month, they succeeded, at least for now. => 而他们在本月取得了胜利，至少是现在。

But they want to follow up their tactical victory – which postpones the restoration of pre-Bush tax rates for a couple of years – with a longer-term victory next spring. => 但他们还想乘胜追击 — — 将恢复小布什上任前税率的提案再推迟几年 — — 再在明年春天取得一个长期胜利。
Their leaders in Congress are already declaring that they will slash public spending in order to begin reducing the deficit. => 他们在众议院的领袖已经明确表示将大幅削减公共开支以减少赤字。
Ironically, there is one area in which large budget cuts are certainly warranted: the military. => 讽刺的是，有一个领域的开支是必须进行大规模削减的 — — 军事。
But that is the one item most Republicans won’t touch. => 但这一领域却是大部分共和党人不愿意触及的。
In the end, I don’t think they will succeed. => 但我不认为他们会最终成功。

For the moment, most Americans seem to be going along with Republican arguments that it is better to close the budget deficit through spending cuts rather than tax increases. => 虽然现在大多数美国人都会同意共和党的说辞，认为应该用减少公共开支的方式来削减预算赤字而不是增税。
Yet when the actual budget proposals are made, there will be a growing backlash. => 但当预算草案最终出台时，就将遇到越来越大的反对阻力。
With their backs against the wall, I predict, poor and working-class Americans will begin to agitate for social justice. => 我预测，那些走投无路的穷人和工薪阶层开始奋起为社会公平而抗争。
This may take time. => 这可能需要一些时间。
The level of political corruption in America is staggering. => 美国政治的腐败程度令人震惊。
Everything now is about money to run electoral campaigns, which have become incredibly expensive. => 一切都围绕着如何搞钱来运作选举活动，而这些活动也变得极端昂贵。
The mid-term elections cost an estimated $4.5 billion, with most of the contributions coming from big corporations and rich contributors. => 刚刚结束的中期选举耗资45亿美元，而大部分的捐助者都是那些大企业和富裕阶层。

These powerful forces, many of which operate anonymously under US law, are working relentlessly to defend those at the top of the income distribution. => 这些巨大的力量 — — 许多都在美国法律下暗中运作着 — — 正不懈地维护那些分配金字塔高层的利益。
But make no mistake: both parties are implicated. => 但可以确定的是：两党都牵涉其中。
There is already talk that Obama will raise $1 billion or more for his re-election campaign. => 已经有传言说奥巴马将为自己的连任竞选筹资超过10亿美元。
That sum will not come from the poor. => 这笔钱显然也不会来自于穷人。

The problem for the rich is that, other than military spending, there is no place to cut the budget other than in areas of core support for the poor and working class. => 而富裕阶层的问题则在于，除了军事领域之外，最可供开支削减的领域莫过于那些主要为穷人和工薪阶级的领域。
Will America really let its public infrastructure continue to deteriorate? => 美国能否继续坐视本国的基础设施逐渐衰败？
The rich will try to push such an agenda, but ultimately they will fail. => 富人们将尝试去实现这几点，但他们最终会失败。
Obama swept to power on the promise of change. => 奥巴马用改变的承诺夺得了总统宝座。
So far there has been none. => 但这些承诺至今还未实现。
His administration is filled with Wall Street bankers. => 他的政府里充斥着华尔街银行家。
His top officials leave to join the banks, as his budget director Peter Orszag recently did. => 他的高级下属纷纷弃他而去，加入银行，正如他的预算办公室主任彼得·奥斯泽格最近所做的那样。
He is always ready to serve the interests of the rich and powerful, with no line in the sand, no limit to “compromise.” => 他自己也常常准备好为权势阶级的利益服务，根本没有自己的底线，任何东西都可以“妥协 ” 。
If this continues, a third party will emerge, committed to cleaning up American politics and restoring a measure of decency and fairness. => 如果这一状况持续下去的话，一个承诺扫除美国政治恶习并重新实现社会正义和公平的第三党派就会崛起。
This, too, will take time. => 这也需要一些时间。
The political system is deeply skewed against challenges to the two incumbent parties. => 整个政治系统虽然遭到了现有这两大党派的扭曲。
Yet the time for change will come. => 但真正的改变依然会降临。

The Republicans believe that they have the upper hand and can pervert the system further in favor of the rich. I believe that they will be proved wrong. => 共和党人相信自己胜券在握并在富人的授意下进一步将这个政治系统引向邪路的时候，我却相信现实最终将证明他们是错的。
America's Problems Run Deeper than Wall Street => 美国的问题不止于华尔街

We are in the midst of a financial crisis caused by the serious mispricing of all kinds of risks and by the collapse of the housing bubble that developed in the first half of this decade. => 我们正处在一场金融危机之中。 这场危机是由对所有风险的严重错误定价和和美国在这十年的前五年中所产生的房地产泡沫的崩溃造成的。
What started as a problem with sub-prime mortgages has now spread to houses more generally, as well as to other asset classes. => 最初的次贷问题现在已经蔓延到整个的房地产以及其他的资产种类。
The housing problem is contributing to the financial crisis, which in turn is reducing the supply of credit needed to sustain economic activity. => 住房问题正使金融危机愈演愈烈，而后者又正减少着维持经济活动所需的信贷供应。
Negative equity is significant because mortgages in the United States are generally “no recourse” loans. => 负资产事关重大是因为美国的房贷通常是“无追索权”贷款。
If a homeowner defaults, creditors can take the house, but they cannot take other property or income to make up any unpaid balance. => 如果房屋业主断供，债权人可以收走房产，但他们却不能用其他的资产或收入来弥补欠款。
Even in those states where mortgages are not “no recourse” loans, creditors generally do not pursue the assets or income of individuals who default. => 即便在那些房贷不是“无追索权”贷款的州，债权人通常也不会追索断供人的资产或收入。
We cannot be sure about how much further house prices will fall. => 我们不能确定房价还会跌多少。
Experts say another 15% decline is required just to return to the pre-bubble price path. => 专家们说必须再跌15%才刚能回到泡沫产生前的价格路径上。
But there is nothing to stop the decline from continuing once it reaches that point. => 可即使房价跌到了那个点也没有任何力量能阻止它继续下滑。
The growing gap between mortgage debts and house prices will continue to increase the rate of defaults. => 房贷债务和房价之间不断扩大的差距会使断供率继续上升。

Many homeowners who can afford to make their mortgage payments will choose to default, move to rental housing, and wait to purchase until house prices have declined further. => 许多有能力偿还房贷的业主也会选择断供，并租房而居，等到房价继续下跌再伺机购房。
As homeowners with large negative equity default, the foreclosed homes contribute to the excess supply that drives prices down further. => 随着拥有负资产的业主断供，取消赎回权的抵押房产又会加剧市场供过于求的情况从而使房价进一步下跌。
And the lower prices lead to more negative equity and therefore to more defaults and foreclosures. => 更低的房价导致更多的负资产从而造成更多的断供和取消房产赎回权的情况发生。
It is not clear what will stop this self-reinforcing process. => 我们还不清楚什么样的力量会阻止这种自我强化的进程。
Until house prices stabilize, these securities cannot be valued with any confidence. => 在房价稳定之前，市场不会对这些证券的价值有任何信心。

And that means that the financial institutions that own them cannot have confidence in the liquidity or solvency of potential counterparties – or even in the value of their own capital. => 而这就意味着持有这些资产的金融机构不能对潜在交易对手的资产变现能力和偿付能力抱有信心—甚至对自身的资本价值也是如此。
Without this confidence, credit will not flow and economic activity will be constrained. => 没有这种信心，信贷就不会流动，经济活动也会被抑制。
Moreover, because financial institutions’ assets were bought mainly with borrowed money, the shortage of credit is exacerbated by their need to deleverage. => 再者，因为金融机构的资产主要使用贷款购得，信贷短缺又加剧了它们减债的需求。
Since raising capital is difficult and costly, they deleverage by lending less. => 由于融资困难重重且代价不菲，他们就通过减少放贷来减债。

But the macroeconomic weakness in the US now goes beyond the decreased supply of credit.  Falling house prices reduce household wealth and therefore consumer spending. => 但美国宏观经济的疲软远远不止于信贷供应的萎缩。 不断下跌的房价使家庭财富缩水从而减少��消费支出。
Falling employment lowers wage and salary incomes. => 就业率的下降降低了薪资收入。
The higher prices of food and energy depress real incomes further. => 高企的食品和能源价格进一步遏制了实际收入。
And declining economic activity in the rest of the world is lowering demand for US exports. => 世界其他国家和地区经济活力的下降也正在降低对美国出口产品的需求。

The US Federal Reserve has, in my judgment, responded appropriately by reducing the federal funds interest rate sharply and creating a variety of new credit facilities. => 我个人认为美联储的应对是得当的。 它大幅降低了联邦基金的利率并创立了一系列新的信贷举措。
The US Congress and the Bush administration enacted a $100 billion tax rebate in an attempt to stimulate consumer spending. => 美国国会和布什政府实施了一项1000亿美元的减税计划，试图刺激消费支出。

Those of us who supported this policy generally knew that history and economic theory implied that such one-time fiscal transfers have little effect, but we thought that this time might be different. => 我们当中那些支持这项政策的人大都明白历史和经济理论证明这种一次性的财政转移支付收效不佳。 但我们认为这次可能会有所不同。
Our support was, in the words of Samuel Johnson, a triumph of hope over experience. => 支持我们观点的论据用Samuel Johnson的话来讲就是“一次希望对于经验的胜利。 ”
In the end, our hopes were frustrated. => 最终，我们的希望受挫了。
The official national income accounting data for the second quarter are now available, and they show that the rebates did very little to stimulate spending. => 第二季度的官方国民收入财务数据已经公布，其显示退税政策对刺激消费几乎没有作用。
More than 80% of the rebate dollars were saved or used to pay down debt. => 80%的退税款都被存入银行或用于还债。
Very little was added to current spending. => 只有很少的一部分被加入到现有支出之上。

So that is where the US is now: in the middle of a financial crisis, with the economy sliding into recession, monetary policy already at maximum easing, and fiscal transfers impotent. => 所以这就是美国的现状：深陷一场金融危机之中，经济正走向衰退，货币政策已经宽松到最大限度，财政转移支付不力。
That is an unenviable situation, to say the least, for any incoming president. => 至少这对于任何一位继任总统都不是什么大好形势。
Obama’s Burmese Gamble => 奥巴马的缅甸之赌
ARLINGTON – The rapprochement between the United States and Myanmar (Burma) has proceeded at a blistering pace. => 阿林顿—美国和缅甸以极快的速度恢复了邦交。
A year ago, the two countries did not even have ambassadors in each other’s capitals. => 一年前，两国还没有互派大使。
In May, President Thein Sein became the first leader from Myanmar to visit the White House in nearly a half-century. => 5月，总统吴登盛成为近半个世纪以来第一个访问白宫的缅甸领导人。
But has Barack Obama’s administration been too quick to embrace what was, until recently, one of the world’s most repressive regimes? => 但奥巴马政府接受这个不久前还是世界最残酷政权的国家是不是太快了点？
Or, on the contrary, is decisive US support essential to Myanmar’s fledgling reform process? => 或者反过来，美国的果断支持是否对缅甸摸石头过河的改革过程至关重要？
Until the recent opening, Myanmar, which gained independence in 1948, had been ruled by a secretive military junta since 1962. => 1948年，缅甸独立。 自1962年到不久前，缅甸一直由神秘的军事集团统治。
As recently as 2010, the regime held elections so blatantly rigged that the main opposition party refused to participate. => 迟至2010年，缅甸军政府还举行了一场赤裸裸操纵的选举，以至于反对党拒绝参与。

But in 2011, shortly before assuming the presidency, Sein, a general who served as Prime Minister under the junta, began to take steps that impressed even the most skeptical observers. => 但在2011年，军政府时期以将军身份担任总理的吴登盛在就任总统前开始采取令最狐疑的观察者也觉得了不起的步骤。
Unlike the token gestures of reform offered by previous rulers, Sein’s actions appeared substantive and meaningful. => 与此前的统治者装模作样的改革姿态不同，吴登盛的动作是具体且意义深远的。

One important change was the release of hundreds of political prisoners, including the regime’s most prominent opponent, Aung San Suu Kyi, who had been under house arrest for nearly 15 years. => 一个重要的变化是释放了数百名政治犯，包括最著名的体制反对者昂山素季，她被软禁将近15年。

Moreover, Sein initiated a dialogue with Suu Kyi, a Nobel Peace Prize winner and the leader of the National League for Democracy (NLD), about a transition to civilian rule. => 此外，吴登盛还与身为诺贝尔和平奖获得者兼全国民主联盟（NLD）领袖的昂山素季举行了会谈，商讨向文治的转型。
The subsequent elections bolstered hope for Myanmar’s democratic future. => 随后的选举增强了人们关于缅甸民主未来的希望。
In 1990, when the NLD won 81% of the seats in Parliament, the junta promptly voided the results and arrested Suu Kyi. => 1990年，NLD在议会赢得80%议席，但军政府马上宣布结果无效并逮捕了昂山素季。
In 2012, the NLD won 43 of the 44 seats that it contested, and the military accepted Suu Kyi as the reform movement’s legitimate leader. => 2012年，NLD在其所争取的44个议席中赢下43席，而军政府接受昂山素季作为改革运动的合法领袖。

Furthermore, Sein has reached out to the Karen, Kachin, and other ethnic minorities – groups whose members have suffered decades of official persecution and mistreatment. => 此外，吴登盛还与克伦、克钦和其他少数民族进行了接触 — — 这些群体遭受了长达数十年的官方迫害和虐待。
But, in some areas, reform has been painfully slow. => 但是，在某些领域，改革进展极为缓慢。
In fact, when it comes to human rights and minority protections, Myanmar may even be regressing. => 事实上，在人权和少数民族保护方面，缅甸甚至可能在退步。

The liberalization process has exposed the country’s long-standing religious divisions, leading to a wave of sectarian violence aimed primarily at the minority Muslim community. => 解放过程暴露了缅甸长期存在的宗教分歧，导致了一系列主要针对穆斯林少数派的宗派暴力。
At his meeting with Sein in Washington, DC, Obama condemned the violence against Myanmar’s Muslims, which has displaced many of them. => 奥巴马在华盛顿与吴登盛会晤时谴责了针对缅甸穆斯林、让其中很多人流离失所的暴力。

On the same day, the US State Department released its annual report on religious freedom, in which Myanmar was included among the world’s eight worst offenders. => 同一天，美国国务院发布了其宗教自由年度报告，缅甸名列全世界对宗教干涉最粗暴的八个国家之一。
This has not always been the case. => 并非总是如此。
Although Myanmar is an overwhelmingly Buddhist country, dozens of religious and ethnic communities have long lived there side by side. => 尽管缅甸是个佛教占压倒性优势的国家，但长期以来，数十种宗教和民族一直共处着。
In the heart of Yangon, the golden dome of the Sule Pagoda stands just across the street from the minarets of the Bengali Mosque. => 在仰光市中心，苏雷宝塔（Sule Pagoda）的金顶与孟加拉清真寺（Bengali Mosque）尖塔隔街相望。
Muslims need to be assured of their personal security and guaranteed full civil rights. => 穆斯林需要得到人生安全和充分公民权利保证。
The Obama administration has staked significant political capital on the wager that Myanmar’s promise may finally bear fruit. => 奥巴马政府下了极大地政治资本赌注，押注缅甸的承诺最终能产生结果。
And, indeed, the rate of change in Myanmar over the last two years has been nothing short of remarkable. => 而事实上，缅甸在过去两年变化的速度绝对称得上令人瞩目。
But, as Sein acknowledged at the White House, Myanmar’s government “has been encountering obstacles and challenges along [its] democratization process.” => 但是，正如吴登盛在白宫所承认的，缅甸政府“已经在（其）民主化道路上遇到了障碍和挑战。
How it copes with these problems – and those that have yet to arise – will determine whether America has given its blessing prematurely. => ”它如何处理这些（以及尚未出现的）问题将决定美国支持缅甸的决定是否操之过急。
America's Renminbi Fixation => 人民币现实主义

NEW YORK – For seven years, the United States has allowed its fixation on the renminbi’s exchange rate to deflect attention from far more important issues in its economic relationship with China. => 纽约—七年来，美国一直紧紧抓住人民币汇率不放，从而将人们的注意力从中美关系的其他重要得多的问题上移开。
The upcoming Strategic and Economic Dialogue between the US and China is an excellent opportunity to examine – and rethink – America’s priorities. => 即将到来的中美战略和经济对话将是一次检验（和反思）美国策略重点的良机。

Since 2005, the US Congress has repeatedly flirted with legislation aimed at defending hard-pressed American workers from the presumed threat of a cheap Chinese currency. => 2005年以来，美国国会一再与立法者演双簧，试图将压力重重的美国工人从假定的廉价人民币的威胁中解救出来。
